Lectures are really interesting, but the tests are very VERY specific and multiple choice. He likes to put two answers that are close but not quite so it can be difficult to know. Tests are hard but he gives good curves so you can definitely do well if you work for it. Interesting stuff!
Really passionate professor

This class is fine if you are a BCS BS and have taken a bit of biology and/or physics. The course gets very specific and if you are not REALLY into this, you will get aggravated. Davis is extremely passionate and will meet with you for office hours but If you simply do not like mathematical approaches (graphs, equations, etc) , I would avoid.
great prosody when lecturing! super passionate
His lectures have been my favorite
Great Professor!
Hilarious and engaging, which is great because BCS 110 piques students' interest in the major instead of weeding them out or boring them away.

Dr. Davis is a very compelling lecturer. He seems genuinely passionate about his  subject and you learn a lot. Unlike many freshman year teachers, he doesn't record his lectures, so it's important to go to class. He covers a lot of material very fast, and while the textbook is interesting he doesn't draw questions out of it.
Professor Davis is amazing. He will spend as much time as you need for you to understand something when you ask him a question. The lectures aren't hard and the class is very interesting.

Professor Davis is amazing. He will spend as much time as you need for you to understand something when you ask him a question. The lectures aren't hard and the class is very interesting. I would definitely want to take it again!

Professor Davis is amazing. He helps all the time, his tests are super easy, and the lectures are clear and simple to understand. The course also opens your eyes to a lot of things, and it's rich with interesting information. 1010

Great at teaching – lectures are interesting and she explains lots of examples. Exams are all multiple choice and you will do very well if you go to lectures. Know vocab and examples from the videos. As a person, she can be quite rude if a student or another professor disrupts class in any way.
Worst professor I've had at this school. Constantly talks about sex and favors female students heavily. Cancels class frequently. STAY AWAY!!!

I don't even know where to begin. She is so rude to students and plays favorites big time. Heavily favored toward women students. Her lectures are all based on her own research and she will act caring then when you need help you get none.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Doc.Estrada is not a harsh professor with exams if you went to listen the lectures. If you really try to grasp all knowledge with some or a little depth in the topics she covers and finds interesting in first and next few lectures and review with the aid of powerpoints incrementally. You will be fine for 3 multi-choice exams. if not, good luck.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Test heavy

comment: Estrada's exams aren't hard as long as you come to class (if she even shows up, that is). She always talks about how expensive the classes at the UofR are and that you are entitled to professor's time, yet she will cancel class for two weeks in a row and not even show up to the exam. Definitely feeling like I'm getting my money's worth :/
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Avoid Estrada at all costs. Her class itself isn't that difficult, it's her attitude that's the problem. I'm considering dropping the class, as she is incredibly rude. She once yelled at a student who came to retrieve something they lost in the previous class. She acts like she can do no wrong herself, but will cancel class over the smallest things

She without a doubt reports rating she gets.. I know for a fact I posted one that state her treatment toward students that shouldn't be deleted. Do not take her.. It is insane how rude she is. She called out a student for being late when she is late often herself.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Estrada is honestly one of the WORST professors at UofR. Please don't take her class, you will cry and think about offing yourself. What blows my mind is how inconsiderate she is when you attend her office hours, she's too busy psychoanalyzing you to answer your question. Her exams are brutal so beware.... I regret taking her class UofR do better!!

This is my third class with MJE and my opinion continues to decline. Her teaching style is inappropriate, as she often introduces unrelated political and sexual topics in lecture. She is also just rude. Specifically to people with disabilities, men, and anyone who doesn't conform to her own ideology. Why are there sex toy links on slides for 283?!

I have taken numerous classes with Estrada. One thing that really bothers me is how she hates people being late, but she herself is always late. Also, on almost every exam day (for all of the classes I have taken with her), she does not show up and makes an excuse - often the same one. She seems really full of herself and Im scared to approach her

She comes off as arrogant and harsh, which is reflected a lot in her teaching. I dislike rating professors but I did not want other students to make the same mistake as I did. Grading consists entirely of three exams only, and the exam content feels particularly malicious. Overall the first professor I've come to actively dislike.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: All of the nice reviews are honestly probably her reviewing herself.. she reports the bad reviews I promise you. Do not take her, she acts caring but she is very harsh and aggressive. Especially if you are a male. She is not a nice person and the classes are hard and based off of her own research.

Her lectures (although disorganized) are engaging, fun, useful IRL, and I learned a lot. However, you are ONLY graded by THREE MULTIPLE CHOICE EXAMS. Very hard to do good on them; she tests on everything she says. Intimidating and can be rude to students sometimes. I wouldn't have taken this class if I knew how hard it would be for an intro course.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Estrada acts like she wants to help students but cites policies to avoid assisting when asked. Yelled at TA over small mistake in front of class and shouted at student during exam. Course content is redundantly her research on sex and love, not the topic of gender psychology. Her hostile attitude toward students is unacceptable.

Estrada likes to project she is helpful but prefers citing policies to avoid helping students.Yelled at a TA in front of the class over a minor mistake and shouted at a student during an exam.Her course content redundantly covers her research on sex and love,not course topic of gender psychology.Her terrible treatment of students is inexcusable.

I took PSYC 101 with Professor Estrada and honestly it was one of my favorite classes. I do admit that her exams are a little hard in that she tests on everything she talks about in her class, so showing up to her lectures is definitely useful. She's really passionate about what she does, and she's super sweet!! 10/10 would recommend her class
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: She is an engaging lecturer, seems to care about students, and is passionate about psychology. You're graded on 3 tests which are each worth a third of your grade which I am personally not a fan of. The tests are all multiple choice which makes it harder to excel in but as long as you really pay attention in lectures you should pass easily.

Was skeptical of this course because of her reviews, and while it's a bit hard for an intro class, her lectures are very interesting and she is very well-spoken. The course is graded on three exams which are relatively difficult but as long as you basically memorize the slides and attend lectures you'll do well.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Tests are fair enough and lectures are easy to understand. Basically just need to memorize lectures for the exams. Make sure you actually go to class because a lot of the things she talks about aren't on the slides.

She talks too much about love life things that I do not want to hear.

Tests are memorization heavy. Attend the lectures and route-memorize everything and you'll score great. Compared to Genetics/Biochem, her tests were easy and generally fair.

She's knowledgeable in psychology and a confident lecturer; but overall, I did not like her.

She was the first professor that openly disrespected other professors at the University. When asked if she would give us practice exams/problems, she replied no, because she "writes [her] own exams, unlike other professors." 

Every science/math professor I've had at U of R writes their own exams. Estrada uses a question bank of problems she wrote.

I respect Estrada and like her lectures but PSY283 was very chaotic, with huge changes in the schedule (slower than planned, reexplaining concepts, guest lectures), and cutting out of several topics. She adjusts content based on interest (mainly her own interest e.g. sex and gender) but it's a hit or miss. Tough, I still overall liked her.

DO NOT recommend taking psyc101 with her. She doesnt post recording because they're her materials so "copy right issues." Her exams are ridiculous for an 101 course. She does post her slides but they dont have all the info so you HAVE to go to class to catch everything she say.

Before Estrada, I couldn't say I've disliked a professor. For a class supposedly on lifestyle change, psychosomatic med, & stress, she really gave all 3 w/o hardly teaching about any. She cut out sleep & obesity just to add her gender studies curriculum in. For someone that wants us to harness stress (as Dr. J would say), she gave me a lot of it.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: She is so inconsiderate. Did not accept my positive covid test as a real reason for why I missed the exam and I had to do so much extra work to make her give me a make up time. graded by only 3 exams 33% each.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Estrada is a master at making it seem like she cares about students' well-being while doing absolutely nothing to help them and even making it hard for them to help themselves. Fraud.
My grade was above the median and I got a C-. That's crazy. She was interesting but it doesn't matter if she's gonna give an average grade of a C-. What a weird thing to do

All that matters are the 3 exams. Class material is fun but impossible for me to get a good grade. Regretted taking this class. Professor herself is nice and fun. But there is just too much stuff that needed to be memorized to get a good grade. /cry Don't have all the information on ppt, have to be there.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Estrada is super caring, and you can tell that she loves what she does. She engages with the class and makes lectures easy to digest. The exams are a bit difficult and you definitely need to study because she tests on small topics that might seem irrelevant. If you study hard and go to lecture you will do great.

Dr. Estrada is amazing and really cares about the material she's presenting to her students. The class I took was entirely test graded, so it required a lot of studying, but I genuinely enjoyed it and feel like I learned a lot from her!

I love Pr Estrada. She is so kind and good at her job b/c she gets down to business. Going to her office hours is like getting privately lectured at but in a way that is helpful to understanding material. Tons of extra credit opportunities. She wants you to get involved in the class and wants to learn names. I appreciate that in a professor.

You can miss a lot of classes and get by if you know people there. She usually never trails off from the slides. Tests can honestly be a struggle as the material seems easy but she makes the exams very detailed. Sometimes she forgets what we went over and so her exams can get messy. Class is interesting if people are fun, it's discussion based.
Failed one midterm and got B+.

She is a lovely professor and by far one of my favorites in this university. Unfortunately, her grading criteria leaves no space for errors. For this class, the grade is based on three exams and extra credit, which caused a lot of anxiety for me. She is passionate and loves to help students. I highly recommend her, but be prepared for the grading

Professor Estrada's lectures are super interesting and you can tell she loves psych. She's very informed and teaches well. However, she does skip over many topics. She gives zero homework, but that just means that you have to do really well on the exams to pass the class and her exams are hard. Don't underestimate her exams and study.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: so sweet + clearly passionate about psych! mid covid she's been good at replying & quite considerate. 4 thought papers, 5 min presentation (both same for psyc101), open book multiple choice final (originally was gonna be mostly short response but let us choose format so we'd be less stressed). class layout this semester was v different from before
she does not reply to emails. Very unapproachable. And her lectures are a mess. Exams are hard and you do not get exams back so you never know what you did wrong
Estrada seems tough and blunt at first but she really cares about her students. The class was very interesting and tests were straightforward if you listened to what she said in class

The lectures are very interesting and Estrada seems nice (although I have never talked with her directly as she has a lot of students) . The tests are easy if you go to lecture and take notes. Write down everything she says (a lot of it is not written on her slides) and you're good to go. Tests are multiple choice so they're really not bad at all.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Amazing lectures

comment: - Interesting lectures - Exam heavy class with tough multiple choice questions

She is not available by email she doesnt answer email. She doesnt follow the syllabus and everything is very messy. I do not recommend taking this class. You dont get ur exam back u can only see it. The final exam is basicly questions from your previous exams.

Professor Estrada is amazing. She delivers clear lectures. You must attend every lecture and read the textbook. Estrada from day one will make this clear. You absolutely CAN see your exam, you just cannot take it home with you. There are opportunities for extra credit (SONA) and final can replace low midterm grade. Easy A.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: She is very unreachable and rude for some reason. she barely replies to emails and doesnt follow the syllabus. Her exams are not fair and you dont get your exams back so you never know your mistakes. I do not recommend taking any classes with her
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Such a privilege to be in her class! Highly recommend this prof!

She does not have a structure for the course the syllabus is just there she doesnt follow it. She is also very unapproachable very rude while replying to emails. The exams are multiple choice and losing 2 points on the exams makes u drop from A to B. No book she teaches whatever is on her mind and skips slides whenever she wants. worst professor
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Memorizing the slides only gives you a B+. Questions on exams repeated. Read the textbook before lectures and go to lectures writing down information that is not on the slides, which might be helpful for exams. No videos/homework. Try not to take optional final because many confusing questions may appear. SONA counts.

Dr. Estrada is extremely smart. I have approached her during office hours and I have always had the best conversations with her. If you need any clarifications, it is best to meet her in person since emails it can be hit or miss. The DOWNSIDES, her tests are CRAZY hard. Lectures are essential. You must study hard! Her classes are not GPA boosters.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: She is a good lecturer, but very unapproachable outside the class. e.g. sending an email and getting slow response. She is really tough with students who get late in class. The exam requires of lots of memorising. For me, I would not take her class again, largely because of her personality and attitudes.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: the lectures are very interesting and she is approachable, but the tests are unnecessarily hard and terribly worded. the material is easy enough but she makes it 100x harder just by the way shes exam wording the questions.

Estrada has some interesting lecture. This is a great class for pre med students who want to get a more psychological perspective to medicine. She is a caring professor although can be quite blunt sometimes. I would recommend taking this class. I dreaded studying for the exams but that's just because I don't like studying psychology material.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Estrada dwells far too long on each topic to the point where half the course material is never covered. The exams are difficult and based on what is discussed in lectures. She is very unaccommodating and does not respond on time or nicely to emails.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I will start with the pros : PSY 267 was super interesting, Estrada is highly qualified and very articulate. BUT DO NOT take this class if you're looking to raise your GPA aka get an A. It's near to impossible! She gives the toughest, hardest exams on the face of this earth so do not make the mistake thinking this will be an easy A or an A at all!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: For a psych professor, she seems very insecure that people often want to take psych classes for an easy A, so she goes out of her way to make the class as difficult as possible. She is completely unaccommodating - for example, the first day of class she talks for 5 minutes about how she will NEVER give you a make up exam and kicks out late students
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Tons of memorization and the toughest exams ever at the end as a "bonus"! You have to memorize till eternity and the short answers and multiple choice are so TOUGH! Glad I could do an S/F and I didn't do badly in this course but do not take it if you want to raise your GPA. This professor gives the toughest tests ever.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She scares me, but she's a really good professor and is actually really nice.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Estrada is one of the best teachers I have ever taken on campus. Estrada speaks eloquently and is always open to listen to her students' suggestions; she is very engaging and will keep you entertained throughout the course - she uses contemporary media that pertains to modern issues. She can be strict but rightfully so, since he has her PhD.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: She is a bit of a mixed bag. Some days, she lectures very well and connects with her students. Other days, she presents material in a pretty shaky way and has a holier-than-though personality.   If she were constantly at her best, she would be an amazing professor. But she isn't.  She's fine, but I don't go out of my way to take her courses.

I loved her. She tends to have a mixed reputation among students, but after getting to know her and having her be a PI on a summer project of mine, you really learn to love and respect her. All of her feedback on my papers in the class were useful, and she is a fair grader who if you take the time to talk to her, is really responsive

just wanna mention one thing, on the first day of class, she said she is extremely bothered by people getting late, in the following three weeks, she only appeared on time for once. she would usually be late for 15 mins. Also, it's true that she gives a lot of documentary, so basically if you see a documentary  listed on the syllabus, you can skip.

Estrada is full of herself . She comes off very smart but there's nothing behind the mask and it's all an act. She is not open to other's opinions in discussion and just reads right from the slides. NOT worth taking if you don't want to be bored and "taught" but someone who lacks intelligence.

Estrada is a direct lecturer, although at times I wish she would lecture off of the slides more. Her slides are to the point though. At first I didn't like her tendency to call you out. I was skipping class and she called me out during the exam. It was embarrassing, but actually helpful and necessary.

She is sooooo AWESOME! Everyone should have her at least once! Her classes are interesting. She really cares about the class and teaching and is therefore really engaged. She is also really helpful even on a personal level to go to for advice. She's incredible!
Awesome professor. Tests were hard but doable if you studied.
Pretty darn good, interesting and knowledgeable
Great lecturer with lots of cute stories!  Gives you lots of opportunities to get a good grade via optional final, test corrections, SONA extra credit.  Take this class, it's pretty interesting!

She is a great lecturer, it's hard to get bored in class because she does a lot of interactive activities.  Getting a good grade is easy with the test corrections and SONA credits.  Definitely take this class if you are looking for something fun for a cluster!

Estrada was a good professor and made it very possible to succeed in the class. She allows exam make ups to earn back points as well as an optional final to boost your grade. There's also the psychology SONA credit which can add to your final letter grade. She was clear in class about what she wanted, though some exam ?s from the book are tough.
Marie Joelle is a pleasure to listen to in class...and also to look at as well. She is a great teacher.

Excellent professor. Very confident, knowledgeable, and willing to help. Expect to be challenged, but also expect to be given the tools to rise to that challenge; learn how to use the tools though. You will love the course.

Nasty attitude towards students for no reason at all. Her constant condescending demeanor was uncalled for. Did not seem to really know what she was talking about. I would definitely never take a class with her again.

She presents herself as one of the most narcissistic people I've ever met. She has no previous knowledge of clinical psychology, so she passed off her whole job to guest lecturers all semester. She has an overly aggressive personality that made me hate going to class. Skip the lectures and read the book, or wait till another prof takes over.

worst class i've ever taken. estrada doesn't teach more than 4 lectures the entire semester and they are awful. the book is outdated and contradicts half of what the guest lecturers say. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS
Very interesting lecturer. Just don't do anything to get on her bad side and everything will be fine.
Great and funny guy, but it is hard to follow his calculations as he flips through them on slides.

Krugh's tests were math based, and if you could do the workshop material you could generally do well on the test. His lectures were drawn out, but as long as you studied the workshop problems and practice tests it was pretty obvious what would be on the exams. He gave a grading excel spreadsheet so you could see how you were doing in the class.

Prof. Krugh is a very kind and caring professor, he wants his students to succeed. As long as you keep up with the homework and study it should be an easy A. Moreover, he drops the worst test grade, and he really does want his students to succeed
Krugh was a really nice and funny  guy but his lectures were hard to follow. He didn't explain things well but reading the book helped.
Prof. Krugh is really respectful. His lectures are clear and well-organized, and he is really kind. Exams are easy if you listen in class and do the practice exams.

Prof. Krugh is absolutely amazing! I LOVED his class! I switched my major to chemistry after taking his class. It's not too difficult to get an A -- go through the past exams and be active in workshops. Very approachable outside the class. I suggest that you go to his office hours, because he really tries to help you understand the material.

His actual exams are always harder than his past exams. The average on his exams were always around 65% to 70%. The material itself is not too challenging but the way he curves his class is frustrating because the range for a B is so huge, meaning that you can score well above average but still get the same letter grade as an average person.

Lecture are pretty unclear but the textbook and tutoring saved my grade. Krugh uses powerpoint lectures and has all his math pre calculated before coming to class which can make it pretty difficult to follow along. I guess it depends on how you learn. I've heard his exams are easier than the other CHM 131 course which is a plus.
A good guy. Really wants to see everyone to do well. Practice tests are very similar to the tests. Work hard to understand material and you will get a good grade.

Krugh's lectures are well planned out and he puts effort into them but often times people zone out and don't pay attention and when I do pay attention I can come out of a lecture having no idea what I learned. Not always constant with delivering the main idea and is all math based, less concept based.

Even if you study his powerpoints, read the book, and review old tests, you still won't understand the concepts. People kept telling me "Oh. He's such an easy teacher," but I guess he must've caught on to those rumors because this class was far from easy. His tests are basically made 100 times harder than the concepts from the textbook. Good luck.
Tests are much much much harder than the material taught without much guidance to be able to feel comfortable answering the more difficult test questions at the end of the chapter.

This class, while still hard of course, is relatively easy to do well because the tests are very predictable based on the practice tests. There are of course a few curve balls, but these usually aren't too much of the test. Lectures are a bit boring, but a lot can be learned in workshops and he really wants to help you if you go to office hours.

Krugh's lectures are straightforward and all his ppts online so you can either follow along in class or review. I personally didn't end up going to class towards the end of the semester and just read his ppts instead. He lets you drop a bad grade and sticks to the same kind of questions so you know what to expect. I would recommend him.
Great professor. Can't go wrong with him for gen chem

Pretty decent professor. Lecture notes were helpful and he puts them online so you don't have to go to class too often. Sample tests are often eerily close to the actual test. Workshop questions are a hit-and-miss in terms of relevancy to tests. Overall, would recommend him for Gen Chem compared to someone with less ratings, better safe than sorry.

Krugh is a great professor. His power points are clear and he is VERY helpful in office hours. Unlike other gen chem professors, he goes over challenge questions in lecture to prepare students for the exams.
amazing guy.

TRK is the man. He honestly wants you to do well and although his exams can be VERY difficult - when the material finally clicks with you, you'll excel in the class. He's always fair and will curve if necessary. Wonderful guy, very helpful if you can speak to him. Class attendance is not mandatory, but definitely go to workshop!

Krugh is awesome! Great lecturer, has a great sense of humor.  His lectures are very clear, and I enjoyed going to class. Exams aren't super easy, but if you study and DO THE PRACTICE EXAMS you will do fine.  Workshop is also super helpful. Made me like chem even more than I already did.

Krugh is funny and approachable. Lectures move at an appropriate pace and all concepts are explained crystal clear. Attending class is optional since he puts his powerpoints online. It's possible to skip every class and get an A if you study the slides and learn in workshops. Exams are never curveballs if you put in at least some effort.

Krugh is wonderful, he is funny and approachable. His exams can be on the tough side but if you do the recommended problems in the book you'll be fine. He does numerous experiments in class and makes lectures fun.

Krugh rocks, whether you hate chemistry or love it. He gives a very specific guide of what it takes to get an A, A-, or B in the class. He is approachable and is also interested in what people have to think of his class. Ready to answer any question (basic or complex) and spend time with student. He really wants us to do well. Plenty of review work

Quite a nice fellow, and a good teacher. I had a medical crisis during the semester and he was very helpful in getting me back on track. Some had trouble following his lectures in class, but I found it all pretty straightforward. Pay attention, do the work, and you'll be fine
He posts his lectures online, which are extremely helpful. I got an A in the course, without going to class.

Krugh is old-school and straightforward.  Stick with the program, do the exercises, follow along, and you'll be fine.  You'll learn a lot.  He's well organized, clear, funny, pure class.  And his demonstrations are fun.  Love this guy.
One of the best teachers I've had at Rochester! So interesting, take his class!

Krugh is a great professor; he teaches right out of the book and does a wonderful job teaching. It's possible to get by without going to class (posts ppts) but he's a very entertaining lecturer and does great demos. Posts practice tests which are great for test review. Take his class over Krauss' CHM131.

Before his class, I loathed chemistry, mainly because I couldn't understand the material. His lectures and teaching style are very understandable and easy to follow. He also answers questions sufficiently. He's a very good professor.
Great professor, class still fairly hard.

He teaches from the textbook which makes studying easier, puts powerpoints online, and provides plenty of practice exams and the solutions. He's pretty much a cute old guy, he likes to tell random stories and relate them back to chem. He also does a lot of really cool demonstrations and gives us a 3-4 minute break in the middle of lecture.

It seems like he has a good amount of experience under his belt, but he has a tough time relating it to his students.  Often times he will ramble and go entirely off topic during lecture.  Some of the material on exams is never gone over in class.
Krugh likes to break things up a lot and he likes to go off course in his lectures, which can be fun but tiring at times.

He's a great prof. He teaches straight from the textbook so you don't really need to pay attention in class, but it is helpful. He does on experiment/demonstration of some sort during every class and he makes a lot of jokes, but his lectures can be rather boring. Very helpful. Don't be afraid to ask questions even if you feel like it's a dumb one.
professor krugh is a dreamboat..and i'm not being sarcastic..i would take this class over and over just to see him
his lectures are very funny. he makes class interesting

Very tough if chemistry is not your thing. The guy is fantastic and easily approachable. Always willing to help. So if you aren't a chemistry master, don't be afraid to take this class, he is really willing to help you out and succeed.

Great professor. Easy class if you put any effort into it. Look to old exams for clues as to the types of problems he will put on the new exams -- he doesn't tend to stray from his set-up too much. Very approachable if you ever have questions.
Krugh is a very nice guy and keeps his lectures mildly entertaining.

This was your typical introductory class.  Not terribly exciting material, but with Krugh, someone who obviously loves what he does, the material is bearable.  I don't know what people are talking about when they say you'll be lost if you have not taken Chem AP.  I haven't take chem since soph year of high school and got an A.
In order to do well in this class you need to have taken AP chem and aced the exam. This class moves fast and you can get lost quickly!
Prof. Krugh is quite possibly the nicest man on Earth.  If you didn't take AP Chem, you're basically in trouble.  Be preparred for 350 classmates.

Krugh's not a bad guy.  He's really nice, and I didn't realize how helpful his powerpoints were until I got to Chem 132 and realized not every teacher had them.  He gives a lot of examples, and explains everything he does.  Oh, and cool experiments in class wake everyone up a bit.

If high school/regents chem is the only chem you've had, you will be lost from the start.  He likes to repeat questions on the final from past exams.  I think that's the only way I passed. He likes to write obscure exam questions.

Krugh is a dynamic professor very helpful and hardworking. His class lectures can be dull, but balances them with exciting (some may find it useless)presentations. The tests can be tough, if you do not stay in top of the material and the labs are somewhat fair.
Good professor.  I did badly in the class because I'm terrible at chemistry, but he is clear and his grading system is nice.  Most people did well in it.

The man lives to torture freshmen. :)  Seriously, this class is HARD.  He focuses mostly on calculations and spends only about 5% of class time actually discussing the principles.  Class is much easier for those with A's in AP Chem from a challenging H.S.  Very few A's given each semester, lots of C's, more than avg. no. of F's.  Be forewarned!

He likes the topic of Chemistry and enjoys discussing it with people, but does not take the time to prepare a good format of displaying notes.  The black-and-white papers are an eyesore and some of the irrelevant info makes people fall asleep.  He is very good at answering questions and his tests are fair, though.
One of the best professors you will ever have at the University...enough said.
This guy is the only good thing about University of Rochester.  Really good professor.
Boring class. Labs are easy, there's a huge curve.
One of the nicest professors out there, definitely very helpful.
So thorough it hurts.  And then puts you to sleep.  I, for one, found him to be a tad creepy. Tests can be tricky, but he's always available to answer your questions.
krugh is amazing! he is very approachable and helps you in any way that he can. awesome guy
No Comments
Learned a lot.  Great professor.
Easier than the other class!
He does a great job with a class of that size... very helpful when asked... and he does some awesome demonstrations in class!
Can be a challenging course, but krugh is very thourough and approachable if you have questions.
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
Impersonal class
No Comments
No Comments

He only provides one sample exam, and the actual exam IS WAY DIFFERENT AND SO MUCH HARDER THAN THE SAMPLE. He has no final review session, And his teaching style is hideous because he is always murmuring, cant understand what he said.

Professor Zhupa is highly respected by both students and colleagues. His extensive knowledge, commitment to teaching, and genuine care for his students' success have earned him an excellent reputation on campus. It's evident that he is not only an outstanding professor but also a highly valued member of the academic community.

He is patient and encouraging. I'm afraid of office hour, but he is so nice and you will feel welcomed in his office. Don't hesitate to talk to him, for any problem you might meet during the course. His classes will always contain exams or pop quizzes. Exams will not be so hard after you go over the material and the given sample exams. I will recom
Borrowing the words of another reviewer here whose comment cannot be topped : "Truly an icon".
easy A class, dont like this guy. am curious as to how some of these people get hired.

He sucks at teaching and his classes will put you to sleep, but it doesn't really matter because the assignments are basically following tutorials so this class is an easy A. He recently started doing weekly 10 minute quizzes which are annoying but easy.
Easy Lab and Grading.

It has been four years since graduation from this university and last time I had to trouble myself to encounter MR.Zhupa was his 282. In a nutshell, it's been six years, and I am still willing to come back, make up an account, and give him a 1/5. That's how much I dislike him. I work at FAANG with six figures now.
A sweet and encouraging professor. Classes could better, but hey, let's be nice.
I am a fool

This professor is the worst organized professor I have ever seen in the University. Syllabus says lowest 2 lab grade will be dropped, but didn't drop when calculating the final grade. Many criteria is not clear. He is not caring this course at all. I even doubt the syllabus is not written by himself.

I'd like to express concerns about his teaching methods. The sample tests did not align well with the actual exams, causing preparation issues. Also, the lectures could be more effective. I hope this feedback helps improve the course for future students. He is the WORST!!!! RUN ASAP!!!
rating_tags: Group projects--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: What the hell was happening this entire semester? I finally was able to grasp master's theorem for solving recursions the semester *after* I took Zhupa's class in an upper-level course. Theoretical concepts were not explained well by Zhupa, and there is no solid support for programming skills either. Ask the TA's for assistance with programming.
Very unengaging and monotone teaching style. Somewhat understandable but refused to give me an incomplete when my grandfather passed and I had to travel to a different country for it.

Zhupa is not a good lecturer. He goes through the standard DSA syllabus but drones on and struggles to make any of his points clear. On the other hand, his exams are ridiculously easy (with a cheat sheet too!). If you felt that 171 was a cake walk, you will do just fine and leave with an easy A. If you didn't, you might struggle.
HELL NO. WOULD RATHER AMPUTATE MY LEG THAN TAKE IT WITH HIM EVER AGAIN!

Zhupa's lectures are super boring and he drones on endlessly about things which don't even show up on his several written exams. He doesn't talk about labs or projects in class, & most of what I learnt was from Youtube and CLRS. Although responsive, he isn't very helpful and can't explain things well. He is really sweet though, & a pretty easy A.

It took a full month and a half to get grades back.I made the same mistake on three consecutive assignments and got significant points off because by the time I realized that what I was doing was wrong, I had already submitted more assignments with the same mistake. It was really unfair

He talks so slow in lectures that it's difficult to pay attention for the whole time. Test/workshop questions and assignments are difficult to understand and poorly written. Assigned the most difficult project to be due at the end of reading week, and tried to assign a project to be due during spring break. Clearly he is out of touch with students.

Lectures are for the most part incomprehensible and not worth attending - YouTube teaches it 10 times better in a fraction of the time. Unfortunately, lecture-specific notation often appears on tests. The material in this class would be exponentially easier if the course was taught by someone else. Even my workshop leader was better at explaining.

Homeworks are Tedious. I literally busted my computer disk, so that I can save his funny requirement of saving a million screenshots to collect some stupid data from a lab. His tests, however, are scarce, but each one was hard to prepare for, as he barely talked about what is going to be in the exams. He never talks about lab and projects, either.

I have no words for his teaching. Multiple people have raised their hands and asked Professor Zhupa questions regarding his lecture slides, and he couldn't explain them. He has come to class unprepared many times, and i strongly recommend professional development courses for his own benefit to continue holding a position here in the University.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: The worst professor I think I will ever have. Currently doing a project but the guidelines are so arbitrary and nothing is clearly explained. Got so pissed that I want to kill myself and will leave this review behind as my last words.

didn't learn a single thing in lectures, don't even know why i went every single time just to play 2048 on my computer. easily one of the worst professors i have had, he has a monotone voice and you cant pay attention with him for more than 5 min because of how boring it is. the labs and projects are difficult, exams you get a cheat sheet for!
His presence on the stage, charisma, and lovable mannerisms make up for the lack of ability in teaching and responding to questions. Truly an icon.
Great professor!!!!!

Going to lectures was pretty much useless, I was able to gain a better understanding through internet resources. Be ready to teach yourself a lot of the material. Pretty generous grading scale though, and most exams are curved.
He is too underrated so I had to give five stars. Great explanation and passion.

Zhupa, what to say. He comes off as a tough guy at first, but towards the end of the semester he lightens up and even starts making jokes in his own horizontally-striped-sweater-way. He sometimes has memes in his class slides too so be sure to attend lectures for those! Go to class, go to workshops, take notes, and fill your cheat sheet for an A!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Caring--Graded by few things

comment: Going to lecture was a waste of my time. I went once and never went back. I learned everything from YouTube and did better on exams than people that went to class. He is impossible to learn from.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: The professor's lecture is soooo hard-understanding. The lab I am writing now is sooooo hard, it is even harder than the first project. You have to be prepared to learn independently in this course. Because you won't get anything in the lecture!!!!!!!!!

Impossible to sit through a lecture, skipped class every day after the first lecture because we never learned anything useful in class anyways. Learned everything online over YouTube and got an A. Not hard to get an A if you do the work, but be prepared to teach yourself because you aren't going to learn the material in class.
Didn't seem to understand the material and just ripped off another professor's slides but couldn't explain them properly, couldn't answer questions about the material
Poor class structure and planning, non-existent rubrics, no point in going to lectures
That's a good chunk of time I will never get back. Googling videos and lectures would have been much more useful than taking this course. Stress and frustration is the only thing I learned here.

This was an extremely poorly taught course. Expectations were high but the level of teaching was subpar. Course was very disorganized and the exams and assignments were always returned late. No answer keys were provided nor any idea about averages and medians.
Doesn't understand what he's teaching
Bad at explaining, reads off slides

Professor Zhupa is kind, funny, and very helpful when you approach him. A lot of people hate on him for things outside of his control, like his accent. I also enjoy the way he accommodates for non-English speakers by speaking slower. Best of all, he's constantly trying to improve as a lecturer, and it shows! He's gotten better over the years!

Very nice and caring professor and will do his best to make sure everyone understands the materials. He also started teaching CSC282 which is a LOT more doable than Daniel's class. I feel it's unfair for him to receive so many negative comments for 172. It's a lab-heavy weeder class and you have to work hard for it no matter who's teaching it.
I don't really feel as though I was taught the course material that was featured on the exams.
class is very tedious and man this guys is a tough grader. i didn't learn much from his class. He is unorganized as hell.
Just avoid his class. DONG DE DOU DONG

I have taken two courses from professor Zhupa, the other one is CSC172. I found that taking professor Zhupa's course is less pain due to the pandemic because now I can watch recorded videos, raise the volume, and select x2.0 video speed. His voice was too low to me, but now I can clearly hear his explanations on examples. Explanations are good.
Tries, but fails, not good lectures, hard to read project descriptions

Professor Zhupa is a very caring and respected person. He understands the difficulties of international students, and he doesn't make things hard on students just to show he has the power to do so, unlike many other professors in the department.

The professor is the book, or maybe the book is professor. Lecture contents are ctrl C and ctrl V from the textbook. In the last exam, there even existed prompt like "remember code line 57 from lecture 11" without any referencing codes. Genius

Never took his class again if I can. When there's an issue with exam grades, he never responded to the email. Also, at this tough time, no different time zone test time, and lots of my classmates took the exam at 3 AM. Believe me, if you can skip this course, just do it.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: He assigns interesting projects and he clearly puts in effort during lectures. However, exams which count for the a signicant portion of the grade often contained material that was barely referenced during class, making it a frustrating class to study for. He does apply a curve to exams but the curve chosen often seems arbitrary.

DO NOT take his course, esp 172. It is not worth it. It will destroy every hope that you have for a CS career unless you are already very good. Too many assignments, very messy schedule, prob the worst lecturer I have ever encountered, very unreachable for most of the time. Exams always test on things he never mentioned or never elaborated on.

Imagine you spend 5 hours for every lab for 7 labs and got your grade ruined by one midterm, because the midterm worth exactly the same as 7 labs total. he is so hard to reach by email he basically won't respond.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: I don't want to waste my time to say anything more about this terrible professor, I think there're already enough commons about him. please fire him
Horrible... can't teach at all. Lectures suck. Doesn't help. Just, don't.

I went through 3 semesters of hell with this guy. Started with an A on lecture material, but when I asked for help with the project, I was sent to TA after TA who refused to meet. Zhupa never once took me up on my offer to meet or directly help, just kept extending my deadline until finally passing me without finishing the project, learning nothing

Professor Zhupa cares about his students and really puts in the effort to make class clearer. I see so many negative ratings here but that seems quite an exaggeration. There is a lot going on in this course throughout the semester for example there are 3 exams, 3 homework, and 4 project milestones, but this made me gain a lot from this course.

He is a very bad professor. He doesn't know the material well himself, and when you asked him a question, he would never answer directly. You feel like you are taking this course alone, without a teacher.

The worst teacher possible ever. Confusing and chaotic teaching which made materials harder to understand than it was supposed to be. No partial credits in grading: incomplete answers will get you zero marks no matter what you accomplished. Appeared to not care about students at all.

Zhupa isn't the best lecturer, but he does genuinely care about you doing well. He wants to get better and he wants the students to enjoy the class. Going to him during office hours is really helpful. He can't lecture, but he can teach one on one really well. Also the textbook is super helpful.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: YouTube taught me. Terrible lectures. So sad because 172 is important for future courses.

A lot of people hate Zhupa and it seems exaggerated. He's not the most talented lecturer in the world, but they're hardly bad enough that it's not worth attending. I recommend doing a bit of outside reading/watching YouTube and then coming to class with questions. Zhupa clearly cares and tries to get better, and asks sudents for feedback.
Just avoid his course. CSC172 is not a hard course if your professor is not him.
It's unfortunate he is the only professor teaching data structures and algorithms, which is arguably the most important class in the CS major. there are other professors who could do a better job.

Lectures are quite boring. Almost all the materials can be accessed from the textbook. Requirements for lab assignments are usually unclear and confusing! However, he is the only professor teaching CSC172 currently...

He makes things more and more complicated. He want students check answers themselves by providing sample input and sample output. HOWEVER, he changed the output several times and we need to change our codes several time which is extremely terrible. Wonder how he became the professor !!!

Definitely the WORST lecturer in department of Computer Science, even in the whole university. He always gives wrong codes and unclear lectures. Also, he often updates his homework requirement just before the deadline. Annoying! Never care about his students. Prepare to teach yourself. Avoid him anyway!

Good prof, interesting class, reasonable workload. I recommend starting projects early in case you have questions and want to go to study session (with TAs) because they tend to get very full close to the deadline. He posts optional homework after each class that helps to understand the material. He can be a little condescending in class at times.

Best lecturer I've had in the CS department so far, he explains things very well and is very approachable outside of class despite how he can come off as rude. Go to lecture in person, the tests I did poorly on were because I skipped the lectures and watched recordings after the fact.

Ferguson is amazing as always - easy to understand, and both his assignments and exams are very very fair. He has such an engaging way of explaining things, and I wish there was another class I could take with him! I do think he made 254 a little too easy at times...

Professor Ferguson's lectures are the best in CS department and no one else ever even gets close. Anyway many people say he's mean. I feel like all smart people would have some sort of this problem and clearly Professor Ferguson is way above the threshold of smartness.

One of the best teachers in the department. He has a very specific system for his teaching, but if you engage with it, it works well. The lectures are mostly 1:1 with the free textbook but they're worth going to because he breaks things down well. Stay off your phone, read the textbook, go to study sessions, and you'll learn a lot.

Definitely one of the best professors here. He makes concepts clear and not too hard to learn. First couple projects were a bit tricky using C for the first time, and later ones were easier. All projects were doable, and tests were not hard. Awesome experience.

Professor Ferguson is undoubtedly one of the best professors I have ever had. He's truly passionate about the course material and CS in general, and gives optional homework to solidify your understanding. His lectures are very engaging, and the 5 online exams and projects are quite reasonable - going to class is super helpful and a must!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Accessible outside class

comment: Overall, He is a good professor. His lectures are interesting and not as boring as other computer science professors however he is a bit condescending and rude especially when you disagree with him. The first three projects were really difficult and time consuming but other than that the content were pretty easy.

By far one of the best CS professors at UR. His lectures are actually pretty fun to listen to because he is very animated and engaging. Tests were not that hard, but first few projects might take a while to get used to (since he doesn't teach you how to use C, you have to teach yourself)
Very passionate about teaching and holds engaging lectures. Exams and projects are relatively easy
He's kind, as far as I know. But you must take his course to major in CS or DS anyway.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback

comment: Took 173 & 242. Pretty great lecturer and since covid has continued to upload his lecture videos. Yes, he may shame you if you're late and might not always respond best to in-class questions. But, if you see/email him outside of class he's really helpful+accommodating. A health issue took me out of class and he was extremely kind and understanding.

People think Ferguson is mean because he tells people off for using their phone in class and rushes people when they show up late. IMO he is well within his right to do that, if you need your phone that badly you can always step outside. He is actually very friendly to students who show up and are attentive. Very strong teacher as well

Fergie is an excellent professor. He is funny and engaging even when the material isn't because of his passion for the subject. His projects are range from very easy to challenging but fair, and his tests are very easy. He seems tough and strict but is actually very fun and casual. You will learn a lot and it won't be too challenging. GOAT

Delivers lectures pretty well in both 173 and 242 and is clearly very organized, however is a bit demeaning towards questions. 173 projects are graded pretty harshly. 242 projects are much easier but a lot of the material itself feels like he is just reciting the textbook.

He is very rude. If you are late to class he will hurry you to sit down, if you are on your phone he will take two minutes out of lecture to bring attention to you. He is super rude in emails and rarely cuts you slack. Since exams are auto graded you have to enter the answer exactly like he says or wants it, or he wont give you any points.

He does fairly well at explaining the information, except he uses the textbook word for word. If you are confused on examples in class, reading the textbook won't help much because he basically just reads from it. Usually I am able to do 100% of the projects in pervious classes, but in this one I could only do certain parts. The exams were easy.

I wish he explained things in a way that was easier to understand. He talks through things very fast, and I have a difficult time processing things in general- so if I have the time, I do my best to go over material before class. Yet, if I cannot find any specific information online, then I'd have to use textbooks, which to me, is not that helpful.

Professor Ferguson was the most real professor I had the pleasure of learning from at the University of Rochester. Sure, the class was difficult, but he made himself always available for questions and was very honest with me as a student and offered thought provoking questions about students' motivations for being in computer science.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Accessible outside class

comment: I took both 173 and 242 with him. He is a good teacher imo but he is a mean person. I understood everything from lectures. Never used textbooks and I got A in both classes. His exams and projects are hard but they can be done using lecture materials. He is so mean towards students and usually respond to questions with with: Go to study sessions
Best lectures. Start projects early, install Valgrind, and do the homework.
Such a mean person. He is not there to help you. TA should gets paid more for saving his bad teaching. Be ready to study everything by yourself.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: He basically explains very quickly. He doesn't give examples of theoretical explanations well. (He often just explains and finishes.) So, you have to refer to the textbook yourself.

Fergusons classes are basically just a test on your ability to execute pseudocode by hand. He doesnt ever really explain the intuition or reasoning behind anything, and all his tests are simply asking you to execute algorithms by hand. Not very interesting, but not difficult.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: CSC 173 was my first experience with professor Ferguson. He quickly became my favorite professor, not only because he has strong teaching skills, but he shows genuine understanding and passion for what he teaches. 173 is a tough course for anyone unfamiliar with C (used in 2020 Spring), but the books and lecture slides are enough to get you 100s.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Ferguson's classes were a delight to experience. He has a precise understanding of the material, making him one of the best professors in the U of R, in my opinion. His Artificial Intelligence course was very noob friendly. However, you must have a strong foundation of computer science and programming to succeed in the course.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Fergie's group projects are so hard, you really need to work in a group. Got laid though, made the work worth it ;)

Whoever gave him a 1/5 is wrong. He was so helpful. When someone asked a question, he NEVER dismissed them, and instead really thought about it, and would answer them when he had a good one. Once he emailed me two weeks later the answer to a difficult question I forgot I asked. Best, most caring professor I've had so far.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Amazing lectures, incredibly engaging, don't skip them. Projects don't take too long if you understand the material well. Homework is optional but highly recommended, he models his test very similar to the homework. Good opportunity for extra help from TA's.

Ferguson is a really good lecturer; probably the best in the department. He comes off as a bit of a hardass, but he does care for his students and is genuinely a nice and funny person. Projects in 173 will take time but are not impossible. DO THE HOMEWORK! The homework questions prepare you very well for the exams.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Amazing lectures

comment: Lectures are awesome, but you still really need to spend a lot of time going over all the materials and reading the textbooks after class; otherwise you will have great trouble in projects and exams.

Great professor, extremely engaging and caring. Isn't too accessible through email but office hours are good. Graded very strictly but if you do what he wants its not too difficult to do well. There is absolutely no room for flexibility or partial credit on tests be aware, HIS process not product!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Lecture heavy

comment: Best professor in the department. Lectures are extremely organized. Projects need some efforts but are very reasonable and helpful for understanding the content.

Although professor Ferguson might not be the smartest computer scientist, he is definitely the most organized and caring instructor I have ever met in the school. I am so lucky to study my favorite topic with such an amazing professor. He had good jokes but its a pity that we comSci nerds are quiet in class. Hope he could teach more courses!
Fantastic professor, probably the best in the department. Exams are straightforward, projects are sometimes too easy (lots of starter code).

Best lecturer Ive ever had! Interesting topics including intro machine learning concepts. Projects were useful, exams were fair. Just he can be condescending at times and makes you not want to ask him questions...
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Ferguson is the best professor I have had for CompSci. His lectures are amazing and organized properly. Although CSC 173 is a hard class and the content is pretty difficult, he tries his best to make it understandable. His homework and lecture slides help in preparing for the unit exams.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Great professor, best lecturer in the CS department. Funny guy, too.

Professor Ferguson is one of the best lecturers in the department. With that said, his courses are extremely content-rich and can be hard to digest. Usually has 4-5 exams and projects, and they are always due at the same day which is annoying. Very passionate teaching style but picky on students at the same time.
Best professor in CS at the UofR. You ACTUALLY get to learn something useful from his lectures. I've taken his 173 and 242, and I'd take any other class he teaches.

I've loved every class I had with him. Engaging lectures, kept me awake even in the 9:40 time slot. :)Unit system for 173/242 is very intuitive, just don't start the project after the exam or you'll so regret it (which he tells you every unit). He cares a lot about the material and his students, and it shows. Do the reading and hw you'll be fine!
Lots of exams and projects, and the wording was vague. Not interested in helping students. Projects are extremely hard. The code he provided was tricky and usually didnt work.
Fergy is a homie. I took CSC 242, CSC 171, & CSC 173 with him. He may have a tough exterior, but he's really nice if you respect him and work hard. One of my favorite professors.

Tests are very expected based on the homeworks. I have had Ferguson for CSC171, CSC173, and now CSC242. He runs his class the same way every time. Projects and Tests for every unit and a final, but again very expected. You have to work hard but it's possible to succeed in these classes. Love taking classes with him.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: I have had professor Ferguson for 171&173. I found 171 to be very easy. 173 is much harder but still doable. What makes me really like Ferguson is that he is a genuinely good person. He is incredibly understanding. If you are having issues in your life, he understands and will give you extensions. If you just talk to him, he will make class easier
He's very inspirational, making the difficulty of the class a source of excitement

Class extremely hard. Expect lots of project assignments , daily homework and extremely difficult exams.  Knows the material for the course well. Seems not interested in helping students. Every time he says "I will have to think about it" when you ask him a question, usually you will not get any response.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: As long as you go to labs and workshops and pay attention in lectures, you'll do just fine.
Great lectures, engaging

Doesn't like to help you or answer questions, likes to yell a lot, I am glad he no longer teaches this course, because he was definitely not passionate about DMS, but he is about CS and is a much better and happier CS professor!

If 171 is your first exposure to programming, go to class, start your weekly homeworks early, ask questions, go to lab and workshops, start your projects early, go to CSUG tutoring or CETL tutoring for things you don't understand. I did this and I got a very high A (98.X%). You will succeed!

Compared to other CS professors, Ferguson is one of the best at this university. Relatively, he's a great lecturer, really passionate about the field, and pretty straightforward and clear most of the time.  That said, he can be very dismissive of questions and is not very accessible outside of class, he's just not a very kind or caring professor,.
um no

Great teacher, he is clear in his class. Only mandatory attendance is workshops, which help you learn to think through different types of problems. Homework is given weekly that you can learn most everything through. A great way to be introduced to computer science

Great teacher, he is clear in his class. Only mandatory attendance is workshops, which help you learn to think through different types of problems. Homework is given weekly that you can learn most everything through. A great way to be introduced to computer science.
Not too difficult, yet very distant from students.  I received an A off basically my extra credit on the 4 projects that are assigned.

He gave really funny lectures, and really knew the subject matter. As long as you actually did all the homework and projects, you don't really need to attend class, study, or read the book at all. Would love for him to be my drinking buddy.

Great professor, knows his stuff and teaches well in lecture. However, don't expect him to have a lot of office hours for one on one help (due to the sheer size of CSC171) but will indeed answer questions in class if you speak up. Assignments, projects, and whats to be expected throughout the course are always clearly posted online

He is funny and a good lecturer, but I think the course is difficult for one who has no experience in programming.  It's a steep learning curve.  Though you probably won't easily find help directly from the prof (it's a HUGE class, after all), there are plenty of TAs who are eager to help.  His projects and labs aren't easy but are manageable.

Fantastic teacher. Incredibly enthusiastic and helpful. Assignment directions are clear, and he offers a lot of extra resources if you need help. Hands-down one of the best (if not the best) professor in the CS department.

While it's very difficult to get an A in the class (in his own words, it's reserved for *brilliant* students), it's clear he's looking out for you the whole way through. Gives good, clear lectures, and offers a lot of resources to help out on projects and to gauge your progress in the class. Very easy to get at least a B.

He's a fantastic lecturer, one of the best and most dynamic in the department. He's also cool and a good research advisor. If you visit his office expect to be there for at least an hour, he'll chat you up.
Great sense of humor with very entertaining lectures. Gives relevant lectures to the book and is very clear. He also gives tons of starter code for the project and is a fairly easy grader.

Seems like a pretty nice guy, good sense of humor, entertaining lectures for the most part. My only complaint is that the projects are VERY complicated, meaning that he has to provide code to jump-start you, and that code doesn't always work.

The class was pretty easy and if you study, you will do great. There's extra credit + questionnaires (kinda extra credit??). He has 3 non-cumulative exams + 3 really leniently graded essays (just follow rubric and you'll get 10/10). I highly recommend this class as a fun and interesting topic! He also does little fun personality tests.

Great guy. Took an intro class so content was v basic + lecture could be boring. Enjoyed his stories that gave us a break from material. Have to purchase the reading, don't need to read it but the bolded vocab words WILL be on the exams. Need to list what he has on his slides on exam. Easy class, j. memorize evtg. 3 essays are not graded harshly.

Great Professor. Exams are generally not too hard and mostly multiple choice. There is a good amount of extra credit opportunities. Attendance isn't mandatory and lecture slides are available on Blackboard. My only criticism is that Prof. Elliot goes on long tangents that often make lectures drag on.

I found Professor Elliott to be a compelling lecturer with clear knowledge and prestige within his field. The class itself was straightforward with the final grade determined by three small papers and three exams. The content was interesting and presented succinctly.

Exams are multiple choice, fill in the blanks and short essay. He uses a lot of cartoons in class which is really funny and he is very easy to follow. In my opinion, the best psychology prof. here with applicable things in real life.

He's a very good professor and is fair in his grading scheme (top 30% get an A). His tests aren't too hard and you can skip one question per section but they require a lot of memorization. There is not much info in each lecture so you won't be frantically writing the whole time. The three papers are very easy and take at most 2-3 hours each.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: Prof. Elliot is very nice and is a good lecturer. Not hard to get a good grade if you go to the lectures and put some efforts.
Interesting class, lectures aren't boring; not that hard if you go to lectures. The assignments/essays are not graded harshly (as long as you put some effort into it you'll get a good grade)

Professor Elliot is a fantastic lecturervery engaging and clear about what material you will be tested on. Apart from his effective teaching style, the material covered in PSY 161 is fascinating and highly applicable to your daily life. Great class to take for psych requirements or just for fun :))
Professor Elliot has been one of my favorite professors so far. His lectures are well-organized and engaging and he is good at explaining the information. The class is very interesting and engaging

This class was one of the most engaging online classes I have taken. The material is very interesting and applicable. It is relatively easy to do well in the class by going to lecture and just focusing on the vocab from the textbook. The professor is very engaging and provides personal anecdotes in each class.
Worst prof ever
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Great guy, very friendly. Lectures can be a bit dull at times since he goes on tangents OFTEN. Exams arent memorization heavy.
Great professor, interesting lectures. Really enjoyed it.

He had an entire section on attraction and did not include any LGBQ relationships whatsoever. He said that there wasn't enough research on it, which is false. He just likes using old, outdated research, and is inflexible. I also didn't like how he wasn't clear that not participating in his studies wouldn't affect your grades (if even true).

Really great class, definitely learned a lot. Puts a little break in the middle of class to tell a funny/inspirational story. If you take good notes in class and do the extra credit, you will get at least a B+. A good portion (20%?) of his tests come straight from the readings (and will say so on tests!) so be prepared to read if you want an A.
Make sure to go over the textbook vocabulary if you don't actually want to read it, that's about as far as the "textbook material that gets tested" goes.

Frankly the lectures are boring even though the topics are  interesting. Lectures are not really organized, so does the textbook, which cause quite a bit confusion when you try to put concepts together. However, you must read the book, since more than 1/5 of the exams are come from parts of the book that's not covered in the lecture.
He's a great professor! People think his class is easy but guys, you have to STUDY for his exams, SERIOUSLY. The topics covered are really interesting and I loved his stories.

It seemed like he valued every possible minute he could get for class, but could have condensed everything that he taught into half an hour. He also takes time to tell you about his life; a nice break but waste of time. Also frustrating is that he required you to read the textbook because he didn't have time to teach everything in class.
Not a hard class. The topic is very interesting however you can't not study for the tests. People go in thinking they'll get As and leave with Bs.

very engaging lecturer, made class interesting and fun. personal revelations helped break up the lecture and music playing before class puts you in an even better mood! the tests are very easy if you study his powerpoints exactly.  awesome professor, i recomment him to anyone.  FAV professor at UR thus far!
Never rated any professor, but this professor deserves it. The best professor I have had here so far, very interesting, laid back and funny. Highly recommend taking his class.

He's an interesting guy. Sure, he talks about himself quite a lot but it's not THAT boring. Besides, it's a nice break to sit back and relax after a 30 minute lecture. But don't miss out his classes, you'll definitely miss some important stuff. You'll do just fine if you do some work and regularly attend.

Go to class, even if you know he could finish the lecture in thirty minutes but wastes an hour and a half on it, read the chapters a few days before the test, memorize the vocab and you'll get an A. I studied for the final for 3 hours after going to every class and no extra help and I got above a 97. Just go to class. Seriously.
Rambles on at points, talks about himself a lot (which is fine sometimes), doesn't seem to present or stress empirical and scientific data/studies in depth enough
Great teacher who loves the subject he teaches. Can go off on tangents from time to time but usually for the benefit of the audience
Talks waay too much about himself. Also, lectures can easily be taught in 30 min instead of 75min. Drags on and on..
easy going! interesting!!

It's easy to do well in the class if you get the lists he puts up in lecture + look over the text.  I didn't like him as a prof.  He spends 1/2 of class talking about his life and showing cartoons.  He spends too long on some subjects, often over complicating them.  Lastly, outside of giving lectures, he has no idea what is going on in the class.

He's very well-liked amongst students, but I was never a fan of his teaching style. Takes frequent and long stilted breaks from class to show cartoons or tell jokes. Why not integrate jokes into lecture? Tests are rote memorization: he asks for THE FIVE reasons for theory x, as if the ones he puts up on a slide were lassoed down from the heavens.

Not a hard class but you still learn a lot. Elliot makes class interesting by taking breaks to show cartoons and tell funny stories about himself so we can get to know him. He has a great sense of humor and is a great teacher.
Great class, watch out for tests, they can be a little tricky.

Assigns textbook readings at times, but you don't even have to do them to do well in the class. Just go to the lectures, take notes and memorize them to get an easy A. The self-reports were a little annoying, but they definitely help to boost your grade. He's also very funny and wakes you up with his weird stories.
He's quite the character and really not sane, but nonetheless very effective

This is definitely my favorite class so far!  He presents the material in an engaging and interesting manner, and has a wonderful sense of humor.  I'm also quite partial to him because he digs Explosions in the Sky, and anyone who digs them is a friend of mine.

No one is more self-centered than Andrew Elliot. Lectures drag on b/c of dawdling, personal revelations & cartoons. If he did therapy of his own and stopped using students as his sofa, it'd be worth going. Hour-and-fifteen min lectures could easily fit into 35. Take the course for an easy A, or if you're the "salivate at the sound of a bell" type.
no comment
Lecture was decent.  He spices it up with stories and cartoons.  Exams are memorization and definitions.  Covers a lot of material.  He likes to use an overhead, which is hard to see.
meh i liked him the 1st time, not so much the 2nd..his schtick gets old
sarcastic and funny,  won't disappoint

I had this guy years ago, and still get a big chuckle out of some of the great quotes he came up with in class.  "EYSENCK IS CAPTAIN CAVEAT..."  What a character.  One of the better large-course professors I had.  Ask him about his special graduation pen!!!
His tests are pure memorization, he loves to ask you to list things. Sometimes entertains himself a little too much, but overall, a good lecturer.
Definitely knows how to keep the class awake with his stories and superb lectures.  One of the best psychology professors on campus!
No Comments
awesome
I worked with Andy's team for research experience. very nice guy, but he didn't make much effort to get to know me. i've heard he's great in class.

I had a crush on this professor as well.  I had him when he first started at the U of R, and he was very entertaining.  He really captured my attention, and he was funny.  I enjoyed his class as a whole.
This guy is great.  His exams require lots of pure memorization but are very predictable.  He loves his job and his stories keep class very entertaining.
i have a hidden crush on andy elliot- so does every psych student i know- even the guys. great at his job.
i do not like this man!
One of the best profs I've ever had.  Kept class interesting and entertaining.
awesome professor
personal revelations, jokes, obsession w britney spears? its definitely a fun class, but look out for the exams!!!
difficult exams...but the comic strips, questionnaires, and personal stories make up for it
Great course material, gotta love the personal revelations
No Comments
Eh
No Comments

Goodman has the unfortunate task of being a first semester orgo professor. He gets a lot of hate. I think I learned more in workshops than in Goodman's lectures but orgo is an interactive learning process and this is unavoidable. Work hard and you'll succeed. Goodman's gruffness will grow on you. Look for his incredible sweater choices!
Tests on concepts not taught before in class. Avoid!
Not at all helpful in office hours

This is the worst class I have ever taken. My workshop TA was pretty awful and Goodman's notes are too messy. His lectures never made sense and I always learned all of the material through the internet. Really annoying student body in this class too.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Worst professor in the history of professors ever period. Does teach anything in the lecture. Doesn't cover the basics in class. The exams are based on workshop. Bad workshop leader... you failed ... only get graded on class based on the 3 exam.. hope I'll never have to take him again.
