Many of her exam problems have been straight out of her notes or similar to practice and video problems. She's given more work than I expected, but she's approachable and responds to emails quickly if you have questions. Def possible to do well
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Assigns more work that the allotted credits, used lecture time as a discussion so all lectures had to be watched on your own time. Does not care about the students and acts as if her class is the only one you have. Tough grader, but gives partial credit for the work she deems fit (which is not much). Not taking her again if I can help it.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: She don't really care about student. She just want to finish her own work of teaching.
Lot of work and you should prepare yourself to work a lot outside the class.

Dr. G was fine. She will tell you how to do well in her course throughout the semester. Follow her advice. She can be nitpicky and wants you to solve problems in certain ways she mentioned in class but she makes this clear. Besides that, discussions and workshops were 30% of our grade and are a giveaway, and she gives EC opportunities.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: could really do without her passive aggressive emails to the class. her lectures themselves are fine, but she's a pretty strict grader, so just be mindful of that. i really hate her attitude and her personality is the most discouraging factor for me.. may just be because we're online, acts like her class is top priority
She gives a lot of work and the class is not completely helpful.

Her lecture is very organized and clear, and so are her lecture notes. She takes off points on even tiny mistakes for both homework and project (often not necessary). Attendance in discussion required. Tests are relatively easy, and it doesn't cover all stuff in lecture and homework.
A solid choice if you are looking to take a stats class. Speaks clearly, very organized, helpful during office hours. A very fair professor.

Stricter in terms of grading than other professors in the statistics department. As a math major having taken classes with Dr. Mueller, McDermott, Nick, Joe, and Heckler, I can say that Dr. G is very nitpicky and takes off points for tiny details, although most people understood the bigger picture. A lot of people lost motivation because of this.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Tough grader

comment: Always open to help (especially during office hours), lectures are slide-based (accessible outside class), weekly homework and recitations, no textbook, and take notes!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class--Lecture heavy

comment: Prof. Grzesik really cares about her class and students. She is a good teacher and tries to help people out as much as possible. I would always get an email back within 12 hours or less. I found her explanation of concepts quite clear and she has a good balance between theory and demonstrating problems. Would definitely recommend

Dr G.'s lectures are clear and easy to follow, w/ tons of example problems. Her assignments reflect exactly what she expects you to know - no surprises. Everything is very straightforward. Office hours are helpful & she makes herself accessible to students to really make sure everyone is understanding the content. So glad I took this class!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. G is the best, she's super organized, so much so that I still use my stats notebook as a reference. Exams are fair and office hours are super helpful. I definitely learned a lot!

Incredibly organized and straight-forward lectures. Material is super accessible outside of class and the homework is very manageable. She cares about the students' success and is has very helpful office hours.

Professor Grzesik is a great lecturer. Lectures are always organized and she does a good job of making sure the material is clear. Easy to get to outside of lecture and helps in every way. Exams can be really long for a short time frame and if you miss lecture youll be lost in homeworks and coding can be difficult.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: While 202 is hard to get an A in, I can definitely say that I enjoyed this class. There's a LOT of work you have to put in outside of lecture bc of the flipped classroom style, but Dr. Sia makes it easy to ask questions and is really personable (also more Q's = higher chance of extra credit). We met a few times and she ended up writing me a LOR!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Calling what she said during her office hours "heavy racial undertones" would be an understatement. She was fully racist in her characterization of the COVID pandemic. She should be ashamed for the things she said in front of international students. Unacceptable behavior.
Very very hard
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: I switched majors because of how incompetent she was both as a teacher and advisor. She ought to be kicked out...

Difficult to work with and not willing to compromise on anything including grading. Avoid her at all costs and switch to a different advisor if possible. She admitted in her office hours she enjoys docking points to "show straight A students the reality of things". Awful mentality
This class is easy, skill issue.
You won't want to take this course....

While this class requires a lot of work outside of class, exams are open note/open internet. So as long as you actually keep up with content and think critically, the exams don't require dedicated study time. Besides taking notes, I never had to study for this class. The prof is very knowledgeable and approachable. Projects boost grade.
The sickest professor I HAVE EVER MET

Things that need to be learned in the classroom are recorded on video and placed on weekends, requiring students to spend MORE time. Also, the online recorded classes are ILLOGICAL in terms of coursework and lecture information, as if she is saying whatever comes to her mind, and after listening to the class, you may not get anything out of it.
Terrible course structure. Worst professor I've had and by a long shot too. Avoid if you don't need this for your major.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Prepare to get a bad grade

She goes on tangents and is so disorganized when lecturing. Her recordings are just her looking at a textbook picture and spilling a string of thoughts on the topic.  Doesn't make a rubric so you are at the mercy of the TA when it comes to grading. Some TAs are chill but some are so unnecessarily strict about the most tiny details.
Lectures do not cover what will be on the exams. Not helpful during office hours.

the best class I've taken in undergrad. definitely challenging but actually teaches you problem-solving and how to apply knowledge to answer scientific questions. Dr. Sia has high expectations but ALWAYS has her door open for students and wants you to succeed. certainly made me more confident as a scientist!

Dr. Sia's Molecular Biology has been the best biology class I've taken. It's not about rote memorization but instead using molecular to answer questions about the way life works. Dr. Sia focuses on problem solving and experimental design. She is also far more willing to meet with students outside of class than most professors.
Sia is the worst bio prof I've ever had. She will test you on the most precise details and offers little to no partial credit. Her lectures are a waste of time

Tries to explain abstract concepts with words, does not know that PowerPoint presentations exist. Goes on tangents talking about her personal life and opinions. Exams ask the most ambiguous open-ended questions and the grading is extremely arbitrary. Never available for office hours. Super arrogant when you have a question. Terrible, horrible prof
don't take this class. sia is super arrogant and goes on tangents without explaining anything meaningful
Horrible professor, take a bio course with literally anyone else.

Sia is easily the worst professor I've had in my time at the U of R. There is a reason she's not teaching BIO 198 anymore. She never used powerpoint or anything, and would try to explain extremely abstract concepts to us verbally. Didn't help that the class was at 9am and had mandatory attendance. I got deducted more points for submitting a regrade

This class really makes you work for your grade, but she is super helpful. She always makes sure to go back and reexplain when people are confused. The final exam is by far the worst part about this class, start studying earlier than you think you need to or you will be in a pickle. Dr. Sia is the professor of the century!!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational

comment: Dr. Sia's class is made out to be extremely difficult, and that is true. The midterms are fine, but the final exam will hit you like a freight train. Dr. Sia, however, is extremely passionate about genetics and wants her students to understand the material, so if you show up to class, read, and talk to her, you'll be fine. She is my inspiration.

Dr. Sia is one of the most knowledgeable professors I have ever had, however this does not translate to her teaching style. She refuses to use lecture powerpoints or write very much down. You must be an auditory learner and be able to decipher pictures that are poorly drawn on the black board to understand extremely abstract concepts. Tests are BAD
rating_tags: Tough Grader--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Didn't record lectures, didn't use a microphone, didn't write much on the board. It's a 9 am class so if you aren't able to focus that early in the morning then good luck passing. Tests are very lecture heavy, not much from the book.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Tests are tough

comment: SIAAAA. Favorite professor. Everyone makes this class seem impossible. I was terrified. But keep up with the readings and put effort to answering the problem sets and you'll do great.  Sia is the woman of the century and a great role model. She is who I want to be. Beyond that, she is incredibly caring and passionate about science and politics.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Hilarious

comment: This class is rough. So much material with so much detail, and Sia loves to ask every bit of it. You absolutely have to keep up with the readings or you will drown. We're not in BIO 110 anymore.  Sia is a very nice person and all but 90% of the class walks out of the tests unable to walk straight.

Worst professor so far at the university. Expects students to be able to keep up with 80 pages per week. Does not put any information into context. Refuses to use powerpoint or anything else to organize lectures. Rambles the whole class and draws random pictures on the board. I can't even begin to explain my frustration with this professor/class.
THE WORST CLASS AND WORST PROFESSOR I'VE EVER HAD IN MY TIME IN EDUCATION

Sia's brilliant and has high expectations for her students.  The material is super interesting but she sticks to chalk-talks and moves pretty quickly so sometimes its tough to keep up.  If she thinks she was unclear she makes an effort to go back and re-explain stuff, which is a huge plus.  The exams blow, they're long and tough, but doable.

There's no doubt Dr. Sia REALLY knows her stuff. Her lectures are a little disorganized though, and her drawings on the board make little sense unless you write down everything she says as well. Since she talks quickly, this is difficult. She is very willing to help students or clarify concepts. Tests are difficult and long.

Prof Sia's alright. Lectures are a tad disorganized, but all the info you need to know is there. Take very good notes on what she says, because her drawings on the board o their own are close to useless. Workshops are very helpful, as is the book. Exams are long and tricky - most students work until the end. She's very friendly and willing to help.

Dr. Sia's class is interesting.  Midterm exams are moderateIy difficult. I would recommend her were it not for the fact that her final exam was the most devastating ambush I have ever experienced in a classroom.  A cumulative exam that focused so heavily on minutia from the final week of class that it left students in tears (literally).

The lectures line up with the textbook which makes studying easier. Sia is very nice and funny, it's obvious she loves what she's teaching which makes the classes enjoyable, they're never boring. She also tried hard to make sure everyone is understanding what she's trying to teach.

Dr. Sia is one of the nicest and most helpful professors at the school. She really cares about her students doing well, and if you have any issue she is more than willing to talk to you at office hours. Her tests don't try to trick you, although they are difficult. My advice is study old tests because she gives you similar questions.

Only a tough class for people who lack initiative. Lectures are clear and move at a reasonable pace (Sia sticks with chalk talks and make sure you can actually catch up). Exams are of an acceptable difficulty, though I know it makes pre-meds rage. :) Extremely attentive to students and will help you out if you seek it out. Wonderful advisor, too!

Sia needs a higher rating on this site. While her lectures are a little bit disorganized and confusing, there is no doubt that she REALLY knows her stuff. She's great at answering questions and makes students a priority. Tests and material are difficult but keep up with readings and you'll be fine. Also she's just plain adorable in class.

Nice person, but useless lecturer. There is no point to this class since she is clearly substitutable by the textbook. She speaks too fast and her notes are disorganized. Her tests are very hard and based solely on memorization.
Extremely boring, all memorization, basically need to memorize entire book chapters to be prepared for whatever obscure passage she's going to force you to regurgitate for an exam.
Awful professor, she is a terrible human being. She is a **** and should be fired from the university. Fucking ****.

Very experienced and knowledgeable, and explains things well if you go to office hours. Organization of lectures was confusing-she jumps around a bit and doesn't contextualize the details. Also speaks rather fast and doesn't write much on the board
I learned nothing from her. Everything was learned in workshop or from the book. Very very poor lecturer.
Dr.Sia is very friendly and kind,but not a very effective teacher. She talks very fast and writes random things on the chalkboard, then jumps from topic to topic. I recommend recording her lectures.

Speaks too fast, everything on the board was completely worthless.  The book is fantastic and I learned everything from it.  She is a good person and helpful outside of lecture, but she is a terrible lecturer.
Great  professor!  Really lenient and cares about you! :)

I learned more in this class than in any other science class I've taken here at the U of R. She is an amazing teacher, very approachable, and was great to go to with any questions or problems (about the class or about life). She goes very fast, so make sure you have a recording device. But she explains things well.
Very fast in class, but extremely helpful. Tonne of notes, lot to memorize, but hey thats what bio requires.

Her class was interesting but required alot of memorization.  She talks VERY fast so expect to take a ton of notes.  I had about 9 pages of handwritten notes for every hour lecture. ouch! Don't skip any lectures because all test questions come straight from what she says in class.  The exams are also very long but she usually allows people to come in early to start.  The class was difficult for me but I still think she's a great teacher and was always helpful when i asked questions :)
Great class, was reviewing things from her class in courses my senior year. Everything is straight forward from her, just watch out for when Hinkle lectures (his test questions really suck)
Elaine is very helpful both as a professor and an advisor.
No Comments
No Comments
stenography 101 is a prerequisite for BIO 202

A very caring professor that wants to help you succeed but exams are impossible. This class is basically chem 2  and I found stupid that mechanical engineers should have to take this class just for their GPA to suffer. Take chem131 because it is only chem 1 and is the equivalent to this class and most kids in that class finish with an A.

It will be your hardest class. Lectures are full of constant content, but have valuable info. If you struggled with chemistry in high school do 131. If you're alright at chem its possible to succeed with determination & exam grading is generous. Despite his infamous homework he cares about mental health and will help you if needed (like extensions)
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Rothberg cares about his students and wants them to succeed but he's a horrible teacher. He runs through slides and practice problems consist of him showing the answer on the slides. There are graded in-class questions to ensure students attend lecture. The questions on previous tests are not always representative of what shows up on the real test.

Not great overall. Class is not super hard but Rothberg isn't the best. He does not grade homework in a timely manor which makes studying difficult. As an example, we have our final tomorrow and 4 of the weekly homework is not graded yet. Lectures are boring but mandatory because of Top Hat. Most learning takes place outside of class.

This professor, while having a great personality and an in-depth knowledge of the field, lacks the ability to teach. Following his lectures get confusing quickly as they often spiral on tangents. His method of teaching is to read off of a presentation which has not been updated in years and needs to be revised.

Rothberg is very smart but not the best teacher. Chem 132 is a class that should be taught step by step (like 131) and not by powerpoint. He goes so fast through the slides it's honestly better to just watch the recordings. There's a lot of different ways to earn points besides tests so don't be scared if you don't understand all the content.
I actually love professor Rothberg, but he is really not good at handling his speed for teaching. CHEM 132 is hard as well.

Professor Rothberg had his ups and downs. I couldn't stand his lectures. He talked extremely slowly and monotone. However, he was one of the most nicest, and understanding professors I have had. He always smiled, emailed if there were problems with grades, and provided helpful information on the class. He was definitely better than Dr. Matson.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Accessible outside class

comment: While some may disagree, I rated Rothberg higher than Matson. I do think that Rothberg cares and he does put effort into his teaching - he just thinks very differently and is out of touch with the students. His lectures are sort of all over the place and his exam questions are very convoluted, but for some reason I liked him more than Matson.

It was incredibly hard to follow Prof. R in lecture. He kind of struggled with the microphone and making it loud enough so that we could hear him, so I can only imagine how terrible it must have been for everyone watching the lecture recordings if they were sick or just didn't show up. Many people skipped his lectures because they were boring.

I went to 1 lecture for this class and it was one of the very 1st ones over zoom. within 10 mins I didn't understand what he was talking about bc who decides to start an intro chem class with quantum theory? He was extremely condescending to students. I said he was "inspirational" bc he inspired me to never take one of his classes again. 0.3/10

This professor is not a good lecturer at all. He speaks in a monotone voice for the 1.5 hours you're in class. On top of that he teaches as if you should already know everything and this class is a review so you can refresh your memories. From everyone I talked to about this class and the way it is taught EVERYONE is miserable.

I hate CHEM132, but it's not really his fault. Rothberg's lectures are boring and I just stopped going to lectures by March. I don't think he writes the tests, just in charge of term project. He is super sweet and cares about his students, but he has not contributed to me learning chemistry.

Rothberg is simply a physics professor and should not be teaching general chemistry. Although he is very knowledgeable about the class's topics, he often delves too deep for what a general chem class can handle. It is hard to measure just how bad of a professor he might have been because his co-professor, Matson, was the one writing the tests.

He was very dry and boring and was very rarely clear. The tests are meant for you to fail because there are other ways to get points based on the course. However, that shouldn't make tests unfair to students and cover random applications of concepts in ways designed to trick you. He is the worst professor I have had here.

As a person, Prof. Rothberg is sweet and it's clear that he cares about you. That being said, he's not the best at teaching, and everything seems all over the place. If you want to learn in this class, your best bet is Khan Academy and workshops. Tests are pretty difficult, however, there is a huge curve at the end of the semester.

This was the hardest I've ever taken, I was completely lost the entire time. To be fair it isn't Rothberg's fault. He knows this is a hard class and does his best. He's a fair grader and a very human professor, open to helping students and generous with extensions. He knows this is a tough, work heavy class and he'll do his best to make it doable.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Participation matters

comment: I don't think I've learned any new chemistry while taking this course. Every test I take I'm basing it off my knowledge from 10th grade, lol. He has a large focus on teaching about environmental impacts, which is great! Except the exams are actual chemistry concepts, which he somehow just expects you to know. Workshops are where you really learn.

I have dropped from his class. He did not mention any hard-core thing during the lecture. Beside, he just record some video and called it "flipped lecture". But why I need to take your "real" lecture? He just discussed some environmental topic in the lecture instead of the "real" chemistry.
Rothberg is a very caring professor and definitely knows his stuff. The content may seem difficult but he truly wants you to get a better understanding of the chemistry.

His lectures sucked!! Most of his time was spent explaining real-life uses, but this didnt help for the test. He went through examples but never worked them out by hand only had them typed on the slide which made the super hard to understand. Because of this, the homework was hard and the tests were hard too.

Dr. Rothberg is a nice guy, super accomodating and willing to help you with just about anything. He is not that great of a lecturer. You'll get test questions from class, but homework and workshop are where you'll do most of the learning. Do the discussion posts because he likes to ask about the environment and there is always a response on tests.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: The curve is what honestly will save you in this class, but the professor is an amazing person, but really cannot teach. If you actually want to learn in this class, go to office hours and asks him questions. Also just take chem 131, it's easier and your advisor is lying, you do not have to take 137 if you are doing engineering.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Lewis Rothberg is a very caring professor. Despite his hard exams, which are eventually curved, you have a conceptual idea of the big picture in CHM 132. This is not a GPA booster class, you will have to work hard and attend his office hours or those of other TA's (Teaching Assistants).
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Over complicates an introductory course to where the exam average was always failing. Very confusing with grading situation, gave a setup in the syllabus but surprise curved everyone in the end. Very confusing lecturer and is condescending if you try and ask him questions.

He is a very nice guy. His lectures are sometimes confusing and scattered, but he means well. He is one of the most caring professors I have ever had. In order to do well, it is important that you spend a lot of time reviewing material on your own. He is very helpful in office hours. You may not like the class if you don't want to do extra effort.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Professor Rothberg was a very smart man and genuinely cared about what he taught, but he did not convey the material in a way that students could easily understand. He taught above the average level of understanding and would often times mess up while doing examples.

Writes very mess notes during lecture, and will erase board immediately after writing. He has posted practice exams with answer keys that have incorrect facts (I had to go to my TA and tutor a lot for help). He likes having "concept lectures" that address real-life applications, but the exam questions on these lectures are vague.

I admit his material is hard to understand at the beginning, but after reviewing his material, you will find he is very organized in his syllabus. I learned a lot from his class. He will give lecture outline and summaries before&after each lecture, and his exam is easier than he what he taught in class. Never regret taking his class this semester.

Rothberg knows this material like the back of his hand and it shows. Lectures are a little disorganized, but about 13 of what he talks about is above the level you really need to know. The lab manual generally has the detail you need. He's a super nice guy and willing to help students, even if it's a "dumb" problem. Learned a ton in this class.

Thermo isn't my favorite subject, but this was a fantastic class. Rothberg's lectures are usually pretty clear, and always interesting. He is prone to getting mixed up, though. He values conceptual mastery on tests, but about 23 of homework are "mathy". He's also probably the kindest prof. on campus and is very very bright.

Be prepared for a very conceptual class - there are some calculations on homework and during lecture, but on tests, the vast majority of the questions are thought-based. Yes, lectures can seem a bit random and scattered, but at the end of the day, big concepts are what matter. Prof. Rothberg seems to genuinely care that his students succeed.

He's a very eager professor and really wants his students to succeed. He can be disorganized and a bit unclear at times, but is very willing to help, even if it's because of confusion he caused. Nice with grading. Definitely better at 252 than 131. He's not a "classic" chemist, so the very basic stuff isn't his background.

He is a wonderful man and tries his best, he wants to cater the class to students so let him know what you need! I liked the class, I learned a lot. He's scatterbrained but he wants to be a good teacher, so let him know how. Tests very fair. Looking forward to 232 with him.

just too aweful...he doesn't know what he is talking about and even said that in homework solution " which I do not understand". Can't answer question in the way students want and do not usually look at his email.. Exams are fine.. but just too many mistakes made in class.. unacceptable

He loves teaching and is genuinely fascinated by the subject. Sometimes he gets confused by his work but he knows what he's talking about. Read chapter before the lecture. If you knows your working hard and understanding material as best you can he is nice with grading. WORKSHOP IS  VERY HELPFUL.

Horrible Chem Prof. He had to correct his own exam while we were taking it. When we went over a practice exam, he had to pull out the book to find the answer. Then said the book confused him. He derived equations then told us we didn't need to use them. GET A DIFFERENT PROF for Chm 132. Farrar is MUCH better

was very enthusiastic about chemistry and its implications re: the real world, particularly on climate change and environmental issues, which I appreciated. I'm not a fan of chemistry but Professor Rothberg made it a bit more interesting for me.
i have no idea what he talked about in the class. FML......
Very knowledgeable. Able to pinpoint the underlying solutions to problems (his physics background helps).
Finds the worst possible way to answer a question, and answers that way. But at least he tries. I would try to get another prof if possible.

Tests are ridiculously hard, at least when I took it in 2003. He was unable to explain things from a chemical perspective -- it always had to relate back to physics!! Very frustrating and ended up not learning much in his class. I would recommend against this professor.
One of the worst profs I've ever had.  Not even the TA's knew what he was talking about.
Very unhelpful guy, wrapped up in his own concerns.  Hard to get ahold of.  Seems to not care, probably shouldn't be a teacher perhaps industry would suit him better.
worst professor ever...I had no idea what was going on in class. His tests don't make sense...
I hear he has a degree in Physics, making his chem class ridiculous.  Hated the tests, hated his derivations.. made it through the course alright thanks to the textbook.
Very bright man, just not the best teacher in the world
No Comments

Caution: very random! Likes to derive things and make references to Physics. Doesn't even have a degree in Chemistry, I don't think. No regrades on exams. He is right, you are wrong. Boo. Worst professor I've had yet... although he's an alright person.

Great professor! Machine learning with Purtee was super fair, with assignments graded quite leniently and with extended deadlines for a lot of them. The final exam was all multiple choice and true/false, and was pretty easy. I wish he'd delved even deeper into the math, but I'm pretty happy with the way he taught and structured the course!

You'll only pass if you alr know Java. Bc he's known Java for so long, he assumes everyone else does and the assignments are every two weeks but they're really hard. They will take two weeks. Also, I had a 103 degree fever for a week and had to go to the ER 2 times the week before my midterm on Monday and I asked him for a make-up and he said no.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: Love this guy, he cares about his students and the topic. Though his passion for java gets a little in the way of his teaching because he tends to under-explain and over-exemplify topics because he's too eager to show the code and doesn't realize this is an introductory course where students need a slower pace and more explanation to succeed.

You can tell Prof Purtee loves the material and wants you to love it too. Exams are fair as well as the grading for the final project. Avg grade for students was high too.  Be careful to make sure you're doing readings and watching videos about the material because lectures are often unclear due to Purtee's passion.  Always ask what's on exams.

I can tell he's good at programming himself, but he's not a good instructor in teaching. The only reason why I got an A is I took Java during high school so I was fully prepared for this class. You can barely learn anything from his lectures...

Your probably better off teaching yourself using the textbook and Youtube videos than going to lectures. After taking CSC161 with Dr. Polak (absolute queen) last semester and enjoying it, I really wanted to like this class --- HUGE let down.

Nice professor, and he always wants to make the class interesting and not "that" hard to students. To success, need some kind of Calculus (Partial Derivative and Matrix Calculus mainly), Linear Algebra, and probability theory, but not that much. However, if you really want to "learn something", I will still suggest CS 229 from Stanford.

Overall pretty solid professor. Lectures are generally interesting, although sometimes he rushes through information and then ends class 20 mins early. Homework and projects are very fair and honestly fun.

Prior to taking this class I had little experience with CS. His lectures are often not helpful and disorganized. I would recommend self-studying this class. It is the only way to understand what he is saying. He often changes the grading criteria so beware. Overall the class was somewhat enjoyable. He was not good at responding to emails.

Purtee is one of those professors that actually cares a lot and is passionate about what he teaches. Nerdy guy who cares about your learning more than just giving you a grade. Super lenient when it comes to giving extra points on exams. Always accessible outside of class and clearly cares for his students. Great prof for an intro class!

Very disorganized lectures, wish they were recorded cause he doesn't post the code before lectures so it is hard to remember what he says as he is typing out code. As a person with zero coding experience, the class was fair, I did do a lot of reading and watching videos and that's how I mainly learned. Purtee is a nice guy with passion, but not 4me

He's a good teacher, I just think he's teaching style might not be for everyone
Yeah sure he is a bit messy, but he actually likes CS which honestly is super important!
He cares about his students, he makes class funny, his homework while a bit tuff is genuily fun to make and he is very acciseble and receptive to feedback!

I switched to this class about three weeks into the semester. Professor Purtee made sure I could catch up and helped me get on track. He is very kind and cares that the students do well in class. He tries to make lectures entertaining and goes through code in class. Assignments aren't too bad and you can always ask TAs/the prof for help.

I think he is a genuine caring guy who loves Computer Science.

Lectures, however, are a flip of a coin.
Sometimes it's entertaining, fun, and he explains things coherently.
Other times, it feels like he got no sleep or is extremely bored, so he rushes through the material in what feels like five minutes.
He is very docile and generally kind.

If you want an "easy" CS course - take 161. 171 will challenge you if you do not have prior CS experience. Purtee is OK - he cares and wants to help his students but struggles to communicate effectively. The difficulty of the course depends entirely on your prior knowledge. If you are experienced, this is an easy A. If not, get ready to work.

The worst professor I've encountered. He constantly altered the course grading criteria throughout the semester. Many peers were unsure if they could get an A due to his erratic policy changes. It's shocking that such an irresponsible approach exists in an intro CS course, potentially dampening many students' passion.

(Fall 2022 course) 3 homework projects and 3 quizzes, no exams. Projects are easy but quizzes need some effort. He has a slow teaching pace and sometimes makes little mistakes during lectures. But he will adjust the coverage  of quizzes accordingly and curve the final scores to save all students if the average scores look bad. BTW, TAs are nice.

I had Purtee in CSC-171: An Introduction to CS. This course was by no means an introduction. I attended nearly every lecture, read from the textbook, went to labs, & still around a month & a half in I was very lost. I don't know if this is because of flaws in the way the course was designed, or Purtee's teaching. Still, he could have done better.
not very organized, exams are harder than he thinks(in-person paper exams because of chat), free textbooks, and lectures are too complex for beginners. Great guy though, he can be very humorous.

Funny, transparent, and great guy. He's kind of confusing and all over the place, but he's always trying new things and trying to get better. Exams are harder than he expects, but he tries to correct this. Good introduction to CS but not good intro to programming. If you've never programmed I HIGHLY recommend taking CSC 161 before this class.

He modified the whole courses schedule this semester which makes everything more difficult ( not fair at all). Now you have to reach 95 to get an A in AN INTRO CLASS. His lecture was so boring. Have no idea what he is talking about. Will not ever take his class.
He is a typical "CS dude", he has a clear passion for cs but in my opinion, his lectures were very disorganized and is not suited for teaching... at least not an intro course!

I found the class super easy. Students completely new to Computer Science will probably find it difficult. Purtee wants to helpful and teach but often gets mixed up when explaining important topics. He really tries which I appreciate but I feel that he isn't suited to teach an intro course.

I personally found the class very easy. Labs take 1-2 hours to complete and projects may take 6-7 hours. Lectures are sometimes all over the place but Purtee is really enthusiast and eager to help his student succeeds.

Professor Purtee is a nice professor and generally gives decent lectures compared to some of the other professors in the department. That being said, I would not rely on lectures to succeed and like many other CS courses, a lot of the learning is up to you. The class was overall useful and you can get a good grade as long as you put in time.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Professor Purtee is a nice guy and really great with grading criteria (if it works you get an 100) but my god he is a horrible lecturer. This class was not accessible for people who haven't coded before. He doesn't explain concepts well at all, and his coding demos are useless as well because he types so fast that everyone gets lost immediately.

Professor Purtee demonstrates a genuine love for the subject, but does not know how to apply it properly and teach his students in a manner that will help them succeed. The assignments he gives are far more complex than what he says in class, and he isn't lenient at all with extensions, 5 points are deducted per day even if you have a good reason.

He is a funny guy. CSC 171 was really not an intro course, i had no coding experience and it was VERY difficult for me. The lectures aren't that helpful, many people did not go to them. Labs/Projects took approximately 1-3 hours, they were difficult. Quizzes are online through blackboard which was nice.

Clearly loves the subject, not super good at explaining things. CSC 171 is supposed to be an intro class for complete beginners, but if you have no background in CS, expect the homework and projects to take an absurd amount of time. The grading is super straightforward - if your code works, full credit.
So good. Really funny and I learned the fundamentals of Java. Adorable man

Prof. Purtee is a very understanding professor, who usually gave extensions on assignments and offered extra credit on projects. The class was graded very fairly. However, he does go a bit fast in lectures and is a bit all over the place, so be prepared for that.

adam purtee is a funny little man. csc171 lectures arent required, i guess you could pass this course only by the graded zybooks, but the lectures were pretty informative when i ended up paying attention (im sorry for falling asleep in class prof purtee). projects in general were VERY fair, make sure to put in the effort and its an easy 90%+ grade

You get what you put in. Good lectures and organized PowerPoints make the concepts very easy to be understood. The final project is challenging but it pushes you and make you learn. Even though the lectures are said to be "optional", it gives you a different perspective on the same concepts which will help you understand better.
I took CS171 in spring 2021. I never attend lecture, and I basically studied everything myself through zybook. Not a bad class and not a bad professor. Take this class if you need!
Great teacher and very lenient, almost too lenient.

This is not a critique of Prof. Purtee's teaching, but a WARNING to those who want recommendations from him! He tends to overpromise and stands you up right before the application due! So if you really want him to recommend you, be sure to have a backup recommender and cross your fingers.

Professor Purtee is very accommodating. He very frequently extends the deadlines of all types of assignments. Quizzes in this class are very quick and straightforward. The only difficult things are projects, but you have a lot of time to do those
Professor Purtee is a really funny guy. He can sometimes be a bit disorganized in class, but he has a clear passion for the topic and makes class interesting with practical demonstrations
His lecture is important if you want to get good grades.

CSC 246 is quite challenging and you must have strong mastery of linear algebra and multivariate calculus in order to succeed, but it is really worth taking, especially for those who want to explore further in theoretical machine learning and AI.

Adam is very nice. I can't say he is perfect teacher but most of times his lectures were enough for me to understand the topic (except for the graphics part). CSC171 is an easy course overall, just start your projects early and everything will be great. Adam is funny and easy grader.

Prof Purtee was an amazing teacher to have, especially for CSC171. He makes sure that everyone feels included in the class and his lectures are very informing. His office hours are also a great resource to ask questions.

He is a really nice professor who cares about students. However, the class in general is really hard and for students with no CS background it can be very fast so it is highly advised to have a study group for his class. This class will feel like a 6 credit course

Dr. Purtee is a great lecturer. He really cares about students and does his best to help students of varying computer science background. He is extremely helpful outside of class! (GO TO OFFICE HOURS). The homeworks are based off lecture material and he always gives recommended reading for if you aren't sure if you understand the material.

This was my first ever official CSC course, and Prof. Purtee is great at bringing people unfamiliar with Computer Science into the fold. Lectures are often very engaging and the assignments are clear and fairly assessed. Not a test heavy course either. Would recommend to those looking to get into CS.
I have to basically teach myself everything. Don't see the point of taking this class.

Taking professor Purtee's class is extremely miserable. His lectures were completely ambiguous, confusing, and preposterously fast. In the class, he taught how to calculate 2 to the power of 2 is 4, and the homework is programming Angry Bird! Yes, he offered materials, but those are nothing more useful than himself. Self-teaching is the only way.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Hilarious

comment: Has his own online space(Piazza) for students to give feedback and ask questions. Extremely helpful. You can really feel like he wants you to do good and understand everything. Liked his energy, his lectures are fine, homework just enough. Overall? Prof. Purtee is the the definition of a good professor.

Prof Purtee has a pleasant teaching style. His humorous ways of speaking really made the CS lectures less stressful and sleepy. Homework and quizzes are pretty easy to handle. The projects are not very hard, though they did take you some time to figure out and finish. The only things that seem to pull down your grade a bit are the 2 paper exams
BEST PROF HERE! His lectures are unconventional, although they are the most interesting. It feels like you are learning by going through a journey. Everyone needs to take one of his classes.
do the readings and get feedback on your papers.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy

comment: I should be sad and weep, but something in me was so overjoyed to hear that Douglas was about to reach total freedom and return to the source, that I jumped and yelled with sheer delight. I knew that sooner or later I would reach another state of awareness and I would weep with sadness. But that day I was filled with happiness and optimism.

Brooks is an amazing professor! His lectures are pure genius and such a pleasure to attend. He's incredibly intelligent and wants to teach this material that he's so passionate about. Makes college meaningful

Brooks is knowledgeable and passionate about his subject and genuinely cares about students. Content is interesting but lectures are purely him talking at you for the full 75 minutes (no visual aids, no participation) which can get boring. Exams draw from readings more than lectures. No technology allowed in class, so notes must be handwritten.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Brooks is very intelligent, knowledgeable, and passionate but he's also super arrogant. I feel like I learned more about his life than about the subject matter. Questions/discussion weren't encouraged and he preferred we regurgitate his opinion than argue our own pov. Good news is he was an easy A.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: You wound regret for taking it

My mind is blown every class with him. Amazing. He's incredibly intelligent and his arguments are flawless (and he knows it) and makes you want to convert to Buddhism. He likes to pretend he's a hard-ass but is really a soft soul that wants you to do your best work and for you to succeed. One of the best professors I've ever had. LOVE.

This class is probably the best with Professor Brooks. He talked a lot about Kashmir Shivaism and Sri Vidya. His area of expertise in Hinduism . Very interesting class but you gotta go to every class to keep track of material.

Brooks is not your conventional professor, and he is brilliant because of this. He walks in to lecture and speaks to students on a string of interests - never a planned lecture. This class is more than just lecture+memorize A. Its about stirring thought, broadening your horizons, and leaving as a more open person. Check his history - he's so cool!
Absolutely amazing lectures. Made me very interested in eastern philosophy. Can't wait to take other classes taught by him.

He is super passionate about C2Z and treats the class as almost a part of his legacy. It's really interesting hearing him lecture as well. Anyone who missed class was severely missing out. Also readings are the only real homework, but don't get behind since the assignments severely rely on them.

Brooks is without a doubt the best professor I have ever had. The reason the "clarity" isn't too high is because the material itself is incredibly confusing. As he says "If you don't leave this class confused, you weren't paying attention". But that "ah ha!" moment is completely worth it! That class is worth it just for his life advice and stories!
He is funny

Brooks is funny and one of the sweetest, most inspirational people you can talk to. If you look him up on google, he has done really great things. He knows a lot, but can sometimes go off on tangents in class. He is incredibly helpful in office hours. I plan on taking 105 with him too!
You'd be crazy not to take his classes! He knows what education is really about, and if you find it incomprehensible it is only your own understanding which must be opened and revitalized.

Douglas Brooks may be the most incomprehensible teacher I have ever had during undergrad.  He goes on random tangents that completely misconstrue the main point of the class.  He has no idea what an intro class is supposed to be.  Most students think he is intelligent, but actually he is just an exceptional ****ter.  Sometimes has good stories.

Professor Brooks clearly did too many drugs.  He rambles on about nonsense in such a way as to make it totally unclear to his students what the hell he's talking about.  He may or may not know his stuff, but the way he presents material to students leads only to confusion. He doesn't give enough background to make reading worthwhile. Bad Professor

This man is so hysterical, so inspiring, incredibly dedicated, and shockingly knowledgeable. As a freshman I feel thankful to have stumbled upon a gem nice and early so I can take all of his classes. His lectures are jam-packed but they go right along with the reading and he repeats himself incessantly from lecture to lecture. TAKE. HIS. CLASSES.
Brooks is one of the most inspirational teachers I ever had.  He is an amazing asset to the University.

Wow, this was one of the best classes I have ever taken (and I'm a bio major).  He allowed for a great class room dynamic with lots of questions being asked.  Class does have substantial reading to it but books were good.  He is fair in grading and can be available to review an essay if needed.  Over all, professor and class both highly recommend.
He is one of the most inspiring professors, had it not been for him, i would never have known the beauty of religion
He makes me want to learn and shows a concern for the education of his students. You'd be doing yourself a favor to take one of his classes and see that college classes don't have to suck.

Brooks is awesome, funny, and genuinely cares about his students. Very "upayic" teaching method, cause he goes over points until he's sure most of us understand them. Oh, and he really digs getting chili peppers on this site.

I chose UR for the study of religion, philology, and philosophy. In him I found an eclectic, polymathic guide to a better education, and I might have judged my academic studies as ignorant rhetoric if not for him. Opinionated, yet most open-minded to other views. He cares for his students and their education. His courses are bliss meets brillance.

I've been attending his class the whole semester and I'm not even registered. He's absolutely brilliant and has an extremely broad knowledge base. Knows how to walk the fine line between the sublime and the ridiculous. One drawback is that he can couch his explanations in overly academic language that can make him difficult to follow at times.
Professor Brooks is the only person in the world who can make a subject as boring and tedious as Sanskrit interesting
I was just a computer science major before I took his class - now I'm doing a religion minor. he is a GENIUS.
THE most amazing professor EVER
The most brilliant and inspiring professor.
The best stuff you'll ever learn

One of the smartest people I have ever met; he's inspiring. He's an engaging, funny professor and the only professor whose class I would like to attend even if I'm not registered for the class. Sometimes however he describes things in a way that the average person, such as myself, has trouble understanding. Great professor!
crazy but absolutely genius, incredibly intelligent, experienced and enthusiastic, very interesting class
went on long tangents and was very unclear. didn't learn much in this class.
Simply brilliant. The man can take any topic and speak extemporaneously forever - and somehow tie it back into the lecture. Makes you think and challenges students individually.

Although my ratings may not reflect it, this guy's a GREAT professor, probably the best one I've had so far in my short college career. He's very insightful (not to mention hilarious) and his classes never fail to interest me. His tests can be very hard to study for. Just make sure you do readings and understand the general concepts. GREAT TEACHER!
excellent professor! one of the best I've ever had. knows his stuff big time. excellent!!! go meet with him. He's super helpful and knowledgeable.
Intersting guy, pushes you to extend your boundaries and to think differently, very worth taking, excited about the material
Funny guy teaching a really interesting class.  I wish I had taken more of his classes.
Amazing
very good
hands down my favorite prof at the u of r!
amazing professor.  makes his subject appealing to others.
He's crazy, that much is true.  The glue holding him together may very well be just enough to make you think however.
he's nuts, but great. really entertaining, interesting course.
take one of his classes before you graduate!!

past the 97% test weight and hard to follow lectures, this class wasn't really hard but just required almost all learning to be done outside the classroom, which wasted lots of time for me, esp in lecture.
Such a great professor I have ever met! He is a genius. I love his lecture. As long as you study, you will ace this
He is a great Professor. You will get A as long as you study the notes. Going to Ta's office hour helps.

Professor Mark Bils is definitely a genius in Econ field. He always has passion about this subject, but his grading method is quite weird. His grading only composed by assignment and exam, but the assignment only occupy 6% of the total, and four exams will take remain 94% grade, which means if you fail on one exam, you will facing a bad situation.

I have to admit Mark Bils is a genius in the econ field and he is also an amiable professor. However, he is a tough grader and most of the credits are graded based on the exams (the exams are also very difficult). His lecture gets confusing after the first 10 min. I would discourage my friends from taking this class when they ask for my opinion.

Professor Bils is great. His lectures are generally very clear, and he is always open for questions. Content isn't particularly hard, and he shows it very clearly with plenty of easily understandable diagrams. Shows up in time, is always prepared, and clearly wants the best for his students. If you're willing to read here and there, should be easy.

Mark Bils is a real genius in Economics. He is very smart and full of passion for this subject. However, his lecture is sometimes confusing. He recommends a textbook (which is a very nice book) but the materials he taught are all in his lectures. And the lectures become confusing after 10-15 minutes. The exams are easier than the lectures tho.
rating_tags: TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Bils is a very smart man, but it doesn't translate to the classroom. Lectures are extremely confusing and will leave you lost after 10 minutes. Exams count for 96% percent of your grade, and they aren't easy. Wouldn't recommend.

Very smart and interesting professor but not as accessible as he should be considering the difficulty of the material. would definately take again but make sure you put in the work on your own before going to class or you may struggle keeping up with the material.
Two tips to get an A:  1 - Read the material BEFORE the class. You'll get infinitely more out of it.  2 - Exams tough? Instead of thinking theory-to-data, think data-to-theory.
Very interesting and engaging. Learned a lot
People who has a true interest in Econ could best appreciate his lectures
Not engaging.  His tests weren't that hard, but failed to really narrow down the topics so lots of material. Keep on top of readings and you'll be fine .
Grading was ridiculous.  Tests were out of 25 pts, then quadrupled. A 2-3 pt math error on your test would move you from an A to a C+   Lectures were unclear and jumped around a lot
He's on Wikipedia
A genius.
No Comments
He's a decent teacher and also extremely nice and very approachable. I recommend him.
his lectures were horrible and the tests were completely irrelevant and difficult to understand. way too hard for an intro class.
Avoid if possible. Lectures are pretty unclear and unfocussed
Boycott him.
hes really funny and really nice and helpful, but the class notes have nothing to with the problems on the test. i feel like i end up memorising the problemsets...

His class was agonizing on a good day.  His questions come out of left field, hence a 30/50 is a B.  I worked way harder in this class than I should've given that it's an intro class with no prior knowledge necessary.  He was pompous and rude in office hours and I would never take a class of his again and discourage friends who ask my opinion.
His lectures are incredibly boring and too general, as his test questions are very specific. He is not helpful at all. This class discouraged me from being an econ major.
No Comments
one of the best professors at the u of r.  he can't help it that his class is at 9 am and that most of the students have hangovers.
A genius! One of the very best professors that the U or R has to offer.

Bils is a very boring lecturer; he has a monotone voice and draws way too many graphs.  The class is solely based on tests that seem easy but usually everyone fails so he has to scale them a****load.  Also, none of the TAs speak English.  His class discouraged me from majoring in Economics.

a very smart guy, but a horrible teacher. he would digress all the time from topic to topic and not explain anything. He would spend most of the class talking about very general things then test you on something you learned the day before the exam. too smart for his own good. he's also a macro prof not a micro

smart guy but doesn't teach too well.  his main downfalls as a teacher are his unwillingness to prepare students well (doesn't offer solutions to previous exams so he can reuse problems; no hw).  he has high expectations but doesn't do much to help students reach those expectations.
For an intro class, it's difficulty is ridiculous.  Waking up for a 9 am with him not explaining clearly makes coming to class a very taxing endeavor.  I hate the class!
not too helpful speeds past things, office hours are pathetic, once a week for an hr...come on
He's clearly an intelligent professor but should not be teaching intro to economics. He skips steps in explaining concepts and says that they are intuitive. Skip 108 and take 207 with Landsburg.

He's rather arrogant but he has the brains to back it up. He isn't clear about a lot of the things he teaches; he mostly counts on you to educate yourself so you can come to class to challenge him with your new insight. If you need someone to hold your hand, he isn't who you're looking for.

He is funny and he knows the stuff really well, but he doesn't convey all of it to the class. He could be clearer. Plus, all his TA's didnt speak english well but thats not his fault.  SKip 108 and take 207 with Landsburg.
This guy ran a crapy class. Didn't make anything clear. Used a lame text book. take 108 with somebody else.

Sexiness does mean anything when you're taking Test 4 and drawing a complete blank.  My TA and another one I went to was horrible, I couldn't understand him.  Bils is not good at explaining the million diagrams he draws.

Lecture and quizzes are great, but his tests are awful!  Reading the textbook and LEARNING is worthless b/c basically a lot of the actual knowledge from the text is not tested.  He simply tests on problems he went over for 5 minutes in various lectures.
Poor professor.  Does not teach well.  Comments on poor testing structure very true.  Poor TAs as well.
very intelligent and enthusiastic, however the testing format was evil
he's really hot
very humorous guy. this guy is a winner. his sweatervests - enough said.
Bils was a very fair professor and I learned a lot in this class.
No Comments
No Comments

Boring class. There are no discussions. He almost seems offended if you ask a question or show up to office hours. You also have to show upto every class and note down everything he says to get a good grade because there is no other material to study (like slides). If you are willing to do that, it is pretty easy to get a good grade.

Earl isnt particularly great. His lectures are turbo BORING and can be hard to understand at times. The class exams are fairly easy if you remember most of what he talks about in class, but the class itself is boring since you only hear him talk for most of the time. He also doesnt value original responses very much, wanting answers from class.
No words... horrible hand writing.. no slides.. mandatory attendance and he is all over the place. Do not do it to yourself.

Conee is not the best professor, his lectures are very boring and he tends to ramble. Also, the grade is only determined by 3 midterms, so no final, but also no homework. However, the tests are all based on content from lectures, so just go to lectures regularly. In my opinion, the content was easy, so having Conee wasn't the worst.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Earl Conee will inspire you profoundly. I cannot stop thinking about him. Taking Ethics with him changed my life.

I think I misunderstood what the meaning of life was before this class because it is the most boring class I have ever taken. It's an easy course as long as you regurgitate what he says on paper, exam questions are not difficult either if you go over the things he talked about in class. Be prepared to fall asleep in every class.

Lectures are often dry and overly textbooky, so it is hard to pay attention and understand the material at times. There are no note handouts/lecture recordings so you MUST attend class. Your grade is only based on three exams, and he tends to grade harshly. Focus on the arguments for/against the theories, as that is what he will test on.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: He is a boring lecturer. I am in this class right now and I have never cared less about the meaning of life. I am a philosophy nerd too it's not like this guy is just too abstract or dense he is just completely unengaging and his readings are generally also this way.

Professor Conee is sweet and knowledgeable. His Phil 101 class was entirely test-based, with exams only on content introduced in class. Exams aren't super difficult but do require studying. His reasoning can be hard to follow, but he uses accessible language and makes an effort to answer questions. He's a decent lecturer and his class is manageable

Material is dry enough, but he does not make it any more interesting. Only 3 exams determine your final grade, but they are pretty lenient (ex: choose 4 out of 7 questions to answer). Tip for notetaking/studying: focus on the objections to the theories - he rambles a lot, but this is all he will test on. Don't write down everything he says.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Rambles during lectures, hard to distinguish what will actually be tested on. Only grades based off of three exams and does not offer any other way to boost your grade.

Classes are just rambling and rambling essentially incoherently. Tests are graded specifically on *his* views and only the stuff that happened in class, so the readings and original conclusions barely help you. Class isn't unbelievably difficult but is totally pointless and frustrating.

Stick figure diagrams and sentence fragments on the board. If that isn't your learning style there is little recourse. I've always struggled to absorb a lecture and take worthwhile notes at the same time so I almost went crosseyed. For the final 15 people pooled their notes and pieced together his lectures like a lost ark. Please give note hndouts!

He made too explicit, at least for non-native speakers, explanations on philosophical points, and it takes you years of time to make sense after class. And the tests are graded on strict but ambiguous criteria; you would be surprised about your grade on a you-seem-to-know-well topic. That is a class that you will regret for rest of your college.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Hes terrible. He will grade you based on his opinions. He will not be fair. He has a lot of issues like OCD and paranoia. I will never take another class from him again. This was terrible. He cant give lectures. He cant explain himself and he shouldnt be teaching any mandatory courses.

Really nice professor who cares about the students. Lectures are kinda boring, but that's more the material than the professor and he does his best with them. Tests are easy and he's more than fair on them. Reading is optional, can easily end with an A with no reading and minimal studying as long as you at least kind of pay attention in class.

I have taken both PHL 102 and PHL 227 by Conee. Trust me take PHL 102  if he ever offers it its a great class and shows a great analytic approach to philosophy and is a lecture hall. PHL 227 is a whole different story. Small class and he takes a analytic approach to simple details. He does not appreciate your own thoughts on the subject.

Connee is the worst professor I have ever had. He is so confusing, he rambles, he is SO boring, and is absolutely useless. Lectures are miserable and if you miss one sentence you will never hear it again, even though you will probably be tested on it. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS! You'll regret it.

I transferred to UR studying philosophy for 2 years. One class with him, and I knew philosophy was quickly becoming a quite worthless, boring field. Too analytic, not enough common sense. He makes easily expressible ideas difficult to comprehend. Suffice to say, I changed my mind about studying philosophy at UR, but not about studying philosophy.
Good professor, interesting lectures with the all bizarre examples he gives to illustrate a point. An easy A if you go to class and thoroughly understand the material.
Whether or not you will enjoy his classes depends on your initial interest in the subject. Can be hard to follow at times but he's helpful and his tests are easy.

great professor!! I loved his ethics 102 class and hope to have him again before I graduate. really makes an effort to be engaging and funny. the subject matter can get a little dry, but he does his absolute best with it. tests are very fair and there is no homework. highly recommend this professor.

Found the text to be interesting at times.  The lectures were pretty boring though.  Sometimes he lectures on stuff out of the book though, which makes it necessary to go to class.  Would not recommend taking this class "for fun."
His teaching style is horrible as is his class. Don't take a class with him if you can help it. He is not at all helpful and acts as if he is insulted if you show up at his office hours.

I enjoyed the coursework very much, but Conee is a boring lecturer with dogmatic interpretations.  I did poorly on the midterms because the answers I tried to express my own interpretations of the text, and Conee clearly didn't appreciate it.
If you go to class...and actually pay attention in class and do your reading you will be fine...onlii thing is it is BORING...atleast PHL 102 ethics was...
hes as awesome as he is bald!
His class (Ethics) is incredibly boring--both the books and the lectures.  I learned a lot more in my high school philosophy & ethics classes.  Do not take this class with Conee.
Easy class if you take notes and go to the lectures, but i was only awake for approximately one lecture in its entirety.

Professor Connee is great!  He is extremely enthusiastic and doesn't really assign work out of class.  The tests come straight from lecture, so if you go, you will do well.  His lectures are also very humerous with all the examples he gives.  Definately recommend.
Mr Clean - who knew he taught a class at UR... not a bad class - just go to it, and def. go the class before the test because he will give you the test right there.
No Comments
Yes, he's hilarious and gives easy A's, but it's impossible to stay awake through his lectures.

SO awesome!  He's like Mr. Clean and a turtle combined. Though some may think the lectures are boring, its really just the material.  If you don't like philosophy, you wont like him.  I think he's halarious and 101 is an easy class!

very easy to get an A as long as  you go to class.  his tests are word for word from his lectures, and as long as you spend a few hours studying before the test you're golden.  and plus, he's completely hairless and hilarious...what more could you want&#6
Not very intersting or easy to follow in class.
Just take notes in class, dont worry about the book. class notes are the same as the book and he basically gives you the test the class before.
Ok, basically, he is a bad teacher who teaching a slacker class (ethics) who tries to get people to take him seriously by giving bad grades.

Okay, so yeah, his lectures are long and the material isn't the most engaging... but the man is hilarious!  His exams are really straightforward and easy-as long as you attend class- there's no reason someone that has attended class should get below a B.
No Comments
A really funny guy.  I learned a lot about various philosophy theories in his class.
Bring a pillow...
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments

Professor Salur (or as she begs everyone to call her, Sema), is by far the best professor I have ever had. I was cold called sometimes, but it really built so much confidence (she was playful about it). I barely went to class, but every time it was enjoyable.

PS: If you're active in class, and she asks for your name, know you're getting bonus pts!
Great professor, class isn't crazy hard if you try, and she cares about her students, though there's a high chance she'll cold call you in lectures.

Absolutely stellar professor, probably the best math teacher I've ever had. She tries to make classes entertaining, if not through the content, then by randomly cracking jokes. She's readily available and explains tough concepts very well. Class is a little fast paced, but if you've done a skim of the textbook readings beforehand, you'll be fine.

Professor Salur is a very good math professor, especially for those who are engaged during lecture. She knows what she's talking about and explains it well. On the topic of grading she is very lenient, extra credit is sometimes offered for lecture attendance and the content of the exams are very clearly laid out in lecture.
Super funny professor and very easy on the grading. Great class I would take it 3 more times if I could

Professor Salur really cares about her students and is willing to help them. She has a good sense of humor and is always open to answering questions during lectures. However, we moved pretty slowly through the content and didn't finish.

Professor Salur is easily the best professor I've had at this school. She is so kind, funny, and good at teaching. She lectures quickly but within a few weeks you can get used to her pace, and she makes sure to answer all questions during class. Her class had me considering a math minor because it was so good.
Great Professor! ! !.

Genuinely one of the nicest and most caring professors you'll ever have. However, lectures can feel a little rushed and she overcomplicates her explanations a lot. Tests were way harder than what's done in class, but webworks and workshops help cushion the grade. She's a great professor and person and wants you to succeed as long as you work
Professor teaches things clearly and will have a small review session in each class. But the class was a little slow and didn't finish everything
You will absolutely love her!

She is very friendly and brings a fun mood to the learning environment. She is understanding of the students and is willing to help you if you ask. The only thing is that her lectures are very rushed and unorganized. The best way to learn would be to read the textbook yourself.

Prof Salur is extremely generous. All the tests she made are very easy. She also marked one webwork complete for us. In lecture, she moves very fast and sometimes directly skips some concepts, but she is willing to slow down, explain and do practices to make sure we understand it. She is very knowledgable in math and kind to her students.
Highly recommend, very knowledgable and clear with her expectations of what students should learn.

Professor Salur does move fast but she is more than willing to answer questions and slow down if needed. She is very accommodating and definitely knows how to break down complex topics, the best math professor in the whole department, easily.
Don't miss prof. Sema session. She is really helpful and kind. JUST TAKE IT.

Prof Salur gives precise, concise, and inspirational lectures. Her notes are also just very helpful alone. She is very respectful and kind. I can assure you that doing any course with her will be dependable. Besides, I suggest that ask her fruitful questions during her office hrs. Also, MATH 165 is just easy and shallow in linear algebra.
Really great!!!

Technically we cant get A+, but I just want to note that my overall grade is almost perfect in this class. Definitely take calc 3 with Prof Sema. She explains everything clearly and slowly to make sure that all students understand the material. Tests are not hard!!! And we had several review sessions before final. They are extremely helpful.
She goes through every little detail and explanation.

Prof. Salur is the perfect combination of a person who knows the content VERY well, can teach more than competently, and is just an all around great and nice person. If you're taking a class that she teaches, TAKE IT

Great teacher, but her organizational skills were so bad that it affected the course it such a bad way that her rating went from a 5 to a 2. Constantly behind where the syllabus said we would be which meant during finals week instead of spending time reviewing she crammed in hours of extra lectures on new content to catch up. Not okay.
She is an amazing professor. True god and legend.

Most caring professor I have ever had. Always willing to extend office hours and respond to emails in detail. Very receptive to even the dumbest questions during class, so don't be afraid to ask. Do the suggested exercises before the exam and you will get an A.
Amazing professor, knows her field really well, will answer any questions in or out of class. Put in the effort and you'll get an A.

Prof Salur was great. She was very clear at communicating the most important topics throughout the semester and was very upfront about what we would be tested on. Lectures could be a bit dry but that comes along with the course material. All in all would highly recommend.

Sema is super smart and a very nice woman. Her class was difficult and she tried really hard to help her students understand the material. There was a lot of webwork homework, but that is the case with any MTH164 professor. She moves quickly, so if you have trouble grasping a concept in a few minutes you may need to get extra help.
Wonderful lectures and easy to comprehend
She's crazy smart and sometimes it's hard to understand because she goes so fast. If you ask a question though, she is great at explaining things in a different way. Don't be afraid to speak up!

She knows her stuff and is pretty enthusiastic about but goes through her lectures very quickly (hopefully you're a fast note-taker). Do as much practice as possible and get as much help as you can because you're gonna need it! Not an easy course.

Salur's brain goes faster than her chalk a lot so her lectures can end up mildly confusing and frustrating if you like things to be neat and in order. She loves people coming to office hours and will help you after class too, you just need to be proactive.

Sema was the best teacher!!! She was clear and concise, explained all the concepts fully but never wasted time dilly-dallying with extraneous information or explaining things that were implied. She made the material seem super easy, and practically told us exactly what would be on the exams. Also she gave us candy on her birthday. :)

I had Sema for MTH 162.  She's very kind, clear, and intelligent. In my opinion she was the best professor of my semester. She gave extra review sessions on friday/saturday for those who needed them.  Only down side is that she goes through problems at a semi-quick pace.

She's an awesome teacher. Sometimes she goes fast, but she's willing to stop and clarify if students have questions. Also, she'll usually summarize the previous lecture for the first bit of class and make it even clearer. Oh, and she's really nice.
asd

Very enthusiastic teacher. Cares very much. thick accent, but you adapt after a week or two and hardly even notice. Always a good laugh or two for each lecture. Makes VERY easy tests. Highly recommend and I hope to TA for her in the spring

She's so helpful. Refuses to move on until every student is comprehending the material presented. She wants to see people do well, so she doesn't make the exams too hard, and also will give out "bonus points" if she felt that the test was "too hard." My favorite professor so far.

best calc professor i've ever had. she truly cares about her students and will do anything she can to give you a good grade. find a way to make her class fit your schedule, this is honestly a time where you should take the professor, not the class

Professor Salur is amazing. She's funny, teaches stuff that actually appears on the test, and cares about the success of her students. I'm pretty lousy at math and I'm actually doing pretty well in the class! Really cool lady.
Awesome person! Very easy class. Reiterates material over and over and over...Great for those with little prior exposure to calculus-based math
Witty, cheerful, helpful.  Salur really cares about her class.

She cracked jokes to wake us up, and went out of her way so that we could get better grades on our tests (she allowed a re-test for the first midterm, which only our class was offered). She answered homework questions in class and focused on what she thought was most important for the final.  Very good teacher. Funny and enthusiastic!
really great professor--nice, helpful, a good grader
Great teacher.  Always goes over the material well, and has a good sense of humor.

While Grella's teaching was entertaining at times and it was definitely apparent that he's an extremely intelligent person, he is extremely harsh. I got a D on my first essay, but as long as you meet with him, you can improve a ton (went up three letter grades on the next one.) I learned a lot from him. Don't take this class if you're sensitive.

Great movies, terrible professor. Avoid Grella at all costs!!! His grading is completely random and not based on any actual rubric. His lectures are a waste of time, reading the movie's wikipedia page would give you the same knowledge.
living proof that course evaluations are not read by anybody of any importance, or else he would be out of a job
While a brilliant professor, he has the tendency to be harsh as hell. Especially in his grades. If you're expecting a professor to hand out A's easily, he's not the professor for you.
