The man is brilliant. He is a vault of knowledge, and the books are very good. He is a very tough grader who grades heavily on grammar and sentence structure. I learned a lot in the class, but he can shoot down your ideas in class. His "meanness" is misunderstood and can be funny in my opinion.

Worst professor I've ever had. Is VERY picky about writing and will give you whatever final grade he thinks appropriate, regardless of what grades you've actually received. Mean-spirited. Says the same thing over and over again.

Gangster Films: Avoid this man. The hardest grader I have encountered at U of R, he loves to give out 'D's and 'F's, but if you suck up to him you can get by with a passing grade. It does NOT matter if you are a good writer, he is super opinionated and will give you what ever he wants. Great topic, great movies, awful professor.
George Grella is a petty, mean-spirited and truly awful person. Avoid any class he teaches at all costs.

Without a doubt the worst professor I ever had. I have regretted taking a class with him every day.  The only reason I haven't dropped his class is because I'm also in another class with him and can't drop one because then I know he'd take it out on me in the other and I can't drop both or else I'd lose my financial aid. Don't ever take his classes

I registered for his course after the first day of class and emailed him asking for the syllabus so I could catch up by the next class.  His email back and our short-lived further correspondence was not welcoming at all.  I have since transferred into another course and am so glad I do not have to deal with any more of his rude remarks.

Taking this class ruins my day every time. He is a pompous ****, an impossible grader, completely unhelpful and in my opinion pretty ****. He fancies himself to be some kind of Hemingway hero but in reality he's just a sad old man. He sucks, avoid him at all costs.

Terrible.  Person transferred in on the second day of classes, and he ran her down about missing the first week.  His "radical new teaching style" consists of watching a movie and talking about it for 5-10 minutes.

Taking his course is self-torture. I was slightly amused by his attacks on the right-wing and stories of his youth. Then I got my first after spring break and the grade was horrible. Grades on grammar and his personal concept of style. Cuts of views different from his own as well. Don't be late to his class.

I genuinely dislike him, both as a person and a teacher.  He does nothing to facilitate an open dialogue.  Rather he cuts off views different from his own, and goes out of his way to try to make his students feel belittled and incompetent.  If you are interested in being abused and having his opinions alone, shoved down your throat then take his cl

I love this guy. He's very funny and basically spends most of class telling stories about his life and writing. In this class we had only 4 assignents, just 2-page essays. He did not really give any feedback on them or put grades on them, so I don't know how I am doing in the class. Even if I fail I had a lot of fun with him as a professor.

He's old school. Mandatory attendance, and a grammar freak. Though a tough grader, he will work with you to improve your writing and let you rewrite papers if necessary. Articulate, informed, and dynamic, he's the best genre studies professor at the university.

He's definetly a pompous ass, which is part of what I like about him. I like the way he runs class ... basically you watch a movie and then discuss it after. He's a tough grader, focusing more on grammar than content. He's very self-centered and hard to persuade. Teaches very interesting classes, so I'd say it's worth it overall.

I had him for films of the 60's. He more or less talked about his escapades with friends in the 60's. He does not look at an essay and see its true content. Instead, he looks at who the person is, and give them what grade he thinks they should have. Don't take him unless you emanate that brainy vibe.
No Comments

We're reading the most amazing books (Fitzgerald, Hemingway, Faulkner), and he only goes over PLOT.  If we go over the books at all.  If you ask questions beyond plot, he says you're overreading it.  I hate you Grella!

Pretty bad class. I respect him for making people write well, but he grades based mostly on grammar as opposed to content. He shows good films and leads interesting discussion afterwards, but I didn't learn much and felt I got better grades for simplistic essays with good grammar than original ideas.
No Comments

Grella goes over the same five themes again and again, and never brings anything new to the table. He also doesn't teach--instead, he expects you to read a book on how to write essays on film. Essentially, you have to dumb your papers down to fit into his criteria for a "good paper". Stupid students and doormats would be best to take his courses.

Pompous jerk.  Grades people WAY too harshly.  Said to me, "That's not part of my job" when i asked him to help me with paper.  No sympathy expressed when I missed a class due to car accident.  I hate this man.
Not many people like Grella; I think he's all right.

He will not tell you why he does not like your paper, but he has not problem giving you a bad grade. However, if you quote him in your paper, it might improve your grade or at least give you one decent comment. Overall, I learned nothing from him. And he's ARROGANT.

20th cent. Brit novel.  Arrogant, lectures are completely useless.  If he isn't talking about himself, then he's rambling about the British class culture.  Had a graduate sub for a week, was sad when it was over.  Totally useless class, learnt nothing.  But I got a decent grade.  Go figure.
seems to go out of his way to be difficult.  rude and pompous.

I loved both of the classes I took with Prof. Grella. He was the one college professor who seemed to care and he was the one guy who wasn't sunshine and hapiness for eveyone. If a student gave a wrong answer, he told them so and moved on. And his grading forced me to become a good writer again.

"Discussions" = him droning for 75 min.  Difficult grader, which would have been fine if he had gone through my paper and told me why it was bad so that I could, you know, learn from my mistakes. All he did was point out words he didn't like.

Awful, AWFUL teacher.  Cannot facilitate a productive or interesting discussion.  Every lesson or theme relates directly back to himself.  Simply terrible.  I cannot recommend avoiding his classes enough.
A very proficent teacher, other students only complain because he expects students to be able to write clearyly and without bsing through their papers

WORST TEACHER EVER....he name drops constantly and cannot grade a paper for anything...he thinks he's Gods gift to baseball...but newsflash, the Cubs were! Someone really needs to bring him back down to earth.
i bet he's cool in the real world.  he just needs to work on being a bit nicer and less viva male power.

It is unbelievable how terrible this guy is. The purpose of a professor is to help the students learn the material and he does the exact opposite.  He's a horrible professor and a waste of a space. Never take a class with him.
Horrible teacher, has no desire to help students

He lives vicariously through the characters in the movies/books he teaches. He is rude to everyone, including the poor people who have to set up the videos. He seems like a sad, lonely little man. Try to avoid unless you want an easy pass/fail class.
Took class in 1974, taught from High School Clff Notes.  Last original thought-never.
Not a nice guy at all.  Avoid him.
HE hates women
teaches contemporary authors.  this guy is a real jerk.  don't take it.
chauvenistic literary and teaching style.  needs to get off his 'high horse' and come down to earth and relate with his students once in awhile.
No Comments
worst four hours of my life, teaching style: asinine musings
A poor, pathetic, old shell of a human being.
Good class. It requires good math skills. I wish it could include broad topics in regression. eg, non-linear regression, ridge, lasso, etc.

I have taken multiple classes with Professor Ciminelli, and he is the best professor I have had at u of r. He is extremely knowledgeable and caring. You can tell he truly cares about his students and what they learn from his classes. Exams and homework can be lengthy and tough, but it is truly worth it.
best prof ever
taken STAT216, best professor ever met
Best stat prof ever

To say that he is a good professor is an understatement. Unlike most of the others I have had, Professor Ciminelli explains concepts extremely well and is always willing to help students who are struggling. Would strongly encourage any CS or stats majors to take a course with him.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Ciminelli is genuinely one of the best professors I've had here. While the content for the class can be quite challenging, his lectures are extremely clear and break everything down. He recognizes when we're not understanding a topic and adjusts accordingly. He genuinely wants you to succeed.
Best professor ever. Amazing lectures. Reasonable and helpful homework. Clear class notes. Students can really learn solid knowledge from his class.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: This is a relatively hard course, but prof. Ciminelli is really helpful!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Best professor ever and STAT 218 is relative easy.
The reviews are true, Dr. Cimminelli is a great professor and will help you outside of class when you need it. Workload is kind of heavy, so get started on assignments in advance.

Fantastic lectures, very passionate and caring. Will respond to emails quickly and is very generous and respectful. 262 was very easy, but stats is not a difficult subject. Prof Ciminelli was a pleasure all semester.

Joe is the best professor in terms of teaching not only in U of R, but also in my grad school. I took his STT218 in Fall 2018 and STT223 in Spring 2019. I feel so lucky to have him during my senior year. He is the one that makes classes organized, easier and interesting. More importantly, you could get a lot of extra help outside of the class.
Rarely do you see a professor that's both a nice and easy-going person while at the same time also a great instructor. One or the other is usually what you hope for.
Good

He is probably one of the best professor at U of R. Not only does his class is super organized and the lectures are very informative and useful. He is very helpful after class and supporting his students. Fantastic teacher!

I've taken STT212 with Prof Ciminelli before and I'm taking his CSC262 through zoom. For each model he listed, he would sliced the content into smaller pieces of videos with clear titles. He cares for students and keeps sending reminding emails with specific responses to questions. He is PERFECT. Such a regret that we cannot meet him in person.
He is one of the nicest professor I had for my undergraduate.

He really is one of the best professors at the University. Caring, gentle, takes time to get to know you. Interesting and really great introduction to statistics. You can't really go wrong with him. Was struggling a bit in the class and he set me up with a great tutor. Great guy.
Professor Ciminelli is a gem at U of R, one hw assignment per week and gives out practice tests that are very similar to the actual ones.

Ciminelli is by far the best professor I've ever had at UR. He truly cares about how his students are doing , and does his best to make sure no one is left behind . The way he approaches the material is easily comprehendible. There is one homework assignment each week , but I feel the assignment directly reflects the types of questions on tests .
He goes above and beyond as a professor. He is very sweet and is always willing to help students out.

Professor Ciminelli is hands down the BEST Professor Ive ever met. Though our class became online, he is very responsive and caring to his students. His tests are reasonable and gives opportunity to correct for credit. His lectures are also super coherent and organized. Simply a great person and lecturer! Thanks for everything Professor Ciminelli!

Super good and helpful prof. Really detailed, clear, and organized slides. Lectures are boring but not required. He often uploads supplemental videos of him solving problems if he thinks he didn't explain something well in lecture. He also made cookies for us on the last class!
He is one of the best professors I have ever had. He is an amazing professor and cares about his students.
He is just amazing. The only bad thing is at the end you realize how BAD your other professors are.

Really nice professor in Statistics Department! For students planning Data Science major: if you haven't decided which course to take among 212/213/262, then 262 can be the best choice for you, which is also the best connection to DSC265!

Easily best professor I've ever had. The material isn't particularly difficult, but if you ever have any troubles with it, Joe is there to help you at almost any hour of the day. And he makes cookies for all his classes. <3 Joe

If the class experience given by professors is normally distributed, then we can reject the null hypothesis the Professor Ciminelli is like other professors, with p<0.0001. Ive never seen a professor devote so much to teaching well. Proof: made cookies for 150 students at finals. thats not a requirement; it says a lot. He wont leave anyone behind.

Professor Ciminelli is the best teacher i've had at the university so far and is my favorite teacher ever. He genuinely cares about his students understanding the material and enjoying his class. His lectures are interesting and he makes sure the students understand the material before they leave each day.

Amazing, amazing, amazing professor! He's one of the most caring and thoughtful people I have encountered at the UofR. He's fully devoted to the class and will try his best to get you to understand this stuff! He was of great help! 100% deserved his Professor of the Year award!

Dr. Ciminelli is literally my absolute favorite teacher. He really wants his students to succeed and works really hard to make sure that his students understand his material. He's extremely accessible and makes stats interesting to learn (he is very knowledgeable). He got the professor of the year award for a reason. TAKE STATS WITH HIM!
I love ciminelli so much that I created an account so that I can hype this man up. TAKE HIS CLASS
I would die for this man

One of the best professor Ive had in college. He cares about students and is approachable outside class. The homework needs some time work but its doable. Class was very helpful in learning RStudio. Definitely recommend to take his class.

Definitely one of the best professors I had in u of r. Always care about his students and respond emails super fast. He even baked cookies himself for 6 hours for us during final week. Strongly recommend to take his class.

He's really approachable and easy to talk to. The homework is challenging, but it makes you to learn the material. This class is awesome if you enjoy statistics and learning more about different tests and models used by statisticians.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Best professor Ive had so far! Hes so organized with his class material and he actually made me interested in statistics (a class I took just for the premed req)! Plus hes very accessible outside of class, which is very nice. Go Joe!!
He really cares about his students and so far one of the most amazing professors.

Joe is by far the best professor I've had at UR, I've taken STT212 and STT218 with him and thoroughly enjoyed both (never in a million years thought I would enjoy stats). His passion for stats and teaching is blatantly obvious and he always makes time to help his students and make sure they understand everything. Restored my faith in professors.

Professor Ciminelli is one of my favorite professors. He is very friendly and approachable and will respond to emails very very quickly! He makes statistics easy to understand and he explains concepts extremely well. Highly recommend Ciminelli for any Intro Stats courses!!
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: OK SO- Dr. Ciminelli actually is easily the most accessible and well-read professor I have come across at U of R. STT212 is needed for lots of kids and he makes the class so FREAKIN' interesting and easy. He is super big on examples, makes great study guides, responds to emails ASAP. I haven't met a teacher like him and I'm scared I never will.

Dr. Ciminelli is by far the best professor I've ever had. His class was wonderful and I learned so much! He was always available for help understanding material, and he even baked us cookies for the last class of the semester! Also, can we talk about how insanely cute Dr. Ciminelli is?! Easily the hottest professor here!

Quite possibly the most upbeat, positive, helpful professor that I have had at UR.  The material she teaches is not only inherently interesting, she constantly pushes you to think about the contemporary ramifications and connections to what the class is about.  Lots of writing!!  So if you hate writing, it's not for you.

She's amazing, so kind and understanding. She lets you re-write papers for a better grade, and will let you make up work that you have missed. She cares about your understanding of the material and wants to hear how you're engaging with it, which is really cool. That said, so much reading.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: She is such a sweet professor who really cares - she's trying to teach students to critically think about incredibly important topics. If you communicate any problems - personal or about the course - with her, she will truly help you. Her course was engaging, and she fosters community within class. The content is also always thought provoking
She is amazing!!! Love her so much! Super knowledge and very accessible outside of class. The lectures are engaging and interesting!!

This was the most valuable class I've ever taken. Lectures are organized and engaging. The material is presented in a balanced and respectful way, and she doesn't expect you to know anything about the Bible going in. I stopped reading the textbook halfway through the semester; basically everything you need to know for tests will be said in lecture.

Great lecturer.  I could listen to her all day.  Just an overall fantastic professor who is excited about the class and is understanding and nice to students.  I took this class on a whim and I am so glad that I did.  Recommend.
Just a gem of a human being -- Super smart and interesting. Packs as much as she can into each class. Great lectures. But treats students like they are humans -- helpful, kind, reasonable.
Best prof
great prof

Prof. Anne is amazing; her lectures are always enlightening and her tests are kind of scary but not that bad. She's very knowledgeable and very open about any kind of question you could ask about the Bible or the Jewish/Christian faiths.

Loved, loved, loved this class. Mostly lectures, but a ton of interesting information. Prof. Merideth is very respectful of people's religious traditions and encourages us to relate our personal traditions to class material.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: She is the best lecturer I have had at UR. She has an amazing understanding of the material and the discussions are deep and well structured. The expectations for the course are reasonable, and there were about 40 pages of readings a week. She is very personable and willing to help students with their writing. I also took 101 with her it was great.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Amazing lectures

comment: Really great professor! learned a lot in a class that I didn't think I would be interested in. really caring and clearly passionate about the subject...
rel101
One of my favorite profs

I loved REL101 with her. She always has a clear outline of her lectures and expectations. She is enthusiastic and passionate about the material she teaches and I learned so much from her. EVERYONE IN THE USA SHOULD TAKE THIS CLASS and maybe we wouldn't have so many quoting the bible horribly out of context. Would recommend. Looking forward to 102.

Provides great feedback with papers, really helped me to organize and develop my ideas. Very hands on and clearly cares about students, also very personable, funny, engaging, and passionate. Great class to take first semester freshman year! No tests, only papers and she's flexible with rewrites etc.

Excellent professor. She is prepared, invested, passionate, and enthusiastic about both the subject and teaching itself. She is helpful and clear in her presentation of the material both in and out of class. A great, friendly professor that I would highly recommend.
Professor Merideth is funny, specific, clear, helpful. She never failed to respond to e-mails, and her replies were always useful. She made dense subject matter a joy to engage with!
Amazing professor.

I took Religion and Violence with Merideth.  Best class I took at the UR.  She's a great professor.  Takes students seriously and is serious herself, but shes also nice and funny.  I wish I had taken more classes with her.  I took this as a senior when it was too late to take more.

Fascinating topic made even more interesting by prof. She's helpful and kind. Willing to really help you with your work and writing. Tells funny stories. Missing discussions WILL bring down your grade.

Very good lecturer! I have only had her for REL 101, Intro to the Old Testament, so far, but I really enjoy her. NOTE: This class is not about her preaching to you; it is about looking at the Hebrew Bible from a scholar point of view. She does very well at explaining, and she gives out weekly study guides as well as exam study sheets.

Teaches really interesting classes in a great way.  Open to student ideas and questions. Fantastic lecturer, goes out of her way to help students.  Definitely take one of her classes if you are interested in Religion.
Great Professor
Awesome professor!  She is a complete angel and you just have to love her!  Splendid!!!
Fascinating class and great professor

She is an amazing teacher. Her classes keep you interested and make you look forward to the readings. Her exams are very comfortable if you do the exam study guide. It was my favorite class of my freshman year!
she is extremely smart, shes cute, and her class is easy to follow... i never thought i could love jesus so much
Really cares about her students

Really keen and stays on track. I've been told she's religious, I'm not. Yet she was great for me: No bias, no preaching, just teaching. I learned a lot fast, and students that don't like her tend to be pious and inconsiderate of her qualities because of ignorant conflicts with their own religion and academia. I love her classes, great teacher!

AMAZING Professor!!! She's easily accessible and very flexiable in terms of assignments and deadlines. Very interesting and enagaging. One of the BEST professors I've had at UR. Don't leave without taking one of her classes!
Made what could be a boring class (Bible) into a fascinating one.  Very understanding about student problems, happy to give extensions and make up work.

Very good lecturer; comes off a little arrogant sometimes.  She's very helpful in terms of assignments but does not seem willing to meet individually with students.  Extremely informative class and professor.
She's engaging, helpful, and available. You learn a ton in class and not too much outside reading is necessary.
Very interesting class.  Excellent teacher!
Very enthusiastic and helpful.  You'll learn a lot in a class you probably never thought could be this interesting!
EXCELLENT Professor! Incredibly clear lecturer, gives tons of feedback on your work, wants you to do your best.  Rare combination of brilliance and nicensss!
She's a cool teacher
efficient: minimum work for interesting material and good grade
Very dedicated, nice, considerate professor.  Learn a ton in her classes.

Prof. Pakianathan's lectures can be a bit dry but that's only because they are heavy on theory. I didn't like his lectures a lot but the abundance of homework problems helps a lot with preparation for exams. His exams are heavily inspired by questions asked on HW assignments so do them sincerely and you will be fine. Classes are well structured.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: His lectures were incredibly funny and he made linear algebra enjoyable.

Jon gives incredibly enjoyable lectures on a difficult subject. When the math gets tricky he'll openly call the problems "obnoxious" and "a pain". If you have an opportunity to get the Pakianathan experience, you should absolutely jump on the opportunity, and enjoy the wildly entertaining and educational ride.
Solid lectures, very knowledgeable. Make linear algebra easy to learn.

This course wasn't easy but Professor Pakianathan made sure to go over examples for each topic in great detail. Though he followed the book, he sometimes diverted from it to show easier ways to do problems.

He's the best of the 165 profs, in my opinion. His lectures were very clear and engaging, and he did a lot of helpful examples for every topic (about the same difficulty as homework and exam problems).

His tests are a unique format. On our 165 final this fall there where: 2 multiple choice sections, and 3 long answers with answer boxes that broke the problem apart. Thus little to no partial credit on these questions. I also thought there was going to be more of a curve considering the average final grades where Part A- 77%, Part B -67%.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: One of my favorite math professor. Very enthusiastic and knowledgeable about math. Lectures sometimes can be confusing very his office hour is very helpful. Exams are relatively hard compared to the past and he sometimes tend to over explain questions. However, outside of class he is very accessible to answer any questions.
By far my favorite professor. Very amazing person both in and outside of the classrooms. Gives very clear examples and is more than willing to help outside of class periods.

His lectures are so helpful!! He does lots of examples and wont have super complicated problems that are a higher level than the tests. Hes super reachable outside of class and always willing to help students
Out of the 165 profs, he is probably the best. If you have to take 165, take it with him.

Professor Pakianathan is a very nice guy and definitely knows what he is doing. Take his class if he is teaching because only his kids understand the language of the written homeworks.The lectures are very heavy and proof based but help. Midterms are on the rougher side, know your rules, properties and how to apply them and you will survive.
Very great professor. He cares about students, highly accessible outside of class.

Excellent overall. I followed his lecture for 1st and 2nd midterm, and I think he is great. Nevertheless, after midterm 2, I am kind of confused since the class goes too fast, so it takes some time for me to study the material on my own. You can go to his office hour. Final is not hard as well. Be aware that quizzes weight almost the same as final.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Lecture heavy

comment: Paki is really nice and also a really good professor. His lectures can sometimes be fast paced or boring, but I think that's more of a consequence of the material than him.

Professor Pakianathan is one of the best professors I had for math. Although, his lecture is fast paced, but his lecture notes are amazing and have enough examples to clarify the concept. His exams are not too hard and you would do great if you go through the homeworks and lecture notes.

Even though this course is not mandatory, I didn't miss a single course. Each of them was too valuable to miss. The professor is passionate to teach, and appreciate every student. I would definitely take his courses again!

His lecture can be confusing but reading the chapters you will do fine. real tests really similar to the samples. lots of homework but answers can be found online. mth 150 is the easiest course you can ever have in your 4-year college
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: The best professor! He's enthusiastic. Lectures are so good.

Very enthusiastic. This class is more a primer on a ton of higher-level topics but without really exploring any of them very deeply, but he manages to go extremely slowly and explain stuff well (even though the class doesn't prove why any of the theorems are true which is annoying). He also sometimes writes a bit small so sit near the front.
Best prof ever

In the beginning the course syllabus may look intimidating but Prof. Pak helps you tackle every type of problem on at a time. He makes sure to go over every possible webwork problem during lecture and helps simplify the course material to the best of his capability.

Prof Pakianathan is an enthusiastic and understanding instructor who is very genuinely willing to help any student who needs help and in great detail! Lectures may be boring at times but you'll do fine with plenty of practice. His exam questions aren't difficult and are actually more lenient than you might think!

This class was really hard for me because I hadn't taken math in two years, but he was so helpful along the way. His teaching style was good and he's a funny guy. He always had office hours before exams and would go over any question you had. Super super helpful. Best math teacher I've ever had.

I did not find this lecture to be very helpful and thought it was boring. I have heard that he is better than the other teachers, but he does not teach in a style that is helpful to me. He quickly jumps through examples without really explaining them and often rambles off topic. Overall he is a good guy, but I did not like him as a professor.

Jon's class was ok. The material is definitely difficult and his tangent rambling is not helpful at times. I've left class some days feeling like I didn't learn anything, and others feeling like I did but it didn't show on the midterms.
Passionate, clear, and wants his students to succeed. He goes over the material very thoroughly and prepares you well for exams. He's such a sweet and funny man and makes calculus 2 totally doable!
He's a good teacher but he's constantly saying sorry and if you pick up on things quickly he goes too slow but if you're not clear he's just right.  He rambles but is a real sweetheart
Great professor, he explained everything very clearly in class so that I didn't even need the textbook.  He's also very helpful during office hours and seems to genuinely want to see people succeed.
He is really really good. I really enjoyed having him as my teacher. He was one of the few that kept me very awake in class.

He's very polite and helpful. He's very interested in seeing that you succeed in his class. Homeworks are a bit lengthy but if you do well he'll even give you bonus points. He even used some of the graphs I had made on the homeworks in his final!

I had Jon a few years ago for Discrete math. The concepts were easy, but a bad teacher could have seriously obfuscated them. Jon's very organized in his teaching style and speech. Pay attention and you'll be rewarded.

I liked the course material, but the lectures were excruciating.  If you know what you're doing, he moves too slowly.  It wouldn't be bad if it were just thorough, but he rambles like crazy and constantly second-guesses hir that doesn't beg forgiveness every 5 minutesmself, which I found extremely irritating.  I want a teache
Really organized, knows subject well, more together in terms of teaching than other math professors @ UR, but gives long irrevelant formal proofs
Good at explaining the material.  Realizes his students don't have their Doctors in Math already, which is more than I can say for the rest of the math department here.
He seems really dorky/nervous at times but just likes to explain things thoroughly.  Nice lectures though.  The class however, hard homeworks.
No Comments

Jon is hands-down the best teacher i've had here.  He is super organized, clear, available, flexible and just all around excellent.  His assignments and exams are fair and reflective of the work that's focused on in class. Homeworks are harder than exams.
The most boring teacher ever, he might as well be talking to an empty room
No Comments

Foster was really funny in lectures, most of the time he just writes things on his ipad the entire lecture, but lab is really fun and if you get to know him and talk to him hes going to be very chill and really down to earth. Once we made him seat every single student to where we sit usually and he did it easily so that was impressive.

His lectures are great and he is easy to understand. He makes things pretty entertaining but the exams tend to be really hard. However, he gives a ton of partial credit and the curve is pretty heavy. He's very clear about what is gonna be on exams but sometimes throws in questions that no one can do, but it all works out in the curve.

The exams take a large amount of your final grade, and they are usually pretty difficult. Average will be like 50% 60%, but he will decide final grade wisely. His lecture is perfect. The problem comes from the course material that is not difficult to be taught in general, understandable language

Very full of himself. He claims he's accommodating at the beginning of the year but is not. If you are struggling in his class talk to the TAs they will be more helpful than him. Go to office hours as frequently as you can.
Foster makes Separations a class you want to go to. Legendary stories and immaculate lecture notes every time. Homework and Exams are a breath of fresh air compared to CHE 243
This legend sips on luxurious beers.  Very positive guy, nothing but respect for him.

Foster is so chill in CHE250.  He beat us up in 243 but he's an angel in 250.  Lectures are laid back with fun stories told by him, hw is not long, exams are short, and he is a much nicer grader.  You'll still learn a lot as he still keeps things professional once he gets his "acting gear" together.

Foster is very full of himself, and hard to reach out to. Very "my way or the highway" mentality, which, when you reach out to him when you're struggling, is very unhelpful. Also your grade is almost all based on your exams, with no way to earn points if you have a bad day. Homeworks are also often long, confusing, and very difficult. Prepare.
The workload is a lot but this is one of the more interesting courses that I took from the CHE department
Great at explaining concepts. I hate his exams and the way he grades them. Way too long, difficult, and a tough grader.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Great teacher, but the grade is test-heavy (75% is test-based). Labs were fun, but make sure you do everything that is "suggested." Take his advice about getting ahead on the work (esp labs).
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: He is kinda like the big brother that likes messing and tormenting his little siblings only to say "gotcha!" at the end. Very big ego but overall not that bad.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Test Heavy is the best way to describe this class, although its not outlined in the grading criteria you're grade will be decided entirely by your tests. The final isn't as bad as it seems, but do not have a bad day on a midterm as it will cost you your final grade. Very clear and direct professor, definitely full of himself but you'll get over it.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY

comment: Professor Foster a high opinion of himself, and a lot of his decisions and actions are guided by his own ego. He tries too hard to appear intelligent, often brags about how he likes to solve equations in his free time, and purposely obfuscates questions and material. He also acts like a brofessor, maybe so students will like him more.  I dunno.

Great professor. Clearly intelligent and well-read, but also expects a certain level of effort on your part. Homework isn't a large portion of the grade, but is critical to understanding the problems on exams.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: This class is k, but the final was quite challenging. It also requires a lot of time doing HW. A lot of people think Prof. Foster is a good guy but I can definitely feel that he is kinda biased against students whose English are not their first language.

I came into this class thinking I was going to hate it.  Instead, it turned into my favorite class thanks to Foster.  His lectures are incredibly detailed and engaging, and seriously help you learn.  He spends time after every class just answering students' questions.  Incredibly helpful and friendly.  Best prof I've had in my two years here.

Foster is an amazing lecturer! Very clear and organized, but if you don't go to class you don't get his notes. Gives lots of homework that if you do yourself and actually understand the tests aren't bad. Always willing to answer questions or go more in depth. Gives real world applications to make it more interesting. Best professor I've ever had.

Learned a lot in Fluids. He's very passionate about the subject and does a good job explaining tough material. Tests are tough but if you do the homework, go to office hours, and study you'll be fine.

Great teacher and knows his stuff for sure. This is a really difficult class but necessarily difficult given the subject manner (Transport is really hard everywhere according to friends I have taking it at other universities). Foster is approachable and his lectures are fast paced and give you what you need to understand the material.

This professor might have good verbal communication skills, but that is it. He tries to make himself seem like an expert, who is really into it. His answers, to questions are brief and lack any depth. He assigns the same homeworks and solutions are typed over from other sources. He simply copies the book over onto the board. Too superficial.
Fantastic, brilliant, helpful, and the lessons stuck with me.
He is a very interesting man. I love the way he teaches the course, but honestly he's a monster. I call him Captain Kodak. He puts on a quality act.
Possibly the best professor I have had at the University of Rochester. He will make you work, but he is definitely helpful and extremely enthusiastic about the material.

Also had him for CHE/BME 259. Great teacher.  He works in this field, so he really loves what he does. Helpful, clear, and organized. I actually LEARNED from his class. One of the Best professors I've had.
Enthusiastic about the material and always available for extra help.  Really loves teaching and wants students to succeed.

He really cares about what he is teaching and goes the extra mile for it. The class is hard, but he's fair and wants everyone tp succeed. Be prepared to work your ass off but your actually going to be learning a lot
Foster is the man. Fluids isn't an easy course but he endlessly facilitates help. He even goes to the recitations! This man knows and loves what he's teaching. One of my favorite professors at UR.
Be prepared to work. Look over your notes after class and ask questions about stuff you don't get.

Professor really cares about students, and does his best to keep you up to date and make you feel good about yourself... Sometimes he doesn't answer questions clearly and bypasses them... but overall a good professor
Great professor; really likes teaching.  Hard class but as long as you go to lecture and keep up with the homework you will do fine.  He really wants his students to do well.

One of the best engineering professors in this university. Lectures are fast paced but informative. Exams and homework are difficult but supportive of the course material. Very approachable and a great guy.
good
Great Prof, yep VERY HOT....I love his class.

Excellent Prof.Expert on material, cares about students, I learned allot.I wish he taught every course I took.  No doubt the best prof in the university. Yea, he's hot, but the great thing is that he doesn't know he's hot, or at least I don't think he does. Very approachable, cares about students.
um.. yeah, good prof, I like his class but... come on girls...he could be our dad...do we get distracted by our dads?, I think not...lets rate the class not the looks.
Well known at the UofR for two things:  1. an excellent prof who really knows what he's doin and a great teacher who cares about students, 2. total hottie, distractingly good looking.
Excellent Prof, really knows the subject, and distractingly good looking. Brilliant and HOT.
Excellent Prof, knows his stuff
Excellent Professor- communicates well

Very caring professor. He was clearly willing to assist me when I asked him for help and responded email quickly. Also, there were multiple opportunities (Optional Quiz/Discussion + Extra Credit) to help us make up for our mistake. I enjoyed this course and was glad to be in his class in my 1st year. Looking forward to having him again in BCS152.

Martin explains things clearly and there's lots of opportunities to do well. Quizzes, homework, midterm + final, and discussions. Well balanced and easy to do well, the only reason I got a B was because the topic of the class was boring to me and I wasn't motivated, but I wouldn't say this class was hard.

Dr. Yang is a really nice and caring professor. I appreciate how he grades us by more than just quizzes/exams; homework is 25% and there's a redo quiz. However, his lectures aren't great. It is hard to understand him from a language prospective and he explains the content terribly. The basics are even unclear. It's too bad, as he's a great guy.

great guy but an average professor at best. lectures have slideshows with 50-60 slides and he does not explain very well. quizzes aren't too bad but you need to teach yourself everything, going to lecture does not help that much
One of the sweetest profs ever, brought candy to class a few times, tried to keep lecture entertaining      -not always succeeding though-, still one of my favorites
Dr. Yang is so cute. I want to put him in my pocket. Chill class.

Super clear about what you need to do well in the class! Lectures are informative and to the point + recorded. Genuinely a good guy who wants you to do well. Decent amount of assignments (HW + discussion posts) but boost your grade. Wish he taught more classes!
A bit quiet but lectures are interesting and informative overall!

If you're looking for an easy class, take one with Professor Yang. If you're looking to actually be challenged and learn, find a different professor. He's a nice guy, but his lectures are super boring - he basically regurgitates the textbook - and the exams are silly. They are all multiple choice but super specific and full of grammar mistakes.

Yang is very easy. Tests and quizzes are multiple choice, lowest quiz score gets dropped. Lectures are a little boring but they are all recorded. I will say that the only downside of the recordings is that it's hard to see things he directly references on slides. Not many people attend lecture, so if you go consistently he will recognize you.

Although his lectures can be boring, he is a very caring professor that has a passion for what he teaches. I loved taking courses with him because his structure was always straight-forward. Also, he records lectures, which makes it easier if you need to miss a class.

Really sweet professor. Lectures may be boring but quizzes and exams are very doable (you still need put in the effort and study). Not the best office hours because it's 1 on 1 and there is usually a really long line with people just hogging and taking 20 minutes of his time. Multiple choice tests, content on the slides. lectures are recorded.

Great guy, super nice. Low maintenance class. Gives quizzes that are supposed to help boost your grade. A lot content to remember for the 2 exams but not difficult. Gives easy hw to help boost grade as well. Personally didn't find the course content as interesting, but people who like linguistics like this course. Love Dr. Yang.

He clearly wants everyone to succeed in this course. He gave optional quiz, optional discussion and extra credit to help us get higher grade. Lecture is a little bit boring but very clear. If you miss classes, you can still know what the contents are by watching recordings which is useful for both learning new things and reviewing.
Very hard to understand (spoken and written language), predictable with all class criteria (BCS 111 compared to 152), easy points for HWs and Discussions

Super nice guy. Also took his 111 class. He can be a bit dry and boring, but if you just pay attention to the lectures and have a reasonable understanding of what is going on, his classes should be an easy A. Tests are easy and his "participation" points just involve writing your thoughts on a certain topic.

Martin was an great professor. This was my second class with him and I enjoyed both of them. His exams and quizzes require you to know specific examples from his lectures so make sure to go to class. Some questions can get challenging so make sure to look over your notes. Very accommodating and offered extra credit to boost your grade.

Oh Martin...

I have had this man for 3 classes now, and can't even begin to describe him. He's such a sweet man and genuinely cares about his students. However, so boring. So so boring. BUT, once you figure out his classes it is easy enough to do well in them. Martin truly is the BCS department here, so just get used to him. 

Live love martin

Dr.Yang is super nice, and very helpful. I've been in 2 of his courses (111 and 152) and is now in BCSC153. I'm very glad that so many of my courses are teached by him. He is creative and leads us to think and discuss on class. Provides clear recordings and crateria of exams. Likes him a lot!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Dr. Yang is one of the nicest professors at UofR. He is a very caring man and he'll often wave to you on campus or in the dining halls. The class material is easy and as long as you attend lectures and read the textbook, the class should be an easy A. He also gives optional quizzes and extra credit.

Martin is a really great professor, and super nice and funny during lectures. All the quizzes and midterms are multiple choice, and the final wasn't cumulative. He really knows the subject and breaks it down so that everyone can easily understand. The homework was also very easy. I highly recommend his classes!

I absolutely love Dr Yang. His grading system is one of the better ones I have seen. He offered a bonus quiz to have our lowest quiz grade replaced which he did in my class last year as well. He also added some extra credit if you submitted discussions early. Sometimes I take the silver line with him (he parks down there & I live in southside) :)
If you're struggling with a topic, Dr. Yang will make time to help you outside of class. His quizzes are fairly easy because everything is mentioned in the lectures.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: The class is so much smoother compared to 110. The content is digestible and you can almost always see how they relate to each other. The homeworks (which are just experiments to do on your friends) are always fun and an easy way to get an A.

Nice and approachable. Reply email quickly even at midnight! Very generous with HW extensions! Give information about career paths or research opportunities in certain lectures. His wording on the slides may be confusing, but if you go ask him he will clarify or paraphrase! Exams are MCQ or T/F questions, revise the notes and you'll be fine.
Very nice professor.

Never went to class and studied strictly from the textbook and slides. It probably would have been more helpful if I studied before class to solidify material, but I have a learning disability so I struggled with paying attention during his lecture (it was very boring for me so I struggled to follow along) but the material itself was interesting.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring--Accessible outside class

comment: This was my second class with Martin. He's a very nice man but his tests are nothing like his lectures are difficult to understand.

Martin is one of those professors that, at the beginning of the course, seems kind of boring, but he has this sort of dry humor that makes the class really enjoyable. All of the homework assignments and discussion assignments were easy points, but midterm and final were a bit difficult. Depending on how well the class does, he will scale the exam.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Respected--Graded by few things

comment: The midterm and final are pretty easy, the quizzes are a lot harder! The class is pretty easy but definitely boring. Dr. Yang is really accommodating and understanding!

Dr. Yang is EXTREMELY understanding of extenuating circumstances. He became one of my favorite professors and really pushed me to continue BCS. He is a bit difficult to understand, but you can always go to him and he will sit down and clarify with you. The material is heavy and difficult, but he is very approachable. Highly recommend him!

I loved this professor and you can tell he cares for his students. He checks up on those who fall behind or have failed a quiz. He holds office hours and the TA's in this class are super nice. Study and look over lectures to do well on his exams and quizzes. Understanding the concepts is important. Sit in the front because he can be hard to hear.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: This class isn't too difficult as long as you review the slides before the quizzes. I took 3 BCS classes with Yang for my cluster and found him to be fair and consistent with grading.

Prof Yang's lectures are generally pretty engaging! He cares about how successful students are and is flexible in terms of quiz or exam make-ups. The homework's were very clear and pretty easy. Quizzes and tests are all multiple choice (at least for BCS152) - tests are important for your grade, but as long as you pay attention in class you're fine

Professor Yang is one of the kindest and most caring professors here. He really cares that you learn the material and there's a strong initiative seen from him. He's passionate about his subject and makes the lectures a little humorous and interactive. Absolutely recommend him.
Enjoyable lectures. It should be an easy-A- class as long as you don't miss homework like me (6.5% each!)

This is my 5th class with Dr. Yang, super awesome instructor! I had office hours with him to discuss about applying for grad school and about my participation in class. He was always helpful, super flexible during COVID, and gave us make up opportunities/extra credit. BCS 261 is a seminar based class, so readings and discussions are a must.
rating_tags: Respected--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: Martin Yang is an amazing professor who gives awesome lectures. The scores are determined basically by quizzes and exams. There will be study guides provided before each exam that would be extremely helpful.
Nice professor, he is funny and try to make the class engage. Had him for BCS111 and 153, will sign up for his experiment class

Dr Yang is a very nice professor and cares about his students. I took BCS 153 with him in person and BCS 152 with him online. He wants his students to do well and always makes time for their questions and sometimes offers easy extra credit. Overall good guy

Almost all of the grading is done through quizzes and exams. You won't be given the chance to practice the format of these quizzes or exams, you will simply have to learn their obscure question-formatting on the job. The lectures are unclear and take a lot of time to discuss very little. He is easily distracted by students asking random questions.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Great professor!  Even though he is disorganized, he knows what he teaches and is passionate about it.  Love his lectures and jokes! I don't understand the bad reviews he got on here, I recommend him.

He's disorganized, constantly rambling about unrelated topics, and rarely covers the material we're actually supposed to be learning. The readings and assignments barely get mentioned,  random tangents that have no relevance to the course. he's completely unreachable TAs are no help either the entire experience has been a waste of time and energy.

Professor Goemans would brighthen up my day whenever I went to his classes. He was understanding, compassionate. While he may be slightly disorganised, his lectures are always interesting and the TA's are always great help!

Prof. Goemans  is by far my favorite professor I have ever had. He is both passionate and knowledgeable about IR, and he truly cares for his students. Although his lecture style is slightly disorganized, and he rarely uses slideshows, he makes up for that in his ability to engage the class by telling crazy stories to explain the concepts.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Goemans is the reason I switched my major from IR to Political Science. He is extremely disorganized, hardly responds to emails, and is rarely at office hours. He is quite rude to students and does not respect their personal circumstances. For example, he was very reluctant to let me move my exam for a family funeral. Would not recommend

Goemans is one of my favorite professors. He always turns students' bad days into good ones. He is thoughtful, jovial, and he brings a good sense of liveliness to the classroom. He expects a lot from his students like doing the reading and participating in class actively. You will not regret taking any of his classes!

he is super friendly and always up to chat during office hours. But he is NEVER at office hours. His lectures are interesting but he tends to ramble and after the theoretical parts its's better to just skip the lectures altogether. I honestly don't feel like I learned anything in this course. Very unclear about exam formats and just frustrating

He's generally rough around the edges. Although the class covered a wide range of topics in IR, he made each one not interesting. My ta truly thought me everything I know in our recitations. Hein is hit or miss whether he'll be on-topic or not during class. The class made me question if I wanted to be an IR major.

I would die for Hein. Lots of readings (a loooot) but it's more about getting a general idea than knowing every page. The most genuine, caring professor I've had- cried in his office before the midterm, he coached me through and reassured me with "you're smart, you know this". Lectures are full of ramblings but take what you can and you're fine!

The course definitely provides a good overview of a wide range of topics that are related to the major. The lectures mainly consist of a discussion in which the most important points from the readings are explained or discussed. I recommend using the main book assigned and attending recitations for getting a good grasp of all of these concepts.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: Hein seems like a fun guy, but not the type of person you want as a professor. He rambles and mumbles, and assigns way too much reading to keep up with and digest. Personally, this class put me off of IR, but some people in my class seem to enjoy him.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Hilarious

comment: Lectures were entertaining because he's a great guy, but you could honestly not attend a single lecture if you did the reading and went to recitation, because most of the learning happened there. The class was stressful because there was no way you could keep up with the absurd amount of reading assigned, and that was absolutely essential to tests

Prof. Goemans' lectures are scattered, but that makes them entertaining. His humor is interesting and he's VERY  approachable and helpful. He cares about your future and has a lot of outside class advice to give.

Goemans is great. Apparently he was a DJ in Amsterdam in his youth. He's very approachable and helpful with academic life in general, not just his class. He's very passionate which is very inspirational. Make sure you do the readings though and see him during office hours.
A professor who is very involved and excited about what he teaches.  He gets excited for class and does his best to explain everything. Would highly recommend.

Absolutely brilliant, fits the "absent-minded professor" stereotype 110%. He leads great discussions and has interesting ideas as well as a lot of knowledge. He assigns a LOT of reading but is sympathetic if you don't get through 100% and tries adapt to student's tests in other classes. Only negative: Hard to reach outside of office hours.
Greatest Professor ever!!!! I love his class!!!!

Amazing class! I know it's a lot of reading but he's so much fun and he actually levels with you and makes you think think think!! I love it that if someone doesn't know the answer he just stays there until they figure it out, critical thinking! His tests are very easy too.
Taught a great seminar course and really knew how to encourage and maintain good discussion. Reading load was VERY heavy, but made the discussions very interesting. Very knowledgeable professor.

He's extremely difficult to understand. Has a slight accent, but mostly it's that he rambles and writes sloppily on the board. Comes in late to every class. TOO MUCH READING for an intro class (about 150 pages a week). Recitations are pointless.

Lectures are hard to follow, but he is a fun and interesting teacher. Had no idea what to expect for midterm and a lot of reading to do each week. Hard to keep up in the class since the material is not that interesting.

I had heard he would be quirky but I didn't know that he would be disorganized and scatterbrained. This professor does not teach well and while he may know the material his failure to impart it on his students is unacceptable. I would advise not taking this class and pursuing a different IR class that you truly enjoy

Very scattered, and has a difficult time getting to the point. Not clear on what he is teaching and honestly, the TA sessions are worth 5 classes, even though they arent all that great. Avoid this class.

Most people either love and hate him, he's funny and interesting and keeps lectures fairly entertaining; or you can find him scatterbrained, disorganized and hard to follow. I LOVE Goemans, I think he teaches what's relevant to IR, is extremely smart, and loves a good discussion.
Funny guy. Very interested in the material, and motivated teacher. Teaching a difficult class but makes it interesting. Great readings.
Knows and loves to tell almost unbelievable but useful historical anecdotes.

Nice, smart guy, forced to teach a class he really does not believe in (and he'll tell you so). If you really want to understand conflict, though, he gives plenty of hints and clues. Take him seriously, and you'll get more than you ever expected. One on one's are opportunities to really get the most.

Nice guy and pretty funny, but his lectures are all over the place and make no sense.  recitations with the TAs are useless and the final was complete **** that he pulled out of nowhere.  midterm we knew exactly what to expect though.   it was a fun intro class in some ways.

He is extremely knowledgeable but rambles and talking too fast.  Good luck figuring out what you need to do for the w section bc he won't really tell you.  He's really good to talk to one on one though
His intro class is fun and easy. He is knowledgable and very approachable.

Very interesting material and fair amount of reading for an intro class.  His lecture style can be all over the place at times, but he'll crack a joke about it.  Funny prof and a more than fair grader.  Also, he's a smoker which is a big plus!

Very knowledgeable, lectures are hard to follow, tests are fair (though he makes them sound harder than they are). He goes off on tangents but is very enthusiastic. He loves what he teaches. I suggest you go to office hours, he may give you hints on what will be on the test.
Tests do not cover what he teaches.

Hein is a very interesting and knowledgeable professor but his lectures are terrible.  I really didn't learn much from his class.  I think he would be a great professor in a small class setting (less than 30 students).
Nice and funny guy. Makes class entertaining and most importantly eager to teach
No Comments
So FUNNY:)
Extremely hot.I think I am in love.Oh and the class is fun.
Hot sweetie. Very smart. Funny, talks too fast

You should definitely not take PHYS141 if you don't have previous physics experience. Wolfs does an excellent job making lectures entertaining and has limited office hours but will put a lot of effort into answering student questions during them and after lectures. However, the lab reports are insane and can take 15-25 hours each for a good grade.

Amazing. He doesn't waste time in trivialities and obvious physics (good!). Provides derivations for theorems that were just accepted in previous physics courses. Very funny; free pack of sparkling water per person every course. Lab reports are fair (8-10 pages), exam questions parallel recitation/homework problems. Always willing to help.

"Class average was 50" 

If this reviewer had went to recitations, they would've been fine. The test was very easy, don't let them scare you. 

The tests are probably the easiest part of class. Homeworks and labs are brutal. Lecture is optional but there's a quiz every class. Everything's graded on accuracy, but he's willing to help you succeed.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: 50.8 average score on the midterm... Good luck taking his class

Wolfs is a decent professor. He does his best to help out the class and is typically understanding. The content and textbook are a bit different from a standard mechanics class. The worst part is that there are 3 midterms, but you can have your lowest midterm dropped.

The professor is a good man. But the course is extremely difficult. His PowerPoint don't help usually and you need to figure
something out by yourself. The lab sucks most. You need to write a 10 pages long lab report each time. The homework is very tough and usually covers things not
discussed. Exams were relatively okay but not curving.

His Labs are the worst. There are much better introductory physics textbooks out there like Young&Freedman, Serway & Jewett, Giancoli , Resnick & Halliday, so many more. Matter and interaction is literally the worst textbook out there. His slides are not at all helpful. Entered Loving Physics , Left Hating it.

Somewhat intimidating, but a good teacher if you put in the effort. 237 is, in principle, a difficult course, but it is easy to do well. His expectations are very clear for exams. Homework was pretty difficult, but a good learning experience. The textbook (Eisberg & Resnick) is horrendous though. It's so wordy and, in my opinion, needlessly dense.
Helpful, but can be intimidating. High expectations, but will help you meet them. Labs are very important to your grade.
Very challenging class, but he really helped make it possible to succeed.  HW was near impossible, but he will help. He is nice and a great lecturer.
Fun class, fun guy. Perfect science course for non-science majors.

He's a decent guy, and very good for non-science majors completing a cluster.  He's a good lecturer, but not the most approachable guy during downtime--if you want help, go to the TAs. The class was challenging, but the grading system makes it easier.  Go to class and recitation--do not skip or fall behind or your grade will suffer.

Had him for astronomy, awesome teacher. Great sense of humor and really cares about his students. Takes time to think about and answer the questions posed to him. An extremely organized and thoughtful man, always planning ahead. Very patient as well. Dope accent.

Professor Wolfs is one of the best teachers I have ever had. He truly cares about every one of his students and everything in his class is geared towards their success. The subject material is hard at times but he presents it in a clear, organized way and is always willing to help.

Brilliant professor and truly the best kind; He expects a lot from his students and does everything he can in his power to get you there. Go to his office hours and USE THE TEXTBOOK! He pulls problems from the textbook for exams and if you can do them on your own you can knock them out of the park test day. One of the best teachers I've ever had.

Prof. Wolfs definitely knows his stuff, and makes himself very available for extra help. However, be warned: the online description of the class says you only need Calc 1 as a prerequisite, and it can be taken at the same time, but you should really have two semesters of Calc behind you going in. If this is not the case take 121 instead.
He rode around in a fire extinguisher powered wheelchair, if that doesn't want to make you a physicist, you should gain knowledge.
He's tough, but he knows this and adjusts his grades accordingly.

Wolfs is an excellent professor. Some comments on this website are too harsh. It is true that powerpoint is his mode of teaching but all of his lectures are online. He really makes this a fun class. Weekly homework, biweekly labs, 3 midterms and a final (though the lowest grade is disregarded) 80 is an A. Also, he has a song and dislikes PCs.
Fantastic Professor, one of the best I have had yet at U of R (I'm in my 3rd semester now)
Entered loving physics, left hating it.
Great guy, homework and tests can be long or difficult but overall a great class and professor. Very organized and concerned for his students.

This class is extremely difficult, but he does a pretty good job of teaching it. He uses Powerpoint for EVERYTHING and puts the lectures on the internet. The lab reports are very long. The only time he really isn't that great is when he tries to introduce multivariable calculus otherwise he's a good professor.

Uses Powerpoint religiously, and can be difficult to understand due to his accent.  However, he is a fair grader and teaches well.  Makes physics students right up their labs rather than doing cookie-cutter "do the lab, write data down, answer a question" format.
Very tough class but extremely nice professor.  Very will to help and seems to genuinely care about his students.  Does fun demonstrations in lecture.  Good sense of humor and sweet accent.
He knows his****

AMAZING PROFESSOR! He is incredibly helpful! He goes way out of his way to help students.  He is very tough because the class must cover a lot of material, but even a poor grade is worth taking a class from him.  He's excellent! He's also funny and enthusiastic.  He knows what he's talking about.

He has a tendency to repeat things when he speaks, but his attitude towards teaching is great. The tests are nice and challenging, but it's relatively easy to get an A, even if you mess up a problem. An 80's an A.

Very tough teacher but he is a great guy. If you go in to ask for help he definitely will help you. Very encouraging and never acts like your questions are too stupid to answer. Just be ready to work your butt off!!!

He is serious in trying to teach basic physics and will have great classroom demonstrations. He is a fun professor but his heavy accent may discourage some to go to lectures. His exams are hard but test your understanding of the material. Webwork is hard and not the proper way to do physics homework.
Only one person ever returned Frank's greeting.  Even though he used cigarettes for experiments during lecture.
Like everybody else said -- fair, but tough.  Prepare to work.  Very thorough and helpful if you have a problem.
Tough professor, but fair. Wants student to learn material; willing to aid student. Good for higher level physics than introductory -- very high expectations. Be prepared to do work.
Tough teacher, gives more applied homework but tests deal more heavily with theory.  I didn't mind, I liked the material and thought he was a reasonable teacher.

The lecture material didnt seem to match up at all with the exams. also  Lecture slides with ideas already dervied arent so good.gave webwork, which is horrible for learning physics.  Id never take another class with him.

he IS a very very tough prof, but I can tell that he really does want us to learn.  he has a hard time getting down to the level of the students, but he explains things clearly and he is very willing to help.  plus, his accent is VERY nice...

Avoid like the Black Plague itself.  He might be the most arrogant person that I have ever met in my entire life.  Lecture is worthless if you read the book because his lecture is copied straight from the book.  I wish that my TA had tought the class.
No Comments
No Comments
Refuses to grade on a curve even when class as a whole does poorly, his lectures do not much up with material on tests, tests are very hard and he grades very harshly on them

Professor Meguid is very knowledgeable about what she is teaching, gives good lectures, and is available outside of class. There is a lot of reading and the class grade is made up mostly of 2 tests. Requires a decent amount of time outside of class to get a good grade in the class.

Class requires a lot of readings and the midterm and final are a very high percentage of your grade. Can be a bit nerve racking not knowing what your grade is until the end, but grading is very fair. Professor covers a lot in lecture and is very approachable if you have any questions.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: I really enjoyed intro to comparative politics with Professor Meguid. There are a lot of reading but I found all of them super interesting. Her lectures are mostly easy to follow and added helpful background along with another layer of nuance to the readings. I studied a lot for the test but looking back going to office hours would have been smart.

Prof is knowledgeable but goes through material quick. Requires heavy weekly readings (several books) that is required to be read to get an A. Grades are only from two exams and participation from recitations, so be ready to study well and speak. Okay class, but stressful at times due to exams being worth so much.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: I really loved Professor Meguid! She's unbelievably smart and really cares about her students. She is very accessible outside of class and super responsive to emails. You can't BS the readings though so don't make my mistake. I was not happy with the grade I received in this class, but that's entirely on me not putting in the necessary effort.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Lectures for this class are necessary as there is no textbook. Meguid does a great job making the lectures interesting but you have to attend. There are also a lot of readings that are necessary to read for recitation and the midterm and final. Overall a great professor.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Had Meguid for PSC/IR 101. All in all an excellent professor. Meguid clearly establishes her expectations and gives you clear directions for what she expects from her students. As long as you pay attention in class and do the expected readings you should do fine in her class. Also very open to helping students after class and during office hours.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Connected to students and does a good job lecturing very knowledgeable

She is an amazing professor. The class is difficult but manageable. If you attend lectures and take notes you will be fine. I didn't do any of the readings and I still did really well. Her lectures are very engaging, and I didn't even like the material. She is one of my favorite professors and I intend on taking more classes with her.

Professor Meguid is terrific, professional, and clear.  Her lectures are absolutely necessary; no attendance required but, without being present in class, you will miss vital information.  She gives a lot of info very fast, so be prepared to type very quickly.  A lot of reading for an intro class.  Grades based entirely on two exams and recitation!

She is a BRILLIANT professor. She is super knowledgeable and fills each class with lots of good information. Very respectful of students' opinions, too.  Her grading is tough, so be prepared to study a lot for the midterm and final but if you like polysci or IR, the studying is interesting and the class is worth the work!
He has a very hard grading system and the tests are so hard.A lot of reading
Very organized lectures and clear expectations. I admire her a lot. She's soooooo freaking smart it's mind blowing! AND she's professionally nice.

It's easy to get a B but very difficult to get an A. Meguid is very clear and organized in her lectures. If you want an A, you have to do all the readings, but to get a B you only need to skim the readings.

Excellent lectures, crystal clear on expectations. The material was interesting. Excessive reading for an intro class - it was unexpected. Her lectures are kind of dry but the class goes quickly. Tough grader. Generally an above-average difficulty class.

She is clear, but 300 page readings in a 101 course on "theories" gets old quickly. Material is rather boring, but if you're really into poli sci you might like it. Just don't make my mistake of thinking 101 is an intro course, because it's really not.

Her class was very structured and clear but not interesting.  She was not very lively and just spit out  lot of information.  She did make a joke... once.  If a question was asked in class she seemed annoyed.  She was clear about what she wanted on exams.  Make sure you go to class and take good notes.  Doing the readings is not so necessary.
She is mad hard, but she is very clear and it is clear what you'll have to know. There is a lot of reading, but she does a good job explaining it all
She is very clear and organized. Her lectures are interesting and very easy to follow. Everything she says is important and relevant. Not too funny or lively, but a great professor.

Meguid is very structured. She provides outlines for all her lectures and tells you exactly what she expects from her students. The only thing that bothered me about her was that she talks too fast during lectures. It is easy to get a B in this course but not a A. There are a ton of readings. Some topics of the class are really interesting.

PRofessor Meguid is very knowledgeable and her lectures are very structured. It might not be the most interesting material to everyone, but, she makes it crystal clear what she wants. Also, she is very helpful in class and out of class!
She does not know how to connect ideas, and just spits out information.  When you ask her a question, bank on her having no idea what the answer is.  TAs are more qualified and better instructors.

In her 267 class, you do have to read and attend lectures if you want an A. You can't BS her exams, and she knows when you don't know the material. Lectures are a tad bit dry, and there's a good amount of reading, but the content is not difficult to grasp and she is very open to helping students.
horrible
Dont take Bonnie She is not a good teacher, Patrick the TA would have been better
Stellar!

Professor Meguid is fantastic: she has excellent command of her field of studies, and is approachable and very helpful. I got the impression she was vested in my success as her student. Highly recommended.

The thing is, her lecture is great if you actually attend. Like she once said, her lecture cant be supplement for the reading and the reading cant be supplement to the class either. So go to lecture and recitation (20% of grade)!! Expect A TONS OF reading, she will ask you to finish a 400 page of book in a week.
A decently designed course, organized, but not always interesting. Robert Putnam readings can be tough to take, too much emphasis on social connectiveness. Otherwise, nice and engaging.
extremely boring lectures and unbelievably boring reading. tests are okay, way too hard to stay awake both during readings and lectures
A's are very hard to get, however she is not a harsh grader. Very friendly and makes the extra effort to help students.
Excellent teacher. A's are not easy to come by in her class, but she is still a wonderful lecturer.
easy teacher! if you want an "A" sign up for a course with her!
Very helpful, very smart. Good lecturer. Assigns too much reading.

She's the reason why I decided to do a poli sci major!!!  I loved her class, though the reading was a challenge in both quantity and difficulty.  Solid lecturer given that the class covered a lot of ground and many theories and cases.  I plan on taking her 267 course.
Great professor. Clear and straightforward. Get ready to do ALOT of readings. Extremely smart and very approachable. I am taking a third class with her! Fair grader.
Smart and serious.  Assigns LOTS of readings, of which most are pretty useless.  Asks easy test questions but grades a bit harshly.  Good lecturer with occasional bouts of boring.
nice professor, but her reading materials can be very boring and somewhat useless (made us read a book and didnt even put it in a exam)
Class was ok, readings were terribly boring. Meguidster is very smart, explains things clearly.
A little full of herself
Very good at making complex theories understandable.  Interested in individual students and very enthusiastic about teaching.  Will challenge you.
Grading criteria are clear from the very beginning. This class requires some prior understanding of chemistry or a lot of reading. He is incredibly nice and funny both during and after lectures
rating_tags: Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Hilarious

comment: TOUGH CHM 173 CLASS. Lectures are very broad and general, doesn't really go over examples in class, so make sure you take full advantage of workshops offered. Sign up for a tutor asap with CETL because for this class, they get booked fast. Cares about students.
It's a tough class, but he is on the students' side and grades generously. He doesn't stress the math as much, but focuses on the concepts. He is very fun and always willing to help.

People who say he doesn't curve/add points didn't listen.
