Everyone bombed the first exam because it wasn't identical to old exams (oh no, it's not like this is college) and he gave a chance to get all those points back on the final. He's a fantastic lecturer, he's inspiring, and he's super nice to his students. He's the best professor I've had.
Maybe he's better teaching upper level classes?

He will not curve. In my class the average of the first exam we took was 28% and he would not add points or anything. He's pretty tough that way, but I also feel like a learned a lot more with him than I did with other Chemistry teachers. If you take him, be ready to put in A LOT of time and effort.

Awesome teacher. He teaches you everything you need to know plus makes it interesting. Very fair exams, very approachable. Read the book ahead of each class and you'll understand everything he says. Anyone who says he expects you to know chemistry before just didn't try. It's not hard if you listen to him and read. One of my favorite professors.

Bad teacher. if your schedule allows you to take it with a different professor then do. The class isnt too hard but he complicates everything, doesnt teach whats on tests and expects everyone to already know the material.  His test used to be like practice tests but the last two years, this year especially his exams are getting harder and less fair

Attendance is not mandatory, but he gets really angry if you don't come. I did not particularly enjoy his lectures and was often bored and distracted. Overall, he is better than the other professors for the course, but that isn't necessarily saying much. The material is also not his strong suit so he isn't that enthusiastic about it all the time.

Of all the other professors for this class, he is the best choice - TAKE HIM. You should go to class or else he will get mad, although it is not mandatory. WORKSHOP will teach you everything! Class is very unorganized so you need to review the notes he will upload online. Do the practice exams, although the actual test might be totally different!
Literally one of the worst professors I've had. He was really unfair. Tests were reasonable, until they became impossible because he had a personal vendetta against the students.

Farrar is constantly using environmental or other examples to create a true understanding of the application of the material. He is funny, makes lecture enjoyable, and definitely cares about his students and their level of comprehension. Tests are not difficult as long as you attend workshop and study with practice exams.

Farrar is probably one of the best professors that you will have if you decide to take his course. He made the material very understandable and really helped me to develop a passion for chemistry. He is entertaining in class and I look forward to going all the time. Tests aren't hard if you study and go to class. He's the man.

He's not a bad lecturer, and it is possible to learn the material from lecture, but it's probably the most time consuming and confusing way to do so. Very little of what he says in lecture is on a test (1 to 2 formulas per lecture if you're lucky). Just read his lecture notes, do the homework, go to workshop and you're good. Lecture is unnecessary.

Farrar is the man!  His lectures can be confusing, but if you read the chapters and do the homework, you'll be fine on the test.  Farrar is probably one of the smartest professors here and amazingly funny at times!  Great class overall.

DIfficult course to understand. Exams are difficult and lectures move too fast to prepare you for exams but workshops help. Chem Engineering majors seem to struggle with the content as its geared more toward (what seems to be meaningless) derivations.

Although I found this course challenging, Prof. Farrar made it manageable.  He always made time to help students outside of class and always welcomed students to office hours or set up more convenient times to meet.  Lectures were interesting and exams were fair.  I feel that I learned a lot of physical chemistry in this course and enjoyed it.

CHM131 is a difficult course, but with sufficient work put into it, it can be done. Farrar is an extremely smart guy, and seems to help the students with what they need. Probably one of the most hip professors on campus. Lectures get very hard to follow at times, but notes are always online to review.
Farrar uses the chalkboard to teach, which I found quite helpful.  He is willing to meet with students and answer questions.  Workshops are very helpful.
farrar is one of those teachers who is simply too brilliant for an intro level class.  it takes him a whole class period to explain not too difficult a concept
Haaaarrrdd Class.  Prepare to be challenged.  The TAs are helpful.  Farrar is confusing in lectures but recitations help you understand the material.

Awesome teacher, very helpful and caring.  I struggled through the first test, but then went to his office hours regularly, and pulled off a good grade.  Definitely go see him after exams, he will do what he can to find you an extra few points!!!

Very nice and extremely helpful. Take the advice and go over all your tests with him afterwards! Who knows, there might be an error or two in your favor! TOUGH exams! He does hold review sessions and stays until you exhaust the questions tho!
A-mazing.  He is an awesome prof and really helpful. take the time to go over your tests with him...its worth is.  hes also a snazzy dresser.
Good teacher at first then lost his love for the students and killed wveryone in the final. Very disappointed at him.
This man and Professor Krugh are practically the same.  They are both the top 2 nicest people in the entire country.  But man, do they give tough exams.  Farrar is tough if you never took AP Chem.
good professor
I find his teaching very good. I pay attention and actually stay awake.
No Comments

At first I thought he was great because he wrote his notes on the board and that forces me to take notes/learn better.  However, he spends a majority of his time derriving equations and going into irrelevant facts that further confuse people.  Going to class was a waste, he never taught us how to do problems.  Use the textbook, Zumdahl is the man.
Interesting class, nice guy. Knows a lot and is not afraid to share it.
Boring as hell. The man makes the same jokes repeatedly and is totally dry. God did not grant him the gift of speaking at all.

I can't believe people are giving Farrar good grades.  He is the worst professor I had so far in my college career.  The dude DOES NOT teach anything.  We'll come to recitation and we'll see stuff we've never seen before that we were supposed to have learned in class.  He's horrible.
the class is long and boring...so sometimes i doze off....but it always leads to a sticky situation....the man is soo hot that i cant help but want him...wet dreams are dangerous in class fyi

lectures are boing and he tends to do a lot of unnecessary algebra with equations.  however, he does tend to crack some jokes and loves "liquid water"...  sit in the back of class and make your own jokes to make note-taking bearable.  he's a cool enough guy, though, i guess...
Jimbo is the man.  He is a great professor and an awesome guy.  Sometimes lecture can be a bit dry, but when he cracks a joke its worth it.
He is always willing to help. His classes are kind of dry, but he is a very kind teacher. And a very kind grader.

There's a lot of work in this course. Not difficult work, but the topics pile up and it will take time. Still, Stu is genuinely worth getting to know, his office hours and recitations will give you most of the answers, and it is a great intro to formal models. Despite 120 students, he will try to learn your name. That tells you all you need to know
amazing professor. talk to him in office hours, he is super duper cool, chill and smart!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Respected

comment: Stew is one of the nicest professors I've met yet. He actively works to memorize the names of his students and is always open to talk with students. The homework is a very large part of the grade, but the instructions are often listed on the assignments. However, the TAs can grade weirdly at times, but Stew is always open to talking about grades.

I absolutely LOVE Stu, he is one of the sweetest and most caring human beings. His class was pretty good, ppt is very homework heavy with at least 6 hours of homework a week. But his grading criteria is very clear and tests are very fair. Overall, he understands that we do not want assignments or tests unrelated to the lectures.

Homework takes time but the instructions posted for the lessons and before each COU basically walks you through everything you need to do them. The exams might add some new twists but Stu will walk you through everything beforehand. Very fair and considerate when addressing questions and regrading concerns. Super accessible via office hours/email.

The content was more difficult than I expected, but this professor's lectures certainly made up for that. Homework(50% of grade) and rubrics are easy to find, but little partial credit. He is not joking when he says the homework takes 5 hours a week, and as the semester goes on more math becomes involved. Very good office hours and clear test prep.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: First of all, I love Stu as a person. He's a king. But this class made absolutely no sense. He tests on material not covered in lectures. Work is very tedious; not necessarily difficult, it's just really confusing. I don't recommend taking the class. Don't think I absorbed any useful knowledge.

I disagree with most others. I found this class to be a thunderously worthless waste of time and energy. The content is easy and simple but he turns this into tons of frivolous busy work that's graded harshly for no reason. I learned next to nothing and I would never take a class taught by Stuart again.
Amazing and brilliant professor. Highly recommend talking to him in office hours as he has lots of interesting information and knowledge to share.

Prof Jordan is a good prof and takes the time to help students outside of class. Make sure you do the COU's because they are worth half of the grade. The course is MUCH harder than in previous years and time consuming with the work, so be aware. The course being more difficult was annoying considering how much easier years previous had it.

To be honest, I don't think you need much mathematical ability in this course. If you have received systematic high school Math education before, you definitely will handle those questions. But in each exam the total points is so low that if you make a little mistake in a single question you will lose a large percentage. Jordan's lecture is great.
a lot of work to do , make sure to do the COUs cause theyre worth hallf your grade. but the class is much more difficult then last year. The professor is nice though.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: If you are taking this course in the fall of 2022 or after, be aware that Stu has changed the curriculum and it is MUCH HARDER than it used to be. There is much more math and algebra involved, and I find it very hard to understand and keep up with. I love Stu as a professor, but this course is not what I was expecting and I am disappointed by it.

Stu is one of the most supportive faculty members at UR. He cares a lot about students (like learning the names of everyone who has ever raised their hand in a huge lecture hall) and wants you to get something valuable from his class. Grading criteria is very clear. The content is pretty basic/easy, but assignments are still a big time commitment.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Stu is amazing! He gave out stickers to people pretty much just for showing up to class. He also bikes to work, and that's amazing. If you show up to office hours, he really puts in the time to make sure you understand the material. He wants everyone to do well in the class and is just an amazing professor. 10/10 recommend.

Stu is such a great guy and I painlessly learned a lot in this class. Seriously, go to office hours to get to know Stu!! He genuinely cares about his students. Attendance is not mandatory, and though the homework can be time consuming, but you'll always be able to figure it out.

really great guy. super accessible, easy to digest lectures with ample help and assistance. if you're thinking about or are already majoring in political science or international relations i highly recommend taking any class with professor stu, just an overall good-hearted empathetic guy with tons of expertise and connections to help you succeed.

LOVED THIS CLASS AND STU. Definitely get the W credit because it's really easy and you do fun activities in the Rochester community. Stu is super caring and is more than accommodating with his students. 10/10

Stu is an absolutely amazing guy. He has a tendency to be very redundant with the material, but he does make it extremely clear. Although you don't have to go to lecture, the work really comes in outside of class, so be prepared for that. I thoroughly enjoyed this class despite its simplicity.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria--Tough grader

comment: Lovvveeed this class, local gov is the best. Really easy to get the W credit and has fun OTB activities around the Rochester community. Stu is also a great guy and professor.

Local govt has been my favorite class at Rochester so far. Class has very clear syllabus. Did very well in this class, and learned so much more than I had anticipated about Rochester+ how local communities function. Class gave us the ability to explore Rochester and meet with guest speakers working in the Rochester community.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: The class required a significant time commitment and came with numerous challenges. Certain aspects of it had a steep learning curve, but there is so much to learn from him. Dealt with real world projects and situations, not a lecture-style environment, but collaborative working space. Experienced more of a real life scenario than academic.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Stu is a real gem! He can light up the room and make everyone laugh but can also teach you so much. I wish I could have taken more classes with him.

Really nice guy. (too nice in my opinion). His version of 202 is much easier than Gamm's. But grading is up to the TAs so grading might be extremely different between TAs. Fair amount of readings and assignments. A solid class!
Professor Jordan is great. He's very intelligent, clear with his requirements, and the nicest guy you'll ever meet. Any class he teaches is worth taking

Stu is the best. I took PSC 280W with him and it was the best W class I could have ever hoped for. Instead of having to write a 25p research paper like most W classes. We wrote 5 5p papers. It was awesome. I highly recommend all of Stu's classes.
He is a great professor. Extremely nice. Very clear. And he teaches you stuff you will actually use.

This is the second course I took with Prof. Jordan. As always, he is incredibly helpful and makes sure everyone has a good learning experience. What I especially like about his classes is that while he has fairly high standards of grading and does not curve, he is always available for extra help and gives regrade opportunities.

Professor Jordan is just a great guy.  Its a pleasure to be in his classes and he is always willing to lend a helping hand upon request.  If you're a poli sci, I suggest taking as many classes with him as possible.

Although the professor tries very hard to revise his instructions for assignments, it is ultimately up to the TAs to grade assignments--who were not able to provide help for the assignments until after they were due. Unless you already have knowledge of game theory, economics, etc I would not recommend taking this class .

Best professor I've ever had so far! Whoever has a problem with his teaching style in PSC 202 is one who expects the professor to feed him all the class material. This class is for people who actually want to learn. Also, if you have good intuition of logic, game theory, economics, etc., the class will be extremely easy for you!

He completely restructured the course from what it had previously been this year, and did so rather poorly in my opinion. It seemed like he knew as little about his assignments as we did and his explanations of them were rather esoteric as well. I would not recommend taking this course until he has had time to fix most of his assignments.
Amazing professor!  So helpful and friendly. Lecture could drag on so bring a computer.
Best prof I have had at the UofR

He is the greatest guy in the world. You can tell that he actually cares about his students and wants to help them do the best they can. He is clear in what he wants out of students, uses good readings, and engages everyone in class discussion as even when he lectures! Also, he's adorable.
Ridiculously good with names.
awesome professor, funny guy, makes some small mistakes but manages to correct himself, & engages all of the students in discussion
Excellent professor. I actually looked forward to going to class. He makes the discussions very thought provoking.

Sometimes he was very unclear and made some very important mistakes/mix-ups, but I think a lot of this had to do with him being very green (he's only been teaching for a couple of years).  He really isn't bad for someone who's so new.  The material was a little hard, but he made it easy and tried to explain it as best he could.

Angelic as in the virtues of and angel who stopped by Harvard for a degree. I could not believe such a good person came to teach at this school. Unbelievably smart and dedicated to her specialty. I mean smart as hell even among the smartest. Lucifer would not stand a chance against her.

She puts an incredible amount of time into her courses, but she also expects a similar time commitment from students. Her weekly recitation sessions are late at night, and if you take a grad course with her, each class will run 30 minutes over time. That being said, it's still worth taking any/all of her courses.
The best professor

One of the best professors ever. Prepares for every lecture. Cares for students. Accessible outside class by email or by phone. Please don't skip any chance of taking her class. It will be an awesome experience
She cares more about her students than their parents do. I emailed her a question and she responded with a forty minute phone call to tutor me on the subject. She cares so much.
The nicest and most patient professor I have ever encountered!

Absolutely wonderful teacher for my learning style. Plenty of examples, very clearly set out in class, wonderfully clear (fast moving though-pay attention!!) Pretty funny, nice person, gives good exams (hard enough to be hard, easy enough that it's possible to pass), etc.  If you're taking math at U of R, try to get Naomi!

Naomi tends to  spend so much time trying to get students to understand the basics of a problem, that she often has to rush through the rest of the material at the end of class. BUT her office hours are tremendously helpful. She stays past 12am sometimes and really wants you to pass the class, really cares for her students
She is a great professor, she will stay during office hours until 11:30 at night and actually gets in trouble with higher-ups because she gets too invested in students and doesn't do enough research.

She is just too smart to be teaching Math 142. She got her PhD in math from Harvard. Her lectures are hard to follow, and she has a hard time relating to students. She tries to cram too much information into each class that students leave hardly remembering anything. The exams are easy though. However, if you can get another math professor, try....

A most excellent professor.  She does tend towards heavy workloads and long tests, though, so come prepared to put in the time.  I highly recommend going to her office hours; these are one of her strong points.
Great Professor!
Extremely helpful. Office hours are a must, she will help you almost finish webwork. She is the best math teacher to have at this school

She is the best Match teacher I have ever had. Very dedicated. Make sure you understand each problem she puts on the board, as she includes it in the test. So if you study, you get an A since her tests do not include any new problems she has not discussed in the class.

Professors (especially women) who refuse to water down the courses tend to get horrible ratings, so it's quite impressive that Naomi has the ratings she has on RYM. From my experience, she is quite simply one of the smartest and most dedicated professors in the school.

An awesome course from a great professor who is dedicated to teaching, but be ready to pull long nights - often.  (For example, we had a midterm from 6pm to 11:15pm today and offices hours are at 8:30pm on Monday and Wednesday - with no time limit)
ridiculously hard tests and webwork, however has an interest in helping students
Spends a huge amount of time helping students.

While she does assign a crazy amount of work, it is all useful and will get referred to on the test.  Plus, she is willing to put in really long hours to make sure that everyone understands what is going on.  Has some of the best math jokes ever!  Definitely a bonus in a tough class.
I love Naomi!!! when she lectures she makes perfect sense, but i can c how others might not think so. she is very nice and funny
Enthusiastic, smart, dedicated, funny, lucid teacher

Very thorough and relatively clear if you just pay attention.  Tries to rush at the end of class to get through all the material which is incredibly annoying.  Straightforward exams.  She is very dedicated to teaching, and is very fair.  I recommend taking calculus with her, just make sure you pay attention.

Workload is way too heavy. Our midterm was 3 weeks before the end of the semester, on a Sunday night, and over 3 hours long. I'm not looking forward to the final. However, Naomi does care about her students and puts a lot of time (albeit at odd hours) into the course.

I took 171-173, she is hard to understand at times, but definitely one of the  most intelligent people I've had as professors.  I was a TA for her one semester, and witnessed her commitment to every single one of her students firsthand.  Do not miss the opportunity to take a class with her.

I didn't realize it at the time, but this lady's a pretty good professor, especially when you compare her to some of the other people in the math department (cough, Segal, cough). She has the most annoying voice in the history of the world but if you can get through that she's not bad. She's damn annoying but a pretty good professor.
She is out of control for workload, and she has a tendency to lose turned in work...and exams, blaming it on the students.
Most intelligent person I've ever met.  Assigns lots of work.  Always willing to help her students.

depending on the subject she may be very clear or not so clear...but regardless she is ALWAYS willing to help her students.  to her, teaching comes before research.  i have never seen such dedication from a teacher to her students.  i'd even be willing to say that she places her students before her sanity.  great sense of humor too.

At first you might be a little thrown off by her and think she is not a good professor...but once you get used to her, she is always willing to help at any time.  She is probably the only professor who answers webwork by herself at 2:00am the night before it's due.  She's a great person outside of the class and will help anyone.

She tends to move quickly in class (yet slowly because she assumes the students aren't as smart as we really are).  I guarantee she will assign more homework than any other class you have ever taken, and she will give tests that could easily run 3+ hours (my last exam was about 18 pages).
brilliant
She's completely nuts.  Her lectures can be confusing, but she's pretty helpful when you ask her questions afterwards.  Tests are manageable, but the curve always helps.

Very enthusiastic, however, doesn't know how to teach.  Is an easy grader if you do your homework, but she gives insane amounts of work.  Her tests are insane, though curved generously.  The end result is a decent grade with nothing learned.
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments

I honestly don't get the über negative ratings. Sure, he can be a bit dull and his assignments are difficult -- but the essays are mostly graded by the TAs, who are pretty horrible. He seems like a friendly, witty guy who keeps his lectures interesting with subtle wit. He can be a bit foggy sometimes but he is a good man.
Yes, lectures are boring. Yes, they are also essential. Book is the key to success. It IS possible to do well in this class, plenty of extra credit opportunities. Just keep up with the reading.

I really don't understand why he has such a high rating. His lectures are absolutely painful to sit through. He assigns reading that covers very difficult subjects, only to devote a few seconds to in class. I learned more reading the book than from him. His exams are confusing;interpreting the questions are difficult. Worst PSY prof I've had.

Okay, he is just the worst. I don't understand anything he says, and he can't spell, and I have no idea what the prompt for any of his questions mean so I'm so confused and his test questions come out of no where and he makes me cry because I hate him so much and I am crying right now because he is literally ruining my life. He looks like a seahors

McAdam is awesome. He was also my academic adviser. He can be pretty vague and mystic at times, however, he is a great professor with a ton of knowledge about EVERYTHING going on at the university, especially within the psych department. Wish I had taken PSY 101 with him too!
Fun and vibrant.

Great professor!  Very funny guy!  His tests were challenging but if you completed the 2nd answer sheet it certainly made up for it.  Very fair class.  Do the psych studies for extra credit - they are fun and it makes an A very attainable!
He is very funny. But the tests are difficult.

Great guy and a fun class. Tests can be somewhat stressful, but you get two tries so get a fews extra points. Write down notes on stuff he spends a long time on in the lecture, there will probably be a tricky question on it in the next test.
Excellent professor. Quite entertaining- keeps your attention. Fair grader- but tricky tests. Read text and take notes in class and you'll do well.
He's one of the best professors I've had. He keeps your attention during lecture and is very interesting and informative. His tests can be very hard though, so prepare for them well.
If you focus and do all the reading required, you will come out with a very decent work. Watch out for his test, they can be verrrrry tricky. But overall, an amazing professor, very approachable.

This class was challenging, but if you do the work, you'll come out with a good grade and a love of psychology. I'm actually considering it as a minor, or even a double major, after taking this class. Such a great instructor. Two thumbs up!
No Comments
His lectures are very interesting, but his tests are difficult. The course is really informative though.
his tests were soooo hard, but the class was really interesting and he's an entertaining man.

Great in PSY 101,wouldn't take 101 with anyone else.The tests require extra time and effort. HOWEVER-PSY113 is totally different.(relatively new course)but it is one of the worst classes I have ever taken and during this course he is the worst:everything unclear and difficult.nearly impos.to do well

He's got a split-curriculum -what he teaches during lectures, and what's in the book; he tests you on Both.  Context clues were the biggest help on his annoying tests, the less I studied the better I tended to do on them.

I don't know what prof. you all had, but i can't stand this man, or the class.  He tries to be funny, but it's usually just wierd, and 113 is so boring, i would fall asleep even if i wasnt at all tired.  I hated the class with a passion.
Best Prof I had at UR. Engaging lectures...never knew what to expect.
I did not like him, he was unhelpful and cold when I asked him about something on the syllabus which wasnt clear which other people had also had a problem with.
Hilarious guy but if you skip a couple lectures or don't read the book, you're screwed on the tests.
Lectures are great, knows his stuff and makes the material engaging.
Great teacher, very knowledgeable.  Tests weren't hard if you paid attention in class.  Very funny too, one of my favorite classes!
very funny, and a good teach
loved the lectures
No Comments
A great teacher with a great sense of humor that keeps his lectures interesting.
Enthusiastic, funny, great with students.
nice guy, very comfortable teaching
Funny as hell, some of the most enjoyable lectures I've had
tests are too hard
No Comments
my DAD had him for a professor 30 years ago!
No Comments
good lecturer
No Comments

Dr. Stein is a good prof and really cares about her students. She is fair on exams even though content is difficult. I would start memorizing metabolism ASAP. Grading is fair and there is credit for recitations, projects, and exams. Sometimes she was unclear about exam content, but overall she is a good professor.

This was a great class, and Dr. Stein explains things great, but do NOT do what I did and get behind for the final exam on metabolism!!! I do not love that she saved so much content for the last exam, as this exam brought me down to a B+.

Amazing lecturer, so funny, makes class fun. This class has a lot of tedious content but she makes it learnable. 2 exams + 1 exam (not cumulative) during finals week - last exam has a lot of info to memorize. Recitations are helpful + boost your grade. Mostly depends on your midterm grades tho. Possible to curve exams/class, 1 EC opportunity.

Prof Stein is one of the best profs I had in the U of R. Despite biochem being new to her, she was so good in explaining concepts despite having Dr. Fu's slides. Her office hours one on one were pretty good. She's funny and gives good explanations. If you keep up with the material and problem sets, you will be fine. Labs are long tho.

I really enjoyed learning the material Stein teaches and I think she's a very knowledgeable person. I just don't think the exams are well written, and it's hard to earn partial credit points. It sucks that she doesn't give any practice exams, and the third exam was information overload nearly impossible to memorize it all.

In office hours she is funny, cool, fun to listen to, and just a nice down to earth person. Even though I absolutely love her as a person, as a professor she just isn't good. Across Genetics and Biochem the lectures usually felt disorgnaized in the way information was presented. She is a tough grader and not very understanding despite her niceness.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I loved Dr. Stein! Super accessible outside class and was a great lecturer. She made genetics fun!

Dr. Stein is a very reasonable professor. The content itself is difficult, but she is very approachable in office hours. The practice exam and practice questions she gives are very good at testing your understanding of the material. The same goes for the homework and recitation content. The course is curved, so it is a difficult but doable class.

Very difficult class but Professor Stein is a great professor. She is extremely knowledgeable and passionate about the subject which makes her class interesting. She is also very kind and willing to help students understand difficult material. If you have the option to take one of her classes, highly recommend doing so.

198 is very dense and she moves too quickly during lecture. It's difficult, but doable. Memorize the slides, go to workshop, know that it is not a point system and partial credit is skimpy. Overall, Stein is a great, caring professor and an even better role model, especially for all the women entering stem. Professors like her are hard to come by.

She goes into depth on all topics and expects a lot of details on exams and doesn't give partial credit easily. Her lectures are easy to follow and she offers good explanations although she does move quickly. She is very approachable during office hours but is hard to reach via email.

Professor Stein is one of my favorite professors so far. Her lectures are easy to follow and she has good slides. You definitely have to put in the work for an A (use the lecture outline questions on the first slide), but she makes it doable.

Dr. Stein is very caring about her students. Her lectures are dense, but she makes herself accessible and breaks down content more if you ask. There is a lot of hard material, but if you go to lecture and understand key concepts you can pull through. The big group paper at the end of the semester is also really helpful for your grade.

The key to doing well in her class is to memorize the slides. If you can remember everything you'll get an A. Class isn't a point system so if you don't realize that early it's hard to reach an A after messing up an exam.

There is a lot of material to know, so it's important to connect the concepts. Dr. Stein is super accessible outside of class for questions. She explains concepts clearly and makes genetics very interesting!

Professor stein thoroughly explains topics and homework is helpful to understand. She gives learning objectives and practice problems that are helpful. This class is a lot of information but she is lenient and willing to help. I would recommend her even though this is a tough class. If you work hard outside of class and come to lectures it is easy

Stein is awesome. She's exceptionally knowledgeable about the material and judges nobody for any questions, and is willing to help not just with course material but study habits and other topics as well. Explanations can be confusing but again, she's willing to clarify anything. Very transparent with grading and expectations.

Professor Stein seems like a good person but she should stick to 50 minute lectures. She sped through way too much material every lecture and expects you to know minor details in her ppt slides. Study the slides hard, go to recitation and get outside help if needed. Exams are difficult but manageable with the curve.
Great teacher, passionate about the class and the content she teaches. Exams are very fair if you study and do the practice exams. Definitely go to recitation if you want to do well!

Dr. Stein is horrible at explaining difficult topics. She speeds through challenging units in lecture and expects you to know intricate details for exams. If you are not specific enough during exams expect to lose nearly all points on questions. Dr. Stein should also never teach an 75 minute lecture because the lectures are often dry and boring.
Dr. Stein is great. She's an engaging lecturer and very respectful towards students. Tests are easy, and she's funny. Regularly talks about the genetics of her cats.

I had Dr. Stein for this past summer term, and she was amazing! Lectures were pretty info-dense, but she explained concepts extremely well. She wants her students to succeed and enjoys students actively engaging with the material. Grades were mostly based on exams and a paper. I highly recommend taking a class with Dr. Stein!!

I really liked Dr. Stein. Her lectures were info-dense but they clearly outline what she wants you to know on exams. Assigned hw that wasn't thaaaat helpful, so focus on her lectures when studying. Her exams were tough but she made them open-note and gave us 2x time than normal. She does make you work for an A, but it's definitely doable.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Always helpful at office hours

The material for this class can be hard sometimes, but Stein is a great lecturer who really cares about teaching. Plus there are many other resources to help understand the material outside of class such as workshops, TAs, office hours, discussion boards, and the textbook. If you put in the time, this class is rewarding and not that difficult.

Dr. Stein's lectures (virtual now) are very info-heavy, but the exams are open note/-book. She has office hours twice a week with thought-provoking conversation (and occasional visits from her cat, Monkey!), and she patiently reexplains hard concepts. She cares about us and once moved a test because it coincided with orgo. Kind & easy to talk to!

Love Dr. Stein! If you study the lectures you'll be fine - textbook could be helpful to understand concepts she explains but typically her material is already overlapping with the book and you don't need to actually get it (even if you are a book person). Material may be tough, but Stein is incredible!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: I 100% do not recommend anyone to take this course. She gave us 7 difficult 3-hour midterms every other week. HW was so long and tedious. Promised short videos but posted 5-8 20-30 min videos in each chapter for each 7 modules. Too much content and not enough time to review. Don't make this mistake of taking this class now during a pandemic!!!!!!!!

Dr. Stein changed the format of her class for COVID and I much prefer this new way. Instead of 3 closed note, memorization heavy midterms, it is 7 open book conceptual module tests. She is an amazing lecturer who cares about the material and her students, and is flexible when she needs to be while still delivering the required amount of content.

Dr. Stein is a decent lecturer; I learned a lot from her class. However, as much as she makes it seem like she's doing us a favor amidst the pandemic, she's not. She gave us 7 exams, each being 3 hours long. The class was split into online modules, where the lecture videos add up to more than in-person lectures. The exams were also graded harshly.

AVOID! This class was the worst class I've ever taken in my academic life. We took 7 3-hour exams every other week + she teaches way too much content in 3 1/2 months! Awful exams! I am exhausted and the hw is longer than the exams! If you leave out a slight word that she was looking for in the exam, you get points off! BEWARE. It is not worth it!!

Where do I even begin. Taking BIOL198 this semester was the worst decision I've made of my entire college career. This semester, amongst a global pandemic, Dr. Stein felt the need to give 7 full-length midterms every other week. Although I believe she is a great lecturer and I understood her content well, the structure of the class was not it.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Test heavy

comment: Rather than in person 3 exam schedule, she gives 7 exams harder and longer than the typical exam. No practice exam, even if you follow what she teaches, you still get points taken off. She looks for extremely specific things in exam that no one would never expect. You dont get answer key for the workshop. She doesnt show up to her Office Hours.
Really fun class. A LOT of memorization, but the teacher is great and the tests are fair with a curve.

One of my favorite professors at UR thus far. She made genetics easy to understand and very enjoyable. Not to mention she has a wonderful personality and her passion for genetics shines through. Wish I had attended more of her office hours.

Dr. Stein gives really fun lectures for BIO 198: Genetics. Clear-minded, intellectual, humorous and explains everything clearly. Homework and exams are neither too dense nor too hard. Accessible outside classroom and very patient at answering questions.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: I took genetics with Dr. Stein over the summer term. It was online due to COVID, but nevertheless I learned a ton and would take it with her again. She's fantastic at what she does, is super passionate, and gives great feedback on tests. There were 6 tests and lots of homeworks. The textbook didn't help much, just pay close attention to the lecture

ECE101 is an easy course, and Mottley especially designs it so that it isn't jarring or difficult if you have no prior knowledge of calculus or physics. Lectures are optional and although I recommend attending, they can be off-track pretty often. Homeworks are sometimes graded incorrectly based on the TAs, but labs and workshops are also not bad.
What a nice guy. He sets every student up for success and is always there to answer questions.

Mottley is so kind, so caring, really wants his students to succeed. All lectures are recorded, but go to class anyway so you can ask questions. Recitations and labs are mandatory, but the labs are actually really fun. Mottley also cancels labs on exam weeks to have an extended Q&A. Great professor.
Very nice man, very easy class. Even though a good portion of the final grade is the exams, they are straight forward and everyone should be well prepared for it. The practice exams really help!
He went through lots of examples in class, and he posted all the notes online which was very helpful. The exam questions were very similar to the homework and examples in class.
He went through lots of examples in class, and the exam questions were very similar to the homework and examples in class.

Professor Mottley is a cool dude. I only got to take a 101 class with him so far, so I didn't get much of a chance to get to know him, and it was very clear that he is much more talented in teaching upper level classes than beginner classes. He will answer all of your questions no matter how stupid. Can't wait to take ECE113 with him next year!

I took this class from 3:15-4:05, and I fell asleep nearly every class. He has a very relaxing way of speaking that almost instantly puts me to sleep. Not a bad thing but it made it very hard to learn, but luckily all of the lectures are recorded ane when I can stay awake, the lectures are very informative and the information is valuable.

If you pay attention in lectures and put in effort in lab this class is an easy A. The homework and tests(do the study guides) all go along with lectures and nothing comes as a surprise or is too challenging. He is very quick to respond to emails and help students with any problems. The labs are simple & fun and for most of them you get out early.
Chill teacher, but he speaks quietly and isn't to engaging. Class is relatively boring but easy, as long as you generally know what's going on you should get the A.

A real stand up guy. Very accommodating towards all needs. Class can get a little bit on the boring side, but as long as you focus and do homework, you should be all set to go for tests/final. He breaks down a lot of the content which makes things very easy to grasp. You will be more than prepared with Jack!

This professor is not motivated in teaching, his class very boring. Exams and homework too easy. Before the exam, he gives all previous years' handouts. Questions are almost the same. I feel that I almost spend no time learning this course and learned very little. Compared with my friends from other top universities, I feel I learned a fake course.
It's just a harder ECE111. Mottley is still a very good professor and the lectures are still a bit dull. The labs for this course are pretty useless.
Class drags on sometimes, but he does his best to keep intro topics interesting.

Professor Mottley is a great teacher who really cares about his students. His lectures aren't super entertaining but he explains all the topics very well. The labs, workshops, homework, and exams all fit together nicely, so it is easy to learn all of the material even though there is a lot of it. Overall great professor.
Jack is genuinely a very good teacher and a very nice person. His lectures can get a bit dull, but you will always understand the material after them.

I like professor Mottley a lot. He's super friendly and easy to talk to, always willing to help. His lectures can get a little messy but he'll go above and beyond to make sure you understand. I recommend attending to recitations where you can ask any questions and you can get more one on one.
Attend class and its easy to do well.

Mottley taught my 111 class in a "flipped-classroom" style at times, but most of the year was just him lecturing. If you put in a decent effort you're likely to do very well! Mottley says he likes to challenge students with hw assignments, so he made the tests very straight forward.

Professor Mottley (as monotonous as he is) is very helpful and clear. He knows and loves what he's doing with circuits so he's always willing to help. The homeworks, labs, workshops and tests all match up to complete one another but they are very difficult so study hard and you'll be fine.

Mottley taught ECE 111 very well. It's a fundamentals class, and Mottley gave students a strong foundation to build more ECE knowledge on. Students were well prepared for exams, which had material on them consistent with the homeworks, labs, and lectures -- something which is rare and underappreciated by students often. Well done, Jack.

Lectures are boring and don't provide enough examples for you to even start the homework problems.  Workshops are somewhat beneficial at best and the labs are pointless.  I barely learned anything in this class.  Mottley is a nice enough guy, but he lacks teaching skills.  After taking this class I still have little idea about how a circuit works.

ECE 101 is a simple class that's just following directions from a provided book or packet and building robots while programming with VHDL.  It's a really fun class that'll get you into ECE.  Sometimes Mottley teaches the class basics, and it's always very clear. He grades very kindly and helps you readily.  He's also fairly likeable to chat with.

This was my least attended class in my history.  He is a terrible teacher, no organization, no enthusiasm, terrible TA's, confusing labs.  This class should be extremely easy, but it becomes difficult because of the lack of support of material (hw doesn't support lecture, labs are confusing, lectures are pointless)

Very nice guy, but bad professor.  Lectures are boring and don't help with the homework at all.  However, if you email him that you are having trouble with a specific homework problem, he will usually do it for you in class.  You should go to workshop; that's where I learned most of the material.

The tests are nearly exactly the same as previous years. Labs suck but they are easy. You will leave the class thinking that you learned very little but will find that you learned more than you thought.

Really nice guy, but not a good teacher.  Lectures don't help with homework, and labs are hard to follow.  Get a good workshop leader and you'll do fine.  Tests are really easy- very similar to previous years.  The book is useless.

Homeworks didnt really help.  Tests were easy because they are the same as previous years.  Spends to much time in lectures deriving.  Don't expect him to respond to emails or to even know what grade to expect.
HW are sometimes pointless, and lectures are fairly boring, expect to take 40 mins writing notes to have him tell you you only need to remember one small equation at the end. Nice guy to talk to.

pointless homework that didn't match tests, awful labs, poorly chosen TAs, boring guy.  stresses professionalism when he doesn't even follow half of what the syllabus says, and in general holds a really boring, difficult course.
very consistant. within 5 minutes, i was asleep.
Lecture notes not relevant with homework, lectures trivial compared to homework, boring, labs are stupid
I have never heard anyone speak in more of a monotone in my life!
Nice guy, kind of aimless class though.  no real goals.
He seems like he should be a highschool teacher.  The class was fun, in an easy way, but not all the benefincial to my life.
CANT TEACH!!!!
No Comments
Great Professor, exams are like practice. Only issue is that HW can be tedious.

Professor Titus is a very lenient professor—flexible due dates, resubmission of homework—and is very clear on what he expects on exams. He does a review session prior to each test, as well as providing study materials. I took MUSC 110 and then continued to MUSC 111, but his lectures are just plain boring and I will not be taking 112 with him.

Titus as a guy is amazing. He's great to talk to, lenient on due dates, and accessible outside of class. His lectures, however, are plain boring. It's very hard for me to be engaged throughout the entire lecture. Homework was pretty easy, and he does a review session the lecture before a test.
Best Professor. Take his classes and you will not regret. He is

Prof. Titus is super attentive, understanding & accessible outside of class. Hands down the best Prof I've had so far. I would suggest you go to his lectures, his piano demos are really fun and he goes out of his way to make sure we do well in his class! He's the reason I decided on Music as a minor & I am taking his classes (MUR111&112) next year!
Great professor overall. Grading rubric is clear, exams and homework are reasonable and straightforward.
Really nice guy! He was so patient. He will give us sufficient exam materials. I will definitely take his course again!

Class content isn't very hard, but he can explain it weirdly. Spends a lot of time on things you don't need to know, sometimes glosses over important things. Gives test study guides; understand them and you'll do very well. weekly online quizzes, 3 points each- not very hard. Lets you resubmit homework. Very kind professor, very funny.

Professor Titus is a very kind professor that allow makeup tests and always there to answer question, but his lectures are a little dry. He does know a lot about music but it's hard for us to engaged. Many people stopped attending lectures a few weeks later, but you can still managed to get A by just practicing and watch his videos. It was an ez A.

Awesome guy overall. Explained topis very clearly and thoroughly which could be boring, but was nonetheless super helpful. Super nice on extensions for HWs or quizzes (both of which were take-home), I was late on a few but he still gave me full credit.  Class was very well organized and he provided a lot of extra material to study.

Professor Titus is a very understanding and helpful professor, but unfortunately, his lectures are quite dry. I stopped attending lectures after the first few weeks but was still able to secure an easy A by reading the textbook and watching instruction videos, though I don't find the class to be very interesting.
Dr.Titus is super nice, he replies to emails very frequently. Love his lectures, gives out everything clearly. Lots of quizes and 3 tests, get ready!
Caring professor! He replies to emails quickly and answers questions precisely. His lectures are well-organized and logical. His sense of humor makes insipid knowledge of music theory less boring.
You won't regret taking him. He really knows the stuff. Well-structured learning modules.

As long as you pay attention in class and complete the weekly (relatively easy and don't take a ton of time), I'd say the class is an easy A. Probably helpful to have a good music background, but it definitely doesn't have to be strong. Titus' lectures were also very well structured.
The class is easy to get high grades!
Always know what to cover in exams and hws.
Exams covered all we learned in class, never out of bound.

Jason is a good professor, but the only thing I advise people is to make sure you have some music experience before taking the course. I've been around music for 8 years and I had some trouble with a couple things; I couldn't imagine what it would be like if you didn't know how to read music or basic elements of musicality and take this course

He just rambles on and on and on and on about utter nonsense. If you know anything about music theory, override their decision and go straight into MUR111. This class is such a waste of time, and he assigns so much unnecessary dumb work to do.
Easily one of the best profs I've had. His knowledge is astonishing and is humor is top notch. I love it when he plays demos on the piano. An absolute gem of a professor.

Titus is a solid prof for 111. He explains the material very clearly-you don't really need the textbook if you go to class and take good notes. If you do the work required (do the homework carefully, and go to class) it's pretty easy to get an A. His tests come directly from the homework exercises and his practice tests are similar to the real ones

Attendance counted but also if you missed a class, you missed the assignment given. All the assignments are posted online but without either taking a music theory class prior or going to class, it's really hard to understand how to do the work. The assignments are short but usually take a little time. The class before tests he goes over everything.

Titus is a fairly good teacher. He deducts points for things that some may not even consider errors depending on school of thought. His class can be a little boring and dry at times. Overall, good teacher, but if you have the option, get BaileyShea. He's truly an expert in the field and teaches at Eastman too. He also doesn't use the expensive book

Great professor. Very clear about teaching music theory and has an obvious passion for music. Coming from AP theory, this was a very easy class but he still offers a nice perspective on stuff. Attendance is recorded. Very funny guy though, worth sitting in lecture for.

Titus is a great professor! He loves what he teaches and teaches well. You don't need the textbook if you go to class. Grading can be harsh, but the material is easy, so as long as you understand it, you won't have problems. He can no longer factor attendance into your grade b/c of issues last semester with swine flu. Oh yeah, corny jokes galore...

Titus was a very great professor! His grading harshness on homework really makes you watch everything you do and not rush. He goes over test topics the lecture before the test so that is nice. The only thing I didn't like is that he didn't follow the syllabus schedule- we are often way behind it. Other than that I would definitely suggest him!

As previously stated, Titus is THE man. My only complaint is that he seems a little poorly organized. I'd like to see more syllabus adherence. That said, he's HILARIOUS, and somehow manages to make music theory not only funny, but really quite interesting. His music theory dorkyness really shines through and makes you care about the material. A+!

Mr. Titus is my favorite professor at  UR. He's really funny and he teaches the material well. Like others stated, he'll deduct points for all errors, but since he reviews every type of test question before hand, it compensates for tough grading. He also puts 50% weight into homework, but he'll accept late homework without deduction, always do it!
Titus is a great prof. I can really appreciate his humor and better yet, he's super nice. watch out though, homework takes up half of your semester grade and attendence counts towards 10%!

He's really nice, and he teaches well, but the thing is, he grades REALLY hard. One mistake is like -3, and the mistakes add up. So watch out for the extremely hard grading, because the WHOLE class depends on your performance on the homework (even though it doesn't feel like it) since hw is worth 50% of the grade, and each mistake is so crucial.
Titus is awesome - witty, fun, interesting, really knows music theory, I loved him

Not only is Titus the man, but he is an increadible music professor.  You can tell that he has taken a deep interest in music and pursued it.  There is no greater professor than one that truly loves what they teach and this is true of Titus.

Ok, so here's the deal.  Titus is the master of all that is music theory.  I mean, yo Titus, you are the bomb!  He's funny, witty, clear, and awesome.  In all seriousness, Titus is an incredible teacher and has won the respect of this student fully.
Titus is the master of being cool, despite the fact that all signs would tell you he isnt.  What a great professor.  I only wish I could take all my music theory with him
No Comments
Titus is a nice guy and tries really hard to be funny.  He assigns very little work compared to other professors of the same course.  A pretty easy class overall.
Dr Platt was an amazing professor and a better teacher. Utilize his office hours. Hes handed over the reigns to Dr. Clark, but still remains very active.

Overall, Bio 112 was a decent class, and much better than the alternative, Bio 110 with Olek. A lot of the material taught (especially at the end) was researched by Platt himself and I found that aspect quite interesting. The key to success is to go to lecture and work on the test questions (he gives them to us in advance) in small groups.

When selecting a biology class I was apprehensive to choose Bio 112, but I'm glad I did. Professor Platt is likeable, a great lecturer, and brilliant. A lot of the material you will discuss in the class he had a role in discovering. As tests go the material is difficult but manageable because this is primarily a biochemistry class. Take this class!

Platt is a brilliant man. He teaches a rough subject and is much better than the alternative, Olek. He gives you the questions beforehand and that forces you to learn the subject matter. It will take effort but its rewarding.

Go to lecture (sit toward the front so you can hear him, he's soft spoken), go to workshop, and take advantage of the exam questions that are given to you before the test and you will be fine. Reading the text before like he recommends helps during lecture.

Platt deserves better scores than he has on here.  Honestly, my friends in 110 with Olek struggled much more than me in 112.  He's a really smart guy so sometimes I'd get a bit lost but he wants his students to do well (he even gives the test Qs in advance).  The class forces you to think so it can be difficult but it's interesting.

If you go to class and go to workshop, you'll probably be okay.  Also, work in groups on exam questions because they're really really hard. Get Lehninger on PDF because it's used way more than the one we bought.He's helpful if you ask him questions, but can get confusing with diagrams.Some stuff is over a freshman's head but he makes it interesting

If you can get past the fact that the required textbook is not actually used, you will learn a ton. Like the other reviewers said, he basically teaches biochemistry.  Great teacher with genuine interest in his students (and the subject matter) and you feel like you are actually a scientist when you leave the course.

Professor Platt's lectures are possibly the most fun out of all the classes I have. Furthermore his exams are not difficult and he provides many thought provoking quotes before each of his classes. I'm very happy that the University of Rochester decided to have such a capable Professor conduct the course
One of the best professors in the school

The lecture is boring useless. I personally felt I didn't learn a lot from this class. Many people I knew who wanted to do bio major decided not to after taking class...To survive this class: go to workshop, review session and buy biochem book!

Biochem 250 was one of the most useful classes that I had before entering medical school.  If you can do this class, you can basically sleep in when you do biochem in med school because you've already learned it.  Platt is a fabulous teacher, and I owe much of my success to him.

Platt has a biochem degree,  and teaches this course straight out of the biochem textbook. If you have a photographic memory you will do well on the tests, otherwise you're screwed. Lectures will put you to sleep, as will his rambling stories of his dad in the 50s. Workshops are the only way to learn anything. Very useless class with little bio.
He does a terrible job of teaching this class. Biochem majors soon realize how useless this class was and how stupid minute details cost big points on exams. Lectures were atrocious.
buy Lehninger.  that's the only book he teaches from and it's not required to buy.  the required book is never used

worst biology professor I've ever had, Lectures are useless as he glosses over many things. The tests are often straight out of a upper level biochem text book and only require pure memorization to pass, No understanding at all is needed. Only the truly brain dead can enjoy the lectures or fail the tests.
He scares everyone into thinking they will fail, then gives everyone A's. You'll either hate him or love him, but don't take his learn-it-yourself take-home-test approach for granted.

Like Slughorn from Harry Potter. If you're "smart" you're made, if you're not then you don't exist.Class is well taught but there is no question that his tests are hard, the material dense, and the prof clearly plays favorites.It's great if you're one of his favorites but otherwise...be prepared for a bit of disdain.
Tests were just regurgitating information taken from anywhere but the text book. Boring. Dont even bother going.

A really helpful and knowledgable man.  The class had a ridiculous amount of stuff to learn.  He claims to try and teach you to sip from the firehose of information but then tests you on the entire firehose.  Workshops are useless and designed with only pre-med students in mind, not science students.  Interesting class, I recommend it.
Does a pretty good job of covering lotssss of material in great detail in one semester.  The key to doing well is to memorize everything and to start studying for his exams well in advance.

Awesome prof who actually cares about his first year students. He practically memorizes everyones name in a class of over 100. Test questions are given out before test, but not all appear on test. Material, thus, while challenging, is not hard to master. Definitely recommend and will miss not having him teaching biochem 250 anymore.

Although this class was challenging, the way Dr. Platt taught forced you to research on your own. The way his exams were structred forced you to fully understand all material. As long as you go to workshop and study for tests I fully recommend this class. Oh and don't bother buying the Purves bio textbook, buy Lehninger's Principles of Biochemistry

While 112 is honors bio, it is still a survey course, so I expected there to be some review of AP Bio material. Instead, the prof. constantly talked about his own research without providing any sort of background or context. (We used the biochem class's textbook, not the one we were told to buy.) This class is truly a waste of time for freshmen.

don't take Bio 112 with him unless you plan on taking chemistry too. He uses a textbook different than the one we were required to buy. He teaches biochemistry in biology 112. Tests are completely different than what we are assigned to read and what is taught in class. It's very confusing.
very helpful. study and memorization is a must.

Nice for the most part, but sometimes when you go into his office hours and tell him that you don't understand something or that you are having trouble with something; he blames you. Overall, very good course and he does a pretty good job keeping a huge lecture hall of students engaged in the lecture.
workshops do not match up with class material at all. tests are INSANE and the material is sometimes all over the place. You might cover metabolism one hour and plant anatomy the next.
No Comments

He is way to hard to get a hold of for office hours.  The only reason people pass this course are because of the back tests.  Class is pointless all he does is read the lecture slides, which he then posts online for later.  Never gives examples or sample problems.  The workshop he made does not follow whats going on in class
While learning with him, I remember only his TESTS, which are, in one word, CRUEL!
He knows my name!
Cruel tests, harsh grading!
A very harsh professor who really expects you to learn a great deal out of textbooks.
awesome teacher
Dr. Platt is truely awesome!  His knowledge deserves everyone's admiration.  I'm glad to be in his class; he does not limit his teaching to textbooks but expands outside knowledge also!  Great!

Very sad that she's retiring this year, but this was a great class to have taken. Lectures were short, homework was the same as exam questions, and she was there to help if you were stuck on questions. Amazing professor.

Her lectures are generally very fast paced, and she almost always doesn't take the full 75 minutes. She uses lots of examples to illustrate concepts which is really helpful. She's always willing to help out with homework questions. Exams are really straight forward. The final project at the end of the course isn't too much to worry about either.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: The content of the course is very interesting and applicable to real life and she was able to explain things so well that I'm pretty sure a 6th grader could pass this course. One of the best courses I've ever taken and one of the most helpful professors I've ever had.

An amazing professor overall. Caring, inspirational, hilarious, knowledgeable, passionate, and accessible. She very clearly understands students' struggles and thus has made efforts to support students in all ways. Her online readings, recordings, homework, and workshops are all that you need to succeed in this class. I recommend her to everyone!

She is very nice and is the least harsh grader I have ever had. On exams, you have the choice to just write RCode that you would use to solve the problem which helps A LOT. I have put wrong numbers in and only got a half a point off.  She also only lectures for 30 minutes, sometimes more or less.

Professor McDermott is one of the best professors I've had at UR so far. She genuinely cares about her students, and is fair and reasonable with what she expects you to know. She's also good at using analogies to break down tricky concepts to make them more digestible. As long as you attend workshop and study the examples/homework, you'll do well.
Very nice and accessible out of class. Gives very clear instructions. She want students to be successful in her class.

Professor McDermott develops a series of online statistic videos, combines them with textual introduction of each teaching unit, thus making the content very easy to understand. She really manages the class well despite teaching asynchronously. All the grades she gives are reasonable. Put some effort into the class and a good grade will ensue.

Professor McDermott was amazing! Given STT212 isn't a very difficult class at UR, her lectures were very easy to understand she went over lots of examples in class. Provides practice exams that are very similar to actual exams and very accessible outside of class.
Most amazing professor ive ever come across

She's the best professor I've had since I started college! She is so respected and caring of her students, not only academically but also to a personal level. She started this semester doing popup quizzes but she lets you drop the 3 worst grades. Her lectures are really entertaining and she explains really really well and makes the class quite easy

I absolutely love prof McDermott. Shes always striving to improve her class and make it a better experience for the students. Shes also incredibly funny, and taking the time to go to office hours and meet her one-on-one is an experience every student of hers should have. One note dont try to bs her, shell be a hard ass if she thinks ur lying!

If you put in the work for the exams (knowing the format of the questions over the actual material), do the HW, and go to workshops, there's no way you won't get an A. She posts everything online, but her lectures are far from helpful. She basically reads off the slides. She is nice and answers questions, but you're better off teaching yourself.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Caring professor, but lectures can get pretty dull. Practically everything is available online, including the powerpoints from lectures, so there is basically no need to go to class. Content is not too challenging, and half of the questions on the exams are copied and pasted from the practice exams.

Easiest class ever, she has powerpoint slides for every class. You can just look at the powerpoint slides without coming to her class. Her class was huge and just went over all the lecture slides. To be honest, I went to all her classes but always slept in the front row.

Professor McDermott has very clear and organized lectures that help tremendously with the online homework and tests. She is very kind and funny and genuinely cares about her students and what she teaches. She is the best professor I have had so far and would definitely take a class with her again.

I would say she had trouble explaining the concepts and her lecture just reading through the slides. This is my first statistic class; I can get good grades for the exams but after listening to her class I am still lost. She wears headphones during the office hours and she is not really helpful!
This class is very easy
One of my favorite professors at the U of R. Super approachable and there to help.
Class is incredibly easy.

She's a sweetheart.  Her lectures are clear with real-world examples and she's so approachable- she's a real person who understands and is really considerate.  As someone who had zero experience in statistics before this course, I got an A.  She made me love stats!

McDermott is just a great professor all around! She is understanding, approachable, and explains concepts clearly in class, not that concepts are all that hard to grasp. Tests were easy and we got a cheat sheet every time. Textbook is somewhat useful if you missed a class or if you just want to go over what was discussed in class. Take this class!

Great intro to OLS. Super helpful as always. Final was a tiny bit tricky but overall great class with fairly easy homework. Lectures never lasted an hour and we got to work on the project the last month of class instead of having lecture.
I took two classes with her and she is a great professor. She is very nice, helpful and clear. But remember never try cheating in her exams. She is very serious about academic honesty.

Ridiculously easy class. 3 MC exams that you get a cheat sheet and graphing calc for. HW can be annoying but it's easy.  She really wants everyone to enjoy the class and do well. She's also one of the nicest profs at UR. Highly recommend her and this class
Easy class. Great experience. East to follow. Got a cheat sheet for every exam. Best class ever!
She is a great professor. Definitely take a class with her!

Extremely easy. you can learn if you want to. Mcdermott is really nice and informal. Textbook readings probably won't be necessary, but do them if you want the material reinforced or if you miss a few classes.
Very easy class but if you pay attention you do learn a lot. Very helpful and a good opportunity to receive an A while learning. I wish more classes were taught like hers.

Such a sweet professor! She always made herself available for help and taught right from the book for the most part. The class seemed like it would be extremely easy but the first couple exams and some homework were hard. However, the final and final project were a great opportunity to boost your grade (so work hard at first). Take this class!
I took this as a pre-requisite for econ and highly recommend it. Learned a decent amount and wasn't overly challenging. Professor McDermott is also extremely helpful.
Professor makes herself readily available. Cover a lot of statistics concepts. Recommend taking this class.
Middle school was more challenging.

This class is a joke. Textbook is useless and expensive; homework questions are poorly worded and often misgraded; and lectures are just reading off powerpoint slides. Take this class if you need time to slack off and party; DON'T take this class if you need it as a prerequisite and/or to prepare for your career.
Easiest/Best Class offered at UR. Great for a GPA boost, or just a better understanding of statistics.
very friendly and nice, wants you to do well in the class. power points are online and tests give you a cheat sheet. definitely do it.

She was only there half the semester which was better because she moved way to fast through lecture. Coding in like learning a new language and she would breeze through it like we all have seen it before. She gave crazy amounts of homework for a two credit class. I had more work in this class than any of my four credit classes. She was very helpful

there is a lot of weekly homework. i think she is a great lecturer with the resources she has. if you do not have any background in coding this will be a hard class. she had to get through a lot of content very quickly, luckily you do not need to understand every topic. very much trial and error with coding. projects are long.
super sweet and remembers names. thoroughly explains complex problems which i love. the exams were fair and a little challenging. overall loved the class and her.

Overall good prof. Works through examples and gives out worksheets in class (+remembers names and faces). Easy course until the end of the semester when the content got harder and she had to leave so there was a prof change.

She left halfway through the semester, but she's alright. She will not explain her slides very well during lectures, so if you have no experience with MATLAB, I would do a little research. If you ask her a question about an assignment, she's good at identifying the problem and telling you the fix. Projects are big. She replies to emails very fast.

Professor Slane is really good in Statics. She has clear lectures and makes the material understandable. She really cares about the student and is always available to help. It is an ME course so it will be tough but very do-able to get a good grade.

Very accessible, each TA has office hours too where they can check your homework. Lectures are very easy to follow and she's good at reviewing the steps that she takes. If you take the class seriously, then it's easy to get an A. Since it has ME104 topics, it's easy to develop the mindset that you don't need to try as hard, but imo you still should

The lectures are engaging and informative, but the workload for a 2-credit course feels excessive. It surpasses the workload of my 4-credit differential equations course. Deducts a lot of points for minor errors. It's important to be cautious about not copying other people's code, as the academic honesty board can be right around the corner.

Lectures themselves are good and engaging, but the amount of work she gives is way too much for a 2 credit course. There was more work than my differential equations 4 credit course, and the grading is very tough and can lose a lot of points on the smallest things. Proficiency tests are stress-inducing, must be done in a short time.

I have taken three courses with Professor Slane. She pushes the limits for the amount of work that can be assigned and expects an unnecessary amount from her students. Her projects are time-consuming and often unreasonable. Be VERY careful about collaboration in her courses, as she reports people every semester to the academic honesty board.

I have taken three courses with professor Slane: two MATLAB courses and Statics. Slane is out to get her students. She is notorious for assigning absurd amounts of monotonous work and reporting students to the academic honesty for collaboration. She is not a supportive professor, she is on a power trip out to get hard working eng students.

Professor Slane is a very kind professor. If you took ME104, the first half of this class is just a repeat of force diagrams. Lectures aren't recorded so make sure to show up. It's a very up close and personal class, and she remembers names and faces.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Lots of MATLAB coding homework but this is a TWO-credit course. My four-credit Mechanical Engineering courses cost me less time than this TWO-credit course. She has THREE long, hard, complicated coding projects during the semester which will take you almost two weeks to complete. Please reduce the workload or increase to four credit course.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: ME 260 is a two-credit course but having the workload of a five-credit course. Do not expect this two-credit course as easy as a normal two-credit course. She had three hard, complicated, time-consuming projects in one semester which is unbelievable and frustrating.

Her project is so annoying. I know every knowledge that being used in the project but it is very awful when you look at a thousand of instruction and must follow the guideline to get score. Very heavy course load.

I am really hate her, though many of my peer think she teach well. As a 2-credits course, the course load is extremely high, especially when doing projects. Her projects are like asking you to utilize everything she mentioned in the class, even sometimes beyond, and ask you with specific method that she assigned. VERY ANNOYING and MAKES ME MAD...

After having Professor Slane for ME 120 in the spring of 2022 and now having completed ME 160 in the fall of 2022 I definitely understand why the reviews for this class are not as good as those of 120. With that being said she and her TAs made the class fair and themselves accessible for the necessary help.

Lots students like this professor, but I am in the minority of disliking her teaching style. While she has office hours, a majority of the material is not taught in lectures. Also, there will be parts on assignments with little explanation from lecture notes. Slane is definitely not the worst professor but could better explain the assignments.
Her grading criteria is shit. You will be deducted point due to drawn figure has flaw in a coding course. Her requirements on format is driving me mad as well. It is super crazy!!!

I've only taken Professor Slane once, but as I was taking her class I was pretty blah about the material and did well without too much fervor. However, when I looked back at all of the things we had learned, I noticed how easily she broke down the subjects into bite-sized pieces that covered an insane amount of material. It was all easy to learn.

She is so lovely and willing to answer all your questions. If you focus on her lectures, finish homework carefully, and prepare her tests and quizzes, you will easily succeed in this course. Five Stars!

Professor Slane is very organized and clearly presents the lectures in a way that is understandable. She structures her homework and exams based on the examples she does in class and the recitations are a good resource for more example problems. Class work time with your friends is great. Slane is a great teacher in the ME track.
