I had prof. Slane for ME 120, 160, and 260. For 120, she was great; a reasonable amount of work,  tried hard to connect with students, and overall seemed very motivated. for ME 160/260, it was inexplicably overwhelming at times. The projects contained material that wasn't covered as she was trying to apply the work in a very advanced way.

Prof Slane has a perfect way of teaching the course. She uploads the slides, examples she went through in class and worked solutions to worksheets and homework sets. She's also always enthusiastic about teaching and is a very fair grader. Go to lectures as she explains everything clearly.

Prof. Slane gives great lectures with enthusiasm. Quizzes and tests are always covered in class. Also, she cares about her students and would always willing to answer our questions, and she really wants to help us get a better grade.. As long as you understand every problem taught in class and do your homework, you will be fine!!!

Prof. Slane is one of the best teachers I've ever had in my entire school career. She's incredibly caring, and passionate, and best of all, amazing at teaching! She breaks everything down into easy steps, and gives so many practice problems if you need them. Studying for exams is great because you know exactly what to expect! She's awesome, 11/10!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Every assignment given included things not taught in class! She uses her belief that people learn coding by doing not hearing as an excuse to not even introduce topics. This makes it harder to complete every assignment, especially projects, because they contain a couple of things she didn't teach. Wort teacher I've experienced so far at Rochester.
She is a wonderful professor who genuinely cares about her students :-)
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Slane is a rare example of professors who truly care about your education. Very understanding, and incredibly smart. Her teaching style, while a little fast-paced, ensures that you don't even have the opportunity to fail to learn a subject. LOVE HER!!!

She is not the main professor, and she is very condescending to students in meetings. She doesn't have any useful feedback, she just picks on wording and small typos in order to feel like she has meaningful input/power. To me, it seems like she's generally on a power trip and wants to assert herself as a young professor.

Prof. Slane is awesome. She is super approachable and accessible, explains her examples well, answers questions, and is a fair grader. The lectures are super in depth, so it's pretty important to go to class, but that meant that I didn't even have to buy the textbook. 10/10 would recommend!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Lectures are very organized with a lot example. Exams can be hard, a new challenge compared to Statics. Don't miss class if you don't have to... makes a huge difference. Office hours are essential and very helpful.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Literally my favorite professor. She is a great lecturer and walks you through examples to make sure you understand the material. She is one of very few professors who makes a point of learning everyone's names. Definitely go to class and recitation if you want to do well in this course!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Professor Slane is my favorite professor I have had so far at the U of R. She makes complex material extremely understandable and if you go to class you will likely have no problem understanding the class material. In our class she also integrated in class worksheets which I think made a big difference in learning the material well.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Great Professor all around, makes class easy to follow. slides are easy to follow, but you have to attend the lectures for the example problem that she solves on the board. Very caring professor about how you do in the class, and very approachable for help in solving problems. Her classes are great, and definitely not boring in the slightest.
rating_tags: Respected--Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Slane is the best professor I've ever had. Her lecture consists of teaching the material, class example then classwork. Her exams are very fair and it's what you learned from homework and worksheets. She's a very kind and fun professor. She tries to get to know her students as well.

Prof Slane took a class that is inherently difficult my nature and made it seem a lot more simple. Tests were very fair she also came to the weekly recitations for more 1 on 1 time. She took the time to get to know each student which was invaluable because their was no intimidation during office hours or during lecture. Would definitely take again.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: SHOW UP TO CLASS. Read the book before attempting homework. A lot of the chapters on the course are similar to each other and can be confusing. The class is not curved and you need to score very highly for an A.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY

comment: She explains course material very clearly and has the new professor enthusiasm. The course material is relatively straight-forward and it introduces 3D systems well. She is accessible outside of class and her TAs are good at explaining questions as well. I would not suggest skipping recitation, especially during the 3D systems unit.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: If you have a background in calculus this class will be very easy however, I feel like she would overcomplicate easy concepts. Do the recent past exams and notes given and you should be fine but lecture could get confusing at times.

Amazing professor!! She is very clear during lectures and if you are confused, she holds long office hours during which she explains the concepts more in-depth and really helps you understand the material.
Madhu is an above-and-beyond professor. She explains things very well in lectures and gets into details. She is inspirational and I plan to take MATH 235 with her to pursue a math minor.
A terrible professor who feels like someone owes him money.

Prof Madhu is extremely knowledgable and insightful for linear algebra. I think she is the best professor for the course. The class itself is definitely difficult. There is a strong emphasis on exams with no curve. The homework felt a bit excessive at times, but honestly pretty helpful in the long run.

Shes an amazing professor but the class itself is insanely hard. Tests are really difficult and there is no curve and no workshop to help your grade. Written homeworks are extremely dumb and difficult.

Fantastic professor. Lectures are very clear and engaging, and she clearly cares a lot about her students and making sure everyone understands the material. She is also very accessible outside of class in office hours if needed. Highly recommend taking this class with her if you can.

The material for this class was challenging but the professor's explanations were one of the best. Of all the professors who teach Math 141, Madhu is the best option. She is super helpful if you have any extra questions after class, provides a lot of office hours, and is great at clearing any little doubt you have about a subject.
Prof. Madhu was a great teacher. Clearly explained ideas and made sure everyone was on the same page. Prepared detailed lecture notes for every lecture. Highly recommended Prof. Madhu
rude professor
No comments

Funny&caring professor who makes you want to do your best. As someone coming in with AP calc knowledge though, I felt she overcomplicated concepts too much and I wouldn't have understood some things without my previous knowledge. Love her grading strategy&pls do the homework it'll save you if you do bad on tests. Try asking for simpler explanations

Professor Madhu is a standout math professor. She is excellent at explaining concepts and always answers students' questions. She responds quickly to emails and is overall a kind, caring person. Calculus is hard, but she makes it as simple as it can be. She makes the content engaging and is very knowledgable. Definitely recommend for any math class

Professor Madhu is a great teacher; her lectures are not too boring, and she seems like a great person overall. She seems like a brilliant professor although sometimes I feel she explains easier concepts a little too complex, so it may be harder understand if you haven't taken calculus before. There are no lecture recordings so don't miss class.
Very funny and engaging in lecture. Teaches in an understandable manner. She's willing to take the time to get students to where they need to be.

She clearly cares about her students and is ready to help them. She intentionally makes herself accessible outside of class and seeks out feedback to be continually improving (and she's already one of the best profs I've had). She explains things clearly and balances explanation and examples well. My passion for math grew because of her teaching.

Madhu is extremely great lecturer: she covers everything in the lecture and refers to the textbook always so that you keep track of everything she says and you can always go to the text for more details. I didn't use the textbook many times along the semester and still managed to get an easy A. My only concern is that she is slow speaker!

Prof Madhu is amazing! She's very helpful and truly wants students to understand the concepts. If you ask her a question she will explain it until you understand it. She's very accessible outside of class and her office hours were amazing. The best math teacher I have ever had. The work and exams are not easy but there are resources to help
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Madhu is a great professor. She truly cares and makes sure you understand the material. Sometimes during lectures she begins talking about math history by accident which is adorable. As long as you pay attention in lectures and worskhops, you'll be fine.

Of all the professors in Math141, she was the best, even though she was online. She cared about her students and would go over anything you asked and would try explaining differently. Her tests were hard. You are required to attend workshops and your attendance to them is graded, but not to her lectures.

I took her for the online class, and sometimes I find it difficult to understand the material during lectures so I often have to go back afterwards and learn it myself. Of course, that could just be me because it's online. Overall, she is probably the best 141 professor. The midterms were graded very harshly though, which is. very frustrating.

Sweet prof, and there are no stupid questions to her! I think she teaches well, but if you took AP calc, then there's really nothing new. Exams were easy, just go over past exams to get an idea of what the exam will be like. Can't go wrong with her!
Best math professor I have ever had. Is willing to answer questions and actually explains them in a way students can understand. She is very personable and caring, highly recommend.

I'm a humanities major but decided to take calculus for fun, and it was AMAZING. Madhu is probably the best professor I've ever had for anything ever. She clearly knows her stuff AND is great at communicating it clearly and making it accessible to students. She is also makes her expectations clear and genuinely cares about our success.
She is a great professor who truly cares about her students.

Read the textbook before class or else attending class isn't worth it. She sometimes goes too fast in lecture, but if you read the section before class you'll do just fine and get an A. She's very smart and also has a great personality.

Good professor, very knowledgeable about her subject, but she is honestly just way too quick. Even though we were in the "easier" math calculus class she just raced through the material. Anytime I wrote the stuff she wrote on the board down I had to write down another thing, never had time to think about what we were going through.

Dr. Madhu is the best. She is one of the better lecturers in the math department, and by far the most considerate and helpful during office hours. She is always willing to schedule an apt. to help out students

Professor Madhu almost made me like calculus. She is SO caring, and she really wants everyone to understand what she is talking about. I would recommend her to anyone that asked me, especially if you are someone that isn't particularly excited about taking calculus.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Dr. Madhu is very invested in her students' success. This is a first course in proofs for most of the class and as such her office hours are great opportunities to work through tricky problems and strategies. Not necessarily exciting lectures, but clear and thorough.

She's really chill and makes an effort to help students understand the material. She pauses and gives time for questions when she knows the material is more difficult. She has a sense of humor and tries to keep things interesting. I wish I had her for all my math classes! Gives good notes
Very good and helpful professor. She was the best section teacher in MTH162, without a shadow of a doubt. I attended a different lecture once and the gap in quality was enormous.
She is so helpful and nice! She explained each concept clearly and answered every question. She also took us through each type of possible problem step by step and made it easy to succeed.
She knows her stuff, plain and simple. Ask questions if you're confused, she will answer anything, no matter how trivial it may seem.

Very sweet lady, she takes great interest in teaching the class and is does not chastise you if you ask clarifying questions. The pace is fast but it is necessarily so as there is a lot to cover in calculus 2. Intended math major and this class has reinforced my desire to pursue a degree in mathematics.
Good.

Explained some things well, but has terrible handwriting, hard to understand what she's writing on the chalk board Also, moves VERY fast through the material, makes it hard to grasp especially if you dont have a knack for math like me.

I have taken two of his classes and I love him! He's a great lecturer and will always explain any topics you aren't familiar with. Doing the readings will help with the midterm, but he's a fair grader and they're not too difficult. I really recommend him!

Primo is one of the best professors at U of R! He cares about his students, and his case studies are very interesting because he uses current real-life examples. By far one of the best PoliSci/Business professors at the university, take his class if you can!

Love love love Primo. He is kind, compassionate, and has deep passion for what he teaches. But there's no final and lectures are interesting. Hopefully will get to take another class with him in the future. I advise staying on top of your homework and participating in class!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Caring

comment: very good professor
Absolute gem!

The class was not too difficult, but you have to be careful on the tests. I lost a few points each test and ended with a A- despite understanding the content extremely well. However, Professor Primo is a mostly fair, extremely intelligent and well-spoken, engaging, and overall a great professor and resource at the college.
I loved this class! Take it!
AMAZING

Nice guy. Lectures are clear and easy to understand. I took both PSCI 238 and PSCI 244k. Exams are not hard but not easy. Just the right level. Not a tough grader and have curves on the final grade. I would definitely try to take every class he holds.

One of the best prof in UR. He assigns just the right amount of reading. His exams are not too hard but not easy either. He is really nice and helpful to every student. The lectures are very informative and fascinating. I regret everyday that I did not take the other class he taught in fall.
Really erudite professor

Primo is the perfect professor: 1) the course is a great mix of business case studies and poli sci literature; 2) regular guest lectures by Rochester alumni in business & politics; 3) Primo is a great speaker; 4) organized lectures and clear expectations for exams (which are easy); 5) Primo is always available for help; 6) he is very open-minded.
interesting class. my only wish is that we covered more. excellent professor

Phenomenal professor who really cares about his students. Prepare to study for the tests because they can be challenging, but he is very clear with his lectures and loves questions. I would love to take a class with him again.
Learned a lot, good teacher. Tests are straightforward but not completely easy if you do not study

Interesting class that will make you think. Primo is not a difficult grader, but study well for the exams. Don't expect to bend rules either (i.e. get unwarranted extensions), Primo is inflexible. I took the "W" section, and the paper assignment was about what I expected in terms of difficulty - not easy, but not crazy hard.
Articulate and knowledgable. Exams are easy, but the scale can be competitive. Keeps you updated about internship opportunities and other stuff.
Great Professor who is extremely knowledgable and helpful. Clearly explains answers in class discussions and emails anything he doesn't know. Easy exams.
This guy is hilarious. Tests and material a bit hard, but fun. Taking any of his classes is a real pleasure. He's such a funny dork.
Very hot; also great class(es); keeps interest levels high; wrote great law school recommendation for me if looking for grad school recs;

Excellent prof. Knows what hes teaching very well. I would recommend taking his pol sci class for cluster if you are not a major for it. Only wish he taught a high level class about congress.        --hes very approachable if you have trouble as well.
If you go to lecture, the class is easy. Tests and homework come straight from the notes. Primo is incredibly smart, but also there to help you. He was my favorite teacher this semester.
Primo's energy for the material he teaches is incredibly addictive. It's one of the few classes that I've never wanted to fall asleep in or question the relevance of the information im being given.
large lecture class but easy to understand if you take notes. homework and test don't come often and they are straight out of the notes.

Great guy, excellent teacher. Has turned a course that arguably could have been the most boring class I've ever taken (based on the topics) and turned it into something very interesting and easy to follow. Approachable and hard working.
He is the nicest guy you will ever meet and is a really good teacher.  Tests are fair and not too much homework.  Cute too.

Primo is amazing. After only a couple years of teaching he not only made prof of the year, but won TWO competative national awards for excellence in teaching. Everything that comes out of Primo's mouth is interesting and enlightening. Clearly he is the best professor here, and taught the best class that I will ever have the honor of taking.
Without question the best professor at the U of R. He didn't make professor of the year for nothing. He is the type of dream professor that students imagine before coming to college.

Best class I've taken and one of the best professors I've had. Primo is very organized, makes lectures interesting, doesn't assign too much homework, brings in guest speakers, and gives very fair exams.
Next to Landsburg, best professor I had at UR. Even if you only need it for a cluster or allied field, take his class.

Top notch professor! He is a wealth of knowledge and is very polite and professional. Teaches effectively and even tends to make dry material interesting. He is curteous and helpful. A bright shining star at the U of R. I cannot say enough good about him. Go Primo!
My first semester on campus was also his......I liked his teaching style...he got me interested in Poli Sci
Could use some more experience, but class was ok...just nothing great
No Comments
No Comments

Even though she is a college professor, she behaves like a high school, condescending ap teacher. I felt she rushed through slides and was quite passive-aggressive and rude at times, especially when a student tried to leave after attendance and said "don't forget to slam the door behind you" after a test. Knowles>Matson

I prefer Knowles over Matson. I felt Matson was sometimes a bit rushed and her slides didn't contain enough information. The class has so many extra credit opportunities that it doesn't really matter though. It's relatively easy to get an A.

Her lectures are easier to follow than Knowles'. But I don't like how she talks down to us like we are 5yo. She says things that rub me the wrong way sometimes. But not a hard course, lots of extra credit to get an A. Points system. EC is graded harshly but attending class gives you points. Lecture is recorded. Final is optional.

She was good for explaining some concepts of chemistry in class. Although her exams are pretty tough, there were lots of extra credit opportunities to make up for. She is decent in office hours, and I think y'all can get a good grade if y'all attend in every class and do not lost for extra credit opportunities.

Matson is an okay professor. She teaches the easier concepts in 132. Despite this, the questions she puts on tests are SUPER LONG and detail heavy, so memorizing her fixations are key to acing exams. However, this doesn't erase the fact that Matson, despite her bubbly and high school teacher vibe, is a very passive aggressive professor. Not great.

Worst class you will take freshman year. She is really passive aggressive, creates difficult tests, and chooses super inconvenient times to do attendance. She speaks at a level that shows she doesn't fully understand what she is teaching, and is kind of rude when people ask questions.

Matson made me appreciate Dr. H more. She even admitted to several of her students that her lecture slides suck. Additionally, Matson is quite an unaccommodating professor and tends to act fake in lectures. Even her exam grades in her were so bad that she almost curved the exam for the first time. Matson needs to give out more practice tests.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I thought her lectures were atleast better than Knowles. However, she is the worst. She masks her rudeness with this fake elementary school teacher vibe, and acts like the class is at fault for the low exam scores. You won't learn shit in this class. Just do all the extra credit for an A.

Matson's teaching is convoluted. Basic concepts often become confusing, leaving complex concepts impossible to understand with just her lectures. I didn't interact with her at all, but she seemed slightly condescending to us during lecture. Overall, don't expect to learn much (from her). You'll be fine if you do most or all of the extra credit.
The best teacher ever. I think I learned everything I need for chemistry in my life through this class. Definitely recommend 10/10.

Professor Matson is like if you took your favorite elementary school teacher and crossed it with a chill and helpful college professor. Those who complain she "treats us like children" are L students! Like brozo(s), you want a professor who doesn't let you get a free A for her extra credit "art projects" so you can not take the final exam? (satire)

Tests were graded very harshly, averages lower than 50% and lectures were rushed and confusing. Your grade depends on how many extra credit assignments you complete, so I learned nothing. As many others have mentioned, I felt like an elementary school student with her. I honestly don't know where I would be if not for AP Chem.

She's funny but she's a terrible teacher. She can't explain things without overcomplicating things. Grading makes no sense and her expectations are never clearly outlined. The entire class basically depends on extra credit. You can pass the class. Don't expect to learn.

As mentioned by many others, Matson treats us like elementary students. Even worse, she is not a good lecturer. She rushes through her lectures. She includes practice problems in her slides but doesn't actually do them during her lectures. She has the answer already typed out, and brushes over the process. Chem 132 was an awful experience.

Rushes through lectures and is not good at explaining challenging concepts. Treats students like children and has very obvious favorites. Overall, class is challenging and you will have to learn material on your own.

She rushes through her lectures. She is very open about her opinions on her students, and is a tough professor. The tests for this class are unnecessarily difficult but this class is point based which is nice. Matson was my least favorite professor for this class because she was not consistent with her teaching.

Prof. Matson is better than Prof. Knowles but by a little bit. She can be quite passive aggressive at times and treats us like we are in kindergarten... Her exams are so hard that test averages were never above 50%. Going to class vs. sleeping in and teaching it to myself later made no difference. Horrendous experience with chem yet again.

Class contents are very different from chem 131, and much more difficult. Extra credit can't even help even though it seems like there are a lot extra credit assignments. Had to take it as my major requirement and now I changed my major.
I think Prof Matson was the better 132 prof, but she was still very hard. Goes through lecture slides very fast, but is very helpful if you ask a question or go to office hours.

Matson started out the semester looking promising since she's super enthusiastic and has passion for what she teaches. However, her grading criteria are super harsh (gives out zeros often and doesn't give partial credit on exams under since the class was a point bucket system). She was also not accommodating and brushed away student complaints.
I freaking love her and her humor during the lecture, though CHEM 132 is problematic.

Professor Matson was an interesting professor. She started off the year strong in teaching, but as the semester went on, it seemed as she got more and more frustrated with the class. She also graded extremely tough on inforgraphics, PAC's, and exams. However, I will say, she was a very nice individual.

She did sort of belittle us sometimes and I do think its a problem that the exam averages are so low. The point based system should not be an excuse to have shitty lectures and terrible exam questions. I 100% recommend doing the infographics and PACS - they were graded super unreliably until the end of the semester, but the points still help.

Initially, I was thinking she would be a great professor, compared to Prof. R, whom she co-taught with, because I just could not understand R's lectures, but about halfway through the semester, I found it difficult to retain information from her lectures because she went incredibly fast. Rewatching her lectures helped, but it took extra time.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: She comes off as friendly at first, but don't be fooled... she is rude, does not respect students, a harsh grader on silly assignments. would not recommend. I WOULD recommend doing as many of the infographics and profile a chemists as possible bc the tests are practically impossible.

She is overall a poor professor. She goes too fast in lectures and the tests are not at all fair, nor do they accurately test your knowledge of chemistry. You'll probably get an A if you put in the effort but it requires a lot (a term project and 3 module infographics on top of tests for me). Unless CHEM132 is required for major, don't take it.

I liked Matson at first. I don't now. The grading on PAC and IG is ridiculous. The tests are insanely hard (49% and 38% averages). She is condescending, has a fake personality, and acts like poor test grades don't reflect poorly on her. I didn't go to class all semester but still got an A, focus on projects not tests.

At first, I liked Matson, she kept the class interesting in comparison to Rothberg. With this being said, she is my least favorite professor now. She treats the class like high schoolers who are far beneath her. If you scroll down on her reviews, you will see someone quoting her, and I bear witness to that exact statement she made during lecture.

Matson seems like she's gonna be a good lecturer at first, but her lectures are too fast and hard to follow. She comes off as very fake and doesn't have a good reputation (she apparently is mean to TA's). Also, everyone knows that PAC and infographics are also graded way too harshly, you have to do way too much work to get a decent grade.

Professor Matson is one of the best professors in the Chem department. With all the opportunities she gives for extra credit, her grading style is fair and if you pay attention you will do well. Also, her lectures are pretty clear and not too complicated, most students that struggle in this course do so because they don't put in the effort.

I like this grading system, I think it is actually very reasonable, but the difficulty of the exam is too hard, and the lecture assumes that you have already learned everything, and it is not very helpful. The grading of info and PAC are too subjective and the lab report's score comes out too slow.

Matson can be quoted as follows:
"so what we're doing moving forward is if students have demonstrated no effort in their infographics we will not be grading their assignments... there's no reason we should be having a less then 50% average on the exam." She is openly resentful of the students, and makes everything more difficult for no reason.
Nothing made sense honestly. I have never cried more from a class. The frustration was horrible and when I asked questions I feel like I never got a straight answer.

Probably the hardest grader I've ever had. She seems like a nice person but she'll take off points for literally everything. You can probably make it through without going to every lecture if you have taken chem in hs. I did like that she had different assignments we could choose to do for credit. And she made our quizzes optional. She was alright.

Professor Matson is a very good professor. She thoroughly teaches the topics and relates them to real-life scenarios effectively. Her grading strategy is very nice; it allows you to demonstrate how you know the material and score well in the class. Chem 132 is a hard class and she teaches it well.

She's tough and takes no disrespect from anyone, but she knows the material she teaches very well and gives interesting lectures. She cares how you are engaging with the material and wants to hear your thoughts. I found her to be kind and caring, but she also liked me. I saw her be... blunt with others. Regardless, she's a great teacher.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Gives good feedback

comment: I can't stress enough, do NOT take a class with her! She's a bully! She talks down to her students, makes them think they're a bad writer, etc just bc she doesn't personally like their story. If you want to be publicly degraded and humiliated, take a class with her! If you value your self esteem, avoid her (she's not intelligent, just opinionated).

This professor is disrespectful. Don't take her classes. If it's a requirement, find another way to satisfy the requirement. She speaks down to students as if she's superior. Her mood will change in an instant. Assignments are vague and arbitrary. She grades harshly and punishes you if you share any ideas in your paper that she doesn't agree with.

DO NOT TAKE A CLASS WITH HER! She is the worst professor I've ever had! She bullies her students, is rude, moody, cranky, and an overall terrible person! No matter how hard you work on your story, if she personally doesn't like it or agree with the ideas in it, she'll give you a terrible grade! She traumatized me and made me cry a lot. AVOID HER!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Higley's strict but I think she's fair. Her class is solid, but be careful. Put extra effort into your paper. Double-check your citations. You do NOT want to be on the receiving end of her sass. Also, you should probably email her if you're going to miss class.

Awful Professor. Will yell at you if you disagree with her in class. Gets really moody and cranky and is sometimes very insulting towards students if they don't agree with her. Overall bad experience. Wouldn't recommend.

The worst professor I have ever come across in life. She says she "sympathises with students with anxiety,.blah blah" but makes condescending and personal comments about your mental state when you go to her with your problem. I had the worst experience with her and would never want to see her again in my life let alone take a class with her.

Professor Higley is engaging and is clearly passionate about the materials taught in the class. The only thing I disliked was the way that she acted towards students, as she can sometimes be very moody and impatient with them. All in all, a very good course. I would take a class with her again just for her outstanding abilities in teaching.

She reminds me of a nice version of Meryl Streep's character in The Devil Wears Prada. She's smart, funny, and passionate about the subjects she teaches. I think some people get intimidated by her (she's sometimes a lil'bit moody, who isn't?) but if you think she's being "mean" or "rude"... you might be taking things a little too personally!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: Kind of flyaway and disorganized, but engaging and passionate about the material. Wants you to think, not regurgitate or give her what you think she wants. Values communication, very understanding, gives you slack when you need it as long as you've demonstrated that you care about the class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Amazing professor. Doesn't speak down to students, expects actual scholarship (GASP), and is genuinely concerned about each of her students as individuals. It's ridiculous to me that so many complain that she has actual expectations of them. I suspect their parents are paying, and always will be. Show up. Behave like an adult. Be a scholar.
Higley is the abject fecundity in the best way

Higley is funny and amusing, but she is also very insulting. In both of my papers she would write rude demeaning comments. I disagreed with her once in class and since that point she has consistently called my points "wrong" no matter what I argue. Her essay prompts are extremely vague. Get a different teacher.

Really enjoyed the classes I've taken with her. She is funny, passionate, eccentric, and awesome! If you tire of boring, stick-in-the-mud professors, definitely take a class with her. She can be intense, but only if you didn't do your homework, participate, or were late. If you're responsible and take college seriously, you are good.

i would suggest not taking a creative writing course with her.  very awkward to hear her call out people for 'mistakes' when the class is about CREATIVE WRITING.  comments were very disrespectful sometimes- its called CONSTRUCTIVE criticism jeez
She is a wonderful professor. Passionate, fun, knowledgeable, and her classes are creative, as she is open to suggestions of all kind.

lots of material but altogether eye-opening class.  higley's a brilliant woman with an unique personality.  get involved in class discussions.  don't come to class late.  she can be moody at times so best to learn sooner than later how to navigate that - it could be hard to recover from a bad encounter or even a moment of memorable disagreement

She is a very enthusiastic and knowledgable professor, and clearly a nice person.  However, she is very fervent about gender issues.  You don't come to it until the end of the semester, but she definitely holds a some sort of grudges.

Very good professor. Bring a "Get tough or die" approach to her courses - i.e. don't come late or unprepared, don't b.s. her, get involved in the discussions, and defend your ideas. In my class, the people who disliked her were the ones trying to just coast through the class. Then, of course, they'd accuse her of favortism. Whatever, dudes.
She's a good professor, very cooky. However, I truly believe she hates males.

Sarah Higley is one of the best professors you will ever meet. Yes, she plays favorites, but if you work hard, you won't get shafted.   She is so funny, it is not unheard of to leave class with aching sides. I miss her lots.

Although Higley is an extremely intelligent professor, it seems like she allows her personal life to interfere with her emotions often. For instance, one day she broke down crying for some reason, and wouldn't explain why. This was in addition to her regular eccentrism, which is somewhat tolerable. You also cannot show up late or even have a cold in class (I'm not joking), because it "disturbs the class". Workload: medium - heavy.

Okay prof, she's knowledgeable and you will learn something from her course.  She is engaging enough as a lecturer but plays favorites.  She is given to dramatics, and is rather childish about discussing sex, with a lot of giggling.  I didn't dislike her class but I did dislike the favoritism.
be careful of her bite, but don't let it intimidate you.
good teacher, but could improve by having clearer objectives, is set in her ways
No Comments

she's insane.  if u ever ask her to clarify an assignment she'll go into hysterics.  she's very intimidating.  the classes she teachers are awesome tho... middle welsh, brit lit, chaucer, old english.  u'll survive if u'r her favorite.
She's very flaky, but OK overall.

She is very educated and enthusiastic about the material she presents in class, and she a fair grader overall.  Also, she teaches classes that appeal to a select few, like Middle Welsh and course that translates Beowulf.
She is very fake and artificial...very enthusiastic though...Insipid discussion and shallow topics at times. Some people liked her class a lot though.

the class was far too easy. i handed in papers that woud've gotten me an F in high school and was praised. also, she goes on boring, meaningless tangents for hours. harmless enough, though, if you stay on her good side.
she is crazy, but in a good way, mostly
No Comments
Teaches interesting classes, but she's not very clear about what she wants
The midterm was hard, and many students got the test before it even started, it's unfair at all.

I greatly enjoyed Professor Luo's class. He spends more time on important parts of the course, relevant in industry. For the homework assignments the grading is fair, allowing students to focus more on preparing for the midterm. Even-though there is a lot of material, the professor always mentions what you need to remember in his lectures.

You may be intimidated by this professor in the beginning, but you will find that he is very helpful and kind. You will need to put in the time and effort to do well, especially if you come from a different academic background. Study for the exam EARLY. The final project is the best learning experience because you get to practice what you learned.

The main thing that matters most is the exam. Only the exam. You can get your homework done not that carefully, but you should be well prepared for the exam. It may cover the 80% of your final grade.
Actually the lectures are a little bit boring, but the professor requires to do the attendance in a random lecture, so it'd be better to attend.

This course could provide you with theoretical knowledge and opportunities to apply the knowledge to real-life problems you are interested in, which eventually help you master data mining skills proficiently.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Luo is very knowledgeable in the field of data mining and machine learning, and his class is definitely a very nice intro if you are interested in the subject. He uses a lot of his own research to illustrate the real application of the concepts in the book. He and his TAs are very helpful and willing to offer additional help.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: I really enjoy taking the Data Mining course and have learned a lot from the Professor. Luo and the TAs. I highly recommend anyone who is interested in Data Science/Machine Learning to take this course. You will not only just learn the concepts in theory but practice them in your own chanllenging research project!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: I really enjoy taking Prof. Luo's data mining class. Not only can I learn the concepts and techniques of data mining, but having an amazing experience of adopting the knowledge to my own research (final) project. Prof Luo really encourages his students to deep dive into the topic they are interested in and advice along the way to reach the goal!

Professor. Luo is extremely knowledgeable in his field. The exam is a little bit challenging but still you will get an A if you do well in homework and projects. You will learn a lot if you interact with him in lectures and read the assigned textbook.The final project was research oriented that may lead to potential publication!

Professor. Luo is a famous computer scientist who is extremely knowledgeable. You will learn a lot if you interact with him in lectures. The exam is a little bit hard but still you will get an A if you do well in projects and homework. The final project was research oriented and may lead to conference or journal publication!

I learned a lot from this course; not only about the data mining algorithms and techniques, but also how to conduct good research. Professor Luo is amazing and supportive. He used a lot of interesting examples to help us understand the contents. The final project is a rewarding hands-on experience, and we can learn from others during presentations.

Luo is a very knowledgeable professor. His lectures are organized and cover important data mining topics. There is a term project, which requires you to read papers and find your own research question. You will get a great understanding of the knowledge in practice. Luo provides insightful feedback and is very willing to help students. Great class!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback

comment: Prof Luo did a good job covering the important details in the data mining field through his course. The midterm was difficult but you can still get an A if you do well in projects and homework. The final project was research oriented. You may continue working with Prof Luo and produce something worth publishing if the project shows good potential.

Prof. Luo is a respectful professor. From the course, I learned many advanced Data Mining as well as Machine Learning techniques, and I could always find interesting points from the professor's explanation regarding the principles and intuition behind the data mining and machine learning techniques.

It is essential to fully understand and know the practical uses of the concepts and techniques. Midterm over 55/100 is within A range if one earns most extra credits. Final project was a rewarding experience, where Professor Luo gave inspirational comments and suggestions. He is a renowned researcher in the field and very accessible outside class.

The course is running fast but if you read the book and do the assignments you can really learn a ton! Professor Luo is smart and he has many research experiences in the field so go to his office hours and he can provide a lot of inspirational advice on your final project.

Pr. Luo is well respected and taking a class with him means you will get exposed to the cutting edge of data mining research. The course is fast paced and if you don't already know some machine learning or aren't willing to self study a lot, you might struggle. The research focus of the course wraps up into a final project that is very rewarding.

CSC440 was useful for learning data mining algorithms &concepts. HWs and midterm based on textbook and slides. Luo does not teach any programming. Before CSC440 non-CS students need to make sure to learn some Python & have some knowledge on prerequisites such as Data Structures and Algorithms. He gives extra credit. Total course grade was 114/100.

This course is full of essential and advanced algorithm and models of data mining, and the materials cover the wide-ranging content of textbook well. The most exciting thing is the final project, you can design and accomplish project as excellent as possible with your teammate, you can learn a lot from others' project too. Professor Luo is amazing
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Amazing lectures

comment: Research focused class. Enjoyed the freedom to select our own final project and work on it independently. The professor is a top scientist, he provides fantastic feedback on your research approach. Lecture wise, the professor encourages us to be independent learners, which is the right mentality to have as researchers. Overall, loved the class.

Great professor. Materials are hard and there are tons of HWs. While he is a world class researcher and obviously very busy, he always holds office hours before classes, allowing any students to come in and ask questions. Highly recommend to take his class if you are CS or DS major.

This course covers many materials, but surly it will equip you with fundamental knowledge about data manipulation and ML techniques.  It is very important  to read the book beforehand and digest the hw.  By doing the substantial final project, which could be advanced into a publication, you will have a chance to gain precious research experiences.

240 is a very challenging but very useful course to take. You will get a chance to learn many classical methods used in data mining, and you will also have a semester-long group project which can be further processed into a publication. My suggestion to get a good grade is - read topics covered before the lecture, and read the textbook before test.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: For those who are interested in AI-related topics, both CSC240440 and CSC249449 taught by him are popular courses 'not to be missed'.  Materials covered are practical and currently widely applied in industry.  In terms of your course project, he is willing to provide frontier ideas and maybe turn it into a publication.
I took his class in 2016 Fall semester. It is a very popular class and the professor covers a ton of useful knowledge in data mining. It was wonderful experience!

Prof. Luo knows his materials very well. In the class we can learn lots of classical and cutting edge vision techniques. The final project takes up a big part of the final grade, and he would like to lead these projects to publication, which will expose us to state-of-the-art techniques and beneficial for those who like to apply for grad school.
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: I didn't learn much from this class. He seems to try to turn this class into a research paper generating machine. I wish I have taken some other class instead.
This is a senior level or even graduate level class, which expects student to read more and "think" more. Professor is presenting lots of useful ideas and techniques, which are very helpful.
Friendly professor, but really helpful.

Professor Jiebo Luo is a research oriented professor who has vast knowledge in fields related to data science, machine learning, computer vision, etc. He has a clearly structured class and makes his expectations well known: the class will be difficult, and you will have to work to understand the material and achieve a good grade.
A lot of data mining techniques are introduced. And these techniques are applied to solve real problems.
The class introduces a lot of exciting ideas. The professor encourages active research and gives careful guidance.

Don't know how to teach, lectures are tedious, basically going through powerpoint. Terrible work organization.A lot of reading and homework, test was hard but without any guidance and sample tests. Basically you need to learn by yourself and the material is far from simple and easy.
Does not teach, but quickly skims textbook-style powerpoints in lecture. Hard to understand, doesn't finish thoughts/explanations.

Krauss is a boss, but his lectures are hard to follow - go too fast. His tests are VERY difficult. He is the hardest out of the CHM131 profs. However, you learn the material more in his class & wkshps are fun & hmwk is optional. He is helpful after class & in OH, very personable. I struggled b/c the material didn't interest me.

I'm not someone who enjoys chem - I took it to fulfill pre-med requirements. This class was an upward struggle for me, but Krauss was really helpful and as someone said, he makes sure you know it's your responsibility to do well. Study hard and the tests really are not that difficult, rather they're more conceptual focusing on your understanding.

I got an A so I'm not being harsh because I did poorly. This class is VERY difficult w/o AP Chem prior so don't take this class if you haven't taken AP. I only did well because I put tons of hours into the class - the lectures were good but the exams were impossible. Krauss is just a genius professor - can't do much about that. He is funny though.

AWESOME PROFESSOR! His class can be tough, but I really enjoyed it. I took AP Chem and this class was a breeze for me. Homework is assigned for your own good, but is not collected and is completely optional. I highly recommend this teacher! He cares about his students' success, but makes it clear that it is your responsibility to do well.

AWESOME CHEM PROF! I am a bio major and CHEM had become the highlight of my day. He is fun and an all around a nice guy. BONUS: He actually writes notes on the board and uses presentations occasionally. He does many examples and will answer any question you have DURING lecture. He WANTS you to go to office hours. Class is tough, but manageable.
He is funny, easy to understand and teaches all the material you need to know for the tests in a helpful and fun way. He made me go from hating chemistry to loving it!
Krauss is a great lecturer, funny and entertaining. The exams are overrated in terms of difficulty just make sure you go to the extremely helpful workshops. They will save you.

As someone who took AP chem in high-school and did well in the class, I found this class surprisingly hard to get an A in. Material in lecture and workshop is straightforward but tests are difficult. Krauss is a cool guy I just hated how hard the tests were.
Tests can be fairly challenging. Not a good choice for someone who has never taken chemistry before. I personally really did enjoy the class.

Avoid this professor. He is a nice guy and very funny, but he is not a good lecturer. His tests are difficult, much more difficult then the alternative professor Krugh. If you have the option take Krugh, you will thank me when your friends are complaining about the tests.

First, I did not take AP chem and still came out with an A- with ALOT of work. Good proff, entertaining lectures with LOTS of examples. He changes the tests every year but expect one easy test and 2 difficult tests. You can drop one. Final was reasonable. 85% is an A-. Overall, good proff, difficult class (without chem background), recommended

The class was not that challenging. If you have taken AP Chemistry class, then you would not have any problem passing the class. He gives us tons of examples to make sure we understand and gives variety of sample questions so that students understand what will be on the test.

He is so clear on his lecture, and he gives tons and tons of examples, so it really helps to go to class! He is very funny and keeps you entertained throughout the class. highly recommend take his class for chem 131

A very solid professor. He's very good at explaining stuff, and always provides plenty of examples for the material. On top of that, he's just a nice guy, and he's always ready to help you outside of class or on the online chat sessions. Extra props for his Fridays, which include a song and a few lame jokes.

Great professor!  Very funny and intelligent guy!  His exams are challenging but he really makes you "step-up" your game.  I learned so much from his course.  I took it a year ago and still remember so much from it.  Definitely recommend him! A+++++
Krauss is great! My favorite professor so far, very entertaining. Class is harder than I expected though.

Krauss was a decent lecuturer, especially considering he had a class of over 200.  The workshop format he uses, rather than recitations, works really well and makes the class much easier to understand.  The class was pretty fun for a chemistry class.

Krauss was my favorite! His lectures, while presenting quite a bit of hard material, were sometimes a blast! He really does help at his office hours, and he wants to see everyone do well! His tests are only hard if you don't study, and workshops kick arse over regular recitations. Great TA selection, great course, great professor!
Makes class interesting and somewhat entertaining.  Very helpful at office hours.
Krauss your the man. Good class, personality, helpful!
His teaching style is good and easy to understand, the concepts of his course are hard and he presents them well with lots of examples.
His tests are so cruel
Hate Krauss. He asks us to do hw online and doesn't give a damn about electronic problems we encounter.
his jokes are kind of corny, but in a cute old man kind of way; understanding concepts is much easier to learn with krauss than with olek
Very humorous!  A relaxing class!  His teaching style is easy to understand!
No Comments

His powers of explanation are incredible.  He presents the material in an extremely organized fashion and demonstrates problem solving technique so thoroughly that I found I did not need to study.  Besides that, he is an unbelievably engaging lecturer.
Fun class even though it is chemistry:)
I never wanted to miss lecture. i had so much fun in a class whose subject i hated.
Takes really boring material and makes you want to come to class to see what he'll do next.  Can make a 200 person class room seem intimate.
No Comments
fun, funny, and totally cute.
This prof really knows his stuff and is an awesome lecturer
Excellent, funny and thorough professor. The kind you wish could follow you throughout your chemistry learning experience!
Very nice and approachable professor. The material in phil103 is extremely interesting.

Fitzpatrick is one of my favorite professors and his class has sparked my interest in ethics. I really like how he fosters thinking and curiosity rather than memorization. He promotes that by requiring homework and by making tests open note. Tests and papers are graded a bit harshly but the criticism is very fair. Great class to introduce ethics.

mandatory attendence for a 9 a.m. course? no videos?
banned the use of chatgpt for everything, too old school
with midterms plus two papers
workload is too much if you take this one for cluster

He cares a lot about his students and definitely knows a lot. Very prepared. Lectures can be a hit or miss. Either very interesting or incredibly boring. Def go to class and take notes. TAs grade papers way too harsh. Textbook is so expensive so I didn't get it and I was lost half the time. Prepare for group discussions everyday.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Short homeworks and reading due before every class so you have to go to lectures. Is a tough grader but all exams are open book and open note. Overall a good and interesting class

Great professor, horrible TAs. Fought for my paper grade that my TA put in the dumps and Fitzpatrick was very supportive of my argument. 225 was more interesting to me since it had less philosophical theory to it. The examples used in class are very interesting. Would highly recommend going to his office hours to review your paper outlines.

Amazing professor and I learned a lot! You could tell he knew what he was talking about and how to convey it. He liked to hear what students had to say and you could tell he genuinely cares. Class was graded based on HW each class(v easy), open note midterm & final, and 2 papers. Make sure to go to OH for papers and use the study guides(v helpful).
rating_tags: Inspirational--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: I think he's a great professor especially if this is your first time taking a philosophy course! Class is solely graded on 5 things, 1 Midterm, 1 Final, 2 Essays, and homework (assigned for every class). It's pretty manageable, make sure to utilize all the help and make use of your time. TA's do majority of the grading, they can be a bit hash...
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Respected--Graded by few things

comment: Prof. Fitzpatrick is a knowledgeable and respectable professor. Good lecturer and well prepared for every class. There's homework assignments to submit at the begnining of each class, as attendance. Papers can be tough, depending on TA- office hours should help. The exams are fair and pretty lenient. Overall, great class with interesting topics!

I learned a lot of interesting philosophy ideas from this class. He was a really nice professor, lenient on late papers but only if you have a good reason, not too hard of a grader in my opinion and felt like he really cared about his students. The only thing I would've liked better is if we had had more open discussions in class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Graded by few things

comment: PHIL225 is an interesting class (as far as philosophy goes) and his lectures were quite engaging, but boring at times. Class is graded by two papers and one final. The open note final is really not bad. Papers are graded by TAs so it's completely up to them how your grade turns out. Would recommend putting a lot of effort into papers.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: Professor Fitzpatrick is a really great guy, he's super knowledgable about the subject and really helpful if you go to office hours. The tests are open note and really easy, and you don't need to study if you take good notes because his slides are very comprehensive. The papers were very manageable and easy to write because of the clear criteria.

Probably one of my favorite professors of all time. Professor Fitzpatrick is truly knowledgeable and passionate about his subject and will teach you a lot of things that are both useful in and outside of class. Showing up to classes is required and the workload is very manageable!

Really recommend taking this class. Grade was based on 2 papers, attendance, homework, and a final which was entirely online. Attendance is mandatory but the homework is very easy and the class is manageable. A very approachable professor and if you put the time in it's an easy A.
I loved Prof. William FitzPatrick. His lectures are very straightforward and super interesting!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Good intro philosophy course! Fitzpatrick broke down all the material really well and is very accommodating. The lectures could get boring, but was over all good. Turning in homework at the beginning of every class was used for attendance, and he doesn't record lectures. So attendance is definitely mandatory which is a little annoying.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: William is the best professor I've met so far because he is super polite, gives wonderful lecture, and a wonderful logician. I often email him for minor questions and he always responded with few paragraphs to make sure that he is clear. He is also very handsome and dress in good taste!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: One of my favorite Prof's I've had at UR. Super engaging if you sit near the front of class - more difficult if you don't because the class is so large. If you participate and build a good relationship he'll be more willing to bump your grade if you're in-between letter grades. Seems intimidating but is kind if you show you're willing to work.

Super engaging lecturer; ask good questions and sit near the front and he'll be sure to remember you. As an aside, the TA's grade all the papers and their feedback can be confusing, so be sure to contact him with any questions about topics your papers are on during office hours.
Great Professor. Lectures very interesting and he breaks down the concepts well for students. Available for communication with students and willing to assist.

He is the greatest philosophy professor I ever met! Give specific study guides for each exam and give out essay prompt a long time before it is due. As long as you give out good logic in your paper you will pass. He covered a lot of topics in his class but give out good examples to make them very easy to understand. A very good introductory course.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: Nice guy but a tough grader. Not a breeze class.

Professor Fitzpatrick recognizes that he has a monotone voice. That's why he chooses early mornings to lecture. When you're having trouble sleeping, attend one of his sluggish speaches. It'll do wonders.
Fitzpatrick was a really good lecturer - engaging and interesting. Outside of class, I relied a little more on the TA for help, because he seemed kind intimidating. #silverfox
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Fitzpatrick is interesting but not mind blowing, assigns a very easy homework assignment every class, and a little annoying about technology- no phone use or laptops in class. He will make you feel a little like you are back in high school, but is a fair enough guy. When you get past the history of philosophy, Socrates, etc, the class gets better.
Miserable class. Boring lecturer. Avoid this class.
PHL 103 is an awesome introduction to Philosophy and FitzPatrick is a great professor. Definitely take advantage of office hours and talking to him after class, you'll get a lot out of it.

My favorite professor at UR. I took 103 for fun and decided on a philosophy minor because of Fitzpatrick, and took 225 just because he was the prof. He's a fantastic lecturer and down to earth--just all around an awesome guy.

The most boring class I've ever taken in my life. He's a nice enough guy and intelligent, but he just repeated exactly what we were supposed to read the night before. The exams were kind of difficult, but I was also a freshman first semester, so I probably could have studied a bit more. Definitely not a breeze class. I fell asleep a few times.

Very clear professor. If you go to class and pay attention you will do fine in the class as he is very clear in what is important in the readings. The TAs grade the papers and tend to be a bit harsh, but he is also flexible with changing your grade if you feel it was unfair. Great professor!

Best professor I've had at U of R so far. Incredibly bright guy, makes the material and clear as possible and presents it in a logical manner. He does tend to talk for long stretches of time, but makes it very clear what the main points are and brings up a lot interesting ideas. Overall a pretty easy and super smart dude, such a great professor

Overall a wonderful professor.  In class, he tended to ramble a bit, but if you paid attention and took notes, you learned a ton.  FitzPatrick is also a really cool guy--go to his office hours and get to know him!  He loves to talk to students and share his passion for philosophy.
Stay away.  Awful class. Rambles on and made me fall asleep every single class. The TA's were way too harsh and I did not learn a single thing from the course.
He is a bit boring, but a good teacher

It's a privilege to be able to have lectures with MLS. This guy's the real deal. He's an excellent, clear lecturer that really knows every detail of what he's talking about. His projects are very relevant to the course material, and were a total success when it comes to reinforcing concepts. Also great to talk to in office hours.

Gives amazing lectures and always goes out of his way to probe for questions and answers them amazingly. By far the nicest and well-mannered professor I have ever had, very approachable. The class itself is difficult as most of the projects are pretty demanding and the tests cover a lot.
Wow, very easy! Should be taught in high school.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Sorry I'm not intelligent enough to memorize all of your readings to pass the exams.

1/3 of the questions on final NEVER appeared on his terribly written notes or textbook, 1/3 are like a randomly picked word or sentence in materials that he did not mention in lectures at all, and 1/3 are something u can only learn from past exams, not from him. Even if you can ctrl + F your brain, prepare to randomly guess 1/3 of the questions.
Poor organization of class, tries to teach you about everything in 'programming languages'. Projects are unreasonable, had a 'rubric' but never adhere to it for grading.

This class is unreasonable. I once spent 40 hours on projects and studying in one week. He literally says at the start that this class will take up all your free time. Also, extra credit isn't even considered unless he "feels" like giving you the points you earned. And his tests are literally just "did you memorize the textbook?...if not you fail.
Memorize everything from his notes and textbooks and lectures or fail the exam.

Worst Professor I have ever had. Boring mandatory lecture useless material weekly quizzes assignments big projects mandatory workshops. You either have a life or you take this class. Once you are here, you have no life just this class 24/7 or you will fail.

I don't understand how on earth this guy have 14 5 stars reviews???? Like whoever did this do you have no life? How is it okay for you that a class take up your whole week? the prof has 0 sympathy for students. I think all positive reviews he wrote him himself bc I doubt anyone would think positively about his class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: I never hated any class as much as I hate this one. I spend few hours daily doing work for this class. Quiz exams workshops assignments he doesn't care if you have life or not.  I have 4.0 GPA after 4 semesters I never struggled with classes but now I have expected grade of C+. Like what can I give 30 hours of my week for one class and I get C+ ok!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Just to warn everyone who would take this class. Be prepared! Extremely high workload, weekly quiz for unlectured material. Forced lecture attendence, and workshop participation. Complex projects that grades tough. Expect this course to take up all your spare time. He literally said this for a project.

Seriously? I got stay up until 3 in the morning to test my stupid code just because the class of almost 70 students are only given 2 machine for testing? Make me really wonder where did my CS lab fees went.

Totally agree with the previous 1.0 reviews. Be prepared for endless torture for an entire semester. Plus, he wants you to remember everything slightly related to his topics: for example, if he mentioned an example of semantic errors in C, you better know every possible case that will result in every type of error in all the languages you heard.

Expects you to memorize all of his notes and be sure to ctrl+f it anytime when it comes to taking the exam because he will randomly just ask you a question about C code's implementation which its own programmer probably would not have answered correctly.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: Awful person. The course feels like 12 credits course not 4. Quiz every week on materials that are not taught yet. Hard assignments and hard pre-assignment for each assignment mandatory useless workshops. I hate this professor his class is lots and lots of work for no obvious reason. He excepts you to have nothing in ur life except his class.

Fantastic professor, knows the material incredibly well (he wrote the textbook), and is happy to answer any kind of question, even unrelated ones. Projects and exams are very doable if you keep up with the material. The only negative about the class was the project grading criteria was not consistent across TA's, make sure you do the whole project

I don't know why this guy has so many good reviews. He made us watch pre-recorded lectures in addition to regular class hours. He refused to teach regular class in a traditional way. Each class was a Q and A session. Guess what? Students can't ask qs when they dont understand the material. 80% skipped class. 0/10. Projects were insanely hard
A well organized professor during a difficult time to stay organized. He was understanding of his students, and is very good at answering students questions. Great class with a great professor.

He's an absolute genius, and his text book is very good. Although I don't think the lectures helped me very much because the material is so complicated and extensive, I don't think anyone could teach the class better. Biggest complaint is that the projects were often very vague, which led to last minute changes and annoying regrade requests.
Super responsive to students. Very nice to everyone. Knows how to make technical topics understandable to the average student.
Hard class but really great lecturer one of the best in the department.
Very nice teacher
Amazing Professor. Made me care about a sub-field of CS I never had before.
Professor Scott's lecture is really clear, and you can learn a lot by doing his homework and reading his own book.
Best lecturer in the CS department.

The best in the department. he's won a lot of awards for his research and teaching and deserves them all. Favorite class i've taken When he goes 'off topic' you can see just how good of a lecturer he is.
Great professor, very engaging, has a sense of humor.
One of the most inspirational and amazing teachers I have ever had. I wish he had his lectures online so I could rewatch them!
Great guy. Super clear, goes out of his way to help, and very straightforward with policy and expectations.

Professor Scott is an amazing teacher.  His lectures cover great depth and explain everything so clearly.  His textbook is the best I've ever read, it is very easy to follow and absolutely PACKED with info and insight.  Best professor I've ever had.

Fantastic and enthusiastic professor. Always speaks lucidly and answers questions effectively. Makes the most uninteresting material interesting. His projects are tough, but his tests are very fair, bordering on easy (if you actually study).
Best professor ever. Pretty dorky, but very clear. Projects are hard but fit well with the classes, and he has great TAs.

We were behind in the first two months. But then he made less errors and got ahead of the other classes. His class is the calmest & simplest. Pick him if you're good at Calc BC concepts, pick a diff prof. if you want to learn the most. Responds very fast to emails + sometimes does hard HW probs in class. Confused in lecture? Ask questions then lol

Doug was an alright professor when he taught integration. However, his class lectures on polar coordinates, parametric equations, and series were often confusing because he would skip some important information on those topics. He did go over many examples for those three topics, but never really explained his process clearly. Get a tutor for 162.

Nice guy and very smart, just one of those people who just cannot teach and should not teach math. His lectures are very confusing and rather than teaching how to work through problems he just does them with little to no coherent explanation. His lectures are similar. Do not take him if you are poor in math.

Awful. Bad lectures. Doesn't know what's going on. Learned everything on my own. Gave our class 20 mins less time on 1st midterm. Whole calc department awful. No one willing to give points back on exams. Graders are so tough. Go to rec and do all webwork to boost grade and you might survive. Never taking a math course at U of R again.

Doug's lectures range from pretty boring to very interesting. He uses a lot of real life examples which many math professors at this university don't seem to do. However, he is very constantly making computational errors which slows down the lectures a lot. Also, I'm often leaving lectures not really feeling confident I learned very much.

Doug is nice and starts lecture by showing famous mathematicians' contributions. He's not great at explaining concepts. He teaches by running through example problems which is only sometimes helpful. He's often out of touch with what's on homework, which tends to be harder than tests. Use previous tests to study as questions are recirculated.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Doug isn't the greatest teacher and has a hard time explaining concepts, he just does a bunch of examples and hopes the students understand. However, he is a caring person who is very funny. For the tests, just use the practice tests, as the tests are very similar year to year. Don't procrastinate WebWork!!!

Doug tells math history stories before every lecture, the highlight of my day. Do the practice tests online; they basically mimic the actual tests and don't cheat your webwork since it's the only homework you get assigned. He's very approachable during office hours and loves to chat with students.

Not a big fan of his teaching. He tries to make class engaging by talking about a random math fact every class, but it got pretty boring. In fact I skipped his lectures altogether and simply just followed the textbook content to self-study. I would recommend choosing the other 162 profs such as Charles Wolf or Bogdan Krstic.

His way of teaching is working through example problems to show you the different techniques. This makes it hard to organise the content as you don't always know what technique he's covering. So, I had to use the textbook to know what exactly was being covered and make additional notes after lectures. He's not the best lecturer but you'll be fine.

Arguably the worst math lecturer I've ever had! He starts every lecture rambling about a non-math tangentially related topic, and then fails to cover relevant parts of the course. Teaches poorly, and though the exams are what I expected, the lack of proper teaching and his nonsense exam curve made the class overly frustrating. Take it with Wolf.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Starts every lecture with an unrelated story and always connects himself at the end. Has a pretty big ego. Lectures make no sense and he jumps right into applications without explaining concepts. His favorite thing to do is start a very complex problem in class and make mistakes solving it, only to say "you can figure that out". DO NOT TAKE RAVENEL

In the first part of the course (integration). His lectures helped but afterwards you need to look at other resources to understand everything. He is a bit slow in my opinion and does not explain everything included in exams. His exams are extremely difficult, but they have great curves. You can get 80ish on every exam and still get an A.

Calc II sucks, he's useful until sequences and series. After that, just watch Khan academy and patrick jmt. Starts every lecture with a story relating to that day's topic, which I liked but others didn't. Other students were pretty noisy, and lectures aren't recorded. Notes are posted but good luck deciphering them. Hit or miss mostly, but fine.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Worst ever professor. Not interested in teaching. Makes easy tests. I don't understand the purpose of his class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Doug is fantastic. Class time is structured with an eye towards applications, hitting on just how the major concepts are useful in (mathematical) practice at a high level. More technical/detailed aspects are left for homework. He's also a sweet guy, and peppers lectures with awesome stories and fun tidbits of information.

I highly recommend his class. The stories he tells are amazing and very funny, but they all have to do with math, in one way or another. He does lectures on his Surface Laptop so his handwriting isnt the best, but if you go to class and see the notes he post later, you can understand it. He loves participation, dont leave him hanging. GREAT PROF

Loves to start class with his stories but will jump right into calculus. If you ask for clarification in class, he will elaborate. Posts notes online , but his handwriting is atrocious. Tests are hard, but there is a generous curve at the end. Go to recitations and do the quizzes. Everyone can get at least a B+ if you're dedicated.

Prof. Ravenel gives very interesting lectures, but he won't go very deep into proof. He have lots of stories to share before classes. He is also very approachable and nice during his office hour. But tests are somehow challenging, so you need to work harder!!

I LOVE HIM!! Best math professor I've ever had. He explains everything really well and all his notes are online. Always available for office hours. He has a bunch of great stories he shares at the beginning of every class. Coolest guy I've ever met. AND! He has a cute dog he takes to class every day :)

He's very nice and understanding. Lecture math classes just overall suck and his tests and homework can be very difficult but he's an overall nice guy. The homework requires some outside help and is accompanied by frustration but he's easy to talk to during office hours and is very approachable.
GOOD
Dougie Ravs is a straight baller. HE has massive curves which counteracts the difficult tests. His stories are legendary.

Really difficult class. Ravenel was the best out of the 3 MTH162 professors this semester though. ADHD though - is always bolted back and forth across the room when explaining something. Usually starts lectures off with a short story - sometimes they are math related, and sometimes they are so random you can't help but laugh.
