Okay at explaining things, but tests are very difficult. Also, dont listen to him when he says he is a lenient grader, he isn't! Also makes a lot of mistake while working on examples in class and rarely fixes them. Not the best professor you could have, but I guess not the worst either.
He tells fun stories before every lecture. LOVE!

He's pretty good, he always opens class with a historical/funny anecdote about math. His teaching style is fairly clear and if you're unsure of something he's usually ok with going back and explaining it again. He puts his full lectures online (he has a touch screen computer that he writes his lecture notes on). He makes his exams super hard though

A pretty quirky professor. He always starts lectures with some other interest (astronomy, math history, etc) and paces a lot. All lecture notes were posted online. Tests were pretty hard and had low averages, but they were always curved. If you work hard, do the Webwork, read the textbook, and do the optional textbook problems, you can get an A.

Brilliant guy who has a lot of interests, including astronomy, math history, and so on, that he sometimes talks about in class.  Lectures go at a good pace (speaking of which, he paces around a lot).  TONS of homework but exams are easy.  He is a little disorganized at times.
He was alright. His lectures are better than most other math professors. But he's not easy. His test medians are usually a failing grade, so you actually have to study to do well.
Prof. Ravenel gives interesting and clear lectures. Seemed intimidating at first, but proved super helpful and friendly.
Good teacher, easy to understand in lecture.  Only need text for extra problems, none of those are ever turned in though.  I liked him a lot

Had interesting lectures but made them bearable to follow and pay attention. The course itself is hard and test make up most of the grading. But the professor was very helpful if one had a question and was always willing to help. Reading the textbook from the start makes the class much easier to follow.
His lecture style was a little disorganized and boring, and he mostly teaches to the textbook. Very understanding with missed due dates. Posts lecture notes online which is extremely useful.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things--Online Savvy

comment: He is very respected and knowledgable in math, but his lectures are pretty monotone, he just reads right off of the textbook. Real Anaylsis is a difficult class and many examples are needed which he doesn't give a lot of. Also there isn't any guidance on how to review for midterm/final. In class he isn't great, but in office hours, he is super help
The syllabus with 8-9 chapters of content, comes with 13 chapters, tests involved in derivation, and proofs.

Professor Mueller had an uncanny style of teaching. His hand-writing ability was fine, but, he often explained what he was writing poorly. I found that it was sometimes extremely hard to understand the lecture he was lecturing. For exams, I had to watch "The Organic Chemistry Tutor" a lot. I tended to use his notes as a backup option for studying.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: His lecture is kind of fast, and I think reading the textbook is more helpful. His exam is extremely tough.

Definitely a brilliant guy, but not good at explaining things. Sometimes I just want the formulas, in which that's all his lectures are good for. Beats around the bush a lot trying to explain stuff, and gets time for 2 examples per lecture that don't help with the homework. Class is slow at times.

Professor Carl is def a good guy, patient, approachable. HOWEVER, homework wouldn't help at all tbh. they are completely different from exams. his exams can be really hard, and i personally found it more helpful to read the book to prep.
I took mth 201 this semester and he was pretty easy to reach out to. His exams can be hard, but he has a good curve. This course contains a lot of statistics contents.

Written HWs and Exams are not remotely similar in level of difficulty to anything covered in class (or in previous sections of the same class by different profs...). He's a good guy who's available, but if the class is going to be this hard, there needs to be better preparation.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Tough grader

comment: He discussed EXTREMLY easy examples in class, but give us EXTREMLY HARD exams and written homework assignments. It is rediculous. MTH201 is not actually hard, but the prof is making the course extremly difficult. For class just reading books and rewrite examples in book and lectures are not perfectly structural. Massive and hard. I regret to take.
He's an amazing professor who is truly smart and dedicated. You'll learn a lot from him. Also, he'll make sure you work to understand every smallest detail, which I find really helpful in long terms.
Such an amazing professor. AMAZING

Awful professor, brilliant mathematician. Genuinely sucks at explaining concepts, mostly because he spends his time proving hand-wavey theorems and corollaries that will never be of any use to people who are taking this class as a requirement. Hell, even math majors get scared off from his teaching style. Nice guy, but that's about all I can say.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Terrible professor. Does too many proofs and not enough examples. Over complicates everything.

Dry lecturer. He ends up proving random things on the board without really giving a good explanation as to why he's doing it. The only times I've followed an entire lecture without getting lost are when I read the chapter beforehand. The best way to get ready for the exams is to do the practice exams. Read the textbook for conceptual understanding.

Carl Mueller is a nice guy however a poor lecturer. Organization of notes on a blackboard can me mediocre at best. His voice will put you to sleep and his examples for theorems are poorly explained. I suggest not taking this professor if you striving to get an A in what is considered a hard class.

The class is what it is, but Prof. Mueller is a very poor lecturer. He mostly just rewrote the examples in the book. I felt uncomfortable in his class, and by the end of the semester most students had either stopped attending or had switched sections.  MTH201 is not easy and gets hard fast. Find a TA.

Hated this class--made me change my major. He jumps around teaching different concepts without spending much time on them/introducing them. Many times we wouldn't even know what he was talking about until someone asked why it would be useful. Expect weekly proofs and webworks. Go to office hours EARLY ON. If you ask for help, he will help.

Lectures can be a little confusing as he just writes in little corners where there is some free space so definitely confusing to follow him. Depends on your learning style but I found it wasn't worth my time to go to class. Really nice guy, and wants students to succeed. However, homeworks, WebWorks, and tests all seemed unrelated.

Honestly his class was awful and I had to drop it because I didn't understand anything, and I got an A in 141. He is so unclear with his explanations that I had to attempt to teach myself everything outside of class. Avoid him if possible.
Genuinely nice guy who has an interest in teaching to the best of his ability. Very knowledgable
Can get confusing at times, but has an interest in helping his students understand the material
so annoying as a professor. cleans board weird
Super friendly and helpful. Lectures were slightly dry but thorough. His subtle and lighthearted sense of humor and his calling on people at random made class enjoyable.
He looks like the Green Goblin from Spiderman! A nice guy but not extremely clear when explaining things. Gets very excited for his special problem things. Could have been better.
Excellent teacher- one of the best math profs.
Very nice and helpful, but class is dull and drags on. He calls on people without warning, which I hate. He also has a habit of not bothering to do harder problems saying "they're too much trouble."
One of the most clever profs I've had.  But subtle. Jokes only caught up to me 3 or 4 days later.  But this material I learned more thoroughly than in any other class.
Doesn't explain challenging problems in class which is harmful especially when tests and homeworks are harder.
He wears the same sweater everyday! His class is boring and confusing, but he is a nice guy, and wants to help his students.

REALLY likes math. Bores me to death but he insists on everyone participating, even if no one knows the answers. Class seems to drag on and on, but he is really nice & wants everyone to do well. Has a math sense-of-humor; very dorky. And Birkenstocks..

She is not a terrible professor, but there are definitely easier stats courses you can take as a requirement. The problem I had with the course was how she pretty much only covers the theory. It is easy for her to understand but definitely not the average student. The exams take up 85% so you are cooked if you mess up once. Avoid if possible.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Test heavy

comment: The material is not that difficult, but Yildiz makes it very confusing. It is really hard to understand her and her slides. My advice, read the textbook and do practice problems. Class alone is not sufficient. Yildiz is very nice and approachable. She is super willing to help in office hours, but it doesn't help too much. Annoying, but doable.
A tragic course that represents economics terribly!

Worsts lecturer I've ever seen. What she puts on the slides, no one can understand it if you are learning the material for the first time. When she talks, she starts off by starting a sentence. Midway, she goes on a tangent, stutters, and ends on a completely different one. No way to understand what she is saying. Get ready to teach yourself.

Professor Yildiz, while clearly a good person who wants nothing but the best for her students (hence a rating of 2 instead of 1), is a terrible communicator. ECON 230 is not supposed to be a particularly hard class, but she makes fairly straightforward concepts look like rocket science. It is extremely hard to keep up.
Worst class and teacher. Avoid
Very disorganized, does not go over questions and just posts answers online. Materials on the tests are also very different from the materials taught in class.

The content of the course is easy but she always overcomplicates or under explains things. She was so disorganized, consistently showing up 5-10 minutes late for class and exams. She did a terrible job of letting us know what material would be covered on tests. We had a homework due every week on a different random day each week. Horrible professor

OMG, she is the worst instructor I have ever met. She conveys no useful information in her class, and would skip class for fixing her car. No slides, if there is any, it is almost copy paste from wikipedia. She can never clarify her points, the only thing she does is confuse you, making you even forget about what you have learned before her class.

She is a really sweet and nice person and a good researcher as well. However, she cannot teach or explain things at all. TBH, she is the worst instructor I have ever met in my entire academic life. I would love to go to the bar and hang out with her because of her nice personality. But She definitely CANNOT teach.
Lovely lady, but tied for worst prof I have had.
The test is not the same thing she taught

She is a funny person. But the lecture is weak. It's hard to understand the slide if you haven't already been exposed to the materials before. If you would take some extra time to read the textbook, then the course is not that hard.

She's a really nice person and she will help you if you need it. And her exams are really easy so if you study you're good. And the textbook is more useful than she claims. Her lecturing is weak but everything else makes up for it.

This is such an interesting class. The students who got A in the exam were the ones that never come to her class, and they were all math majors. Her exam never included what she taught in class. Some of the students even say her class was some kind of like STAT 101!
It is hard to read her handwriting on the board. Worst class ever...

I am now taking the class and I have no idea what her tests will be. She gave us practice exam questions which even primary students could do. But her test is very different from the practice exam questions.
Worst teacher I've ever had.
Useful class. She is fairly clear if you have the book. The material is very technical and abstract, but that's the point of the course.
Pure useless class.
She is a nice person but very bad in teaching and testing
No comments.

Horrible. She doesnt care about teaching or the students. First 10-15 minutes of every lecture she talked about her memories of a trip and always complained about not having enough time. She rushed through the most important topics and in most sessions she had no idea of what she is talking about. Exams are tough and not related to the material.
Not a good prof at all. Not qualified for an introductory course. Apparently good in research but from my experience very bad in explaining

I waited for ECON484 course to start and then submit my rating to see whether I learned enough material. Let me tell you, it was one of the worst. I have no idea what she covered even tough I got a relatively good grade. I am clueless here. The prof tell us that she was supposed to cover these topics. Personality and knowledge-wise she is the worst
She doesn't follow the textbook and jumps around the material. Her mid-term and final were totally irrelevant to the material covered. Avoid taking her if you can.

Sitting in her lectures and listening to what she is saying is like an insult to the Econ field. She doesn't use any of the references, her lectures are super confusing, she forgets the proofs constantly and makes abysmal mistakes which she either never corrects or in future lectures reminds u of them, and her exams are crazy tough. The worst prof.

While she was a very nice person, I felt that she was a horrible teacher, and was also very disorganized. For our two exams, she did not give us a list of topics until the last minute, and did not even take the time to do a review session for us. I hope I never get a professor as apathetic about teaching as her.
She is extremely funny. Uses examples from the textbook, and beyond. Tries helping students in her office hours.
One of the worst teachers I have ever had in my entire life. INever knew it was possible to be that bad at explaining concepts
No Comments

She is extremely smart, but not the greatest teacher. She spent a lot of time deriving formulas, and it was very hard to understand her point. It was not a easy class to follow, even though the concepts were very easy. I attended every class and still struggled because she just didn't teach the material well.

This prof made a class, which should have been easy, extremely difficult with her teaching style. Class time was useless: she spent vast majority of lecture deriving functions, and then would test on function's applications. Constantly contradicted required textbook with her own definitions. Very unhelpful during office hours. Avoid at all costs.
Prof. Perucchio is absolutely amazing to me his class was a really fun intro to engineering. The projects were interesting and his lectures were not at all ambiguous.
Great guy but often goes over time for lectures and content is very repetitive

Professor Perucchio is passionate about his 'Engineering of Bridges' class but was harsh when grading the group presentations for my final project. His TAs were very helpful though for the homeworks!!!
rating_tags: Group projects--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Perruchio is clearly very passionate and knowledgeable; however, he often doesn't express exactly what he wanted in projects and his “time management” is poor.
Teaches things very clearly and makes it easy to understand. He will 100% go 5-10 minutes over time though after lectures.
Do not schedule something right after class, he will always go over the time allotted for lecture.
He is very passionate about what he teaches and the energy is contagious. Great professor. "Very fundamental!"

Perucchio was one of the most passionate professors I had as a first-year. He was relatively understanding and wanted his students to succeed. GO TO RECITATION. I learned most of the class through recitation and found that lectures were easier to follow after going to recitation. Be prepared to do important group projects. Utilize office hours.

Very good professor that makes the material fun and interesting to learn. Material is hard to understand at first because it is new and unique but can be learned quickly will little practice. Recitation are very helpful if payed attention to and the homework are only long because the material has to be taught first. The projects are kinda hard.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: He teaches forces, vectors, and equilibrium stuff from the ground up. If you've taken physics before, the class should be pretty easy. Homework is relatively light for most of the semester, but the last two weeks are a GRIND. We had a homework, a project, a presentation, and an exam all within five days.

A bit overrated. His homework dates are very generous. Lectures can be insightful but often boring, there was once a lecture when he spent time drawing out an entire excel table. Practice exams are old and didn't feel representative of what the actual exams were. Recitations and TAs are the MVPs of this course. And he's a good and patient person.

He seems nice, but the grading scale is not forgiving at all and he is very harsh and blunt if you dont know something. Most of the time he won't criticize you for not knowing things directly, but he will ask you many question that you cannot answer to make yourself look stupid. He gives no extra credit either and is very harsh when you appeal him
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Amazing professor. You can tell that Perucchio has a passion for mechanical engineering. The lectures were boring, but applying the concepts from his class was fun in workshops, homework, and group projects. Beware that Perucchio gets scary during the third project.
Interesting guy. Lecture can be a bit boring but overall good.

Great intro to ME. Lectures can feel slow, but only because he explains everything in great detail and will take as long as it takes to answer a question fully. He's a great personality and really cares about each student. Workload is totally manageable and there are plenty of resources to get help if you need. Don't buy the textbook (ME104).

Professor Perucchio is a great lecturer and fully applies the lectures. As Chair of the ME Department, Perucchio's class is a great base for entering the ME track. His class is a decent and fair amount of work but the projects and group work is fun and knowledgeable. A must take for ME.

Professor Perucchio is a very caring teacher and is willing to answer questions if you have them. He is very passionate about engineering as a whole and architecture as well (including bridges). His lectures are a bit dry, but going to office hours with the TA is very enlightening. As long as you know the process, the class won't be too difficult.

I don't have the space to say everything I want to, but, for context, I received a 4 on the AP Physics C: Mechanics exam. Now, listen carefully: for the love of god, don't take this class if you have had *any* physics experience; you will be punished for it. The grading method for this class is beyond asinine and I can't understate my hatred for it
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Very passionate about his work and what he is teaching in class. Kind yet straightforward when talking one-on-one. While he is fairly good at explaining concepts, his greatest strength is attracting and finding the most competent, knowledgeable, and helpful TAs who show you how solve problems on homework and exams. Taking ME104 helps with ME120.
Great introduction to mechanical engineering
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Dude's great. Be prepared to get blindsided by the amount of work the first project is, but from there it's an easy A as long as you do your work and go to lectures. The lectures are sometimes confusing because of their fast pace but overall Perucchio is engaging and helpful and I would recommend taking his class if possible.

"Are you with me on this guys?" - Professor Perucchio can give in depth lectures in engineering, and paying attention is a must, because if you are not "with him," you lose track of variables and ideas. Not so good at explaining when asked a question. You may have more questions afterward. All in all, he is a solid choice, TAs are helpful, etc.
DONT BUY THE TEXTBOOK. Amazing professor, very very passionate. Make sure you find a group of four students asap because you dont want to be stuck working with someone who doesnt care.

Professor Perucchio was extremely helpful as he would explain any question you had with as much effort. He does sometimes get lost in what he does as he is very passionate about it but he definitely teaches all the material that is needed.

Great professor. Lectures can sometimes get boring because he drones on and on, but I still found the material very interesting. His TA's are fantastic and are great resources for help. He's more than willing to explain concepts and help if you go to his office hours. One of the most passionate professors. Very tough on the final project

Do some preview before you go to class. Answer his questions and go to lectures. Although his homework and projects will cover almost everything you need for the exam, his lecture will give you some very very interesting and helpful info. Enjoy.

Be warned: although this man looks like an adorable old Italian man with a strange obsession with strange hats, this cat's got claws. The homework was really hard, but he picks good TA's for the class, so you can usually just do it during office hours with their help. Also, he gets scary during the final project.
Awesome professor, great class. Really sparked my interest in Mech E.

He's a really great guy, with a deep passion for the subject. Really comes through for each student (more so than any other I had this term); as an example, he attended a play in which one of his students was acting. Office hours are very helpful. Don't be afraid to go to them. Highly suggest anything he teaches.

He's really passionate about whate he teaches and really wants every1 to do well. he tries to make ppl pass with higher grades when possible.  unfortunately for him, he's teaching a boring subject. the lectures tend to put atleast 5 students to sleep.

Perucchio and his stereotypical Italian accent are great.  He was always excited about the class and did his best to make it interesting.  Unfortunately, many times his lectures would put half the class to sleep.  Other than the occasional boring lecture, Perucchio did a good job teaching the basics of ME.

Perucchio is a complex professor. For several lectures, he is interesting and the the point. For several others, he repeats the same information over and over and over. This accent is a HUGE plus, and his trademark slogans ('Is everyone witth me on this?') almost put you to sleep. Good TA selection and the course is a blast...you'll remember him!

Prof. Perucchio is very passionate about the topics in class.  He knows what he's talking about and makes sure to ask if everyone is clear on new concepts.  There are 4 group projects throughout the semester that can be a little hectic to complete, but none of the homework or tests are unfair.  You get to play with "KiNex!"
Great teacher! Spends extra time to make sure everyone understands and presents the material in a clear, concise manner. 104Q was my favorite course at college so far, mostly because he taught it.
No Comments
such a cool guy. so interested in what he does and making you understand it. all around great teacher.

Cares immensely about student wellbeing and understanding of material. Fair and thoughtful. Interesting guy, too (and his Italian accent will keep you at least mildly interested no matter the lecture topic). I've TAed for him, so I speak from experience.

I've had Prof Eickbush for two semesters now (110+111). He is the BEST first-year bio professor out there. If you can get into his class, DO SO, you won't regret it. It isn't easy, but it also isn't impossible. If you go to lectures, study groups, and workshops, you will be prepared.

Prof. Eickbush has been one of the best professors Ive ever had. He is very passionate about biology and also wants you to be. This is simply the best choice for the introductory Bio course. Highly recommended for people that consider not having a really strong background in Biology. DONT just memorize everything, it wont work. Go to classs!!!!!

Wanted very specific answers on exams. Was kind of rude in class, especially if no one was answering his questions. Had a TA count the amount of people in lecture, if it was under a certain amount he would give a quiz. Amazing lecturer, but thats about it.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Dr. Eickbush is one of the best professors I've had. He can be intimidating sometimes, but nice at the same time. He really wants you to understand the material and will do whatever so you understand. He really knows what he's doing and can answer any question that is not chemistry related (he has a profound dislike towards the chem department).
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures

comment: Eickbush really wants you to do well and is very accessible. Concept based, not really memorization.

Dr. Eickbush is a decent prof, and is definitely the better option for Bio 110. There will never be anything on the exams that he did not mention in lecture. Textbook use is optional, it's more important that you listen to what he says in class. Oh yea, and make sure you actually go to every lecture, because he gives pop quizzes
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: He is passionate about biology and wishes his student to feel the same way. His class is NOT based on memorizing terms and then throwing up all your knowledge on an exam; you must understand bio conceptually. Although he is intimidating at the beginning, he IS willing to help. Book seriously helps. Honestly, Great Prof! Lecture Slides important!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Amazing lectures

comment: Doesn't have practice exams, and the recitation questions do not reflect the difficulty for real exams. His grading cateria is so weird that you can't get full credit even if you know the concept really well.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Do not take if you are looking for an easy way out. This man is very passionate about Biology and does not like to see his students just focus on getting the information they need for the exams. He really wants you to learn. His lectures were very interesting. Eickbush is really willing to help students, you just have to ask for the help.

He focuses too much on the application of methods rather than the key principles of biology. His course literally jumped around from one body system to the cell cycle and then to photosynthesis. His tests are poorly worded, and the homeworks are a joke. Don't buy a textbook because he tests really broad concepts. Powerpoints were the most helpful.
He is a great professor and he made me want to major in biology!
Helpful professor and tests that are fair.

I had never met a professor more rude than him. When I asked him for help he was obnoxious and rude. No doubt he is smart but he is condescending and therefore won't understand why you might struggle a bit in his course.

Test is more comprehensive. You have to understand the course material as well as the textbook to do well on the test. There no guarantee that the test questions are parts of lecture notes or textbook.

Dr. Eickbush is one of the best professors at UofR. His power-points are clear and helpful for the exam. The exams aren't that difficult as long as you attend the lectures. Most of the questions on the exam are from his lectures, only a few from the book. He is friendly, not intimidating. Overall, even though I don't like Bio, I liked his class.

Dr. Eickbush is one of the best bio profs at the U of R. Although he's exams are pretty tough, he gives a generous curve. He is clear and loves what he studies and is willing to explain things if you don't understand. I would definitely take another course with him. It will be tough but if you dedicate yourself, you will do just fine.

I know from others that some dispise Eikbush because he seems condescending but I honestly think he's such a great professor. Having taken 3 years of Bio (including AP Bio) I can assure you it's not like your typical Bio where you memorize. He really makes you think and you will struggle with some material but that helped me learn! :) Inspirational

If you are one of those people that is looking for a professor that will utterly repulsed by your existence and who's most typical behavior is belittling students for asking standard questions that Professor Eickbush finds beneath him then take this class. If you are looking for someone who actually wants to teach you, look ANYWHERE else.

One of the best professor in Bio department. He is extremely clear and organized, and he really emphasizes the importance of the experiment. Workshop is all about experiments and a lot of questions  on the exam are about experiments. No homework for the class. The exam is hard, but there will be a curve.
Gives "pop" quizzes practically every class, and you don't get any credit if your answer is correct but not phrased exactly how he wants.

I never took AP Bio or Chem in high school so I am having a very hard time doing well in this class. He excepts us to know a lot more than most of us do. It is his first time teaching BIO110 and it seems more like an upper level bio-chem class than intro bio. He is very unapproachable and will shun you for not knowing an answer to a question.

His tests are so hard. So much synthesis. Don't just memorize, you need to be able to apply the info to experiments and know examples of things. Lots of graphing. Workshops are more material you need to know not practice questions and what not. Very hard class. Do the reading 47 times

Eickbush is a great and occasionally cracks jokes. His lectures are very thorough and he does a good job of presenting the material. This is his first year teaching 110, and I feel like he expects us to know bio, as he usually teaches upper bio levels. Tests and workshops very hard. He focuses on experiments which make it hard, but generous curves.

Amazing class, great professor. He truly cares about the subject and the students. Runs the recitations himself. Really wants you to think and engage with the material. The class gave me a whole new perspective on how the genome evolved.

Fantastic professor! I loved the way that he taught BIO 206. He really enjoys teaching the material and gets very much into some of the arguments that he makes. He likes to see that we are all understanding the material as well. I would have loved to have been able to take another class with him. He makes sure everyone is understanding the material
I highly recommend taking his class. Very good lecturer.
Professor is extremely clear and  articulate.  He seems to really care about his students.  The class is quite easy.  Take this class not BIO 198.

The most interesting biology class at the U of R. Really teaches you how to read sceintific papers and analyze them. Papers are on the brink of genetic advancement and understanding. I would love to take a continuation of this class. Eickbush is tough, but very fair and subtly funny (espeically to the smarter folk in class). A+ rating!
Great Class
Possibly the most intelligent person in the biology department. Is clear with course work and takes a personal interest in the class, running the recitations himself. One of my favorite classes.
No Comments

HW not too hard but takes a long time to finish so get started early. Sometimes lenient with extensions, mostly not. Wants students to understand/enjoy the content, but can move too quickly through lectures. Attendance not mandatory, but since the unmarked lecture slides are posted on Blackboard instead of the annotated ones, u should go to class.

I don't really understand why wouldn't she post the lecture notes, she should be aware of students are having a hard time following. No computer or phone is allowed, means we handwrite everything. She goes through slides so fast, a full page of solution and she only showed for a minute. But gives extra credit, and  is a nice person.

Lectures are unorganized and confusing. She does not post the answers to solutions on slides, which is a problem because even if you attend class she speeds through them before you can finish writing. Labs and HW are just busywork and not very helpful. After chapter 5 everything went downhill. If you can take anyone else, please do.

She treats everyone as if they are elementary students. Has an absolutely inflated ego and assigns a ridiculous amount of busywork. Multiple weekly labs and homework with letter parts going to p or q for each. Probably a good 12 hours the week before finals. Only explanations are zero awareness, purposeful overloading, or compensating for herself.

She's very organized on the surface but her lectures are really difficult to follow. Like don't get me wrong - she definitely cares. If YOU have to take this class then I'd recommend you spend time organizing the concepts and use cases on your own. In retrospect this class could've been a cheat sheet.

She was nice and engaging lecturer. Gotta go to class tho cause she don't post notes. Her slides were kinda disorganized but understandable. Ngl so much tedious work tho if ur taking other harder classes too (weekly mandatory labs, long hw)

its not too hard to understand her, the hard part is trying to decipher what she is trying to say because she tends to say something wrong, correct it, then correct it again, then go back to the second thing she said. no recorded lectures, no work notes posted but says attendance is not mandatory. do not take her if you don't know stats before
Not a difficult class. Professor is patient to teach everything.

A very caring person and a fine lecturer. She is understanding and will give extensions if you need one. Her tests are not too hard if you review lecture notes and do the past exams. Homeworks can be a bit difficult, but the TAs are helpful. She is great at answering questions and getting to know each student in the class. Attendance is important.
She just yaps and yaps. Whole lot of nothing being said. Atleast its easy content, and she does give bonus points.

She is nice and always answer your questions in Officehour(she didnot work during the non oh time so go to ask questions directly). You can even check all the HWanswer with her, and she will help u if u have questions. The most problems are this lecture is not hard but seems rly difficult, you just need to remember how to do question is enough!

Lecture heavy and she won't put answers (for practice problems) on the slides in order to "encourage attendance". Pestered us for attendance so we could get an "attendance point" that didn't end up happening. Very accessible outside of class and willing to answer questions. Lots of homework (around 6) and a final project. The labs are easy.
Pretty accessible outside of class, lectures are okay not that fun to sit through
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment:
- If you attend class, you can get her full slides. It's not a big deal
- Between her own and TA office hours, there are hours every single day 
- She does answer questions via email
- Her lectures are interesting and stay on topic
- I had to study a TON for tests

I've never taken a stat class before, and I've learned a lot! I recommend her class.
Her lecture is so good

The biggest thing is that she doesn't post the examples from the lecture slides which makes it difficult to review materials outside of class. Homeworks are graded pretty strictly and she often rambles/gets off topic during lectures.

Very tough grader, and makes her self inaccessible. Refuses to answer questions through email and will only answer questions during her limited office hours. Does not teach the class, just flips through a slide show and expects us to immediately comprehend the information as she quickly skips. Not allowing students to access class notes after class
Her notes are so good. Take the course if you have experience of math 201 and math 203, then it would be great experience

Very condescending to students, talks down to most of the students as if we are in elementary school. Consistently complains about how nobody talks to her, but makes herself very unapproachable by essentially fighting back if you have any questions. Her lectures just become her rambling then asking us to participate. Tests are their own content.
Says a whole lot of nothing with how much she says, must have been a lawyer in her past life but she is friendly...
Explained concepts well and criteria were very well outlined. Pretty easy to get an A.

she puts a lot of effort into teaching, but self-study is still more effective. Attendance is mandatory, and tough grading for homework. It's suitable for individuals who enjoy doing extra work to take on.
She is the best stat prof that I ever met!! Some hard work but it will be worth it

She was very sweet and tries her best to help her students. However, lectures often go off topic, and notes are sometimes unclear. Exams are way too easy which makes it hard to justify studying hard for this class.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: STAT 216 -Very knowledgeable, very competent professor, but the course structure is very annoying. Feels very rushed at times. Kind of feels like information is thrown at you. HW is graded very harshly, feels like you have to be a mind reader for full points.  Not too hard though, and the material is very useful. Also gives bonus points.

I am a student who struggled with the course for a lot of reasons, but she never made me feel bad about it, made me laugh, and was there to answer every question I had no matter how simple it was. She is a professor who will never give up on you and will encourage you no matter how you are with math/stats/life in general.
She is a really good professor. She makes statistics easy to understand.

Although the class itself was not hard, the professor made the class almost unbearable. The professor avoided questions and when the questions were answered, they were answered in an almost sarcastic tone. 

Beware of the final, it was very hard! I had an A in the class but my grade dropped to a B after the final and additional bonus points.

Dr. J has a very strong accent but it is very understandable. The class itself it pretty straightforward, it is easy to earn partial credit on exams, and you can get away with not going to lectures as long as you understand the homework and the content
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: While it's not her fault it was hard to understand her due to the accent and even her own recording wasn't able to pick up what she said most of the time so it was useless. I went to like 1/3 of the lectures so if you do the weekly assignments, really memorize the noted slides, and attend the labs it's a doable A.
Didn't show her respect to students, I think I sustained discrimination.
Terrible professor

Math 171 is tough, but worth it. I would highly recommend it to anyone who cares about the "why" behind math. Homework (worth 1/3) is graded rigorously for accuracy and should take 8-12 hours per week (they warn you of this). Tucker is very accessible outside class, even on weekends. You really need to come to class, and be sure to ask questions!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: Tucker is an amazing prof. who genuinely wants you to understand concepts taught in class. She is good at clarifying any topic to make sure it makes sense to her students, and she is also very accessible. Also does homework questions in-class sometimes and loves doing test prep. Highly recommend her.

Worst experience at UofR and definitely a GPA killer. Professor Tucker always makes mistakes in illustrating examples in class, and she WILL NOT give answer keys to the homework and practice exams. Homework and exams are super heavy and the grading is harsh as well. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!

Amanda is the worst and most inconsiderate professor I have had at UR. She has no idea what she's talking about and has no knowledge outside of what she copies down from the textbook. Unsure about many things and always make mistakes during the lecture.

Btw, difficult homework and exams. BAD experience!!!
No office hours and not accessible outside of class. Homework and exam super long and hard. Lectures are fine but not friendly to students.

Generally Prof. Tucker elaborates the concepts well, but sometimes she just gives the conclusions without much reasonings behind which seem quite difficult to make sense. Also, homework and exam problems are workable.

Prof Tucker is the clearest prof in the dept. Take this from her if you get the chance. She made a mistake one time and emailed us all a detailed correction - not sure what that last guy is talking about. Prob didn't read his email. She's super helpful and gets us to understand things. Gives lots of help if you seek it out.

In 280 classes, she often made mistakes in teaching materials (NOT calculating, BUT showing/illustrating examples). I followed her wrong steps showing in class and got a bad grade in HW. And the TA is also harsh. I do NOT think Tucker can handle teaching this course. This course should be taught by other professors, instead of her.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: bad at explaining concepts

Not sure why she changed the A range to be higher than 93. It is impossible almost. Do not know why she did that. All people know that this is a hard course to take. Previously, the A range should be 90+, but she changed it. You can know that also if you reached 89.9 will you get a B+ and 87 is going to be a B.
She is a great professor and truly cares about her students. Very approachable and helpful. I would definitely recommend choosing her as your professor if you have the option
Horrible professor. lectures are not helpful. Is not understanding at all. Just don't take her class, she's horrible.

A terrible racist professor even if she seems nice at first. She makes it sound like she cares when she really really doesn't. Most of my friends liked her but once interacted with her realized how awful she is. Easily my least favorite professor on this campus

She's great. If you want to learn the material clearly and easily go to her lecture. I attended all 164 lectures and only her and prof Salur were great. Tough on grades though. I heard she was tough on cheaters too.
I don't know what all these other people are talking about. She's great, end of story. Possibly best teacher for math. Saved my life in this class. Look out tho her grading is hard.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: She's a terrible communicator and very unpleasant to talk to. Midterms were much worse than practice exams , careful of the quizzes. For the final she marked me down 15 points (she missed a question) and was like "Oops!My bad" did not fix it till I emailed many more times. Can't be happier that I graduated so I don't see her

She is just the WORST professor I have ever had. She's very racist and biased and I hated every interaction I had with her. She was always very condescending and extremely unhelpful. Communicating with her was an absolute horror! The course itself is not bad and can always go to other prof's classes if you need to. If you're white u good tho

She explained concepts well during class but wasn't very nice to students during office hours. Could be very condescending at times when asked about "simple" topics, so I had to rely on peers and TAs for help a majority of the time. Would not recommend going to her office hours; go to TAs instead.
A very good math teacher who cares about her students. Clearly explains topics and gives help on homework when it's needed. A very solid choice for math teacher.

Her lectures are the best. Made MTH 162 easy while the other professors made it look like some alien speech! She plans her lectures well and gives examples of the type of problems that would appear on the test and webwork.
She's super nice and her lecture covers the exact same materials that appear on the test.

Her lectures are truly amazing! Tells you the subtle points of a topic also which other professors don't go over. She really makes it very easy to understand math. I think she's the best prof for 162. PERIOD.
Her tests are fairly easy compared to the practice exams. She's an amazing professor explains concepts really well.
Tucker is an amazing professor! She makes math easier to understand.

I attended lectures of all of the MTH162 professors, and Tucker is the best. Her explanations are clear,  she provides many examples, and is always willing to help with WebWork. Very approachable and nice. Midterms were hard, final was very hard, but the class was curved and graded fairly. Make sure you get 100% for WebWork and workshops.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--TEST HEAVY

comment: Best professor I've had. Extremely good lecturer, and very clear in her explanations. Keeps lectures engaging and well structured. Overall amazing!
Best professor that I have ever met in my college life. Great lecture and entertaining style of giving examples. Feel great and easy to understand what she wants to show.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures

comment: Funny, engaging, by far the best professor in the Math department. Clear notes with examples that are very related to the webwork. Always has time to answer questions, both in office hours and in class. Loves giving partial credit on exams.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: She is terrible. Treats 153 as a review and expects you to know all the grammar. Never assigns hw or follows the syllabus but randomly expects you to have done practice problems in the book and quizzes on the answers in class. Only grade is the final which is over grammar that is never taught - just mentioned. Regret taking the class with her.

Douchin is one of the most passionate teachers that I have ever had. Period.  But if you're looking to improve your FR, this is not the class for you.  Skips midterm, doesn't follow syllabus and expects you to already know your grammar and vocabulary.  The only grade in the course is the final-which is mostly grammar that you won't learn here.

The most passionate professor or  teacher i've ever had. You will succeed in her class if you complete the assignments, do the homework and study the textbook. She gives MANY opportunities to improve your grade. Take advantage of all the extra credit assignments she offers, and you will get an A as long as she knows you care and are trying!

She's simply a lovely and charming woman. I looked forward to every french class. Often she'd tell inspirational stories and try to engage the class in debates. She doesn't really follow a syllabus and doesn't use black board. It's hard to know what she expects, but if you approach her, she is very helpful. One of the best professors i've ever had.

A generally very nice old lady --  was very excited during the first class. Interest waned somewhat; she's very disorganized and her grading confuses the hell out of me. But, overall, I'm thankful to have taken the class. Use the textbook: memorize everything and don't skip class.

Honestly, she should not be teaching 153. She believes that you already speak Fr when you enter her class. You do not go over grammar or vocab. You only read stories. She never uses a syllabus, everyone in class was lost each day, midterm was simply skipped, then added on to the final.Very nice though. Great teacher if you already speak fr.

She is entertaining in class but assignments are very ambiguous. Find out when her office hours are (doesn't list them or her email in the syllabus) and go see her often. There are hardly any real assignments but if you want to make a good grade just pick a random page in the book every couple weeks to do for extra credit and turn it in TYPED.

I can understand why some students don't like her teaching because it seems unorganized and unvaried, but she passionate, funny and her spoken French is easy to understand. She's also really helpful if you go see her one-on-one, which is a good idea. I really liked her as a teacher.

Fun, funny and eccentric as a person, but awful as a teacher.She's ambiguous about what you're supposed to do for hw, she NEVER puts down a letter grade for any work that you do (so I'm freaking out about my ambiguous final grade), and she's clearly one of those teachers who has favourites and rewards them the most. I regret taking her class.
awful. just awful.
The title of the class was Aspects of French Grammar, but in this class u will not learn any grammar!
i hate her class. she forced poetry on us

avoid this professor for your own sanity! she will drive you crazy with her senseless grading policies and other ridiculous things (she leaves office hours a half an hour early even when she gets there 15 minutes late). she is awful and of top of it all...I can honestly say that I learned nothing.

C+ here as well.  She tends to love giving those out to people she doesn't favor as much in class.  Wasn't favortism a thing of the past? Apparently not, I really did HOURS of work for this class and it all went unnoticed.  I would advise you STRONGLY to not take this class.  If you are, be on top of your grade.
If people have issues with her, it's their own fault for not doing the work....  I thought she was a really funny, cool, cute French lady.

I took AP French in HS, and was technically exempt from this class. But, i took it thinking it would be easy. Boy was I wrong. I was easily far ahead of the rest of the class, did the work, participated and got shafted extra hard in the end. Extremely unorganized, we strayed away from our syllabus a few weeks in.

HORRIBLE! Diligent worker here and got a C+..and know a few others who received the same grade with even better work ethic.  She has a very traditional style of grading and doesn't really write anything down on your paper. Your surprise comes when you check your final grade...and voila...not pretty. If you take this class, be alert on your grade.
she is absolutely hilarious and makes the class really fun.  on the other hand, she is poorly organized and you are constantly wondering where you stand in your grade.

I had her for recitation, so i can't really comment on her grading style or fairness, but she is HILARIOUS! tell us about her ex-husband, and tells us to shape our mouths like the anus of a chicken to make the correct "oo" sound.

She is fun-loving and great to have in class (as long as you agree with her), but then she absolutely shafts you on your grade. Even if you do all your essays and participate in class every day, it doesn't matter. Likes it when you visit her during office hours, but frequently won't be there herself. Misses appointments - very unprofessional.
Nice lady. Not very organized. Fun conversations in class.
Very nice and flexible.

If you don't suck up to her or have the same opinion as her, she won't like you -- no matter how good your papers are. My advice is to agree with everything she says... even if it kills you. Suck up enough and go to her office hours? You'll be fine.

Definately a good professor, energetic, knowledgable, and enthusiastic about the language. The only thing is the GRADING. The hardest grader i've ever had. even if she likes you, she still might give you a bad grade, so don't slack.

what a crazy old bat.. so nice..but thats part of the plan she makes you think you're doing great.. infact she even said she would let me know if i was gonna get anything less than an A..a B+ later i decided she really doesn't care

The definition of eccentric, but an interesting woman with a wealth of irrational stories.  Once forced me to try her reading glasses on during class.   I would suggest her as a professor for people used to energetic professors.

Energetic yeah but never gives you a sense of how you're doing in the semester even when you ask, then you end up with a less-than-expected grade. Lets you revise papers but class discussion is unorganized. Overall enthusiastic but poor at organization.
Energetic, eccentric, but understanding and extremely nice.
so energetic, interesting, helpful, and a pleasure to learn from.
fun, energetic, knows and loves the language.

Professor Weaver led a very engaging course on the history of the City of London. He's a dynamic speaker who seeks to involve all students in the class. He makes a point to learn your name and gives pointed, detailed feedback on the work you submit.
His classes are very well-rounded and engaging. You will want to do the readings (it is a manageable load) because he makes the material so interesting.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: Weaver is a super interesting, kind man and is VERY knowledgable about history. He assigns a lot of reading but gives you enough time to do it, and you don't even have to do the reading if you want a good grade. Workload is light and it is easy to get an A, even if you don't participate, don't do most of the readings, and don't come to class often.
Weaver is really knowledgeable, but this class was lecture heavy and sometimes it was boring. I honestly didn't pay that much attention, but I did all the readings and papers and still got an A.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Hilarious--So many papers

comment: Amazing teacher and person overall. Doesn't assign much work besides a a few books and papers over the semester. Lectures were interesting and he really cares about what the students think about the topics. Best professor I've ever had.
Great Professor. Knows what he is talking about!

One of my favorite professors at UofR. He is passionate about all of his classes and has good insight. He wants everyone to participate, so he will call on you. He is really approachable outside of class. I am actively attempting to take another class with him because I enjoyed the first so much. A+

History of India He is knowledgeable and passionate about the subject and gives that to the students. Very fair grader and makes sure you understand the assignment and relevant materials. I highly recommend.

He is an amazing professor. I took a 200 level course with him my first semester of college. He was my favorite class and professor that semester. Not a single test was given. Only a handful of one page reading responses, discussion, a midterm paper, and final paper. Very easy grader too. Class is fascinating, best lecturer ever. 10/10

I'm biased because Stewart Weaver is down with the history I'm interested in. But he was always a nice guy and, I think, pretty much trying to do his own writing and not give undergrads a hard time.  Plus the ladies love the silver fox, so I guess he gets a good rating for that reason as well.
Easy grader. Lectures are somewhat confusing at times. Overall really helpful

I took just about all of Weaver's classes when I was at UR. I loved them all. He was also my advisor for my Senior Thesis, so maybe I'm biased. He always made time to meet with me and is a great guy. Just don't fall asleep in his class. He doesn't like that.
Love him.  Favorite prof at UR
Awesome. His lectures are interesting and flow really well, class goes by really fast. Extremely fair grader. Also, oddly very attractive
Best. Professor. Ever.

Weaver's pretty witty, always seemed kind of bitter to me, like he didn't want to be there.  Lectures aren't too clear, but the class isnt too bad.  Also he takes sleeping in class as a personal offense so watch out.  I saw him wake someone up in a class of 60.
No Comments
His lectures are interesting and on topic.
Weaver is a fabulous professor-very good at lecturing. He's a nice guy and quite funny. He's an easier grader on the tests than the papers
Very funny professor.  Dry wit, very knowledgeable.  Makes history come alive.  Fantastic selection of course materials and class lecture topics.
Good lecturer, interesting, nice guy overall
yeah yeah he's the greatest
great guy and teacher
Very bright and insightful, though slightly impenetrable.  Liked his innovative use of period source material.
No Comments
No Comments
Not a bad teacher at all. I swear, he looks exactly like the main bad guy in Die Hard 3.
Great man... he's one of the best!
A fool who grades based on your compatability with his beliefs
The best professor I've had at the UofR
Great

Prof. Kaeuper is a class act and a real gem. He really lives and breathes medieval history. I was very happy to be able to take all of his classes and seminars. He helped me solidify a general interest into an organized effort. He actually had projects organized around the Doomsday Book original material. Plus, he was just pleasant and funny.
Easy course. Lecture and seminar not very organized and he seems to be too nice on grading papers. Very caring for students. A good professor over all.

Professor Kaeuper is this university's greatest treasure, and one of the greatest living scholars of medieval history. Not taking a class with him would be to do yourself a disservice. You will be challenged, and rewarded. You will love him, the class, and the material.

He is the nicest, sweetest professor I've ever met. A bit absentminded, but that only adds to his charm. Lectures can drag, but his enthusiasm is contagious. He takes time to meet with every student about their papers individually, and loves talking to his students. He is great story teller and overall wonderful man
Great professor. His knowledge of Medieval France and emphasis on the usage and interpretation of primary sources makes every class illuminating.
best professor in the world. super passionate and knowledgable- he knows everything.  he's such a kind soul and just really very witty in the style of Monty Python.

The very best professor I ever had in any subject.  His passion and devotion to his discipline affected keeners and rocks the same way, and he left no one behind.  I write books today because of him; I still go back and ask him to explain thorny questions of history.
Best professor I ever had, hands down. Reason I am a historian today.

Professor Kaeuper is completely invested in his students' success both in and out of the classroom and is willing to do whatever it takes to make sure you are well. He changed the course of my career and it is completely reasonable to say that without him I would not be nearly as successful or as happy as I am today.
The greatest professor I've ever had. Mentor, teacher, friend; he inspires everyone around him and all of his students.
Memorable.  Makes the subject come to life

Best prof I had in undergrad. I have taken away more useful info from this man than any other. We still chat about stuff and he continues to provide me with his sage comments on history. Nothing should deter you from taking his courses. He will also make whatever accomodations you need to help you complete your assignments.
he's great
As funny as he is brilliant.

so cool.  office is full of dusty medieval gizmos. Very smart but absentminded XD but not so it interferes with lectures.  lectures are funny and huge plus for no in-class exams.  straightforward class but graders don't take any BS on essays which is good/bad depending on how much time you spent writing ur essay.
By far the best professor I have had at Rochester.

Had three classes with him in the early to mid 1990's. The best professor I had in terms of knowledge, story-telling, sense of humor and a tough, yet fair grader. 3 hour seminars flew by, even stayed late at times. He saw something in me early on that got me interested in Medieval history. We is a class act and it was a joy to be in his class.
I added a history major because of his class.  He tells great stories and gives students really interesting research experience.
Absolutely funny in class
Threw chalk and ppl sleeping in class, monty python references, actually made me look forward to a 940 class, great prof
One of the best classes I ever took.  Great lectures that were funny and interesting. If have any interest in medievalism take this class!
Had him as a teacher in the late '80s and still remember his with freat fondness.  In fact, he's the reason I changed my major to history.  'Nuff said.

appearances can be deceiving.  when u meet him u wouldn't expect him to be as funny as he is.  his classes are great.  definitely has notable quotes to remember.  he knows his stuff.  one of the best professors U of R has to offer
the best professor, riveting lectures
He is the best history professor I've encountered in my college experience.  He tells great historical anecdotes in class to illustrate his points, and he loves talking with students.
Gives very interesting lectures.
Had him for medievial history 15 years ago, still remember his class well.  Possibly the best teacher I have ever seen.
The best ever, ever.

homework is online which is $110, no other option. he is kinda boring and doesnt teach that well but it might just be the material he teaches. he has 1 extra credit opportunity, 12 homeworks (2 skips), 3 quizzes, 2 midterms, 1 final. uses pretty relevant examples, takes forever to grade exams. not the worst, not the best, prob wouldnt retake w him
He is a really good professor, he is very patient and he can teach clearly. It is really interesting taking his course, I will definitely take the course again.

Eric is my Goat, my one and only, my sunshine. His lectures were inspirational and single-handedly inspired me to work for that A. His ppts were gorgeous and his little pet fish are the cutest things ever.

I've taken both ACC 201 and ACC 221. He gives EC opportunities and weighs midterm 1 & 2 differently based off whichever you scored higher.

While the quizzes don't help much with exam prep, doing the practice test he posts + reading through his PPTs is enough to prepare for the exams even if you don't show up for lectures. 

Gelsomin is my GOAT
I like this class very much. After this class, I am very interested in accounting. I really hope to have the opportunity to attend Professor eric's class here
Very good professor, very caring for students. I really liked his teaching style and enjoyed talking with Professor ERIC.

Eric is very friendly to students, and responds to emails very quickly both in office hours and at other times (even on weekends). In addition, eric will explain every problem very carefully and look at your questions patiently. I think he's really nice. the PPT is very detailed, and many examples will be included in the PPT.

I had a difficult time with Professor Gelsomin in ACC201. The exams were difficult, and i wish i could say "just study more" as an effective solution but it wasnt. Made me rethink accounting as my minor, very hard. I am a MechE major if that gives you and sort of clue as to how i perceived the class and was able to handle the material.

The material is difficult, especially for anyone without any previous knowledge. He always ran through the lecture and ended class early so it was hard to grasp material well. Homework was helpful in practicing material but the checking option was deceiving. Practice exams are very similar to the real exams but the MC and open response are brutal.
He probably don't curve for at all even for a exam only got 80 in median
tough grader and test heavy. not good for high GPA goal.

Try to take accounting with a different professor! Class heavily relies on midterms and a cumulative final, so if you're a bad test taker and can't consume lots of info and formulas, don't take Eric's. Slides are spedrun during lecture and you won't learn anything because the info is so dense. Expects everyone to have the same ACC knowledge as him.
very limited review materials. Hard tests, quizzes are not really helpful at all. efforts you put in this courses doesn't reflect on your grades. DON'T TAKE HIS CLASS!!!
Totally a disaster

Never once at u of r have I walked out of a class thinking I have not gained a single thing, until taking this class with Eric. Extremely hard exams and a very unreasonable final exam. He speed-runs every single lecture and assumes we all know what he is talking about, when this is the most basic accounting class you can take here. Dissatisfied.
Great slides, easy exams

Exams are way more difficult than homework or practice exams. Homework might be helpful for understanding knowledge, but they aren't enough for getting good grade. Multiple questions are hard, but we seldom have chance to practice. Eric is a good person though. He even offered snacks during the final. But still, I wish I hadn't taken it.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: This is a pretty good professor. Accounting is a subject that more related to mathematics and analyzing, and the homework is an effective way to train it, not to mention that you can check your answers are correct or not while doing it, so it is easy to get perfect on this. If you finish your homework well, exams will also not be a problem

Professor Gelsomin is a kind guy to be hang out with after class, but is definitely not a professor that you would want to choose for ACC201. His teaching style is simply reading from slides, which is a 0 point that you would possibly get if you are doing a presentation for a class.

He is rly nice and reply email quickly but too be honest his speaking is rly fast, and you must review even self learning after each lecture. But the stuffs in this course are not that hard, you can learn a lot from the HW, even HW system looks rly bad... After doing the HW and review on time, you can got a good grade. Good luck.

Had the most homework. Millions of journal entries to fill up and the homework system was hard to use. Said he would accept late assignments for 50% credit but locked the access before the final exam and I couldn't do these assignments. But a very nice guy to hang out with or to chat with. Provided free candy during exams. Not such good professor.

Super nice guy who is willing to help. But it's just really hard to catch up with lectures and do well in exams. Assignments are for each chapter that are 13 in total, but it takes hours to finish one. No grading scale on syllabus, which is good for him to adjust standard based on students' performance but bad for students who care about grade.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Would definitely NOT recommend this class to freshmen or anybody who wants an easy A. Homework heavy and even during breaks. Need a 160$ textbook for it. Exam averages at 80% and he said he's gonna make A line a 94%+. Not enough exam practice questions so you better create similar questions off the slides to practice. Avoid if possible

Very harsh grader, would expect A to be 95+ when his exams counts for 80% overall grades with averages around 85/100. Homeworks are long and tedious, and some are during breaks but only counts 15% of the overall grade. Gives no curves to his test. Lectures are  super boring. Dont take his class for your GPA.
Knows the material but doesn't teach it well. Homeworks are long and tedious at points and it cost 150 dollars to do it. Assigns homework during breaks
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Decent professor, nice and such but a very harsh grader. DONT take his class for your GPA's sake. Criteria for an A is way too high with very limited practices. Reads of presentations and slides.

Very amazing down to Earth person. I would definitely hang out with him outside of the classroom. In the classrooms, however, he is not the most brilliant. Lectures are very boring since he just reads off his slides.

Gelsomin offers minimal extra credit and limited exam practice, providing just one practice test that's less effective. He has a simple and fast, slide-based teaching style. Homework, requiring a textbook purchase, is tough. Overall, Gelsomin's friendly demeanor and approachability are positives, but his overall teaching effectiveness is debatable.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: ACC 201 in the fall 2023 semester is difficult, you only have 2 exams and theyre weighted pretty heavily. the exams are tough. period. he is a nice guy but i dont think he takes into consideration that not everyone is on the same accounting level as him! nice guy, some extra credit but low amount. difficult class for sure. had to buy $200 textbook.
Very engaging teacher. Offers insightful feedback on essays.

Bleich had nothing to offer but an atmosphere of fear and hate. He used slurs in class even after we decided it wasn't okay as a group. I'm glad my classmate came forward and let everyone know what was going on in our class. It wasn't ok. Never take a class from him. He should be suspended permanently.

Constantly challenges students' views so he can come off as aggressive and opinionated (if you argue you better have sound reasons to back it). Class is unstructured and involves a lot of his opinions (sometimes whole lecture). But his assigned readings and films are very interesting. He cares about growth in students. Main work was weekly papers.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: He has been so cruel and unkind that certain students have stopped attending class altogether out of fear of being ridiculed and belittled anytime they try to speak. And every other student sits silently in class and zone out of fear of the same thing. You will spend all semester shutting up and listening to his opinions that are stated as fact.

This class is the worst I've ever taken. You'll need at least 10+ hours per week, per course you take with him. Most weeks we were expected to read multiple and entire 300-page texts, along with 3+ page essays. The man only wants to hear his opinions. He also says slurs frequently, along with silencing any minority students that argue with him.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: I took David Bleich's Pedagogy course in graduate school. Bleich is very intelligent and cares about social justice. He also cares deeply about his students. I am now a professor myself, and he taught me how to be a good professor.

A professor unlike any other at U of R, Bleich will undoubtably make you think differently about the world around you. Not for the faint of heart, as his humor is no doubt borderline offensive in today's higher learning atmosphere, but if you can get through that, his teachings are well worth it.

Seriously the best professor you will ever have. He'll make you question the society we live in through thoughtful, inspirational, and provocative discussion. Sincerely cares about teaching and is also hilarious. Bleich will get you out of your comfort zone which is the only time you really learn something deeply valuable. Highly recommend.

His classes were literally life changing experiences and if you have the possibility to take one with him then please do. He helped me develop a much better writing style and his classes are eye openers to the world we live in and what we can do about it.
He's a good professor and bit critical on his own opionion of things, just have to be able to look at things differently in his class (his way) :D
Most influential class taken in college.

Bleich is a fantastic teacher--this was a refreshing and interesting course. I was getting tired of writing essays for other classes. Not so for this course--the authors and essayists we read and responded to were very engaging. My interest in reading was renewed, and Bleich helped me develop a clearer, and more personal, writing style.
Best professor I've ever had!

One of the most incredible professors I've had at Rochester. Bleich really pushes students to think for themselves and consider every side of an issue. Although he can be a handful at times, class was never boring. The literature/films he chose were fantastic as well.

Absolutely loved this course and Prof. Bleich. While Bleich does give his opinions and has a unique teaching technique, he is always encouraging students to actively participate and give their own insights to facilitate class discussions. This course was the best, most interesting, and worth while that I have taken at UR.

Bleich enables students to open up and gain new insight on language and communication. Both the topics and class discussions were always fun and interesting! His style is different and he gives his opinions openly, but he encourages all students to do the same. This course was the best, most interesting, and worth while that I have taken at UR.

I absolutely loved his courses! Best professor in the department. He encourages students to find their own style and is extremely intolerant of academic writing. :) His classes are also very unique and really make you think!
Super Teacher
Great teacher!
excellent professor. class discussion and involvement led to much higher learning and understanding, comprehension and applicable knowlege.
He is an amazing professor and I am so glad I took one of his courses.  He certainly opens your mind and forces you to think beyond conventional reasoning.  I highly recommend any course by him.

Do not take classes from him if you are narrow-minded and uptight, unwilling to view things from all perspectives, and unwilling to become actively involved in learning.  He is an amazing teacher and will change your perception of higher education.

He is the best professor I had over my four years at Rochester.  He urges you to consider and interpret the content and information from your own point of view, and does not accept passivity or lack of passion.  He has a genuine interest in his students success, and invests his own personal time and outside of the classroom to encourage it.
He is an amazing teacher who challenges the way that students think.  By far one of the best teachers I have ever had in my life.  He has a great sense of humor!

This is the worst class I have taken at Rochester. Professor Bleich is inappropriate, rude, and does not foster an environment in his classroom where he wants his students to succeed or even learn. The class could have been so interesting, but Bleich single-handedly ruined it.

His class was one of the best I've ever taken.  The material is engaging, and Bleich is a very direct, and learned person with good humor.  He forces you to  think and see things differently.  And he takes his class out for food.
He teaches you stuff AND buys you food!  What more could you ask for?
No Comments

Hysterically funny, entertaining, opinionated and stubborn to no end.  His class was interesting and fun and forced me to write in a completely different way than I was used to.  The shock factor of our discussion topics alone is worth taking his class.

BaileyShea is organized, makes the material very simple and effective, and the grading is also very generous if you simply do the homework. Only possible complaint is that he moves somewhat slow but that's just the curriculum, and it makes the class very manageable!

First time ever taking a music class, but he made the class so engaging and fun. Homework is easy, and he's very light with the grading. Also, if you have any questions about anything music related (a cool piece you tried composing, a piece with some cool musical aspects, or even just homework points you lost) you can talk with him about it.
Really fun professor, great lectures and minimal homework. Very light grader, and you can always ask about anything you lost points on after class.

Professor Baileyshea is truly the best professor I have ever had at U of R. He explains concepts so well in lecture, and the homework and exams, while not always easy, have no surprises. I appreciate how he is always willing to help students on assignments and how he puts more emphasis on hw than exams. If I could give more than a 5, I would.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Dr. Bailey-Shea is a caring professor and his homework is easy and tests are fair. He is approachable and very involved in the music department.
Took him for Music theory 111 and 112. His lectures are super entertaining! He applies all the knowledge learned to real life examples. Tests and homework are easy.
Extremely kind and helpful; always willing to answer questions. Tests and homework are very easy if you have a solid understanding of the material.
My favorite professor

Prof. Baileyshea makes me fall in love with music theory. He is easily the best professor I have ever had. He knows how to explain the material so well, and you can tell he cares about his students. I especially appreciated his take on exams as exams do not count for much of your grade and homework counting for much more instead. 11/10 professor.

Professor BaileyShea is probably one of the best professors in this university. He is extremely caring and such a great teacher. He takes time to explain what he is talking about and you can tell that he knows a lot more and is passionate about music.

Prof. Baileyshea is hands down the best professor I have ever had at this university. His lectures are so clear, and he always tries to get student participation. There is homework due before every class, but it is very manageable if you went to class and paid attention. I cannot say enough good about Prof. Baileyshea.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor BaileyShea is wonderful! His lectures are organized and clear and he is dedicated to making sure everyone is on the same page with the material. There is lots of homework, but the assignments aren't super difficult and help your understanding of the class topics. Overall, super chill guy and always willing to help if needed!
