I took his class for 111 and took it again for 112 and both were absolutely amazing. There's homework every night, but it really helps in understanding the material. His teaching style is very easy to follow and he really makes sure that the students understand the material. Overall a great guy and a great class for sure.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria

comment: Really fantastic teacher. Clear, caring, effective, and makes it easy for you to do well if you put in a bit of effort. Would highly recommend taking a class with him if possible!!

He is such an amazing professor, I recommend him to everyone that I see that is thinking of taking Theory.  His lectures are involving and group work is part of class but very low-pressure.  There is homework, every night, but it's not terribly hard if you've paid attention in class.  Overall, he's amazing and you can tell that he cares.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Favorite professor on campus

Wonderful professor. Lectures are very clear and he draws upon a wide variety of interesting examples for the material. He is very reasonable with his grading and late policy, but deson't take nonsense either.

This is THE music theory class to take. Prof BaileyShea knows how to teach and can see the big picture and direction of what he teaches. Often uses pop music and classical music to illustrate the concepts he teaches-got to learn other cool music out there and new ways of listening to music and fantastic music. Every classis wonderful fm 1st to last

Fantastic prof! Makes you really appreciate music theory by applying fundamental classical concepts to all sorts of modern music from pop to rock to jazz. Assignments can be tricky occasionally, but take a very reasonable amt of time. Grading is very fair. If you are even thinking about taking a theory class, try to get him if you can!

Best professor I've ever had. Extremely helpful, efficient homework assignments, and interesting classes. He taught us 18th century music theory and yet applied it to a variety of 20th and 21st century contexts. DO WHAT YOU NEED TO DO TO TAKE A CLASS WITH THIS MAN.

Basically, BailyShea is the man. I had never taken a theory course before his, and I was pretty nervous. But his approach to teaching made me fall in love with music theory, and I'm now completing a minor in it. Assigns homework every class, but they're very reasonable in length and content.  Also is a very fair grader, as long as you put in effort

Such a great guy. Knowledgeable, friendly, approachable and very passionate about his subject. Homework tends to be a bit more involved than previous music theory courses, but there's no tests or final. I would love to take another class from BaileyShea.
Excellent teacher who possesses a great deal of knowledge and clearly explains ideas.  A good amount of homework really helps students to learn and think about the concepts presented in class.
Excellent theory teacher. Incredibly clear and open to questions/discussions. Friendly too. Definitely knows his stuff, especially when it comes to lieder and Wagner. Great asset to college.
BaileyShea is such a cool guy.  Extremely intelligent, knows a lot of theory, difficult hw, but that's how you learn.
basically... he's awesome. i've had him for my first two semesters of music theory and plan on having him for my second two as well.

My only regret by having BaileyShea for my last two semesters of theory is that I didn't have him for the first two. He treated us like adults with our analysis. He was reasonable but did not take B.S. either. On research, he makes you feel like an equal and he is still helping me design my fifth-year program proposal.
No Comments
No Comments

BaileyShea is a great teacher. He is very clear and easy to approach for discussions or help. Grading and tests done the way they should be - incredibly fair. Course is very interesting, especially analysis of German lied. The final composition project was fun to write and he even got the pieces performed by professionals.

For a one credit lab class, the workload should not have been so heavy. It was more than my 4 credit courses. He gives tough quizzes that you don't even have enough time to complete, makes you write pre-labs, excessively long post-labs, and unnecessary long homework. Also not very polite. This class was the reason I couldn't get a 4.0 this sem.>:(
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes--So many papers

comment: I learned more about chem in this single credit class than like ever before. Professor Toder doesn't seem like the most approachable but then again I never had a reason to so I am sure he would be friendly if you had questions or were very interested in the subject. Labs were pretty intense but just go to the lab lectures (!!!!)and you'll do fine.

This was the most work ever for a 1 credit class. Forces you to attend lectures through random quizzes that are super difficult; the last quiz was pretty much an exam and took place after labs had already ended. Also during lectures he will assign more work to hand in with lab reports and he often assigns it the week the report is due. Ridiculous.

A lot of memorization, so don't slack. Gives a couple of 10 pt quizzes per week, drops the lowest one. Goes exactly section through section, so follow the textbook. To do well on his tests you need to do and understand his previous tests, send him your answers and he'll correct them. Built-in-curve on each test, so curves a little/maybe not at end.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: didn't understand anything
very clear and easy
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Very difficult class to start with, even more so because of him and they way he  tests.
can be confusing at times but gives easy exams

Terrible, terrible Professor. Wants the students to fail and is sneaky about his grading. He has random quizzes in his lectures in order to force you to attend, and will "update" lab report assignments with additional work without proper notification, he'll just mention it in his lectures and expect you to be responsible for it. Avoid at all costs.

Will knock points for trivial things. He is uncompromising and unimaginative. His lectures are boring. His lab manual is confusing. Only good thing about the course is the TA's. He is somewhat helpful 1-on-1, but I found it difficult to work with him.

bad. Just plain bad. Makes a lot of mistakes. On the NMR he gave out, it was wrong, so I spent 2 days trying to find the answer to a wrong answer. Obviously, I didn't find the answer. Horrible. I hate him with a passion
Worst Prof ever! I cant believed he's still teaching at this university. If I were the head of Chem department, I would definitely fire him

Took the summer courses (both orgo I and II with labs). If you listen to him, take good notes, and study from his notes and follow along in the book, you'll be fine. Of course, Organic Chem is difficult and it's even more difficult to teach. I did well in the class because I worked to learn the material. It's not a spoonfeeding class.

Taught material very clearly and simply, but when it came to exams there was always something  tricky on them that was not seen in class or on the homeworks making it unfair for those who were taking the class for the first time.  Not to mention he does not curve grades... Wait for the school year to take this or don't take the lab with it.

WORST LAB LECTURER EVER!!! Best part of the class was rating his sweaters. His is extremely boring and yells at you when you aren't wearing goggles in the lab. If you ask him a question, he looks at you like your stupid. He is mean and should definitely retire. Avoid CHM 207 and 208 if you can!

I have never had a worse "professor" in my life! He's someone who gives little to no interest in helping you out; in fact, actually wants you to fail and have a miserable life. His labs are easy to do, but writing them is hell...avoid avoid the toad (looks like one too haha)

Boring and never really explains himself well.  Puts me to sleep every lecture, yet will pull out a quiz when he feels like the class is not understanding the material... way to kick us when we are down.

ugh.  tried to make chem lab more important than it should be.   tried to teach during lab lectures in such a boring manner that all you do is fall asleep.  Kudos for trying i guess.  Pretty sneaky about his lab quizzes.  Make sure you pick out the easiest version.

He is a socially inept individual - not going to his office hours is highly recommended. Taught summer Orgo in a very clear way and was very fair about grading. Was a horrible lab coordinator for CHM 207 and 208, though.

a terrible prof.  can seem docile and nurturing at first, but don't be fooled. he is evil in human form.  today he felt the need to clarify something in an email...he said "i am not totally heartless." take from that what you will.

awfull,  this joke of a professor seems to take pride in all the ways through which he intimidates the students to follow his strict rules.  He is not helpful at all, his lectures are boring and he's just downright  mean.  there is absolutely nothing redeaming about professor toder, avoid him if at all possible.

I don't know why the university keeps people like this around. They do us no good at all and help to ruin the experience of being a student at UR. He needs to get a life (and an orgo textbook to learn from)
No Comments
He is the worst professor I have ever had.  He is condescending and mean.  He isn't helpful at all. AVOID  HIM AT ALL COSTS!!
This man is a useless tub of lard... "poor plan" is not a suggestion it's an insult
I found his grading to be very unfair..also, he was not very helpful when i had problems. Sarcastic sense of humor and alittle mean to me.
He has a very superficial knowledge of organic chemistry.
No Comments

This guy is a lot of things.  Not only is he fat and mean, but he's the worst teacher I've ever had.  The only thing he knows about organic chemistry is that sexy female lab TAs are a must.  This guy is a high school wannabe gym teacher at heart.

Hilarious in a bad way. I wanted to take MATH200 with him despite the horrible reviews, but I should've listened. Please listen. PLEASE LISTEN. It's impossible to learn logic/proofs from Dr. Lubkin who will make 1 fundamental error every two minutes (~40 per class). Old age is really a shame, he has a PhD from Harvard and you can't tell anymore.
has got to easily be one of the worst professors here at u of r.

Professor Lubkin seems like a genuinely nice guy but he cannot teach. He's very old and teaches by always facing the board to write and speaking in a low and monotone voice. He rarely turns around, so he doesn't see questions, and it's hard to follow along. I had to change course sections.
No energy in his lecture. the semester start with 90 student and after few weeks there are
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: This poor guy was born in 1939. He's 84 as of writing this, and it shows. The only thing saving my grade is the fact that I've taken calculus before. He is easily the worst professor I have ever had, but I don't want to blame him. My lecture went from some 80 people to 4. He really should retire, for his own sake if anything.

Whatever you do, don't sign up for Prof. Lubkin's class. I was in his 161 for 1 lecture. He was barely audible, couldn't read his writing, and had his back turned to the class the entire time. On top of this, I was near the front of the class, so I couldn't imagine trying to follow along from the back of the class.

Literally the worst professor I have ever had. I never went to a single class because they were so horrible and like torture. i went for one week and realized it was a waste of time. He does not know what he is writing half the time and his voice will put you to sleep. He has zero energy and I had to teach myself everything from the textbook.

You can tell he really cares, but he just can't teach. 141 is not supposed to be hard but he makes it so overly complicated and it's hard to understand what he's trying to say. You're gonna have to teach yourself the material but the material isn't too hard.
can't hear a single word his voice is too low

The course material is not hard, but he makes it complicated. Cant read his writing during lectures and he goes way too fast with no time for questions. People just stopped showing up to the lectures after the first few classes and started learning the material on our own, do not take his class, especially if ur not good at math, not worth it.
I loved the professor, he may not be super active unlike others. However, he is very knowledgeable and a caring professor.
he's a good teacher.

He is such a nice person but he cannot teach. You honestly don't have to go to classes, just read the textbook and go to the workshops and you will learn more and be less confused than if you went to the lectures. He also gets confused when he is doing problems, and talks really quietly, such a nice guy though.

AVOID LUBKIN AT ALL COSTS. His lectures are super disorganized and basically incoherent b/c he just mumbles at the board. Doesn't give time for ppl to ask questions. I had to teach myself the entire class from the textbook because what he says genuinely makes no sense.

This professor is phenomenal! I love him! While many complain about him being hard to hear in years past, starting this year he is using a microphone. He really cares about the students, always willing to answer questions. He is a super sweet man whose class was always a highlight of my day.

AVOID AT ALL COSTS Had to learn from Khan Academy or from attending another prof's lectures/office hours. On the first day of class I sat in the second row (5ft from the board and Lubkin) and was unable to hear or read anything he said or wrote. The class had 90 people enrolled but by the end of the term only 12 people showed up to lectures.

Taking Lubkin's class will be fine if you have the mental will to keep going to his lectures, which are just painful to attend. What he covers in lecture never matches up to what actually happens in class, if you can manage to figure out what he's saying at all. All his students just have to teach themselves in his class.

The only thing better than looking at his glorious mane was his style. His flyers shirt, too short athletic shorts and tie-"died" socks were just too much to take and while i was focusing on them i missed most  of  his mumbled lecture.

This guy is the worst. I took AP Calculus last year, so I already knew the stuff he was teaching but he made it so hard. He never lets class out on time -- he often runs 10 minutes over. The absolute worst teacher I have ever had. Get out while you still can!

Very poor teacher. Without having very good knowledge of the material before coming into the class I would have been clueless the entire semester. He makes mistakes all the time while teaching and the students can figure out where better than him. When he actually does check for questions, he looks at his desk and not the students.

Lubkin made an introductory course that should have been a relatively easy A extremely difficult. Not a single person I know did well in his class. He also talks to the chalkboard, so when you have a question, he won't even see it for 5 or 10 minutes.
His class is not interesting at all but you can see his sincerely face all the time that makes you feel hopeful for your math.
Very Helpful teacher. He gets carried away, or off topic, but is always willing to help anyone with the drive to learn.

He is the WORST professor ever. I learned everything in a 50 minute recitation every week from my TA. He was rude to me, singled people out in class who asked questions and made them feel stupid. He is absolutely useless. Avoid if at all possible!!

He is a funny looking little guy. He is one of the most genuinly nice teachers you will have but not a good professor at all. His handwritting is illegible. He will get you laughing when he answers family phone calls in during class or when he takes frequent bathroom trips.
ADVOID AT ALL COSTS
He is the worst teacher ever. He doesn't know how to do basic arithmetic. He says one thing and does another. The midterm was pure hell...

save yourselves the pain of attending this class.  He makes simple algebra error that throw off the entire point of a problem and excuses himself with his PhD.  Better yet, take it with a different professor or 165.
No Comments
What an interesting subject, but a deadly boring teaching style! You should read the book and understand on your own; coming to class is a waste of time!

Best class I've ever taken, with the best professor I've ever had. Holmes changed my outlook on life. His philosophy of nonviolence class was amazing, and he even brought Gandhi's grandson in to speak to us. It was mind-blowing. Some classes you take for a requirement, and some you take for your personal passions. This class was my passion.
Awesome class.  He's a great professor, and very passionate about what he is teaching.

Dr. Holmes is a great professor. He takes a different approach to teaching and learning in that he uses divergent thinking ( more than 1 right answer). He is passionate in how he teaches the courses and cares about what we get out of it. Those of you who think he is boring, are probably taking the course for the wrong reasons.

This is perhaps one of the most amazing class I've taken. Dr. Holmes is passionate in how he addresses certain issues and makes them interesting. Probably the nicest, most personable professor I've ever taken a class with. Take a class with him, it could be life changing..
best professor i had freshman year.

Passionate, intelligent and charming.  Extremely approachable, like the grandfather you never had.  Extensive knowledge of ethical and political theory, especially nonviolence and anarchist theory.  Probably the only professor in the department that doesn't shy away from continental or eastern schools of thought.

PHL 102 is a frustratingly, demoralizingly easy course.  Holmes is a very patient, careful, and effective lecturer, but he tends to repeat himself a little too often.  Also he pronounces 'Kant' like 'Can't', which was really difficult for me.

Holmes is a great teacher! Many students claim he is boring,but that is because they have no interest in the topic.Holmes is really enthusiastic about the course,and is always willing to help you understand the concepts. just study hard,because he doesn't curve grades :(

Everyone thinks he's amazing, but I think he's very overrated.  Some of the class was really interesting (particularly the part about sexism), though I know he changes the material.  It's a pretty interesting class for the most part.

.  THis class will change or at least open your mind to strategic nonviolence and the power which it holds.  If you dont take this class i truely feel sorry for you.  Also, if you are in the rotc program you must take this class before you decide to become a professional solidger, you could be making a mistake.

Great professor. The best philosophy professor in the department. He is unbiased, intelligent, and encourages participation. Very soothing voice so it can be easy to fall asleep. But try not to.. because he makes you think. Definitely would take him again.
i love this guy!  he was a great teacher, who cares about what he does.  TAKE HIS CLASS!!! THY FILL UP FAST
Amazing.  Wise.  Inspiring.  Life Changing.  Awesome.

This guy is great to watch and listen to.  He somehow manages to learn the names of a number of students in such a large class, and he never makes anybody feel stupid.  He encourages participation, and IS VERY GOOD LOOKING FOR AN OLDER MAN.  Easy grader too.
A very considerate professor who conducts thoughtful discussions. It is interesting to watch as he tries to be nice when people say dumb things in class.
Great profesor. Very clear and unbiased lectures. Very knowledgeable. Interesting lectures. Holmes is a very good guy.
No Comments
I really liked him, i enjoyed going to class, and thats sayin something for me.  I love the way he teaches. somehow he just makes me pay attention...
Like the first comment said, 116Q made me decide to be a philosophy major.  He's not only a great professor but also an admirable man. I liked that the readings didn't go hand in hand with lecture.
The class was life-altering and made me decide to be a philosophy major, and he's such a nice, caring person!
very interesting class...i would definitely recommend taking it!  holmes is considerate and thorough in his explanations, a bit boring, but he knows his stuff!
No Comments
great -teacher-, good discussions, not too hard
material from class didn't go hand in hand with textbook
really nice professor, clear and interesting course material
Clear, concise, big on discussion.  One of my better proffessors.
A great professor!  Interesting, clear lectures, with student involvement!
Learned alot but boring class; He's always right so essay tests graded way hard

Professor Mandala is an interesting man who's clearly very passionate and knowledgeable about the subject. The guidelines may have been a bit vague with no specific grading criteria and limited communication from the professor, but I thought the course was worth it.

I love the approach of how Prof. mandala teaches. Even though he speaks so slowly, but he presents the lecture in a way everyone could understand. My favorite thing about him is he challenges us to go for office hours and also allows students to resubmit a paper if they did not do well. I will definitely recommend him because he is so good!

great professor. gave useful feedback on essays and allowed students to rewrite and resubmit their papers if their grade fell below the average. entirely paper based so there is quite a bit to read and write but very manageable. would definitely recommend!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Accessible outside class

comment: Take it, take it, take it! The best History Professor I have seen out there. Always encourages his students to attend office hours, and even asked students to redo their papers if they fall below the class average. An incredible professor he is.

Professor Mandala is a gem. Hes extremely experienced and knows how to present the lectures. The most incredible thing about this class is being thought from the perspective of an African. Even though he is a tough Professor and has an accent, hes understanding and he dedicates a lot of time to his student in ensuring that they do well in class.

I learn so many things in this class. If you are interested in History and want to learn more about Africa from a perspective of an experienced person, you should give this guy a shot. This class requires so many writings(short papers), but it is worth it because all you need to do is to get the work done. Take it!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: An experience Professor who has been teaching his entire life. Well-knowledgeable and up to date about the topics. I got to learn so many things about global and African history from this professor. Though he is old and he teaches slowly, he is the very few of the best you can find out there. I will admonish you to take his history classes.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: One of the worst professors I've ever had. Syllabus is extremely vague, gives almost no instructions about homework, gets mad at you when you contact him to ask questions about the extremely vague assignments, refuses to give feedback on assignments, extremely rude and condescending to students, seems to grade things arbitrarily, INFLEXIBLE!!
One of the best History professors I have had. He's not a tough grader and makes the lecture accessible for all. Just show up, participate and do your research paper.

His classes are really insightful about the history & geopolitics surrounding to Africa. The readings can be very painful to read, but they also teach you a lot about subjects like the Angolan Civil War. What's critical is that you learn to separate the actual history from the class' pro-Communist indoctrination and to think for yourself.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: Amazing Professor, I loved every bits of his class.

Professor creates an atmosphere for good classroom conversations and loves when students have questions and dialogue among themselves. It is only boring if no one does the reading, so don't take this class if you are not willing to read at least 30 pages a week. Not an easy A, you need to read, participate, and submit quality papers.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: I don't by any means dread his class, but it is incredibly boring. I was very interested to learn about Africa, however my own research and the assigned novels have taught me far more than he has. Not a bad guy by any means, just rambles without giving much actual information. The novels are good, but the articles assigned are also very boring.

This class strongly influenced how I think about both history and the current world order. There are many assumptions that have become mainstream in the social sciences and policy world about the Global South and what is best for it, which this class challenged. (Of course he has his own biases too.) Work hard, ask questions and you'll learn a lot.

Mandala's classes are as good as you make them.  If you expect your professor to outline the path towards an A, you should avoid his classes.  But his classes are very informative, and if you try to talk to him 1-on-1 about the course material he's very accommodating.  Classes require lots of writing, but he's lenient on deadlines.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: I loved all my classes with Mandala. He is a truly inspirational man. It is a great thing to be taught about Africa and the third world from someone who is actually from there. He makes you work hard, but is available during office hours. Truly kind man.  He wrote me a letter of recommendation for grad school. Learn from someone different.

Don't be afraid of his accent; he is actually a pretty witty guy. However, he is the type of teacher that wants particular things, but will not hint to you what those things are which can be pretty humiliating during class discussion or result in a poor grade on assignments. Besides the novels, class material is pretty boring.

Professor is very hard to understand, the class consists of people going over the readings the whole time - basically a book club you're paying a ton of money for.  Never had any real lectures.  He fell asleep in class a few times, showed a bunch of movies.  Was generally a nice guy, though.

Made a class with incredible potential into one of the worst classes ive taken at school.  All he had us do was summarize readings which we read out loud in class while he just sat there for 2 hours (he fell asleep in class one time), and he simply lectures the last 30 mins of class. also it is hard to understand what he says due to his accent.
Avoid his courses at all cost!!!

All comments here are extremely harsh.  Mandala is an interesting man, while sometimes his lectures can be extremely boring at other times you will be completely enthralled.  He does not express his views as openly as some have previously said and seems to be a very intellectual nice man.  Would recomend this class to any history major
This teacher is one of the most closed minded individuals who, at times, has the ability to make students feel as though their insight is absolutely useless.

Overall, I appreciated my experience in Mandala's Class.  However, I work better in a seminar environment rather than a straight lecture.  Although finding his class difficult, I learned a lot.  Elias may not be hot, but he has a style all his own.

An intelligent man but a poor lecturer.  He assigns good readings and provides pretty decent instruction on a basic level, but his classes are a chore and so is he, sometimes.  Not recommended, but not awful by any stretch.

I think he does a good job in lecture, very interesting material.  Not the most clear professor out there, but he does have sense of humor which clearly can be interpretted as being patronizing.  When I went to office hours for assistance with a research paper, he was very helpful.
Mandala does not give effective feedback about how you are doing in his class and his course objectives are not clear.  In the end, though, you still learn, and he grades easliy.
Worst professor ever. Do not take his classes. Doesn't even know what he is talking about
Ruined the class for me basically. Very patronizing and wants you to be able to read his mind. Take a class with this guy, and you'll greatly wish you hadn't.
the first prof that impressed me profoundly

He is my favorite math prof at u of r. He laid the foundation of my mathematical mindset that benefited my later math-related studies. As a first semester freshman class in the university, it was a hard transition from high school math to proof heavy analysis but he helped me make it interesting and worthwhile. I cannot thank him more
Professor Haessig gives very well-organized lectures and is willing to answer students' questions.

He is very smart, gentle, polite, nice, organized and patient:) He teaches u how to think and his class is full of logics. I think all the students in our class love him!!! Because of him, I decide to change my major into math. Never need to be afraid to ask why and expression my confusion, feel very comfortable to learn math with this professor><.
Very nice professor. I'm considering going to math graduate school after taking his course.
My best decision at this school was to take this class. The lectures are clear and well paced, the content is extremely interesting, and the grading is very fair.
Really good professor. The class was fun and you actually get to learn. The book is really useful too.

The professor often starts class with a good story related to the matter. He jumps into teaching soon enough, and may be fast on some topics, depending on the student. Don't skip class, because you can find yourself lost in the next lecture. And don't expect to read the online notes; the notes on the projector are close to illegible.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: He is really helpful. He explains things patiently and clearly in his office hours. He doesn't give an easy curve though. A lot of students got pretty bad grades in this class. Overall, he is definitely one of the better professors in math department.
Great professor. He really did a great job at teaching the material. He made sure that students understood what he was talking about and he prepared us well for the midterm. Great guy too.

Definitely the professor to take!  He is a math genius who is super approachable and nice and who genuinely cares.  Even the following semester he remembered me and asked how I was doing.  If you don't understand something he is always there to help, and his problem examples are perfect for studying for the exams.  Take him!

Prof. Haessig was a very good professor. At times he seemed a bit unorganized, but it's clear that he knows what he's talking about. He also does a very good job of explaining why things are a certain way and relates to students well. The class isn't super-easy, but it's very manageable. All in all, Haessig is a good choice for a Calc professor.

You quickly realize how smart he truly is. He genuinely cares and wants you to understand the WHY behind math. I actually enjoyed coming to this class although math isn't my favorite subject because he's such a great lecturer.

He is really nice and always is there to help the students. If you have any questions be sure to ask him or just go meet him during office hours. And if you have the slightest interest in majoring in maths or joining research, he is probably the most helpful person around.

Haessig is a nice guy, sort of awkward, but in a good, funny way. Lectures aren't super exciting, but he does a good job of preparing notes that are helpful.  If you go to his office hours he's great.  Exams aren't bad at all if you go to class and do the homework. He really wants his students to do well, and is very willing to help

I love this man. Everything he does makes me laugh, and I was always disappointed when lecture was over. Very clear instruction, the notes I was taking were so useful I felt like I was back in high school. :)

Prof Haessig is a wonderful math prof- and I wish we had more like him at this school. He covers every topic at a good pace, makes sure we understand it, and is very approachable. He always has fun jokes and is always smiling. He genuinely cares about his students and is, over all, a great guy. I am very glad he was hired for a professorship at UR.
This class alone was very difficult, but he in no way made it easier. the only reason i would go to class is because he is hot.

The class was mind-boggling hard.  It was all proof-based, so it sucks for all math minors and majors.  The prof likes to talk to himself during class and then makes crazy exclamations that make no sense, especially if you could not hear what he was mumbling about.
Great professor. Explains concepts very clearly and is extremely helpful. MTH 162Q is a hard class, but grading was very fair. Highly recommended.

One of the top 3 professors I have had in college.  I've had him for 282 and 233, and his lecture notes are flawless.  He really cares about his students and loves what he does.  He even took time out of his busy schedule to have an independent study seminar...please stay at UR Doug!
Good Lectures, feed back, character. Tests are hard, but appropriate curves.

Great teacher. So many teachers at UR are either smart but can't teach or are nice teachers but don't know their stuff. But Haessig is the perfect balance of the two. He's really smart, but still great at explaining difficult subjects. He's very fair when it comes to grading, and he makes class enjoyable with his enthusiasm and sense of humor.

Best teacher I've had at UR (MTH 141+142) He is approachable, friendly, and can make sense out of anything. EXTREMELY helpful; this guy would stay past dark in his office helping me with problems. The class material can be a little tough, just stay on top of WebWork and you will be fine. The tests are almost verbatim from WebWork so do it.
Haessig really wants everyone in the class to learn. He is extremely helpful especially with homework questions. He also will let you turn in homework late and redo your homework if you ask him.

Had Doug for 141 and 142. If you took calc in high school, dont bother going to lecture.  Just do the webwork.  Doug will help you if you have questions, or just go to recitation.  Exams are easy if you've kept up with webwork.  Doug seemed like a good prof, but I didnt go to class much.  From what I hear, the other 141 professors are terrible.
He's a pretty nice guy who honestly wants to teach you the material.

He looks like the dude from scooby doo. (lol) Well he was prolly the best math professor i had at uci. He is clear and concise unlike all the asain math teachers at uci. His tests are straight forward and you should ace his class if you go to lecture.

Professor Manly was inspirational to me this semester. 123 was the first physics class I took at UR, and he certainly continued to inspire the love of physics that I got from a good teacher in high school. The tests are difficult, but doing the problem sets and practicing from old exams makes them absolutely doable.

Manly is a good prof. Lectures are energetic and entertaining but he would often miss a week of classes at a time do to research commitments. Exams were tough and given in a 50 minute time period so you had to race against the clock. All in all the guy is a good prof but the logistics of the class could be much better.

Manly was the professor for my E&M class that was self-paced. At first, he seems really helpful and genuinely interested in the students. Soon, it became clear that was not the case. He and his TA would send emails weeklysaying that he would "laugh in our faces" if we didn't get all the work done and needed help. The emails really put students down

Genuinely invested in teaching and really wants you to understand physics, but not always great at explain things - lecture is often unhelpful. Tests are really tough but fair, and he let's you bring in a formula sheet. Going to workshop and doing the problem sets are essential to passing. The book is super helpful - definitely a must have.

I have a love hate relationship with him. Love him until an exam then hate a few days after exam then I forgive him. You will literally not pass if you don't study and actual learn. You can't just pattern match the problems with how he writes his exams. Very conceptual and creative with writing problems. But I still love him

Manly is funny, interesting, and wholly devoted to his students. There were moments in lecture where he'd lose track of a problem he was doing, but he'd always inform us of the right solution once he'd worked it out properly. His tests are fair, but they're definitely difficult. One of the most dedicated teachers I've had here in a long time.
Great class, don't be concerned about his curve. He respects the effort the class requires and grades accordingly. He's also pretty funny.

He is a funny guy and know the material very, very well. But, if you were not studying regularly, it's very hard, i mean VERY hard, to keep up with. His exams are conceptual and tricky. Understand the concept is a key to do well in his class.

He's pretty interesting in class.  Sometimes he slips into just showing lots of slides in a row, making me painfully aware of the clock above his left shoulder.  His curve doesn't really make sense to me (normalizes all tests to an 70% mean, even if it means students losing points) but my grade in the class turned out alright, so I can't complain.

Took 113 as a freshman. Not a phsyics person but pulled off a B. Manly is a good prof. Exams are hard but not impossible. He curves (even if that means curving DOWN). Graded homework is a booster.  Don't skip lecture.  Workshop was alright.  Labs are easy.

Very enthusiastic and clear. Lectures are usually interesting. 142 was a very challenging course. My average test score was in the 40's but I got a B in the course. Homeworks aren't worth very many points but DO THEM. They will help you more than anything else.

EXCELLENT communication--he e-mailed us constantly with corrections, helpful hints, & other info, and he always added bits of humor to keep things entertaining.  He used a light saber as a pointer, and his method of using a tablet PC projected onto a big screen for lectures was perfect.  Demos were exciting and lectures were interesting. Great guy!

Seems nice, but can turn on you.  Is a bit full of himself. Lecture was at times entertaining. Exams are difficult.  (but people still got 100s, I have no idea how).  Workshop was somewhat helpful.  At least he renormalizes the grades.
What a terrible teacher! And he thinks he's funny too.
best prof in the physics department
Great Guy.  Definitely knew how to party back in his time!
Learned a lot.  Great professor.

Excellent professor.  Very clear/Instructs well.  Uses effective in-class demonstrations.  Instituted small groups which really help learning the material.  Tests are generally fair, and well representative of material that was supposed to be learned.
Manly's awesome!  Good natured, and a great professor.  Makes a painful course slightly easier.
Eager for the students to do well without being overly easy.
He liked White Russians.  Very helpful even though the class was mad hard.
No Comments
No Comments
funny, remembers what it's like to be a college student
enthusiastic, extremely funny
No Comments
No Comments

While it is incredibly difficult to listen to this professor for more than a few minutes at a time, the material is important, and he makes it somewhat relevant. While the assignments are more difficult than they should be, the TAs are accessible. Furthermore, the final is optional, which is always a benefit.
His lectures are so boring, Mohr does not care about the material he is teaching! I wish I took this course with a different professor. DO NOT TAKE ANY CLASSES WITH HIM!
rating_tags: Group projects--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Lectures are boring, and questions on tests/homework are often hard to read. He does less teaching and more of expecting you to know the material. Most lectures are not worth going to. The only important parts are when he gives you excel formulas.

there is no clear grading rubric for homeworks, he does give you 2 extra credit opportunities, he doesnt teach from the slides, he basically doesnt use them at all, he talks as he goes. hes pretty boring and attendance isnt mandatory so you can watch the recordings on 2x speed. if you can, dont take him, if you have to, youll be fine

Professor Mohr clearly wants students to do well in his class, by giving plenty of extra credit and fairly straightforward assignments, but it is hard to stay engaged in his lectures. He is very monotonous and often goes in tangents that don't really help with the content at all. Not a hard course if you know basic finance, though.

Literally the worst professor at the business department. if the class is offered with anyone else - take it with them. He is simply not a good lecturer, gets lost in his words, makes finance an even drier subject than it needs to be. He schedules exams right after fall break and thanksgiving, so you can't spend time with your family. Beware!!!!!!!

Not a good professor, doesn't really teach much, but not terrible. Gives lots of practice tests so you just have to master those and you'll do well on exams. In class assignments are not bad either, you should go to TA office hours to ask how to do questions. Offers 2 extra credit assignments at end of class.

His lectures are do droney and he hardly gets through any important material per class. gets distracted easily. will spend all class on yahoo finance rather than teaching us the material. he skips around slides and is not organized.

A nice guy, but his lectures were incredibly boring. Not a hard class to pass. All of the exams are made up of questions from previous exams, and he gives them out. You would honestly be better off learning the material online than going to class.

Super boring during class. Don't even bother going to his class because you won't learn anything. Use Investopedia and other online resources to learn the materials, and stick to a good group for the homework. He almost always skips office hours, has messy lectures, has unclear wording for the exams, and is very unfit to prep you for the exams.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Ridiculous professor

I don't know whether Derek Mohr really cares about his students. I makes tons of mistakes on both slides and handouts. Most of his class time would go off topic. There is no way to learn something during his office hour since he always skips it.

His way of teaching is pointless. It's hard to keep notes because he always jumps in between slideshows. He claims there are problems with them so he would not teach in sequence but a comment in 2019 stated the same exact thing: he knows and never fixes these issues. It creates so many hardships when u prepare for exams. DO NOT TAKE HIS FIN205 RUN!
His assignments and tests are clearly worded and he makes clear what is demanded. So no unpleasant surprises on the exam.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: great professor
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: He is a really nice person who provides sufficient materials for students to prepare for the exams. Extra credits also provided.
Great Professor, very fair grading and lectures are clear and interesting.

There are other professors at UR teaching fin213. If you really want to lay a solid foundation with the corporate finance material, don't choose his class. Derek doesn't respond to email, and yes, he neither appear in his office hour in most cases. Tests are fair, 65% related to homework and past exam, 15% lecture content, 20% from nowhere

I don't know why his rating is such high. I took the course this year, and he is one of the most irresponsible professors I ever had. He never replied to the email and he never appeared during his office hour. The tests are extremely hard and the contents are totally unrelated to his lectures.
Tests are usually very fair and not really difficult

Great professor! Really cares about his students. Sure the lectures can be boring at times but hes very knowledgeable about finance and often talks about finance in the current news. His grading is very lenient and offers extra credit. Will take him again!
You will learn everything by searching investopedia. His lectures are boring and won't help you do well on the homework or exams. The textbook is confusing and doesn't help too.
Best prof ever, loved lecture
Best professor ever. Could listen to him all day. Very organised, respectful and educated. Every student loves him. Amazing slides and best lectures ever.

Took FIN 204/205 for easy A. Group HWs similar to prev years w/ changed #'s (ask prev. students for answer keys), easy 100%. Exams have formula sheet and q's are variations of PPT,HW, and prev test questions. Memorize Prev test q's, how/ when to use formulas to solve ppt/hw/examples/prev test questions easily. Curves exams. generous Extra Credit.

This professor frequently will read off slides ( he uses the ones provided by the book) and every class he says there's issues with the slides but after years of teaching it seems like he doesn't care enough up to update them. I found him unclear and very difficult to reach. It seems like he just doesn't care.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Mohr is hands down the best professor that I've had at the University of Rochester since coming here. He's respected by his students and deserves to be recognized for his work.
Easy class, clear expectations

Professor Ashby is an amazing teacher of economics. She is my favorite Professor and I encourage everyone taking economics to take her classes. She speaks to you like a friend and when you walk away, you feel like a better person. Her teaching abilities are out of this world and she is a top notch Professor.

My English is not that good and I have troubles listening to most Professors. Professor Ashby teaches her lectures in a way that is easy for me to understand. Professor Ashby takes time and will speak to you outside of class.

Attendance is not graded but you need it to have decent notes. The course is suspiciously easy and the tests are exactly like the homework and problem sets. If you do your work, you are pretty much guaranteed a good grade in the course. The lectures can be extremely boring and Ashby tends to spend a crazy amount of time on trivial things.
Ashby has clear powerpoint for students to review the material. But her grade really depends on exams. And the A grade needs a pretty high exam scores.

Professor Ashby teaching ability is top-notch and is willing to help you succeed in her class. Everyone has their strengths and economics is not mine. I recommend Professor Ashby to everyone who struggles in economics. She is very organized and easy to follow.
ECON 207. Too easy for a intermediate course.

Took both Econ108 and Econ207 with Prof Ashby and she is a great lecturer and person. I recommend her to anyone that wants to get into Econ. Lectures are not recorded so it's important to go to class, exams are based off of HWs and Recitation Questions from the unit, recitations are not required, exams are not cumulative and there is no final exam.
Loved the class and the Professor. I recommend taking her class.

Prof. Ashby is a nice person and is very approachable. Tests are easy and often draw straight from the practice sheets, but her lectures are disorganized. 
Lectures are mainly example based and Prof.Ashby overexplains a lot. Highly suggest reading the textbook, it simplifies most of the concepts so you can understand them.
I do not like Economics, but Professor Ashby is a wonderful teacher. I would recommend other students to take her class.
Great Professor.
Great class and a talented Professor. Professor Ashby really helped with problems I had in economics and directed me in the right direction going forward in the economics world.

Professor Ashby is a very caring professor, I enjoyed taking her class. Homework assignments are manageable, and tests are fair. Pay attention in lecture and ask for help, exams are difficult. Make sure to comprehend the material taught in class and not only memorize the content. Make sure not to fall behind, a lot of content goes into the exam!
Enjoyed Professor Ashby's lectures and she was very helpful whenever I approached her. If you attend class you will have no problem passing.

Took ECON 263. Not a difficult class, lectures were kinda dull. She also never/rarely was able to get through all the slides. Exams weren't difficult, she provides practice problems and goes through examples in class.
Professor Ashby was very helpful when I needed the help. Her classes were clear and easy to understand. I met  with her after class multiple times and she answered all my questions.
Very happy that Professor Ashby came to Rochester. I was advised by a fellow student to take her class and I am glad I listened to her. She is such a nice person and a great teacher of economics.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: My friend went to Syracuse University where Professor Ashby previously worked and recommended me to take her courses. I have taken two of her classes now and Professor Ashby is a amazing instructor. I am very excited that I listened to my friend.
Was scared to take economics and after taking her class I am not scared anymore.

Love her teaching style. Professor Ashby breaks things down and makes it easy to learn the material. She is refreshing and has a peaceful presence about her. Glad she made the move to Rochester. I have always struggled in this area and she made it easy for me.

Her teachings make it very easy to learn the material. Do the work and go to class and you will have no problems scoring high in her class. Professor Ashby will always help you if you reach out to her. Great addition to University of Rochester. If you are serious in Economics take her class.

Very nice Professor who is down to earth. Professor Ashby took the time to help me when I really needed the help.  Economics is not the most exciting class to take, but she does her best job to get you through  it. Just a good person.
Lectures are organized. Is willing to help if you ask. You will do well in class if you put your time in. If you have to take econ take her class.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: ECON207: Lectures will put you to sleep. Teaches nothing new, yet somehow makes it more complicated. Fair tests, but weigh a lot. Hard to get an A in this class. Need a $130 online text book and HW software. Lectures are vague, and homework is specific. Not a bad professor, just a poorly structured class. You will do fine, but hate every second
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Do you work and study for the tests. Economics is really never exciting to learn, but Professor Ashby does a great job. If you go to all the lectures you will have no problem.

Seems like a nice person but teaches like a high school teacher that doesn't care about their job. Has "other important things to do." If you want to pass her class you shouldn't come to lectures because you will fall behind. Instead, read the text book and practice with the website you spent $130 on! WARNING (Don't take pictures of her slides!!)

Dr. Ashby is an amazing Professor. She is very organized and conveys her material with ease. She is willing to help you if you are having troubles and cares about making you a better student. I love her class and hope she stays at Rochester.
Though she is a good person, her lab lectures and her criteria of both prelabs and postlabs are driving me crazy both this semester and last semester.

Had her for lab lecture. Lab is fine, only 1 lab report and others are just post-lab worksheets graded super easily. Lab lecture attendance is basically mandatory, easy hw assignments. Feel like lecture is a waste of time tho bc you don't learn anything lab related, you just learn life skills - feel like my time can better be used for smtg else.

It is one thing to genuinely care for a student's ability to succeed, it is another thing to fill countless *Chemistry* lab lectures with assignments solely about study skills. Students need to learn about lab techniques, not how some student managed to go from F to A with the prof's study techniques.

A lot of people said that she is mean and picky, but if you follow every thing said on the syllabus, it is easy to get a good grade. If you are still worried, you can go to her office hour. She is actually quite approachable and funny sometimes and very willing and patient to answer the questions you have.

(*Note the 137) Yeah she is strict and her lab manuals have several spelling errors, but it never affected her teaching or my learning. Her office hours were always reliable and so were the TAs'. If you're afraid of losing points or whatever they're happy to check if you're right or not. The labs were a good supplement/review for the main material.

Semi-regular homework assignments, dull lectures, only one credit. This add on was begging to be treated like a class in its own right. Just go to lab and do the assignments and you will do fine. They removed the need to do lab reports so it'll be a breeze.
rating_tags: Group projects--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: The labs were a good learning experience and also and taught me how to keep an organized scientific notebook. She's a kind professor and cares that her students understand the experiments. I liked her lectures.

We get very lengthy instructions in our lab manuals but we're given little to no help beyond that, directions can be very confusing and contain many typos, making some questions impossible, and grading is wildly inconsistent across different TAs. Points can be taken off for things never explicitly asked for in instructions. Awful class.

She's strict about things but honestly the lab manual carried my entire grade. While there are grammatical errors, the lab manual takes you through every single step and actually teaches you how to do problems unlike some professors. A good TA is still pretty important, but she makes them all have office hours so you can just go see another one.
She's helpful during lab lecture but oftentimes not very accommodating. Her TAs do the grading which was relatively fair. Her homeworks were easy.

The lectures were mainly just teaching basic Microsoft skills and filling in a worksheet for attendance. The labs were fine but did take a long time to complete. Your lab grade is a quarter of your overall CHEM 131 grade. There is a few extra credit points towards the end to boost your grade. FREQUENT EMAILS
Your grade mainly depends on your TAs. Pray for good ones.

I heavily disliked CHEM 131 lab and lab lecture. The labs were shoddily designed and confusing, and Dr. Stanford was not receptive to genuine inquiry from my classmates. On the other hand, the lab lectures were dreadfully easy and gave me a minimal knowledge of Excel I could just as easily get off YouTube. Only take this if you absolutely must.

This is her second or third year doing CHEM 131 lab and she decided to rewrite the entire lab manual. The experiments are standard, but the manual is riddled with errors. Seriously, did anyone proof read it? Additionally, the post lab questions are way beyond the scope of our 131 lecture. More communication is needed between 131 and 131L.
Terrible teacher.
She took off all 3 points for one small missing calculation which is just ridiculous because it is not an accurate representation of the work completed.

This professor is the most awful one that I have ever met in U of R. The whole CHEM 131 teaching team is chaotic. There are no clear guideline of how to complete the post-lab work, and it's even due before the first lab lecture. She can be hardly accessed by email, and her words on webpage indicated "Don't contact me for most of the time". Worst!!!
Prof Stanford inherited the old guys labs and didn't have enough time to change them for her first year but she did what she could to make them easier to understand/complete
Dr Stanford is a very good instructor.  She is very well prepared and presents things in a organized manner. She does make you work for a good grade,

I had Dr. Stanford for first semester and initially was not a fan because the lab lectures had a lot of information packed into such a short amount of time. However, this semester, the material in lab lecture lined up with the course, so it was easier to follow, and I actually learned more in lab lecture versus regular lecture. Love her dogs too :)
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: 95% of the lab lectures were useless, the only good parts were the last 4-5 slides with sample calculations for the lab. I asked her to check my work for one question during lab lecture and she told me I was wrong, but when she showed the answer it was the same as mine..? Luckily the TAs were often just as confused as students so they helped w/labs

Lab lectures were confusing and not helpful for completing the post lab report or making sense of experiments. She would speed through slides and then tell us to work on the worksheets and yell at us when we were confused. Not very helpful and very critical in a destructive way. No way to get around having her if you take chem though.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: The lab for CHEM137 is stupendously long and incredibly awful when it comes to grading, can you believe that merely the TA signature takes up half of the points for a lab?! You work your ass off to get all calculations correct, yet you lose half of the points because of the absence stupid TA signature! Even you took all the data!

I don't know, the lab lectures were incredibly confusing and I didn't even understand the material until the actual lab to be honest. Her emails also seem very passive aggressive when you ask her a question. Like, one word responses when you type an entire formal paragraph length email. I did just fine in labs with TAs being the ones teaching us.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Stanford is new at the university, taking over for the old department leader (I think). The labs given were from the last head and don't relate to the class and are often very confusing. Dr. Stanford is remaking the labs to be more reasonable and relatable to the class. I appreciate her effort in bettering the curriculum.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: I have so much respect for Dr. Stanford. She knows the labs we have to do are brutal and don't make sense, and she's spent a lot of time adjusting them and teaching us calculations step by step to make it easier on us. Makes the math and concepts understandable, & has a pretty good sense of humor. Very grateful for the fact that she made lab easier
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Roy is a pretty good professor but I do agree that his exams are hard to study for. Your final grade consists of HW and 2 exams so you really need to lock it in for this class. I would recommend atttending class and doing all the HW as that really reflects on your exam in my opinion. Overall, I think an A is definitely attainable!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: one multiple choice question counts for 5 points. If you messed up two, this is A to A-
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Terrible grading scale and extremely subjective. Has changed his approach to the very basics each and every year. Tests if you get one question wrong you get five points off. Lectures are very boring, overall a painful class to take.

This is the only class in my entire 4 years of college that I was not able to get an A or A- on. His tests are extremely subjective and you do not know what he is looking for in his answers. Frustrating class in general. Good luck if you are taking him because your grade will depend on luck more than your knowledge in the materials.
This is the only class in my entire 4 years of college that I was not able to get an A or A- on. His tests are extremely

Not a terrible professor, but there was almost no grading criteria. Most of the assignments were completely subjective, and while he didn't grade them hard, they were annoying to complete, as you have no idea what he is looking for. Tests don't make any sense and there is no point studying for them. Frustrating course overall.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: The coursework isn't very hard, and he seems like a decent guy.  But an insane portion of his tests are purely opinion-based but graded for accuracy.  It is incredibly frustrating when you spend plenty of time preparing just for him to ask about something he did not cover.  Also a very boring lecturer, very tough to get through at times.
Not good.
Great course. Professor Jones is approachable and care about his students.

Useless class. He teaches material about 'technology' that my 100-year old great-grandma should already be aware of. I am convinced that I know more than he does about technology. Instead of wasting my time, I wish I watched some cat videos on YouTube instead.

Prof is a pretty nice guy and classes were pretty chill and interesting. Like others said, only problem was the exam grading being a bit subjective. Totally bombed the first exam but completely nailed the second exam and still got a B+. HWs were straightforward and graded fairly. Going over lecture recordings to study def helped.

Was kind of a chill business class. Professor is a good guy but the issue is that his exams and some assignments are very subjective. You kind of have to answer based on his own opinion which he doesn't seem to understand which is very annoying. Not hard though, but does depend a bit on luck.

After the exam, I asked ChatGPT to redo the questions for me, and for almost every question, I got an answer that is different from the solution key.

If you ask the professor, he would say, "ChatGPT is wrong." If you ask me, I would say the professor is wrong.

Who is right?

Ridiculous. Extremely subjective exams yet he decides which options is the "best" with little to no justifications, and he insists on doing so through multiple choice only. It doesn't matter if you understand the material or not, getting a good grade really depends on luck in his class.
Bad.
Most boring lectures I have ever had but he is a nice guy. Homework is fair i feel and the exam is also fair with a curve.

You can do better in his exams if you don't study for them - total nonsense. You can be Oppenheimer and still not do well in his exam, unbelievable. One of the worst classes I have ever taken in my life.

Lectures are good but you won't be able to do good on exams even though you went to the lecture. The exam questions are very subjective and ambiguous that you end up guessing what's the "best" answer even though they can all be correct in some way. Exam grades made up almost all grading.
Homework were easy but exams were unfair. The exams are extremely arbitrary and he decided it would be best to use a multiple choice format for all questions.
The Best business Professor ever seen.Always manage to improve the class experience. Tests are fair.

Great 5 star teacher, I get B+ because I didnt try harder; I think an A is not difficult to achieve! Very interesting lectures, kind teacher, easy to talk with, test was fair in my perspective. If u are thinking of a business class, CIS220 is the one!!! And there is recordings!!!
Jones is a great professor. Very interesting course and very organized. 10/10 reccomend. Far better than BUS220
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Very organized professor, everything is clear and straight. I would recommend him
This man is so dry and doesn't explain concepts in class, please note that he tries to make his class harder semester by semester.

Very unorganized but it is made up by how easy the class is. Had one midterm and one non-cumulative final that took 20 minutes. Easy individual and group assignments. He has 5% for participation which he awards you if you can put your name to your face so attendance is partly mandatory although he does not officially record it.
Easy class, easy professor. Marketing on the Internet isn't anything complicated. No midterm.. grade is based on final exam which takes 20 minutes and easy case assignments.
Easy to understand, and an easy class overall.

The best Spanish teacher at the University!! He truly cares about his students and is so accommodating for any problems you may be facing outside of class. Super kind and patient, I really recommend taking him as. professor over the other ones if you have the option to.

Kirt is so amazing. The most caring professor on this campus. Please talk to him if you're struggling, he is soooo accommodating. Spanish is the third language I am learning and English is my second language so I often struggled to keep up in this class but he was soo helpful and always had such a good attitude everyday. Loved him and this class.

By far the nicest and most understanding professor I've ever had. He is excited to teach and always welcoming. Assignments are very manageable with fairly frequent, yet understandable quizzes. Each class is discussion-oriented and he is always helpful and judgement-free if you get stuck while speaking in Spanish. Great feedback too!

Professor Komocki comes to class prepared and excited to teach. He is always enthusiastic about the subject matter at hand and makes everything extremely clear. There are quite a few quizzes, but they are all pretty easy and straightforward as long as you review the notes he posts. He is extremely accessible, kind, and accommodating.

Amazing professor. He makes going to class enjoyable and even though participation is important, you're never scared of getting something wrong. Probably the kindest and happiest professor you'll ever have. Do yourself a favor and take this class if he's the professor, he'll make your day every class.

Professor Komocki is one of the best professors I have ever had. He makes Spanish class fun through his positive energy, exciting lectures, and his creative ties. He's always available outside of class for help, and if you're willing to put in the work, you will succeed. I looked forward going to his class every day, and am going to miss his class.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Kirt Kimocki is that old memory of a teacher who showed up to class excited to be teaching others. He's charismatic, respectful, and accommodating. He's not afraid to adapt or even embarrass himself if it means that his students may learn the course's content better. A class-act professor and a decent human being. Also impeccable taste in ties.

Be prepared to speak a lot of Spanish, but also learn a lot! This class is super collaborative and you will get a lot of practice speaking and reading Spanish. The class is not homework heavy and if you do have questions about the work, Prof. Komocki is very helpful. It's obvious that he cares about his students and wants everyone to succeed.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: By far the best Spanish professor I've ever had. Class is pretty participation-heavy, but he doesn't make you feel judged for getting something wrong, which I really appreciated. He's very accommodating and easy to contact if you need any help or have questions.

My favorite professor, super accommodating and overall really cares for his students. As long as you show up and make an effort you will get a good grade. Super nice guy who genuinely cares for his students, ESPECIALLY during covid.
Super great guy. If you put in the work he will help you.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: Great Professor. Cares about his students and is willing to discuss your grades. Would always take him again.

Kirt is an amazing professor and he really cares about his students. He might seem like a tough grader but he puts a lot of effort into grading, and gives you a chance to write a draft/ final. If you are unsure how to correct your assignments, just talk to him. He is super open to helping his students.
Very enthusiastic, very detailed notes

One of the best Spanish professors I've ever had! Very patient, genuinely cares that everyone feels comfortable speaking in Spanish, and makes his class relatively easy as long as you put in the work. Always available for extra help during office hours and before and after class.

Kirt is honestly one of my favorite professors I've ever had, period. He makes his lectures really interesting and engaging and will always help you out when needed or give an extension if you email him. He obviously loves what he teaches so it makes the experience that much more enjoyable. Had him for 152 too and I loved it. Pick Kirt for classes!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: One of the best professors I've ever had. Super nice and funny with interesting lectures. Very approachable and gives clear feedback. The tests and papers are easy as long as you put in the work.
He's really sweet and is willing to slow down. He doesn't make anyone feel stupid and he is very open-minded. A great professor with lots of enthusiasm.

Kirt is a super great teacher, very enthusiastic about Spanish which makes it all the more fun to learn. Very clear and helpful to students. You won't do bad if you put in the work and show a real passion for learning Spanish.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment: One of the best professors at U of R. He's very funny, engaging, understanding, and smart. He makes learning spanish so much fun. If you're not ready to commit 4 days a week for this class, it's not for you. Participation matters! (: Would recommend!!

Kirt is great! I had him for SP 152 and 200 and he was great both times. Really energetic and easy to understand, and if you put in a little effort you will do well. He's just an all around great guy.
keeps students really involved. always enthusiastic.
Funny proffessor, which makes it easy for his students with clear material. Impossible to fail with him. Great!!

Kirt is honestly one of the most fun and creative teachers for SP 101. He makes the class fun and incorporates students into the lesson, without studying you will have a B. If you study the material it is a easy A and you actually learn spanish.  If you are looking to study Spanish 101 make sure to pick Kirt.

Very great teacher! Always super enthusiastic and helpful. You will never be bored in this class, professor Komocki always incorporates individuality and freedom in this Advanced Spanish Composition class!
awesome

Far too much to memorize and you wind up feeling incompetent. Wasn't there half the time, with the substitute being useful if not as dry as the Gobi desert. When he's there he's a great guy and really knows what he's talking about. He obviously doesn't want to be teaching an intro class, though.
Smart guy, funny lecturer, but the class has so much stuff you have to memorize. Not very available as far as office hours and email contact goes

The content was hard, but it was a privilege to be in the presence of Pouget. He clearly knew what he was talking about, and he speaks well. He wasn't there all the time, but his co-Professor was just as qualified. Loved him.
There was a lot of material, but I'm so amazed by how much I learned.  Dr. Pouget was organized and really passionate about BCS.  He was a lot funnier than I expected.

This class is based on memorization, but if you start 2-3 weeks before the exam and cover a little every few days, you should do well.  I was closer to the B range, but he was nice enough to move me to a B+. (This might not work for everyone-special circumstances) The material's dense, but he does his best to liven up class with a few jokes

Challenging class. Lot's of informations to memorize. I found reading the book quite helpful for reviewing before taking midterms. Eventhough his lecture slides are online, attending to class is crucial to pass the class. I personally enjoyed this class and learned many informations. I would highly recommend this class.

This class is tough. The midterms are based entirely on  the lectures so reading the book was pointless. I found the notes he posted online to be very helpful when it came time to studying. The final exam was pretty brutal. Overall, I learned a ton in a very short amount of time and Pouget always tries to thrown in some jokes to keep us entertained

This is not an easy course, theres a LOT of material to be remembered...but Pouget somehow gets the information across and its not terribly hard to get an A if you spend a great amount of time studying. Tests are all multiplce choice, but r very detailed and tricky.

Knows his material, but his accent--he's french--sometimes prevents clear understanding.  And, as a lecture class in a large dark room with padded seats at 9:40 in the morning?  Zzzzzzz...  literally.
Good professor considering the amount of information given and class sizee.  Just wish he placed more priority on the class and used less guest lecturers.
He got me excited about BCS!   When I came into the class, I didn't even know what BCS really was.  Now, I want to major in it!

Alex is an expert in computational modeling. He expects a high level of performance. The syllabus claims the class is for all math skills but be prepared for lots of derivations and much more intensity than Robbie's 512 course.  CS446 Foundations of AI is a good complement to the course. You can learn quite a bit about modeling if you work hard.
YEA. pougets cool. amazone dote coame, axone, things of that nature. 110s better than 111
Pouget is awesome. He is really cool and funny (without trying to be). Kinda awkward and French. Lectures are interesting and clear. He does a great job. Tests are multiple choice and easy.
Material is great, he doesn't teach much... which is a shame because his lectures are easy to follow, but he seems to pick good guest lecturers
No Comments
good class you learnm a lot and its hard to organize it all but it is a good class
too many guest lecturers, incredibly knowledgable, intense lecturer but very worthwhile.  HOT!
Basically he shows up sometimes and lectures, otherwise the (stupid) TAs do everything.
did he teach the class? hmmm, i remember a holtzman
Definitely a good lecturer. You don't fall asleep in the class of 250 students. Only problem was too many guest lecturers who were not as good as he was.
love that accent
He's nice as a person, but his teaching skills need some help.  He's not very assertive.
he taught less than half of our classes
Too many guest lecturers

Willis is clearly knowledgable and passionate about her work. Class mostly focused on analyzing films scene by scene. Readings were assigned but were rarely needed to understand course material. Lots of papers throughout the semester but students who watch the films and do the writing thoughtfully should excel in the course.

AHST254
Decent lectures, spend the entire time analyzing films scene by scene. Very unorganized, and hard to take notes on. Graded on 3 take-home exams that are each 3 essays (2-3 pgs each). Insists that the long readings are vital but...I never read any of them and excelled in the class. Just watch the assigned movies and write some decent essays
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Hilarious--Graded by few things

comment: I love Professor Willis, her lectures are very interesting, even for a stem kid like myself, and flow nicely. Her vocabulary takes some getting used to but once you adjust, her lectures are very comprehensive. You will read a lot, but I would advise picking one reading per week to really delve into and annotate, as her exams will be based on them.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: Sharon Willis is one of my absolute favorite professors. I always take her classes because I just love the way she lectures. She is SO SMART and her vocabulary is amazing. Her lectures are even poetic, the ways she speaks can take a little getting used to but once you are in the groove with her she is fantastic. She is also really encouraging

Amazing professor. Incredibly smart and funny. Her vocabulary may be intimidating at first, but you get used to her way of lecturing and she is truly great at what she does. Makes you think about things you never thought about before. Take this class if you like art and culture and contemplating and writing.

Difficult to get used to her way of speaking at first. However, her lectures are pretty inspirational and encouraging to participate as long as you have done the readings. Hard to get a very decent grade on exams (long papers) because she would judge upon grammar, but A- or B+ is not hard as long as you understand all the lectures.

Lecture heavy and lots of reading assignments. The final grade is based on 3 takehome exams and your participation. As long as you read what Professor Willis tells you to do and go to the lectures you will know how to write the exams. Exam questions are posted on bb 1 week before it's due, you will have enough time to write if you start early.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Willis deeply cares about the material and it shows in her lectures. There is a heavy focus on class discussion and participation. Stay up to date with your screenings and you will be fine! She is a wonderful woman who cares for her students and their well being. Highly recommend, especially if your major isn't in Media.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS
