When people say that college professors rarely have enough time to meet with their students, clearly they have not met professor Dalecki. And yeah, she tests what she teaches. There are no random questions, or trick questions for that fact.
Amazing class. I learned so much from her. She is clear and easy to follow. Lectures were interesting and relevant.
loves her students...great prof
Nice and friendly, suitable for the introductory course she teaches. Course is relatively easy for serious engineers-to-be but can be tedious with the labs.

VERY easy class, however she is a really good professor- very clear and straightfoward. Could make the course just a little bit more challenging... The stuff on the tests is what she actually teaches, not some random bs
Best Professor yet, she has a great teaching style and is very helpful.
Very good all around professor! Very clear and straightforward in lecture and on tests though course is hard but doable
A great professor. Makes the class challenging, but still introductory and she's always there to help and clarify.
No Comments
Very clear and easy to talk to.

I like Prof Powell, he seems like a nice old gentleman, but honestly his class is quite dull and usually puts me to sleep. My love for political science was completely destroyed after taking his class. The worst thing is I did pretty well through most of the semester and screwed up my final and only got A-.

I liked Prof Powell, but he was pretty boring. Granted, I took a ten AM online class with him, but I love politics, and was struck by how boring it was. His lectures were informative and educational, but they lacked pizazz, anecdotes, or really any kind of humor. The readings were short, repetitive, and easy to keep up with, and the tests were easy
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: He is boring. He is respectable and knows what he is talking about, but he manages to make an interesting topic boring. The class is very easy, however.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: He is very approachable, even willing to meet me beside office hours. But he sometimes speaks in a very low volume and makes it really difficult to hear. He is very knowledgeable but he gave out large amount of information in no particular order, which is sometimes annoying.
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: The most boring class I have ever take in my life. Just read the book and its clearer than classes. As an international student, nowing all the stuff he talks about, but still don't get good grades for not writing enough pages for the test essays (got all the points though). Will never take PSC, since aparently I am not suitable for this subject.

I had a relatively easy time, because I had taken Comp. Pol. at another school and was already familiar with most of what was discussed, but as long as you keep up with the reading and go to class, it shouldn't be hard to at least get a solid B. He's not the most charismatic or engaging speaker, but he is friendly, knowledgeable and helpful.

VERY CLEAR AND KNOWLEDGEABLE PROFESSOR.I never opened the book and just attended lectures & took notes and received a great grade. His lectures are superb and require attention. His TAs are okay at summarizing but the Powell has superior teaching methods. His knowledge shines through the class.

Lectures were hard to understand at times, due to clarity issues and volume. T.A.'s are helpful. The tests were a lot easier than I expected. Reading the book seemed to help a lot of people. It's more about concepts than facts which is nice.

I didn't enjoy the PSC101 class. We went over 4 countries--U.S., UK, Russia, and Germany, and I felt like the class and recitation were dry and not very interesting. The class focused more on how policies differed in other countries as opposed to a discussion of varying views on how a country should be governed. I wish class was more interesting.

Powell is a great guy, really loves political science and democracy. He's hard to hear though because he speaks so quietly, but what he does say is wicked important. It's almost impossible to get an A, the TAs are vicious. Great guy though, remembered who I was even after the course was over. I'd definitely take his class again. (DO THE READING!!)
Same opinion as everyone else basically. Really friendly guy. Class wasn't too difficult. Some lectures pretty boring. I suggest going to class. Its not enough just copying down the lecture outlines.

Not an incredibly interesting class, but he's pretty awesome.  Very knowledgeable and helpful.  Minimal grades in the class, and his TA's grade the exams pretty hard (albeit not well).  But it was definitely worth taking.
He's a very good professor but he reminds me of harry caray (the famed cubs announcer) a little bit. In my mind this is an added bonus. CUBS WIN!!! CUBS WIN!!!
His lectures are very clear and precise, but can be somewhat boring. Tests are straightforward.  Very friendly and helpful.
Wonderfully frinedly guy.  Really knows his stuff -- lectures precisely and knowledgeably.  Lectures are not always interesting, however.
very smart, nice and helpful. only drawback is that he can be somewhat boring. very good professor overall
He's very nice and helpful if you go to his office hours. He's also very organized. However, his classes are dry and he's not good at generating discussion.

Lectures are sometimes bland, but he is extremely well-prepared, approachable, helpful, and informative. Uses overhead for lecture-objectives, allows class to vote on countries to study, made midterm 2 & final paper both optional - extra weight on final. Tough grader but very fair. Very solid prof.
Great guy. Very enthusiastic and helpful, very approachable.
Don't take his 101 class if you're looking for an easy A, you won't get it.  But he's a nice guy.
He's so nice, and very enthusiastic about the subject.  A cool guy.
No Comments
No Comments

One of the best professors I had at University of Rochester. She is very knowledgable and organized, and she is willing to help if any students had difficulty with the content. Although she talks fast, she does many practices to make sure you understand the materials. I rarely been to her lectures because it is recorded but I truly love her class.
Great professor. Made ACC 201 enjoyable. Class was cumulative, so attending lectures is important. Exams were not difficult.
Just so good. I take note and listen carefully every lecture and do all questions, just do your work and it would be very good outcome
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational--Lecture heavy

comment: She is kind and helpful.

- Pretty straightforward - Open to help during office hours - Lecture heavy (attendance is not mandatory, but you won't pass if you do not attend class) - Exams reflect class material - No graded homework
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: She is the best professor you can ever meet in U of R. She is so willing to teach whatever she knows to her students and always ready to help students either inside the class or outside classes. Though she teaches fast, you can always learn a lot if you pay attention. I thought I did not like accounting until I met her. She is so amazing! Love her!
Either you like her or not. Her lectures are too fast and she covers topics VERY quickly. She's willing to help outside of class and is a nice person.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Hands down the best professor I've come across! Makes learning Accounting interesting :)

Prof Iyer is hands down the BEST professor I've ever met! She makes the tedious concepts of accounting really easy to comprehend and she is always glad to offer help to students. ACC201 is a basic class to be honest but I would be more than glad to take more of her classes in the future if she offers. Just amazing!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures

comment: Very helpful and wants her students to succeed. Gives lots of additional practice and even conducts additional lectures to answer questions and help students.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: The class is graded on just 3 exams, so it was stressful to get a good grade, especially if you fall behind. I look at the reviews below and they all say tests are easy As. I disagree. Or maybe the tests got harder this year. I did not find accounting concepts easy and the tests seemed rather difficult. She teaches really well and is respected.

I really enjoyed Professor Iyer's class. Although, I had no prior knowledge of accounting, her comprehensive lectures and chapter problems she gave made it easier to understand concepts. Exams aren't tough if you pay attention in class.
Amazing professor! very clear lectures. exams are not hard and there is little homework.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: She genuinely cares about the students and directly helps them understand how to get their scores reflect what they know, and not be overwhelmed by exams. She has in-depth knowledge of accounting and does her level best to deliver it to students effectively. Great teacher.

Amazing professor, who makes you interested in accounting. Goes through concepts very fast, but if you pay attention and ask her questions (she is very helpful and approachable outside of class and via e-mail), you will be fine. I did not do any of the HW from the textbook, but went through all of the problems sets before the exams, which helped.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: So I didn't do so great in her class because I the material is very easy so I thought I knew it and I wouldn't prepare. She actually genuinely cares about her students though and will reinforce ideas and make sure all of the students are up to date and up to speed. sometimes she holds review sessions which are extremely helpful.
Professor Iyer is a great teacher and explains everything really well. Very helpful and accessible too. Would recommend her class to everyone.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Easy class. Great teacher. Save more. Live better. Walmart.
Super nice professor. She explains everything clearly. I went to her office hours a lot, she will slowly explains everything again to me.  Easy test, if you study a lot and do all the exercises.

A natural at teaching! She gives thorough answers to the questions asked both in and out of class, super patient, and provides plenty of learning material and examples. Like the person before me said- Prof. Iyer's business professional outfits are absolutely perfect!
She explains thoroughly, gives good application, and her outfits are always 100% on point. What a classy lady.
Easy exams, goes slow in class with multiple explanations and examples to make sure people understand the material. Hands outs problem sets, notes, and old exams
Textbook is better than professor, she uploads all her class materials. Easy exams.
hes cool

Prof Eberly is truly a great lecturer. Though, you shouldnt take his class if you are not a genius in math and physics. PHYS 143 is very rigorous and need very advanced linear algebra, calculus to master this. I'd say it probably harder than PHYS 237 later. but definitely a great course if u dont care about pressure

Time consuming weekly Homework with few helpful resources for questions. Tests are extremely difficult, and practically impossible to study for due to lack of practice problems and brain teaser type of questions asked. Lectures are just derivations with no conceptual information. Would not recommend PHY 143. Extremely difficult with little payoff.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I am sort of NAVY guy and want to be the Professor myself. Cannot imagine being dressed like Eberly at the lecture in a suit church-like perfect style and teach not wearing uniform or para-uniform at the same time. Enormously difficult job for me. Perfect lecturer under extremely heavy conditions. Perfect lectures. Dream home exams, my favorite.
One of the best professors in the Physics department. Definitely take his class. I wasn't interested in Quantum at all previously, but now I am even considering it as my specialization.

Best class of college so far! Loved him and his teaching. Difficult, but worth the feeling you get when you figure his problems out. Very particular sense of humor (dry, witty, and sarcastic), so beware of taking things he says too seriously! :)

One of the best classes I ever took. It cemented my love for science and math. If you go into the class with an open mind and expect it to be the most rigorous class in your schedule then you'll be fine. If you disrespect it, you will get burned. The more you put in, the more you get out.

Makes Quantum actually easy and very graspable. Only gripe is that he spends a lot of time going over math, and the math is beyond what the prereqs require. But if you know basic diff. eq. you're golden- if you don't, I'd suggest looking over a book before taking the class.
I would say that, with pretty good confidence, most of my fellow students agree that Eberly is just not what he's meant out to be.

May be smart, but bad at teaching. Very hard to follow, and most of material is math, and very little concepts. Tests are unreasonable. Class requires a lot more work than any other class, with lab, wrkshop, lecture, weekly graded hw. Would not recommend.

He's brilliant. As a professor, he's great if you're interested in the theoretical aspect of physics. He emphasizes creativity in proofs. Several of his proofs left me open mouthed and profoundly excited about the subject. I'm a physics major because of professor Eberly.

His tests were awesome...they really aligned with class material, you got to pick and choose questions, and doing extra questions gave you bonus points.  Great lecturer.  Homework could be tedious at times, but a lot of the time hw questions appeared on exams.
Prof. Eberly is an incredible person and a brilliant physicist. It's worth getting to know him.

His lectures are very difficult to understand, focusing entirely on derivation.  Besides the few times when he talks down to students when we miss something on a test or don't answer a question in class, he generally ignores our presence.  You probably have to take his class - just use the book and TAs and hope for the best.

He's incredibly smart but expects too much of his students. Lectures focus entirely on the math rather than concepts and it's hard to follow what he says in class. He's the classic case of a teacher who thinks he's teaching well but no one understands him and so workshops are where the TA says "So here's what you should have learned..." Annoying.

He's a really smart guy with a quirky sense of humor. His lectures are excellent, and very clear. It's true that he has high expectations. He expects his students to be competent. Willing to answer questions. And he's the President of the Optics Society of America. Wow.
Does well explaining hard material. HW is indeed loooong, but interesting and not terribly difficult. Tests are easy, but easy to lose points as well. He makes lectures pretty interesting.

He is very discouraging because he treats you like an idiot. Very demeaning and possibly ****. Its better to go to the TA's and not him because he will just make you feel bad for not knowing EVERYTHING about physics

many people say he's difficult but that's easily compensated for by lax grading and an abundance of extra credit--120%!  he's a good guy as long as he thinks you're busting your butt--i went to off hours once without being read and got my butt handed to me for it.  material till first test difficult but the rest is piece of cake.  hw VERY LONG.

He is an excellent lecturer, but he gets quite upset when people don't know their basic trig identities, formula for solving geometric series, etc.  However, his temper does get in the way of his teaching on occasion.
A bit "aloof" in person, but an excellent professor for a challenging class.  Also has a good sense of humor and keeps lectures pretty interesting.

Teaches a course that is very challenging in the best way. Rigorous, difficult material is presented fast, but he isn't aloof to students' needs or difficulties. Responds well to interest shown outside of class (e.g. students going to his office hours).
Good, intelligent and clear professor but with a nasty temper

The class used extremely interesting material, but there was no room for discussion. A sometimes hilarious professor but I usually found myself just doing chores or falling fully asleep during endless online lecture. Clearly loves his work but not accommodating, not clear on grading, and not very memorable outside of some moments of true insanity

No clear grading criteria on anything at all and no feedback, the class was at times so elementary it was insulting, the man went over character and setting with a group of college students. But he was a jolly man so at least theres that.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I would give him a zero if I could. He was not accommodating at all during a pandemic and wouldn't let you be excused from class if you were sick. He also had no clear grading criteria and didn't provide us with any feedback. It was a mess.

Avoid him like the plague. Professor Eaves has no syllabus, no clear organizational process, and never came to class prepared for his lectures. Every lecture he would speak on topics that had nothing to do with the coursework we were being assigned. Easily the worst class I've ever taken at UR. Please value your sanity and don't waste your time!

Don't take his classes. He has no grading system and refuses to give any feedback at all. He spends every class lecturing about completely irrelevant topics and never lets us discuss, even when we have interesting things to say about the material. He is literally a walking talking disaster. Every class I went to was a complete waste of time.

I had such high expectations for the course material going into the semester but Professor Eaves and his irrelevant lectures squashed it. There was no clear organization of the course and we did not get feedback on our assignments. There was little opportunity to discuss during class. This class could have been an email.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: There's no direction in Morris's class. There's ambiguous assignment instructions, no feedback, and lectures that are way off topic and lead no where. Don't expect to learn anything in this class. Little class engagement, not a lot of assignments, so if you do poorly on just one or two, you're out of luck.

I've found that at the end of a lecture in this course, I usually have learned nothing. This class is heavily based on discussion. Although the work is easy, it's sometimes difficult to understand what Morris is looking for within an assignment. He also tends to go on tangents during lectures. Very boring course.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Excellent professor.. extremely bright with a great vocabulary that makes you run to the dictionary to understand him......... occasional curse words ok. If you like to read very difficult passages and explain them or write long very detailed papers full of English perfection you will like his classes.

Very laid back and cool guy which adds to a comfortable class atmosphere. This class is very discussion oriented. It's an easy class as long as you do his short writing assignments (no more than one page) for almost every class. He's a passionate and oddly engaging professor!
He's AWESOME

I think "strange little guy" summarizes him quite well.  Kind of a lame class, but still kept my interest - we had a lot of outside speakers come in and talk about cool topics.  He's a good guy, he isn't stupid, he's just.....off.  Work's not bad at all b/c it's pretty open, no guidelines really.
Took ENG 101 and 225/420. Easy classes if you're prepared to write for every class.  Awesome guy.
strange little fella

Professor Eaves, though highly unorthodox, is an excellent professor.  Unfortunately he is also a real stickler for things like class attendance and punctuality of written assignments, which are due nearly every class.

Morris' class is not for the faint of heart, but they are worth it.  I simply mean that if you want clear-cut answers by the end of the year and a set, unalterable syllabus at the beginning, choose a different class.  He likes to plan as he goes, but it all works out in the end.  He's funny as hell and very supportive.
Great teacher. Fun
Although Morris is very funny and has alot of personality, there is very little direction in this class. I wouldn't recommend it.
Morris rules
No Comments
Lots of fun videos but kinda swears a lot
Eh...fun personality and great mix of of music at the beginning of each class, but his teaching methods are unrefined.
Pretty eccentric

Dr. Curren is a very kind professor who is quite passionate about what he teaches. While his lectures can be boring at times, I found his tangents as incredibly interesting and surprisingly funny. He truly cares about his students actually LEARNING and is willing to put this over the letter grade you receive.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I found his lectures extremely hard to follow, he tended to ramble and didn't make it clear what was actual material and what was fluff. We had a guest lecturer for one week and it was the only time I felt clear on the material, and his review sessions were pretty much useless. It made it very difficult to study for the final exam
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Curren is a very nice person. However, classes are mind-numbingly boring, so much that I needed to chug an energy drink before class to stay awake. He has no slide shows so if you don't go to class/aren't paying attention, ur screwed. I took this as an elective and it was my biggest mistake of that semester. Can't not recommend this class enough.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment:
CONS: Extremely boring lectures, no visual learning, no clear grading rubric, wouldn't recommend taking unless you have to.

PROS: Open to questions and encourages participation, respectful and nice, the class is not a lot of work.

Prof Curren is really cute like gives Bernie Sanders, but he is not a phenomenal professor. He often goes on very long tangents that are unrelated to the readings we are discussing, and he leaves all the dirty work of grading exams to the TA and when you ask to meet to go over an exam, he has your meet with the TA instead. Do not love.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: Assigned good readings and brought up interesting points in lecture, but there was a lot of overlap between the two. Lectures were often regurgitating material from the book. When he brought up new material in lecture, it was interesting, but that was not a guarantee and lecture was often somewhat boring. Assignments were fair and not too hard.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Curren included quality readings, excluding his own writings, throughout the course, but it was a shame we never really got the chance to talk about them. Professor Curren frequently goes on topics that are tangential to the readings we have due in class and assumes that we haven't read them. He's very narcissistic and this slows his class down.

Professor Curren frequently interrupts students. This causes students to retreat inward and discontinue discussion. Curren personifies the Professor that doesn't care about the opinions of his students; instead, he blatantly disregards the views we have that differ from his own.

This course is about the ethics of technology and the amount of information that Curren lacks on technology is quite staggering. It's amazing that the University of Rochester hasn't replaced him with someone more knowledgeable about the subjects discussed within the course. Overall, I would strongly recommend staying away from this course and him.

I feel sorry for him. I guess he over invested his resources into the wrong field and is now trying to compensate for his many shortcomings. To cite a few examples, he, often, highlights his own personal life, his travels, and his leftist views on many subjects. There're some good articles included, however, these are ignored. It's quite shameful.

Professor Curren is excellent. He does tend to go off on 'tangents' but often they're actually quite relevant to what is being discussed - I view it as broadening the scope of what we're talking about and find it improves my understanding. His class is engaging and useful. I plan on taking more classes with Professor Curren.
BORING!!!, just him standing in the front droning on and on about how great his own views are. Biased and useless information. Do not take any class with this idiot.

I don't know why Curren is getting poor reviews. He is a great professor and extremely inspiring! This has been my favorite class at UR and I recommend it to everyone, especially if you have an interest in the environment. He rambles a bit but tells GREAT and RELEVANT stories.He is a wise teacher and a good soul.
No studies, no readings, no facts, just him rambling on and on about his own opinions. Very narrow worldview.
Terrible.

Horrible. The stuff we covered was interesting but class was a JOKE. He rambles on and on about nothing and I am so glad it's over. Go to the TA's office hours if you need help, but if you read the book you'll be fine.

Curren is a good guy, he just tends to ramble here and there.  His lectures can sometimes get a little boring, but the good thing is that the tests are fairly easy as long as you study.  Utilize the TA's office hours to brush up on notes you miss and you will be fine.  READ THE BOOK!!!  the tests are straight memorization.  Good luck!
this proff is all over the place, knows his stuff a little bit buy horrible overall, talks abut religion in one context then talks about flowers the next. he is all over the place
BORING BEYOND WORDS. intolerable. sooo glad its over

Professor Curren's monologues, essentially point by point interpretations of the selected texts, are both lucid and witty, but unfortunately will render either the reading or the lectures intolerable.
A truly great thinker, and excellent teacher.  If you are willing to really put your mind and effort into this course you won't be disappointed.  Would recommend taking any course he teaches.
Great prof.  Challenging course, but it will really make you think.
No Comments

One of the best professors I've had at the University of Rochester! Her workload is manageable, her feedback is helpful and constructive, and her chill, approachable demeanor makes learning enjoyable. She even brought treats to celebrate our Midpoint Portfolio! If you get the chance to take her class, I highly recommend it!

Excellent professor all around. The class cirriculum is super fun, she cares about her students and makes the class engaging. On top of all that, she's an easy grader and gives good feedback. Probably the best professor I've ever had.
Solid 10/10 writing professor. Best Professor I met at this stupid school ever. She really nice and patient to listen all things you talking about:)
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: My favorite professor!!

Professor Tinelli is amazing, she is more than approachable and is always willing to help. She gives good feedback on papers and you also spend a good amount of time doing peer reviewing and reflecting on all of your papers. Despite this, she manages to keep the class fun and easy, as there are readings, but they aren't typically required.

Professor Tinelli is my favorite teacher and truly a gem. I really enjoyed her class; she put a lot of effort into revision feedback, and her assignments were very clear. I highly recommend any class she teaches.

Liz was one of the most fantastic professors I've ever had. If you have a chance, make sure to sign up for any of her classes. She's funny, understanding, and a very fair grader. One of, if not my favorite teacher ever.

An amazing professor. She is always wiling to help and gives fantastic feedback. Doing the assignments were genuinely beneficial to my writing. She also gives good grades as long as you out in some effort.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: For a required course for Hajim students, she made it very fun and enjoyable. Her feedback on assignments was always incredibly helpful, which was beneficial since our assignments were things like cover letters and resumes, so her feedback can be applied to future professional materials. I loved Liz! Highly recommend taking 273 with her!!

Liz was amazing! The workload was so manageable, and she made an otherwise boring topic seem interesting. She was so understanding and kind, and an easy and clear grader. Despite this class being an easy A, I actually learned a lot about academic writing. Liz felt more like a friend than a professor, and was super understanding about absences.
AMAZING PROF EVER MET if u have chance definitely take hers and enjoy your semester
Love her! She gives great feedback and is very helpful. Show up, participate, do your work, and you'll get an A. She makes writing less intimidating and teaches you very useful skills.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Really an excellent professor! She is very inspired to teach and will give you really useful comment on your paper. I would definitely take her class again in the future!

Goes above and beyond. Phenomenal professor. She is aware that WRT 273 is a mandatory course, but does her best for the students to get the best out of it. She actually cares about the course and the students. Highly recommend.

The only instructor who I would love for life. She helps you to always have hope. The A- during my first semester of this two-part course was a pity but it was largely my own fault. And during the second semester, she decides to award everyone who is responsible and respectful an A, which is exactly my ultimate standard for education. God Bless You
She is very kind to students, loves to inspire students in class. She is very friendly in grading paper.
Although her class is very great, to get an A in her class is impossible. Her comments and her final grading criteria are very different. You cannot get any improvement for your writing in her class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She's very nice
She is the best of best professor I have ever met in my entire studying life. Would recommend to every student to take her writing class.
Knowledgeable, enthusiastic, and approachable. Always willing to discuss abstract concepts with me so that I could develop and clarify my ideas in writing.
One of the best professors I've ever met! Really inspired me a lot!
This this the best professor since I enter college!

Great Feedback!! She reads your papers really carefully and give useful comments. Don't worry if you miss two or three classes, she doesn't care! But don't miss a lot. Class is relaxing, and feels quick. She is great, overall.

Prof Kleene was a great professor for my first term at UofR. 171 is a difficult course that is heavy on homework--expect to spend 10-15 hours of week on it!! Exams are also very difficult however, the curve lessens the blow. Prof. Kleene is a great lecturer but can be disorganized at times. He is also very accessible outside of class.

Kleene is a great professor, he always does his best to make sure everyone in the class understands what he is writing and is very friendly and approachable. The content is very hard, but that is expected from a proof-based calculus class. Also, if you are taking MATH171, set aside at least 10 hours a week for homework, no matter the professor.

The course is very difficult but Kleene tries his best and makes sure that everyone understands. He sticks to his notes and sometimes may not be prepared if asked anything outside of it, he tries his best to answer every query of the student. He is very friendly and helpful. Would love to take some of his other classes.
Extremely difficult class, but this guy KNOWS what he is doing, and KNOWS how to teach. Really wish the homework wasnt so insane, it took probably 5 hours each week.
Difficult to read his hand writing. Had to watch online lectures from another professor who was teaching this course.

Professor Kleene is a really great professor, and I feel like he explained the material as well as it could be explained. He is great with talking to the class and checking in to see if everyone understands, and learned most people's names too. The homework was ridiculously difficult, but I thought the tests were very reasonable.

You MUST read the textbook to even consider passing discrete math. Get ready for this class, as you have probably never taken anything like it. Stephen Kleene is extremely smart, and a very caring professor. Go to his office hours because he WANTS to help you, and see you succeed!! The homeworks are very hard, the tests are also insanely difficult.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: He is a great professor! He tries to make everything as clear as possible. If anything is unclear to anyone, he will take the time to make you understand. His exams are very fair. 2 midterms and a final.

He's great. He tries to lecture so that his students understand what he's teaching. He also gives difficult tests, (2 midterms and a final), but just do a bunch of problems out the book and you'll be fine.
Steve cares so much for his students. I found his office hours very helpful! I went to all his office hours, and I learned a lot in his class!
Very tough class. Lectures can be a bit tough to grasp at first. If you go to office hours and really engage with the material, you can do fine.
really nice guy, great lectures.
Lectures are not very clear, which isn't great for a tough subject.
Awesome! Follows the book pretty closely. Exams are tough!
Decent guy, good lectures.
extremely difficult final!!!
Really nice guy. Can be hard to follow sometimes though.
Very good explanations and an obvious passion about Mathematics.
I'm sure he's a very smart guy, but horrendous at conveying information that's in his head. Couldn't find a way to digestibly explain information that the other MTH 150 was able to.
Class was pretty boring, but he's  a pretty good talker. Definitely way better than some other profs

Professor Kleene was very helpful. It was not my favorite class, however this was largely due the material and not the fault of the instructor. Professor Kleene mentioned that Discrete math is not in his research area. Nonetheless he did an excellent job of keeping me interested

Lectures are useless and make the topic more confusing. Office hours (which there were more cancelled then held) were not helpful as he would explain topic exactly the same way he did in class. Basically need to self teach if you want to pass.

He's a nice person and is clearly interested in mathematics.  Discrete mathematics, however? Not really.  Had to teach myself most of the information through the internet and supplementary tutoring.  His lectures only confused me more.  He's not a tough grader, though, and is pretty lenient for the most part.  I wouldn't, however, recommend for 150
I was going to go on his field school next summer but I heard horrible stories about them from previous students.  I think these precious  reviews were written by Jarvis, they're not real!

I had for Archaeology in Early America and he is well versed in the subject. His lectures were clear and interesting and his grading was fair, but from what I could tell his grading varies depending on what he expects from a particular student.

Best professor at UR.  Funny, fair, amazing lecturer.  Makes you work for your grade, but this is easy to do if you follow the syllabus, which he sticks to.  Very professional and interested.  This is my second class with him and I can't wait for a third.  I enjoyed learning.

Prof. Jarvis is a great professor. He really knows what he is talking about and loves what he teaches. The course can be difficult but staying up with the reading, attending class, and taking good notes will keep you up with the class.

Prof. Jarvis is very passionate about his subject. If you like history, you will like Jarvis. Downside: the syllabus says there are no papers, but each test (4 total) involves a "take-home essay section" a.k.a. a paper. Don't be fooled!

Introduced himself as Snape the first day, but he's the farthest from Snape you could imagine. Great prof, super interesting, very clear about what he wants from you on exams/papers.  Only drawback is mandatory attendance.
I only had Jarvis for Maritime Atlantic 301W, but he was great. A little hard at first with all the reaction papers, but his class was lots of fun. Very helpful and enthusiastic.

Professor Jarvis picked the best kind of history to specialize in: early American colonies in the Caribbean/ Bermuda colonies. So whenever he has to go "study in the field" he goes somewhere with great weather and a beach! Pirates, arrrrrr!
He oversees my internship and is very helpful and willing to spend time to help.

Probably my favorite professor thus far. Very helpful, clear, and engaging. I've taken both 100 and 300 level courses and found him to be a tough but fair grader. He makes himself available to students and appears genuinely interested in their enjoyment and progress in the courses he teaches. I'd recommend any class taught by him.

He's a pretty chill dude. Did well at first and must have fallen asleep during the Final which is the only reason i didn't get an A.  Whatever, he's pretty nice and fair...he makes US history easy to swallow even for the most reluctant.  Also, go on the field trip @ the end of the year.

History can sometimes be a boring topic, but Jarvis made it pretty interesting.  His use of multimedia within lectures was a nice touch and helped make the class much more visual.  Jarvis knows basically everything there is to know about US history, which is a great asset.  If you have to take a history course, take it with Jarvis.
Jarvis is the man.  Really smart and knowledgable about the topic.  For sure, one of the best classes I've had at UR.  He turned me into a history major.  He also has some pretty funny little quips.
I am in love with this man. He is so nice and so funny. He's just so incredibly awkward-he cracks me up. You need to take a class with him-you definitly won't regret it!
madler is awesome
Prof. Jarvis is a really nice guy.  This class was awesome.  I want to retake it, but they won't let me.  You watch cool movies, you take fair exams, and you learn a lot about our country.
Definitly worth taking a class by him. He's a great teacher and very organized! You know what you have to study and his tests are very fair.

He spent about 3 days talking about Haiti, because he had pictures of his trip there, and about half a day talking about the Consititution in an Early American history class. Class was reading, memorizing, taking a test. Do the work = get a good grade. I got a D+. My bad
Great teacher, very hands on, and sticks to readings and assignments.
very helpful and knowledgable professor.  doesn't skimp of reading or writing, but topics are generally interesting and he leads disscussion well.
My AP American class was harder and more involved than this one. I think my IQ dropped by taking this class.
Very Interesting, engaging, only drawback is mandatory attendance...
Favorite Prof. ever!  Go Jarvis!

Muthu teaches very well and encourages questions from students in the class. The Crypto course is theory-heavy and the assignmnt problems are really good to get a good grasp of the topics. My only caveat -- super delayed feedback. Homeworks were given back to us after a month of submission almost every single time. very stressful with no feedback
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: the good part was the lecture. the bad part was pretty much everything else. there was no syllabus, 40% of grade was up to chance due to these wacky weird quizzes, and he never responded to student questions. he also gave a take home midterm which was a terrible idea and this caused unfairness bc EVERYONE used internet, but only some got caught.

His lecture style wasn't very engaging, but he taught the material fairly clearly. Many people were upset with his inflexibility when it came to personal issues. His quizzes(40% of the grade), did not test whether we paid attention to lecture, and came to a guessing game. Exams much harder than homework. Never followed through on promised deadlines
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: 4 reasons I regret taking Muthu's course: 1) has a tough time seeing things from the student's point of view 2) doesn't see himself as accountable to students 3) doesn't make himself accessible to students 4) makes claims but doesn't follow through. says midterm will take 2 hours, it takes 12. says grades back by mon, changes to wed, then fri, etc.
not good. rude and condescending. closed minded. take his class if you hate yourself.

5-minute-Quizs in every class counted as 40% of the final grade. Professor Muthu said this quiz quired minimum study to pass. Actually, you should study a lot, cause the questions are hard and weird. Also, during the class, he does not have any idea what he is talking about. He always says, "now I know, let us start over".
Worst class I've taken in my 4 years of college
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Most of the grade comes from daily quizzes which he claims needing only minimal preparation. However, you would find that minimal preparation for the quizzes would only give you a D in the course. Grading system is confusing and if you calculate your grade based on his grading scheme, you will find that your grade is way higher than what it shows.

Incredibly condescending and rude. Randomly takes a two week vacation in the middle of the semester, comes back and then assigned two large homework sets in one week to "make up for lost time." Doesn't care about the anxiety his poor communication and disorganization causes students. I would never take a class with him again; it was a horrible time
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Muthu is good at explaining things and knows his stuff, but the course was VERY VERY poorly managed.
Worst class I've taken so far..
He decided to give himself a long break and then left the whole class behind for two weeks. Then he came back and posted two homework at a time and you only got one week to finish them:)
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Terrible lectures.
Worst Professor

The daily quiz was worth 40% of the grade. Each quiz was 5-7 minutes long but some questions were so hard that he admitted that it couldn't be done in a minute. Also, since it was MCQ if you have one wrong answer you get a 0. So a huge portion of the grade was random.

I feel like he was intimidated by the class size the whole semester, he went on to blame everything that went wrong to the large class size which was frustrating. Also, he went on to not let students, who had legitimate reasons to miss the quiz, make up for the missed quiz which is 40% of the grade. Makes bad jokes all the time.
Very unreasonable person and almost impossible to get your point through. He starts a discussion after he has already made his mind beforehand.

amazing lecturer, but unreasonable person. doesn't think any excuse is valid-even if you broke your leg and came to class few min late he just doesn't care. doesn't have the ability to think about the world from others' perspectives. seriously. also, reprimands kids for showing up 2 min late to class, yet he shows up 5+ min late to class sometimes.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: He cares about his students, welcomes feedback, and genuinely wants you to learn the material.

I was skeptical at first because I heard mixed things about his 281 class, but CSC 280 turned out to be a fascinating, well taught, and delightful class. The professor seemed to genuinely care about his students and tried hard to make sure everyone understood the material.
Daily quizzes are annoying, but if you paid attention in the previous lecture then you'll do fine. Has good TAs and lectures are good.
Teaches some cool subjects. Not terrible by any means.
Hard homework, tough TA and grade.
Hard class but really interesting. Attend lecture and don't be lazy.
Very smart guy

The midterm and final take about 70% of the course points and be prepared for them! The grading is relatively loose since this is a hard course, just write your ideas about the questions in exams and if your are on the right track, he will give you the points. His passionate in lectures and definitely worth to go to the lectures.
Great guy. During lecture he makes sure everyone's clear on the topic before moving forward. You can tell he cares. Not sure what all the hate's about.
worst teacher i know in finance, give us problem set that ta couldn't understand, and he refused to help students on this

It is a very difficult class due to the nature of the material. Even if you do not score well he is very understanding and will help improve your grade. Going to office hours and recitation is essential to learning the material and way he solves problems similar to exam. It is hard to fail the class and he does have a generous curve. Love the guy.
Worst Class

He lectures as if we have all already seen the content before, and all have a high understanding. Although the class is really hard, he is very available outside of class and good at teaching one-on-one.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Bad time management, never finished the class on time.
The classes always went overtime, never finished the class on time.
The easiest course I have taken in UofR. Really Easy A!
GREAT
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Worst class ever!!!!!!!!
His exam is bad. It requires too much work to show your knowledge. I dont understnad him.
Great instructor, difficult class but overall very helpful.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Great person! Humble, passionate, friendly, etc.... As a professor though, well lets just say his lecture treated my Insomnia better than anything else in the world. He's probably a great researcher/project teammate, just not a great instructor.

The class by its nature is very difficult but he does not make it easy by the way he teaches it. He goes over concepts extremely fast and I think his teaching style is more suited to grad level than undergrads. Extremely hard to get a good grade in his course. Otherwise, he is a respectful guy and was always approachable after class.
Really bad. Never think for his students, don't care about how his slides are, speak like a rapper in class, and do not inform students even if there are typos in homeworks.

SO BAD. Slides are nightmarishly bad, and never sends an email. Everything is on piazza and never talks unless students post questions. The passive attitude, bad teaching quality & ridiculous demands amidst the COVID19 pandemic, make me hate so much. The other comment, "whining"?, lol, you either be giulio himself or a loser cant wait to suc his *?
By far the worst professor I have had at Rochester. If you care about your grade, then don't take him. You have been warned...
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Not sure what all the whinings are about. Good professor, explains concepts well PERIOD
WORST FINANCE INSTRUCTOR EVER

Drills over easy stuff and then goes through difficult stuff very quickly assuming that you know it. Makes you feel dumb if you ask questions outside of class and tells you you should have asked in class, even though it's a large lecture. Homeworks are nothing like the powerpoints he presents. Assumes you know excel fluently

The majority of the learning in this class will happen while doing the homework for up to 20 hours every week. Gonek does a good job of making the lectures entertaining with his stories, but they are almost the exact same as the textbook and the material gets a lot slower later in the semester. Success in 171 is dependent on the TAs you work with.

Professor Gonek is a fine Professor & a good man. He taught MATH 172 at the perfect pace. While his stories did take time away from lecture, & gave the slight impression that he was a bit full of himself, they did brighten my mornings. He also flexible, but not overly so, which I appreciated.
Great professor that engages the class and tells fun stories. It's a difficult class, but you can get through it with help from TA's and other classmates. Exams are less difficult than homework.
He is humorous. He would tell a funny story at the end of every chapter. Exams can be hard, but the curve makes them nicer.

The only reason his rating is not a perfect 5 is that he teaches hard courses so someone is bound to find an issue with him. Lectures are enjoyable and easy to understand. The amount of homework and overall difficulty is justified since this is a 5-credit honors course. It's still a fun course though, I never felt bored.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: IDK what everyone else is on. Firstly, he is not sexist at all. Secondly, if you're thinking of taking "The Infinite", don't. Complete waste of time. The syllabus looks cool (a bunch of famous philosophers) but the whole class is just reading a paper written by each of them each class. No variation at all. He is an inflexible and boring professor.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: He's funny and teaches the material very well. Homework can be very difficult but doing it makes the difficult exams much easier. Female students beware - you're going to have to work a lot harder to be taken seriously.

Don't miss a single lecture - you don't know what you have missed. Outside of calculus, Professor Gonek introduces a lot of inspiring and advanced mathematical topics (the continuum hypothesis, Kakeya's needle problem, etc.). Of course, he organized the lessons so well that he had time to do so!
A magical Math professor teaches a magical Math course.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--TEST HEAVY

comment: Best professor I've ever had. He's teaching tough stuff but does it really well. Takes the time to get to know his students and really cares about how they do. Exams are a lot easier than homework assignments

Steve Gonek is an incredible professor. He is extremely smart, yet also super approachable and hilarious. The class material is hard, but he does his best to teach it and help you learn. He also tells incredible stories at the end of each chapter and is a really genuine guy. Definitely don't pass up on the chance to take a class with him!

Professor Gonek is my absolute fave! The class itself is pretty hard, but the curves are generous and the grade policy is pretty nice too. Homework is a really important part of the course, and it's not stuff that wolfram can help you out with, so be ready to put in a few hours every week. Also, his stories are super funny (and kinda weird).
A gentle, brilliant educator. Cannot reccomend highly enough. Took him for 2 years/4 classes and I miss seeing him 3x a week.

This man is amazing! He is very funny and he has the most unique stories. At the end of every class he tells stories about his life that are not too funny, but he makes them funny because he is funny. In conclusion he is FUNNY! Also explains stuff very detailed, which is good. Very helpful, you just have to ask him and study.
Literally one of the best professors I have ever had. He is incredibly smart and manages to convey his knowledge clearly and efficiently, while also throwing in some hilarious stories.

oh mann, if at all possible, take a class with doctor steve...he is a god...teaches so that you LEARN, and that you are interested in the material, not so that you memorize things and worry about them...his grading policy (see below) makes the class stress free and manageable, despite having more difficult content than other classes

Gonek is by far the best professor I had my freshmen year, he is extremely funny during class and very enthusiastic about the material.  At times he has problems explaining things on the fly, but has never failed to provide clarity by the end of a lecture.  His grading policy is "I like to give A's and B's"  Was nominated for professor of the year

He sometimes has trouble explaining things he considers obvious, but other than that, he does a great job of teaching the material. And he's hilarious. He also chooses very interesting and challenging problems for homework, if you're into that. I highly recommend.
No Comments
He skipped differential forms, which is a drag.
Gonek is da bomb
No Comments
eh, good teacher
Excellent teacher.  He teaches the course very well, and in addition, he effectively keeps his students interested in mathematics by informing us  of new developments in the field.
Very nice professor, and gives very interesting lectures. Very nice when giving grades and I am lucky to have her for this course.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Inspirational

comment: She's the coolest prof, but you have to work for what she gives you. Also make sure you do your readings when she assigns them, or she penalizes the class. Just gotta show up and do your work- she doesn't expect much else
If you are interested in the topic area, you will love her class. Very knowledgeable about her field.
Easy boring class
She is a great person to talk to in terms of help. Her class is very interesting and if you're interested in African Americans in the quest for political freedom, it's for you.

She obviously knowledgeable about what she'd teaching. She's engaging and enthusiastic. She discusses reading extensively in class and is pretty clear about what will be on exams. Discusses race and gender, but tells you that right at the beginning of the semester- no surprises. Overall, a good teacher.
She is a very interesting woman! She has a ton to offer and has been a great help as my adviser. Her randomness makes studying for exams and writing papers hard.
Can't work a computer, so that cause many class delays.  Gets off topic, but it's interesting.  LOTS of thick reading with odd formatted exams

TERRIBLE professor. Avoid at all costs. She is horrible with technology, yet used powerpoint for all the lectures. We usually got through a few slides a day. Terribly boring and not welcoming. Tests are not good measures of the material, little class discussion, everyone just surfs facebook. AVOID HER.

While she seems like a knowledgeable person, her strength is clearly not in teaching. Her voice is monotone; it sounds like she's reciting facts. The textbook readings are long and often extremely in-depth for a 105 class, and she covers a lot of the key points in the reading in her lectures (if you can pay attention).

She expects her students to read upwards of 100 pages of dense, textbook reading per week, but she does not hold herself to the same rigorous standard. She shows up late, and is an inconsistent grader. She is obviously knowledgeable on the subject matter, but I wish she would spend a little more time on how she teaches the class.
she is the best prof at the Roch!
very nice professor, with interesting reading materials (most of the time)
No Comments

I transferred from UR, but I would have to say that Professor Sinclair-Chapman is an excellent professor. She is a savant in her field, intelligent, eloquent, insightful, and dedicated. Also, her approach to the topic of race is veracious.

Stimulated good discussion, didn't let people get away with just spouting off on things, even if she may have agreed with what they were saying.  Interested in students, maybe a bit too easy with grading.
Thinks everything in the world is about race. Can't admit that there are other views than her own. And told me that I was wrong, because i disagreed with her.
Good discussion, isn't always clear

The problem with Rochester students is that they want to bury their heads in the sand and pretend that race doesn't exist.  At least she is bringing an important issue to the forefront that no one else has the guts to discuss frankly (i.e. the admin.)
No Comments
very very easy, but very very boring
Very intelligent...edgy...talks about race WAY too much!
greatest teacher I‘ve ever met
He's an amazing person, but a harsh grader.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: He's great. The class is fun, helpful, considerable, respectful. I would say is the best writting professor i've ever met. How ever the grade is tough,,,I did pay too much time on it compared to other courses in the first year.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: I recommend not taking him.
Matt Bayne is an awesome dude and really cares about helping students when he can. Great class.

Matthew makes writing surprisingly fun. I don't especially like writing papers for school, but he helped to show me how to feel confident about writing in college. He left with many useful writing and research skills.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: This professor is pretty much the same as every writing professor at the University of Rochester. They are pretty pretentious about writing since they "astoundingly" achieved a Ph.D. in English Lit. I would still recommend picking this professor over other professors since they are all mostly pretty awful. Pretty easy class, especially for eng.
Dr. Bayne is a great professor with adequate humor, though it was hard to get a good grade. For the students who do want to learn something from the writing courses, he is a good choice.
rating_tags: So many papers--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lots of homework

comment: He provided me a lot of inspirational things in WRT. He is amazing and humorous teacher that I have ever met.
He's fantastic. Good commenter and makes writing as fun as it can possibly be. Cool clothes also.
Funny. Cool. Interesting. Stylish.

He's a very sweet guy who clearly cares about his students. The books we read weren't too difficult, assignments and rubrics were clear and his feedback was very good. Not extremely challenging but WRT105 isn't really supposed to be.
He is a great and funny professor who respect our mind
Helpful feedback, and funny.
A little quirky, but nice and provides a lot of support.
He's wonderful.  Very smart and committed to his students.

Gives helpful comments on your papers. If you change the things he asks you to change, you can get good grades. However, I feel like he doesn't explain exactly what he's looking for in his papers, so email him for clarification
He's amazing!!!! And extremely funny!
He's simply great

Possibly the greatest teacher I have had. He really cares about helping his students and is really helpful in office hours. He has a great personality and always comes to class happy. He gives a decent amount of work but not too much.

Not overly hard at all, pretty much what you'd expect from a required writing course. Follow the assignment and you'll get a good grade, and the assignments are clear. EXTREMELY helpful when you ask. Great teacher, also fairly lenient. Will work with you.

I took a rigorous AP English course in high school and it did not prepare me for college writing at all, being able to read and analyze books is useless. This guy is a tough grader and has high expectations, expect to have your GPA ruined and your self confidence shattered.

Professor Iosevich is great; he's respectable and knowledgeable. Although he was only a sub for my math 142 class for 1.5 weeks, I can tell he's excellent at his job and makes difficult concepts seem much easier and doable. You can tell he is passionate about teaching because helps everyone- even if you are not his student.

Professor Iosevich is knowledgeable and gives great lectures. Really enjoy his class though the homework is a little bit tough. He gives out curved grades. This is definitely a harder class but I would recommend taking it for those who are actually interested in math. He is also approachable and willing to discuss questions with students.

Professor Iosevich is very kind but he tends to make topics more difficult than they need to be. Going to lecture is very important and so is reading the textbook if you're looking to do well. Overall he is an okay option, better than others but others are better than him. He is a solid choice.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: This dude is a joke. Never shows up when he says he'll meet you outside class.  I know he's "busy" but come on man just show up when you say you will. He is always trying to make us think the class is "so hard" and he's "helping us". Sure the material is hard, but you always know you're going to get an A because he doesn't give anything less

I took 173 and 174 with him. Great professor. Hard classes but I asked for it I guess. Read the textbook and go to office hours, he's very helpful if you reach out. Homework and exam scores looked low but final grades were very generous, don't get scared off.

Alex's MTH173 is really hard. He never writes a whole proof on board, and expects us to understand it. He doesn't know how teach. If not reading book ahead, you couldn't get it. And the speed is really fast. In a single class, he can prove more than 5 theorems and it's really hard to catch up. In addition, his exam is hard with mean below 25/50.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: He is so good at teaching

He is a great lecturer and explains concepts really well. He tells jokes and class is not boring at all. He is extremely smart and sometimes thinks stuff is high school level math when it feels complicated, but other than that he is great.
He is one of the most awesome math professor out there in America
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Alex is very kind, personable, and an engaging lecturer. He will also make you realize how little you know about math. He is an absolute genius and operates in a different academic stratosphere. He is very merciful with grades and is more concerned with seeing you stretch yourself academically than the final outcome

Alex is a great guy. He is also very very busy and rarely has official office hours. He is kind, respectful, and helpful, but his greatest downfall is the massive intelligence gap between he and his students. I think he often genuinely believes a difficult topic is "simple" or "high school level," and doesn't mean it as an insult.

I have to admit, this guy is arrogant. He will literally make everyone around him feel stupid. If you dont care about math too much, dont take a class from him. Dont get me wrong, he is funny, and he gives good grades. And to be honest he is a genius. But your motivation will basically go downhill.
The curve is sooo nice. Also Alex is a great guy. Great lecturer, really funny.
The BEST math teacher I met ever! He always challenge you during the lecture. Watch out and pay attention!

Attendance isn't mandatory, but he remembers who shows up and who doesn't. He's very helpful and accommodating, and I could tell he really wanted us all to succeed. If you're willing to learn, he'll do everything he can to make sure that you do. He also regularly brings his dog to wander around during lectures, which was kinda fun.

Going to lecture did not help at all. He just made things more confusing. If you have to take a class from him, stay home and read the book. You'll be better off! And don't even try going to office hours - he'll brush you off.
If you have to suffer through a math class, this is the best guy to help you through it!

This is a hard course, but not because of the professor.  He genuinely wants his students to learn the material and will help you as much as you want, but only if you ask him for it.  He's very funny in class, although that often leads to getting off-topic.

His class is very easy to follow because he makes sure you understand the concept with multiple examples that make you think outside of the box (ironically, he uses a box and other items instead of standard variables). Always sets office hours and review sessions that work for the entire class, and he runs the review.

AMAZING PROFESSOR! Iosevich doesn't get to teach many undergraduate classes, so if you have the good fortune of taking his class you are very lucky! He is dedicated to his class and will go out of his way to help you even after you complete his class. He is a funny guy and a great lecturer. He makes sure you understand the math beyond equations.
Fantastic!!!!

Very funny. He cares about his students, and often asks how they're doing before class. His lessons are usually crystal clear, which is impressive for such a difficult subject. He's always honest, and is a fair grader.

MATH-171 was my introduction to higher math. I found the course incredibly difficult, but am very glad that I took it with this professor. He packed an insane amount of information into each lecture, which was at times overwhelming, but in the long run rewarding. The textbook, Calculus by Michael Spivak, will be your saving grace.
He writes faster than I can think omg. The only reason this class is somewhat doable is because of the workshops and the good TAs. still not easy tho
He ruined my life :)))))))))))))
There are many abstract examples in his class, but if you can understand them, you will find the exam pretty easy

just a heads up, while sevak is def one of the better math profs out there, 150 is seriously no joke. he is an amazing teacher but i found the material so ridiculously difficult that by a certain point even with the office hours (which were v helpful ALWAYS TAKE ADVANTAGE OF) i still had to google for so so much clarification by the end of semester
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Respected

comment: Excellent professor! If you need to take Math 150, definitely take it with Sevak. He explains things very thoroughly and clearly during class and is very accessible. The class itself can be challenging at times, but I barely needed to touch the textbook at all - his lectures were usually enough to understand the material.

Take MATH 150 with no one but professor Sevak! He creates a laid-back classroom atmosphere and does a great job at explaining concepts and distinctions. He also tries to answer every question raised in the classroom and makes sure students understand his responses.

Sevak is my favorite professor during the freshman year. I barely did anything for the course rather than his lectures and they were more than enough. Although the topic are difficult sevak made them easy so that I got an A without studying much. If you are going to take Math150 then take it with no one but Sevak! He gives it only in fall though

He is my best professor so far! Clear and helpful lecture and notes. I recommend skim the important or complicate sections of the textbook. Go to every office hours of him even without questions! In addition, if you know how to solve every problem from the past exams, you will surely get an A.
The best professor for math 150! Very accessible and willing to help during office hours.
The best professor ever! If you want to take math 150, take his class! He is willing to help outside class. You can ask anything related to the course during office hours.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Great professor! Very accessible! Best Professor for MTH150.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: He is a good professor and does really care about his students. The lecture material is quite complicated, but he does his best to explain it. He's helpful during office hours and the webwork is very helpful. Make sure to do the webwork and practice exams. He kind of has a thick accent, but he's willing to repeat what he said.

If you have to take MTH150, make sure it is with Sevak. He is by far the best of the four teachers who teach it. The subject is extremely difficult, there's no getting around that, but he does it the best. You walk in, and the lecture starts immediately, and goes until the minute class is over. He never wastes a second of your time.
mth202 is hard class but he is very good teacher

Very good professor. Make sure you do your webwork and practice tests before each exam to do really well. Not the easiest class, but going to Sevak's office hours and doing your work definitely makes this class very doable.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria--TEST HEAVY

comment: Easy to follow along and always willing to answer questions. 162 is a very tough course but Sevak is one of the better professors to prepare you for exams. Use the textbook to supplement before or after lecture

Sevak is generally a good professor, not the best out there but better than most of those teaching MTH 162. The class itself is pretty hard but I think he's one of the most helpful professors. Use his office hours, he's really useful in them
Very helpful and approachable. Gives lots of examples, and is always willing to go over a concept again in class. However, you will have to go through the textbook to supplement your learning.

Explains concepts really well through examples. Attending his lectures and practicing problems from the textbook helps. He is extremely helpful during office hours and is ready to explain a concept from scratch.
Flies through lectures but if you ask him to explain will take the time and provide extra examples. Expects you to try it on your own and read the book first.
He is great.

Due to the online lectures, Sumpter is always behind and classes often go overtime. The approach of his lecture is confusing as in the beginning, he introduced three physics models with no context. His handwriting is unbearable and his practice exam solutions are full of mistakes.

Dr. Sumpter was a very boring lecturer. He told us the night before classes that the semester was going to be online, and he read word for word from the textbook. His handwriting was illegible. He seemed very bored. He was also horrible with communication and often was behind other sections. Would not take his class again.

Sumpter is not a good zoom lecturer, and he sent an email 12 hours before the first class that the whole semester would be online... He copied word for word from textbook, with little explanation, and made a lot of mistakes. He also randomly went completely silent for a few minutes often, and went 10-15 minutes over class time every single lecture.

He's a pretty good professor and helpful during office hours, but his lectures have been online the past few semesters (even though the original course listings said they'd be in person). If you don't like online lectures, I recommend picking a different section. I'd take his class again if it wasn't virtual.

He is a kind and friendly professor who is willing to help. But his lecture is more like reading and copying his notes to the whiteboard and I need to self-teach after class, and the worst part is that we had Zoom class without knowing it before the class began. Besides, the written homework was hard but it's helpful for exams.
Good lectures and clear notes. Posts extra notes to help learning. Also posts recordings of lectures. If you take notes and watch his lectures, class isn't too bad.

Taught Probability really well, prepared us adequately for exams. Only issues in the course were that Written HW assignments were very hard for no reason, not super related to class, but webworks were fine. Content was rushed at the end though which sucked. Tests were pretty fair but final was brutal for some reason. Other than that good class.
He is caring and willing to answer questions. But his lecture is almost like reading and copying textbooks. He made writing mistakes on the board some times but he is willing to correct them.

He's alright. Lectures are kinda monotonous, easy to fall asleep in the morning, but at least he gets the information out and if you copy it all down you can usually sort it out later. Lectures directly from his notes so it's generally put together, but also not very inspired. It's calc, it's difficult, but he'll help you out in office hours.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Prof Sumpter's lecture pace is quite slow, so it was boring at first. But as the coursework got harder, his lecture was extremely helpful. He touched on all the strategies needed to approach a topic, and the lecture helped with homework, which eventually help with exams. Prof is nice and accessible outside of class, overall very recommended.
He's very fair and his lectures are helpful and worthwhile. The notes he writes during lectures are really good and all you need to do well on the exams.

Joshie is a technically fine professor, but he does very little to make the content particularly interesting or go above and beyond. He's basically just a textbook. 2 stars seems harsh because you could definitely do worse than Josh, but he's not great. Super boring but he will prepare you decently for the exam

He really gets straight to the point and does not waste time lecturing on topic that are irrelevant and/or will not be on the exam. Always clear about if a topic will or will not covered on an exam. He is a bit monotone in his voice while lecturing, so its a bit tough to stay engaged at times. Felt very prepared for exams and would take him again.

A great professor with the best intention for people to learn. Accessible outside of class. Sometimes goes into too abstract concepts but that could be a good or bad thing depending on what kind of student you are.

His lectures are boring, but I don't really think that's his fault- the material is pretty dull. He is accessible outside of class, and is willing to help with hw problems during office hours. He doesn't have any sort of ego, which I really appreciated.

His lectures were slow and boring. He made mistakes often when writing on the board, but was very willing to admit being wrong if someone pointed it out. He spends more time on defining ideas than showing examples of how to solve the problems. He was patient and willing to answer questions. Grading and test expectations were fair.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: As someone who took Calc 1 in high school, this class was very boring for me. In the end, we got to some new things and I had very little comprehension despite putting in the effort to learn. I'm glad I already knew some calc otherwise I would probably have failed. On a good note, he is very approachable and takes time to answer questions.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: MATH 201, conceptually, isn't that bad. Professor Sumpter sort of assumes that you're keeping up with the very mathematically dense definitions of stuff that he gives in class, but sort of clarifies after. Nice guy though. Keep in mind that nothing in the class really goes beyond the difficulty level of a calculus course; go to office hours too.
great lectures

Professor Sumpter is one of the best math teachers I have had not only at UR but in general. He is beyond funny and keeps you interested in what is usually a simple, boring math lecture. He is extremely caring and accessible outside of class, great guy!

I was wondering why Prof Sumpter receives so few reviews! Definitely one of the best professors at U of R, he is very funny and easily approachable. He responds to emails quickly and his office hours are helpful. His lectures are well organized and easy to understand if you pay enough attention and he goes over the materials really carefully.
Professor Sumpter is one of the greatest Math professors that I've ever had. His office hours were beyond helpful.
Worst teacher in college. Talks like he is going to pass out. Terrible handwriting. Just so bad. How does he become a professor?

he is one of the worst professors I've ever had. he constatly messes up proofs, forgets where he is and makes simple material confusing and mundane. it has gotten to the point where I exclusively rely on the teaching assistants to understand the material. Cohen might have been a good teacher at some point but that was at least 20 years ago

"I hear: I forget. I see: I remember. I do: I understand."  Dr. Cohen is brilliant, and always willing to help students. He subscribes to the Moore Method; that is, class is instructive for developing basic intuition for concepts, but true knowledge is gained through homework completion and conversation in his office hours. Amazing experience!
Obviously does not prepare for class.

Nice guy, but terribly disorganized. Can't finish half of his proofs. Frequently begins teaching a topic after homework on that topic is already handed in, which makes going to class pretty pointless. He is a brilliant guy, however, and very willing to help.

This is the best professor I had all my freshmen year, this guy is great. You can go to him for everything at any time and he really cares about your understanding of the topic regardless of your grade or whatever else, he just wants you to learn. He might seem a bit tough at first, but then HE RULES!

Loved this class, mostly because of him. I entertained my friends with his ridiculous math metaphors, I am now a math major because of the class. He expects a LOT out of you at first, but eases up after the first test.  Very responsive to our homework woes.  Assumes that you want to know the whole back story for every proof. Sweetest prof ever!

He tells very corny jokes and sometimes gets lost in his own proofs. He assumes his students know most of the material and doesn't help much when he ends class in the middle of a proof. It also doesn't help when he gives a proof in class, asks you to prove it on an exam, and marks it wrong, even when you copied it straight from the board.
