He's a really nice guy and legitimately wants to see his students succeed but he's really horrible at explaining key subjects and tends to lose focus of what he's talking about and then get the example problem wrong and then he'll tell the students to finish it by themselves when he hasn't taught them how to do it.

Nice guy. Corney Jokes. Makes lots of mistakes on the board but just arithmatic usually. I have found that most of the non honors low level math professors are poor so I would say that he is above average in comparison but I still don't think he was a good teacher.

Better than Harper.  Decent at explaining the material.  Follows the book mostly.  The course isn't fun; webwork is a killer.  Cohen is a considerate professor.  He rewrites, redraws, uses different colored chalk to indicate things.  Not a bad experience overall.
Would not reccomend this teacher.  Very bad at explaining things.  I do not know what the other reviewers are thinking.  I'm an excellent math student and I think this guy shouldn't be teaching.
Very nice guy, very helpful. Go to his office hrs, talk about life. He's great!
I learned a lot in the course but not everything that was probably intended.  Cohen is a great teacher, although sometimes he is too overly concerned maybe with how everyone is doing.
Hard to follow sometimes... especially for theoretical material.  Is happy and very willing to revisit material to help comprehension, though.  Overall not a bad experience.
Great Professor, he is enthusiastic and cares.
Good teacher.  He's very concerned about his students and is very enthusiastic about what he teaches.
Excellent professor.  Really enthusiastic about mathematics, and makes it clear in his teaching.  Teaches calculus without boring you, as he tells funny anecdotes and draws pictures on the board.
Has an odd obsession with bugs.  Very helpful and concerned about my progress.
Doesn't cover the intended course material, but still a decent teacher. Has a few lame jokes and uses the same ones daily.
FredProCoh!
very helpful

Prof. Hudson is engaging and thought provoking, but the most difficult history professor I've taken. Get ready to write, and write a lot. However, he will actually read it all and give real feedback. He's also open to student disagreement with his interpretations. Kind of a dry humor, and witty if you give him a chance.

Prof. Hudson is one of my favorite teachers at this university because of his ability to create class dialogue. He poses questions to the class in a very neutral way but is able to take students' own opinions and thoughts and help them rethink historical events and stigmas that exist in the field. He expects high-quality work but it is manageable.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: This is my second class with Prof Hudson and he is one of my favorites at the school. He does have the ability to talk for long periods of time, but he is self aware of this, and his lectures are interesting! He's funny and engaging, and wants to see you do well/ leave with a solid understanding of the material. He has made me a better writer.
Decent prof, but grading seems somewhat arbitrary and the lectures are horribly boring. Often fails to stay on topic and doesn't engage much with the readings.

I've taken two courses with Professor Hudson-- after taking the first, I was better prepared to rise to his expectations. Yes, Hudson has a propensity to speak a lot and is a tough grader, but his thoughts are intriguing and he really values pushing his students to think. Be prepared to read a lot. Also be sure to utilize his office hours.

Hudson assigns a lot of homework and is a pretty harsh grader, but the class discussions are really good. He wants everyone to participate, so be prepared to share your opinion. Take a class from him if you are up for a challenge!

He's an OK lecturer, but not very helpful. If he doesn't already know you, you are much less likely to get a good grade. He expects a great amount of detail (fine with me) but then gives you a MAXIMUM of three pages in which to write it. AVOID.
he averages about 20 "uh"s a minute while lecturing. not worth it.

He's a nice guy and very smart.  I loved his class and would recommend it.  yes you have to come to class and yes you can't just sit back and not pay attention because he will call on you randomly but you actually learn something.  His class is definitely worth taking and I have no idea why he has such bad scores!

Hudson is the man - I don't know why people give him a bad rap. His Civil War class was very interesting. He didn't cover the actual war very much; his class was more about the history leading up to the war, which I found interesting. He grades easy, is a nice person to talk to and cares about the students who care about the class. I recommend him!

The class was called "The Civil War." We spent the semester on very early American history, skipped the actual war, then had 2 days on reconstruction before finals. Hudson is useless. His grading is a HUGE grey area. He doesn't like students who are concerned with their grades. As he always says, "the joy is in the work." Avoid him at all costs.

Save yourself. He will tear apart your papers, and insist you use first hand sources, he literally wants you to go to the LIbrary of Congress to look at the physical document. Impossible. Never a straight answer out of this guy even on simple questions

Professor Hudson was just okay. In a class about the Civil War, we never actually got to the Civil War. He talked about whatever was on his mind even if completely off topic. Unenthusiastic and boring. Nonetheless, go to class--he takes participation into account when evaluating students. Somewhat easy grader but not worth it.

OK class. Always make it to class, he remembers who attends and will hold it against you if you don't. Exams are simple but there are certain things he expects you to include based off of lecture. If you don't include it you may be in trouble. Also he may spring a pop exam on you, he'll say you should expect an exam soon.
I've never had a professor who answered a yes or no question with a 20 minute response, and still didnt really answer it.

Yes, he is an easy grader, yes his class can be a little boring at times, but he is such a wonderful guy.  His classes are a mix of lecture and discussion, so if the class is boring, you can talk about whatever you want and make it better.  Go to his office hours.  He is an interesting guy.

This class was painfully boring. In a class of about 80 people, 20 people showed and those that did didn't count because they were sleeping anyways. He's a nice guy who grades fairly easily but the grades aren't worth the class. Most of the time you have no idea what the hell he is talking about!

He is curtious and genial. His classes are always interesting, he tends to go off topic. He is a ridiculously easy grader. Definately go to his office hours, he is a nice person to talk to, and if you show interest in his class you will do very well.

He's definitely a nice guy.  If you take one of his classes, definitely go to his office hours so he can know you by name and face.  Once he knows who you are and let him know that your interested in his class, you'll automatically do well.
He is very nice and friendly and a really easy grader.  I don't know why he has such a bad score.
useless
Avoid taking his classes and you'll be much happier
Really nice professor. Very understanding about missing class, clearly cares about what shes teaching.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I've taken four classes with Prof Kegl & I really enjoyed them! She's a very understanding professor who is very available for feedback and advice and takes notice of student interest. She's not instantly engaging while lecturing but she's worth listening to. You basically get out what you put in. Make an effort and the classes will be enjoyable.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Rosemary is one of the worst professors you will find at this school. Her class talks are so boring. She grades like a middle school teacher as she's more concerned with grammar and citations over information. You can walk all over her by emailing her you're sick to get out of her class. She should never lead a class on Rochester. Disgrace to PhD's

This was my first English class at U of R and I really liked it. Some of the material was difficult but Professor Kegl did a great job of explaining what we should be looking for. The discussions were really interesting, and they added a lot to my understanding. Overall her lectures and feedback were really helpful and I feel like learned a lot.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Kegl is an awesome instructor and I would definitely take a class with her again! She showed the most respect for her students out of any professor I have had in college. There were definitely some technology barriers during this course but Kegl did her very best to adapt when there was an issue and went above and beyond.

She is very intelligent and well-spoken. Amazing at lecture and creating good discussion. A lot of reading and homework (mostly writing). I found this amount of work to be uncalled for given that this only a 100 level course. However, because of this work, I am a much better reader and writer. I left this course knowledgeable on the subject matter.

This was my first English course at the University and she made it very worthwhile. I liked her accommodation to students and her willingness to help us as much as possible. There will be a lot of reading but it is never too overwhelming.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: She is wonderful at taking students' ideas and times seriously & meeting students where they're at. The workload is reasonable and she makes it clear that she is for you as a student. For example, she added flexibility with our due dates multiple times and was willing to work with individuals on adjustments when they had extenuating circumstances.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Get ready to read--Gives good feedback

comment: I am a huge Shakespeare fan, so this class was a disappointment to me. I liked reading the stuff but class was so boring. Overall, it is so easy to get a good grade in this class. There are no tests just a lot of essays, but she grades them really easily. I skipped at least half of the plays that we were supposed to read and still did really well.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: This was my second course with Kegl and she's become one of my favorite professors. She makes even the driest material entertaining with her easy-going personality. Participation is important and she gives awesome feedback on essays. Lectures are always interesting.

Prof Kegl managed to make an interesting subject, Shakespeare, incredibly tedious. She seemed to grade arbitrarily, chose to teach plays she didn't find interesting, and struggled with technology every day. Her class was also lecture style, which I found to be a poor choice for an English class. Attendance and turning in papers on time is a must.

Professor Kegl is a very fair, honest, grader. She gives very good feedback and appreciates every type of student---whether you're there to simply listen to lecture or if you want to comment on every  point--as long as you pay attention. If you hold an interest in Shakespeare, her way of analysis is very clear and helpful.

Was consistently late to class and often was late on giving us an assignment. I could tell she was passionate about Shakespeare, but her lectures were thoroughly unengaging - if not for mandatory attendance, I probably would have never come to class.
Really knowledgeable, really nice. Sometimes got off topic, but usually not too bad. Just repeat back what she says in class in your papers and you'll do great!
Definately fell asleep during many of her classes. She knows her stuff and is passionate about it. Might wanna look into someone else to teach Shakespeare though.

"Meh" is the best expression to describe Kegl. She's clearly passionate about her work, but the material was just a hair away from being painfully basic (even for an intro class). Grading is a tad confusing. She's not terrible, just mediocre. Well intentioned, but flighty. It seemed to me that the LENGTH of papers (less so content) was important.

I had Prof. Kegl for many classes, and her courses always held my interest. She was especially helpful to me during a thesis paper. I always found her comments on papers especially helpful, and she was always willing to meet with students.
Knows her material, but lacks the ability to hold a classes interest; without the mandatory attendance, few would show up regularly, but there is rarely any incentive to participate in class.
Very mean at times and unhelpful at office hours. Grading seems arbitrary and often punishes for not conforming to her feminist views.
No Comments

I liked Professor Kegl a lot. She helped me with an independent project, and I really liked talking to her. Except then at the end of one term I was really stressed and decided to take her up on the option of not doing the final paper, and since then she hasn't spoken to me. Weird.
A very unhelpful and mean woman. Unable to meet students needs. Grades tough and often arbitrarily. Recommend avoiding.

Although her essays were easy and she is a great, passionate professor, Prof. B. assigns way too many readings. You'll be reading 17+ readings a week, and a lot of them are long. She grades participation, and you're grade will definitely go down if you don't participate enough. Lots of group work in class. Not a class for people with anxiety.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: Tanya is very chill when it comes to late assignments. The course was a little disorganized, but all of the readings were really interesting.
Take a class with her, you won't regret it. Easy but super rewarding and she's amazing.
She's great.  Real personality and great lectures with a depth of knowledge.  Would highly recommend.

She's an amazing lecturer who knows how to talk for an hour without losing students' attentions, which is a rare talent. She assigns a LOT of reading, but if you choose carefully it's pretty easy to jump in on discussions (participation is important) without doing the reading. You do have to write several pieces based on the readings, though.
Will definitely be taking more of her classes in the future!

She's amazing. Her enthusiasm made me more excited about the material, and made me really enjoy her class. She assigns a considerable amount of reading, but you can get away with not doing it all because she her lectures on the readings are very in-depth. All in all, I would definitely take another of her classes in the future.

She is my teacher at Hobart College and I have personally never had a teacher who is as engaged in a specific topic. She is not only engaged herself, she keeps her students very into the class using many slideshows, at least a youtube video everyday, and then lecture based.

Had her for Special Topics: Crime and Punishment in European History. Easy class, she made it impossible for you to obtain anything less than a B. Could resubmit your papers if you did not get the grade you wanted. Great lecturer.

She's a wonderful and enthusiastic lecturer and takes a lot of time with students individually to discuss classwork and anything of interest.  I wish she taught more upper-level classes instead of just freshmen.
Great class, great professor.
Nice
Great
I am actually sorry her class is over and she is not teaching anything new next year. Would take anything with her. Super helpful and a lot of fun.
Fantastic. Made CAS105 fun. Very helpful, extremely kind, but challenging.
very helpful and willing to give feedback at all stages of a paper. Difficult grader.

TOTAL ****! Seems all nice and friendly in class, but then she grades your paper in about 3 seconds and write C+ on it for NO REASON. Other CAS teachers just give out the As, but she makes everyone's life miserable. Made taking this useless and stupid class even worse than it had to be.
Excellent.
My favorite class and my favorite teacher: nice, sweet, smart, interesting stuff. Learnt a lot!
Great!
****. grades impossibly hard. every other cas teacher gives out As like nobody's business, but she gives Bs and Cs.
No Comments
HORRIBLE PROFESSOR!!!!

I had difficulty with exams, but it's clear she wants everyone to do well. Her lectures are really helpful - she is really good at breaking down problems. They become harder to follow if you fall behind so it's really important to keep up.
To be honest, I'm not a big fan of her lecture, but it is not hard to prepare for her exams. Read the book/notes, do her practice exam and additional problems, and you'll do fine.

Her lectures are dull and full of mistakes. She makes hard exams. She loves to test thermodynamic cycle but do not teach how to solve a question on it. She expects that students already know so much in chemistry, so she does not do enough efforts to teach in class. She is quite arrogant and rude. You learn most in workshops and through self-study.

Best teacher ever!! Some of these reviews dont do her justice at all. Shes the most inspirational professor Ive ever had the privilege of meeting, and she is also a great person. You will DEFINITELY do well if you do homework and attend workshops!

CHM 132 with Bren was not that bad. The tests are easy if you do the practice problems (which she made sure to provide a lot) and she genuinely cares about her students. She adjusted the difficulty of her tests after she noticed we all did poorly on the first exam and made sure to provide us with plenty of resources for the next tests.

Horrible Professor. Makes so many mistakes. Even on exam questions she make so many mistakes. She confuses her students and keeps telling them "I know you find this too easy" "I am assuming you have done this before". Her class is for people who have done AP or IB and yet those people don't do well either. I will never recommend her to anyone.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY

comment: Professor Bren clearly knows her stuff and fits a lot of information into lectures. The textbook chapters align well with her teaching and are very helpful. She provides plenty of resources to get the chemistry practice you need. Exams can be tough, but if you know what you're doing and fit in some practice, they're not bad.

Not at all helpful. When I asked her to explain a part of the question again in class. She says you can refer back on your notes, I am done explaining the problem. She makes so many mistakes on blackboard and is very confusing.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Professor Bren lectures are really good and she is available outside. Her tests are sometimes difficult but are fair.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Prof. Bren is the best professor I have ever had not only because she is one of the most knowledgeable and modest professors on this University, but also because she truly cares about her students' success. Chemistry requires individual work, but if you follow her lectures carefully, you will never have to do anything except practice problems.

This is the worst class I have ever taken. My workshop TA was prettty awful and Bren notes were messy and full of mistakes. Her lectures never made sense and I had to rely on internet to learn chem. Really annoying, avoid!

Hope she teaches CHM 132 for the first and last time. Not at all clear on blackboard. Cannot solve a problem without an error in it. When students ask her to design challenging workshops to prepare for the hard exams, she simply told class making such workshops would take a lot of time which she does not have. Very uncaring professor
Confusing professor. Makes lot of errors on blackboard.

For the first time teaching CHM 132, it's evident she has put a ton of time into developing the curriculum. Very open to suggestion and really listens to what students have to say. First exam was extremely difficult with workshops that did not reflect material, but second exam was extremely similar to homeworks/workshops. Good lecturer

Her class is so awful that I couldn't pay any attention to the texture and can't help looking at phones. There are so many errors on the practice exams solutions and doesn't reflect the true difficulty of the real exams. I found no useness to do these practice.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: Lectures are great for learning and really understanding the material. Go to her office hours if you can! One of the nicer profs around.

Is not at all helpful in her office hours? Make a lot of errors on blackboard. Her workshops don't represent the difficult level in exams. if her exam average goes down to 60%, she blames students for poor study skills and do not take any responsibility for weak workshops and her poor teaching skills.

Workshops and textbook don't prepare you for what's being tested on exams. Beware exam questions can be page long and you won't be able to finish the entire exam. Her class is best for students with ap chem background.
She is an awesome researcher. Hope she does not leave class at the mercy of other professors and workshop leaders.
Clear, interesting, fun class
Hard class.  Kara covered so much but she was very clear and explanations were very clear so it was manageable.  Glad I took this class and learned more than i expected.

Dr Jacobs was always very helpful and always able to be reached. There were 3 main coding homeworks which were not too bad if you give time to work through them and 2 multiple choice exams which weren't the worst. Overall I would definitely take this class again, as well as any other classes he teaches.

Dr. Jacobs is very nice and passionate about the material. Perception and cognitive modeling are his field so he is very knowledgeable in the field. No tests, 6 coding homeworks, and short final paper. Perfect class if you don't want to stress about exams and don't mind coding.

This course is Prof. Jacobs specialty. If you are interested in computational methods and Bayesianism, take this from him. All the readings are recent publications in the field so it's a great way to get exposed to the research going on. There are no exams, just some tricky homework coding assignments and a final essay.

Professor Jacobs is really interested in the subject and you can tell he's just a big nerd about the material. There is a lot of readings to do, but the lectures cover a lot of the readings. There are no exams, but the homeworks can be quite difficult. I think his lectures are fairly interesting, but sometimes they are heavy on the math.
Helpful and competent, but unfortunately a very dry lecturer and confusing test-writer.

So amazingly boring. If you need to take this class do not take it with him as a professor. The only grades are all multiple choice tests-all of which are super confusing. He is also confusing during class. The only reason to truly go to class is for the review questions.

Boring boring boring. Probably can do without attending the lectures. The things that he says are often confusing. The review sessions were helpful though and he often told you things to focus on while studying at them.

He's a wonderful professor! Very clear in what he expects of you. His exam questions all come directly from lectures, there is no textbook. He is so helpful during office hours, and the class before a midterm is always a review session. Great professor! Midterms are fairly easy if you study, the material is interesting/ fun to study.

Really clear and used great examples to relate the material to every day things. Also, extremely nice and kind to students. Tests are difficult, but he normalizes grades, so all you have to do is score higher than average (average is usually ~70%), and you'll get a good grade! Also, no textbook and no hw. No outside work... just learn the material.

His commentary on lectures really don't help, you could probably skip class and get the same grade. For instance, I hardly studied for the first test, got a grade I was not satisfied. I must have spent about 15 hours or so studying for the second test and got about 5 percent higher. I'm not a bad student, I've made the Dean's List.

HORRIBLE! Just reads from Powerpoints which are full of jargon and don't clarify anything. He might add an example here or there, but it's usually vague and doesn't help. His exam questions are obscure, and hard to study for. Wasn't even around to take questions for reading period and finals! Take this with someone else.
He seems to love what he's teaching, but he reads right off his slides.  You can skip class, read his slides, and you'll get the same education.  His exams are impossible though!!!
The teacher no longer uses a real textbook - instead, articles from various books accompany the powerpoints. He isn't a great professor, but he isn't horrible, either.

Teaches strictly from powerpoints that are dull and incomplete. Requires two expensive books, neither of which are helpful since he uses terms aren't listed. Tests are 11 questions that cover a months worth of material, and grading is heavily subjective. The TA knew more than him...
Not a good teacher.  Do not take 111 with him.  His grading is subjective, and lectures are boring.

This class was awful!!! The worst I've taken here.  His exam grading is purely subjective.  Lecture was horribly boring.  The book he chose was USELESS.  And his powerpoint slides aren't helpful either.  Don't take BCS 111 with him.  Take it with Achtman or anyone else.  He is terrible.
the material itself has the potential to make a great class, but he's reduced it to a monotone run-through of powerpoint slides
No Comments
He's really great and very helpful, esp. if you go and talk to him during office hours.  I love him!
what a horrid professor.  pointless slides, tests are hard because he picks obscure things to question.  i don't even think he does research, he is just unhelpful and dumb sometimes.
ugh...so inconsiderate
good professor, interesting

AHH-MAZING. Passionate, intelligent lecturer, makes class super interesting. Very flexible, wants to help students succeed. An expert in the field and has worked with many of public health leaders. No other course/professor at U of R has been more eye opening and increased my interest in a subject as much as TB.

I took both 116& his 373 with professor Brown.Although his lectures are clear, the courses he teaches are repetitive in nature. As well, he is not open minded. Ph 116 wasn't bad since the TAs did half the grading but HIS 373, the average grades were B-/C+ on essay assignments. Would not recommend, I changed my major from HLP to Econ because of him.
He is very passionate about the problems of the U.S. health system. I enjoy his lecturing style, even though it can be hard to follow for taking notes. Exams are fair.

I would not suggest this class to anybody who is open minded and doesn't want to hear only a lecture of opinions and one side of a every issue covered.  The class was not very difficult and the homework was not necessary to get a good grade, but I wish I hadn't taken this class.

Ted Brown is a great lecturer, advisor and professor.  While he does tend to express his opinion moreso than exploring both sides to an argument he also includes valuable facts and information.  I took more away from his class than the majority of the core PH requirements.  I would definitely suggest taking 116

The only way to succeed in this class is to have great notes, and since Brown only lectures, you're going to be seriously lacking if you don't go to class. He's a great lecturer, but the classroom (B&L 106) is warm and I actually fell asleep a few times. I did the readings, and even after missing sections a day, I managed an A. I reccommend HIS 287

Grading is very arbitrary and has three different graders so there is no form of standardization. Point system is ridiculous since one ends up receiving scores like 4.3 and 3.65 for short answers. How such numbers are reached is beyond me. Very spirited in lecture but lectures are one-sided and should not be taught that way.

The worst class I have ever taken. I had heard he was an excellent lecturer and, to be fair, his lectures were fairly engaging. However, I have never sat through a more one-sided class. The class is 90 percent HIS opinion so if you came to college to learn, I do not recommend Ted Brown.

Professor Brown is very expressive! I like his lecture style, he's never boring and has a bit of humor. The topics he covers are things really worth thinking about and are actually applicable to life.

Ted Brown is wonderful. HLS 116 is fantastic...such important topics to know about. He isn't shy about expressing his political beliefs, etc. but who would want him to be!!?? It makes class that much more interesting. The man is a genius. Office hours can be intimidating to go to...but go anyway! He is very helpful with papers, etc.

As mentioned previously, likes to ramble and tends to be verbose in conveying an argument or point. But he's knowledgeable and a fair grader; not difficult to get an A if you do you work. Recommended.
Smart guy but talks way too much.  He talks for the entire class time and does not really try to elicit questions/discussions.  Very slow grader.  Exams are fair.

Could have been an interesting class, but not well constructed and lectures were rather boring. Intelligent and somewhat interesting prof, but given to rambling unnecessarily for long periods of time - no structure or obvious point to his long lectures. Also tends to ask a lot of questions with a very specific answer in mind, hard to respond to.

Arguably the best professor at Rochester on many levels--Brilliant man, very effective teaching style, and available to students for absolutely anything. A true leader in his field, Professor Brown is inspiring. TAKE A CLASS WITH HIM, even if you aren't in the public health or history fields.

This man inspired me to change to an HLS minor -- he simply made me love the idea of public health and made me want to learn everything I can about it. Tests aren't too bad as long as you go to class. Take all his classes -- you'll thank yourself later!
AMAZING. Take all of his classes. Every last one.

The absolute best and most inspiring professor at the university. He knows his subjects well and is incredibly passionate about sharing his knowledge. His course truly did change the way I look at health care in America and has motivated me to choose a different career. Very highly recommended!
No Comments

Wonderful professor, makes the material truly interesting.  Not the easiest of classes but if you need help he's generally around (sometimes he can be very busy due to travel) to talk to and get help from.  Best professor I've had so far and I'm a senior.
Simply an amazing prof. - most dynamic prof. I have had.
great professor, i love his courses. He's very interesting and makes class fun.

Very caring and understanding prof. You can tell he wants you to succeed and gives really good feedback. I went into WRTG 273 thinking my LinkedIn and resume were already fire but he helped make them so much better.

Nice professor willing to answer and help with your questions.

A lot of work
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: He cares about the students. He understands that students have things that are more important than life design notebook entries. If there's conflicts between actual interview/opportunity and class time he is open to communicating how to work that issue around. He is fine with you turning a LDN late by a couple days, as long as it's not over a week.

Amazing professor. His office hours are also very helpful as he gives a lot of specific instructions to edit the essays. One downside is that he is a REALLY TOUGH GRADER. With that being said, the educational process is the most important, and he is one of the only professors at the university who knows how to teach.
He gives the grade not very well although I did a huge effort on the paper.

This class is not an easy A class, but getting an A is worth the effort. As long as you participate in class discussions about the reading and put decent effort into your papers you will do just fine. Karl gave me great advice when it came to my papers, and I definitely improved thanks to it. I'm glad I chose to take this class, it was fun!

Karl is strict with his class structure and grading criteria, but he is also flexible and understanding of his students. He gives amazing feedback and I feel like my writing really improved because of him. My interest in writing increased after taking this class. You have to work for your A, but it feels deserved and not given to you.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Professor Mohn was fantastic. My writing really improved throughout the semester and he always brought a great attitude to class. His office hours were incredibly useful he is very good at giving one on one advice on how to improve your writing. You do need to put some effort in for his class, but I would recommend taking it.

The best writing professor I ever had. Talk to him if you do not have a clear idea about your paper. He gives amazing advice on your paper. If you work hard and willing to talk and discuss with him during his office hours, you will at least get an A-. If you just hurry in the last hour and imagine getting an A, this class is not for you.

Not much homework which was nice but also this means 75% of your grade comes from the three papers that you will write. However, he gives good feedback and you have peer review days which are very helpful. It was easy to pay attention in his class as everything was interesting. I would definitely take again.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Graded by few things

comment: I took this course online. Karl is really an interesting person, and his class is overall joyful. I myself did a lot research for the final paper, but I do like the result. His comments on the drafts are useful, you can learn a lot if you want to.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read

comment: During my freshman year, I took this class, and I have to say Professor Mohn's lecture is one of the best lectures I ever had. He is a harsh grader, but he is usually easy to reach out to and gives you a lot of useful feedback.

Professor Mohn is definitely one of the hardest graders out there. I would suggest not taking his class for a grade because frankly you wouldn't get an A unless you are really good. However, he is really nice person to talk to and get your writings cross checked from. A really nice person to be around
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: A good indtructor over all. Not so much reading. Not that tough on greading papers. Try hard and you'll at least get a B.

If you want easy A's, don't take Karl. If you sincerely want to learn, please do. He is a tough grader, but he lets you know exactly where you are at and makes you work hard to better your writing skills. I find reading materials and some of his feedback immensely useful for future use.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: I would recommend every comics/anime fan to take Professor Mohns class. Professor Mohn is always willing to assist with papers and is ready to meet outside office hours. His feedback really helps in revising drafts and with his cooperation getting an A is not hard if you are will8ng to put in effort. Going to his office hours helps a lot.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: This professor is vague in his feedback and assignment guidelines, and yet he has high expectations from the students. Although a 2 credit course, for some weeks there are about 5 assignments due. Each week there is 1-2 work intensive assignments due.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: OH MY GOD. He only teaches freshman writing class, and I got a grade lower than the ones from upper level ENG/ HIS courses that I later took. HOW COME? HE EXPECTED BEYOND THE COURSE'S SUPPOSED LEVEL OF DIFFICULTY, and he DID NOT PRPEPARE US FOR HIS STANDARDS!!! MY FONTS CANNOT BE BOLDER, MY RAGE CANNOT BE HOTTER.

Professor Karl is a good professor. He is passionate about his class and respects all his students. However, the work for his class is heavy and he is kind of a tough grader. It's not easy to get an A range score in his class unless you work really hard.
Professor is nice, classes are fun, but grading is some kind of hard. If you like comics, take this course, you will definitely love it! There are trips to the art gallery and a comic-con.
classes are fun. readings take time. participation matters. be genuinely interested in the content and getting a good grade will be much easier

Chancer as read by Peck in class is entertaining; Peck outside of class is not entertaining at all. I went to his office hours to get clarity on thoughts for a paper. Said nothing & was treated to a diatribe on how being a Christian & seeing history as a creation of Christianity is the only proper worldview and context to view the world. Sick.

Wonderful professor! Enthusiastic about his subject, cares about students. If he suspects the class isn't reading, he gives surprise in-class quizzes, but is a very fair grader in general. He is awesome.
The best professor I have ever had.
BEST EVER

I admit I wasn't the best student in terms of attendance but I somehow managed to bang out a B+ and such, which is good enough for me for his standards. His 9AM lectures are so interesting but perhaps a bit too dense for mornings, hence the lack of attendance. But a great person, a truly nice professor and one of the smartest men I've met.
He is a very influential teacher! He loves Middle English and gets so excited to teach it! I highly recommend this class, it was a lot of reading but fun!

LOVE HIM! He expects a lot from his students but it is all worth it in the end. Teaching is his life and he will do anything to help you succeed. I have no idea how he has so much energy and enthusiasm at his age. DO NOT leave Rochester without taking one of his classes!

Very interesting man. Knows his material and is very animated when he teaches. Very eager to help his students, just go to his office hours. He takes into account if you want and try to succeed in his class.

Professor Peck is one of those few professors that actually understands what it means to be a professor. He loves what he teaches, knows it inside and out, and is always ready to accept a new idea. I went on one of his theatre trips to England, and I was dragging arse the morning after I got back. I went to my 9am anyway because he was the professor, and just as I expected, he was there, animated as ever. A true scholar and gentleman. One in a million.
No Comments
The guy is great, full of life and truly enjoys his work and his students. Always there to help and wholly involved in the English Dept on every level. You'd be lucky to find a better professor

One of the few professors who is knowledgeable, helpful, and interesting.  I was able to stay awake and interested at 9am on Friday mornings, and that says a lot!!!  Even if you don't need the credit, audit a class w/ him- he's excellent!

Incredibly intelligent man.  One of the best professors ever.  Knows the material that he teaches incredibly well.  Very demanding in terms of papers and tests, but his classes are a must take.  A gentleman and a scholar.
Great teacher- made even Middle English interesting.

He loves teaching and his students, and he's an incredibly intelligent man.  He makes you work hard for a good grade, especially when it comes to papers and the length of reading assignments.  Definitely take at least one class with him.
Expectations to high for a class over winter break in England.
Enthusiastic, energetic, fun. Great Professor! Makes you earn your grade. Take his class if you can, but leave a seat for me :-)
Fine scholar, generous mentor; a man for all seasons
Engaging and theatrical
It's been 21 years since I took the course and I still remember it vividly.
Engaging, relevant, and incredibly talented

Very entertaining lecturer who's not only hilarious but willing to go over material until students understand it. This is good because there's a lot of readings, many of which are at a higher level than I personally had ever read in Spanish before. Fairly straightforward essays, the partial exams were strange but manageable.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback

comment: Very rude. Harassed student for registering for his course, which he left open, before the add/drop period ended after only 3 lectures having passed. Complained about being contacted in Spanish for a Spanish class. If he didn't want anyone to add his class anymore, he should have closed the listing with the registrar.

Prof. RH is a good but imperfect professor. While I came out of the class definitely having learned a lot, it wasn't exactly what I expected. He seemed to lose the focus on Latin America midway through and just wanted us to know the details of Freudian thought. As a Spanish major, I was hoping to learn more about its impact on the L.A. world.
Very tough grader and very writing/reading heavy, however he makes lecture super entertaining and is easily available outside of class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Get ready to read

comment: You have to read a lot, it takes forever. It was very stressful for me, but he grades pretty fairly and is patient when you don't understand (esp bc his first language isn't English).

Very, VERY disorganized. Unclear, confusing. It's really difficult to follow what is going on in class. Lots of reading that is over our level. I would not recommend anyone to take this class, or anything else with this professor for that matter. However, if you need extra help he is willing to meet with you. It is very unhelpful because not clear.
I enjoyed this professor and he really knows how to make class fun.
Professor Rodriguez-Hernandez is always very clear with his expectations and is very big on using content specific  vocabulary when it comes to writing essays. He's pretty funny and easy going.

He's hilarious! Class is long so you'll obviously get tired but he does a great job of keeping you interested. He's a very tough grader but pay attention to his edits and edit your papers by yourself a couple of times before submitting and you should be good. Each week you're either writing or editing a paper but it's fun.

He is very funny and makes the 75 minutes bearable. He's a hard grader, but he wants you to improve and understand everything. Tests aren't hard, essays are fun, class is interesting, reading is cool. Raul is great
Very quirky and endearing. Class was a lot of fun, and he does know a lot about spanish literature. Very approachable.
Quirky and likable; take him if you can as soon as you can (his classes tend to fill quickly).
He is simply an awesome, funny, smart man. Also way easier than the other 200 professors. TAKE HIS CLASS!
Definitely knowledgeable on literature and theory, but he can be too specific with the papers making them very difficult. Talks a lot if you don't.
Nice professor, puts forth a good effort, but a little bit confusing sometimes.  Adorably wacky.
very helpful, good professor, very knowledgeable
No Comments
No Comments
Not bad as a Spanish prof.  Horrible for the major seminar- he tried to include way too much information and made class a drudgery.  Plus, rumor has it he didn't even read our final papers!
GO AWAY
No Comments

I would like to throw shade at other reviewers who suggest that the course is incoherent: it isn't. Lecture attendance (or recordings) and note-taking are essential in this course (as in other conceptually higher-level courses), and homework follows directly from it if you're paying attention to the elegant explanations. He clearly knows his stuff.

His courses are not organized at all, and he won't even be there for lectures sometimes. Although he doesn't have any finals, his course is not easy to get an A because 95 is an A. What's more, his homework has nothing to do with his class, toooooo hard. He also has three term projects which is also not organized, and not enough instructions.

You can tell he is incredibly smart, but not in a way where he doesn't know how to explain things in simple terms. One of the best lecturers I have ever had. There aren't any exams which is nice but weekly homeworks and 3 group projects. Give lots of time for the projects because they are sometimes not that clear what to do so you may need to ask

Prof Aluie is great with his lectures, hard class! As long as you understand his lectures, you should be able to do the homework, no exams. Projects are rough but I did not have any CS background. It would be very helpful to know some coding. If you need extensions, better to ask him in person! He recognizes where you sit if you go to class often.
I really enjoyed the lectures and found them very stimulating. I've never had a professor who could answer complicated questions so quickly and in such an intuitive way.

Prof. Aluie is very knowledgable and very willing to help students. The subject material itself is difficult with long tedious homeworks and grueling group projects, but Prof. Aluie knows this and gives students plenty of time to tackle these. Do not procrastinate, and reach out for help, and he will be amazing.

He's a pretty good lecturer and explains concepts well. Homework and exams are challenging for sure but the lecture material is directly relevant, plus- Aluie is the nicest person and incredibly helpful in office hours!
Homeworks and tests are difficult, but the class and concepts are taught well.

Professor Aluie is exciting and full of energy. He always has useful ideas and made connections between math and physics. He is also very friendly. Sometimes I could guess he did not prepare well but I always enjoyed his lectures. I think this was the first time he teached this course.
An awesome Professor, passionate and very friendly. He has a strong understanding of the course and tried hard to make us understand what he was teaching. He is good at explaining difficult concepts.

I worked hard for this class but I liked it the most. Lectures are great even though they are at 9am :( Perfect teacher for this class. Tries to guess the answer before solving the math which is very helpful. Jumps a lot between big picture and small details. Good balance between theory and examples.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Amazing lectures

comment: Difficult but manageable class. The textbook is very helpful but the exams reference many in-class examples and demonstrations he does, so it's important to go to class. He's very helpful one and one (more so than in lecture) and definitely rewards effort and initative.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Great guy! values intuition, shows demos and exams are fair. MCQ's makes you think and are tricky but are identical to practice exams except for subtle differences. It's good that he uses the textbook for notes because you don't have to spend much time reading it. If you are a Physics major, probably one of the easiest PHY classes out there.
+1 Truther here. Average class at best, lectures straight from the book, certainly not as great as the reviews say. The book was really good thankfully.
By far the best professor I ever had in all of my courses. He is so cool and gives very interesting examples from the real world.
Good lecturer, very intelligent guy, for my personal learning more examples and less derivation would have been helpful. Would have been nice if tests were curved slightly.
Good Professor,  very helpful but expects quite a bit from his students.
great guy!!!!!
Professor Aluie is by far one of the best professors I have met in college. He is one of the smartest people I have met he is a good person and he is HOT!!!
One of the best professors I had. He values intuition and is tough but fair.
He is an awesome professor. He really cares about the students and his lectures are fun a lot of the time.

One of the best professors I've seen. Made the course very simple and explained it really well. She's funny, helpful and definitely there to help students who are having trouble. 10/10 would recommend.

Professor Tucker (neé Beeson) explained series, sequences, and polar calculus way better than the 2 other professors I had for MTH 162. Her examples in class corresponded with the practice midterms/actual midterms and final, which helped a lot on the webwork as well. She made sure the last week of class was entirely review for the final. Great prof
she was great! very clear lectures, always finished on time, neat handwriting. i never had to read the text, lectures made everything crystal clear. super available outside of class too.

The worst math professor. Is scatterbrained and terrible at explaining even basic concepts. She is both rude and condescending, treating you like an idiot if you don't understand. Does really easy examples in class and the exams end up being 10 times harder. Obviously is more interested in her own research than in teaching.

She is terrible at explaining things. She'll write an essay instead of writing the or a graph. Don't bother seeing her for extra help, because she just tells you to do the book problems or says that you should already know how to do this, and should therefore not be in the class if you can't, even if you got a B+ on the last test.
She is friendly, gives clean and easy lectures, and is pretty helpful. Overall she is a great teacher and prepares you well for exams.
She was alright.

Going to her class bored me to death and made it so I just couldn't grasp what she was saying, she goes at a snails pace. This may be good for some, but was killing me. I skipped this class and went to Isovich's instead, saved me on my final.
She was pretty good. Probably the best teacher for this class.

Great Professor. I don't know what these other reviewers are talking about but I thought she explained the concepts clearly and effectively. I really enjoyed her teaching method. One of the top math professors in the department. And she really cares about her students.

Beeson really cares about her class, it is a fun environment and she jokes around a fair amount. Her teaching style is great for math, she actually explains concepts and ensures her class understands the concepts before applying them. It is Calc 1, which you probably took in high school, so it's a great review before Calc 2 second semester.

Beeson really cares about her class, it is a fun environment and she jokes around a fair amount. Her teaching style is great for math, she actually explains concepts and ensures her class understands the concepts before applying them. It is Calc 1, which you probably took in highschool, so it's a great review before Calc 2 second semester.

Beeson really cares about her class, it is a fun environment and she jokes around a fair amount. Her teaching style is great for math, she actually explains concepts and ensures her class understands the concepts before applying them. It is Calc 1, which you probably took in highschool, so it's a great review before Calc 2 second semester.

Professor Beeson is the nicest and sweetest professor I have had at the UR. She is very helpful during office hours and her lectures are very precise and easy to understand. She cares about the success of her students and will take the time to talk to you and get to know you as well. Her handwriting is very neat and she is very organized!

She is a great professor and never gave difficult exams. I enjoyed having a math professor that actually spoke English too. She is super sweet and helpful in office hours. She is ridiculously smart too. I'm not sure what these other students are talking about but her tests were never difficult. Looks like someone wasn't going to class.

Worst professor ever.  She only goes over basic concepts (while testing you on difficult ones) and lectures are boring and unhelpful.  Her final exam was absurdly hard given how terrible she taught the concepts.  Avoid if possible.
She teaches only on a basic level. She treats the class like we are still in middle school. Everything about this lecture is frustrating, because we didn't learn anything worth learning.

Beeson is terrible. She is very awkward during lecture. She tries to be funny but she ends up embarrassing herself. She literally get red in the face after one of her failed attempts at engaging the class. She treats us like seven year olds! In the last 5 minutes of every class she tries to cram in a proof or an example. Please avoid her teaching!
She is great

I feel as though she is being very highly underrated. As far as teaching the subject she is extremely clear with a bottom up approach. Her exams are never curve balls and as far as questions and being approachable she is a different and very open person during office hours.
She's crystal clear.. just on basic concepts.  Doesn't teach beyond basic concepts, and looks at you like your dumb if you ask her questions.

Prof. Jordan is clearly extremely intelligent, and as is often the case, this makes understanding him at time difficult. I think Jordan would help society more if he was completely be dedicated to research. The lectures varied in their difficulty; some I loved, some I hated (from frustration and being lost).

Jordan rarely explained topics in a way that was clear to those who had never taken Physics. The class was not meant as a class for physics majors, but rather was full of mostly students in other disciplines who were required to take it. He was unclear, and would focus on discussing the theoretical aspects of the problems, instead of how to do them

Not a good professor at all. His lectures are really confusing and the math he uses is well beyond the scope of the course. You 100% need to read the book to learn anything. The HW assignments are long and tedious. 1st midterm was easy, 2nd was challenging but fair, the final exam was RIDICULOUSLY HARD and very unfair. Pray for a good workshop TA.
His instruction will leave you confused. His tests will leave you angry. Avoid at all costs.

Be prepared for long grueling homework assignments. Oh and the TA's will grade at most 2 problems of the 20 asked to turn in. So if you mess up only 2 questions on the 20 question assignment and they only grade those 2 questions you get a 0, for literally hours of work.

Jordan isn't that bad. He only uses variables in lecture so that can be hard to get used to, but it really does help in the end if you put in the effort to follow it. Physics is just a tough subject, there's not going to be an easy way to teach it. You really have to change your way of thinking to be successful. Try to really learn the CONCEPTS.

He seems like a nice guy but I think 90% of the class would appreciate it if he "came down to our level" a few times per lecture instead of zooming through so much material and examples on the board. Get a tutor.

Not the greatest at making lecture interesting though he does have his moments. Does a lot of derivations in class that are not necessary for passing the class. I definitely suggest knowing the homework very well, tests are heavily based on them
A smart guy, but feels the need to derive and integrate everything. Take this course if you like the greek alphabet, as you will be seeing a lot of it.

Prof Jordan is a terrible teacher. He may be good at physics but he can't convey his understanding to students at all. Going to class was useless as well as the book. His tests were mostly unfair and difficult.
I took AP Mechanics in high school, so the class hasn't pushed me too hard. I've done pretty well. Other students with little previous physics experience tend to struggle, though.

Professor Jordan thinks that everyone is a calculus super star and that we all scored 5's on our AP exams. His lectures are extremely boring and his tests are ridiculous. He likes to say they're possible maybe because he's the professor. If at all possible stay away.

Jordan is one of the worst professors here. I understand physics is a challenging subject, but this guy can't teach it to save his life. If more then a 3rd of the class continually fails, then it's HIS fault! We study hard! He might possibly be worse then the intro to French professor here, Madame Lutkus. Both need to be fired. NOW!
awful class. very difficult, no review in or outside of class. goes quickly and assumes everyone is a calc genius. class did not help me or my gpa. lab is awful as well & is included in your grade.

I survived, this guy is tough and his lectures are almost useless, spends the a lot of time deriving formulas but no time on how to use them.  Real world examples are nice though.  Though when I started studying for MCAT's wow he did a better job than I thought.  Still tough though.
blamed us when the whole class didn't do well on a test
Jordan was not very clear and quite boring.  I consider him to be the worst professor I had during my freshman year.  Would not recommend taking a class with him.

This professor needs to improve his teaching skills and make the class more interesting in a way where the students understand the work and also have fun. More than half the class has failed both of his exams, and he's not to blame???

AVOID AT ALL COST!! lectures are useless! homework is differernt from lectures and the exams are 100% different than the lectures and homework!!...dont even ask about workshops.......He is without a doubt the worst professor I have ever had. Do your GPA a favor and dont take Jordan!! ...take it over the summer if u had to

His first midterm wasnt extremely hard but the second one was off the charts crappy. 45% is not a good average. He said something along the lines of "I can't believe you did so poorly when I gave you all spring break to do your homework and study." in regards to our lack of knowledge on a certain type of problem. Avoid him if possible  for you gpa.

Jordan is the most arrogant person I have ever met. He knows physics well but is horrible at teaching it and doesn't listen to students at all when they make suggestions or complain. The average grade on our last test was 47.5 and he told us that we clearly weren't studying enough. Never take a class with him if you can avoid it.

Professor Wojat tries to make auditing more interesting. His auditing stories actually help me remember concepts better. He is obviously really smart and will do anything to make time for his students! He is a good professor!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: GO TO LECTURE and make sure he knows your name/face, he's been known to bump grades. HW isn't graded, but very similar to Exams, some exactly the same with different #'s. He is the only Prof. for FIN 205, so take his 201 so you can get used to his style before FIN 205. FIN 205 will be impossible if you take ACC 201 w/ another prof.

The WORST professor I have ever had. Goes on too many tangents during class. Very bad at explaining concepts in class. Very hard to know how to study for tests because they are all multiple choice. Do the homeworks to study for the test.

Biggest waste of time. Didn't learn anything about accounting with him besides his rants of how much his life sucks. If I were the University I would probably fire him except he probably hides all the bad numbers and raise in tuition for them. Oh yeah, if you love learning through transparencies in a large auditorium, he's perfect.

Very knowledgeable professor. Excited in the material. Taught very well. Was available meet and go over questions on the material outside of class. Test questions were based on the lecture notes. Easy to do well in this class if you went and did the problems assigned.

He really care about his students and want them to learn but has standards. The notes are overwhelming but his format is straightforward. It was one of my favorite classes at the school. I'd like to take a class with him again.

REALLY energetic prof.  he even admits that ACC material is dry, but he makes the best of it.  Even though he has over 150 students a semester, he makes it his duty to get to know every last one of them--->he's very passionate about teaching and is an overall great person.  Tests are right out of notes.
Extremely boring class and likes to call on random people. Reads off his lecture notes on the overhead and talks way too loudly. Subject is way too boring to get through reading the book.

he is all over the place when he talks, not too interesting, tries to get really into the lectures but they are still boring and confusing, tells random, unrelated stories over and over. likes to learn his students names and get to know you, gives out lecture notes, tests are all multiple choice.
No Comments

the man loves to teach and he DOES care if you learn or not which is good...class can be real boring...he's easy to understand though and he gives out notes and his tests are multiple choice...very similar to ECO 211 if you've taken that before

Makes an effort to get to know each student, gives great lecture notes, and very fair exams. The course is a very general overview of finance that makes a few too many generalizations, but Wodjat does a good job teaching it. Occassional tangents can be strange, but he's a nice guy and a great prof.
Spends a lot of time preparing lectures and genuinly tries to make sure the material is understood.
Wojdat is a really sharp guy who cares a lot about teaching. He works hard to make sure he gets the material across to his classes. Accounting and Finance can be boring, but Wojdat makes it fun!
excellent notes give out, straight forward exams if you do the hwk and attend class
Excellent teacher.  It is nice to have a professor who goes out of his way to get to know his students.  He is genuinely concerned about seeing his students doing well.
He's an awesome prof. It seems he spends a long time preparing before his lectures and he gives out his notes as well which makes studying easier. He's also a generally funny and cool guy.
Excellent prof, wished he taught more classes for undergrad.
No Comments
No Comments
Good teacher. Funny guy.

Awful professor! Had her for mth 165 as well during fall 2016 and her section consistently performed the worst out of all the other mth 165 sections. Lectures have no structure and are, in general, confusing.
horrible. does not teach. lessons are VERY hard to understand. very confusing. if you are bad at math and cant teach yourself new things, especially calculus, then do NOT take this professor.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Had her for mth 165 in fall 2016. Horrible and disorganized lectures!
Great professor. Make exams and homework really easy
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Amazing lectures

comment: Hardest class I have ever taken and extremely confusing lectures!
Disorganized, hard to follow, and confusing. Stay away at all costs.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Tests? Not many--Tests are tough

comment: Easy A. Basically tells you exactly what will be on the test, and the webwork is right out of the book. Her lectures are pretty good, but you don't really need to go if you cram the textbook.

Generally a good professor - solid lectures and reasonable tests. And she's also helpful outside of class. I went to her office hours all the time, and she helped with he and have good hints for the test.  Loved this class, will definitely take her in the fall.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures

comment: Good lecturer, but even better outside of class. I went to her office hours all the time, and she was super helpful.  Loved this class, will definitely take her in the fall.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures

comment: Smart and clear. Gave good examples in class and homework looked a lot like the test. If you have to take math, there are a lot worse teachers.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: Ignores emails, which makes the class difficult to follow! Inattentive to students' needs!!

One of my favorite classes in the entire math sequence. She always had time to meet after class and during office hours, even for topics unrelated to the class. As a senior, glad I could take one last class with a Prof like her.
I'm a math person, so I did do great, although she did not at least help. Got much out of the other prof's lectures, while her's were pretty unclear.
The class was pretty tough, but I really feel like I understand topology now. She's a genius!
Bad prof. Not really a math person and still hated this course.
Good prof. Not really a math person, but still a good course.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Gives good intuition, and easy to follow proofs.
Loved this professor. Good lectures, great office hours. Always helpful, and explained things a lot of different ways til I got it.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures

comment: Good lectures. Helpful in office hours. Wasn't a very hard class, but she did a pretty good job.
Good teacher, fair grader, easy class. Not much more to say.
Hard to understand and breezes through lectures that were usually disorganized in nature. Go to the other sections for lectures, notes, and clear examples.
He was very helpful when it came to assignments and talked about the lore behind subjects not just the content itself. Also is ALWAYS fitted up. Overall 10/10 for the suits

Dan Watson is a beautiful human being. His lectures can be a little boring, but his passion for the topic of astronomy and his amazing suits make lecture worth it. The grading of exams is extremely fair as Dan looks for any excuse to give partial credit. All around an amazing person, I cannot recommend taking him enough.

Dan Watson is an amazing professor. ASTR 111 is challenging, but he grades kindly. If you put the work in you'll learn a LOT. Watson is really kind, helpful in office hours, and always willing to chat about astronomy. He wrote me rec letters and connected me with alumni in the field I want to go into. Top tier professor, I hope I have him again.

Very enjoyable professor, he makes lots of funny quips and he's very interesting. He does spend a lot of time explaining math that isn't exactly relevant and you do have to go back into the slides to understand a lot of things, but the website and slides are laid out very well

I believe the homeworks were a bit difficult, and they do take a lot of time and work, but I really enjoy Watson as a person and overall as a teacher. He is very helpful and wonderful to talk to during office hours (oftentimes he even gives cookies!). Sometimes I did get sleepy during his lectures, but I really did learn a lot!
Love his class. Great guy, very accessible, and surprisingly funny during lectures. Also, the suits are impeccable.

If Dan Watson has 10,000 fans I'm one of them. If Dan Watson has 100 fans I'm one of them. If Dan Watson has one fan it's me. If Dan Watson has no fans I'm no longer alive. If the world is against Dan Watson I am against the world. 
This man's style is IMPECCABLE, also he is super forgiving with extensions and very available outside class.
Love
Very passionate about teaching astronomy and has easy-to-follow lectures. Would recommend taking the class

If you don't have a science background I would not take this class unless you're willing to work. He goes into extreme specifics that you don't need to know for tests, and the tests are on webwork which sucks. Go to lecture and recitation, and DO THE PRACTICE TESTS, half the questions are on the real tests. He's very passionate and a great lecturer

I cannot believe that my 70,000 dollar a year tuition is going towards this man attempt to teach me physics. Every time I went to lecture I left even more confused than I started. He never responded to emails, tests were insanely hard (over half the class failed his second midterm). His class was harder than the honors version of the same class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dan is really bad at conveying any idea to students. He also makes you feel dumb for asking questions and gets some weird joy out of assigning homework questions that even the TAs can't solve. He's also just an all around jerk.

-Assigns homework due the day before a midterm (only two midterms in the class) -Tries teaching Calc-based Physics through powerpoint -Never has homework due on the same day every week (could be Monday, Wednesday, or Friday. You never know) -Tries writing his own homework problems that even the TAs can't solve

Since day one he threw equations that were not explained at us. He knows the course but does not teach it well at all. Does not take into consideration the fact that this is most people's first time dealing with this subject. If possible take this class with someone else or at another place.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: He is smart but he does not have the slightest clue on how to teach. He is completely out of touch and teaches a class that clearly requires someone to do out problems by hand, with lecture slides. He is horrible at teaching PHY122. He know the material but does not understand that the people he is teaching may be seeing this for the first time.

I'm not a science person. At all. I heard this class required little math -- not so much. There is Web Work involved. T.A.'s aren't that helpful. Lectures can be confusing/boring, but his eccentricities make them bearable.

Dan Watson is funny, smart, and adorably nerdy. He loves what he is doing and does his best to help students. I learned more in Astro 142 from him than in any of my subsequent classes in higher level astronomy. Only thing to beware of are magically appearing variables in his powerpoint slides.

He may well be the least helpful person on the face of the earth. More than half the class had issues taking a test on webwork and he told us that we probably did something wrong. Oh, he also says "Uh" or "Um" between every word and moves his arms like a penguin.

He knows that most people in the class are only there because of requirements, and he makes it VERY easy to get an A.  The lectures are generally boring / sometimes incomprehensible, yet he is very helpful if you have questions outside of lecture.

I could NOT stay awake during his lectures.  He seems like a nice guy, but when I tried to introduce myself it was awkward; I never talked to him again.  His lecture notes don't make sense unless you hear the lecture.  The homework isn't hard, but the tests are tricky.  He knows what he's talking about, but he's not very fun to listen to.

Lectures are pretty boring, but he teaches well nonetheless. The test is based entirely on lecture, so the book is really just for your own use. The powerpoints usually don't make sense unless you hear him explain them, so you need to go to class most of the time.

Actually, he's a nice guy outside of class and sometimes makes more sense if you go to him for help.  But the class is very dull.  He just reads from powerpoints and puts you to sleep.  Lots of equations, naturally.  But his powerpoints are not very good at explaining things.  And the book is rarely any help, though it can be amusing.
learned nothing from her class. Avoid at all costs. none of her comments are constructive. this class made me a worse person.
Everything you've done can be written off by her.

She gets a bad rap, but is an amazing professor who cares tremendously. I think most students are just mad they actually have to try in a gen ed. She makes you think, gives great feedback, and pushes to improve your writing past the 10th grade level most students come in with. She absolutely would not get so much hate if she was a man.
literally avoid this woman at all costs
rating_tags: Tough grader--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: Ridiculous class that did not highlight what was expected of students and yet somehow found a way to punish the lack of communication even though it was mainly from Dr. Sol's side. Very difficult to get a hold of her and would not recommend the class unless you want to have your jaw dropped on how many random points you will lose.
She doesn't really care about students and is pretty unaccessible
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: Her class is really bad. I mean REALLY bad. I feel like the only reason I did well in her class is because I got lucky. Classes are disorganized and boring... only reason I didn't get an A is because I skipped majority of the time. Just take a different 105 if you can.

Just like what the other comment said about her, her instruction's always confusing. 
If you want to learn any writing skills, DON'T take her class. You WON'T gain anything from the class other than the ugly grades. She's definitely a tough grader. 
She's a nice person though, it's just she's not the right professor you are looking for.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: God, Im literally grading her during her class. This is just unbearable

Solid professor with a lot of dedication to the subject, but a little unclear with the grading and what she expects from you. Also a bit disorganized, but she has a strong love of the subject and let's you use your creative side on presentations and such. Super kind and caring person!!!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational--Group projects

comment: Prof Sol will go down as one of my least favorite teachers I've ever had. She is unorganized and unclear with instructions and feedback on essays. She is also condescending and not helpful when you try to reach out for help. She makes assignments due at 8 pm and she will not accept late work at all. Horrible experience.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: This professor was inconsistent with her comments, unclear with assignment instructions, and disorganized with her syllabus. It was very hard for me to improve on assignments when she says one thing and then she says the opposite on another draft. Almost everyone in my class hated this lady. Don't set yourself up.

I really wouldn't recommend taking her class. I was in her WRTG 105 class and I was miserable every assignment feedback session. She doesn't have a good grasp on the functions of the English language which I found baffling. She would mis-construe every other sentence that I wrote and criticize it, even though my Peer Reviewers understood perfectly.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Tough grader

comment: She is not willing to accept any late work regardless of circumstances or situation. I was given an extension by her but even then was refused credit for the project when I tried to hand it in. Not a difficult class, easy way to get some credit but she does grade harshly. Wouldn't take it again, will not take her classes either

grade relies too heavily on participation. she seems to grade people's 30% of the final grade by memory. for tests and homeworks, she takes off points for subjective reasons. spent 10x more of my time on this course than all of my other courses of that semester (I got A's for all of which) combined and still cannot get a good grade

Sol is extremely knowledgeable and full of interesting stories, insights and information regarding linguistics. Her class is my first experience with linguistics, and I've enjoyed it for the most part. Her teaching itself can be confusing and disorganized since she's so well-versed in the subject that she won't slow downespecially true of syntax.

Professor Armoskaite is very well versed in linguistics. The classroom is different than most classes and is very discussion based and interactive. Be prepared to read the textbook and readings for class or else you will be lost. The class is not hard and is interesting, but sometimes Professor Armoskaite would be disorganized.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: She is a good prof, easy grader and encourages debates in class. Fun if you like to state your opinions.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: This professor made me want to major in linguistics. Very nice person, very inspirational and helpful. Some assignments are a bit ambiguous, but she is good at clarifying if you ask. Very interesting ideas and class discussions!

She's a terrible professor.  Extremely condescending, confusing and not in the  least bit helpful.  She does not have office hours. When I  did make an appointment with her, she didn't answer my questions at all. AVOID HER.

Professor Armoskaite is excellent. She is one of the best professors in the department, both because she teaches well and because she is a genuinely nice person. I highly recommend taking one of her courses if you get the chance.

seems nice but a horrible professor. I don't get why the university allows him to teach. We spend too much time in class explaining to him how to give homework and exams. He reads his notes and does not seem to care to do much more than that. Horrible class and horrible teacher

the worst professor that I have ever had. He has not the slightest clue how to teach an online class. He just basically rereads his notes for the entire class and does not care to learn how to improve his teaching style. The first 30 minutes are often spent with students trying to explain to him how to give an exam/do anything with technology.

Waste of time. Avoid if possible. Doesn't know any technology and online classes are disasters. Apparently doesn't do anything related to teaching outside lectures as well and we spend 30min+ every lecture discussing whether/how to have exams, and he overturns everything discussed previously every lecture. Learned absolutely nothing.
I just dont like him

Saw Chen in the hallway the other day after just having his class in Fall 2017. He remembered my name, and we had a great conversation. Shows truly how much he cares. Wish I could have him again, his class was fun!

I think Chen has definitely changed his teaching style since 2005, and likely for the better. Great professor, great lectures, told a lot of lame jokes but still got laughs all the same.
