Stella was an amazing teacher. I went into this class ready to hate it but she made me enjoy it. We didn't have to write as many papers as the other WRT 105 classes (only wrote 2). She gives amazing feedback, too!
One of the nicest professors I've had. She will do anything to help you, and puts 100% into the class, helping students, and making the class engaging. Very fair in grading as well.
she is nice but i find it is not helpful to take this writing class at all

Nicest professor I've ever met. I love this woman and have great respect for her. Well informed, helpful and very nice. She has a tendency to talk a lot, but she tries her best to make the class interesting.

Applegate is a great lecturer- she really knows her stuff and conveys important information clearly and logically. Also, the readings she assigns are quite good. She isn't easy, by any means, but if you attend class and do the readings you should do well.
The best humanities teacher/professor I've ever had. She's also pretty hot in a smart professor kinda way, and brilliantly witty. I'm taking another class with her, just to hear her lecture.

Applegate is a great professor, she's always into the material and presents it in a comprehensive and interesting manner.  You get to see some cool films in this class and she is very helpful all the time.  She is also quite funny and into The Who, so you can't go wrong.
She's great. Helped me alot with my Senior Thesis and she's always cheerful.

One of my absolute favorite prof s at UR, had her for Holocaust and Hitler's Germany. She is a superb lecturer, chooses great reading material, very intelligent and witty. I admire her very much and plan to take as many classes with her as I can.
best professor I've ever had.  helpful, down to earth, and fun.  she knows how to make the class interesting! definately would take another course by her again

I had Celia for two classes that could have been complete crap.  In fact, if not for her, they would have been.  She supported lectures with great reading materials, fiction and nonfiction.  Look for her name when choosing classes.

Celia is a brilliant professor who loves helping her students.  The reading selection is superb, her style of teaching is fantastic, and she's a veritable fountain of knowledge.  HIGHLY recommended.  She's got the dry wit down, too.

She is amazing, without a doubt. Her wit, intelligence and great lecturing ability are off the charts. She's also a very cool and down to earth woman when you get to know her personally. I think that her husband is amazing too...such a cute couple.
awesome
Excellent lectures, very considerate and helpful, challenging!
My favorite lecturer hands down
A wonderful teacher who cares about her students and how they do.
Great lecturer, very informative, will go out of her way to help you, simply spectacular
witty and fun - amazing lecturer!
Great prof. - witty and smart - great in seminar classes -
Very smart, informative and fun.
Prof. Applegate is a great professor. She is fun and outgoing, which is amazing considering her husband (weaver) is the polar opposite. She needs to teach some more 18th century german history though
Applegate is the best professor EVER!

Dr. Uy clearly cared about her research more than students. Grading criteria was extremely harsh and she was not accessible outside of class (didn't show up to office hours etc.). She expected students to memorize random material from the slides and she didn't curve any exam, even when averages were low. Don't know if she's worse than Minkley.

Professor Uy is very nice and her lecture examples are very interesting. There were instances where she was not very understanding of students' stress or confusion about a topic. I would highly recommend going to the lectures to stay on top of the workload (especially since the rcorded lectures would upload a little late sometimes). Not bad overall
This class is very lecture heavy. If you want to do well on the exams, you need to know everything from the powerpoints (know examples!).

Dr. Uy is the most compassionate prof I've had at UR. She offered to reschedule a midterm because she knew we were having a busy week. Her exams are fine, but they also include content from assigned papers and discussion posts so it was more than it seemed at first. She assigned papers every class for a class discussion, but you get used to it fast

Dr. Uy is understanding and definitely pushes you to be on your A-game since there's a paper to read for every class. Her lectures were unclear at times, but she's available for help and her exams aren't bad. You gotta know the graphs and terms she presents. The recent reviews are probably from lazy freshmen who haven't found their groove yet.

Dr. Uy herself doesn't seem like a bad person; HOWEVER, she is a terrible lecturer. Her slides contradict, she is degrading and rude to students, and I honestly do not think she should be teaching a 100 level class. Her tests require you to be very specific, otherwise you won't do well. I really don't recommend her class.

content of the class isn't hard but the test is. You can study your butt off but still do bad on exams. I understand that she started teaching during covid and the tests were open notes. It is not fair since it's the first time she taught in person and the grading criteria is the same but we don't get the option of open notes exams.

A lot of memorization but she is generally a good lecturer. The tests are just memorization which makes the class much harder than it needs to be. Additionally, there is no curve so one test can really make or break your grade.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: You can be an expert in the class and still tank on the tests. Tests study memorization and not concepts. Class make me sad, class lower my chances of getting into med school :(

Professor Uy is a nice person. She is really nice. But her exam grading schema is actually insane. Don't even study just make vocab cards of everything on the slides, it is the *only* way to do well in this class...

She is nice but the grading scale makes it very hard to get an A. Exams are difficult with little room for error. Recitations have weekly quizzes which can really drag down your grades. Same for lab quizzes. There is no curve in this class which makes exams horrible. I would recommend taking the other bio course because they have a decent curve.

Exams leave little room for error. Lots of quizzes in recitation and lab. There is no curve so it is very difficult to get an A or even A- in this class. At least bio 111 has generous curve. I do not recommend taking 113
Stay away. Recorded lecture audio bad, unforgiving grading, just trust me and never take this class.

Lab and recitation quizzes that are hard and do have a big impact on grade. Tests are VERY harshly graded and you have to add things into questions that she doesn’t even ask. If she says explain or what is you have to know that she means add an example. She wants you to reference graphs not in test. Must know smallest details.
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Uy often contradicted herself and exams were very harshly graded. She seems like a nice person outside of class but during class is extremely condescending and doesn't understand when students ask questions. Slides are horribly written. Overall terrible experience and would not take again.

Professor Uy was rude to students and make them feel stupid when asking questions in class or in office hours. Even when her slides contradicted each other, and it was wrong, she still did not understand and look at the content instead blaming external influences. Content is better than BIO111 with less memorizations and fixation but still hard.

Yes, Professor Uy really cares about the student and is a nice person. However, she did not give clear lectures. Things on the slides contradicted each other. Answer keys of the current exams contradicted the same thing on the previous exams. Often she really did not explain the concepts well. No curve. Questions/grading of exams can be confusing.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: She's a great teacher! Really cares about her students and makes an effort to make the lectures enjoyable. The tests seem easier than they are, be as precise with your answer as possible because the tests are often graded looking for a very specific phrase or idea and you can lose points if you leave anything out. Lots of reading but manageable
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Uy is such a wonderful person & teacher. Started semester by saying she doesn't curve anything because if everybody does bad on an exam, then that's on her (and would have to reevaluate everything). Genuinely cares and class isn't bad. You get as much as you put in. Most difficult thing was had to read a research paper for every lab/recitation

Metcalf really cares about her students! Classes are mainly just her talking, but it's still enjoyable. There is quite a bit of reading, but she seemed to be pretty nice about grading papers as long as you somewhat showed that you read the material. My one point of critique is she does not give a lot of feedback on papers (but you can talk to her)
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Caring

comment: Prof Metcalf is very nice and sweet! I agree with the fact that lectures are not that necessary but they are indeed hilarious. If you do your best on your papers you will get a good grade on the class.

Professor Metcalf is really cool but if you don't do the readings she will know. The only grades were papers synthesizing the readings so read them!!! Attendance and participation are graded too but if you're doing the readings it's really easy to contribute.

Lectures are kind of pointless as she just talks about the readings. However, the books she assigns are compelling and she is an easy grader. Its an interesting class, but her lectures aren't so great. Seems like the same lecture over and over again.

First off, she does make smart comments occasionally, however, as a rule, she perpetuates offensive stereotypes and generally condescends third world countries and their state of being. Her analyses concerning the world can be refuted by any fifth grader, and ultimately, I see her as a model employee for Fox News. Amateurism at is finest.

I got an A. Class material interesting, but lectures can get dull as she just likes to talk and talk. 2 take home essay exams and 1 research paper - Very vague grading and guidelines but she is always willing to meet with you to help you as best she can. She expects all papers to be clear, although she doesn't care as much about a "correct answer"
Medical anthropology was one of my favorite classes. She's an engaging professor and helpful. The class is not hard if you do the readings.

Such anamazing prof, she is so interested in what she teaches and loves to discuss, as long as you pay attn in class you will get an A, on the test and paper as long as you put in a lot of effort you will get an A. she is amazing, favorite prof of all four years..VERY FAIR

never took an anthro class before and I loved this class, the books are really interesting, she keeps the discussions going and is just an overall awesome professor, gives you general questions to study before the exams that are really helpful
I HEART METCALF!!! She is so great.  She really enjoys talking about the material and loves going off topic even more.  It's a really easy yet interesting class.
A really great professor. She knows what she's talking about.  The readings/materials are just as great.  I think probably my favorite professor of all my 4 years
The class is alot of fun. Her laugh is worth going to class!
Easy class
A little weird, love the haircut but overall she's very fun and knows what she's talking about. She seems to enjoy teaching..I never skipped a class..so that says a lot about her.
Good class and prof
This professor is the reason I chose to major in anthropology! Lots of reading, but great review and excellent preparation for upper-division classes.
No Comments
Great Professor
really nice professor, lots of reading but reviewed in class
Excellent teacher.
most inspirational professor I have ever had. Takes time to help students further their studies and understand concepts. Very intelligent.

I enjoy this class! Emil is a very passionate speaker, and it makes everything he says very interesting. It is easy to tell he is very passionate about what he is teaching. He has been one of my favorite professors so far. His grading criteria is very clear, and if you prepare yourself it isn't difficult to receive good marks.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: One of my favorite professors. Sometimes history professors can give very incohesive lectures, where it's a ton of facts it's hard to string them all together to make a functioning story. Homerin does that for you, to the point where even though it's essential that you take notes, you can recall all of it in a cohesive way months after you're done.

One of the best teachers I have ever had.  Well-organized, very clear, and very passionate about his work.  I recommend taking a class from him at least once regardless of major, minor, or cluster, for he will make the material interesting to you.

Professor Homerin is one of the best teachers I have ever had. He has a very deep understanding and love for what he teaches and definitely hooks the entire class. I took his class as a senior and wish I had done it sooner so that I could take more classes with him. Truly an amazing professor.
Homerin is a wonderful professor.  He is extremely enthusiastic about his subject are and has inspired me to pursue it further.
this guys truly knows his islam... the best class for him is islamic mystic poetry, he is truly a poet at heart, and i def enjoyed mysticism thanks to him

I am currently taking Speaking Stones with Dr. Homerin. He is a great professor, he has his ways of making what i thought would be boring material very interesting. He is articulate, enthusiastic and personable. He cares about what he teaches and he cares about his students. Put some effort and you'll improve your writing!

Fantastic professor. Really cares about his students, challenges people to think in ways different from their own. Can be a hard grader but definitely worth the time and effort - you'll never regret taking one of Homerin's classes.
Great Guy!  Very well-spoked and extremely passionate.  Lectures were full of interesting facts and were entertaining.
TAKE SPEAKING STONES! Homerin is a fantastic teacher. so passionate
Amazing professor. A complete genius when it comes to history of Islam, and a wonderful Qur'anic reader.

Speaking Stones was an AMAZING class! Very little work other than readings, and if you follow his editing marks on papers you are virtually guranteed an A. Very personable and enthusiastic. I may change to a religion cluster just to take more of his classes. Great guy.
Awesome professor - extremely passionate about the subject, always open to new questions. Hard grader but it's totally worth it.

Homerin is awesome...especially in the Speaking Stones class. He is so helpful and makes the class so interesting. He does grade pretty hard though, but the projects aren't bad at all. Definitely a great guy!
No Comments
EXCELLENT!  Excited about his material and an extremely clear lecturer.  Extremely helpful to students and interested in their success and well-being.
insightful and thoroughly engaging

literally the most caring professor ever. he makes an effort to get to know you and will help you out with anything you need. he works around your schedule in order and helps you out whenever you need it.
Really nice Prof, he read drafts of my papers before each submit and if he did not get around to it he would extend the deadline which was really nice of him.

Jimbo is my absolute favourite. I adored every single class with him he is so fun and kind and his classes are super lightweight and not very work-heavy. He gives great feedback on assignments that if you just follow, you'll get an A and the assignments are very lenient. You get given a style of article and you choose what you write about.

I <3 Memmott SO MUCH. Lil Jimbo is my life. He is so kind and caring, he's happy to give you extra time on assignments and all the help you need. His classes are super light-hearted and not content-heavy AT ALL. He's amazing, I really adore him and his class so much.
one of the most amazing professors I've ever had. Makes journalism digestible for everyone, even pure engineering students.
Took 3 of his classes. Such a great man. Might be an Easy Class but you can learn a lot from this man.
So little work. Smart man. Kind teacher.
I <3 Memmott
Best Professor and overall genuinely great person. Take his classes if you want an easy-going class that is also fun. They are few and far between at the U of R.
Any class with Memmott is a treat.  132 is, by far, the best the class I've taken in 3 years at UR.  If you have the opportunity, take a Memmott class.  You won't be disappointed.
Who loves Memmott? WE LOVE MEMMOTT!!!
Jim Memmott is arguably the greatest man in update new york. this is not a joke, best ever. Memmott should be a major within the Eng. dpt.
Memmott's the MAN!!
Awsome guy, awsome class. Really down to earth.
Jim is awesome!  Funny, honest and wonderful.  Highly recommended!
An awesome guy! Fun class, easy assignments and grading. Laidback and helpful. I'd recommend him to anyone for any class!

I love Memmott.  I could never say it enough.  Not only does he look like Larry David, but he has a wonderful personality.  He befriends people so easily and takes an interest in getting to know you, even if all you do is read the CT in his class!
great guy, always a joy in class and very helpful
easy easy easy!  a little flakey perhaps, he lets you turn in your assignments basically anytime before he records the final grades, but no complaints here. he knows everyone.

I honestly really liked Dr Miller but did not like this class. Unfortunately, this class made me switch my major (not because it was too hard, it's manageable). this class is unavoidable for any student pursing neuro so be prepared! The content itself was rather interesting but I thought we would have done more with this class.
Most condescending teacher i've met; reason why I'm not a neuro major.
my number one op. went to all lectures and OH in this class and she never learned my name. content was interesting, but she was very demeaning.

NSCI201 lab is graded by too few things. If you did terrible in one assignment or quiz, no matter how hard you try in other assignments, you will still be screwed. It is not a "graded on completion/effort" course, but it should have been, because many questions in assignments, even in quiz, are open ended.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: She explains well and is available for extra help. However, she is a tough *very tough* grader and the class grades always stay the same. Her way of asking questions in exams is very "her" so write what she would answer and not how the book might answer it
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: I respect her and she is very knowledgable. I struggled with the content and had to rewatch every lecture to understand (self recorded), but if you have more bio/research background it may be easier. My ability to read research papers has improved, and if you demonstrate interest, she is really nice and understanding (including with grade bonuses)

201Lab was tough, since there were few assignments we were graded by. Listen to her instructions and copy them EXACTLY (take crazy notes or record her) and you will do well enough. She really likes when students demonstrate interest - go to her OH or chat with her and she might grade more nicely...I liked her overall and found her very knowledgable

She is such an intellectual and knowledgeable person inspiring her students to think critically. 301 is made up of discussions and presentations covering interesting topics that bridge science and society, like neuro ethics, scientific integrity, neuroeconomics etc. Do the readings, show up, and talk and talk. then you will get a A in this class.

Dr. Miller is such an amazing professor. I was told by peers to avoid her, so that's what I tried to do, but it's near impossible as a neuro major. I took two classes with her and I don't know what my peers were talking about. She was incredibly caring and kind to me, and explained everything so well, and was more than happy to answer my questions.

Professor Miller is one of the least understanding professors I have had at the university. She quizzes you on small details, grades really hard, and is not clear about the expectations for her assignments. She is the reason I switched my major, and I have heard similar experiences from others.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: I took her neurochemistry course in summer online. The content was dense but hard. A lot of paper discussions and write-ups & presentations. You have to attend the lectures and discussions as well as prepare for lecture quizzes and exams, but none of them was too difficult. Definitely learned a lot of things in depth and she is very helpful.

Dr. Miller is very knowledgable on the topics that she teaches and is clearly passionate in the field of neuro. Her class is tough and she definitely makes you work for it, but it's a class worth taking. She is also very helpful and caring during office hours, which I recommend going to.
A tough instructor, but a very intelligent and caring woman. Always prepared and likes to make you think. Class participation is very important.
rating_tags: Respected--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Her class was overall very easy to succeed in however the book assigned was completely useless the only way to get a good grade was to go to class and memorize her slides.

She is my favorite professor at this school. Yes, her tests are hard, and she makes you actually learn and apply the material, but she is very willing to help you if you go to her office hours. Once I went to go over a test and she ended up giving me 5 points back.
She is very difficult to follow. Avoid taking a class with her if possible. Literally just throws jargon at you and is extremely rude.
Extremely helpful. Best professor at the school.
Had her as a lab professor. She was very nice and I thought she was approachable.
She seemed very nice to me and approachable. I only had her as a lab professor though.

Lovely person, but poor professor. By the end of the semester, nobody wanted to raise their hands for discussions because she would always interrupt them to make her own point. It was less a discussion class than a lecture class listed as discussion heavy. She grades at a level much higher than undergraduate, so if you take this class, be prepared.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: While she knows what she's talking about and is passionate about the material, it's difficult to participate in discussion as she doesn't leave space for discussion on average when she is lecturing. Tough grader for papers and leaves lots of constructive criticism. However, I've found she's pretty kind and with it.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: I hate her...tough grader for real and she gives vague instructions on her criteria of paper...She said she's liberal but if your idea violates w her central beliefs...be ready for a B and less...She also interrupts when students talk, like a lot of times...
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers--Lecture heavy

comment: This professor is BORING. All she does is read off of a sheet of paper for the whole class. You will read 100-200 pgs for hw per class. She grades REALLY tough and writes very critical responses to students' papers. The essay exam is ridiculously hard and you have two other long papers. She requires participation but interrupts when students talk.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor London is absolutely amazing. She genuinely cares about her students succeeding and learning. I had one 6 page paper where she left well over a hundred comments. She' super knowledgeable and smart, but she's also very approachable for her students. You will read a fair amount, but I didn't find it unmanageable as long as I planned ahead.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Learned a lot about literary elements. This professor is dedicated and passionate about her material.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Tough grader

comment: Great lecturer and promoter of discussion. She is a tough but fair grader with plenty of constructive criticism. Would recommend!
Prof London is a passionate, intelligent woman who leaves room for discussion while also managing to teach new material at the same time. she is by far the best english teacher I'ver ever had.

Professor London was great! Her class was very discussion based, and she is a tough grader when it comes to written papers. However, she wants you to succeed and grades fairly and takes improvement into consideration. She is very helpful outside of class during office hours. Would highly recommend!

I loved this class. The books were great, and Professor London really contributed to my understanding of them. The writing assignments really made you think, but it challenged me and my writing has greatly improved since I've really learned what makes the difference between an A- and an A paper.

I have had Dr. London for two classes and I really enjoyed both. The entire class is discussion based, so pretty much everyone is forced to get involved. The books she assigned were excellent; she had a lot of good insight to share during class. Also, when you ask for help, she is more than willing to give you a hand, and is very encouraging.

Excellent teacher, she was very helpful with helping papers, more interested in making sure students learned than paper grades (allowed revisions and went over papers with students). She will ask for input in her classes, but doesn't call on anyone. Good class.
Very interested in what she teaches and very intelligent. Understanding and easy to talk to. Great prof. overall.

Very easy class to sit in and not pay attention if you want to...but if you want to participate, its really difficult because she likes to talk. Very opinionated. If you are writing something she disagrees with (shes liberal), she will say your argument is weak (even if paper, truthfully, is good). Annoying mannerisms - including stutter.
She fabulous, encouraging, insightful. She provides feedback and helpful comments and she kept me incredibly interested.

I think Prof. London gives incredibly comprehensive and high-quality feedback on students' papers, something I often find lacking from other professors.  She's kind, sympathetic and very insightful.  I've learned a great deal from her classes and talking with her during office hours etc.
had her for contemporary women writers. it drove me crazy listening to her speak. she said nothing of importance. i watched the clock that entire class...books were decent though.

Woah, I think it's pretty extreme to transfer because of ONE teacher in ONE class. I found Professor London clear, interested in the material and organized in leading discussions. She let you revise papers and books assigned were varied and enjoyable.

I had London last fall and I never knew this website existed until now,  and I am so glad because I feel it is necessary to tell people just how awful this professor was! I have transferred schools because of the poor experience I had with this professor!

Dr. Frontier is so knowledgeable but so humble. She really understands her students and will reexplain things if needed. Her exams can sometimes be awful, but she appreciates effort and students end up doing better than they think they did. Don't be afraid to ask questions, because it will absolutely help your understanding.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: She is great at explaining things, but her tests are at a different level. She always adds something that wasn't really taught fully on the test, so keep an eye out if you want an A. Very flexible at reexplaining or setting up appointments. Don't underestimate the tests and consider looking at later practice exams (2&3) for possible exam problems.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Nice guy and talks a lot about the apllication of orgo reactions. Exams are hard as hell but the curve is fair. No need to use the textbook if you go to lectures, but the textbook does help when she goes too fast in class.

I had Frontier for Freshman Orgo II back in 2019. She's very knowledgeable about the material, BUT her exams are extremely difficult. She once told our class that "teaching was a hindrance to her research" and the only reason she was teaching was because she had to. I definitely used the textbook a lot for this class in order to learn material.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor's exams are remarkably difficult and seemingly unrelated to class and workshop examples. Professor stutters in class.Retrosynthesis is huge. WILL be the "premed or not" class, whether intentional or not.
Very good professors, exams are difficult, sometimes arguably more so they needed. When the class average is 60/125, there's a problem with the exam format.

She's pretty much amazing and I love her <3  She's just like Sandra Bullock in Miss Congeniality.. so adorable :)  Yes, her exams are pretty difficult, especially the final, which caused me to receive a disappointing A-, but oh well.
Easy class, you'll see her with black shirts and black pants all semester long. If you have a chance, see her baby. So CUTE.. Mid-terms are easy, not the final exam
Such a easy class, because other people don't do well. Her mid-terms are fair, but final exam is a bit difficult. I've studied for 4 hours for the final exam, still ended up getting an A
She's pretty cool. She knows her stuff and  is interested in it.

Her lectures are very informative. Sometimes she is a bit disorganized in the way she presents topics so my notes aren't always in order. She always has chalk over her body which makes class a bit more entertaining. Practice tests are crucial and very helpful when it comes to the actual exam. The midterms are fair and the material is from lecture.
Stammers sometimes, but is intelligent and active. Usually helpful and knowledgeable.
Very interesting lectures. Its obvious that she loves chemistry and teaching it. Very nice and approachable.

She admits her self she makes hard tests, out of 125 points, only 2 or 3 get above 100 points, but curve is generous. She's good at explaining and has a lot of interesting lectures on applications of chem in real world.
No Comments
If i were you and had to take a writing class I would pick this one. She is a great teacher, lots of work but fun. lot of drug ref
No Comments

Overall, this was an okay class. I think other students will enjoy her lectures if they're interested in history. However, I wished she was more clear about her grading criteria and her guidelines. She tended to change many things on the syllabus with little to no heads up. Also, the quality of her lectures could use some improvements.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Group projects--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Prof. Zhang's lectures were precise and informative. Her exams weren't too difficult as long as you did the readings and took notes.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: She cares about what she teaches, and she tries her best to make them interesting. As long as you pay attention in class you will do fine. Textbook readings are not necessary.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Professor Zhang is a very clear lecturer and she lends an interesting perspective to Japanese history. As long as you pay attention in class and study some, the textbook readings are unnecessary and the exams are straightforward. My issue was she treated us like high school students, like forcing us to move seats and "hula" dance along to a movie.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: She is the worst and she's not even a professor, she's only a LECTURER.
She never answers her email.

Professor Zhang is honestly just not a great professor or person in general. She can barely speak English and is pretty rude to her students. She forces you to take off your mask (during COVID) and she's really racist to non-white students. DON'T TAKE HER CLASSES, we can't condone such behaviors from a professor.

I didn't buy a textbook, read any of the books we had to write papers about, and skipped class a lot of times but still passed with a 3.0 so if u try ull be fine. Lectures can be a bit boring as there's no interactive work she kinda just stands and talks about stuff, its np tho. The tests sucked tho class average was like a 50 and she doesn't curve

She was a really great professor who was interested in the topic. She is also an early bird if that makes any difference at all. She will make everything really clear so you understand. She likes participation and she grades essays based on your ideas and research rather than the quality of your writing. The readings were also very interesting.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: She's always enthusiastic to teach and show every perspective of those involved with the history of modern China. The class feels like a really good T.V. show and I'm always excited to come to class to get the next episode.
Worst professor in the history dept. The experience is nightmare.

I loved the material and the assignments, but Prof. Zhang 's lecturing was mediocre. I felt like there wasn't much discussed in class that I hadn't already read in the textbook-- in fact, I feel like most of the class time was just watching Chinese dramas. As much as I love Chinese dramas, mandatory attendance for them seemed too much.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: Prof Zhang is a kind lady with great knowledge on Chinese history. Though her class is not that organized she is really trying hard, given English is not her first language. It can be hard for non-East Asians but it should be super easy for people who went over education in East Asia before
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Prof. Zhang is really nice in person: no tough grade, somewhat easy A/A-, fair exam, very accessible outside the class. But I do think she might want to organize her materials a little bit better. Also, I have no idea why she refuses the Chicago style in assignment 2.

Professor Zhang is a nice lady, and she really tries her best to make the class interesting, but I think the course materials should be more organized. The tests are based on lectures and the whole two books and the questions are very specific. It is hard to tell what to concentrate on.

This class is based off 4 tests on readings from 2 textbooks. They ask 8 IDs and 2 short answers. They are hard, and ask very specific questions despite covering like 100 pages of reading each. However, this means there is no final or midterm. Prof Zhang is a nice, no nonsense lady. I respect her a lot. However this does not seem like a 100 level.

Professor Zhang is responsible and knowledgeable, she makes the class really interesting by various materials, and she is native speaker Chinese thus I feel that I learned to view China from a broader mindset and leaned the truest aspect of China without biases from the western ideology. definitely would take her class again.
Very intelligent and interesting, though the workload/expectations/grading didn't seem to match a 100 level course. Otherwise, it was a really great class.

This professor was so terrible she almost left me in tears on several occasions. This class is tough but that is really only due to this professors grading. As someone who took several high level writing courses I thought this class would be an easy A; I mistaken. There is no need for this class to be so difficult and useless at the same time.

Although kind, she is an incredibly tough grader for a freshman writing class. Gives way more work than any other writing class and grades everything. Has a stupid contract system that makes no sense. Do not take this because it is not as easy an like freshman writing should be.
Do not take this professor I can't stress this enough. You will have a horrible semester if you're in this class.
Would not recommend, do not take her classes
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: Do not take this class!
I did not like her.

Do not take this professor under any circumstances. She does not teach you anything substantial about writing whatsoever and makes you do many assignments. I honestly do not know how she is a professor at the University of Rochester.

Not my first choice. Dr. Towsley is probably the worst professor I have ever had. She does not sincerely respect any of the students, and assigns hours of tedious busywork. We had to do a pointless "portfolio" (among other things), that no other writing class had to do. By far the hardest writing class that the school offers. AVOID THIS PROFESSOR.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Fine. Uses contract grading which is really harsh, if you're late a by a few minutes more than twice your grade drops. Overall far less papers than I would expect from a writing class.

Wasn't expecting much from WRT 105 and Dr. Towsley's Careers in America section pretty much met my expectations. There were a few big papers, but most of the writing assignments didn't seem that helpful. Class discussions can be agonizing but your grade will plummet if you skip one class. Wish that we could have discussed a better variety of works
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: Unforgiving with attendance and usually assigned tedious and boring homework after every class. While her demeanor was usually friendly, I felt like she didn't really like anyone in the class and could have shown more respect. If you do all of the work she assigns and don't miss it isn't hard to get an A.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Grade knocked down because of one missed class. Extremely and unnecessarily tough grader for a resume and cover letter class. Unresponsive to feedback. All of class is dragging on unhelpful discussions. Unhelpful and unclear with expectations.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Compare to what I heard from other 105 classes, she definitely gives more writing assignment than others do. And she always has class discussion. She is more like a high school teacher instead of a college one. If you miss one single class, A goes to A-. ATTENDANCE IS EVERYTHING.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: You literally don't have to put any effort into class and you won't want to because its not super interesting. The entire thing is based on just showing up and all assignments are completion grades. The only thing that matters is the final portfolio which you do in the last two weeks of class.
Probably the best WRT105 session at the University of Rochester. You actually learn a lot
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Really an awful professor. I left the class after three weeks, as there's lots of busy work, most of which was at a 9th grade level, and she seems to have this really fake smile on all the time.

Professor Towsley was an overall good professor. The class was easy, but there was a lot of work that you had to put in to get an A. She cared a lot about attendance and participation so if you didn't show up then it would be hard to get an A. None of the grades were put in until the end of the semester so it was hard to know how you were doing.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: It is very easy to do well in her class, but it is very tedious. If you are late or don't show up for a class your grade will be substantially affected. Also, nothing is due until the last day of class so you'll have no idea what your grade is for the whole semester. Despite this, she is a very nice person and knows what she is doing.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Geba is very respected and you could do a lot worse, but to be honest I didn't think he was a great lecturer. He's  a nice guy though.

Prof Geba really made me love math again. Clear and thorough lectures, he did one example from the practice problems and there was one worked out in the book for every topic. He was late to almost every class by 10 minutes, but still got through the content. As long as you stay on top of practice problems, especially with vector spaces, its fine.

He is a super harsh grader, no curve, and is very rude when you go to him because he graded someone differently that you  when you had the same thing. Overall rude when one-on-one and his notes are terrible.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: His lecture is clear and understandable. You can learn a lot from his lecture.
For those who love mathematics, especially proof-based mathematics, you cannot miss Geba's classes!

Great Professor. Friendly and approachable in office hours. Early content is pretty easy, but get ready to read the book for the second midterm. Tests are tough, but reasonable. Do your work, and you won't have to worry about your grade.
rating_tags: Respected--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: MTH190 is only 1 credit, but Geba's very available in office hours. Problems are very difficult, but he helps a lot. The first time I went to office hours he made sure I knew that his door was always open for any questions/concerns I had about my future math studies. My favorite professor this semester, can't wait to take more of his classes.a
Best teacher I ever had. Got me really interested in the material. Especially helpful in office hours- take advantage of these.
Great professor. Prob the smartest guy I've ever seen. Take his class(tho I dropped because I had to take another class...)!
Great professor. Very funny!

Prof. Geba is awesome! He is so smart that he doesn't need to read or copy any of his notes. And he really teaches you what math really means. He talked a lot about motivations. He is also the funniest person on the planet. Love him!
Geba is awesome. Tests were straightforward for this class IF you knew your stuff. Would have done better if I had taken the time to really understand the concepts.
great professor, really cared about the students and made sure you understood the material
i never actually went to him for help outside of class (even tho i really needed it), because he scared me. and i almost never skipped class, and always had no clue what was going on
Professor Geba is the smartest man I have ever met. I love him.
No Comments
Definately not the most interesting class in the world, but if you actually pay attention, he's not so bad. The final exam, however, is the hardest thing in the world.
No Comments

Do not take this class unless you need it. I made the mistake of taking it for "fun," but it wasn't worth it. It's very essay-heavy, with lots of busy work, and the professor is strict about paper outlines. I wish students new to this class had better supplementation on correctly citing sources instead of just being expected to know it.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Best professor I've ever had. Funny, engaging, extremely knowledgeable, genuinely passionate. The only time I've ever seen a professor's eyes literally light up when I asked a good question. Accessible and cares about students. Lots of reading but you don't really have to do it, fair grader but you do have to try to do well.
Honestly, I am inept and do not understand Greek, but Professor Gresens has been understanding from the beginning and has pushed me to do better but is extremely gentle
Just a good professor and a good guy. He expects a lot but is available for help. My favorite prof so far.

He's probably the best professor I've ever had. He's so understanding and genuinely wants the students to succeed. He's incredibly helpful and that's made it so I've done better in this class than any other language classes I've taken

He's my favorite professor I've ever had. He's made it so that I want to learn the language for the language itself rather than wanting to learn it just so I could read things. He's also incredibly kind and understanding. Attendance wasn't mandatory but I know I wouldn't be able to pass the class if I didn't actually go to class

I usually HATE language classes but his Classical Greek class was awesome! I did better in that class than I've ever done in a language class because he made things actually make sense. He's also really understanding and just generally great overall
Prof G is the best! Lectures are super fun and casual, and he really cares about both students and the material. Lots of interesting and relevant tangents.

This class comes with a lot of work --hw assignments due every class, vocab every week, with 2 mini quizzes but all are necessary to keep up with learning Latin and are definitely manageable! Gresens is a very nice, caring and understanding professor and I am definitely taking more courses with him :)
Professor G is really nice, and he won't call on you in class if you don't raise your hand first (so don't worry about getting anxiety over not knowing answers).

Took two classes with him. Gave a lot of reading, but I did extremely well just by listening in class. Flexible: Gives multiple options about when to write essays. Lectures are extremely interesting, and he likes to connect the ancient world to the present. Really nice guy who actively tries to learn everyone's name and is extremely approachable.

The majority of classes focused on translating passages from the book, and the rest were devoted to learning grammar. He described everything clearly and in an interesting way, though, so the class was not boring. There was homework between classes to be turned in, but it helped reinforce the material you had already learned.
Incredibly passionate about what he teaches, engages the class in inspirational and interesting discussions and, above all, best dad jokes.

Really enjoyed taking a class on Catullus from Prof G! He expects a lot from his students but doesn't overload on the work. Very smart, friendly, and open to new ideas and perspectives. Would definitely take again!

An all around great guy and prof! Class is fast-paced and there is a lot to memorize. Very willing to hold individual office hours to help one-on-one. Attendance is graded, there is online and written HW. Weekly quizzes (not hard).  Oral midterm and final (grades leniently on both). Short writing assignment. Must watch online videos and self teach
Best professor I have ever had.Funny. Smart. Makes material interesting and exciting. Always available to help his students.

Prof G is awesome. He knows his stuff. The material is fast paced and can be difficult at times. However, he is a really helpful guy and will make an effort to be available for you either after class or outside of class. His teaching style is energetic and enthusiastic. I enjoyed his class so much!

Very enthusiastic about the material, very approachable and open to questions in and outside of class; when he cannot be reached in person, very accessible by email.  Knowledgeable about the language and broader subject matter, and expresses his thoughts, knowledge, and experience fantastically.
Makes you work for your grade but you learn a lot from the class.
Derefinko is Awesome, though expect to spend a lot of time in labs (HW is nothing)
dont take this
Very helpful and effective professor. He is a nice guy to talk to and will try to help.
Derefinko is great, just make sure to go to every class, that way you don't need to ever read the book.
Vic's the shizzle
Great prof - willing to take extra time to explain concepts
Great guy.  Lectures consist of figures from the book, which can make them very boring.  Be sure you go to his office hours!  He grades hard to get people in there to get points back.

Derefinko is a really nice guy. He actually really cares about if you get the stuff or not. But his lectures are kind of like reading the textbook, so you should study the textbook extensively. His homework tend to be really time consuming and hard. And the course is a bit hard to grasp in the beginning, but if becomes easier after catching on.

I love D-fink!  His lectures can be a little boring, but he'll spiff them up with stories about his horses or bailing hay. Haha.  He's the cutest old man ever.  A bit senile, but really knows his ECE and has high expectations. You must attend at least 2/3 of class or you'll get a zero for attendance.  He does post all lectures online though! :)
Good
Derefinko is the man, his class is easy if you actually try and he is flexible if you have any problems finishing stuff on time in the beginning of the year
Defefinko is a very intelligent guy who knows his stuff.  He makes himself available and will help you out if you get to know him and bother to go to class.
He's generally okay, except it's quite clear that he needs to retire.  Half of the time he clearly has little clue what he's doing, and his mind wanders.  Would have been great a few years ago.
Nice guy, but class seemed like a highschool class.

this is the most ridiculus class ever.  derifinco is in charge and he hasnt taught the class once.  we get a new prof or GRAD STUDENT every 4 weeks.  what a horrible way to learn.  university of rochester should be ashamed.
Nice guy, but talks too much about random stuff (ie sidetracked easily).  Impossible to reach outside of class and not especially well organized.

Luisa is a great teacher who cares about the class and tries hard to immerse you in Italian culture.  She expects a lot, and she can be grumpy when she doesn't get it, but if you have the time and work ethic to truly learn Italian, there is no better teacher.

She's a great professor once you realize how her class works. All of the classes she teaches are not easy language courses where you just sit back and get an A. You really have to work for your grade. Once she gets to know you and you get to know her, she is more than helpful and warm. Its not always easy but this class is worth it. You learn a lot

She wasn't bad. She can definitely be moody and on her bad days the class can be uncomfortable but on her good days she is the best professor. There is a lot of work involved though. She does offer extra credit. I got an A and it wasn't extraordinarily hard. Just put some effort in and you'll be ok.
Her test are very hard, even if you study for hours. Do not take this class.
the worst
Shes a good teacher and all but don't expect an A second semester with her. No matter how amazing your writing assingments are, you are always wrong.

As a teacher, she's great and easy to learn from. However, it's not uncommon to receive writing assignments back from her where she says everything is wrong and tells you to redo it. Also, her tests and her grading are unfair. It's impossible to get above an 85 on any test and a 90 on any assignment, which discouraged me from an Italian minor.

Luisa is very nice and very funny.  She explains things really well and the workload is very light.  I don't know why people say her tests are so hard.  If you take the time to do the homework (only due once a week) and GLANCE at the textbook you'll get an A.
Luisa is extremely  nice and helpful. The work load is very heavy, but if you participate in class and put in the time you can get a good grade.
AWFUL! She was the worst professor I have ever had. Unfair grading, her tests are impossible and she is very cold and discouraging. I could not wait to finish her class and never see her again.
So friendly! Everyone wants her to be their grandmother. Excellent teacher- makes learning really fun.
I liked her, people that complain saying she is hard just don't put forth the slighest bit of effort to study.
O'keefe was not very clear on objectives and what she wanted from you at first.  The combination of the harder material, and it not being explained as well made it much harder that 101.
unfair and unclear, pretty discouraging, too

She plays a baddie in 101, but that's just to put a scare into people. She really warms up after she gets to know you, and if you're brave enough to ask questions, she will give you the answers you need.
very difficult, unfair test grading. will take away your enthusiasm for the language
No Comments

Oh my goodness, this lady is the coldest teacher i've ever had. Ask her a question about grammar or anything else, and she gives you single word answers, not helpful. Her tests are hard because we don't go over any of the test material during class time. Harsh grader with the 4 pg italian compositions, expects you to be pretty much fluent by 152

Professor McCamant is one of the best professors at U of R. He wants you to succeed with a true understanding of the material, and he cares about his students as individuals despite having hundreds of them. His passion for chemistry is contagious and is evident in his teaching.

Professor McCamant is, in my opinion, the best professor at UofR. He is one of the few that truly cares about students' learning and well-being instead of just his research. He is down-to-earth, kind, funny, and extremely understanding of personal circumstances that may impact your schoolwork. Tough class but awesome prof.
Highly recommend Dr. McCamant for CHM 132. He seems to love teaching and is good to his students. Exams were kinda hard, but it is general chemistry.
Probably the best chemistry professor at UR. Great lectures but tests got progressively more difficult throughout the semester.

The material itself was not that bad, especially how it was presented in class, but I found the exams to be a bit more difficult when they came around. He is so kind and makes a huge effort to connect with students and make learning fun for them. Really passionate about the subject and overall just a great guy doing his best to teach students.
Nice guy in class but very rude in office hours

I loved McCamant. Tests werent very challenging if you really knew the material. He was hilarious and quirky in lecture, but doesnt normally stop to take questions. Textbook really helped me with the material.

He's a really great person but the class was rough. He's generally bad at explaining concepts, so get ready to read the entire textbook and teach yourself everything right before an exam. He is very accessible outside of class though if you want him to clarify anything.

Professor McCamant is brilliant, kind, and a wonderful educator. His lectures are clear and engaging. The exams are difficult, but not that difficult if you work at understanding the concepts instead of just the process. Grading is fair.
Good professor, class was insanely easy. He's clear on what he expects you to know and workshops really help.

I received my first ever B in his class. Up to that point I had all A's or A-'s. I had it during his 2nd year, where he really made his class harder. Having been new the year before we thought he would be "easy" again but he wasn't. Not the most helpful professor, very boring in lecture, but seems awkward and kind.

Mccamant is a really good professor who wants to help you if you are really willing to work for it. Pay attention to what he says in the first lecture for what you must do to succeed in the class, and use all resources available ( book, sapling, lectures, workshops) in order to put all you can. If you do that, you can really succeed in the class.

He is very confusing at office hours and in lecture. I actually showed up to office hours and he berated me for memorizing some concepts that obviously required some form of memorization. Exams are pretty good but it was so arrogant of him to criticize me in that manner.

231 Class is soon bad. DO NOT TAKE IT if you can. There are ELEVEN lab reports and you don't get them graded right away. You don't receive any help in writing them.  There's so much work that you ave to put into it and in the end it all depends on the rubric of lab report.

He's adorable and really passionate about the students doing well.  Unfortunately, most students just don't put in the time to do well.  Great guy. Used iclicker consistently.  Homework assignments were also consistent, and due before you learned about the topic in lecture, which made you feel more prepared for lecture.
Dr. McCamant is such an awesome professor! He makes his lectures very interesting and his exams are not bad. Definitely would take him again.
GREATEST TEACHER EVER

He manages to make the lectures pretty interesting and he can be funny sometimes. The workload is pretty redonkulous, so don't fall behind on lab reports. But if you do fall behind, the late policy is pretty forgiving and he goes out of his way to help. tl;dr - nicest guy in the world and good teacher, but workload is tough. Stay on top of it.
Wonderful lady and incredibly helpful one-on-one... but she is a terrible lecturer. Read the book, study with friends, and go to her for extra help; don't rely on just sitting there and listening.

She is a very nice lady but is incredibly quiet and boring.  It was difficult to stay awake (especially because I absolutely hated the material), but she cares so much about her students.  She's extremely flexible and always willing to adjust to extenuating circumstances.  She will always give the students the benefit of the doubt by far.

She's a sweet lady, and she means well, but she's the most horrifically boring prof I've ever had. The material tends to be simple enough, if you can focus long enough to figure out what she's talking about, but her quiet, timid teaching style is completely offputting.

She's quiet, but an amazing professor.  Extremely helpful, understanding, can talk about her subject for hours. Only caveat: since she's so quiet, it can be easy to get distracted and feel bored in class.

I really enjoyed the class.  She is quiet, but not humorless.  She gives good examples and smiles when students come up with good ones.  It made me feel like she enjoyed the material, which helped me enjoy it.  I liked the HS style question and answer classroom set-up.  She knew everyone's name and history.  Wasn't too tough to stay awake in class.

She is the nicest lady, but her quiet disposition doesn't make for the most interesting.  As fascinated as I was by the material, even I found it difficult to stay awake some days.  But she is extremely knowledgeable, helpful, and easy.  I'd take another one of her classes, but I can't say I wouldn't fall asleep again.
Though well meaning, Gunlogson is a terrible professor.  Avoid her.
AWFUL!!

If you can manage to stay conscious for an entire one of Gunlogson's lectures you either an insomniac or incredibly high on ceffeine.  Nothing against her personally, but she seems very disorganized and is hardly ever prepared for class.
Christine is a great teacher, but a bit boring at times.  Just bring something to do that isn't too distracting and you'll be fine.
Very nice, and very knowledgeable, but WOW -- what a snooze.  Especially with the 85 degree classroom and a 4:50 PM class.
very helpful
Not a bad professor, but BOOOOOOORRRRRRRRRIIIIIIINNNNNNNNNGGGGGGGGGGG. Nevertheless, if you so much as show up and sleep through class you will do very well.
soooo nice, but soooo boring. i slept in this class everyday and still made it out with an A! she is also very understanding. i would take another class with her if i had the chance.
No Comments
A relatively easy class. Although she is quie boring but if you have the attention span to last you could definetely take a lot from her class.
No Comments
The Nicest lady, but the combination of my triptophane sandwich and her lecture is an instant cure for insomnia
you couldn't imagine how many homework to do..... plus, all the attendance and lateness is RECORDED. I thought it is not recorded because she never said anything about those. REALLY TOUGH GRADE!!!
couldn't imagine how many homework to do....
She provides clear guidelines for assignments and timely feedback which is always very helpful. If you want to improve your writing, Prof. Gegg-Harrison is perfect for you.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: You will not regret taking writing with her; she's incredibly caring about her students, informative, and gives AMAZING feedback about your writing so you can improve. The workload isn't too heavy, just be sure to do things on time and participate in class. She is very understanding but is strict enough with grading that you don't slack off.
She is amazing. Really learned something in her class. It is kind of hard to get an A, but as long as you aren't that lazy you'll be fine.

Whitney is a great professor and really cares about her students. I learned a lot about writing from her. However, she is a somewhat a tough grader and you are guaranteed at least a B in her class if you do all the work. I thought I worked extra hard and ended with a B+.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Professor Gegg-Harrison is lovely. You will learn a lot about writing from her. If you put time and effort into the class you will be recognized for that.

She is absolutely amazing, caring and kind. I used to hate my English class in high school but now I'm in love. She gives clear, on point and kind feedbacks and she is the most organised person I've ever met. I love taking her class because she really takes the time to explain everything to make sure we understand the material.

Don't expect to get an A just for showing up like the other WRT105 classes. However, you can if you put in effort. It isn't hard to put in effort either, since the topic is extremely interesting (language as a window to the mind). Don't listen to the other reviews. Read the description, and if it interests you, then take it.

She is loving and caring for the students! Gives very specific and helpful feedback. The grading criteria are pretty hard, but you will get a solid grade if you work hard. It is an extremely helpful class especially for international students to improve their writing skills.

She is a terrible professor. She looks kind and helpful. However, her class is meaningless. If you take her class, drop it immediately or you will get a C and your GPA will boom. In fact, C is not a bad grade because if you do everything great and on time in her class, you will  just get a B. I wonder whether she knows  there is an A better than B.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: She is kind and helpful. But you will never expect to get an A in this class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Loved her Language as a Window into the Mind class. She offered nice, helpful, and to-the-point feedback. The class was really interesting too. It was a very interdisciplinary cognitive science-y class - with a mixture of readings various fields. She makes you works for your grade though.

This a Great class! The teacher is friendly and very helpful. I learned a lot from this class and I appreciate the advice from Dr. Harrison. I strongly recommend international students to take this course which will be very helpful!
Very friendly and accessible. She really inspires you to think. Be prepared to read a lot and write a lot.

One of my favorite professors ever! She is really nice and helpful. She lists all her available meeting time online,  and you can click the one that works for you the best.  She encourages you to talk to her more often, and even requires at least two personal meetings during the semester. She gives detailed feedbacks for your papers. LOVE HER!!!
The grade criteria is strict, however, the professor is really helpful. The feedbacks from her help a lot when your do revisions! I really learned a lot from this class!

Somehow at first of her class, she smiles a lot which makes students think that she is approachable and easy-going. However, you can hardly get enough useful information or skills of writing from her, anyway. It is hard to get a satisfied comments and grades from her.
He's my favorite professor here. He's knowledgeable, and he's kind. Definitely taking his class again!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Gives good feedback

comment: He is absolutely the best professor I met at University of Rochester. So inspirational, knowledgable, and caring for student. Lectures are amazing! Definitely choose his course if you can!

cons:
- Contact outside of class is hard bc he doesn't like to use technology
- Classes are pure lecture. He talks the entire time, often with no clear purpose.
- No slides, quizzes, units, objectives, etc.
- long readings
- mandatory weekly discussions in person and online via blogs

pros:
- generally friendly
- few assignments
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: Although his lectures can be a little boring, he is obviously super knowledge and cares so much about the topic and his students. As long as you do the reading and write the essays, the class is not hard and discussion sections are pretty interesting.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: Professor Gibson is one of the kindest professors. His lectures are sometimes long and scattered, but he's very knowledgeable and passionate about what he studies. Graded on three papers (synthesizing readings and some analysis) and participation. If you do well on the papers and show up to class, you'll do great.

Knows his stuff for sure. Sees students as future activists so he genuinely wants people to take stuff away from readings & apply to today (criticize, reflect, etc). One class is him talking the entire time about next week's readings (he knows u won't read all or just skim and it's fine, just read what most interested in) and other is discussion.
Lots of readings to do in this class, so get prepared for it. I probably shouldnt choose it as my cluster...

Fascinating stuff. Tangents a lot but I think they're interesting. There are a lot of readings and you do have to read them but it's definitely worth it. Easy to talk to outside of class. Really cares about his students. A+ would learn from again.

Overall great professor. He is very intelligent and does pretty well in keeping the class engaged on discussion days. The class is pretty easy only 3 essays. Just try and keep up with the readings and actually listen to what he says during lectures. Typically its all pretty darn interesting if you ask me.

Overall I find him to be a great professor. This class is given on tues. and thurs. so he has one day to lecture about the readings and the other day for discussion on them. During discussion days he doesn't talk at all and lets the class handle the discussion. Since the topics are are interesting its a pretty good class. Heavy readings though!

He is a nice enough guy, but he can lecture for a full class period and I have no idea what he's talking about.  His lectures are really scattered and unclear, but they don't seem to matter for the homework and essays.  There's no tests so the class is easy enough and passable but sitting through it twice a week is a struggle.

Gibson is incredibly intelligent and very familiar with history, politics and theory.  His courses are great if you are interested in theory, but those who might not be will find it a waste.  He is slightly monotoned, but the material is fascinating enough to make up for it.
get coffee before class...very smart guy
It's too bad such an intelligent guy has such a monotone.

Tom is a great guy, who tries to supress his liberal views.  He has a wealth of knowledge about the world.  His voice is pleasant, almost too pleasant, just get some coffee and you'll be glad you paid attention, he'll blow ur mind man...
BORING
He is interesting if you can stay awake, which is pretty hard because he has long pauses and a soothing voice.  Very interesting but not really charasmatic.

Very boring lectures but he takes attendance for the first half of the semester.  Lots of reading if you actually do the readings, but only 2 essays overall so not too much work outside of journal entries.

Overall Thomas Brown's class was an amazing overview of optics, from basic thin lens to holography  The test were very fair and resemble the practice tests very closely. Definitely not impossible to do poorly on but if you know your stuff you'll be fine. Lectures made me a bit sleepy at times, but the professor is still very passionate about optics
lectures can be a bit boring sometimes but prof is very caring and kind
He is such a sweetheart and clearly passionate about what he is teaching. If you pay attention and go to workshops you'll be fine. Take the time to talk to him one on one! He is a great guy

Professor Brown is one of those teachers who cares about his students and ensures everyone's success. While he does care about his students, his lectures are extremely boring. He took lasers, LASERS!, and made them not interesting to me. I learned a lot more from the workshops and practice tests than from the lectures, but that's just personal.

Everybody loves Prof. Brown. It is clear that he is very passionate about what he's teaching. There is graded homework and the tests are relatively easy if you simply listen in class. That being said, because optics is not widely studied and we don't use a textbook, his lectures are the only place you find what you're learning.

TGB is the real deal; he knows his stuff inside and out, but he explains it in ways that anyone can understand. He mixes up the lectures, homework, and tests with jokes and fun stories, and really cares about each individual student. Amazing person and professor!!

He is such an amazing professor, but this is a difficult class. If you do not go to the lectures or watch his videos you will be lost in the class. Also the homework is difficult so don't procrastinate, and go to his office hour for extra help.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Freshmen taking this class with no understanding of Optics, Brown made it interesting. This class is straight forward: he is a hard grader on hw but give you guide for test just rearranged test or with different math. He is willing to answer any questions, bad thing about him he just speaks and shouts in the same tone. Optics major due to him.
My insomnia is cured by him. I don't know what he is talking about. And the grade is ridiculously lowwwwwww.
Tom is the bomb!

class is completely of matlab...tends to be quite boring and frustrating when matlab gives you problems and there is no textbook except a short lab manual used for lab and class....hard to keep up with all of the work. good guy tho

very nice guy, very personable. his class is all matlab which is very dry but he does a pretty good job with it. little tip; if nothing else put lots of time into the take home midterm and final, its the easiest way to get a good grade...heinsight

I took OPT 442 in 1996.  Tom can be boring, but he's clear.  I've never met a professor who had as much concern for his students.  He once taught the recitation because he felt he had done a poor job explaining a concept in class.  The "seminar style" of the last few lectures covered loads of material very useful for job interviews.
Impossible to reach!
class is all matlab. totally disorganized. always goes overtime, and even starts early. speaks in slow motion. friendly, though.
Very fair and clear
No Comments
Learned a lot.  Good professor.
An intersting, challenging teacher.  Somewhat boring at times, but certainly learned a lot.

Taking a course as part of a cluster and with no context or experience for engineering otherwise. Professor Ronald's lectures are clear and easy to understand, and he takes the time for all the students to understand the content and catch up.
Professor Ronald is a nice dude and makes the class enjoyable and gets the basics of CAD down.
Professor Ronald is so caring and nice, he makes the heavy courseload bearable and is so down to earth.
Really a nice professor! A really kind person and easy to reach out. He explained the points in the lecture pretty well with some good examples. I will definitely take his course again!

He's really nice and understanding. The material he teaches is clearly related to the exam. He also gives practice exams which are basically all you need to know before a midterm. One of the best professors ever!

Really nice guy, super helpful and personable. Don't skip lectures, because they're only once a week, but if you need to miss one he will help you figure it out. I had this class during corona and he was awesome and understanding.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Great class!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: He is good at explaining class material and he walks you through the processes of how to use CAD. He has a group of TAs that are in every class to help students whenever they have a question about the material. However, he is not really accessible through email. He did not respond on a timely manner to any emails I have sent him.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: not very responsive to email

Prof. Ronald is an amazing teacher. He really tried to help his students understand the material and how it will relate in our work as engineers in the future. He was always available by email and in person to answer questions. One of my favorite professors so far at UofR.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Ronald is a great teacher and a super genuine guy. He makes the material pretty easy and enjoyable to learn.  He also ordered us a pizza during the middle of the final, if that gives any indication of what kind of person and professor he is.  Honestly probably my favorite professor yet, Ronald is awesome. Definitely take his classes!
He is one of the best professors i have had so far. He is helpful, approachable and his classes are always interesting.
One of the best professors I have had thus far. Does a great job explaining the material. Very accessible, approachable, and entertaining, as well as a fantastic teacher.

Ronald knows his stuff.  He is an actual engineer with a real world job so he makes his lectures much more applicable to the outside world.  He has a thorough understanding of the concepts and will make sure you do too.
No Comments
smart guy who knows his stuff but he doesnt forget that he is teaching, not just reciting, wants you t do well and will work with you to help you, not just say it.

claims to be a really easy professor but that isn't actually the case, though the class is still very manageable. truly cares about students' success, and along those lines sometimes bends his grading rules to help your final grade. he's really cool (and smart!) as well. fall statics is a small class so he likes to keep a casual atmosphere as well.

Ronald is the man ... he's a great teacher, and he can make the most complicated concepts understandable. He's funny, considerate, and interested in his students' success. He's part-time but if you have a chance to take one of his classes, you should.

Dr. Olek is an interesting professor.  The main key to succeeding in his class is to think conceptually and in a "creative" fashion.  I really like how he taught us to think critically.  You will have to put in effort in this class.  I went to class, actively participate in workshop, and went up to him to ask questions and managed to pull off an A.

Very disorganized. Made us buy textbooks but never used it (said textbooks were "dinosaurs"). He is helpful if you try with an open mind. Gives away some questions on his test in lecture, so make sure you don't miss those. His slides can be very vague but he bases his tests on his them. The workshops are more helpful.

I wouldn't go to class because he goes over the slides so quickly, you don't learn much. He's also very condescending and hard to respect. I wish I would have just solely taught myself from the slides and would have done much much better in the class.

People like to complain about him, but if you keep an open mind he's not terrible. He has a unique style but if you make the effort to learn it, you'll be fine. Pay close attention to the lecture slides, as tests are based off of these. He's helpful outside of class. If you have the option, take BIO 112 instead. Much harder class, but better prof.
Not as bad as everyone says. Went to lecture, went to workshop, got an A. Fair grader. Go visit during his office hours on finals week and he is 10X more helpful

Olek is definitely a professor that really only uses his data and thinking to teach, despite other view points.  You really learn how to pass his test by learning how to think like him, versus the material itself. The TA's for him aren't even that helpful sometimes, especially when they skip over material in workshop.

Try not to miss lectures because it is easier to absorb the information on your own (which you MUST do) later on to understand it. Once you look at the slides a few times though, it all makes sense. His lectures are clear and he always answers questions clearly.

Taking Olek requires you to pay attention in class. You can't slack off and miss class and expect an A. I went to every recitation w/ TAs and tried to make it to every class (and took notes at that) and pulled off an A. It was definitely my hardest class w/ math&chem, but its not impossible. It requires work, if you try, you'll succeed. Stillpremed

Avoid at all costs! Just do something and do not take his class. He is so disorganized. Made us buy the book only to tell us that he hates the book and told us that everything in the book is wrong. Before him, I was a bio major, well, now I'm not.
