rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: Great overall Professor. Do the work, show up to class, you get an A. Nothing is random or unexpected. Participation matters a lot though, so always be ready to discuss.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: He always pushes you to think in depth. It is quite challenging, but his class is absolutely worthwhile taking.
He is a very nice guy, and really cares about what he is doing.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: The material is really interesting, but the lectures are very monotonous Definitely has favorites (observationally, based on who laughs at his 'jokes'). Would not take again.

Great guy, interesting subject matter that he clearly cares about. Reading is a significant component of his classes, but isn't unmanageable. Response papers were graded more than fairly, as were tests. Class got boring sometimes, but other times it was fascinating. He gives you all the information you need to succeed, and expectations are fair.
The material is great but his lectures are draaaaaggggging. He must be passionate about what he teaches, but he has a hard time showing it?
Reichman is relatable and interesting. The material for the class was applicable and the books were worth reading. He is a pretty hard grader though. Very hard to get an A.

I think I learned more about how to write well in this class than I did in my WRTG 105. All the readings are super interesting, and class is usually just discussion about the readings, which everyone participates in and is really helpful when it comes time to write the papers. Overall, I loved this class and had a great time.

Professor Doughty is overall a great professor. I actually feel that I learned a lot over the course of the class, although it was very reading intensive. She talks fast, but her lectures are interesting. She prepares you well for tests and grades pretty easily. Also, she was very flexible and understanding in terms of attendance and due dates.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Amazing professor in every way. Grading criteria is clear, she cares about her students, and provides great reading material and discussion. One of my favorite classes I've taken.

The best professor in the whole university. She taught me how to write and think for myself. She takes the time to scrupulously comment on your papers so you can improve your writing and arguments. The topics covered are tough, but the class discussions mixed with her beloved rants humanizes our detached univ. Highly rec for every major!
Just pure awesomeness. She even helped me with an outside project.
Very amazing professor. Definitely recommend anyone who can to take her courses!
Professor Doughty had amazing lectures. I admire that she tries to fit so much material in a 101 class, which shows that she cares about students actually getting something from the class.
The most passionate professor I've ever had. Knows her subject well. Has changed my college career. Highly recommend!

She is tough, but fair. She expects you to engage with the material, but is understanding of the fact you are a college student. She is really helpful, despite the fact she might ramble a bit. But, her ramblings are always helpful! Even if they sometimes cause you to think more deeply about the issue. She is really great. Be prepared to work hard.

She is very passionate about what she is teaching but does tend to speak very fast. Readings are mixed with some very interesting ones and some you just have to get through. Exams were pretty difficult but if you take good notes and know the structure of the readings then you will should do fine.

Speaks really fast, but you get used to it. She was nice and helpful when you go to office hours or as a question after class. Doesn't lecture often, sit in a circle and had group discussions of the reading. interesting topics, hard exam essay questions, easy weekly journals. MANDATORY attendance-she will notice if you arent there and email you.
She is very nice but she talks really fast and there is often no information provided to you except the readings.

Kinda bland. She gives her powerpoints, but they're drastically different from what she uses in class to the point that it's distracting from material so be sure to take your own notes from scratch. She's very fair and up-front about grades. Tests are fairly simple.
If you get a chance to work at her lab and get to know her better, she is an amazing professor! Respond to emails quickly and always there when you need advice.

Her lectures are interesting and have a lot of information. Her tests consist of multiple choice, definition, and short/longer answer questions. Those tests you basically have to memorize everything and be ready to throw it back up in the short/longer answer section. Otherwise it was an interesting course
i really liked her, she knows a lot and if you email her or talk to her, she is always there to help clarify questions. shes very nice!
great class!
interesting lectures and very fair... watch out for researchers' names on the exams
kind of a drag

She does okay. Adol Dev is a pretty fun topic since everyone remembers their teen years.  She's really into making sure students know the names of researchers and not just their findings (beware on tests). Also 1/2 the tests are based solely on the book material.

Adolescent Dev. is a BORING class, but easy...since I got a B+ and never went to class and if i did i slept thru it cause it is SO boring.  I think she's a nice person, but not a good teacher.  She likes research, and she'll tell you ALL about it.
No Comments

I will never forget how awful this woman made me feel when I questioned her research.  A shift in perspective should be welcomed from students---not almost ridiculed.  The psych dept. has a real problem with not welcoming the students to think for themsel
No Comments

He sometimes lets his emotions get the best of him, and you can tell when he's frustrated that his students clearly aren't understanding the material. He is very flexible, however, if moving around test dates/homework due dates if enough students have simultaneous exams etc. He cares very much, yet seems very distant.

A great professor -- I despised the teacher and the topics in 121, and I came to this class expecting more of the same, but was very pleasantly surprised.  He's helpful, clear, offers tons of resources to succeed, and does his best to challenge you fairly. Hotness point for his amazing, soothing voice.

Course is fairly terrible, and I didn't learn a thing... doing well on tests is a result of luck and putting the right examples on your cheat sheets... At least he lets you drop one midterm, but the class is very confusing and he refuses to do examples to teach.. Nice guy, smart guy, but not the best teacher

Good professor.  Very committed to making sure students understand the material.  Comes to lecture extremely prepared and spends a lot of time on the class.  Pre-class quizzes force you to do the readings and make the lectures easy to follow.  Lecture slides from University of Illinois and he never mentioned it.

When approached, he doesn't help students AT ALL.  He is very inconsiderate and not tolerable in any way.  Does not care to help those in need.  Does not give out + and - grades so you get what you get and there's no discussing anything with him.

Learn to learn from power points as early as possible, youll get *very* little out of lecture if you dont make this adjustment. If you go to workshop, do the homeoworks, and put in the man hours, youll be fine. Bears an uncanny resemblance to Mclovin.
Puts in a lot of time and effort into his class. For the "A" is a cool idea. He's a little too PC, but the class is fun.
Amazing Professor. Incredibly enthusiastic about the course and really cares about the students.
An extremely inconsiderate and condescending teacher when approached.  He appears to be excited about the course, but is unable to teach it.
Worst professor Ive ever had. Is extremely inconsiderate during office hours. Very smart and expects students to know it all as well as he does, but no one understands a thing he says.

This Guy Sucks.  Does a horrible job teaching.  Lectures in PowerPoint Format.  Powerpoint slides aren't his own.  Doesn't release answers to midterms so that he can give same exams every year.  Doesnt care if you dont understand whats going on.
Great Professor.  Makes Physics fun.

Prof.Singh is the kind of prof. who makes even the hardest topics click. He's super approachable, always puts students first, and creates a really welcoming and supportive vibe. Magically, he makes every single moment of his lecture enjoyable. And, he goes above and beyond to be attentive and accommodating to students with accessibility needs.10/10

Prof.Sohbit is hands-down one of the best professors in the department. He cares so much about his students and their performance in his class. He is very friendly, and his lectures are very engaging.

Professor Singh very evidently cares about his students and the material more than any professor I've taken from. He's clearly very well versed in the subject and his lectures were structured in such a way to maximize learning. He was very helpful in and out of class, ready to answer questions, and would start most lectures asking how we were doing

I have nothing but praise for this course and Prof. Singh. As a senior, I can confidently say it's been one of the least stressful yet the most effective class in helping me grasp the material. Class content is challenging though! This course has been my favorite so far during my time at UofR. I wish Prof. Singh could teach all our classes.

Prof. Singh is the best. He is super funny and truly cares about students. The class content is tough but Singh explains everything very well and generally exams were manageable. Workshop is super helpful, weekly homework is accurate to exam content. Overall 10/10 would recommend taking a class with him.
Very cool guy. Funny and super nice.

Professor Singh cares extremely about the well-being of students. His charming and outgoing personality keeps the class awake at such an early time. His policies are extremely fair and he is a knowledgeable professor who wants you to do well in the course. Exams are exactly what we practice, unlike many other courses. I recommend taking his course.

Professor Singh is a great professor who can make almost any student passionate about Materials Science. He makes the material interesting and easy to learn and shows compassion for his students. I would highly recommend anyone to take this course.

Professor Singh is an amazing professor and I would recommend his courses to anyone. He is very friendly and caring and genuinely wants you to learn. His lectures are clear and concise and the resources he provides are great for learning the content.

Professor Singh is the most understanding and approachable professor i've had here at the UofR. With that being said there is a decent amount of work with the class, weekly homework's, workshop's, three midterm exams, labs and a final project/presentation. Going to lecture and keeping up on notes makes earning an A easily achievable.

Professor Singh is one of the best professors I've had. He is very knowledgeable in material science and teaches the material well with very thorough and thoughtful lecture slides. He also genuinely cares about the well being of his students and wants to make sure that everyone is doing well not only in class but also outside class.

The best professor ever. Not only good at teaching, but also very caring. 
The lecture, hw, exams, all designed great.

The homework was concise and simple, and everything on the exams was quite easy and covered thoroughly through workshops and lectures. Labs were also easy and less time-consuming. Overall, one of the best Professors in the ME department. Highly recommend taking his courses!
Professor Singh is an amazing teacher!
Best person ever.

Well, a mixed bag. Very poorly organized lectures. Basically friendly in a phoney way. Not evil, just not helpful. Disappointing, mediocre in general, as a historian and teacher. Will make some good observations about you papers, but that's it.
HES CHILL

Professor Borus is a so funny. He is so quirky but it works for him. He definitely keeps the class interesting and he tell you straight forward what he wants you to know for the exam. He's a good professor
Definitely a unique guy.  Pretty funny too.  he speaks a a little too quickly for good notes and is a little weird when you come to talk to him alone.  Overall though a good guy.
I had to keep myself from bursting out lauging in the first lecture; he has a very "unique" speaking style. He's a nice guy and grades easily, though a bit obsessed with certain eras.
He's a really sweet professor.  Fun lectures.
Great at teaching 301 class.  A lot of work but interesting readings and topic discussions.  Willing to sit down to discuss papers and grades.  Interested in teaching and his students.

i don't consider him one of my favorite teachers or the best by any means, but he's definitely more enjoyable if you get past the first few lectures. a bit pedantic in his manner of speaking but will make a few jokes.
Very helpful, insightful, keeps the material fresh and interesting.
No Comments
No Comments

If you can take this class with another professor, do it. She was good at the beginning, but when grammar became complicated, she often went on side tangents not relevant to the lesson. She doesn't focus on pronunciation either. This class is very homework and test heavy, if you have a lot of other obligations, it's hard to manage.
Intimidating at first but nice!

Prof. Brown's 102 is test-heavy and most of the grades are decided by tests. As an international student learning Spanish as my third language, I performed worse in 102 than in 101 as there are lots of complicated grammar and tenses. I do not think my grade reflects my work ethic.
I liked Professor Brown's Spanish 101 class. The pace of the class is okay and she cares about her students. The grade is heavily based on the unit tests, though.

Prof. Brown is probably the most strict professor I've had at the U of R. She even goes so far as to prevent students from using the bathroom during class. She is unpleasant and judgemental, and cannot understand that students have other commitments outside of her class. Her class was consistently the worst part of my day. Do not take this class!

She's OK. She would frequently go off-topic in class, so make sure you actually learn vocab on your own time. Tests were usually rushed because they were 10+ pages long. Homework is annoying and doesn't help your grade. Best way to do well is learn as much of the vocab as you can and practice pronunciation for speaking exams.

She is not prepared for class a lot of times and expects you to learn most of the stuff on your own and only briefly goes over it in class. The most frustrating thing is that her tests are not fair. It is unclear and has stuff from other chapters. DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS.
I love professor Brown. She is such a nice person and she teaches us more than textbook. Her class is fun and helps you learn language with a good mood! One of the most amazing professors I have met.
Lectures with Prof. Brown is a pastime, not a class. You will always be drawn into learning spanish with her and her amazing stories.

Prof. Brown explains things well in class, though she relies that you learn about 60% of the material in the homework and during recitation. Her exams are clear and concise, either you get it or you don't. Could be a bit more organized though with a little better time management.

SUCH an amazing professor, & person! Very caring & genuinely wants you to understand the material. Will go out of her way to help & has a very "motherly" quality to her & very positive energy- it is truly a pleasure to come to class/ interact with her. Only thing is she sometimes goes fast with grammar, but as long as you are awake,you'll be fine.

She is funny and energetic and very understanding! She makes it fun to go to class even if it's at 9 or 10 am. She is not super focused on details in the lower levels she just wants you to understand the concepts. I am personally looking forward to having her again next semester!

She is very nice! The only thing I didn't like was that she expected us to teach ourselves from the textbook before coming to class. Since this was a beginning language that was difficult and I would rather of had her teach me things. But overall, great Spanish professor.
Very nice and caring professor

I personally really enjoyed Dr Lawton's class, shes quite enjoyable as a teacher and I genuinely enjoyed her class and the workshop associated with her. It gives you a great introduction to Chemical engineering and this class will tell you if you are ready to become a ChemE major because after this it'll get much worse.
One of the worst professors I've had at UR. Lectures do not prepare you for exams at all and are unorganized and poorly taught. Exams are also extremely long and difficult.

Lectures involved copying off of the board the whole time and were not interesting at all. She explains everything well, but lectures do not prepare you for exams at all, and exams are extremely hard. She curves a lot and is caring when you reach out to her which makes it a bit better. But overall, lectures suck, homework is hard, exams are harder.

Prof. Lawton is a nice person, but her lectures involve copying off the board and are not engaging. Homework is quite hard and the tests are inhumanly long, it would probably take the full test period to write out the answers alone.

Melodie is arguably the worst professor in the Chemical engineering department at U of R. I have never met a professor who found joy in seeing her students do poorly. No one deserves to be taught by her and i honestly dont think she deserves her job. Give this job to a professor who would work to see their students achieve great things.

This class was unreasonably tough, especially for a lab class. Melodie has given me the two lowest grades of my college career, for senior lab and senior design. What pains me the most is that these classes are lab classes, and consequently subjective and she felt that my 20+ hours in lab every week merited a C+. Fortunately I have a job lined up.
dear prof. lawton, Bruh why gotta be so hard.  its senior year we worked our asses off u needs to chill boo boo.
Doesn't give constructive feedback. Selectively responds to emails. Unreasonably tough grader.

This class requires a lot of time and effort. The breakdown is unclear and some submissions dont even get graded. I was an awful experience because you put in a lot of work in the class and end up getting a grade you dont even understand how you got there.

She means well, but her teaching style doesn't work for me. I was always lost. The lectures didn't prepare me for the homework, which didn't prepare me for the exams. The exams were the majority of the grade, so the homework didn't feel worth it. Workshops helped the most, but everyone was so confused. She puts most of the effort on the students.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: She's good at explaining things much better than the textbook but her exams are challenging. I would also consider her a tough grader.

Prof. Lawton is a very wholesome person, and very approachable to ask any question! The book required for the class is horrible to learn from but she uses a supplementary book that is interactive which was extremely helpful. The only negative thing I have to say about her is that her exams are hard, but she accommodate them with reasonabl curves
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: CB stopped giving his pop quizzes in Fall '13. A small fraction of the class came to each lecture. A large portion of the programming assignments is understanding the prompt.

The lectures are useless.  The coursework (CSC 172) is easy, but the professor is not helpful.  He is not very familiar with what he is teaching and often gets confused much like a high school teacher would.

Most important class I've taken in college - the pacing and the structure of CB's homework and project assignments gives you a very strong incentive to learn how to teach yourself new CS theory and tools and how to do it quickly. Also taught me to do the readings BEFORE lecture. CB is underrated mostly by people expecting someone to spoonfeed them.
Does not make any part of the class clear, gets mad at students for asking good questions

I don't know why he is still allowed to teach. His lectures are almost incomprehensible and his assignment descriptions are worse. I am spending 3 times the amount of time for his class per week than any other class I am taking.

This professor honestly doesn't seem to care anymore about the courses he teaches. This could be an interesting course if it were taught by someone who took the minimal time to even read the assignments he gives. One of the main problems is he is extremely difficult to follow in class, so avoid this course if possible.

A brilliant professor that teaches a great class.  I took it before they used the quake code and it was still fun.  It's not easy, but Brown is an excellent teacher.  He also has the best sense of humor.
He is a fine teacher but you must keep up in the class. If you don't you'll find yourself not doing too well.
He is a super nice guy, happens to be one of the best in the world in his feild. If you are at UR and have the opportunity to take a class with him you should.
If you can keep up with him, there's nobody better to learn from... If not, you'll quickly find yourself asleep (and failing).
No Comments
No Comments

Ken is a nice guy, and pretty laid-back, which makes the atmosphere of the classes cool. Unfortunately, his idea of teaching debate is more like shamelessly plugging for the Debate Team. 90% of what I learned in this class would only ever be applicable if I decided to do Academic Debate on a team, which was not helpful for my legal minor.

He is very funny and lively, so "lecture" is entertaining. He's also very nice and approachable. The workload really isn't much at all- just a couple research projects take a while. He's also pretty clear, and tests/quizzes are pretty fair.

Ken is an interesting guy. The class is not easy because you need to do the work. The drag of the class has to be the tests about the book and vocabulary. Ken does show favoritism to those who are on the debate team but it is just the same type of favor that other professors show to students they already know.The best parts are the inclass debates.

Ken is a very good professor. He is extremely approachable and possibly the nicest professor I have had here. Many have said that the workload is large, but I didn't find it difficult at all.His assistant Brad is also unbelievably nice and very helpful. I look forward to any other class I have with Ken.
Tough class. Lots of work but I learned more than I have in many others. People complain about his style, but pay attention and it all comes together ...

Ken is super funny and he has tons of hilarious stories. Lectures are not the easiest to follow.Notes on the board are hard to understand but he will always answer questions during or after class. He is really helpful. He also lets you edit the biggest assignment for a better grade. Focuses more on competitive debate but still a great class!

First up, this class is a LOT of work. I would have liked more focus on debate techniques and less on politics. That being said, Ken is a good guy, easy going and interesting. If you have an interest in competitive debate, this is a great class. If you don't and just want to learn general techniques with real life applications, it's less useful.

Although an extremely funny guy, Ken's lecture notes and style is very messy and difficult to understand. I thought it was going to be more debate, but its a lot more lecture and him trying to convince you to join the debate team, favors students that are on the debate team. Unless you are on the debate team... don't take this class!

This class is a ****load of work!!! BE WARNED! If you can do it all, you will do well. Do not get behind, and attend every class. Ken is amazing, and definitely makes the course worth it. He's really funny and keeps the course from dragging. Always there to talk to. Definitely a worthwhile course if you're up to the challenge.

Ken is a funny guy and a good teacher.  He teaches in a very down-to-earth style that makes the material much less intimidating.  Assignments take some work, but they aren't too difficult.  He'll ask very pointed questions and force you to defend your answer, which makes everything feel like a  debate.  It's fun though - keeps you on your toes.

Very nice, friendly, funny.  Not a great teacher.  It's kind of unclear how knowledgeable he is about his field, but he does have pretty impressive credentials.  The class was boring to me, but he did his best to keep it interesting.

He's the man. A very interesting and funny guy who teaches a good class. He knows his stuff as well. Class starts out a little boring but gets good once it gets going. He might play favorites with kids who are on the debate team, but that's not to say he's not cool with everyone else. Ken Johnson=Jack Black+Conan O'Brien+Philip Seymour Hoffman.

confuses himself when explaining simple things, often makes mistakes and does example problems wrong.  unhelpful when asking for clarity in review sessions.  does not seem to know much about calc and his hesitations make his lectures awkward. the grading for this class is however quite lenient. dont take if you actually care to learn calculus!
Starr is an all-starr. I don't know why people give him a hard time, he is very patient and explains things well.
Very clear, takes time in office hours to work with me
This professor is really good.His class is clear and office hours are very helpful.
Very friendly. Always willing to help. Lectures were clear and exams were fair.

the worst/most imcompetent professor one could possibly imagine. I have never seen that level of incompetence in my life. Its embarrasing that he teaches in a school as good as the University Of Rochester. Its a sad situation

Tests way too long, most people there at end. I got a 60 on the final (average was 65). It wasn't hard, just too long. Tons of homework that didn't count much. I've taken Adv Stat and Econometrics (As). The material was easy stuff, but I (and others) didn't have the time necessary. The grade won't piss me off, but the grading method does.
does not understand what he's teaching

If he doesn't have his notes in front of him he has no idea how to do anything. I could teach the class better than he could; he has no idea what he's talking about at all. We were reviewing for our midterm and someone asked a question and he actually said "i don't have my notes in front of me so i don't know how to do this, can anyone help me?"
No Comments

DONT EVER CHOOSE A CLASS WITH HIM. He has no idea what he's talking about and has no knowledge outside of what he copies down from the textbook. Unsure about many things. A large portion of the class dropped out of his class since the first day. Most incompetent professor I have ever met. Behind on lessons. Teaches useless things.
SO BORING!! Covers things that we never need to know!
Great teacher!!!Very clear and patient. Encourage students a lot. Generous extra credit in quiz and test. Give thoroughly review before every test.
Shino Sensei is such a sweet lady and an excellent teacher!

Shino sensei is wonderful. It's a tough class and there's a lot of work, but you learn a lot of Japanese very quickly and she's always there to help. She is a native speaker so she gives lots of great insight into Japanese culture.

Shino-sensei is great. Her class is very structured and you learn a lot of Japanese really fast. As long as you study a little, the quizzes and tests are very manageable. She has a slight accent, but it doesn't affect being able to understand what she says. I definitely recommend this class for a good start in Japanese.

Very nice, fun lady, but I actually didn't find her all that helpful. I was usually referred to the textbook when I had a question and the textbook itself seemed to be composed of scattered tiny text boxes of information sprinkled amidst random words and exercises. The class was also very large which wasn't a huge help for learning a language...

Really sweet woman and soo helpful when you go to her.  Sometimes I don't follow her at all because I'm just awful with the mechanics of grammar, but when really lost, the textbook is usually there to save you.  Awesome but time consuming class. I want Shino as my grandmother!
The best sensei ever! Very fun, very enthusiastic! The class is extremely easy! Easy A! Don't be afraid, take it!
Shino-sensei is an amazing teacher. She is really helpful one on one as well as in a class of 40.
I missed a load of class from being sick, and while other teachers shoved late penalties down my throat, she was the only one who actually wished me good health... I wish she were my mother :)
Although the material is pretty difficult, Shino-sensei is very helpful and patient. She is always willing to talk to you, and makes class fun and interesting.
Easier and more forgiving than Tamate, she doesn't give as much work because the class is designed as an introduction.  Fantastic teacher, really goes the extra mile.
Very rigorous course.  Overall I gained a great deal of knowledge, but be prepared for a LOT of work.

Really good teacher. 4 multiple choice exams, 2 mini-courses taught by TAs graded on HW completion and attendance. All of the exam questions come straight from the lectures so you have to go to them/watch the recordings
Very fun and explains things well!

Some of Chris's lectures are hilarious and amazing while others were boring and seemed to drag. He does have mandatory 1 hr long sessions on top of the lectures taught by TAs, and there are 6 sessions. Tests are very fair and are not there to trick you. Make sure to do the extra credit early as that takes a lot of stress off the last two exams.
Chris is hilarious, such a g. Great class, just study for the exams and you'll do well.

His lectures are long but he is very engaging and extremely funny. He talks slowly and repeats/emphasizes stuff he really wants you to write down. Only grades are exams which are pretty straightforward. A lot just relate to vocabulary words so remember the terms. Mini-courses were fun and had free points. Would definitely take him again.

psych 181 is a confusing class. it's more like a philosophy class rather than a psych one. Chris rarely does live lectures; he made us watch recordings online instead where he explains stuff in a way that's so unnatural and confusing. You only get to see him once a week if he decides to walk into your weekly recitation and ask random questions.
He is a great teacher and I love how much he shares about his life. Definitely a performer.

He's literally the nicest professor I've ever met. I've taken psyc181 last semester and followed him to psyc262 this semester. Workload for this course is huge: you can be really exhausted for the first half of the course. It could be a perfect choice if you wish to do psychology studies afterwards. Just be prepared!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Prof. Niemiec is very passionate and knowledgeable in what he teaches. Lectures are very engaging and informative. The materials in this class are useful and easy to understand, but expect at least 2 research papers to read and 1 essay to write per week. Overall, definitely a class that's worth to take.

Take him, easy/funny - you dont have to show up to class to get A, he records all lectures -4 multiple choice tests worth 50 points each -2 mini courses offered by TAs (attendance and a small asaignments to do- you choose the course) worth 25 points each -2 discussion/debate session worth 2 points each (for showing up) - can get extra credit
Very easy class, but still interesting. Niemiec is a great guy and makes the lectures enjoyable.
Such a nice guy. Lectures gave you everything you needed for every exam. AKA don't bother buying the textbook (sorry Professor haha)
She is so good, like her class. Once you master on the course materials she provided in class, you will have a great chance to get an A.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: The class grade is based on only quizzes and tests. Attend lectures and take notes. You can cram everything the night before an exam but its probably better not to.
Repeats herself to the point that the information is hammered into your head. The class is elementary, and Professor Iyer does a great job and explaining the basics of Accounting.

Very passionate instructor. She carefully explained concepts and most of the times repeated them to make sure that students can understand well. Her class is organized as well, with most of her in-class practice are well-prepared with posted solutions.
She is good, tries to explain carefully concepts. Classes are well-paced, you don't have to do too much at-home practice to get good grades. In-class problems are nicely presented and quite enough.

Prof Rajeshwari is easily the best professor Ive had. Her lectures are perfectly paced with many practice problems and very clear explanations on how to solve them. There is no homework and she's more than willing to help students out of class. If you simply attend lecture and do the problems as she does in class, you will know everything on exams.
Perfect professor!

Shes amazing, repeats anything you need until you understand and examples in class are clear. Class is not mandatory but in order to pass you need to go. Theres pretty much no homework and she tells you exactly what is going to be on the tests.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Gives good feedback

comment: She is passionate and does her best to help students understand. She is one of the best professors in U of R.
Her teaching style is so good! No words needed. This course is highly recommended.

5 star professor, even though the accent was difficult to under stand at first, however when u get use to it, it became acceptable. She teaches step by step and go over problems more than once, so u don't have to worry if u don't understand. Fair test and quizzes, no HW, strongly recommended!!!
Really nice and accessible out of class. She wants students to be successful in her class.

Physic 2 is really hard, but he does not make it easier. Really nice guy that cares about the students, but he lectures are a waste of time and he never explains the concepts of what we are learning. He cares more about making crazy integrals on problems. But you can get awful test scores and still get a passing grade.

This course is hard, but he doesn't make it any easier. Lectures are rushed and he opts to go through complicated problems instead of teaching the concepts needed to understand them. Reading the textbook and seeing a tutor is far more beneficial. The TAs are wildly inconsistent with their grading, so HW grades largely boil down to who your TA is.

Worst class I've taken at UofR. Had to watch Youtube videos and read the textbook to learn this course. Lectures make the course seem more complicated then it should be. He is obsessed with academic dishonesty. He posts fake answers on Chegg and will edit old HW answer keys and make them wrong in order to catch people for academic dishonesty.
Nice guy but awful incomprehensible lectures done quickly on slides
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: Grade class

The professor is excellent; his personal qualities are understanding and helpful. This professor does not have much to do with pedagogy and researcher than a professor. Lectures are complex and incomprehensible.Students stopped attending lectures after the second exam, and there was no class activity, hence the lack of motivation to attend lectures

He clearly cares deeply about the students and is a nice guy, but lectures are difficult to follow, confusing, and not super well organized. After the first month or so we were at about 40% lecture attendance and it gradually declined from there. Get a good study group, get ready to read the textbook and watch videos.

Lectures are pointless, you will not learn anything from them, he rambles through PowerPoint slides, going over complex integrals and theory as opposed to the actual inner workings of E and M and focusing on genuine understanding. Read the textbook.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Lots of homework

comment: Professor's lectures are a bit convoluted and winding, but he is super kind and willing to help. Homeworks are killer, but the tests not so much. Class structure, with the workshops and all, is very helpful.

Professor Tzeferacos is a very nice man and is very accessible to students. This class is the hardest I have taken at the U of R. The material is very difficult and the workshops are long and treacherous. With that being said there are ample opportunities to get an A in this class with several point opportunities.
He is a fantastic professor. The course is really hard; however, there are a lot of ways to get the final grade higher.

His lectures sometimes were a little unclear, but he clearly wants you to succeed and there are many ways to boost your grade (HW, labs, extra credit) in the class outside of exams. Workshops are helpful, so make sure to attend them.

He is the worst Professor I have ever had at this school. He teaches the material poorly and tests on concepts that are not made apparent in the practice exam. The midterms make zero sense, and he truly sets you up to fail.
Dont even bother going to his lectures, it is totally useless. Practice exams totally irrelevant with wrong answer key. Doesn't post all information for exams (hw/workshop solutions etc)
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: He clearly knows the material well and is passionate about it. His lectures can be a bit confusing as there is a lot of information on them, but they help a lot for the homework as some questions are exactly the same. The TA's can be a hit or a miss, luckily I had a good TA which really helped with my understanding. If not, read the textbook!!!

Avoid if you can, if not it'll be okay. He grades nicely (85 is an A), but learning anything from his lectures is impossible. Also, the TAs are very rough. E&M is a hard class. Completely learned this course from the textbook which is good, so recommend renting/buying that.
Do not write. Most of the explanations are done through slides (maybe because of the online classes, it's 2020). Not very engaging but is flexible on gradings.
This was an amazing class. Sadly, Professor Paauw passed away last year.

Most of the questions on his exams basically comes from his lectures. The book gives clarify any help needed but you don't really need to read it. He is always concerned about kids who give effort and care about showing up to class. He is personable too, he gets to know everyone in the class too!
This class was incredibly easy, and almost guaranteed A as long as you show up occasionally and do your homework.

He's a super friendly guy who really cares both for his students and for linguistics. His passion shows when he teaches, and he does an amazing job engaging students and making the material interesting. A must-have and one of the best professors I've had here!

Very engaging, great professor. Really cares about his students and always willing to help. Attend class, do the HW, and you'll do well on the tests and get an A. Wasn't expecting to enjoy it, but loved the class solely because of how great he is.

smart, very caring, very helpful. He'll learn everyone's names who are in his class. 2 tests and one final project. passionate about the subject. I'm by no means interested in linguistics, but loved his class!

One of the best professors I've ever had. Loves his subject and loves to teach. Show up and pay attention and you'll get an A. The textbook helps and you need it for homeworks. Two tests and one project.

Prof. Pauuw, probably more than any teacher I've had at the UR, genuinely cares about his students. Always willing to help. Tests were pretty easy, the homework was the only part that was occasionally difficult. For the most part though, extremely nice guy leading an interesting class.
Extremely smart and helpful teacher. Definitely come to his OH, as he will always help you. Also, he makes the effort to remember each student's name, which is extremely remarkable.

His teaching style is not restricted nor influenced by tests. He engages the class in dialogues often and assigns practical projects applicable to daily life. Thus one is not highly pressured to perform and rather, really learns. Fun teacher to listen to. Overall, good professor.

Everybody seems to love Scott, but personally I'm not a fan.  He doesn't really seem to like opinions that aren't in line with his (political or linguistic) and can be kind of a jerk about it.  It also seems like teaching interferes with his job instead of being part of it.  Really easy class though.  No tests or anything.

Dr. Pai is straight up the goat. I've taken three courses with him now, and have almost entirely positive things to say. If you're at all interested in systems, you'll be missing out if you don't take a course with him. He's extremely knowledgeable, personable, organized, and explains concepts clearly. Also very helpful in office hours.

The material is very difficult, but Pai does an excellent job explaining the content during lectures and is very accessible and willing to help outside of class. Assignments are difficult but he gives you plenty of time and a lot of guidance, tests are challenging but appropriately so, and he curves generously.
Great professor. The exams are challenging but fair.

You will not be treated as an undergrad, but as his equal. His purpose is not to give a neutral, system-level view of computer design, but rather to only communicate what he personally finds more useful. He won't regard your well-being, or your grades. Doesn't curve. The materials are tough, but he makes them tougher. Avoid if you can.

An extremely thoughtful instructor that cares about the understanding of their students. Makes class comfortable and conducive to learning by putting effort into details which is evident in concise, thought-out explanations and examples. Accessible and easy to talk with both in and out of class.

Very knowledgable and smart. He puts real efforts into customizing the course materials instead of blindly following textbook. His lectures are very helpful and insightful. He taught 252 for the first time and in my opinion he nailed it (of course, no one is perfect, so I'm ignoring the little useless details that students usually complain about)

Professor Pai is REALLY knowledgeable and smart.I like how he gives very important resources to explore and for us to "learn how to learn". His projects can are hard and challenging, but he provides help along the way and you learn a lot. Exams are hard too, but that is normal given the nature of the course and the many complex topics it explores.

Very smart man, willing to answer questions. Projects are very hard, and the grading criteria is often released as late as one day before due date. START EARLY. Project criteria is often unclear and not graded until end of term.
Give an average of C. Wanna say more? Pretty accessible outside class and super helpful. But you wont get good grade on his class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Tough grader

comment: Difficult course and material. Unreasonable grading scale. Avoid if possible.
Great professor! But the class material is really hard.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Do not take this class unless you know what you're getting into. If there were tests I would've failed. The homeworks and papers make zero sense and you need to teach yourself everything. Lectures are pointless and you have to ask the TA for help on every homework every week. He's passionate but the class makes no sense. THE PREREQS ARE A LIE.

AVOID AT ALL COSTS! Office hours are a waste of time--he will simply say "you should know this", and ramble on about something else. Frequently goes off topic in class. Homework questions are long and confusing. Sometimes makes inappropriate jokes.
Thick German accent.
Horrible... You can't understand anything in the lab book...
No Comments
Thermodynamic freak. Screwed me on a midterm (admittedly, I'd been skipping class) by not adhering to the syllabus and extending 2 weeks of lectures into 2.5 months!
Wolf's got balls. Very outspoken. You'll learn more about the current issues and his views than about quantum.
Thick German accent makes him hard to understand.
No Comments
No Comments
should spend less time trying to be  cool  bad teacher, but gives lots of EC

This is a good intro course for people who never coded before as Professor Lee does the examples himself and is also available outside of class if anyone has doubts. There will be homework every week relevant to that week's topic. Start early and pay attention during lab assignments.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Anyone who doesn't give Ming-Lun a 5, please ignore them. Best professor in the ECE Department!

The professor was really nice. Even though he doesn't offer set office hours, he is easily reached through email and responds really quick. As long as you put in the effort then the class and the exams should be easy.

Professor Lee is one of the most caring teachers I have had at UR. But the amount of homework assigned is crazy. It counts towards your grade more than anything else. But Professor Lee and his TAs really care and are accessible outside the class. The textbooks are also super helpful. Pay attention in class and do your homework!

One of the sweetest professors at the uofr. Not only is he kind but he legitimately wants too help and get too know his students. However, when it comes too being a professor things get a bit shakey. He's very passionate but often unclear, and for how much HW we're assigned it's often more busy work then reinforcing what we've learned.
So sweet and really cares about his students

Very accomodating but also assigns a LOT of assignments. Some of them are so unnecessary like he doesn't realize that we have other classes besides his. Don't take AME196 if it's not relevant to your major/cluster/minor, it is too much work as an elective.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: It was my first programming course and I'm glad that it was c/c++ instead of python! His slides really helped me. And though homework questions were challenging, they were thought provoking at the same time. I learned how to think as a programmer from his class. Prof Lee wants his students to do well and is generous in grading.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: He is always open to help students but as a professor he is not really good. He is really hard to understand and assigns homework without explaining what you have to do. If it's the first time you are programming and it's the first language you are learning you will probably require a lot of extra work and help from the TA's.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: My favorite professor! He really cared students and wanted them to understand C/C++.

Ming-Lun is awesome! He genuinely cares for his students and wants everybody to understand the material. Is SUPER helpful in office hours. Sometimes he isn't very clear during lecture however he is very organized and easily approachable. HW is tricky (for 114) but extra credit helps! Would definitely take another class with him!
fantastic professor; very willing to help with long and extremely convenient office hours
No need to buy the textbook.  Everything he says in lecture is crystal clear and his love of teaching shows.  Open book/notes/whatever tests!  One of the best professors I have had in college.
Fantastic Professor.

Best math professor I've ever had.  He's a well-oiled explaining machine.  281 was the first time I've seen a lecture hall still full by the end of the semester - Clark actually teaches the material.  Great guy and funny too.
Amazing teacher.  Attendance wasn't mandatory, but it should have been.  Extremely helpful, extreme nice, extremely clear.
Sick nasty teacher, love the guy

He is the best teacher I have ever hard.  Both classes have difficult material but he teaches them very well.  He is organized, clear and helpful.  Very concerned with students' progress.  If you can take a class with him, you should.
Clark is God.  Best professor ever, period.
Best professor I have ever had.
Ouch, this course killed me.  Good professor and a nice guy, but way too difficult
One of the best professors I've ever had. Kind, considerate, clear, patient, fair, extremely knowledgeable, and down-to-earth. Teaches Statics, Fluid Dynamics, and ME201/MTH281.

homework is irrelevant. lectures are pointless. tests are ambiguous and incoherent. he cares more about writing style than actual engineering. he assigns random projects about animal spots and stripes with students who are not even in the class. he focuses on everything but engineering and starts with the last chapter in the book.

Hates undergrads and curves the class down.  Doesn't teach well, and the homework is so hard that not even your TAs can figure it out.  Grades partially on personality.  Overall I was displeased with pretty much everything about him, though makes for some great comedic material. Take the class with the other prof. if you can.

I really liked Prof. Quesnel. You do have to pay attention, because he goes quite quickly, but if you stay on top of the material his lectures are really helpful. He also clearly loves the subject, and if you do too, you'll have no problems. (Be warned, though, the homework is HARD)

Professor's nice and helpful but has no idea what he is doing in class; hardly explains anything and having fun on his own. he repeats himself like 100 times on a single concept and leaves you wondering by the end of the class

Quesnel is a really nice guy. Sometimes he makes you think he doesn't know what he's saying, but he's a very intelligent guy (I guess he just can't explain himself very well). He's always available to help and has always been very clear when I go for homework help.

Quesnel is a nice guy, but he seems to have very little idea of what he is doing.  He copies nearly all the stuff he writes on the board from a sheet.  He explains everything in 3 or more ways, each less clear than the last.  It is likley that you will need to go to the TAs to finish the difficult homework that you didnt get taught in class.

Prof is a very nice guy who is unfortunately not very good at teaching. He has difficulty communicating material and uses many unnecessarily complicated methods for solving problems.  You will likely need to go to TA office hours to complete the weekly homework assignments, which are quite difficult and often cover material not taught in class.

This teacher made me want to switch majors.  He was always off-topic, although funny, I never could get the grasp of what was going on. He seems to reach about half the class, but leaves the rest behind, especially on tests where the standard deviation is usually about 19 points.  And his curves are ridiculous.
The prof starts discussing a topic and then goes off on a tangent.  He starts a hypothetical problem and then gets confused and by the time class ends, we are left hanging until the next class.

Quesnel seemed to be hit or miss from day to day. Either his lecture was very clear or it just seemed like he was trying to teach in a foreign language. Some of the problems he assigned were so difficult that he had trouble solving them. With all things considered he was very helpful and made sure he was always available if you needed extra help.

The main problem with Prof Q's class is the fact that we are learning it at the same time as we are learning the same exact things in MTH164 and PHY121. The recitations are incredibly difficult problems while the homework problems are fairly easy.  The exams...so far though are very easy.

Very hard worker who cares a lot about his students.  Homework and exams are fair and straightforward.  He responds to email quickly.  However, in lectures he talks quietly and writes too much on the board too fast.  You'll do well if you sit in the front and take fast, messy notes.

In my opinion, worst professor ever. Do not take a class with him if you can help it. Not usefully at all. Gave us a review sheet <20 hours before an exam. The solutions, 3 hours later (which were incomplete). How are we supposed to get answers from him such late notice?
Kind of awkward and very quiet, but he knows the material and does a decent job of explaining things. Very generous with extensions on assignments.

Seems to not enjoy teaching this class, as his lecture is copied straight from the textbook. He goes too quickly in class and really doesn't explain things. If you attempt to go in for explanation, his explanations outside of class are even poorer. On top of this, he's too quiet to hear in the back rows of Dewey 1-101. Other than that, easy.
Very nice~ He posted every note online. The class is easy~ Just... hope he can be louder in class...
For 162, he did an amazing job.  His notes were slightly hard to read, but he posted all lectures online.  As long as you follow his hints, the exams are a breeze.

take classes with him! great professor, more than willing to explain anything that you don't understand in office hours.    when he tells you to star a note problem or to triple star it, do it! and you'll do above the average if you remember to look back on it
Although slightly awkward in large groups, he is extremely nice and helpful during office hours.

Pretty easy class.  Not the best teacher of Calculus, but a very smart guy, and definitely willing to help out.  I think he'd be a good teacher for higher math courses, though.  Quizzes are all easy, just do the webwork and review it before the exams and you'll get an A on the exams.

This class is very fair!  Just go to class, take the notes, then look over the notes before an exam. Easy peasy. But be prepared to write A LOT of notes but the notes are useful so its worth it.  This man should write math textbook really, his notes are SO MUCH better than the stupid Stewart's text.

A bit awkward at first but after he warms up to the class he's pretty cool (tho still very nerdy ^^). REALLY wants you to succeed - there is just no way to fail his class. I hated math with a passion but he really helps you along; and he is a very generous grader and makes more than fair exams. Nice guy and made math a lot more tolerable for me.

Yilmaz was approachable, but doesn't possess very good teaching abilities. Material was difficult, and he just wasn't able to explain the concepts very clearly. Most people attended the lectures, but many just ended up studying with others or self studying to learn the material.

Had Prof Yilmaz this past semester. He's a bit quirky, but has a good sense of humor. I went to all of his classes and I enjoyed his lectures. He sometimes went over HW questions in class which was cool. Exams were tough but his curve is nice, and he even offers hints sometimes during exams. All around, he's a great guy, and this was a solid class.
so bad, so boring, study by yourself.
The accent might be an obstacle to some, but give Professor Yilmaz some credit; he's really funny when you least expect it.

Read the textbook. His assignments go with each segment of the textbook, and you will NEED to read the textbook. The class seems really easy the first four weeks, and all of a sudden the material becomes unbelievable. Get ahead and stay ahead. You might as well not go to lecture, he does not explain or emphasize anything well. Read the chapters.

He is willing to offer help during office hour. He goes over whatever the textbook covers and strictly follows the sequence of textbook. However he doesn't teach extra stuff.  If you thoroughly read textbook and spend time doing homework, you will be find on the exams. He won't give very challenging questions on exams.
He has a good rapport with students. He is there when we need help.
He is a really nice and helpful professor.
Lectures are very dry and boring. Doesn't clearly explain concepts. Exams are very difficult.

Language is most certainly a barrier for Professor Yilmaz- not merely in terms of speaking but writing (exams) as well. Exams were poorly worded or outright contradictory. He makes things more complex than they need be. And worst of all, he seems to think he's a great teacher.
Follows Landsburg textbook, which may or may not be a good thing.
She is so good that the calculus classroom is full for each class. She's clear, organized and nice. When she teaches, I think I see her eyes shining.
nearly all the examples are from the testbook
Lecture is the same as book. Once she spent one hr to work out one problem. She is a good prof, but not that helpful to me.
hard grader

i never realize how clear she is until I took some other professor's math course. She is young, well-organized, clear and helpful. But her first year math235 final was a nightmare and I was pretty sure she did not make the exam. Courses are not easy, but you will be ok if you keep working.Oh she looks like a student?

One of the best math professors I've had. Extremely clear, organized and thorough (great handwriting!). She is a very tough grader, but there was a fair curve. She was very helpful outside of class during office hours. Expect to spend 8+ hours a week on homework, and be able to endure some frustration from grading.

Very AWESOME professor! She is clear and her handwriting is like that of an angel. It helps to read the textbook about the section you are going to learn about before you have it in class. Exams are difficult, but studying is the best way to prepare!
don't take the math 200. its homework could cost you more than 5 hours and endless frustration when you are trying to write PROOFS.

She is a meticulous grader when it comes to exams and homework.  Don't take her class unless you really know how to write proofs.  You won't learn it while taking this course without failing A LOT first.
She is really helpful and nice. The course almost relies on the textbook, as since the exams are based on chapter examples and questions. Homework/quizzes are assigned but are not difficult.

Fatima's lectures were very well done, and it was clear she was well prepared for them. Unfortunately, her problem sets took me ~12 hours a week and she was not very understanding about this when it came to grading them. The final was HARD.

Cares for students, lectures are organized and easy to understand, but the exams are so hard. I understood the content perfectly but could not understand her exams. Exams and class are normally not curved. HW is graded by correction. Not the easy A people say this class is. She's a great professor though, and she wants her students to do well.

The class is fair, although I did find it challenging. Make sure to fully understand material and practice it. The exams get harder with each year and material is seldom repeated. Sometimes, they aren't written the best so make sure you understand what the question is asking. Homeworks can be difficult but they are really helpful.

Dr. Brisson is knowledgable and very fair with her hw assignments and exams. She makes it clear what she will and will not test you on. Attendance is mandatory but going to class is extremely helpful for passing the class. Study well for the final because it's worth a lot of points. One of the easier bio courses and she is very nice

Dr. Brisson was a pleasure this semester. She explains concepts super clearly and has a fair grading system. I really liked that she only teaches information she knows students will use in the future. There is plenty of material to help you study for this class! Attend class for the attendance points and go to recitations, both are super helpful!

Professor Brisson was excellent in Genetics. Although I was not the best in science, she tries hard for us to understand. Her slides are clear and study the HW, workshop questions. As well as the past exam questions, they are fair but she does grade a bit strict. However, she wants you to succeed and is open for any questions in office hours!

Nice teacher. She wants students to really understand the material. Homeworks are easy and are good preparations for the exams. Recitation is mandatory and those also help with exams -- there are plenty of practice resources to get you ready for the midterms. She's always willing to answer questions.

Dr. Brisson is one of my favorite professors! She has a really reasonable expectations of students and always takes the time if things are confusing. She mentioned many times how it is literally her job to make sure that we learn and I always felt like that was the priority of the class.

If you have a chance to take a class with Dr. Brisson, do it. Shes an amazing professor who truly cares about her students well being. Takes feedback strongly into consideration to make the class accessible to everyone. The material was not difficult so if you do the work, you will do fine! Im not a biology major but wish I was because of her!

I took her class in the fall. She is very fair with grading. Her exams are heavily based on the lecture material, so go to class. Plus, she does attendance points so class is basically mandatory. She's very good at answering questions, and is helpful outside of class! Go to office hours if you have any questions!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Brisson is very fair. If you do the practice exams, actually do the homework, and go to lecture, her exams are extremely fair. She makes you work for it, but if you put the work in, you'll do well. Beware, class is really not curved. Homework is worth a nice chunk of the class grade.

Dr. Brisson gives very dry lectures and looks like she has no energy. She assumes that students already know many concepts of Biology therefore, she does not go into very much detail. I feel like learning is jeopardized like this. She teaches very basic but exams require you to have to solid understanding. exams are all application based.
Hard class but study and you'll be fine! Dr. Brisson is really passionate about genetics and is willing to help her students.
She's good. I feel like even if you only wrote name on your exam you would still pass it.
AMAZING PROFESSOR. Accessible outside of class and will remember your name in a room of a hundred students.

Good very nice professor. Felt like a lot of HW at the start but then it gets normal. Attendance is mandatory and few pop quizzes are given in first half of semester. Exams are almost exactly like practice exams making it easy to do well.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: I enjoyed Prof Gregory and her Musc 101 class. If you went to class and stayed on top of the homework (1 short assignment per class), it is hard not to do well in her class. She's super sweet, passionate, and always willing to help outside of class.
Prof. Gregory's class is definitely not an easy A, but she explains the material so well and explains what she expects on writing assignments and exams, giving great feedback from them.

Prof. Gregory was a very caring and enthusiastic professor who wants to share her passion for music with her students. Super accessible outside class and gives plenty of practice to work with. As long as you keep up with homework and readings, achieving an A is very doable.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: I joined the class a week late and she made it very easy to catch up. She great at explaining the concepts and homeworks. It's a pretty easy class if you go to class and do the homework sheets.
A very good class. The content is not hard, and the professor is very nice!

This is an OUT OF MIND extremely hard course. I know it's the minor requirement but this class is definitely not for people who have only taken theory 1&2. You have to memorize all the pieces and composers studied in class (20-30) & style, about 40 terms definition which you can't find in ppt or book. 5 part essay at the end. IMPOSSIBLE CLASS WTF
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Professor Gregory made online class somewhat tolerable. I can't say her lectures kept me on the edge of my seat, but they are clear and easy to understand. The homework can be somewhat tedious but it's easy credit if you watch the lectures back. I joined the class two weeks late and she was very kind about the whole process. Also has 2 music PhDs.

This professor is good at what she does. Her lectures are well executed and she is very helpful during office hours. The TAs are nice and grade very fast. The only thing is that the homework is very repetitive and long. Only take this class if you're interested in music. It IS NOT an easy A.

Laura is a very nice professor who gives clear and useful feedbacks to students. She is good at teaching too. I'm not a fan of writing, but I enjoyed writing in her class. She is a fair grader that if you have done your work well, she would give you the grade that you deserve.

I absolutely loved professor Whitebell for my required writing class this semester. She was super flexible with my schedule and was understanding about extensions. I'm not a huge fan of writing in general, but I'd take this class again with her any semester. Would definitely recommend!

I am the one who got an A from WRTG 105A on 1/20/21. Everything is similar. She is always respectful, kind, and structural in teaching. I would love to take a future writing course with her if I have a chance.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Although the readings she assigned weren't all that in-depth, I thought the provided material was still interesting enough to have a pretty fun class. Lectures weren't too heavy, so long as you participate in discussions and submit the papers on time, the class is not too difficult.

For her 105A, what really matters are the two formal assignments (two roughly 5-pages papers), which add to 60% of the grade. As long as you do all the homework, you will get the rest 40%. She is very caring and serious about academics. She is open to paper extensions as long as you are hard-working and respectful. Sincere thanks to her.

Awesome teacher. She is naturally funny and will always give super helpful feedback. Her style of teaching is very collaborative (making sure you get feedback from different sources), and she's always available if you need to talk to her about something.
Takes herself very seriously and has no sense of humor, which is probably why she didn't get that 273 is a joke. It's an easy class though so it doesn't really matter that she's not great.
She's a really caring professor and is very open and wants to make sure that her students succeed. While she is a tough grader in my opinion, she gives good feedback. Really great class.

She chose super boring readings and topics for the course. Was forcing us to do a lot of group work, during which she was doing her own stuff and didn't even pay attention to us. Surprisingly, the requirements were more harsh in this  class than in WRT 105 (according to my friends' feedback). Laura is nice as a person though and gives extensions.
Best professor I had in this university yet; love her.
Super nice, really into her class. Had some great discussions. I would recommend if you are picking a WRT105E class.
best prof ever makes you wanna laugh after his exams :DDD

The curve in this class saved me and the only reason I was able to get problems on the test correct was because I taught myself all of the homework and workshop problems through online resources. I attended every lecture and don't think I learned a single thing.
Grading is really generous. Curve can save you as long as you try a little bit.

Professor Gourdain's class is a vibe. He actually makes his students learn the basic mathematics behind the physics of electric charges/fields/etc. 

While those "pesky exam cheaters" are annoying, his curve, which he "is very proud of," is beyond generous... This is a tough course but if you spend the time, you're guaranteed a B+ or higher.
He's not the best lecturer, super reliant on powerpoints and doesn't really TEACH the concepts. He has incredibly fair tests though, and as long as you do the homework and study, you'll do fine.
Class is really difficult and his lectures are extremely difficult to understand - also, he does extremely few examples of how to problem solve during lecture (says that is for workshop....).

Horrible class to take. No matter how hard you try, because others all cheat in exams so you can't get an A if you didn't. Honestly it is prof's responsibility to prevent this from happening but he did nothing. It is general physics which is an introductory class but you have to get full score for every exam to get an A. Not exaggerated!

Professor is a horrible lecturer and made me despise physics. Tests are more about calculus than physics. Lectures have nothing to do with the tests. Professor takes no steps to ensure that students are academically honest.
Easy class to take online

Gourdain is funny and a good lecturer. I think his use of linear algebra (and notation) for some units threw some people off since that's not a pre-req, so people who weren't comfortable with it struggled. Some exam questions were similar to in-lecture problems and HW questions, so I got a lot from going to lecture and rewatching them.

This professor's homework and other course requirements are not too bad, but his lecture ability is horrible. Be prepared for fast paced class with no explanations. He provides little to no background information about concepts that are completely new to the majority of students and is bad at explaining everything. Most students stopped attending.

I had a hard time in the class, but I respect him so much for being patient and helpful when I went to his office hours. He's the man. Best math professor, hands down. Also he's adorable and Icelandic.
Great guy. Take his class!
Great guy, great notes, overall pleasant experience. His accent is cool and he gives you all the tools needed to succeed in the class. Whether or not you use them properly is on you

Excellent professor!  I have had so many terrible math profs, and having him was like a breath if fresh air.  Clearly explained concepts, was extremely helpful in office hours, and very flexible/understanding.  The course was required for my major, so I wasn't too thrilled to be taking it, but Eyvi made the whole experience bearable! Learned a lot.

The course itself is abstract and at times confusing, but Palsson made the material bearable at worst and enjoyable at best. He was very clear with course expectations, has no accent, and answered questions fully. Overall he's a great professor and I highly recommend him

Calculus is definitely not my favorite subject, but Eyvy is awesome. His love of math is pretty adorable. He's always willing to help you understand things you struggle with. Most importantly, his English is impeccable, which can't be said for most of the math professors at Rochester.

He's really nice, and really helpful. Lecture is fairly entertaining for a math lecture. Despite the giant class size, he actually remembered me individually, although that could have been because I kept emailing him about WeBWork...
Awesome professor, excellent sense of humor!! His accent is Icelandic, but is very understandable, and even makes the lectures more entertaining.
Palsson is a GREAT professor. His lectures are very clear, and he's super friendly if you need extra help.
What a boss. Just... take this class.
This guy is the man. He is very helpful and he acknowledges you outside of class. what a pro.

Alex is the best professor I have ever had. He makes 165, a highly abstract and hard to comprehend topic, graspable and breaks it down easily. He could teach this to a child. He is also brilliant, coming up with far thought out examples on the spot that have simple and nice solutions (which, for linear algebra, if you know, is hard to do.)

Alex Rice. What a bae. One of the clearest lecturers I've ever had and the most helpful and thoughtful office hours I've gone to. Wouldn't have wished for any other professors my Freshman year. Love this man. I may have nodded off during some lectures but that does not diminish my respect for this guy.
He barely do  examples of question types in class. He is not at all helpful in office hour. Rude to talk to.

Clearest professor in the world. The examples he gives are extremely relevant to the problems you'll have to do and he explains them amazingly well. Makes great use of class time. I wish he could teach me every subject for the rest of my life.

Alex is the CLEAREST math professor you could ever have. He literally writes EVERYTHING on the board & explains it all. Not only is he great at teaching, but he's just a very cool person in general. Alex definitely wants his students to understand everything he is teaching. Don't think twice about signing up for a class he's teaching.

Alex was the best math professor I have ever had - he makes sure everyone understands his lectures, and they are incredibly clear and amazing. I never once opened the textbook for the class,  and was able to learn everything in his lectures.  He is also easy to talk to and gives an enjoyable lecture. He is a great guy, and an amazing teacher
He breaks down ideas into really small, manageable pieces and provides with action steps for difficult problems. He also helps a lot during office hours and is very approachable.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures

comment: One of the best Math teachers I've ever had. Alex is incredibly clear and straightforward in his lectures. He makes the material very easy to understand and does lots of examples in class that are similar to the exam questions. He is very approachable in office hours as well. Great guy, great teacher. The school is lucky to have him.

He lays out all the necessary material you will see on the exams. If you can get him then go for it as he is a very good professor. He is very clear and from the exam results, his section is always significantly higher (5-7%) higher than the other sections. Numbers don't lie! He's one of the best!

Very organized lecturer.  When he finished his notes for the day he would dismiss the class, even if it is very early.  Efficient with time and even when the class got out early, it didn't feel like he was skimping on the material.  He always started lecture on time and help office hours immediately following class.  He was very helpful.

Alex is a great guy and an amazing math professor. He makes calculus seem easy. Tests are not super hard but you definitely need to study. Lectures are good and Alex keeps things moving while also pausing for questions periodically.
Professor Jarrell is perhaps the best finance professor in Simon school, I still apply what he taught me 6 years ago in my job on a daily basis.

If I could go back and take courses from anyone, it would be for Prof. Jarrell. He is definitely one of the best things that has happened to Simon. He is an absolute authority in the domain of Corporate Finance and Business Valuations. I will cherish every moment that I spent in his classroom. Your education at Simon is incomplete without him.

The best Professor I've had so far. He is one of the most brilliant individuals I have come across and he knows his stuff inside out. His communication is crystal clear and notes are amazing. He is in one word a masterclass.
Great Design but Rude Professor
Best course ever
Outstanding teacher
Awesome Teacher Not organized, hard to get in contact with
He is really good. Makes difficult things very easyyy
No Comments
Cool teacher
He is my dad, so I have to say he is good

Being able to comprehend lectures heavily relied on being able to read his extremely poor penmanship. He also required us to buy a book he wrote, but hardly used it and opted to mostly teach from the other and significantly cheaper required text. Pretty nice guy, very intelligent, but easily the worst professor I've had.

The only reason Professor Chimowitz's class is hard is that he does not explain anything clearly. Replace the professor with a book, and you'll learn  way more. Did I mention that he's also very lazy and will never give you feedback on your project papers?
No Comments
No Comments
The most impersonable man I know.
The course material is hard, but I still think the man is brilliant.  Also, I love his accent.
love him! great professor!
No Comments
No Comments
Man went on Acid trip and never came back!
Replace this man with a potted fern and no one will notice or care.

One of the best professors in Black/African-American literature. Very kind and understanding. Great lectures. Clear grading as well - class structure is a few reading responses, and 2-3 essays, participation, and lesson plan questions.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Prof. Tucker is so clearly a master of the subjects which he lectures on. If you're willing to participate in class (which you totally should), you will grow so much more. He's kind, responsive to emails and questions, and all-around is a professor I've learned a lot from. I look forward to continuing to take his classes.

Always respectful, super happy to help, wonderful prof. My class was almost entirely discussion based and he always found a way to keep it going and get people engaged even on a Monday morning. Very light workload, technically all readings are required but you can do well only reading the ones that you have to respond to (trust me). Great guy.
Excellent Professor who gives great lectures and detailed feedback on your assignments. Also gives extremely clear grading criteria which I found to be extremely helpful. Would definitely recommend!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: EXCELLENT PROFESSOR. I absolutely loved his teaching style, and you can tell he genuinely loves what he does. He speaks softly, but you hang on to every word. He facilitates a classroom where you walk away having a better understanding of the course and why you study what you love.
