Mihai very much loves what he does and puts forth an honest effort. That, however, does no coincide with teaching ability. He has a very roundabout way of teaching that never actually teaches you the methods needed. Without fail, my undergrad TA has explained in 50 minutes what Mihai fails to explain in 150. I do not recommend him by any means.
So nice and Super Hot! Really passionate about math.

Sometimes he's too smart for his own good, but he truly cares more about his students than any other professor at UofR. He gladly meets with you outside of class when you're confused and really wants you to learn.

Mihai is a really cute, funny guy, and it's obvious that he is passionate about math and teaching it. He wants students to be passionate too. The problem is that his tests are difficult and he sometimes doesn't understand why a student can't grasp a concept as easily as he can. Overall, great teacher IF you're good at math.
Best math professor I've ever had. Good humor. Actually explains the math well.
Super nice guy, really tries to explain it from a students point of view so you can understand it. Very helpful in office hours too. Exam's aren't too difficult.

A great professor who knows what he is talking about. He really cares about his students and is willing to meet with you outside of class if need be. One of the best math professors I have had thus far at Rochester. The material in the class is difficult, but Mihai does a great job explaining it.

I struggled with following his lecture style. He is a good professor, but he doesn't answer questions very clearly so I would go to a different professor for office hours. He also isn't forgiving so if you have an excuse for something, it better be good. He's an easier grader than other professors so just sign up for his class and go to another one

Professor Cheng does want you to understand the contents, but he went through all these very fast and without very clear explanation, so sometimes it's getting very confusing. The contents of discrete math are hard itself, so get ready to watch youtube videos and read textbook by yourself would be a solution toward success.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: He speaks slowly and is generally easy to follow along. However, when asking him questions, he might leave you more confused than when you first asked. Overall, his lectures and homework assignments are good.

Even though he cares about his students and tries his best to understand the concepts, his English is simply not good enough to teach. On some occasions, students had to teach him English so that he could answer a simple question. He could barely speak in class and had to resort to writing examples and working problems on the board.
most boring lecture and probably the worst in the math department

Not very good at lecturing, usually jumping around with his ideas. It's hard to follow him. Also, he teaches everything out of order. The best way to succeed in his class is to read the textbook by yourself before class.
The homework is challenging, but it makes you to learn the material. His class was wonderful and I learned so much!
He's fully devoted to the class and will try his best to get you to understand this stuff!
Lectures are very boring. Be prepared teach yourself

She is a very caring professor and explains things well. She is very accessible outside of class and respond to emails promptly. Tests are easy and straightforward, and essays are graded based on your ideas rather than the quality of your writing. The overall difficulty of this class is around N2-N3.
Amazing professor, fun and interesting lectures, gives a lot of good cultural context

She is fair, clear, and makes herself available outside of class and passionate about teaching. If you ever need extra help, she is very willing to help you out.  I'm really glad UofR has a Japanese professor like her.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Hilarious

comment: Tamate-sensei is one of the best professors at this university. She is clear, thorough, and caring.

She is a very nice person. She takes her time moving through the readings to make sure everyone understands everything and calls on everyone to give them a chance to answer. However, she is a fairly strict grader. Messing up a particle or kanji stroke on an exam will cost you. Study hard, but you can always ask her questions.

She's incredibly patient, straightforward, and funny.  She relates to the students like they're equals, and will go out of her way to accommodate the busy schedules of her students.  She's by far one of my favorite professors here.
Amazing teacher, totally worth taking classes.  A bit tougher and less forgiving than Shino, but both are outstanding in their own ways.
She's just an awesome teacher.  She really knows what's she's doing, is very organized, and is very kind and considerate.
Fun class. It's a lot of work, but if you go to class, you'll do well.

I can't imagine a more amazing professor.  She is clear, direct and efficient, but still manages to create lectures and course schedules that are fully entertaining.  She is one of the most warm hearted professors I've ever met.

Professor Ren's lectures are so effective, they could put Melatonin out of business. With only a handful of students willing to brave his chalkboard monologues, the rest have found the ultimate sleep-inducing experience in his classes.

He's super nice and lenient on grading -unlike other engineering professors who care about nitty-gritty like writing down units and sig figs. As long as the final answers are correct, full credit. His exams are short (3 mids 1 optional final, 2q on each), but they are super easy. You will get a good grade unless you just have no idea whats going on
He just write everything from the textbook, even draw an exactly same image. His lecture is worthless.

He is the worst professor I have had at the University of Rochester by FAR! He has no idea what he is doing, and is completely worthless without his notes. He makes frequent mistakes during lectures. On top of that, his grading scheme is broken. He will only ask 8 questions, each one being worth 10% of your grade. He gives almost no partial credit.

His lectures were easy to listen to even when when we were digging deep into the mathematics. I also thought his final project of a PIC code was a great idea. You end up remembering what you learned a lot better when it's part of a big project. Not to mention it gives a great introduction to PIC codes which is important for research.

I really enjoyed this class.  He does teach right from the book, but I liked this style of teaching as I knew where he is getting his information and where he was going with it. Also, if I missed something in class, I could easily look it up. He was very helpful at rec. and extremely fair grader.He really captivated my interest in thermo.

Taught right out of the book.  His lectures and examples were almost completely from the book, so they did not add much more than what the textbook already outlined.  Professor Ren probably gets more criticism than he deserves, but he can definately improve his taching style.
No Comments

He sucks. He doesnt like to help you. He will give u the hardest quiz and tests ever. He will save 60% of yout grade til the last week of the semester and murder you with an impossible project and exam
Bushleague teacher... Don't know anyone who enjoys his class.
Exceptionnel teacher

This is a terrific course and Prof Harper really knows his stuff.  He adds lots of interesting interesting information about the history of math, well beyond what's in the text.  He comes off as intimidating at first but soon you realize he has a gruff style at times but is really very helpful and funny.  Take away:  math is incredible!

He mumbles a lot in class and his handwriting is near impossible to read. Luckily, the whole class is out of the book. The lectures themselves are near useless, though he is willing to explain things outside of class.
Overall the class isn't bad.  Harper looks, a kinda acts, like the old guy from back to the future.

Probability. The textbooks he uses are really terrible.  If you are taking a course with him, research the textbooks and pick anything but the one he lists.  He purposefully put a question on the exam stating that he expects no one to get it, but is curious.  And then there was no scale...Unclear explanations, and difficult homeworks.

Class gets kind of boring but he has a good sense of humor and occasionally has interesting comments.  Easy grader - assignments and tests are stress-free.  He's very approachable.  Expect to spend time reading the textbook, though.
If you have any questions he is really willing to explain. Sometimes the explanations are really long, but they are thorough!

Horrible professor, definately the worst I've had here. Unclear in class, mumbles a lot, and half the time you can't read what he's writting on the board.  He also has a tendency to randomly hit the board. Really confusing!! and horrible book too

I've had this dude for 2 classes. He is a  bit unclear at times and meanders but he is always willing to handle questions during class. The thing is that you have to speak up, or else he'll just continue on. doesn't do a lot to make the topic exciting, unless you're interested in it don't prepare to be entertained. Does have a good sense of humor

I never know what he is talking about in class, extremely unclear and confusing.  Never explains anything.  Only good quality is that he always lets you out of class early and homework is most of your grade.  Also, he confuses himself quite often with stupid mistakes when attempting to do "examples."

Professor Shanahan is one of the best professors I've had at the University of Rochester. He truly cares about his students, makes content engaging, and keeps assignments minimal. Tests align with class discussions, and his teaching made a 9 AM class enjoyable. I learned a lot and had a fantastic experience. Great teacher, great person!

Prof. Shanahan is a great professor. His lectures consist of a PowerPoint and 2-4 student case presentations. Class is mandatory & there are no recordings. Computers are not allowed so be prepared to always show up with a notebook or an iPad. He is EXTREMELY lenient in his grading but exams are no longer open notes. Material is dense but not hard.

he doesn't give out bad grades, if you get 60% or less on the midterm, its a b-. he tells alot of storys and tends to get off topic. lectures are not recorded and his tests are based off of the lectures. he says he uses the textbook but i never read it and i did good. he sometimes cold calls and there is a oral presentation
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Prof. Shanahan is one of the best professors at UR. His lectures are generally in the mornings and can get boring, but they're interesting overall. In LAW 250 they become a lot more intriguing since he has guest speakers. But for both classes, there's an easy presentation and tests are online open notes/open source.

Wonderful professor! He made a morning law class my favorite in the semester! Materials and classes are very interesting and the professor is well connected with industry leaders. There is essentially no homework beside one simple presentation. He doesn't allow the use of electronic devices in class, though. Exams are open notes, and aren't hard.

Great professor and great guy. His lectures are straight to the point, and the use of student cases helps to explain the concepts. The tests are open notes, and as long as you are paying attention in class, they are not difficult at all.

Professor Shanahan was one of the best professors at the U of R. He gives the best lectures. He shows you pictures of him and many celebrities and also tells you funny stories. He made business law so interesting. Tests are open-book and you can do it in your dorm or in the classroom. Definitely take his class! Highest recommendation!
One of the most engaging professor's at the UofR. Great guy, tests are on major material covered. Go to class and you should do fine.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Great lecturer who manages to make classes interesting, even when the content gets dull. Almost no coursework, and the exams are easy if you've made a decent cheat sheet.

he is an amazing professor. even for a student have no law experience in law i still made through this class. also, he is warm-hearted, he would help you a lot with anything you concern . and, past exams he posted is very helpful.

No electronic devices in class, but he's so good at lecturing you won't even want to use one since he's easily one of the funniest professors at the university. One easy assignment for a huge chunk of grade. Make a good cheat sheet and you'll breeze through the tests. Highly recommend the course and professor. Was one of my favorite classes at UofR
EXTREMELY BORING. Just study the notes he make and you don't really have to do the readings. Also, the homework answers are on the same notes sheet that he writes for class and posts on bb

This class was interesting.  Prof. Bennett could be boring in his presentation but he has a genuine enthusiasm for the material.  He was very helpful through e-mail and through comments on my papers.  He was tough and expects you to be cogent and sound. Though tough, he was fair.
Good professor.  Expects students to work hard but rewards those that do.

So. Boring.  Everything this professor said in class was straight from the textbook, there was never a point to listening to him. His lectures were incredibly boring, and the material itself didn't seem to have a purpose.
Going into this (history of ethics) class I didnt expect to think much.  I was right

Professor Bennett was a ridiculously hard grader, and if you do not agree with his views, you will be marked wrong.  His test questions were a matter of opinion, not fact.  He gave primarily C's and D's on the majority of students' papers.  I took this class for a cluster and it ruined my GPA.

Never went to class, all the notes were online and the answers to study questions were in the notes or book.  Tests were made of study questions.  However he was a very hard greater and one bad grade on a paper can kill you like me.

Very unhelpful. Seemed to have no interest in helping the students - sent them all to the TA first and said people could come to him only if they had to. Harsh grader and basically said that you were wrong if you didn't agree with him.
Intro to Ethics was really easy.  All the lectures were online and all the answers to the webwork and exams were in the notes or readings.
This was by far the worst class I have ever taken on this campus.  The prof. is boring, and grading is very unfair.  He is too specific on tests because he teaches in a very vague sense.
Whole class is powerpoint, I could've not gone to class and gotten a good grade just with the book.
Good teacher, easy teacher. What else needs to be said?

I agree that the friday presentations are completely unnecessary, but the rest of the class is great. read the book and understand the material and you'll do well on the tests and quizzes. i'm interning at a tv station now and i surprisingly have found that what i learned in this class is helping me in what i've been doing.
Such a sweetheart! She makes the effort to learn everyone's name. It's really good if you talk in class. Lectures are clear and tests are fair.

Very nice and intelligent teacher but her classes are too focused on the students' opinions, not hers. Introduction to Media Studies consisted mostly of student presentations. There are multiple extra assignments and a very unorganized syllabus. The subject was quite interesting but the way in which it was presented was unclear.

I was really excited about this class but she completely destroyed it. She did not teach anything, the entire class was student presentations, and attendance counts towards your grade even though there are over 100 people in the class. She is a very sweet lady but she taught the class in the worst way possible.

Terrible. Gives tons of useless assignments and class is entirely discussion (she barely taught anything at all). She is a nice person and the book was good but the class was terrible. Her tests are long and difficult as well.

great professor. extremely intelligent, knowledgable, enthusiastic and helpful. her chinese cinema class was one of the best i have taken. my only complaint is that she relied a bit too much on group discussion. i would have liked to have heard more of what she had to say.
Great professor overall. Discussion-based, broad. Pretty intensive reading  but it's worth it.

Extremely helpful, considerate & enthusiastic. Truly concerned about students & open to their needs & suggestions.  Always available to students & easy to talk to.  ENG 118 is pretty easy with minimal work.
Personally I think he is very good at teaching and he has a weird sense of humor and is funny and the class is pretty long but it will still be amusing.

Amazing professor, modifies the course constantly based on the students' feedback and makes it engaging. I've learned loads and became interested in philo. The lectures are discussion based and provide useful insight into the readings. 2 essays are challenging but you get the chance to rewrite them so getting a good grade is easy if you put work.

Prof. Sherman is great. Lectures can get a little bit dull over time but his killer sense of humor and bright personality save the day. Makes it very easy to do well if you put in a bit of effort. Very little hw and problem sets and reviews are almost exactly what you can expect to see on the tests. Very passionate about the material. Recommended!
Formal logic sounds like a dry subject, but Sherman is genuinely hilarious.

You don't really learn much in lectures. The workshops saved my grade. He posts practice tests that are extremely similar to what will be on the test. The textbook is online but as long as you do the practice problems at the end of each chapter then you're set.

His lectures can be sort of confusing, especially when he goes off on tangents. When he needs to be clear, he can be. Super nice, very approachable, incredibly helpful in office hours. Sentence logic is pretty easy, predicate logic is harder. Midterm and Final, both super easy if you study a bit. Graded Problem Sets are kind of tough and annoying.

This was my second class with him.  I dropped another class just to take this class because I like Sherman so much. One of the most approachable, hilarious, & genuinely kind professors I have ever had.  His lectures can get confusing, but if you go to his office hours, he will explain everything to you.  I highly recommend taking a class with him!

This was my second class with Sherman.  I love him!!!  Highly recommend.  Easy classes--but you will get a lot out of them.  Also, super helpful in office hours and VERY FLEXIBLE.  I wish I could take more classes with him!

He's the best, he knows his stuff, really tries and cares about his students, he is funny, a great lecturer and he's really fair.  I highly, highly, highly recommend him.  Really, there should not be a doubt, if you like the subject matter go for it.  Also he is very helpful, a really cool and super approachable guy, math oriented though.
He is the coolest teacher at rochester. You can get an A if you try.  This guy freaking rocks though.  Really a fun class and a great prof.

This professor seems to be too smart for an intro level class. I didn't have any background knowledge of calc and she assumed we all did. She does NOT let you get a tutor even if you need only badly and is a very hard grader. Not flexible for struggling students. I feel stupid every time I leave her class. Don't recommend her. 0/5
SHE DOESNT CARE ABOUT HER STUDENTS. DOES NOT EMPATHIZE WELL. DOESNT TEACH YOU HOW TO DO IT. HOMEWORK TOO HARD.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Tamar was tough at first but once I started to go see her and get her help out side of class she became very helpful and very invested in my learning. I would recommend to anyone who is willing to grind and work hard. She will make you stare at a problem until you get it, but sometimes that's what you need.
Professor Friedmann is very clear and her explanations are very helpful. She is really enthusiastic while lecturing and makes me really appreciate math!

Horrible professor. Has little to no ability to empathize with students or see things from their perspective. She teaches the class like it's a refresher course. If I could go up to her face and tell her just how awful she is, I would do it in a heartbeat.
very talented, very clear, smart, organized, great teacher
She is really helpful and is willing to help you whenever you need it! She overall cares a lot about her students and offers a generous curve for exams.
Lovely Tamar!!!!!!
The best professor ever! I love her in any single aspect!!! Lovely lady and friendly and helpful professor too. Let alone she's very smart!

If you go to most classes, about 9/10, and actually do the webworks then the tests are pretty easy. She is a pretty good teacher but i have tried to ask her questions after class and i came away more confused then when i started. Can be sassy but all in all fine teacher

Easy because nicely graded but the lectures are awful, just read the textbook. Never answered any of my emails, despite saying she's accessible outside of class and willing to meet the needs of students. Also test questions are poorly written and often have many mistakes or missing info. Was excited for solids but not anymore because of professor.
Nice to answer questions and provide help. The grading is very nice.

She gives incredibly hard homework and her lectures are not very well organized. The textbook is the saving grace of this course because without it you're done. TA's are helpful for the most part, but OH can be crowded as they are really the only time you can learn the content. Tough times in ME 226. Take it with the other Prof. if possible.

One of the worst teachers I've experienced in my entire life; her lectures cover tons of material yet seem all over the place. She consistently gets things wrong on the board, is hard to understand, and has 0 relationship with the class. If you read the textbook it is WAY more helpful which is embarrassing considering how expensive this school is.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Lots of homework

comment: Does not answer emails or provide assistance, very unaccommodating. Will make many many mistakes on the board when doing lectures but is not lenient with others' mistakes. Does not give any real test prep.
her lectures were useless -- if you read the textbook and go to recitation you'll be fine. there is a huge curve on exams too
She is great in explaining materials. She really cares about her students. Highly recommend her.
Very dry lectures with LOTS of mistakes, homework and most textbook problems don't prepare you for the tests, and long homeworks.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Though she makes mistakes on the board, it does not take away from learning the concept. She really cares about the students. You can argue for extra points after receiving your test.

Her lectures are okay but she's really bad at math. Every time she does math in lecture there are lots of mistakes. She talks really quietly but is really nice, accessible, and good at explaining topics clearly outside of class.
He is a nice person but the class is difficult and the grading is not clear
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Very approachable and a nice professor. Explain things in an elegant and concise manner. Would take again.

The course is difficult, the readings are not easy to understand. But prof weslake is a very nice person, very friendly and approachable. The workload also is okay.Come to his office hours if you have any questions, communicate more and you should be fine
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: Very strict grading, unclear grading criteria.
Took his Global perspective on society at NYU Shanghai. Prof. Weslake is nice and approachable. The ideas in his lecture are thought-provoking, but are not that easy to understand.

I have taken a LOT of philosophy classes and Brad is probably the best professor I've had in any of them. He's young enough to really relate to college students, and he's smart enough that he always understands and can always explain complex ideas. He does assign a lot of reading, but hey, that's how he got so smart.
awesome proff!! reason why I am a Philosophy major!
No Comments

Very clear about the material, very helpful, nice, and approachable. Goes through the material at a pretty slow pace, but not too slow. Does a good job handling the obnoxious kids who raise their hands without thinking. Very approachable and friendly. Possibly the nicest guy I know.
Philosophy is definitely one of the worst classes I've ever taken.  Brad, on the other hand, is INCREDIBLY SEXY.  That Austrilian accent, oh yes! Lecture me baby, lecture me!
I absolutely love Pam. I've had her for ASL101 and ASL102 and she is easily my favorite professor I have had here. She's a sweetheart and she really cares about her students.
I absolutely loved her, shes so sweet

Such a wonderful person! She tries her best to make class really interesting and doesn't make you feel stupid if you forget a sign. She has a great sense of humor and wants you to do well in the class, which isn't hard as long as you show up.

Pam is amazing-- super encouraging and helpful! I took ASL just to try for fun, but thanks to her passion and great teaching I became very interested in the subject and want to continue. Really recommend taking her!

She is an amazing ASL professor. Makes the language fun and interesting for students. Very funny and helps all students to make sure they can follow. Her teaching is somewhat reliant on the textbook but makes it her own. Really cares about her students and is making the language easier to pick up than I imagined. Really great person and professor!
Pam really got me interested in deaf culture. She made learning ASL fun and easy. She's an incredible professor. Don't pass up on taking a course with her!! Truly an INCREDIBLE experience.

Pam is super sweet and doesn't make  you do all the repetitive activities like some teachers. She answers any questions you may have and is fine if you "talk" in class just because she likes to see people practicing and helping each other. Scheduling isn't her forte so you'll have to remind her to give you rubrics and such but overall she's great!
She is probably the sweetest teacher you'll ever have. She is very nice, and very patient. She is, by far, the best teacher to have for ASL 101.

Pam is one of the greatest teachers ever! I have not only learned so much, but I have retained the information. She solidified my minor in ASL. She is 100% approachable, and wants to help students learn ASL and about Deaf Culture. Our ASL department is great!
best teacher i've ever had. love love love love love her

Dr. Hannum was a good writing professor, but seemed to have a little too high expectations for students. Given that this class is required for all students, most shouldn't have to struggle to get a B. He gave good feedback on essays, but often even if you did everything he mentioned you wouldn't receive a high grade.

Professor Hannum is a tough grader, but you truly get a lot out of this class. He gives helpful feedback and offers many assignments that can help boost your grade. Be prepared to really work on your essays because it is almost impossible to get an A. If you truly want to learn how to write, I recommend 100%. I would def take it again!

Professor Hannum is a strict/tough grader however he has assisted profoundly in my critical thinking and writing skills. His comments are detailed, along with peer review you learn more and have a plethora of opportunities to strengthen your paper.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: While Professor Hannum was amusing and the class was very engaging, he does expect students to complete A TON of assignments. This is an introductory writing course and should be educational but not impossible to excel in. So while you may be interested in the title of the course, beware that this may not be the class you want to take for writing.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Doesn't give proper grading criteria, but still grades very harshly. Class material itself was interesting and wasn't super hard, but the professor is strict and unapproachable.

Has a harsh grading style and criteria is impossible to meet, he is too strict on academic dishonesty and takes it way more seriously than any other writing professor, I do not like his grading style because he will take points off for every little thing, feedback is good but critical, he is a nice funny guy but I found this class very stressful

For an introductory and mandatory writing class, I felt like he graded a little harshly and a lot was expected from the students. If you have time to put in extra work and to work with him, this shouldn't be a problem. If you don't like writing, I'd be a bit more weary about taking this professor.

Dustin's class is highly organized and planned out. The assignments are very clear and straight-forward. He always grades in a timely manner and gives plenty of feedback on nearly every assignment. He's always willing to answer questions and help you if you need it. The atmosphere is comfortable and inclusive.

Amazing Professor who improved my critical thinking and writing skills tremendously. He is flexible and will work with you on due dates. He values quality of work, effort, and class attendance. He expects a lot out of you and if you buy in and apply yourself you will not regret it. Short shorts. Tribe called Quest. Avid Bicyclist. Beautiful & Bald.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Great professor and great class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: He speaks English pretty well, but not great. Some words he says are hard to understand. He does not really engage in the class much. He just writes the notes on the board and explains what he is doing. For example, if you have a question and simply raise your hand, he will not see you because he doesn't turn around. He's okay, not terrible.

He is the best math teacher I have had so far. I think it was helpful that this was a quest course because his english wasn't perfect but because of the small class it wasn't a problem. I learned more in his one class than I did in all of the other 160's put together. definately recommend taking one of his classes.
I am a poli sci major. I hate math. However, I got an A in both 141 and 143..because of him--no doubt. I struggled in 142.. the one class i took without him. He's amazing and very helpful.
kijung lee is a listener of music and a nice guy
His english is a big barrier to the quality of his teaching especially with such a confusing subject.  Very nice and helpful and very interested in his students performance.  Tough final.
he is so good, i hope to get him again in years to come and i will still keep lookin for him for help. Awesome guy
he is so good, i hope to get him again in years to come and i will still keep lookin for him for help. Awesome guy
This professor is the shizzle.  I wish all professors were like that.  He really cares that you learn.
PROBABLY THE BEST MATH TEACHER I EVER HAD! Hate math with a passion. But he made it possible for me to get As on both midterms. Excellent professor. Highly reccommended.

This professor is not very responsible. She usually posts review question & solutions or homework solutions like only 2 days ahead of the midterm day. I am not very sure what other students feel, but for me it's very overwhelmed. Imagine when you looked at some weird review questions and there were only 2 days left.
If you did the homeworks, the midterm will not be any trouble. Im not trying to trick you *Class average is a 50% on the midterm...
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Her tests are almost not related to what she taught. Read the textbooks! Dont trust her slides.

Her lecture slides are very vague and given the material is quite dry and difficult to comprehend, it's hard to follow her lecture. Once you're lost in lecture, you ain't finding your way back. Go to TA office hours for help! And read the textbook. It's much more detailed than her slides. Study hard. Not an easy class!
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Write out the definition of Competition Equilibrium. That worth 10 points on the midterm
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Lu's first time teaching ECO 209. Nice, a little quiet, and approachable in office hours. It's important to go to class lectures,  the recitation when offered by the TA, and to read the textbook. That's the only way to really understand the material, since it is very dry. The homework can be challenging, so go to office hours for help if needed.
Her class goes really quick. GO TO HER OFFICE HOURS!
The exams were a little bit challenging, but I found them to be reasonable, and it covered essential materials.

Worst Econ class I've taken. No textbook. Doesn't explain things during lecture. Isn't clear about what we need to know or don't need to know for tests. Puts way too much material in each class and assumes from her barebones lectures outlines she puts up online prior that we have a complete understanding.
The professor gives great lectures but is unusually strict about a few things that aren't in the syllabus.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: He should not be teaching courses. He didn't seem to care much about students or actually coming to class. The course was not on a hard topic but his lack of teaching made it difficult to grasp the concepts and he blamed the students for not understanding. He is extremely strict on deadlines and despite missing a quarter of classes gives no leeway.

I wouldn't say Criswell is a lazy person, but he definitely is a lazy professor. Lazy with returning work to students, responding to emails in a reasonable amount of time, and posting lecture material. But he'll make a big stink if you walk in two minutes late because it's a "reflection of your character". Kinda insufferable and the work is hard.

Slow grader, slow responses to emails (will not respond to emails sometimes), and does not upload lecture materials. Programming project writeups are confusing and the tools you have to use for them are difficult to work with. Can be condescending and full of himself at times. Would've gotten more out of an online course if I'm being honest.
This class was incredibly well-taught, I almost forgot I took this class!

Professor Criswell's CSC252 is an exemplary showcase on teaching with passion. His lectures are filled with fun moments and performance arts, alone with energy that can only be found in hospitals. The lecture is very informative and usually require a whole page of post-it note for every lecture to fit in all the information taught.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: This course by professor criswell was an amazing example of why all CS researchers aren't fitted to teach. In this inspirational course, I have accumulated knowledge that can be distilled onto a single 8x11 standard printing paper. His lectures have never failed me, if sleeping in his class was my goal.

Took CSC 252; this is one of the best professors I've met. He has clear grading criteria and words he uses are exquisitely labyrinth; the quizzes are well phrased and weighted reasonably where one question on the quiz is only worth single digits of your total grade. He gives timely feedback; homework is graded usually within 5 to 7 business weeks.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: I was in Prof. Criswell's class for both CSC278 and CSC256(not currently available in the course selection field). Prof. Criswell is one of the best I have had the pleasure of learning from. His lectures are great. He explains all the concepts in a way that is fun and very easy to understand. Plus, he is always willing to provide guidance.

Prof. Criswell is condescending and disrespectful. He doesn't have the students best interest in mind and frequently brags about how he gets to do things (like be forgetful, not respond to your emails, not show up for office hours) because he is a "professor". You need ask the TAs for coding question (he doesn't know much about Linux internals).
Grades late, not receptive to feedback. Doesn't post lecture slides. Course is uninteresting.
Prof Lee is super nice and really easy to approach. Gives homework but it is really easy to do and it is mainly for participation points.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: Really fair introduction to college writing. Not a hard class if you already have writing skills, and feedback is really good.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Her lectures are well organized and the class material is straight-forward and relatively easy. She responds quickly to emails and provides good feedback on submitted work. Do not save your additional activities until the last minute! It will be difficult to squeeze them in all at once.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Her lectures are really interesting. You can see her passion every day. She provides really good feedback, but she uses contract grading so getting a B is easy but getting an A takes effort. All the homework and assignments are mandated by the writing curriculum so its not on her.
She was excited about the topics and did well leading class discussions.  I learned a lot.
Rachel is a great teacher! Approachable and funny! I think she has taken into account how much progress and efforts you have made when she graded papers.
LOTS OF HOMEWORK!!!

What I didn't like about Rachel was that she did not take effort or attendance into consideration when evaluating student work. The grading was arbitrary...don't try to do anything insightful or creative. Lectures were boring and she gave mostly busy work. Rachel is okay but there are better CAS teachers.

DO NOT take Rachel Lee's class. Although she is very passionate, she's useless to students. Her grading is a huge gray area and her lectures are vague. She gives mostly busy work and it's hard to figure out what exactly she wants. I didn't really learn anything. Can be condescending.
Overall super nice professor!

This Professor is selfish. In my class, he moved us from a classroom that fit everyone comfortably to one where 6 students don't have desks all because he preferred the room be right next to his office. He also references his own fieldwork nearly every class. Apart from that he is very available which is great if you have questions on the material.

try to attend all lectures, take notes, and you will be fine. missing a couple of classes won't kill you, just make sure you know the topics you missed. Foster is very willing to help outside of class and if you put in the basic work, it should be an easy A.
Foster teaches good topics.  However, he is an **** if you have a question.  He is also a jerk to foreign/international students.
This guy is mind-numbingly smart.
Great teacher, very helpful, makes everything interesting, very understanding. Awesome. Simply awesome.
Foster is incredibly smart.  Is effective and interesting in both seminar and lecture classrooms.  Sometimes I am intimidated.  He is really quite nice, though.
No Comments
Awesome profesor. I thought this class was going to be lame but he made it so interesting. He is extremely nice and helpful and fun. His lectures are interesting. One of the best professors I've had.
This class is run by the Graduate TA's. Not helpful or valuable in any way.
He is amazing. AMAZING
Such a great professor!
really great professor
good teacher

His class is very boring and he talks a lot about his personal life case instead of talking about the practice questions. Since the attendance is not mandatory, lots of student do not show up in class because his class is not helpful.

Greg is actually pretty cool, no mandatory attendance, but I recommend going to class. There's a tiny bit of math, but master it and you'll do well on the exams. He drops your lowest midterm (there are three) also a good class to take the W section, you only write one 10 page paper, topic of your choice.

He thinks that what he's teaching is really important and he tries to teach you about life through his class. If you pay attention and do all the work it's good. He doesn't believe in problem sets, so there are 4 midterms.

He is very vague when it comes to his lectures, and does not offer much help outside of class. The coursework revolves around the book, (which is horribly written and has many errors) and he barely covers any of it, so a lot of reading outside of class is necessary to succeed. He's also very strict when it comes to grading homework and tests.

The lectures and homework were fine, the exams were ridiculous. The homework was far easier than the exams, and thus did an awful job of preparing me for them. I failed the final after spending the last week reviewing the lecture material. Also, on short notice he gave a course eval incentive, then released the final grades prior to the deadline.

I have never had a more compassionate and passionate math professor. Belmirio is a stand-up gentleman and cares about the success of his students and the application of calculus to the outside world. Homework isn't overbearing and workshops allow you to apply knowledge in a mini-test format.

technically didn't have him but we had access to recordings of all math 141 professors. he's extremely helpful and his reviews prior to midterms or for webwork help literally saved me I appreciate him so much. only started watching his lectures towards the end, very sad I didn't earlier because they definitely would've helped me do better on exams

Prof. Galo is the man! I listened to the lectures from the other Calc professors to see which professor was the clearest teacher and they weren't even close to on par with him. He responds to emails really quickly and is always ready to help with the webwork. He really wants his students to understand the concepts, and really wants them to succeed.

Professor Galo is a great professor in that he actually works to help you succeed in the class and not only in getting a good grade, which is nice but also in helping you to truly understand the course material. Office hours are extremely helpful. His lectures are also very funny and he gives a lot of example problems that help a lot with webwork.

Professor Galo is a reason why this course was enjoyable to study. He tries to mix humor with his math content and is always open for participation from all students. He was always available to help me after class to provide any feedback. His helpful mentality and clarity in teaching made it easier to adjust to this class.

He is really a great professor. He is respectful, inspirational, and caring. He cares about students' understanding of the course material and their comfortability with math despite their background in math. He uses simple and relevant examples that make students easily understand the course material and concept taught in class.
Belmiro is very enthusiastic and holds workshops, recitations and office hours to help students struggling in Math.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Spends a huge amount of time helping students. Enthusiastic, funny, beautiful, smart, dedicated, exams are easy but always 1 or 2 hard problems. Actually, his accent is his only problem.
His lectures are pointless. A lot of unnecssary rambling. He's not very engaging and his study guides need to be structured better. Took 102 with him and he made me lose all interest in philosophy.
if you engage and listen in class you will do amazing. Professor actually wants you to care and learn about political philosophy. come with an open mind and you will be rewarded
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor Carrick was great. The class in itself was not the most compelling, but he could get the point across whilst entertaining the students. He is very funny and he seems to truly care. The reading is not awful. A class I could look forward to going to. Comments on papers can seem harsh, but they are very helpful. Remember: Tom Brady=Goat
I really enjoyed this class!

Professor Carrick did a poor job teaching PHIL 102. He would essentially contradict students or try to prove them wrong in class discussion. His essay comments were unhelpful and unkind, and he graded them very harshly. He tends to ramble a lot in his lectures and uses a lot of unnecessary big words. Worth the time but with a different prof.

It seems like what I am seeing from other ratings, he seemed like a good professor at U of R. I am at Geneseo and this class is one of my hardest. It's not so much the in class lectures that is hard to understand, but the papers I have no idea what he is looking for. There is no rubric and his comments on the essays are really hard to understand.

Prof. Carrick is one of my favorite professors. I decided to take his class after I read an interview with him where he mentions that he sings songs to his cats. If it's not enough for you, he is also a former football player in Manchester United. Such a versatile personality! I see him sometimes on campus playing with his ball! He still got this!
Dont think this man knows what hes looking for. Has no rubrics, asks you to include certain things in your papers but then grades against you for using those same things. A very poor teaching style
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: I recommend it! It's a very straightforward class and if you do your assignments and pay attention it's an easy A. I took the summer course so the workload might be different, but I found it manageable though there was a lot of reading- but if you skim for main ideas he'll go into more detail during lecture.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Very nice guy, but the class is dull beyond belief. All of the assignments are take-home essays, so going to lecture is only useful to get lecture notes (but most of the information can be found in your books). You don't really have to do most of the reading either. You'll forget you're taking this class sometimes.
Not much interaction but very nice. Easy grader.
Class is very boring but, there are no in class tests all papers.  There is a lot of reading but, you don't actually have to do most of it.  He is an easy grader.

An extremely unfair grader for a 100-level class. Admitted to me that he has become "cranky" with his old age and that his knee problems impacted his grading. I typically do well on papers, and I put a lot of effort into his class, what a waste of time. Take something else.
lots of reading but a great prof to take a class with. very knowledgable and his classes are like story time with lots of disscusion.
This professor is terribly paranoid about student plagerism--but he is NOT upfront about it.  For the innocent student, it is unnerving and very insulting.
No Comments
Great prof! Extremely knowledgeable and interesting
Easy class.  He's interesting, and doesn't grade hard.  Take classes with him if you're interested in Asian History.  You'll do well.

(With regard to his 208W course in Spring 2012) Prof. Niemi is extremely patient and really wants his students to learn. He taught me so much about doing research in that one course. He is also one of the most approachable professors I've ever known. I am grateful beyond words for all the help he has offered.

He is a sweet guy but rather unapproachable and awkward. He is a stickler for grammar which can be really annoying if you have to write papers for him. If it was not required I would never take another class with him again. Also he is very vague in his lectures and what is actually useful for the exams

If you are an IR or PSC major, you should really take a class with him. He is very informative and explains examples very well. If you dont like the topic he teaches, sure you will probably hate the class. He is by far the best professor I have had at UR. Best class was Junior Honors. He makes sure you will get a good grade too if you put in effort
Much more work in this class than you word expect for an elective political science course, prepare to do a lot of writing (even if you're not taking it as a writing course). Otherwise interesting.
SO BAD!  he is full of himself and boring to listen to.  I would never take a class with him if its not required

My course was taught by both Niemi and Linda Powell.  This was the funniest ****ing class I've ever had.  Dick is hilarious (in that old style grandfather way).  His relationship with Linda was also highly comedic.  The  class was somewhat boring, but very useful (for poly sci majors).  The TAs were really good and able to teach the class.
the best poli sci prof at the place.  I LEARNED SO MUCH, more than i expected to.
probably the best professor i've ever had.  a lot of fun, makes class interesting.  always available for questions.
great guy, very knowledgeable but nice, not stuffy or arrogant, great with discussions, even when working with boring material,

The lectures were incredibly unstructured and we were about a month behind by the end of the semester. He gives little guidance for the group project and he is very ambiguous. It's easy enough to pass by just doing a good final project and repeating his ideas in the papers and tests.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: He is very subjective and his lectures arent useful or applicable. His prompts for the assignments arent clear and wont help you with the exams. The group project is good in theory but poor in execution. Hope does not provide great instructions for the project and when you ask for help be prepared for him to go off topic.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Most of his lectures were boring and filled with buzzwords rather than actually useful content. His expectations for assignments were very unclear which made it difficult to understand what he wanted from each assignment. He is a subjective grader and your success in this class likely will depend on whether or not he likes the way that you write.

Professor Hope is an absolute gem of a person. It is clear that he has vast expertise in his field, and he uses his experiences to supplement the lecture material. The group project is a significant amount of work, but it can be enjoyable with the right time management.
He is a very tough grade. He expects a lot from you but he doesn't tell you what to do. unclear grading criteria. His lectures are so boring as well. I wouldn't recommend taking him.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Vague grading criteria. You can't really have a control of your own grades even you've worked hard for the whole semester. He gives you a grade solely based on his current mood. Wordings for exams and homework are also vague. Can't learn real stuff from the course.
Amazing professor, has relevant work experience and brings that to his class. Super helpful and knowledgeable in his field, great class overall! :)
A great professor who really wants his students to learn the material. Really knows what he's talking about.
very good professor. Very intelligent man and knows what he is talking about. Very clear and straight to the point when it comes to things. very sweet and caring :-)
Great class. Assignments have clear criteria and were helpful for understanding the material lectured on. Professor Meconi is very knowledgable about her subject and an interesting lecturer.
There are a good amount of assigned essays, but not too many. Quizzes are pure memorization. Very nice and helpful professor who is passionate about the subject and good at teaching.
As long as you put in the work, you are u are guaranteed a good grade. No previous music experience is necessary but it might help to have one
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--So many papers

comment: She is really caring and patient. She will give clear material about the test. Although we need to write several assignments, her grading is not heavy. As long as you have a good attitude to write you can get a good grade on those papers.

Prof. Meconi is one of the finest professors I have ever had. Her class is definitely challenging, and it will not be an easy A. However, her exams are very straightforward, and she teaches the material so well and makes lecture so interesting and engaging. She clearly cares about her students and her teaching. 10/10 professor

An amazing scholar and mentor! Prof Meconi really makes me fall in love with music history. She cares about her students. Very approachable! Do talk to her if you have any questions or concerns - she is one of the most responsive professors I have ever known.
Greatest Professor ever! So caring and inspirational! Lots of work but she makes the lectures so interesting!
The class was hard, but Professor Honey is helpful. Be sure to communicate with Professor Honey much, and I would say you will have a grade that you expected.
Great professor and great lecture. Be aware of the quizzes and homework, they are good practice for the tests.
No Comments
Amazing lectures! really brilliant. She could make me interested in anything.

Super nice professor!! As long as you put in effort to learning chinese, you will get a good grade even if you mess up on the assignments and quizzes. She is also really nice and accessible outside of class.

Prof. Pian is super nice and lenient. She understands that learning new languages is hard and is willing to help you outside of class. CHIN 202 has a decent amount of homework and required readings as well, but they're not hard although it is long. Overall great class, do your homework and show up and you'll do well.

Prof Pian is great! CHIN 151 is a lot of work, the homework from the workbook and studying for vocab quizzes took a lot of time more than being difficult, but I still learned so much and my Chinese definitely improved because of the class. The unit tests are relatively easy and the final is optional if you have an A.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: She really cares about her subject and her students, and she holds you to high standards while still trusting that you want to succeed. You can expect a LOT of homework, but it's not busywork; everything has a purpose. If there's something you don't understand, she's very open to meeting to discuss what you're missing.

I took this class Fall 2020 and Professor Pian is so, so kind and cares a lot about her students. She's very patient and cares that her students are learning above all else; she does her best to clarify confusions and is very flexible with how students are learning, especially with the online component. 10/10 professor!

I've had Professor Pian for 5 semesters. The curriculum is insanely difficult, with a ton of reading, memorization, and tests, but she's an easy grader, or maybe she grades on effort? I know that I was not great at the class but she was always encouraging and I always got a good grade in the end. She is also super understanding of personal stuff.
Super nice, does not really hold student accountable on deadlines.

She really is a fantastic teacher, the class is difficult and requires a lot of work but Professor Pian makes its interesting and worthwhile. Only sign-up if you're willing to put in a lot of work, but if you put in the work then you can do well in the class.
Professor Pian is an outstanding teacher. If you want to take Chinese, take it with her. The class is very difficult, it's 5 days a week, but she makes it interesting and is always willing to help.

Aaron is fantastic. My time in his class has only deepened my interest in the topics we discussed. He's always ready to accommodate and treats his students as equals, not condescending in the least bit. Sometimes it really feels like we're his colleagues not just his students, in the best way haha. Thanks for a great semester!

By far the best professor at UR.  He is so caring, understanding, and happy, and truly wishes to see students succeed.  Having a difficult week and need an extension on an assignment?  He'll tell you to take as much time as you need.  Not understanding something?  He'll explain it in such an exciting way.  Dude is awesome, 10/10.

Professor Hughes has not only been my favorite professor at UR, but has also had the biggest impact on my education and career path. I've never had a professor who genuinely loves his students and wants to learn from them. if you have any interest in religion I highly recommend any of his classes. He is full of so much wisdom and knowledge !

The class was very difficult because it's a 6-credit class, but Aaron is an easy grader and a really considerate professor. He can be quite cynical and sharp, but he is also very passionate about his students and what he's teaching. I learned a lot from him, although I wouldn't recommend him if you're sensitive about religion.

The guy who gives me the only A in my last semester at Rochester. I feel that he gives me the hope to live on. What an awesome guy! I wish that every instructor could be like him! There were only two papers and his aim was always to let the students enjoy writing them! God bless you!
Best Professor ever. His material is dense and classes are more of open discussions. Very lenient on grades and also go to class or you will fail. Very well regarded and also down to earth professor.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: interesting and very fair

Class discussion tended toward the boring side. The secondary source readings were awfully boring, too, and extensive (though primary sources were good). There were only 3 assignments, and they were not hard. I would be willing to take another class with him, but preferably a lecture-based class, rather than another seminar-style class.
He is a really great professor. Attending class is optional, but I feel like I learn a lot when I go to class. He posts the notes on Blackboard as well. Just an all around interesting professor.

LOTS of reading, but class was never boring. Professor Rozenski is an engaging and interesting professor who is incredibly knowledgeable about classical + scriptural literature, as well as music, medieval Europe, baking, Internet culture, and more. Quizzes and responses are easy to do well on, and everything's graded very leniently.

Very passionate and has great suits, and overall a super nice guy. I can't say I found old english particularly riveting, but he made me want to come to class and participate, plus there were plenty of extra credit opportunities despite the quizzes being difficult!

this guy made my whole year so much better. i always looked forward to going to this class and honestly it gave me the will to start trying again in school. smart, interesting, kind, hilarious. makes everything interesting. the course material was fascinating and he made everything so exciting and engaging!! my favorite class i have  taken here.

Prof. Rozenski is by far my favorite professor I've had thus far. Super smart guy who knows his stuff, but makes every class really fun and engaging. Lots of reading, but totally worth it to get to talk about it in class. Manages to make tests fun. He's also great with communication outside of class via email if extenuating circumstances come up.

From a STEM major with clustering in classic literature, Rozenski is awesome. He's extraordinarily knowledgeable and receptive to literally any opinion on any topic related to the readings at hand and willing to discuss it seriously. I learned a lot about literary criticism and left the course feeling like I gained something I didn't have before.

Although he's a funny and overall nice person, Prof. Rozenski is not a good professor. I didn't learn anything in his class, and when it came time to write the midterm and final papers, I really struggled. Be prepared to read A TON! We read 100+ pages for each class and 1800 lines of Middle English. Essays are HARD. Class has no structure at all.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Good lectures, easy to pass. Make sure to participate and show up in class, because he grades a lot based off of that.
Adorable. What a great guy.

Wonderful professor and human being--we had to read the frickin BIBLE and he made it entertaining. You can do traditional response papers or creative responses which is always fun. You do have to read a lot, but he does a good job prepping you for the quizzes with study guides. Oh, and he's adorable.

Rozenski is amazing. He's the funniest professor I've ever had, and he genuinely cares about the success of his students. He is also creative and flexible with the lectures and assignments and does his best to make sure that everything is clear and fair. 12/10

Yes, this is a very challenging class, but I genuinely learned a lot about metrics and can understand the methodology/math in Econ papers. If you want to do Econ research/grad school, take it with him. If you just want the A/credit, take it with the other professor. Difficult homeworks, but graded really nicely. Exams are also curved generously.

only speaking for 231W, if you are not solid in stats, don't take his 231, it's very painful to catch up with stats and proofs.If you skip lectures, it's hard to succeed in his class. Homework are hard but grade leniently. The exams are kind of hard, but curved very generously, and don't worry too much if you perform poorly on the midterm.
Don't take this course if your knowledge background for statistics is weak, or you will struggle a lot!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Super boring class. He reads off the slides, and rarely ever talks about real world examples. Luckily he uploads the (very detailed) slides. The homework is pretty hard but is graded leniently. The exams are also generously curved.
Generous curve, the exams really aren't bad if you study the hw assignments and recitation problems.
board work is not organized and has sloppy handwriting. great personality, grading is pretty easy in terms of the curve.
sloppy board work, thick accent, and little commitment to the class. he's not completely unapproachable outside of class. after taking this class, I have lost all interest in being an econ major.
No Comments

Good professor, teaches straight out of the book but does a good job explaining concepts.  Don't be afraid to interrupt him if he is going too fast.  The curve in this class is very generous so don't worry too much about your grade as long as you are keeping up with the material.
He could be a decent teacher. but pretentious and self centered sometimes. Class was VERY BORING. TOUGH GRADER. Unless you are totally into what he teaches and LOVE writing, DON'T take his class.

Mr. Chandler is a good guy. He's very helpful if you ask and often emails what the homework is if he assigns it during class. The class isn't the most interesting subject and he is a fairly tough grader, but it is not impossible to do well. You get out what you put in, and he's willing to help you out.

Idk why the ratings r so bad 4 him b/c I found him to be very helpful, friendly, & engaging. He gives great feedback on essays & provided u take the time to go to his office hours w/ ur rough drafts or even email urs to him, he will give u plenty of advice. I think it was fairly easy to pull of a decent grade as long as u do the work.
bad

John Chandler is very potentially the worst teacher I had my freshmen year.  He was extraordinarily disrespectful to me and constantly attacked me during class for simply stating my opinion.  He is obsessed with his fairy tales and is honestly a little kid who just never grew up.  Do not take his class unless you have an interest in faerie tales.
comics...woo...

People say he is bad guy. But really he is nota  bad guy. Chandler is really very helpful and knows alot about what want to learn. Always wants to help with ofifce houcrs. But really class peers fall asleep and do not try to learn what they want to learn.
Major headcase and quite pretentious. Do not take this class!! Difficult grader and very very boring.
Difficult grader, randomly walks into classroom objects, class moved slowly, he brought food the last day

Easily one of, if not the best studio art teacher at UofR. While his style of teaching is anything but ordinary, and he can come off cold and uninterested. If you take the time to converse and actually talk to him, he is a wealth of knowledge, well thought out critiques, advice, and jokes. Literal textbook zany art professor.

His drawing classes do not teach you how to draw. Want to learn and improve your technique? Nope, not at this school. But they're pretty valuable in that they teach you how to think creatively and critically about art-making. He gives you a prompt and you have a lot of liberty as to how you work with it. Note: he's demanding. doesnt seem so at 1st
I absolutely loved this class.  This professor.  Easy.  I suggest you take this class.  He is funny, and has a great sense of humor.  HOT
Best professor ever. Seriously. The kind that changes your life.

I would get into trouble if I wrote what I really thought of this man. But art is his life, he takes it very seriously. That's respectable. But I don't respect much else. Short temper, hard to work with.
Very friendly. Low stress course.  Definatley improved my drawing skills. Great as a first studio art class.
great professor, easy to talk to, relaxed, funny and helpful.
amazing, amazing man. my hero.
He encourages creativity and is fairly personable. He doesn't teach you much HOW to draw however and he's scatter-brained and disorganized.
The professor is rude. Has absurd rules in class and is full of himself.

Really knowledgeable and updated with the latest developments. Course is intensive and the Verilog Projects are difficult, but really helps to understand the low level details of designing a modern processor. Really learnt a lot and easy to get A if one can do all the projects (including bonus parts) :)
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Great thanks
Extremely knowledgeable. He is a good lecturer and works through many examples on the board. If you attend class and pay attention, you will learn a lot.    Tests are tough, but he curves.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I honestly have no idea what the grading scheme is. This has been the hardest class I have ever taken.  The curve was at least 30 points (i.e if you had a C you get a A). He's a guy that knows his stuff and he seems like a good person but hes not a great professor.  My grade was a F and was curved to a C-. Mind you I worked HARD for an F.
Avoid at all costs or enjoy your suffering. 10 mins quiz is worth 25% grade. Good luck.
the grading criteria is amazing.

He insists on using a programming language that isn't used by any other CS professor or grad student, leaving me resource-less and frustrated on every assignment. His TAs have to post the grading scheme and office hours because he doesn't remember to do it himself. Assignments are completely unrelated to lectures or the textbook. Avoid at all costs
The worst professor ever! an alive example of delusion.

One of the most valuable classes I've taken in college. I always struggle with public speaking, but now they are not challenging for me at all. Lectures are more like workshops, and the professor is like a coach who pushes you more. Like others said, he sticks HEAVILY to rubrics, but as long as you do what he wants and put in work then you're good.
He's a very nice guy. Solid class which is useful for life.
This class is not an easy A but would recommend taking it if you want to get better at public speaking, definitely got so much better. Vamos!
He's tuff!
Professor went above and beyond to help this semester which he didn't have to do. and Showed much grace to when I had to bury to family within two weeks. I am thankful truly

Prof. Marsherall is a diligent professor; he gives feedback and suggestions to every student. However, he is very strict with the rubrics, so you'd better follow all his steps and not add additional thoughts. To be honest, sometimes I feel really frustrated in this course because of those limitations.

Dr Drew is a genuinely nice person. He will go to extra lengths to help you out provided that you want to improve. He really cares about teaching and his students. His grading is not lenient; however, he does provide clear grading rubrics for each assignment so us students can know what we are being graded on. Do take this class if you have time!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: I dont recommend you guys to take Prof. Drews communication course, well, if you have a chance to skip it. First, workload is heavy. Frankly, some of those help you to construct your points, but the others are repetitive work with no specific meaning. Second, grading criteria is stiff and the way he communicates is hidebound.

Drew will always go out of his way to help ya out. In addition to making me introspect on my public speaking abilities a lot more than I ever would have, he provided the explicit tools in order to bolster my own strengths and to identify and patch my weaknesses. I would highly recommend this class to anyone who has a desire to better their speaking
I can tell she's trying compared to two years ago. But I mean, she's okay.
pretty approachable outside class

It was pretty easy to complete the labs. The lab lectures were boring but if you have to miss some of it, it is ok because it is recorded. Also, she goes over how to solve the problems for the pre-lab during lab lecture.

I personally never went to the lab lectures because they were recorded. I would just watch the lab lecture to help me complete the pre-lab assignment. All of the labs were pretty easy, and some were actually fun. It is a very easy way to boost your great in BME 101.

The lectures were boring but they were never mandatory to attend especially since they were recorded. However, the lectures were helpful because she literally showed us how to solve the problems for the pre-lab.

She does not like students taking pictures while she is teaching. However, the lectures are recorded. Also, she basically tells you the answers, or at least how to solve the problems, for the pre-lab during lab lecture.

BME101 lablectures were very boring & unentertaining. Always felt like it could have simply been in an email, & Dr. Vats already uploaded videos of the lab which is what many students relied on. Granted, the labs in BME101 are very simple, which is why lab lectures unnecessary.I cannot complain too much about lablecture since it was relatively easy

Dr. Vats was a good lab lecturer in my opinion. I was lucky to get good TAs as well, so the labs seemed completely doable. I found the lectures to be useful only for some of the labs, primarily the practical labs, as opposed to the technical (Excel) labs. She even cracked a few jokes here and there, which I certainly was not expecting.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Lecture heavy

comment: She taught the lab portion of my BME 101 class. Takes hours to explain a simple lab, and her TAs aren't helpful. Never answered her emails, and gave the impression she didn't really care. Will give you a zero if an assignment is so much as a minute late, regardless of personal circumstances. Also won't let you make up labs. Honestly made me cry.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Great professor who made learning calc kinda funny/interesting. Would definitely take a class with Prof Chio again. His blackboard notes were easily the best of the 142 professors. Super helpful in class and in office hours if you had any questions

Ivan is one of the better profs I've had. He knows what he's doing, is always prepared, and we usually got out of lecture early. Sometimes I would get confused by his lectures; I think he overcomplicates some things but if you ask he will go back through the problem. I recommend taking his class.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: This is the only professor that was able to actually teach me calculus. Calc 2 is an extremely hard subject but Dr.Chio somehow finds a way to make students understand the concepts well. Even if you can't make it to lecture, his notes are extremely thorough and easy to follow. His lectures are fun and interactive as well.

His lectures are a bit confusing because he goes through the material so quickly, but he is otherwise a great professor. If you reread the lecture notes you will usually understand what he is teaching. He is very funny and tries to make class interesting.
He's a great guy, but lowkey a bad teacher. Doesn't explain things very well
His notes are clear. I like him.

Ivan is a pretty solid lecturer, despite English not being his native language. He can get a bit sidetracked sometimes but he makes up for it by trying to stay as engaging as possible. The notes he uses and gives are also amazing. Could do a slightly better job of explaining things.
He is the best math professor I've ever seen in UR.

Calc 2 is a beast on its own, but Ivan made me excited to attend class. He's funny and sympathized with the students about having online class. He's super understanding and caring, I'd definitely take a course with him again. I could have put more effort into the course, so my grade doesn't reflect his teaching ability--that's my bad.

Classes are basically discussions about the reading, so make sure you read to know what is going on. You're graded off three 7 page papers which he grades relatively easily, but you should definitely pay attention during discussion because you can always use that in your papers. Boring at times, but if you are interested in lit then you're good.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Accessible outside class

comment: I like this professor but i wish he would give us less homework and lower his voice. I always end up getting a headache.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Test heavy--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: I loved Professor Michael. He was kind and knowledgeable and respected every student's input. Participation is not required and he won't necessarily call on you randomly, but you get so much more out of his classes if you're part of the discussion. Every class consisted basically of discussions about the books, so you'd be lost if you didn't read.

Great Professor! Deeply cares about his students and will go out of his way to gte to know you/help you. Very articulate and enthusiastic. Tough grader but willing to work with you on papers and often gives opportunities for rewrites. One of the best professors at UR!

Nice guy/decent professor. Is very good at leading discussions, but values certain students comments over others. He basically calls on the same four people all class and it can get pretty boring. Easy to approach and very clear on objectives. Pretty tough grader. Overall, pretty good teacher.
Very Nice Guy, but classes are very boring when he lectures. When they are discussions they are better. Fair grader!
Really smart guy, which can help and hurt. He is clear on what he wants, doesn't waste your time with busy work and treats you like adults.
only real problem was he jumped around a lot in class, switching subjects than going back, etc.
Very enthusiastic about the course, lots of reading, but the book choices were decent.  Papers weren't graded too strictly, if you write well you won't have a problem.

I have never seen a worse professor, no questions. He does not have a clear handle on how the students are understanding or engaging with the material and most are lost. When concerns are brought up he is completely unreceptive and borderline hostile. I think you are better served self studying the material rather than taking his course.

Ridiculous professor. I am more confused about data science after taking the course. makes everything extremely complicated and confusing. Homework impossible, he's not accessible at all. TA's don't know how to do the homeworks. His class is a total mess. Do not take this class if you don't have to. Does not care about his students at all. Avoid
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Awful Lecture, not organized. Cant understand what he said.

Very disorganized and confusing lectures. Read the textbook if you want to pass the class. But the material and assignments are extremely difficult, not even considering the fact that you have to learn all of it on your own (lectures make you more confused).
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Worst lectures ever. If you need someone to read the textbooks go for it but thats all he does.
Fair, straight-forward and introduces interesting and powerful techniques in statistical learning.

The class feels impossible. Lecture is useless and impossible to follow and you should just read his textbook since that's what he does, but his book is really hard to understand. The class is mixed with graduate students who seem to know way more. Grading consists of a few impossible assignments, a midterm and exam and good luck trying to do well.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: His lecture consists of reading the textbook in class, given that he wrote the textbook himself. He is incredibly boring in class and mumbles a lot. He does not make himself available for students with usual office hours. Instead, you must make an appointment with him, which is very inconvenient. Read the textbook if you want to pass the class.

He's so boring. Also, I wasn't sure if I was even going to pass his class and almost dropped it only to end up with an A. He gives hw, which is easy then gets hard and requires knowing R. I failed a couple of those hence I got worried (HW is 35%!!!). Exams are a lot easier than HW. He's also very nice if you actually sit down and talk to him.
