He writes *really* quickly on the board, which can be incredibly hard to follow (especially when he's doing proofs that are completely irrelevant to you). One on one he's really helpful and a nice guy to talk to.

Fili is a really nice guy and extremely helpful when you go to his office hours. 164 is a tough course and with his help it isn't as bad. He does a lot of proof based work towards the end of the year but going to office hours will definitely help you get some good examples and explanations.

Fili is a smart guy and a great professor. He moves along at a reasonable pace and is probably the most helpful professor outside of class I've ever had: responds quickly to emails and is always helpful during office hours. 164 is tough, but he makes it manageable. And to top it all off, he's super friendly. Really top-notch.

He's super nice and helpful, but I often got the feeling he was too smart for our class. His lectures are very proof/theory based and unlike the tests. I found it helpful to search lessons on YouTube. This was his first year teaching discrete math, though, so I'd cut him some slack. The class isn't too hard.

He is a nice guy. However, I cannot follow him at all! He is very smart and maybe too smart to me. I don't know. The good thing is that he IS the textbook. If I don't understand him, I will check my textbook.
Fantastic Professor! He really cares about his students and is passionate about the material. Take his classes!

Lectures move very fast and are sometimes less than clear, so stay on top of your note-taking. Fortunately he's patient and helpful in lecture and especially in office hours. HW is a lot harder than tests. Overall a great professor who's passionate about his subject. Decided to add a math major after taking his class.
Really nice guy, but tends to rush and skip steps which leaves you puzzled trying to figure out what your notes mean after class
Great professor. He gives a lot of work (at least at the beginning of the course, it dies down after a while), but he is both very accessible and willing to help.
He was a good lecturer- I really did not have any problems with him and am surprised why a bunch of my classmates did. Nice person, clear lectures (to me), makes you work and learn.

He is really good at explaining stuff and goes over most of the concepts covered in projects and labs in the lecture. He has a heavy accent which is sometimes an issue. His exams are tough but doable if you go over his lecture slides, quizzes, and workshops. His lectures are recorded which helps in revising the course material.
Poor professor, heavy accent, terrible lecture policies, and has no connection between parts of course, the projects seem to be made up and thrown in there. Do not recommend.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He seems like a pretty nice guy with good sense of humor. He makes the class very engaging and responsive to student's questions. Very approachable and does everything he can to help you understand the subject. Really passionate about teaching. Lot's of coding involved. Sometimes, it's hard to keep track of all the websites he uses.

A nightmare. Very disorganized- don't expect to learn from him, count on using as many outside resources as necessary. Huge disconnect between each part of the class (labs, lectures, workshops, projects), eg what he lectures is not what's on the labs is not what the projects are about etc. Somewhat receptive to feedback but still a mess.

Didn't do well on exams and quizzes, but did really well on projects. He pushes students to really understand the concepts. Lectures aren't primarily for learning everything, but a place to clarify on your reading and studies.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: A total mess. He confuses himself before he's able to confuse us.

I never expect a university professor can be that bad on teaching. Disorganized lecture notes, easy but useless labs and projects, and the syllabus will change because he can't deal with Canvas textbook that he insists to use. In the lecture you can't understand what he's talking about. Avoid his class if you can.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Do NOT ever take his course!!! This professor is very unorganized. Poor power point skills, confusing lectures. You have to learn all by yourself.
Goes through lectures way too quickly and his notes are not accessible anywhere
Very clear definitions and class notes. A very good professor to take higher level math courses with, especially classes where definitions and proofs are important.

His class moves insanely quickly. His lecture style didn't work for me, it was all just copying down notes and very little understanding of the material but I understand that works for some. While I didn't like his in-class style, he was very understanding outside of class and took time to talk about other topics to help me understand the concepts.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Really glad I took Intro to Topology with him. He wrote and explained his notes as he went through the lectures AND recorded every single one. It allowed me more time to stew over the more difficult proofs/theorems. You really should not try rushing topology proofs, it will only rot your brain.
A fantastic professor with adequate humor. I feel shameful did not get an A.
My saver for calculus II

He recorded all his lectures and posted his notes which was very easy as I would print his notes after class and watch the lecture at my pace. Whenever I had questions and emailed him, he would always respond quickly and  he really want students to do well in his class. For 162 - he is the best professor.

Bogdan's lectures are very fast paced and cover a lot of material daily. Miss a class? You're behind a week. Miss a part of class for the bathroom? You could have covered 2 sections of material. Class is dense, attend recitations for WebWork help and you will survive. Curved at the end.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I had this professor for MATH 162, one of the hardest classes in the basic calc sequence here. He had a mazing lectures with lots of examples and was easy to reach via email or in office hours. He even did a great series of review lectures at the end of the year

Great lecturer. I took this class with him last spring and really enjoyed it. The concepts were all so interesting, and many of the homeworks were basically puzzles to solve (e.g., decrypting something) using the concepts from class.

Very plain and clear lectures. He doesn't exactly excite you about the broader or abstract applications of linear algebra, just what you need to know. Got a bit behind schedule but not too much, and his notes are truly fantastic. It's just the right amount of detail and examples to basically learn the whole class from them quickly!

He's a pretty nice guy and will give extensions if you need them. Midterms weren't bad, final was harder than expected. Webwork counts a lot so it balances out exam grades. Lectures can be a little bland but he explains the content well and likes when people raise their hands to participate.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: The lectures are very clear, and his notes are great to review with. He is good at further clarifying things when you go to office hours.

Professor Han is a very smart individual if you do not understand a concept, he will be able to explain it very clearly if you ask for help. His lectures are very informative and structured. Excellent professor, would take again.
Very clear lectures. Nice guy. He sticks to the course content, nothing more, nothing less.
I joined his class only to go to another professor. He is a nice and genuine individual but lacks the personality to teach
He is the best professor in my life.
I really love his class. I learned a lot from him. U guys should take his course!!!!!
minsik is very good
patient, responsible, clear and well-prepared professor; he made a 142-pages materials for the whole semester.  Super helpful and give you all the corresponding content in index.
His lecture was useful and he explained concepts clearly. If he teaches Math 235 next semester I would definitely take it.

Great professor. Lectures are concept-based and informed by examples from the real-world and literature. Heavy on memorization but if you study, it'll be fine. All around a nice guy who cares about his field/students really understanding the concepts. 1000% better than some other evolutionary bio profs here (*cough cough* Uy and Minckley)
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy

comment: class isn't particularly interesting -- assignments overly specific or too vague
I wish I dropped this class when I had the chance. Very unclear with what he wants and very picky grader.

The class is ridiculously boring and he is very nit picky in his grading. Other than tests and quizzes, a decent chunk of your grade lies in limbo to be decided by his own subjective assessment. Would not take a class with him again
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: the absolute worst teacher i have ever taken a class with. not only does his class drag to no end, but he is so passive aggressive and condescending to students. his lack of social skills and robotic demeanor make him difficult to interact with
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Beware of pop quizzes--Tough grader

comment: A 2-credit writing class? Basically a total DIY experience. Just read a lot of papers, and then write a long review paper of your own.
Lectures can be a bit dry. Exams are easy if you study the slides and do the homework.

Interesting class, professor gave straight forward lectures.  Some test questions were more slightly ambiguous that resulted in harder than expected test, but a good class none the less.  I though the class would be a lot about disease but it was mostly about diversity.  Over all though professor and class recommended.
No Comments

I graduated from U of R 4 years ago, if I had to basically say there was one professor who was not professional, it was Professor Chao.

I would basically say that she's in a cult. And you will get bad grades on your work if it does not justify Falun Gong. If you research using official narratives such as NYTimes you will be penalized. No fair 4 me

I mean, I really like her. Since this is my last semester, if I had the chance, I would take her class again. Very nice lady who is professional and caring for what she teaches. But please do the readings if you want to write good essays. Once you read, it won't be hard to get a good grade. Please take her class.

She is incredibly repetitive, makes tons of errors and still grades very harshly. Please do not take her class! The only regret is I didn't check her up on rate my professors before I signed up for her class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Extremely tough grader, very repetitive and sometimes contradicts herself. She couldn't spell properly and make tons of grammatical mistakes in her materials but expects us to hand in papers with perfect writing. The only good thing I can say about this class is the interesting readings. Overall 10/10 do not recommend.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Not much good to say. She made the lessons hard to understand, was repetitive, and not very helpful even when the students reached out.

The other reviews here shocked me - I've had nothing but good experiences with Professor Chao. Her English is fine, her grading isn't that rough (I got a B+ on my midterm and actually thought she was quite generous with that), show up and do the readings. She's a little repetitive but I always left class understanding the important points.

Insanely hard grader. If you miss a keyword that she's looking for, but accurately describe the concept, she will count it completely wrong. She focuses on tiny details- be prepared to really memorize every little thing in the readings. I'm taking this class pass fail because I just don't know how to meet her standards and she is not helpful at all
Was condescending and not particularly helpful, can't recommend this class to anyone.

This professor is absolutely terrible. She does not speak English well enough to teach this class. She says contradictory things in her lecture, and when you write down what she said on exams, she counts them wrong. When you go ask her about why you got it wrong, she doesn't explain herself and is extremely condescending. Don not take her classes.

He is awesome. Very passionate, caring, and doesn't try to kill you with work. The class is graded on a couple papers that he grades very easily. Lots of reading, but you don't have to do it. I would recommend doing some of the reading- only the ones on topics that particularly interest you. Everyone should take this class- you will learn a lot!

Overall I enjoyed the class and thought the topic was interesting. However I thought much of the material was too hypothetical and overly optimistic. I wish the course looked at more tangible solutions to incarceration, and that the course wasn't so biased towards compete prison abolition. The guest speakers were the highlight of the course.

Josh is by far my favorite professor. He encourages students to actively engage with the community, goes out of his way to bring in a variety of perspectives, and is always willing to spend time talking to students about their own views and lives. I've learned so much about the structures in society and so much about myself in the process.

This was a super interesting class and I learned a lot from the lectures and speakers we had. I wish the class wasn't cut short by covid, but still solid online. Make sure to do the readings and pay attention to the authors and quotes he points out and you should be fine.
Meliora Seminar Class - Open to help - Gives good feedback and opportunities to boost grade - Class based on weekly book readings and papers
Super easy class just show up and study hard for midterm and final. Need to do the readings and Dubler is a great guy. Very passionate about his work and everything he is involved in.

He's very understanding and it's clear he loves his job. He's always available for feedback or for working through the heavy topics brought up in lecture, and he truly wants his students to think for themselves and learn how to analyze what they're reading. He's also a great facilitator of discussion! Dubler is the best.

Great guy! Always willing to meet outside of class for help. Has answered numerous questions even unrelated to class through email and even, per request, created a meme board for the class for a bit of a laugh. Lots of reading. Acknowledges his faults. Intelligent, lots of big words, so sometimes confusing. Likes hearing opinions/debating - A+
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Worst class Ive ever taken. Hes the most subjective and biased grader Ive ever experienced. He also thinks hes WAY smarter than he is and it comes across as condescending. The class didnt teach me much that I didnt already know, either. Got all As in other classes, this was the easiest by far and got a B because hes biased.

Professor DiPiero is the best professor I have ever had at this University. He is extremely smart, approachable, funny, and encouraging. Though the class is really difficult, he makes you feel really smart when you finally understand a tough concept, and helps you get there when you don't. TAKE CLASSES WITH HIM. I'm sad this one's over.
I became a French major just so that he would be my advisor.  By far the best part of my college experience.
Smartest man I ever met, amazing teacher, and really understanding. Tough grader.

I hope you are not overloading if you are signed up for this class.  It's not so much the amount of work as the diffculty of the readings in this class. Be prepared to think outside the box and if you are not an avid participator in class, be prepared for a B+ or less. Talk, talk and I mean TALK in class.  You have to have the mindset to talk!

Major Seminar with DiPiero is the Organic Chemistry of the Humanities Department.  Your writing skills will be whipped into shape by the end and your preconceived notion of anything in this world will be flushed down the toilet as new ideas emerge in his class. Readings are difficult to comprehend and often leave you wanting to cry.
Very knowledgeable and entertaining. Work is not easy, but classtime is extremely enjoyable.  I was definitely very sad to see this class end!
Absolutely brilliant--the best.
greatest prof ever.  we all loved him.  he's absolutely brilliant.  i wish i wasn't finished with french so I could take more classes with him
He is absolutely the best teacher at the U of R.  I have taken courses of his just because he's teaching it.  Entertaining, funny... excellent!

Prof Brown is one of the best teachers I've had a U of R to date. She gives great lectures and explains difficult material in a way that is easy to understand and comprehend. She's always willing to take the time during class to answer questions and is accessible after class and during office hours. I highly recommend taking this class with her!
Erin is an amazing professor, and was especially able to teach the more abstract concepts that come with multivar. I felt very prepared for the tests just from going over her notes.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Test heavy

comment: Erin is an amazing teacher, she is very clear with walking through examples, and is able to explain concepts very clearly. She is also very approachable outside of the classroom, and more than willing to help you with something you do not understand. Best professor I have had here.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures

comment: This was one of my favorite classes, and Prof. Crossen Brown is one of the best teachers and persons I've met here.
Prof. Crossen is such a nice person!!! Super caring and devoted to this class!!! Always prepared and super organized!!!!
Tests are usually harder than expected, but the curve is huge so it doesnt really matter. I loved erin
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Amazing lectures--Tests are tough

comment: Great teacher, great class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Would take again

comment: Great professor. Very clear, and genuinely cares about her students. Highly recommend taking her class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures

comment: MUST TAKE HER CLASS!! YOU WON'T REGRET IT, SHE IS THE BEST PROFESSOR EVER!! If other math professors were like her, I would do so much better.
Inspiring teacher!

He is an excellent teacher. Materials are clear and organized. And he goes through everything in great details! I asked for several office hours l, and he made great efforts to cooperate. Good teacher!

The content covered in his lecture has no connection. His teaching method always tried to mess me up and made me even more confused! The worst professor I have ever met. And the exam is quite different from what he taught in his meaningless lecture.

Not sure he has any idea about what he's teaching. He gave difficult coding assignments to students with 0 Python background and was being tough on grading. If you don't have a strong stats background, don't even consider taking his class.
He is a fantastic teacher. Very funny. Did some reviewers confuse him for somebody else? He never gave extra credit
His lectures are disorganized and the slides dont help in the slightest. However, he offers up to 2% extra credits. If you only want a good grade and dont expect to learn much, take his class.

The lectures were not very clear and Professor Yang sometimes rambled on about a study or an example that wasn't making sense to the students. The content overall wasn't difficult so as long as you did well on the homeworks and studied for the quizzes and exams, you can get a good grade. The textbook can be helpful, but not mandatory.

He's a nice enough guy but his lectures make no sense whatsoever. He would bring up a topic, say a few sentences about what it is, give 10 minutes worth of examples and say the important conclusion once and move on. The thing is though, is that the slides that he posts don't have the important parts so you have to read the book if you miss.
Ok guy
very caring professor

Thrilled with Prof. Demirhan's course in Spring. Math 282 Initially seemed daunting, but it turned out to be enriching and beneficial. He is a very approachable professor, his office hours are conveniently scheduled before hw deadlines. You will learn a lot, so definitely go to his session. Possibly he's only prof in math dept doing review sessions
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: He was an excellent professor. He teaches everything in detail and would be happy to help you with any questions.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: I took the writing version of MATH200 to fulfill my upper writing requirement. He was so nice that I got extra help for both of my papers. He was always available no matter after class or during his office hours to talk about homework problems as well as class contents. Highly recommended to take his class.
Breaking down and going through problems helped me a great deal. After office hours, I was normally able to have a better idea of how to solve problems.

I'm in discrete, he gets himself confused during lectures and has never ended class on time. He can be quite hard to understand at times but if you ask him to clarify he will and make sure you understand it more than you probably wanted to. His mannerisms are so adorable and he's unintentionally hilarious you can't help but love the guy.

He's not the best type of math professors, but definitely a good one. Easily understandable lectures and are always happy to help outside classroom. If you understand everything on your homework and sample exams, you will have no problems on the tests. Remember that practice makes perfect.

You can tell that he is a genuinely nice guy but he should not be a professor. The lectures are super disorganized and all he does is read directly from the textbook and write it on the board. Overall, if you don't read the textbook/teach yourself you're not going to know what's going on...
Lectures are incredibly hard to stay awake through.

Dr. Basu is a VERY intelligent person. Of course you will read alot on your own. Read the chapter before coming to class. The tests are easy if you study. If you wait till the day or so before, you'll fail test. Lab is tough. Put the time in & you'll be fine. If you put the time in and gradually learn the material, you'll make an "A" easily.

The Dr. thinks you should study 30+ hours a week.  recommend lecture but he puts it all on BB. must ask him for help personally. no help in class by question. uses multiple books in class. TA's do EVERYTHING! they take the test and make the key, so hope it matches theirs. prepare for long nights in lab and hours studying. HE LOVES CHARTS! MUST MEMO

Dr. Basu is a very interesting lecturer, passionate about his subuject. However he is a little disorganized in his lecture style. He is intelligent and helpful but at the same time is very demanding and has high expectations. You must work VERY, VERY hard to get a C in this class and double that if you want an A. Overall enjoyed the class.

At first I didn't like Mineralogy (EES 204). It was a tough class and the material seemed to go way over my head. And the labs were difficult to understand. But it got really fun in the second half where Dr. Basu went over phase diagrams ( love diagrams). You WILL have to study ALOT for this class. Put in the time and effort and you will pass.

Absolutely terrible! relies so heavily on technical jargon, its easy to get confused. Not clear about expectations for exams. Will take points off if your answer is not framed exactly the way he wants it, even though the questions are broad/vague. Class average was at a 60% immediately before the final. Worst professor I've ever had!

Extremely knowledgeable instructor. Intimidating at first, but really a nice and caring person if you get to know him. The material is memorization heavy, so be prepared to study. But it is very interesting. And always ask questions in class.
Hard to understand and teaches like you have the knowledge of a grad student. Expects large time commitment for studying outside of class.
Interesting material but tests hard. Study!
Get ready to read. Hard exams, tough grader

Favorite professor EVER. Cannot say enough about her. I found myself interested and moved by her every class. Also HILARIOUS and has an amazing sense of humor. I would take any class of hers just so I could listen to her lecture!
She's a busy lady, but she's interested in what she teaches and she teaches it well. If you memorize the material, the tests are easy... and there isn't that much material.

Dr. Ghera was a good lecturer. Her enthusiasm and humor made classes a lot easier to sit through.  The class was pretty easy, but her presentation of the material was well done. She's always good about giving tangible examples to whatever concept or theory she's teaching.

I loved her class.  She was engaging, entertaining, and educated.  Yes she has a lot on her platter with working at two colleges; but whenever I needed help on something she always managed to find the time.

One of the worst professors I have ever had. Tried to be funny and appeal to teenagers but it was completely unfounded. Class was a complete waste of my time--a child could have done a better job teaching. I just feel sorry for her children because they will grow up with the knowledge that she shared personal details about them in her classes.
She was super entertaining and her anecdotes were extremely helpful. Definitely worth going to class

Perfect example of an adjunct with "better things to do". Never felt like UR was on her priority list. Let's the students who like to hear themselves speak do just that and never curtails their tangents which resulted in a whole lot of wasted time. She did share some funny stories and had a good sense of humor, but overall- horrible experience.

Was hoping I'd have a change of heart about him but I feel too strongly mid-semester not to chime in. He's smart and not a bad person but the way he teaches is unbelievably confusing. Nothing at all to do with his accent. The course content has become very redundant, syllabi+assignments are messy and grading is extremely unclear. Avoid if possible.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: The way Professor Cilas teaches is he talks then you discuss. There's a lot of reading and writing for both papers and exams. The content that he is teaching most of the time literally does not have definitive answers thats why it can seem like the way he marks is unclear but if you meet with him outside of class he can give you specific feedback.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: WORST professor ever.  Instructions always unclear. Insists he follows syllabus, does not. Exams are ridiculous. Forgets about assignments and blames us when he magically remembers.  Avoid at all costs.

I found that Dr.Kemedjio was, when independently sought after, very helpful. His assignments did a lot to help students stretch their understanding of the topics at hand. Group collaboration was encouraged. The selection of readings and films for the class was, in my opinion, very well curated. I enjoyed his class.

One of the worst professors I have ever encountered. Not only he is very bad at explaining new grammar or forming discussions, he is not helpful at all either. Do not expect him to respond to your emails. Also, his HW is ridiculous and his grading does not make any sense. DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASSES!!!!

If this guy is teaching this class for the semester, do not sign up.  I'd recommend signing up for 204 with another professor. Doesn't seem like he's there for the well-being of the students.  His grading is non-existent and you're all of a sudden slapped with whatever he thinks you deserve.  B+ here but nothing to show for it!

For the more advanced courses, this class SUX! This class is the epitome of boring and I'd honestly rather have spent my time finger painting! I took 2 of his courses and regret every bit of it. Consider dropping the course within the 3 weeks of exploring the course!

I like clias as a person alot. The first day of class i could not understand a word he was saying, but by the end of the semester, i understand practically every word. He really deosn't teach new points well, u really have to teach urself, which sucks, but i got some text books that teach french in english, which helps alot. A really easy grader.

I feel like Curt pulls good reviews because his course is easy and he seems like a cool guy. Yeah, the course is very fair and well-organized, but is he actually good at lecturing and explaining concepts? No

Professor Signorino did a good job conveying content that was not particularly compelling. He offered plentiful online resources to supplement the class and was available for questions outside of class. While the content wasn't of much interest to me or relevant to my future, he made it palatable and comprehensible.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Did the best he could with somewhat boring material. Tests are open-note and based on lectures. I bought the textbooks but never needed them - don't waste your money. Attendance is mandatory. As someone who is not going into a technical field, I found the content pretty useless but not too hard.

The course materials are not easy for me but if you prepared and studied, you can handle them well. The class is mainly based on homework (around 8-9 homework) which consisted of 70% of the grade. If you are not good at coding, you might struggle a little. Try to go to Professor's office hours, because they really helped me boost my grade.

75% of your grade is composed of homework and the rest an open note final exam, which I personally love. His lectures and website created for practice problems are helpful. Hes a decent lecturer and is always willing to answer questions during and after class. If you're looking for an easy Stats class that integrates R in would highly recommend.

really amazing guy. if you took AP stats in high school this class will be easier to understand. does a very good job providing resources and material to assist with lectures. my only downside is that the lectures can be incredibly boring. i slept in every class and still ended up with an A. amazing professor regardless, just be prepared for such.
Great professor! Very knowledgable and caring! One of the best professors from the political science department.

Curt is extremely smart and very knowledgeable about R and political science in general. He's really fun to talk to and a genuine human unlike some professors at Rochester. I understood R pretty well for how bad of lecturer he is (he just reads the slides) because he answers questions very well. Overall a great class that I would recommend again

Professor is an okay guy, but can be rude in his emails and calls people out sometimes. Class can be overwhelming at times with lots of code to learn quickly, but if you really understand the app he builds right before the project, you'll be able to do the projects well. His attendance tracking is not graded, but I suggest going to learn better.

says attendance is mandatory but its not. nice guy, if you show you care for him then he will show he cares for you. sometimes online sometimes in person. just an fyi, dont p!ss him off and send him redundant emails, hes not gonna respond to you with what you think he will. dont ask for extensions unless someting actually happens, too.
Nice Professor
Easy Class

Lectures are insanely boring but the class is easy enough if you follow the assignment directions and what he does in class. Lectures switch from being in class or online and in the syllabus it says attendance is necessary but there's no grade for it so it doesn't really matter.

hes a weird guy. very difficult to understand as english is his second language and he mumbles and whispers. he can come off as rough and abrasive, sometimes it was difficult to understand his grading criteria. YOU MUST HAVE A MACBOOK FOR THIS CLASS or you will not be able to code! this is for fall iOS dev. :)

He comes across as a hard professor but he has a style which if you follow you can be confident that you can do mobile app development. The class has a lot of homework but it is helpful. No extra credit but getting an A is not too hard if you work constantly. He isn't very flexible otherwise but the card itself is not too hard.
Took android dev. You can basically copy his code and finish every project and HW. Every HW can be done the day it's due. Projects take 1-2 days.

His lecture is about wasting your 75 minutes listening to intro content that doesn't worth 5 minutes and never mentions anything useful. He even shows how to use a plugin that is not in the marketplace and he does not release the install pack; all he does is to show something you can't use and say "but I already installed it". Hilarious.

I hated this class. Please don't take Mitsu, take literally any other professor for CSC 120. His lectures are of absolutely no use, especially if you don't have prior coding experience. He uses autograder for the exams, which is pretty much useless. I got a really bad grade, and my only mistakes were adding space or not adding space in the exam.

It's true that Professor is great and he will curve the first two exams. However, It is hard for me to learn it especially if u haven't learned it before. I will not recommend u to choose this course.

Lectures are pretty much optional because he puts all of the lecture materials on blackboard. If you go to his lectures you probably won't learn anything anyway because he's hard to understand and his slides are confusing. Test wise, there's only a midterm and a final. There are lab assignments every week, but the TA's are really helpful.

I loved Dr. Ogihara! Yes, his lectures sometimes got confusing, but the quizzes he gave actually helped me understand the material so much more (the labs helped as well). Don't worry too much about quizzes though. They are only 5% of the grade, so they don't hurt you that much. He curves A LOT, too. Very enthusiastic and overall a respectful prof.

If you have not taken computer science, you will have to spend a good deal of time reading and programming outside of his class since his lectures aren't very clear or engaging. Do all the labs and go to his office hours for help. Make friends with someone who has programming experience.

I'm sorry. Seriously if you're stuck with this guy like I am either A) kill yourself or B) find a tutor ASAP. He is very enthusiastic about the subject just does a terrible job teaching or relating subject  matter to students. You can bearly understand a word he's saying so it matters worse. Nice guy though. DO NOT TAKE! Vaya con Dios

Enthusiastic and tries (and fails) to keep students interested. Is extremely helpful and available for his students. His accent can be difficult to understand, but wears well over time (I loved it after a month).
He tries hard to keep students interested and works hard to help them, that too, for very boring subject matter. Props to him for that.
great prof
Truly amazing professor. Cares for his students and giving all the perspective which astronomy is

Professor Frank is a very engaging speaker. Cosmic Origins of Life was a fascinating class. Some concepts covered on tests were never even addressed in class time, however.  This is not an easy course, but it is worth your while.  DO NOT buy the textbook, you will never use it.  At all.
hilarious and entertaining. i love astronomy to begin with, but he just makes it even cooler. he's passionate about what he teaches. i'd take another class with him if i could.

Great professor! He is funny and makes lectures zoom by. He can be a bit slow on putting up review questions for exams but he's working on it. He also plays really great music before class and at the mid-lecture break. Take a class with him!
One of the best professors in the world! He is just simply amazing. I wouldn't be surprised if he was jesus, himself.
A good speaker, inspiring and humorous!!! Easy class!
Love his class, makes his 75 min lecture fly by most days -  intelligent, clear, enthusiastic, great taste in music - overall really cool guy

The material is hard, but I don't believe that is on the professor. He truly cares about his students and tries to explain real life examples of the material we encounter which makes it more interesting and gives a sense where I can apply the knowledge outside of it.. at least intuitively. To think of the bigger picture.
Great course, awful professor. Whyyyyy?

Professor Askari is a nice guy and clearly knows the material enough to the point where it is so easy for him he messes up in ways that us students do with basic arithmetic. Dynamics is tough and test heavy.
Professor Askari is my favorite professor ever. Sure, his class is difficult but that is mostly due to the material. He is very nice, caring, and gives great advice. Best professor ever!

Professor Askari's class was very difficult, but I enjoyed it a lot. He is very clear when explaining concepts and is very accessible. If you want to do well in this class, you have to go to recitation and office hours.

Professor Askari is an incredible professor. He is good at explaining concepts that are difficult and he makes the course interesting. That being said, it is a weed-out class, and it is quite difficult. Askari is very approachable and personable though, so getting help is easy. Go to recitations and office hours if you want to get a good grade.
His test are crazy hard!

Worst class I've ever taken. Not in touch with his students at all, his expectations of their ability is sky high compared to what he prepares them for. Test averages are very low and few to no peope finish the tests in the allotted time.

Workshops are the most important part of this class. The lecture material barely corresponds with the book and some test questions seem out of no where. I feel like I learned nothing in class and had to figure out most of the material with the TAs.

Many years ago,(25) I had the misfortune of taking Prof. Eisenberg's honors introductory general chemistry class.  He made his exams hard by the inexcusable method of making them far too long for the time allowed, NOT because they were intelligent or clever. I still became a physician, but I AGREE with today's students: AVOID Prof. Eisenberg.

I took his honors chem class...for the record, anyone taking honors classes in college...it's not like high school anymore...honors classes are extremely difficult. Consider taking them if you are majoring in that subject.  Class was ridiculously hard. Of course it has to be, they have to weed out the pre-meds somehow. Stay away from Eisenberg
ok, to sum it up. Salutatorian here, got a 5 on the AP chem test and dropped this course with a D.  I'm not retarded, this class was hella hard.

THE WORST TEACHER EVER! He is not approachable. In fact if you ask him questions, he hates you and gives a BS answer. Teaches random things that undergraduates have no clue about. Thinks he is always right. He probably never even looked at the book he uses because his lectures are incoherent. He uses other people's PPT. NEVER TAKE A CLASS WITH HIM!

Took his honors chem class and was definitely bumped away from pursuing his course by the level of difficulty.  The class is curved and material is covered rapidly and overheads are essential. If you are pre-med, put some time into this class.
horrible horrible person. doesn't deserve to teach or be called a professor. Don't have enough respect for him to call him that. needs to learn how to be a person before becoming a professor.

Out of touch with students, does not give clear information about what will be covered on exams, assigns homework that often does not coincide with course material, preaches about the journal he edits and how important it is, congratulates himself on predicting the winner of Nobel prize award...but hey--it must be the next best thing to winning it.
Great teacher, really personable and fun!
Amazing teacher. really really easy tests, you can ues a calculator, he lets you get extra points after the test too.
Great Teacher, hard workshop problems. He has a good TA as well
Really good teacher. Very clear, students in his class get very high scores.

Wei is hard to understand... I almost walked out the first day due to his accent.  However, he is the best math professor ever!  He will answer questions over and over again until it all makes sense, and he responds to emails very quickly (roughly 10 minutes, at most hours).  I learned more with him than with the "better" ones.
smart guy, helpful, easy grading

Almost impossible to understand in class. Very unorganized as well. Probably the worst math teacher I've ever had. It'd be a lot better use of time to read the text book to go to class. Also the quest workshop has nothing to do with class and is pointless and the TAs are less than useful.

He's a really nice guy, but it's a little confusing when he teaches. If you ask him for help, he's very nice and will show you how to do the problem. Great one on one. I'd recommend having taken calculus before, though.

The material is simple but very engaging. Prof. Pazda uses great examples to explain his material and although class isn't mandatory it's fun to attend anyways.  He's a great guy.  As long as you read as well as review the slides from class, you should be okay test-wise.
This class is pretty easy as long as you go to class and then study by going through the powerpoint lectures. The material is straight-forward and I never needed to use the book.
Really awesome professor!:)  Super sweet
Interesting lectures and very good at explaining material. Tests were fairly simple with a lot of multiple choice.
Great Class.  Professor is very clear with his lectures and exams.  Can be dull at times, but his examples and stories are great.
He's an amazing professor. Class isn't necessary but very interesting, he uses great examples to explain material. The exams are simple but you do need to read the textbook for a few questions.
He is really willing to help you with your questions and grades !!! And there are many ways to get extra credits!

I took this class my freshman year and it was my favorite class of the year, mainly because of him. The material taught is pretty easy and the tests are usually multiple choice questions and short answers but you need to know all the stuff to score well in  his class.

Prof Dwarkadas is clearly very intelligent, and has a lot of respect for students However, she did not adapt to the online format very well. Lectures are reading off power points and notes are typed in awkward formats, sometimes drawing with a mouse. Recycled the same projects from past years verbatim. Very reachable outside of lecture, cares a lot
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: I learn nothing from her lectures. She cannot explain anything in a way that makes sense to someone unfamiliar with the subject matter. This is basically a class where you have to teach yourself. If you take this class, don't feel bad about searching online for help.
Worst Prof ever. Doesn't know the material well.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Awesome teacher, very difficult course, but she explained things really well and told us to come to her office anytime for help, not just during office hours. Broke things down and really promoted questions. Ngl hard course, but it's OS, what do you expect?
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Caring

comment: Good material, good lectures, kinda hard but good it is that way

Class was good. Could be kept more interesting somehow but assignments were tough and again could be made more interesting and less of kernel debugging. Little more coverage of exact kernel material would have been great.
Adorable!
Good lecturer, fairly demanding as well.  Did I mention hot?

Prof. Xu is really knowledgeable and engaged in research. Lectures were inspirational but involved little coding, so be prepared to learn PyTorch on your own. Easy A. No exam. 2 projects and 1 final group project, open-topics. Level of difficulty really depends on the topic one choose. Clear grading rubrics and instruction.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: A terrible professor with poor character, a bad attitude in class, and no respect for students.

Actually CSC 298:

Abysmal communication. Slides intentionally hide info (you cannot learn / review after class). Lectures are poorly structured and delivered: always derailed by simple student questions that he spends 10min answering at *extreme* length. Project instructions self-contradictory and intentionally incomplete.

He is the professor who spent the least effort in teaching. He's lecture PowerPoint was borrowed from another school. You could feel that he had never prepared his lecture before class. He had 1 hour/per week oh and he didn't reply to the email. His TAs put the minimum effort too, when you asked someone he would let you find the other TA and so on.
Prof. Xu is great!
CV is hard but Prof. Xu can explain everything in a clearer and easier way.

The whole operation is tightly run. The class is such a struggle, but it leaves you with the feeling that you can only blame Xu last. So that's good learnin'. The assignments are where it really all connects. Wouldn't recommend this class for credit if you are just casually interested in the material.
rating_tags: Respected--Beware of pop quizzes--So many papers

comment: Professor Xu is a very nice guy. His slides and teaching are very clear and you can tell he loves what he does.
I like the paper discussion.

Honestly not a bad teacher and her motivations for teaching the class are good. You'll learn a lot about how chemical engineering actually works. With that being said, there is no reason she needs to be this crazy about academic honesty and not posting slides. I really don't get it. Just let me look at the slides so I can see if I missed anything.
Astrid is a great professor. She is always available for answering questions and be prepared before the class! A very good class to take.

Fair grader. Grades my addition, not subtraction. Extremely strict about the academic honesty policy. Do not take videos or pictures of her lectures, she will see you and call you out and take action against you. Lectures are focused on the textbook which is very easy to comprehend. Must purchase a hard copy of the book for this class.

I took this class like a year ago but I'm returning to remind her to read her reviews and apply herself.  yo ahh still getting bad reviews?  is change that hard for ya? here's some tips for u astrid: write your own notes don't be lazy and use others.  Let ur students take photos u f-ing weirdo no one gonna sell that shiz LMAO. WHO TF IS U...
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Must teach yourself.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: The academic honesty policy can be violated by doing anything in her class. She talks like an uneducated person in a very rude way to students. Nobody dared to give her any suggestions. She does not give enough time for students to take notes on her powerpoint and accuses you if you take a single photo of that powerpoint.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: She was quite rude to many students, especially those who asked questions. She immediately becomes very defensive, and claims you are "accusing her." It really seems like she only cares about her research, and would not even be present for her office hours some days. On the surface seems nice, but shows her true colors later on.

MUST teach yourself by reading the textbook b/c lectures are PowerPoint slides and she goes through them super quick and they simply are not good notes. She is also rude and not approachable. Despite the L's everywhere, her exams are kinda fair and lets you use your textbook on them, not a lot of HW is given, but it is hard HW.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: literally the WORST at helping students understand the material

Professor Fey was clearly passionate about what he talked about. There weren't many assignments and no final exam only a 10-page paper. His lectures are thorough and he does have a tendency to go on tangents but otherwise conveys information well.

Really fun class that's fairly low stress. Midterm, one paper, and some problem sets throughout the semester. I would strongly suggest you have some level of math skill/logic skill, as the course is math intensive but it's not like calculus. Great professor that seems to really like teaching the course. Textbook is used but all info is in lecture

He doesn't say "um" anymore. I took this as an undergrad. Challenging, but very helpful. Material can seem a bit dry, but he clearly lectures, methodically getting to cool and very important stuff from basic foundations. If you need help, he'll provide it. 2 midterms and final are take-home, but real doozies. (Weekly homeworks mixed difficulty.)
Great teacher.
Ummmmmmmmmmmmmmmm
No Comments

Ummm, hmmm, ummm, yea.  Nice guy, quite an experience to watch him lecture and say hmmmm and ummmm 764334557864321256 times in 75 minutes.  But he's pretty interesting, knows what he's talking about and grades very fairly.

So, he was, um, one of the uh, most boring professors in an otherwise great dept. Uh, Political Economy could be a great class if uh he didn't um, make it so uh, boring. If you're confused by all the so's, um's, uh's, etc...sit in his lecture for 5 minutes. The papers are easy but too open ended.

I've taken 2 classes with Lacina and they're not bad. However, for this class, your whole grade is based on 3 essays so make sure you are good at writing and studying the content throughout the semester. My only complaint is that her grading criteria varied for each of my essays so it was hard to understand what she was looking for.

Professor Lacina is kind but not the most engaging professor. This class is incredibly reading-heavy, so make sure you can dedicate enough time to read a book a week (or at least skim it thoroughly). Her feedback sometimes varies, I wish she was a little more specific at times, but overall not a bad course!

Professor Lacina is a skilled political scientist and kind person, but sometimes not the most engaging as a professor. My biggest issue was that the amount of reading assigned was completely unrealistic, and this is coming from someone who has taken quite reading-heavy courses in the past. Feedback is useful and grading is not harsh.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Would not recommend Prof Lacina. She came across as very awkward,unclear, and not very confident with the material. The assigned readings for the class were interesting, but Prof Lacina was boring as an instructor and killed all interest I had in the class.

The course itself was an easy A, but the instructor was frequently confused and not very knowledgeable. Professor Lacina was also just socially awkward and not good at interacting with students, which made class meetings uncomfortable.

I love her.  She seemed kinda dry in the beginning, but by the end of the class she was my favorite.  She is not a pushover, she is organized and expects something from you, she is really smart and you will learn a lot.  She is an excellent lecturer and very inspiring, she treats you like an adult, in a good way. She's just really great.

Prof is helpful, approachable, passionate about the subject, but poor lecturer.  Frequently pauses in mid-sentence as if confused. An overall interesting class and not too difficult, but lectures are not inspiring and usually lackluster.  Take the course if you are interested in the subject. Lacina probably won't inspire.

Professor Lacina is awesome. This class was very interesting, and she managed the discussion in a way that kept it quite engaging. I would call her neither difficult nor easy, but students should expect to at least skim the reading. Her knowledge is vast, but she's still very friendly and funny. Acts more like a grad student than a professor.

He is charismatic and dedicated to being a good teacher. Told a funny story about eating raw chicken in Japan. Did a final showing of the class' final project of sound design though it's not necessary. Since there are few jobs in sound design, I don't recommend taking more classes. Definitely read the book on sound design to prepare for quiz.

Prof. Lavaque is so passionate about what he teaches, he makes the class so fun. He is quite hands-off in his approach and mostly leaves you to figure things out by yourself, but he or the TAs will always help if you get stuck. The projects take a lot of time, but they're not brain-rackingly difficult.

Esteemed professor with loads of industry experience. Projects are structured with real-world-clients in mind. Genuinely cares for his students' success and is understanding when life get tough. Don't slack off or you can easily get behind. 

*another rating said he expects you to know certain software, but it's literally listed in the pre-reqs
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: He is known for being irresponsible, not only been ignoring the students questions via Zoom, but also been a procrastinator in terms of giving grades and assignments. The class is frankly boring and irrelevant to the topic. He would talk about softwares which we should be already familiar with. Therefore, I don't suggest to take this course.

If you're planning to take this class, think again. Previously, I expected the class to be super fun and interesting. Yet, it turns out to be unpleasant and unsatisfying. He's known for his unpunctuality of getting the class started, his irresponsibility, ungenerous, and his irrelevant teaching. Thus, I won't recommend students to take this class.
Easy and fun class, just do the work and for the most part you will be fine.

Professor Lavaque is a great guy.  He's heavily decorated and really knows what he's talking about when it comes to sound production.  He's always quick to give good feedback, and won't hesitate to help if anything isn't clear.  His classes aren't easy per se, but it's the kind of hard work you have fun with.

Very fun and worthwile class! Class is mostly project-based, and it really gets you familiar with the tools that professionals in the field use (of which he is one - an Emmy-winner). His demos can be rushed somewhat unclear at times, but he takes a "learn by doing" approach to teaching the class.

I was in 181 (not listed). Probably the best math professor I've had, he's caring, gave very helpful examples, helped us through homework problems and gave enthusiastic explanations of mathematical principles. He also made himself very available outside of class. I'm sad to see him have to leave, I hope he comes back to RIT to teach in the future.
Shashank is the best professor I've had. He was always available to meet outside of class and help with practice problems. The lectures were very clear and he demonstrated a lot of practice problems.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: I got an A in this class but only bc he MAAD curved our grades at the end of the course. he seems to care for his students but mans just did NOT convey the subject material well. I don't think I learned enough in this course as I should've but it's his first semester at RIT so I can forgive some of the stuff? just don't take him for multivar/vect

Professor Chorge was really helpful in me understanding and learning calculus for the first time. His lectures are not bad if you pay attention and follow his work. He is a little unorganized when he works out a problem but he explains everything clear. He was one of my favorite instructors I had this semester and I recommend him to anyone.

In this class I ended up having to teach myself most of the material. I got little to no feedback from him on exams or quizzes.

There were multiple times where I would only have a calculation error on a quiz/exam and he would not give any credit(even though he said he would).

Chorge is very nice, but  I would not recommend this taking this class.

Can be a little hard to understand, but is fun if you get to know him. Homework every class but it takes 5 minuets to do and is graded on completion. If you show up and pay attention in class its a easy A or B
He wasn't the best but was by no means the worst. Just wanted his students to do their best and made himself super available in order to help!
I don't understand why this professor rated so low, but he is the best professor I have ever met in the university. He answers every question thoroughly, and I can understand his lecture.

Dr. Dove was my favorite professor this semester by far. She was everything you would ask for in a teacher and more. She was accessible, clear, and a very fair grader. She makes you work for your grade, but in doing so you become a better writer and student. I am extremely excited and nervous for HON272 next semester. I would highly recommend.

Dr. Dove is awesome! I highly recommend her. She is kind, respectful of your comments and ideas and facilitates class discussion well. She also chooses interesting and applicable readings and is more than willing to help with papers in office hours, unlike some other HON272 professors.  I would take her class again in a heartbeat.

Dr Dove was an AMAZING human event professor. Kind and helpful, she was excellent at facilitating group discussion and creating a class that was surprisingly very interesting. She always appreciates the comments that everyone makes and makes achieving a high grade a possibility. Coming from someone who HATED Hon 171, I loved this class. TAKE HER!!

Had her for hon 171 and she had a lot of energy and enthusiasm for the subjects. Her grading is fair, a little rough sometimes, but the weighting of grades work out that you get the grade you deserve. She is not mean at all, super nice. Three papers, and a one paragraph response due every friday. Not bad. Highly encouraged.

Dr. D. has a very interesting approach to her subject and you can tell that she is passionate about it.  It's easy to ask her questions and she is more than willing to help in any way that she can.  She provided the class with entertaining projects and helped us to improve in areas we were struggling in.

she's a pretty cool and down to earth professor. helpful when you need her and is always smiles. she tries pretty hard to make the class interesting and the films for the class are pretty good as well as the paper topics. she grades pretty fair- you get the grade you deserve
No Comments
She was pretty chill, but her grading is a little rough...overall a lot better than other CAS techers
One of the best teachers I ever had. The man is brilliant and has so much to offer. I had a better understanding of International Security than I had ever imagined after his class.
GLORIOUS
Incredible Teacher

He is incredibly condescending sometimes and clearly picks favorites.  A lot of the time when people answer questions he makes them feel dumb and isn't encouraging at all.  He is really smart and clearly knowledgeable but just isn't a good teacher.
Very Interesting Class

Great professor who really makes an effort to get the class involved. Talking to him after class is always a pleasure, and a surprise because his wealth of knowledge is almost unbelievable. Overall a great professor and should be taken advantage of.

Class is very interesting and good.  Not a lot of work for a W class, which is huge.  A good amount of reading, but it's all posted online.  Not a terribly hard class if you do the reading and pay attention.  Dolan is really interesting, knows his stuff, and is passionate about it.

A gentleman and a scholar. A veritable encyclopedia of international relations, his classes are an essential part of any Political Science or IR degree. Straightforward, relatively lenient grading. Will turn you into an IR major.

I had Ed my first semester freshman year and he gave me the only B+ of my entire college career. That being said he was caring and thoughtful and his lectures were set up well and really made you think.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Great teacher. Very patient, and willing to answer any questions he can about religious/philosophical topics. He cares about his class, and it shows in his teaching ability.
He's extremely helpful and he mostly just wants you to succeed. I'd take his classes again, if only for his amusing favorite-uncle jokes.

Although philosophical theology is well, theology gone wrong, this guy is sooo great, and he is def smart and funny, totally nice and i think he cares about his students. what is fascinating is that he still finds meaning in the work he does, something you see in all religion professors

Deals with a difficult subject and works to help students not just present the work as a 'task' that must be done. On a personal level, he's extremely smart and funny,but his monotone voice and intelligent jokes are often missed when students aren't paying attention. He is a fine professor and person.

He's a really nice guy, but on tests he just wants you to site his lecture notes, not really engage the material. Discussion is allowed but has no effect on the lessons, and there is NO application of the material to the real world. This class seemed pointless and hard to follow unless you're a PHL major.
really a nice guy, but that first midterm's a killer
He's very smart and a great professor. He's also very funny.
Interesting class, very reasonable professor who's invested in your learning.

Professor is clearly invested in his students. Approachable for sure and gives amazing feedback. In class, he always seems to brighten the mood with his teaching style and takes the questions of his students seriously. I definitely improved on my writing skills after taking the course. Awesome professor.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Inspirational

comment: He really cares about phil and students - he went out of his way to meet with me in the evenings bc of my busy schedule to make sure I understood concepts. He also helped me with another phil class b/c I was struggling. Lectures are long but philosophy isn't exciting stuff - puts in more effort than any other PhD I know - worthwhile class!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Clearly cares about students. Lectures can get dry and long.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Classes are absolutely useless and extremely boring. Readings are boring and terribly useless, too. Gives good feedback and is a pretty (I'd say overly) cooperative guy with deadlines. Just skip classes when you can (cause participation is part of the grade) and don't waste your time on readings, they don't matter at all for anything.

Professor Rowley is a really good guy The class is boring and very dry, again it's not hard or impossible but Ethics at the Edges of Life is a very dry class, but he's a great guy and it's good he's teaching it. I can say I definitely became a more purposeful writer after taking him. He gives great feedback on your papers so you can correct them
Great professor. He tends to ramble on a bit though. He gives great feedback on papers and is clear about what he wants. Interesting topics as well.
Great professor. Hard class, but interesting

Attendance not mandatory but daily "pop quizzes" (random topics). Lectures are useless. No prerequisites but expects a lot from students. Extremely impatient of students not meeting his OWN expectations (bad temper). Do not take this course.

No exams. Homework every day but easier than cs173. Quiz every class but memorizing notes posted online is enough. Attendance  Participation. Need to know java, python, and C. Homework graded based on effort so more words, better grades.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Interesting guy. Assignments can be confusing or much at times. Very knowledge can go off on random tangents. A lot of work in beginning dies down at the end. No exams

Wasn't strictly a compsci class in the conventional sense. Assignments usually involved answering something like "how much gold is in the ocean" where you're graded on process rather than answer. Not sure why you'd need this course but if you do, he's a nice guy and it's an easy A.

He just let you do lots of no use things. In a computer science class he let you read hundreds of pages of public law files and have a quiz on it! You cannot tell the reason why he has those silly and time wasting assignments for the students.
Great professor with a passion for robotics and CS. He's a genius coated in a relative layer of crazy. Always ready to help at any moment.

He seemed strict in the beginning but turned out to be an amazing person. Sometimes he can seem a little different but mindblowing knowledge on a lot of things. In CS dept he brings in his background of physics and math. Offers frank and good advice. Well spoken person. Genuinely nice person who can be misunderstood easily.

Lectures are completely useless. Required textbooks used only for 5 assignments.  Attendance is not mandatory, but they had to use "daily quizzes" to get people to come (that should say how bad the class is).  Syllabus for class is also terrible. 350 characters are not enough to comment how lousy this prof. or the course actually is.

Liza is one of the best professors that I met in University of Rochester. She is really cared about not only students' studying in lecture but also help student in different perspectives like graduate school application. Highly recommend.

Lectures are a little bit dull, however, her slides and materials are excellent in showing you what you need to know. Interesting topics with lots of applications, and she provides tons of practice material/exam prep for you to do well.

You will learn nothing from this course except for plenty of homework. She also won't give you the reason why your homework receives a low grade. Almost everyone can't follow her in class. Her class materials also have nothing to do with the homework. Ridiculous.
If you value your GPA please don't take this class. You can expect no response when she asks' any questions?', because the entire class were too confused to ask any question.

If you like your GPA please don't take a class with her. She has the worst outdated slides in the world. It is so sad because what she teaches is very interesting but she makes it so boring with her outdated lifeless slides. She would ask "Are you with me" and no one answers and she never revises anything in class. I did well in class thanks udemy.

Very kind professor! Very passionate about teaching and her students' success. I took CIS240 with her last semester and GBA211 with her this semseter and it's been great. Pretty chill class and I've learned a ton of technical skills in my field. Highly recommend!

This course covers material that is quite relevant for any major, as I've found the coursework to be applicable to other classes I'm currently enrolled in. She's, again, a caring woman that wants her students to do well and it shows. The only issues stem from the University forcing her to take care of too many students that are enrolled.

Professor Mohr has a sense of humor that's evident from her teaching style. She's a nice, warmhearted woman that teaches with clear grading instructions. The class was valuable and it's clear that she valued the input of her students. I strongly recommend taking this class, as I learned a lot and have since found the skills quite relevant.

Seplaki is not the worst professor I've had; he's test-heavy but has homework, quizzes, and other assignments (readings). Lectures are pretty much the textbook, just simplified (I just read the textbook and came to lecture for the questions). Homework is time-consuming, but answers are in the textbook (the textbook is easy to understand).

Everything revolved around 3 tests. Loved the structure, but didn't like when the tests were harder than any of the work we did before. Everything can be done online, and all from the textbook, word for word. He has a lot of passion for his field, I just don't think a blanket intro class is where he thrives.

Dr seplaki is amazing and so passionate about public health. Lectures are CRUCIAL to attend if you want to succeed since the class is graded by two tests and a few low weighted homework assignments. He is very caring and always will stop to explain something more if you ask. He is hard to reach outside of class but always stays late for questions.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: He's available for help, but for a limited time. Class is only based on a few items graded, overall it's test heavy. His exams are very difficult and worth a lot compared to the couple of assignments given, which are worth very little of your grade. Lectures are mostly guest speakers and sometimes asynchronous, but they're pretty straightforward.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Two exams make up 70% of your grade, so it's really hard to get a good grade if you don't do well on the exams. Lectures are pretty boring and not really anything new if you've taken PH classes before. Tests aren't super difficult, but hard to study for because questions are a little random and tricky. HW is long but easy and graded easily.

Once in a while, we had an interesting lecture. But overall, the lectures were boring, and the test questions were unfair. He asks very specific questions about a quote that a guest lecturer had on their slides. He also gives very time-consuming assignments that require us to write several paragraphs, and we usually only get five points for them.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: HWs are stupid easy, tests are specific and difficult. He provides no materials to study, is barely at lecture at all because of guest lecturers. Course policies are insane, 89.99% gets rounded down. Late HW by 1 min is 0. Only way to get an extentino is providing DOCUMENTED proof of an illness or family emergency. Overall, very unpleasant class.

grading system = absurd. Students can only get 100 points TOTAL in the class: 2 exams 40 points each and 4 homework assignments 5 points each. The homeworks take a lot more work/time for just 5 points toward grade, which really annoying. I'd say that the exams consisted of very specific topics/facts from modules, so kind of asked a lot. Leplaki
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: He literally is the least flexible professor I have ever had at the UofR. He gives no feedback on his grading and does not allow any extra credit or help. He didn't even show up for like 4 weeks because there were guest lecturers. Unfortunately, this class is required for public health majors but take it with caution.

He is very clear about grading policies from the start, and encourages lots of questions regarding class guidelines. I took 102 online and I think the open note and open book policies during tests were great, I recommend watching the lectures too b/c 70-80% of exams are based on lecture material (including guest lectures!). Overall, pretty easy.

I really enjoyed Guillaume's class! I found him slightly intimidating, but hes very personable and happy to help. He also has the patience of a saint--I would have lost it several times if I were him, but he's always level-headed. He's also very funny, definitely laugh at his dad jokes! He set a good foundation for ASL & I'm excited to learn more.

Guillaume is one of the most passionate professors I have ever had. He truly cares about helping his students excel and improve. That being said, this is an intermediate class, so outside practice will be required for an a. It will not just happen from going to lecture. Put in the work! He is a super fun guy.

He is an extreamly strict teacher and does not care or understand the impact of his harsh grading on student GPAs. It doesnt matter how well you did on an assignment he will always look for your faults to lower your grade. If you want to enjoy learning ASL while also having a realistic grade reflecting your work I recommend taking another teacher.

Guillaume is an amazing professor and person. He is caring about his students and is knowledgeable and clearly explains the materials he discusses. He allows the classroom to be an equally respectable space for students and shows interest in their questions. He clarifies materials well and responds well to questions. Would definitely take again!!

I struggled a lot the semester I took this class and he was so great in helping me get at least a B so I could take more ASL classes. He is kinda a hard grader but his feedback is always helpful. He tries his best to make his class entertaining so please laugh at his dad jokes. Also there's some in person events so prepare for that.
Alright, I might just be awful at ASL, but this professor is a REALLY tough grader. I genuinely don't think I could be trying harder and I'm still doing poorly. RIPs to my GPA.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: I have been wanting to learn ASL for the longest time and honestly I'm so glad that I had the opportunity to be taught by Prof. Chastel. Since he, himself, is deaf, he is passionate about making sure that his student not only learn how to properly sign, but teaches about the culture. I loved his class and I'm excited to be having hime again for 102

He does a wonderful job providing feedback for students on their signing and is extremely patient with students when they struggle to understand. This was especially helpful with much of class on Zoom this semester. He genuinely cares about his students and is an engaging teacher who gives students lots of opportunity to practice in class.
He's a nice person, just go to his class and you will get extra credit.

Kind professor who wants you to succeed; to really do well though, focus on reading and understanding the textbook at a moderate pace. He really only covers a very specific set of materials in preparation for exams; if you know how to do all the problems on the exam review guides for the midterm and final, you will 100% do well on the exams.

Professor Roman is a great person who really wants to believe the best in all of his students. His lectures are a bit tough to follow at times, so the textbook was a great resource during the semester. He presents A LOT of opportunities for extra credit, so while the class is tough, it is hard to fail it if you try.

Unfortunately, the professor presents condensed slides on lectures which prevents the student from catching up. The classroom is big, and the professor's voice cannot be heard clearly from the third row. There were extra credits on homework, but because of one student cheating, the professor uncounted all hw grades for all students. High grade % ex
He is the worst lecturer I've ever had .
Professor Roman is a great Professor. He gives comprehensive lectures and really helpful review sessions. He's a really nice guy who wants students to get good grades.
He is a really good guy. Students love him and he has good reputations on the field.

Kind of tough, thick accent.  He is a really nice guy though.  Sometimes it is hard to follow his lectures, as he is a good bit smarter than his audience :).  Overall not too bad... no 'trouble free' course either though.
He's nice.
I was in his class two years ago, he's great at explaining new concepts, but you have to really focus on the lecture.
He's very helpful and offer extra office hour.
He showed lots of examples in the class, which is helpful for me to understand the concepts.
He literally cannot teach . Hell do the math hisself on the board and give his own un understandable explanation .
He's nice, knows lots of stuff and very helpful.
The instructor is good but this course is so difficult to me. His office hour helped me a lot.
This guy is smart and the lecture is amazing. One thing you need to be aware of is that the exam (especially the midterm) can be so hard but the grade is curved in the end.
Homework is difficult.
Voice clear and easy to understand. Best professor ever!
Hes a good professor.
The best math professor in the UR math department. Lectures are crystal clear and he would listen to student's ideas with respect.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Explain things pretty clear. Make students' life easier.
Not a super interesting person, but incredibly clear and just teaches everything incredibly well. Made learning a hard topic seems super easy

Professor Amelotte is a great math teacher! He gives very clear lectures in class and he reviews the same topic multiple times. Lectures are are rarely too easy to be boring, but also never too difficult. 10/10 would recomend!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Lecture heavy

comment: Hes so caring and a good lecturer in general. Makes my life easier

Easily the worst professor I've had, which is saying something at U of R.  Lectures are unbearable, homeworks are useless and tedious, and he is cold and unapproachable out of class.  If it weren't for the textbook I would have failed.
Lecture are terrible, has a very thick accent and small writing so understanding him is difficult. The book is what will get you through exams.
Terrible public speaker, and no interest in the students.
The most painful class I've ever taken.  The lectures are horrible.  Very little work made it ok.
Heavy Accent. Nice guy. My god the worst lectures ever, second only to his Advanced Materials 50 overheads/class lectures.
crap book, examples have nothing to do with HW. good guy but pretty boring. helpful if you take the time to approach him.
Go Hong!  Very nice man!  Go talk to him!
No Comments
Excellent course

Prof. Orr was absolutely amazing. Her lectures were crystal clear and she tried her best to explain the material to make sure everyone understood.
