She is always willing to hear out questions and if she doesn't know the answer she will seek it out for you. Tests are much easier than the homework. She is super nice with partial credit. Amazing class!
Really helpful both inside and outside class. Easy exams.
Best professor I've ever had.

GREAT professor. She really tries to make sure that each person understands, and offers many examples in lectures. however, this makes the class move slowly. she has a strict homework policy, but other than that and the slow pace, i'd recommend her

I had her for 2 classes (soph level E&M) and Quantum (the easier one).  She is a very good teacher and you can tell she cares about teaching (unlike a lot of other professors).  She always answered questions at extra help and seems to take a genuine interest in her students.  Def recommend her.

She moves at an appropriate pace for a quantum class.  She has a very strict homework policy, but other than that, she's fairly lenient.  She has reasonable expectations of the class and makes an attempt at proving something on a whim if someone asks a quesiton.  She is interesting lecturer.

She's kind of like a robot that's been programmed to teach a course in physics, as opposed to an actual professor. Watch her recite University policy verbatum if you ask her a question outside of class.

He's not a bad person, but he is a terrible lecturer. Unclearly, unorganized, and dully explained, I never learned anything from his lectures and self-taught myself everything straight out of the textbook and with Sapling.
Does not lecture well, does not teach material effectively, hard to understand, teaches irrelevant things, tests are okay.
Tests are straightforward; he's friendly and will write you a good recommendation if you come to office hours and participate in class.

Do not take this class with this professor. His lecture style is confusing and frustrating, especially if you haven't taken AP Chem, but even if you have. He doesn't post lecture slides and works out of his notebook on a chalkboard, speaks in an accent, and makes frequent mistakes on example problems. His thoughts and notes are jumbled.

For being a part of his first class he ever taught, I have no problem with him. His accent isn't bad, just stop him and ask him to explain whenever he explains something in a way that you don't get. He won't go on until he explains it to you the right way. He is only going to get better the more he teaches. He has very interesting ideas/lectures.
Tests were easy, and he really makes some chem concepts seem interesting.  Some people didn't 132 but that's because the farrar/prezhdo combination was bad.  By himself, Prezhdo was great!
Please avoid prezhdo. His lecture style is awful.  He cannot organize his thoughts. Doesn't always know the material and can't stay away from tangents about the Russia.
fair lectures

OMG!  this class sounded interesting until you are in it!  SO so so so so much work and its overloading the subject matter where you cant really get into it or learn much, just worried more about finishing the ridiculous amount of assignments.  She is a nice teacher and  smart, just gives way too much work.  Would suggest against her classes.

Glover is a pretty decent lecturer, though she sometimes makes mistakes. She uses technology a lot better than some of the other professors (digital lecture notes, class notes online) which can be helpful if you miss lecture and means you don't need the textbook much. Very helpful and patient during her office hours. Tests are medium difficulty.

MTH161 Fall'14 Dr. Glover is an extremely intelligent and organized math professor. Her notes are clear, concise and neat! Truly wants you to learn! Do not miss lecture because she explains everything in detail. Tests are medium difficulty! Always seek help during office hours and do not fall behind! Definitely take her class again hands down!
I loved Dr. Glover for 164. She's very organized with her notes and will always help you understand the material. I would most definitely take her classes again.

I absolutely love Dr. Glover, but I suck at Math and really hate it. I attend her office hours every week. She is extremely approachable and tries to help me understand the content. I just really struggle with math so my grade is low, regardless, I can tell she is a great professor. Would take for 162 if she was teaching it.

Look at the rater interest on the poor reviews - usually the interest is directly correlated with the rest of the ratings. Dr. Glover loves math and does a good job teaching it as well. If something is unclear in class, she will do whatever it takes to clear up the confusion during office hours. If you want to do well in her class, you can.

Dr. Glover is not very helpful at all, she is often confused during lectures and is all over the place. She is one of those professors who are really smart, but they have no clue how to teach. I would recommend taking the class with someone else.

Glover certainly knows her calculus and knows how to gradually convey it. She teaches it so neatly and clearly that you can't help but fall in love with math! She's also really helpful during office hours.
Bridy was a great teacher for MTH 161. Go to his office hours because he helps a lot and clarifies the important concepts you need to know for the exam.

His lecture is very clear and organized. His notes on the board are very tidy and clear. Exam difficulty is fair. His office hours also help a lot and would like to answer questions. A great professor!!!

This guy is a pretty average math teacher. He knows his stuff, and answers questions accurately and helpfully. If Bridy's math class fits your schedule the best, take the class. He's by far not the worst math professor.

He's genuinely a nice person who just loves math. He tries very hard to make sure the material is accessible to all students and does a good job fully answering any question he is asked. Overall just there to help. Occasionally will spend too much of a lecture on the basic info and throw all the harder stuff in at the end but he's always clear.

He was amazing. Always answered questions, and really loved the subject matter. Would change lectures to help those who weren't understanding what was being taught, and was very aware of different learning styles. Honestly, one the best teachers I have ever had.

Professor Bridy really knows his stuff. He always explains topics clearly and if you follow through the course and do the work you definitely should come out doing great. If you get stuck or confused, he does an awesome job of explaining in office hours.

Really great guy. Loves math and is really good at explaining concepts and answering questions. For MTH 150, don't focus too hard on the proofs he gives since they aren't in the exams. All examples he gives are useful and matter the most.

Really sweet guy. He is very clear, organized and definitely knows his stuff.  He does tend to breeze through some of the more complicated topics, forgetting that we're not all PhDs, so he's a little difficult to keep up with at times. However, he is very encouraging, takes all questions and requests seriously and respectfully, and loves math!

Bobkova is amazing and it is extremely obvious that she loves what she does. Overall, go to class, do the optional homework if you don't understand it very well, and bring questions. She's not very lenient on the grades at the end so put in the work and try to be at the top of the class because that's how you get an A.

She's alright if you have previous experience with the material, say, if you had taken some not-pre-calculus before. But if you haven't, then you should steer VERY clear. She talks in a very heavy accent, very fast, and she makes ample mistakes, some of which are critical to understanding. She looks away from the chalkboard maybe once every 10 min.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Prof. Bobkova is adorable. She's an enthusiastic lecturer, and leaves lots of time for student questions: she will stop lecture and stare the class down until someone asks a question, so bring some to class. The material can be challenging, but she's pretty good at explaining it. If you do the problems in the textbook and study, you'll be fine.

This class is HARD. The final is 20 pages long. Her lecture was literally her running back and forth along the chalk board writing down her notes from a piece of paper she brought with her.  She gets confused and disorganized during her own explanations. If you gotta take 161 instead of 141, find a different professor.
It is extremely hard to pass this course if you did not take Calc AB in high school. She is very confusing and moves VERY fast.
Not very helpful only talks to the board and absolutely flies when writing. Never gives enough time to read what is on the board. Very tough to get a good grade in her class.

Irina Bobkova is not a very clear professor, and this is not just because of her thick accent. She teaches Calculus in a very roundabout way that is hard to follow. I would not recommend her as a professor.

Super energetic, really bubbly, opens up room for questions often, for 142 slows down on tougher subjects and provides lots of examples, but as homework (Webwork) and exams are managed by the Department, her examples don't often translate to work. 161 was hardest class ever. Webworkexams made no sense. Wolfram Alpha is a godsend. Take 140 track.

Lectures are straight out of the book.  I skipped 90% of the classes, finished with an A- Tests are ok, but his grading sucks.  Questions are vague but grading is HARSH.  Lot's of "describe briefly" questions, then he'll take off half credit for not answering exactly how he wanted.  Write every detail you can remember if you hope to do ok!

I had Mcnabney for Animal Behavior and Physio - he was my favorite professor at U of R. You have to work hard for an A, and his tests are really difficult and nit-picky, but not impossible. People complained about the difficulty level, but its not that bad if you have a good work ethic. He's a really nice guy too, makes nerdy little jokes.

Course material is interested and recommended. Exams are frequent and difficult because they cram 7-8 chapters - all memorization based. I would take the class, but make sure you have a lot of time to devote to it. Class is not curved and you have to get high grades on exams to get a good grade - Not an "Easy A" class. Worth it for pre-med students
He made the class interesting and the material easy to learn by using videos, lots of examples, and class discussions. I learned  a lot in his class (when I was not too busy staring at him lol).

Worst professor I have ever had. He relies solely on the textbook and does not explain the material well in class. He just lectures straight from the book and it is clear that he has trouble keeping the classes attention. Definitely stay far away from Mcnabney!

Very interesting class. He is more than willing to answer questions via email or meeting, and he really gets you interested in the subject. Reading the textbook will definitely help you understand the lecture material
He is really interested about what he teaches. He can be a little confusing during lectures though but overall a good teacher. Attendance is mandatory
Great professor! Made class interesting. Readings were intense, but he was a very easy professor.

I like Emmett because she is open minded.  Also, her Rochester seeds program is very inspiring.  I hope students recognize that she is bringing a foreign perspective to American anthropology.  (This is a GOOD thing.)

Emmett is awesome. You read great books and have lots of discussions. She is so nice and I really liked this class. She can be a little unclear but she will help you as much as you need. If you participate in class you have nothing to worry about. How!
awful teacher who subjectively grades based on her feelings toward you. very unwilling to help. never take  her class. not a bad person,just unfair professor
One of the worst professors I've ever had. Gives the same grade on every paper regardless of quality. Class is repetative and extrememly boring.I would not recommend this class to anyone.
not helpful
Oh Emmett and your accent
She might have spent a little too much time in the mountains of Tibet, but she's a great woman.
She's an interesting combination of Voldemort and Professor Umbridge. But seriously, I would rather go into the Forbidden Forest than take her class.
I didn't wear a seat belt in the car ride to this class because I wasn't sure if I wanted to survive the drive.

She mislead multiple students about the requirements for the final paper (while refusing to admit this) and did not answer questions clearly. The lectures were very interesting, but the assignments are horrible-- page limits are impossibly low, and then she takes off points for not including more specifics. She's smart but needs to learn to teach.

Professor Hazelton is very knowledgeable about her subject but her class has several drawbacks. She tends to heavily penalize anyone who disagrees with her and she refuses to admit a mistake she has made. She is very susceptible to flattery and be ready to do this or you won't do well in her class.

I highly regret taking her class IR228 discuss. She has killed all the passion I had for International Relations. I did not find her helpful. She has made my Spring 2012 semester at the UofR difficult. Very sarcastic too.She is very happy to give you an F even if you show up to class, participate and write your papers.
She is very helpful, but expects you to work very  hard. If you want an easy course, do NOT take a class with her.

If you are interested in international security, Hazelton is the way to go. She expects you to do your reading and come to lecture, but you can learn a lot. She is also great about answering questions outside of class.
This class provided a great opportunity for design and provided the tools for practical engineering problem solving.
Great guy... Interests mostly in environmental issues...
No Comments
Really nice guy...doesn't run a very tight ship.
Good professor, advisor.  Very helpful, nice.  One I actually got to know.  Just some problems with organization, slowness.
An awesome guy. Very interesting and interested about environmental issues. Relaxed and informal in a good way.
He sucks!  His status should be GONE! AVOID!!

I heard this course is good and it wasnt. It was GREAT! Professor Jorne has been teaching a long time but stays so up to date he is amazing. He knows whats happening with fuel cells, electric cars etc. In my four years here he is in the top three of my favorite professors. He is very encouraging and very patient. Hard tests but grades fairly.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Dr Jorne is a great professor. You will learn so much and he is on top of his field. Any question you have in Microelectronics Processing he can either answer or work together to find the answer. You can tell he likes to teach and really likes lively students who care about learning. If he sees you making an effort he will help you achieve.

Prof Jorne teaches well. I took his course on Separation and learned so much. He does a great job of explaining things in a way you can really understand. He is always available to students and will give good career advice in addition to course advice. Also, if you like basketball, hes your guy! Seriously though, he is smart and funny and kind.
Great professor, very smart. Has changed my outlook.

Scattered, unclear, boring, unprepared.  He has a decent understanding of most material but can't convey it to students.  Horrible planning of exams and scheduling.  His exams were also not at all a good representation of what was taught or covered in HW.  He gave very poor descriptions of what would be covered on exams.
Can't explain course basics. Uses a poor textbook.  Doesn't seem to want to be around students.

has in-depth knowledge but lacks proper skills to communicate with students.  very unsteady in terms of mental mood stability and is prone to lash out on students.  not very engaging and helpful with graduate students. no innovative ideas for research.

One of the worst professors I've encountered. Doesn't notice when people are trying to ask questions. Basically recites what is in the textbook (which itself isn't the most clear) but in a less clear way. Macro is hard and she somehow makes it harder. Homework and exam questions are a huge leap above what is taught.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: If you value your time or sanity do not take this class. Yena Park is easily the departments poorest professor. She is not good at explaining concepts and rushes through things in class. The exams are very difficult and she does not do a good job of preparing students to do well on exams. I'm not even sure why she got hired. Bad teacher all around.
Get ready to teach yourself everything you need to know.
- Lectures are very boring.  - Doesn't encourage class participation. Almost never pauses for questions.  - Almost never looks at the students to see if anyone's raised their hand.
Poor Lecturer. Very heavy accent makes it hard to understand. Little to no Explanation of topics. Misunderstands questions all the time. Avoid her as a professor at all costs.
Very poor lecturing. Gives almost no explanation to anything, explanation that she does give is poorly worded.

I can't believe the U of R takes themselves seriously with Yena Park on staff. She can barely speak English, is horrible at explaining concepts, doesn't adequately answer questions, and is hard to access after class (1 hour office hours per week). It sucks you can't always avoid her with 209, but, if you can, please do.
Don't take his class

So many homework worst course I have ever taken. Useless Professor read the book in class all the time and make lots of mistakes. HW is so difficult and long. No curve at all!!! Dont take any course with him.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: In the first half of the course, I found it hard to follow Professor Xuwen. The second half of the semester. He was knowledgeable and gave great lectures on topics related to options. Tests are fair, and his grading system is well-designed and curved already.

His lectures are (less understandable) repetitions of the textbook. He occasionally makes basic but important mistakes and refuses to acknowledge them. A LOT of homework with both hard and tedious problems but almost no enlightening insights to the material as a whole. Math to him is just a matter of repetitive practicing.

He's a great prof! The class is hard, and there is a lot of homework just by nature of the topic, but his lectures were great, and he would sometimes talk about interesting applications/examples of the material. He was also always helpful during office hours for any questions about the homework or class in general.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Amazing professor. The course is very challenging, but if you attend lectures and work hard, you will learn a lot. Professor Chen is very approachable outside of the class and always being so supportive and enthusiastic.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback

comment: Hard to understand

10/10 professor, he is so funny, lectures are AMAZING. The class this semester was only graded on 12 HW assignments which were not hard at all. His office hours are so AMAZING. I also took Math 285 with him this semester and the same thing. He is very much into PDEs and I love his research and he inspired me to go after PDEs.

Professor Chen is great! He is very enthusiastic about the material and brings a lot of context into his lectures, for example which theorems were handy in his own research... His office hours are very helpful and pretty much helped me survive the course. This class is very demanding but also incredibly rewarding, you will learn a lot!
This course is very challenging but Professor Chen is very enthusiastic when giving the lectures and can make everything easier to understand.

Very understanding and nice guy!!!! Lectures were kinda boring but recorded. He made a lot of mistakes during his in-class demos but sent us fixed versions after class. But no exams and all the assignments were easy. Easy A
easy class, just keep on top of the material. do well on homeworks!!

This class is pretty easy whether you have programming background or not. He explains everything assuming that no one has any background in programming, so if you do, then the lecture will be a little boring but they are definitely really helpful. The homeworks are all pretty easy and workshops prepare you well for the midterm and final.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Beware of pop quizzes--Accessible outside class

comment: Very easy course as an intro level programming course, however, professor does not understand the essence of teaching programming languages and instead tried to teach it like math. Mandatory attendance. Lots of opportunities for extra credit however.

This class is really easy whether or not you have coding experience. He does come across as a pretty new professor and his lectures often cover topics that you don't really need to know. Homeworks can range from  easy to impossible, and tests are extremely easy as long as you go over the slides before. He's a really nice guy and is very approchable

This guy is absolutely amazing. Many people dont attend his lectures because he makes his slideshows (which he posts) super easy to follow Ive also texted him on slack at 10pm and hell be working with me past midnight to work on things. Basically, if you wanna learn to web dev, hell teach you. If you dont, you can still get an A

Andrew Read-McFarland isn't a bad professor, but he comes off as a very new professor and is not incredibly engaging :(. I enjoyed most of the course, but towards the end, the assignments became quite convoluted in their instruction. Plus, lecture was far ahead of the lab, which made going to lecture less valuable. He seems really nice though!
Hoozori's lectures were boring and he only goes over basic example problems in class. Then when doing the homework I would feel unprepared because of the easiness of the lectures problems.
I can't understand his handwriting
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: It's impressive how he made something as complex as differential equations and linear algebra so understandable. FYI I rarely used the textbook in this class so it's not essential (it helps some people though). I also recommend doing the written homework because even though it's not worth that much it's a great learning tool. Also lectures are fast
has got to easily be one of the worst professors here at u of r.

Took this class over the summer. Would suggest you to try to avoid taking it with him if you can. He's a nice guy, but his explanations can be confusing and complicated. Way easier to find a simple explanation online to teach you. Spent a lot of lectures confused and had to essentially reteach myself material outside of class.

Ik he's trying his best and cares about his students, but his lectures just weren't clear and his handwriting is messy so I spend a lot of time in class just trying to figure out what he's writing. He makes mistakes a lot and it can be hard to understand what he's saying sometimes.

Hoozori is a pretty good teacher, but he can be a bit dry. He explains all the concepts pretty well so as long as you put in effort outside of lecture you should be fine. But he does tend to skip a lot of steps for problems or overcomplicates things a bit. Tests are fair and he does a great job of taking things slow when he knows topics are hard.

By far one of the best professors I've ever taken. He's very insightful and gives excellent feedback on your writing. The readings only last a few weeks before you begin writing your own fiction. Workshops might seem scary, but he makes sure everyone is respectful and engaging, so it's more fun than anything. If you get the chance, take his class!

Provides the perfect atmosphere for an introductory creative writing course. The workshop aspect of this class might be intimidating, but he ensures that your stories are discussed in a productive and respectful manner. Highly recommend.

David's great! He facilitates student discussion really well and makes sure everyone's voices are heard. There's a couple short stories to read a week, but the workload is VERY manageable and he gives plenty of time for writing assignments. When work is being workshopped in class, the discussion is always very respectful. HIGHLY RECOMMEND
Without a doubt one of the best professors I've ever had. If you ever have the opportunity to be in one of his sections I would absolutely take it.
Best course taken by far at the university.

Took it last semester; even in an online setting, he made sure everyone got the chance to contribute and created a very open and non-judgmental environment. Made me cry in workshop lol but he really thought he was complimenting my story.

He's a great professor! In online class, he made sure that everyone felt heard and that people were able to speak about the readings we did. Also, the readings were only for about the first two weeks in this class, before you started writing 5-page minimum (double spaced) stories (fiction). After we critiqued each other's stories and it was fun!

He's a great teacher--writes a ton of helpful feedback, funny, approachable, brings SNACKS to class. If anything he's too nice. He seemed to genuinely care about everyone in the class and was always encouraging and kind I highly recommend taking a class with him if you can, it's a blast and you'll learn a lot.

Loved having professor hansen for eng121, he always made our entire class laugh and still have great discussions on the stories we were reading, whether they were published or during the workshop. Highly recommend!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Hilarious

comment: Prof. Chaves is a bore to listen to lecture and does not do a great job of explaining material. Like all math courses here they are ungodly difficult for no reason. He did care and was open to questions and would help but was not very good at getting the material to click with students and went very slow in lecture.
has got to easily be one of the worst professors here at u of r.

MATH 200: Easily worst professor and class Ive ever taken. He does not care about his students. Contents in lecture and hw do not match, sometimes hw has content not in textbook. This class is to prepare us for math proofs but he DOES NOT PREPARE ANYTHING and expect us to write like we know everything. Not even a hard class but harsh af grading.

I have never had a professor who makes more mistakes than him. EVERY SINGLE assignment has a mistake on it and there are 10 emails of me CORRECTING HIM. IM THE STUDENT I SHOULDNT BE CORRECTING THE PROF. THERE WERE MISTAKES ON THE FINAL, MULTIPLE IN FACT. He is so disorganized and such a harsh grader and isn't lenient at all. Avoid if possible.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Professor chaves has one of the best methods of going throught examples. His notes are also a piece of art, more than enough to study everything with examples and be able to answer questions in homework and lectures. He made discrete math an easy A for me!
This guy is great. He's a talented mathematician and can cast light on some really difficult topics. The class is difficult, but he does a great job of showing the more beautiful side of mathematics.
really good!! hard to pay attention in class, because its pretty boring/monotone, so its easy to doze off

I took his surveys class at SBU. He is a really chill professor. Whenever I needed extensions, he was always understanding and whenever I needed extra help, he was there. The class itself is not the worst, but if you're not good with statistics or using software like excel or SPSS, don't take the class since most assignments require its usage.

Lectures are boring but contain a lot of useful material. Great insight on quantitative analysis. There's a sign-in sheet, but you can work on other projects if you feel like sleeping in class. You can use class readings and outside research for the assignments. Handwritten feedback isn't always useful, but he's very accessible outside of class.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Michael is a good instructor. Lectures are kinda boring, though. Most of the grade is based on a 15 page paper about a single piece of legislation. Meet with him beforehand, and during the writing process hell help you out. Always accessible. Quick replies. I barely read any of the assigned readings though. Still did fine. No exams, just writing.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Caring

comment: No written feedback on assignments. Hard to hear. He spends the lectures going through slides (too fast) and discussing statistical trends/theoretical scenarios rather than basic congressional mechanisms. He doesn't go over the readings and neither they nor the lectures are needed for the assignments. Stony Brook University.

The only class I've ever taken in 4 years that I can honestly say by the end of the semester I had no idea what was going on. He expected poli sci students to understand SPSSS without ever going over it and his lecturesnotes provided no additional clarity and when I asked for help I had my question reworded to me. I would never recommend
He is really easy.  Really nice guy.  He will help you all the way through the class. Not a ton of work. Slides posted online.  Kinda boring at times, but it's a good A.

The book is helpful for the first half of the class! The second half you have to read his lecture notes and go to class. The professor himself is not really interesting or exciting at all. He's quiet so sit near the front of the class. Recitation is KEY for homework help. Sign up for Martin's section if you can.
Prof Rubel seems to genuinely care about her students and assigns interesting articles.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: AMAZING! Will definitely take more of her Women's Studies classes in the future!

Classes were painfully boring. I didn't learn anything. Textbook was not useful at all. I got a good grade, but I'm pretty sure she didn't read any of my essays. Anyway, she was very nice and funny. Also, she assigned great books and movies (although you won't have time to do them during the course, because she assigns way too many of them).

Overall, the class was okay, but was not as interesting as I had hoped. She is also very easily distracted and rarely stays on topic. As a course I did not enjoy it very much and didn't learn very much. I think that she is probably a decent teacher, but this class was not her strong point and she didn't always know what she was talking about.
She's a little spacy when it comes to e-mails.  She's a pretty easy grader and a pretty good professor.  She gets really angry when people don't do the readings but understandably so.
she's pretty easy...its pretty sweet
A great professor! I had her in my first semester of freshman year and she made me become a religion major. Very personable and completely reasonable with work/assignments required.
Not too interesting in class. Speaks real slow, but is a fair grader and organizes awesome specially curated trips into the archives of George Eastman House.
Good professor. Explains things well, likes discussion.
Boring lecture with awkward questions (followed by awkward silences); unclear syllabus/assignments.

Lectures can be kind of boring and important material kind of hard to pick out. Field trips to George Eastman House can be interesting, though. She is flattered when students take interest and asks questions during her lectures. Sometimes she pulls material out of no where for the test though. You really do get a good base knowledge. Lenient grader
excellent teacher
interesting subject, knowledgeable teacher--looking at slides in the dark makes you want to sleep every time though.

She's nice but the class is rather boring. The material could be interesting but she talks from the second you walk in until class is over. She expects you to already know a lot even though it was an INTRO class.
Make sure to do the extra credit assignments ;) She is a lot better than you think

She splits class each week into two sections: first call of the week is "lecture" and the second is "small" group interaction with the 3 TA's about the readings for that week. She's one of those "Yeah I don't want any screens in my classroom", and is a bit condescending when you ask questions about exams/assignments. Don't take her class.

She's really cute and entertaining. Her film class is actually pretty fun and I'm glad I took it. Her tests are really not that bad, but attendance does matter and the movies can be kind of boring sometimes.
She is great, absolutely inspirational and awesome.  I took two more classes with her :)

doesn't go over any vocabularies or technical terms in class but expects you to know them on the exams. makes exams harder than they need to be for an intro class. doesn't care about students' grades.
She is very condescending. Be prepared to be treated like a 4 year old. Film choice for class was terrible. I hated this course. You'll be fine as long as you read the book.
Very inspiring, very knowledgeable.  Has very high expectations.

One of the best professors I have had at the U of R.  He has a way of making concepts clear like no other professor I have had.  Very organized, and I knew exactly what to expect from the first class.  Great feedback on papers.  Reading load VERY manageable, and I am a SLOW reader. I highly recommend taking a class with him before you graduate.

All in all a good professor. He can be a bit repetitive when describing concepts or answering questions, but if you can keep yourself from spacing out then you'll pick up a lot from lectures. I took this as a tertiary humanities requirement, so I'm not the most philosophically minded person, but Meerbote made the class enjoyable for me.
Great guy, strong teacher.  He was kind of obsessed with the disease jaundice which was funny.  He wears yellow sunglasses all the time.  It was cool.

I just started this class. I just like this guy: Smart, dry wit, concerned, and others reasons. Type of teacher you should just try listening to, whether you or I get a bad grade; though he really doesn't seem to like class when he has to do all the talking, but he's very well spoken and good at talking when he must.

I've had him for 202 and 261 (Kant seminar). His expertise in early modern philosophy, especially Kant, is remarkable. Knows the major treatises of the 18th century inside and out. Conversations with him can be a little less than satisfying when trying to get at philosophical concepts outside of 18th century terminology.
Very effective.  I know exactly what he set out to teach.
He's the most old school professor you'll have. He doesn't even have a computer. He knows what he's teaching, but if you aren't prepared for class it won't be fun.

Really did not like this class. First off it was every day which was super annoying but then you had to basically memorize tons of vocabulary words every night and the next day she would quiz you on words from weeks ago and would get mad if kids didn't remember them. Came off as super judgey, so I wasn't a fan. Also the textbook is super expensive

Cara professoressa! She taught so much about Italian language and culture in this class (I took it at the Eastman campus). There is a lot of homework (homeworks as she calls them :) ) but its helpful. She really wants students to succeed and to participate actively. Grazie mille professoressa!
Cares about students and really wants to see us succeed. Class was pretty easy, as long as you actually put in the work to do the online homework and study for the quizzes you really can't go wrong.

Hands down the best teacher I've ever had. She's a native speaker of Italian, so you will get way more out of her class than you would from some of the other Italian profs. She's incredibly organized, kind, clear and is always willing to help you learn material outside of class. I really can't recommend her enough!!
She is the sweetest little Italian woman. Since Italian is her first language, she is a very effective teacher. As long as you do your homework, you will do fine on all of the quizzes and tests.

Her class is very easy compared to the other sections of intro italian. Take it with her and you're most likely to get an A. You can't really not do well in her class. She is a great professor who really cares about her students.
Excellent professor! I've learned so much from her. She cares very much about her students and if you understand the material it is easy to do well. Take IT 101 if only to have this professor!

Good lectures and he explains hard topics simply and clearly! I learned a lot from this class, but there's lots of work to do. I'd recommend it if you really want to learn. This class won't disappoint you:)

JOHN KESSLER IS AMAZING. He is extremely passionate about oceanography and cares about his students. He wants you to succeed in his class. John's lecturers were thought-provoking and informative. He is accessible outside of class and gives his students pre-lecture videos to watch, which helped me understand the class content for that week

One of my favorite classes in the EESC department. The course content is very interesting and professor Kessler is good at lecturing. The only thing I didn't like was the heavy workload, but everything else is fine.

Professor Kessler is passionate about his field, which shows through his engaging lectures. Reading from the textbook is required for the class and it is a rather dry, technical read. Though luckily the Professor also posts short videos for each chapter to help prime students on the concepts it will cover. HWs and tests are reasonable.

There are very few teachers as caring. He wants to hear what students need to succeed. He has an extreme passion towards the subject. He is very transparent with his teaching and explanations. He does repeat stuff in the videos in class, but he pays attention to the discussions to explain concepts in class. Best class I've had in a long time.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: John's Oceanography class was a great time! He is passionate, approachable, and explains concepts very clearly. The workload is manageable, but make sure you're participating consistently. Exams are straightforward and the questions are similar to that of the problem sets, so do the homework! Overall, great course and would recommend for engineers.

John is super great! He is very easy to talk to outside of class, and clearly cares a lot for his students. Tests and homework are almost fully based off lectures, so you have to be in class every day but he is also accommodating if something comes up. He's also very passionate about what he teaches!

Pretty easy A. Workload is a couple of 1-2 page papers. Will make you break out into groups. Otherwise- Funny guy, with entertaining lectures. Never once asked for our names tho (Pretty small class size)

This class was an absolute joke. I learned literally nothing and barely went to lectures after I realized how irrelevant they are. Just show up to the class right before the midterm and final and he will give you all the answers.

You will get an easy A, however you will learn nothing, and if you do learn something it won't be what you expected. The course description is clickbait. If you ever want some humor, just pop in and sit through a lecture, but don't sign up for the class unless you desperately need the grade.

Can be entertaining at times, but no essential material covered. Nothing is needed besides doing the homework, which isn't even explained at times. His TAs are essentially running the entire operation and do not explain anything. Your time is more valuable spent elsewhere. Get used to seeing the same two outfits on him.
Literally learned nothing unfortunately. Really nice guy, but he just rambles and I got nothing out of lecture. You only need to go to the classes before exams in order to do well.

His class was a joke. Our class was a mess, no one paid attention because he was such a bad teacher. None of us learned anything, and we didn't need to because he gave us the answers to the midterm and final, word for word the class before. He was a terrible lecturer. Super unclear. Worst professor I've had here by far. What a joke.
His TA does everything. He uses cursing words a lot but he is fun. And his midterm and final are very easy. He will have test review in the class before exam which is exact same thing on the test.

She is just so nice 😭 I had a panic attack during the exam and I had to leave. She was just so caring and so helpful throughout the whole process. I love her😭 Thanks to her, otherwise I wouldn't have passed the course.

Great lectures, and cares a lot about making sure everyone understands the concepts. I never liked probability in the past but found this class interesting, especially once we got into more complicated math.

Mary Cook is one of the best math professors I ever had! She was accommodating and accessible outside of class. The final was a surprise for all of us since the questions were harder than previous years. Due to the midterm averages being higher than the final averages, our grades were curved. If I studied harder, I could have gotten at least an A-

Dr. Cook is an amazing professor. She is patient and explains things clearly. She's accessible outside of class and always willing to provide support if you ask. Her lecture notes are extremely well-organized, just like her lectures. Def attend her classes. Her office hours are incredibly helpful too. Don't hesitate to ask for help if you need it.

Dr. Cook has extremely concise lectures, but even more concise complimentary notes. She is EXTREMELY accessible outside of class, and will give great advice for non-class related matters such as course selection. I didn't go to class much because the notes were so good, but I definitely recommend going to recitation or study hours. Great professor!

She is a very nice professor who lectures well but the math department at this school is just awful. The exams are difficult and the webwork is harder than 141. She records lectures which is nice and she is accessible outside of class. She also posts filled-in notes and blank notes. Definitely try to get 100% on the webwork and workshop.

I was never able to get above a B+ in a calc class, finally was able to after taking 164 with her. She is so clear and concise when teaching. Everything was thoroughly explained. Exams were difficult though, review her in class examples when studying for an exam.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Test heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Mary Cook is a good professor, explains topics well and is very approachable. If she is teaching multi you are in good shape.

Cook is a great professor, the class is quite difficult tho. All of her examples come directly out of the book. The Webwork is quite challenging. Recommend using prof Leonard on YouTube for help to make the class more manageable.

Coming into college,I thought I wanted to be a math minor. To say the least, I never plan to take another math class again. The homework for this class is ten times more difficult than what we are taught. You basically have to teach yourself everything. I attended math study halls for roughly five hours every week to just get help, and I still bad.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Cook is great, but this course is toooooo difficult

She is so nice. I wouldn't have passed without her. If you need to set up an appointment or her notes, she will get back to you. The material and webwork is still difficult, so I recommend using Paul's Online Notes or CETL alongside the class. One of the best math professors I've had.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: Lecture may be long and a little dull, but if you really like the material, it could still be a good experience.

Stunningly boring, but she's clearly knowledgeable on the subject matter, which is a shame considering her teaching style is about at interesting as watching paint dry. Probably good idea to go to class--I did--but you can just as easily learn the philosophy from the internet with ease.

Dry and boring professor; does no justice to the interesting topics under discussion. Has a lot of expectations but gives no clue to what she expects. Places no value on comprehension of topics and has no care for original thought; she things she tells you what she wants and you know, but you must magically know what she wants to make the grade.

Impossible not to sleep through class. Modrak does the impossible and somehow makes Aristotle and Plato more boring than they already are. Philosophy majors, beware- take this class either as a junior or a senior, seeing as Modrak is a very rigorous grader.

She's enthusiastic but her teaching style (direct from overheads) can be dull at times.  I found that the individual tests are graded somewhat harshly but she was forgiving in the overall course grade.

She is the most boring professor ever. You'll hate going to class, but you have to or you won't be prepared for the tests. She knows her stuff, but it was painful being in her class due to how she lectures.
Ancient Philosophy is really boring but she is really nice and does her best to get discussions going. very nice, helpful and understanding.
Aslin is amazing. Clear, crisp, and presents just the right depth of material for a 100-level class.
rating_tags: CARES ABOUT STUDENTS--Respected by students--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: I took Development of the Mind & Brain with him in spring 2015. He co-taught with Celeste Kidd, and she was good, but I loved lecture days with him. A wonderful, funny guy really passionate about the topic.  I learned SO MUCH. He talked to all of us almost as if we were colleagues, and he valued our opinions.  Take his class! Wonderful professor!

Amazing professor, and he talks to all the students, regardless of previous experience or background, just the same way he talks to other faculty members. He's clear, knowledgable, and, you'd never guess from how much time he makes for all his students... a really productive, famous research scientist on top of everything!  Amazing class.
Best prof I've ever had. Speaks to even intro students as though they are peers and respects their ideas accordingly.

Awesome! A leader in his field, but i don't care about that. What I do care is how nice he is when you go to his office hours and he even helped me and a friend find research labs to work in for the summer. What prof. will go out of there way like that? very rare!
He is a very clear and precise lecturer, and is very fair with students.
Sometimes a little boring in lecture, but overall a great teacher.
All he does in class is work examples from the book, and then get lost. This class was absurd once we got past what I knew from hs calc

Seems like a cool guy, but he's a terrible teacher. During class he just works out the examples from the book and talks to the chalk board.  The class was easy at first because it was just review of my AP calc, but once we got past that point I was lost. I am so glad that I am done with this calc class!

If you took Calculus AB and got a 5, don't think this class will be fine if Ortiz is teaching it.  He doesn't explain a thing.  I thought I understood the first few topics, but that was just because I had already learned the material.  Your text book will definitely be your best friend

Can I just say that he is the hottest thing known to mankind. He is honestly God's gift to women. BEAUTIFUL! I think he's a good teacher too; he's very young but he knows his stuff! And he's always willing to help during office hours. His jokes are corny but very cute. Wonderful body as well!

got better through the semester...i think he's still new to teaching and needs to learn to lighten up some more. he does teach directly from the book, and his lectures are rather pointless, but they make sense at least. the final was not as hard as i feared; pretty fair
No Comments

He seems like a cool guy, but he teaches word for word from teh text book which makes class seem entirely pointless. he also doesnt project his voice so being stuck in the back of the room kind of sucks sometimes.

A nice and funny person, a brilliant researcher, but a very bad lecturer. He just goes through slides and bases classes purely on mathematical equations. The lectures are not engaging and difficult to follow. Exams were very easy - he's a lean grader.
brilliant researcher but not suitable for teaching

Physics113 with him was nothing to write home about. I'm sure he's better at higher-level physics, but struggles to explain physics at a more basic level. Lectures are dry and feature a lot of derivations that are sometimes helpful, often not. You should still attend since he sometimes will get test material from what he says in lecture or workshop
For Intro Physics II, it was miserable.  Like the last post said, lectures were so pointless less than a 1/4 of the class would attend lectures.  Without the book, students would be doomed.

Rajeev is woeful. Students stopped attending lecture because he goes on tangents unrelated to class material. He has a sense of humor, but beyond that no redeeming qualities that merit him teaching a class of UR's caliber
See previous listing -- I concur.

Rajeev is an advanced theorist, but his courses are well-paced and enlightening.  He explains the material in a way approachable to newcomers and still interesting and illuminating to those who "already know it."  Homework assignments are light.  Tests are reasonable.  I recommend him very strongly.

Two exams in total. Weekly assignment, quizzes, and discussion post. He is nice and can extend deadlines for you if you had a good reason. He was inaccessible halfway through the semester with late to no replies. The first exam was more focused on the theory than the code.
Took his class in Fall 2018. One of my favorite professors. Lots of reading and lecture heavy. Exams are super fun and interesting. He clerked on Supreme Court and knows a lot about the subject.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: the best professor i ever had. Extremely intelligent and very helpful. Fair grader. Lectures are very inspiring. Make sure that you are really into the course material though, otherwise the lectures may seem to be too long

His lectures do seem to drag on for quite a while. Yet, if you can take good notes(or get them from a friend), you should not have any issues doing well. If you ever try and talk to him he is very approachable and friendly.

Jackson's best attribute is that he is a legal genius. He provides so much insight into each case. Sometimes his analysis is quite heavy, but he does not expect you to think at the same level as he in exams; students would be at a great disadvantage, seeing that he is the ex-president of the school and is crazy smart.
Not very engaging, but the topics he picked were all relevant to the class. A lot of reading, especially for a topic this dry.

Professor Jackson knows his stuff, he's extremely bright.  Has his law degree from Yale and clerked for Rehnquist on the supreme court.  He likes to get up and just keep lecturing the whole time so it's good to ask him questions.  His tests aren't too hard you just have to study for them.  He's also got some great stories from the supreme court.

Lots of reading... like an insane amount. Interesting class and lectures, but the readings were a toss up--in regards to both enjoyment and relevance. Graded off a few papers and attendance/participation, so get ready to talk. Challenges a lot of assumed norms of history and content wise he really hits the mark, readings just dragged it down.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: I thought the class itself was really interesting, and his lectures were informative. Professor Devaney gives a lot of dense material to read which can get a bit repetitive, especially in discussions. There are only 3 main papers that have flexible prompts; these makeup most of your grade. Could be harder if you're not as experienced with writing.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: He makes the class enjoyable and is a great lecturer. It's not that hard to do well but the readings can feel pointless and unnecessarily long. The papers and tests aren't that bad as long as you go to lecture. He answers questions and you can tell he loves what he's talking about. Do the readings because a lot of the lecture is discussion based.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: Devaney is a really good professor in that he is tough, but he also cares about you. He does make you do some unnecessary reading, but he has a great way of explaining things and making you tie things together. He can get dry in lectures, but it's still a good class if you need an elective.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Provided A LOT of readings for every single class (Had to buy 5 books), which were then discussed in class. The lecture was just an hour of information being thrown at you. Although the professor is lovely and accessible out of class, I felt like the class itself could have been a little less dull and dense.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: Professor was really knowledgeable and helpful. Doesn't give away A's but fairly generous if you do the work.
Lectures are solid background, what made the class are the very interesting readings and discussions, which were well-facilitated.

This was the single most hardest thing I've done. I'm in my last semester with a 4.0 and this class killed it. Subject matter is boring and very paper heavy. Prof Butterfield is also the toughest and nit-pickiest grader I have ever had. It is almost impossible to get an A in his class. Even if your paper is good, he'll find something.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: He is a great professor and really has a natural want for students' improvements. Nice guy, but a little tough to get an A on papers. I received a B on EVERY paper, even though I felt I improved. He shows you where you have rm for improvements and tries to work with u. Very flexible and understanding!

Professor Butterfield is a decent professor. He really wants his students to improve. However, most of his class was spent talking about boring things or really dragging out the conversation unnecessarily. The time spent looking at hand outs could be cut in half. Difficult to get an A on papers. You really have to work hard.

I LOVE shane butterfield! he is so nice and helpful and cares about his students, and knows everything about history but is not cocky at all. everyone interested in history should have shane at least 10 times while at rochester.
No Comments
No Comments
He loves writing and American history.  He is a very kind man, but not a very kind grader.  However, he wants to see you improve, and will do anything to help.

Atmospheric Geochemistry is not an easy class, but definitely one of the most helpful science classes I have taken in college. Professor Petrenko truly cares about his students and his lectures are beyond amazing.

Vas is the best professor I have ever had. He genuinely cares about and enjoys teaching. He is kind/helpful during OHs and his courses are organized/easy to follow. During every class, there are engaging discussion questions that teach you so much about climate science, think about it deeply, and apply it. He made me more passionate about climate.

Vas is a great professor and I highly recommend taking Intro Climate Change! It's a great basis for future Environmental Science courses and gives a great background for an introduction class. If confused, he's super accessible during office hours. If you study the lectures and labs, you'll do well.

Best professor I have had. Really open minded to student ideas and questions and incredibly passionate about climate and his own research. He regularly told off White house climate denial in our class with the most calm demeanor.
He is a very good professor, but beware, even though this class in an intro class, it is harder than expected, but definitely manageable.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Vas is a fantastic professor.  He's incredibly passionate about Climatology and Earth Sciences, and it's clear to me after leaving his course that climate change is a distinct threat to humanity.  I can GUARANTEE you that even if you haven't believed in climate change since you heard about it in 1990, Vas will let you know what's really going down!

He's technically an assistant professor, but he's very passionate about what he teaches, and lectures are really clear. This was the first year the class was taught, but he was really organized and adjusted the schedule when needed. He really wants you to succeed.
Prof. Lee is smart and approachable!

The Origins of the Modern World is the most difficult non-science course I've taken here. But, if you are willing to do the weekly reading and talk in class discussion, totally worth it. Professor Lee is very supportive and explains things well. The reading selections showed how we went from kings and emperors to modern politics.

Very intelligent and has deep understanding of the course. His lectures are very dry though and in this course, if you did all the readings beforehand, the lecture didnt add much to your knowledge. He taught it by assigning research papers each week and then randomly quizzing students on them. Also had a final research proposal and take home final
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Super friendly guy and fascinating lectures. One of my favorite classes ever.
The lectures were really interesting. The one on suicide bombers taught me a lot about the motives of these people.
Though the lectures are long and dry, he is extremely cute!!!!!!!  Fair grader, not that hard to get A No textbook required
Dragging lectures, no passion, very dry.
Extremely knowledgable teacher! Classes are 95% her lecturing on the book. Very straightforward, and the content is interesting. You have to pay attention though, and attend the recitation.

She's a great teacher. I took her year-long Dante course in 2001-2002 and loved it. My favorite course in college. She's a genius, willing to work with students outside of class, and passionate about the subject. The class was challenging, but it was fantastic. It inspired me to take more classes with her and in Italian language and literature.
This class was so much like high school we even had a library session. She dumbs the discourse with her teaching style. Also, BAD TAs.
Brilliant woman, amazing class, learned a ton. DONT MISS THIS GREAT COURSE
I fell asleep in her class every day. She just jumps into lectures and starts babbling. Although she is certainly knowledgable, she killed Dante for me.
Best professor Ive ever had. Absolutely brilliant, approachable, nice, and clear. Fascinating lecturer.
awesome teacher. must take one of her classes. it must be the italian charm.

Dr. Curry does not give students constructive criticism; she talks down to her students. Furthermore, she will embarrass the students in front of other classmates. I will never take another class with Dr. Curry.
Dr. Curry is a strict editor, but she will impact your thinking and writing! She will make you better!

Dr. Curry is an excellent researcher and has quite an interesting perspective and academic voice. Yet, I asked several times to meet with her and she refused. I went to writing services and learning a ton there! However, my grades consistently stayed low. I love when professors push you down, but this one doesn't try to pick you up.

Not always clear with expectations. Makes condescending remarks in front of class regarding students. Unrealistic expectations for educators considering she has extremely limited experience in the K-12 education world. Not very personable unless you are a "star" student. Has obvious favorites.

Dr Curry is a dedicated professional with a wonderful sense of (darkish) humor.  She is fair- and she will push her students, but she also provides instruction as to how to make the grade.  MJ is a great teacher (but tough!!!--and that is a compliment!)  students learn  ALOT.  Take her Accademic Writing Course- it is spectacular!

A good researcher but has no teaching experience teaching language in K-12 public school settings. I find it odd that she leads a program in teacher training. Approachable once you get to know her. Fair to those who work hard and fulfill course responsibilities.
Has the personality of a T-Rex. Incidentally, not very approachable.
AMAZING, KNOWLEDGEABLE PROFESSOR AND VERY KIND PERSON
Professor Bazler is wonderful. He gets really enthusiastic and animated, which makes every lecture memorable. I can't recommend taking a class with him highly enough.

Makes a constant effort to get to know students and their interests. He's incredibly animated and it's extremely helpful and engaging. He's very funny and yet amazingly brilliant, and has gotten me to think about music in totally new ways I'd never before considered. In my opinion, he's one of the best professors at U of R!

A nice guy and interested professor, but I think he tries too hard to make his class difficult. He's also kind of obnoxious, especially when he talks down to the students (which happened occasionally), and when he flat-out screeches/yells in class sometimes. Totally annoying. BUT, passionate about the material and clearly very smart.

i am obsessed with him. he is smart, funny and genuinely interested in his students. He is unafraid to admit he is not proficient in something ( i.e. hiphop). the course was the highlight of my year and i may take opera , even though i hate it, just to have him again.
Quite an intelligent and knowledgeable guy.  Makes the material interesting and fun to learn. :)
Pretty great guy. Glad to see he is sticking around!

Dr. Schaefer is undoubtedly a knowledgable professor. However, she is a professor who has favorites and does not employ empathy or consideration for what extenuating circumstances a student may be experiencing. Additionally, her grading scheme is SET. On the cusp of a letter grade? You won't bumped up, regardless of strong participation in class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: This course helps me a lot. You can get an A if you could send many versions of revision before the deadline. The only thing is that you need to put much more effort in the class than the writing held by some other professors.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Very clear grading criteria. Good experience. She's very nice and always provides feedback to students.

She is a good professor and gives enough respect to students. And she will make student revise and revise and revise until your paper is good enough or reach the deadlines. I personally don't have much opinion on this, and I think this is a way to educate students. And I do learned a lot from her. But she is really a hard professor with good heart.
As long as you put in effort, you will get a good grade but it can be tedious. She is not specific enough when it comes to assignments. But, visit her during office hours and you'll do just fine.
Amazing professor. 272 helps prepare you for post graduation so it's great to take. Very helpful feedback. Favorite professor of mine.

Class: Disease and Society. Class is SUPER easy as long as you send her many versions of your essays. Send her your essay, she will put comments, edit, and do it over and over again until the essay is due - You will get an A like this! Go see her in your office if you need more help. VERY LITTLE readings and very little work. Just revise a lot!
A nice teacher! Definitely an easy A if you do all your work.

She was a great professor! Her humor and knowledge makes you want to come to class. She's also published various research papers and has simple slides for lectures. The only thing I would suggest is to look out for pop-up assignments in class ( which are so easy). Take her for a nice grade and to learn new things!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Hilarious--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: I love Paula!!!! I think people on here are just sensitive. She was super funny and knowledgeable. I don't think you guys realize how accomplished and smart she is! I loved this class and loved the group discussions. There were pop quizzes but one missed one is excused. This class is a very easy A if you do everything you need to.

If you want an easy A, take it with her - no exams or papers, only 1 group project that is graded very leniently. However - I agree with other students that she is a terrible professor and not that great of a person either. Did not care a single bit about the class and made several offensive remarks.

I had Prof. Alio for P.H. 101 and really enjoyed it. Lectures were fairly interesting but sometimes boring. There are no tests (this may have just been a covid thing), just homework assignments, in-class workshops, and projects so it's super easy to get a good grade. All of the grading is done by TA's, so it also depends on who your TA is.

always wore her mask below her nose and complained about mask mandates. >:(
during a lecture on gender and sex, spread complete misinformation. Said that if a trans man wanted to become a man she would need to get surgery in order for her to do that. Lecture implied that trans people are their sex assigned at birth.

The class itself is easy, but she's a horrible person. She made several transphobic remarks & misgendered people, and makes racially insensitive/micro-aggressive remarks & says it's okay for her to say since she's half black. She wears her mask under her nose & makes anti-mask remarks. She's the literal opposite of what public health stands for.

Had Hopper for MATH 141, not 165. Hopper was excellent. His lectures were straightforward and it was easy to understand the content. It definitely helps if you took calc in high school though. I just wish they had a curve in 141, but other than that, no complaints really.

BEST professor ever. I took 141 and wished he taught 142. Lectures/notes are VERY clear; he is amazing at teaching. He helped me understand concepts I struggled w in HS for the longest time. Exams are easy, as long as you do at least 2 practice exams, since they're exactly like the real exams. If you have Qs, he will help you until you understand.
one of the best professors in this university. great handouts. lectures are so clear that I don't even have to review after class. sure would take his class again.

Prof. Hopper is amazing. MATH 235 is an extremely hard subject. His homework is very very hard and time consuming, probably gonna take you over 15 hours per week. This can be stress out but you really learn the stuff. His exams are hard, but way easier than HW. He is a nice grader so don't worry about your raw score. The most caring prof I've met
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment:
The most difficult course I have ever had at this Uni. It is difficult because the course materials get so wide and don't go too deeply, and TONS of homework go deeply. The exam is freaking hard; He doesn't make even a single problem similar to the past exams or the homework. 

DON'T TAKE IT. (EVEN NOW I AM STRUGGLING WITH THE HOMEWORK.)
One of the best Math professors at U of R. Lectures are super clear and organized. Go to his office hours.

Eric is easily one of the best professor I've had in this university so far, and I'm sure he will stay in my tops. He makes really good handouts and give them out before classes. Lecture is super clear and understandable. If you go to his office hours, he will clarify things for you and explain them patiently. Try your best to register his section!
Course materials horribly hard. RUN if you are taking for credits

by far the hardest ECON class out there...too bad its required for the major..but Dahl i feel does a decent job teaching the tedious and boring material...paper is very interesting and its agreed that you'll learn more from the paper than from the book or class...plan to spend a lot of time learning the material, 1st weeks of sem. is eco 230 review
Great guy, but makes lots of mistakes! Sometimes there will be glaring errors on the board and he'll correct the less important ones. "Oops, forgot the i-subscript."

Class was hard, because Dahl assumes that you've read and re-read and re-read the material before he ever showed it to you. If you're lucky your TA will be helpful, otherwise your screwed. This class is required so take it as soon as you can before senior year.

Econometrics was really easy for me since I have a math background and enjoy economics, but Dahl is a good teacher.  Class was straight forward, I always got help when I went to talk about the research paper and had him as my advisor for a short time.

For people interested in a future in Economics or Finance, it's a must. Too much memorization, should be more analytical. Homework grades based on 1-2 random ?'s. Exams are tough & overweighted. Paper is the most informative part of the class, Dahl doesn't let students pick own topic though.
No Comments
Best teacher here.
She's a gem! If you're sincere, she'll help you as much as she can!

Professor Carney teaches in a manner that provides students with a legitimate and constructive challenge. This class is certainly not easy, but has left most students engaged in the material. Along with being a clear lecturer, homeworks, tests, and hands-on labs help in fostering a true understanding of the material.
Really tries to get to know her students. Good professor. She is very helpful. Be prepared to get called on in class.
Very clear, honest with students.  Not afraid to fail you if you don't show you can handle the class. But vast majority pass. Class consistently improving year-over-year.

She puts in an effort to get to know students. She is very helpful if you show that you are putting forth an effort. Do the homework and the tests should be easy. The final is designed to rip you a new one so dont take it personally

This class is not that hard, (the midterms are pretty easy), but the final is very, very hard so do well going into it.  Professor is really nice once you get to know her and she tries to make a connection with students.. if you try hard you will do well.
If you want a writing teacher who is very clear and precise then Amy is awesome. For someone who is not in the humanities, she made WRT105 approachable and not overwhelming.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Amy is a cool professor. She does give back good feedbacks, just you have to work hard to get a good grade. Her homework is not bad but I believe it's fair, since other professors are the same. Choose Amy if you like this topic, otherwise, nope.

Obviously there is a lot of writing but Amy is a great professor and tells you exactly what you need to work on to do well. It's tough, but definitely one of my favorite classes. Amy's super cool too.
One of the best instructors I have ever had.
She negatively impacted my interest in writing. If the class had any structure at all it was around her, she even made us read her papers from high school just so she could talk about herself more.

Hands down the best writing instructor I've ever had. Despite her relatively young age, her authority, approachability, and humor in the classroom made the class enjoyable without compromising her ability to present writing components in a clear and accessible way.
Not helpful at all. She doesn't know what she is talking about for most of the class. She is not worth your time.
shes super sweet but its easy to fall behind in work
she's very nice but doesn't really explain things in a logical order. not much work, but it's a bit of a challenge.
kind of boring but you learn a lot
Very nice teacher, very understanding of extinuating circumstances. Highly recommended if at all interested in learning Arabic.
outstanding professor.  any talk of consolidating the two-person arabic department and leaving her out is borderline idiocy.
one of the nicest professors ever...very lenient and understanding.
Very Nice. Recommended if interested in arabic. Coursework is minimal and not too difficult. Recommended.

Unintelligible. Unecessarily made things very complicated which should have been very simple. Grading did not account for people who dropped course due to its difficulty. Fortunately, she discovered that teaching is not her forte and is now working at the Federal Reserve.

Seems to overcomplicate things a lot, she could make everything a lot more straightforward if she wanted to.  Does not seem to communicate with the TAs, so everyone teaches a different method of doing problems, which really sucks when the material is confusing already.
Part of the problem is with the statistical economics course itself, but she really doesn't help much with her explanations of the material. A bit cold and distant.
Made economics "beautiful" if you know what I'm saying.
She is great! Very helpful and knows the material very well!

She makes mistakes on the board all the time, and had to be corrected by people in the class.  She wants you to do well, and is willing ot talk to you about it, but is not very clear or all that helpful in and outside class.
Thick accent.  Good luck.

Class was a bit challenging, but no more than the other writing classes here.  Hardeep seems to really enjoy teaching writing and fostering discussion in his class.  He's also extremely helpful outside of class as long as you try and is very lenient in special circumstances.
Best professor ever. Super clear and helpful.

Hardeep is great! He loves it when you meet with him outside of class, and he is really helpful when you do! He uses boring books but the class is worth it. He's an awesome teacher, and if you put forth an honest effort, you'll get a good grade. He obviously cares about doing a good job as a teacher.
love hardeep
Hardeep is the best. He is so knowledgeable  about the topic and writing, in general. Hardeep is always willing to do more than he has to. Definitely recommend him!
He's the man!

He is very clear and thorough and is very insightful when helping. He really cares about being a good instructor. The class is a little boring, especially when debate is little and some dominate it. He can be monotonous, but you will learn. Tough grader, but he'll work with you to get the top grade you can get.

Exams are slight variations from textbook/webwork/workshop/lecture examples. Workshop get 100% for showing up. Quizzes are group and are from examples you will have seen if you look at the upcoming week's workshop sheet beforehand, do webwork a week early and read notes/book sections for current topics (get 100%). Curves heavily 45%/55% ->80%/90%
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: So as a non-math major this class was hard af, but he's really nice and helpful and will do everything he can to help people out, including going over confusing hw problems in class before they're due. He can go a bit fast at times, but he's happy to explain things in more detail if asked. Genuinely good person who cares about his students

Explains concepts very clearly and logically - makes lectures engaging and easy to follow. Exams were kinda difficult, but they were prepared by another professor from the Math dept. Yamazaki is very caring and wants his students to do well.

This professor is knowledgeable in his field, but he really is not a good teacher. Honestly, you will learn more if you do not go to class and just teach yourself out of the book. He just makes the subject material confusing with his poor explanations. Again, he's a nice guy, but a bad teacher.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Nice guy, and means well. English isn't his first language, but he talks faster than I can understand it (it is mine). Really difficult class, and I never felt like I understood a concept before the homework was due. "If you aren't getting it right, try again, and if you still aren't getting it right, try harder".

Very strict grader-- in math there's only correct answer and incorrect answer, so instead of arguing for partial credit you might just as well practice and get it right the next time. That's the important thing I learned from this class. He makes concepts really clear and easy to comprehend. A is not impossible to get as long as you work hard.
Explains in a way that makes you understand the questions easily, gives funny and creative examples to support mathematical concepts.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: If you really want to learn Japanese and put in an honest effort, you will have zero problems. She is very nice and what she asks of you is almost always clearly defined. If you've never studied an eastern language before, I would do some prep beforehand. Lectures involve lots of group work. Some online assignments like multi-choice and listening.

Nothing to say but good things about Hardy-sensei. Classes and assignments are straight forward. You just need to devote the time to study the material. Hardy-sensei is caring and always answers any questions you might have. Recitations are always fun to participate in.

One of the best professors! Always caring, clear grading criteria, always accessible after class. Will give you one-on-one tutoring if you need it. However, get ready to learn and devote time to it. Requires a lot of effort if you are a beginner. She will spend every effort to help you, but you have to be ready and work hard!

Professor Hardy is the best professor I've had! She cares about students' success and is always willing to help those who are struggling! Class activities were fun and engaging, tests and quizzes were fair, and plenty of chances to get bonus points. She answers emails quickly. Your main homework is studying for tests/quizzes.
Her lecture is good, and you will get an easy A if you do everything she says. Tests are based on lectures and textbooks. She's one of the best profs I had in uor.

Hardy-Sensei is super nice, understanding, and funny! Participation may be a bit difficult but it is very worth it.
