I took a class, participated in an ensemble, and later TA'd for professor Hanson. Awesome guy and my favorite teacher in the music department. Genuinely cares about the material and his students and tries to keep class interesting with great discussion. I would highly recommend taking a class or an ensemble with him.

Nice guy, his class was easy, but holy moly was it a lot of work. He would assign mountains of reading for a class that should be an easy A, found myself dedicating way more time than I wanted to this class. Also, used too much in-class discussion for my taste, but that's more of a personal preference thing.
Great guy, really nice. Very lenient with attendance and assignments, and grading for that matter. Very passionate about music and conducting nicely.
good teacher to have
Ehh... Wouldn't hold your breath for anything amazing.
Professor Bilgic wasn't even teaching this class. He just posted other Professor's lectures and added added a recitation component that replaced his second lecture of the week.
Not recommended to take his class. If you are a data science major, try to take other Stats classes to fulfill the requirement.

The class is poorly structured. We are required to read the slides or watch *another faculty* talking through his slides && take a quiz before class. The professor always say he is going to do R demo during lecture but always end up talking through the slides again. His ambiguous written English in slides, hw, and exams is rather frustrating.
Bad lectures. Study the PowerPoint and do the homework, then everything will be ok.

He is a very disorganized Professor. Planned many quizzes and tests but forgot about them occasionally. Final exam was somehow delayed for 3 hrs because he forgot. The lectures were confusing at most of the times. The questions on the exams were confusing with grammatical errors. The grading was not too harsh because the TAs were overwhelmed too.

The most frustrating and disorganized class you will ever take. Professor's poor English makes lectures, assignment instructions, and test questions impossible to understand. Incredibly vague instructions. Extremely rigorous assignments take upwards of 10 hours a week. Consistently forgets to open quizzes and post assignments; very unreliable.

He knows the material insanely well, and expects you to put in the time to do the same. If you do, you'll find one of the most tangible and rewarding classes I've taken, and if not you'll be lost, weeks behind because he blitzes through the material. Always super encouraging of students to get help when the need it. Robotically fair about grading.

One of the most respectful professors out there. He genuinely cares about the students doing well and lowered the amount of work we had to do mid-semester to accommodate for the busy schedule. He also provided many office hour opportunities including being on campus until midnight. Exams were hard but I doubt anyone fully failed the class.

Too talented of a professor with a unique characteristic to be at U of R. Course expectations are high- a high contrast in the U of R community where "happy-study" courses are abundant. Hard-working students learn a lot; lazy/incompetent ones hate this class.
Run! Run away!!!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Prof. Howard is a hard but rewarding teacher. He is highly knowledgeable and cares about his the students. I feel like I actually learned in his class, which is not something I can say for a lot of ECE classes. The lectures are alright until the end of the course. He is very helpful in the lab, and is willing to give points back (email him!).

The lab assignments were helpful for learning, but the lectures were always a complete waste of time. He goes through slides way too fast and refuses to upload them online for people to follow along. Feedback on labs was very helpful but they took WAY too long to get graded. Class material is fun but he's just an awful lecturer.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: Projects are difficult af. Class can be rewarding but process is very frustrating. Lectures are difficult to follow because of speed. Quite approachable outside of class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: I wish I could also take Physics II with Professor Visser. One of the kindest professors I've had. I just wish he gave us more practice exams/problems that he wrote himself, since he writes the actual exam problems himself. But overall, wonderful professor.
Prof. Visser's lectures were easy to follow and his tests questions were almost always just the examples he did in class.

Taco is very entertaining, especially when he goes into certain historical concepts... except it's a physics class. I like his lecturing style, but he sometimes goes into far more depth in lecture than is on the exam, which is nice for grades, but makes it seem a lot more stressful/difficult than it is.

Taco has an incredible personality, although the lectures can drag sometimes. He'll spend 5 minutes and 4 chalkboards deriving an equation just to show it works, which is insightful but a bit dull. He pulls stuff right out the book, most of the class could be self taught and you'd do fine, but it'd be like reading a screenplay; you'd miss the show.

Great guy. Funny and engaging. Goes super in depth on topics that we only need an elementary understanding of to do well, but that's probably the best complaint you could have of a professor. No practice problems in class though so ask him questions about specific stuff and go to workshop. No office hours, but he's very approachable after class.
Taco is an engaging lecturer. He sometimes gets a bit off topic and isn't the best at explaining things sometimes, but he's very willing to interact with students and he wants you to succeed.

Professor Black is an amazing teacher, I learned so much in her intro to climate change class. As someone who has never taken any science classes she made the technical aspects of climate change very easy to understand without oversimplifying. She was always happy and enthusiastic to answer any question I had.

Professor Black is undoubtably the best professor I've had at UofR. She shows a genuine respect and care for her students, and is wonderfully accommodating. She's very passionate about environmental science, a fact which is evident in every one of her lectures. The first third of the semester was difficult, the rest was pretty easy. 10/10 reccomend

Where do I start... The kindest, most understanding professor I've had in my 4 years at the UR.  She's professional and fun at the same time.  She always values students' feedback and continuously tries to improve the learning experience. Do yourself a favor and sign up for her class; whether its grad, under-grad, or W, all options are manageable.
The only big assignments are problem sets and the final presentation (An extra paper for writing students). Not a hard class and would like to recommend people to take it.

Prof. Black is a great professor. Everything asked on the exam is thoroughly reviewed in class and she genuinely cares about each student's performance and wellbeing. Not too much work, but you should attend lectures as they are better than the book.

Loved this class! Great intro to climate science/environmental science in general. I'm an env. sci. major so obvious bias, but Professor Black is really clear on what you need to know, so all you need to have to get an A in this class is determination. Take thorough notes, review all the content before midterm/final, and you'll be in great shape!

Her workshops are productive, and not bogged down by the overly-intellectual or unnecessarily academicness of it. That's not to say we don't have intellectual discussions, because we do, but it's relaxed and low-stress while maintaining a degree of productive critique and improvement. She's very kind and eager to hear different viewpoints.

Very lovely person! Very passionate about poetry, would spend a week studying a poet and analyzing their poems. Discussion driven obviously, respectful and loves any/all input even if she interprets poem differently. Had 2 written assignments ("suggested" due dates but could turn them in the very last day of class) and presentation
Grotz really gives you the space to growas a writer! She consistently kept class engaging and really connested our readings to what she expected from us as writers.

Grotz is hilarious. She's quirky and swears like a sailor, which is surprising since she has such a sweet demeanor. I loved this class. We read some great poets and she always had stimulating things to say. She grades fairly. I'm really excited to take another course with her next semester.

I took 2 poetry courses with Prof. Grotz.  Granted, I like poetry, but I really enjoyed these and felt like I learned a lot. She made the classroom feel like a safe place to share personal writings, and experiment with new styles.  She has a good sense of humor, but expected everyone to keep up with assignments too - which was fairly easy to do.
I've taken two poetry classes with Prof. Grotz, and loved both of them; she leads the workshop format excellently, with a lot of in depth discussion of both the text readings and the student work.

He is bad organized with inefficient lecture setup. His lab session is tough with unclear wording, torturing students to spent large amount of time on an issue caused by equipments or setup. Really wasting time on something not really essential for this course. Don't see any connection between this course and mechanical engineering.

Prof. Kelley is a good teacher, and a great professor. His lectures are usually interesting, he's fun and engaging, and very accessible out of class. The HW and tests were difficult, but he's a fair grader. He does a good job of explaining the more difficult concepts in fluids and really teaches understanding, not just memorization.

I am fortunate to have him, and I am certain that the department is fortunate to have him also. The best professor. The most friendly and energetic person. His teaching is a piece of art. He did change my life.

Difficult class but he's the best professor in the MechE department in my opinion. Lectures are good, tests are hard, but he's very supportive and caring for students. Hard work will pay off and he's very helpful one on one.

Great professor, definitely would recommend choosing him if you have an option for a class.  Engages the class well and has a good balance of lecturing and example problems.  Really nice guy who you can tell cares about his students.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures

comment: Super fun professor and interesting lectures. He's very passionate about engineering, and very easy to listen to in class. He makes an effort to learn everyone's names which is awesome, and he's a very personable guy. Would definitely recommend to take his section of a class if there are multiple professors for a course.
rating_tags: Respected--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: She really opened my eyes to the area. I thought it was one of the best classes Ive had.

Boring teacher. This kind of stuff can be so interesting but she makes it difficult to sit through the class. White slides with black text. Reads what is written on the slides almost word for word. You could get away with not going to class except that there are in-class assignments, and even some that are not on the syllabus.
She literally reads from the slides. You don't need to show up to class.
HORRIBLE
horrible teacher. wait till the professor is there next year. she's a grad student and her teaching is not coherent at all
Memorize concepts and you're good TAs know nothing (they get confused and give bad examples)
Impatient. Horrible handwriting. Confusing. Gave the wrong formulas in class and did not realize that the ones in the book were wrong at times as well. Avoid her class if at all possible.

Horrible Teacher. Terrible Handwriting. Impatient. Gave the wrong formulas in class. Didn't realize the textbook also had errors. Made mistakes on her own practice exam keys, and did not sent out corrections though they were pointed out by a student.

Provides wrong formulas in class.  Her practice test solutions have many errors, and not just at the superficial typo/miscalculation level. She makes fundamental mistakes on her own tests.  The textbook is also horrendous and of no use.
she explains everything very clear. ^_^
She's clear and helpful. Doesnt compromise on homework deadlines.
No Comments

Don't be fooled, this class has barely anything to do with its title. It's just a bunch of game theory math w/no real applications to real world policy. The first unit is difficult but passable due to his Youtube series, but after that you're on your own. He gives practice problem sets, but no solutions or help. No idea why this is a PS 1500 course
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Prof. Spaniel's lectures are very clear and well planned. Exams are mostly quantitative; these questions come directly from problem sets. His grading is very reasonable. Having some knowledge of basic calculus (differentiation, series, sequences) helps but isn't necessary. Make sure you are comfortable with algebraic manipulation of inequalities.

Dr. Spaniel is definitely a smart guy, and most political science majors will be seeing some brand new material in taking his lectures. Any math-based problems on his exams are given a few weeks prior in a problem set that you can work out on your own. However, don't be fooled, this class is hard and the problem sets will require a lot of thought.

IF you are wanting another math class, take this course, if not , do not take this course.   The course is based solely on Game Theory.  A lot of application problems.  The course moves very fast and it is hard to follow.  You must show up every day , if not you will be lost.
He really knows a lot about International Relations and he is willing to help you understand it too if you put in the effort.
Our Lord and Savior William Spaniel, master of Game Theory! He literally wrote the book on it! And the Youtube series! And the website! Seriously!
hot
Teaches about race, gender and sexuality. Three subjects that go without any mention in most classes.
Very helpful and interesting class
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments

Tech Theater is SUPER easy. Cancels class a lot and/or starts late. Mostly just graded by Charlie on lab hours (60) Canceled our final and did final project - to make beer carriers. Pretty simple as long as you have time to show up. Also 9am MW sucks. Learned more, but I also knew a lot before. No outside work except 4 reviews. Textbooks  don't
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things

comment: ENG171 Fall'14 Gordon is truly an awesome dude! Technical theater is so cool and he made me appreciate it even more! I truly enjoyed his class! Lab hours in Todd Theater are vital to pass the class. Make sure you can commit before registering for class! Very helpful and would most definitely take class again!

It's an easy class, but don't miss labs. You have to punch in your hours and they will notice if you don't show up. As long as you attend labs, you'll do fine. As others have said, just be prepared to work. I also suggest that if you don't get assigned a job during a busy day, or you don't know what to do - just ask. They're always happy to help.

Gordon is awesome. It's not a hard class, I actually enjoy myself during lab. The classes aren't really that rigorous, but it's important to attend all the labs and work. Skipping labs is a big no-no and they will notice. Don't put on your best clothes on + don't wear flip flops, it gets messy sometimes. Have a friend in this class, it'll be fun.
Great guy, great class. Textbook not needed. :)

don't bother buying the textbook. a collosal waste of money, since he never refers to it or assigns reading. it is easy to get an A if you come for all your required labs and actually work. and make sure not to be one of those people who shows up on a workday wearing flipflops. just be ready to work.

E&M self-paced is rewarding IF you have the time for it, I can't imagine trying to learn this material through in-person lectures. The textbook is really good. I suggest going into the class with a friend group where you can discuss study guides and problems. Fair warning you will have to take 24 pre-tests and 12 quizzes AT LEAST to finish content
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Test heavy

comment: Phys 121 is a hard class, but Aran made it a little better. He's very clear in lectures and answers as many questions as he can. His demonstrations are helpful but only if you can see them. Some topics covered were not on homework or tests so I'm questioning why they were in lecture. Held test review sessions which were semi-helpful

This class is tough and usually required. Aran made was a good professor the class just simply is a lot of work. Get the text book and be delight and you will get a good grade. Tests are hard but class is curved. His lecture notes are good and he is easy to listen to so go to class but outside studying is needed.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes--Caring

comment: TAKE SELF-PACED!! Lectures constantly felt like a waste of time. You might laugh sometimes, make new friends, and see physics demos, but that's about it. This is the only class where I can say the hw was more fun than attending lecture. Also, we get tested on things we don't discuss or barely discuss. A lot resources exist to help with hw, use them

One of the best science professors I have had. Very clear and extremely organized. Break down concepts and explains them so that students have a clear picture of the topic and can develop a deep understanding.  His workshops and homework adequately prepare you for the exam. Great with administrative stuff and adapting to best help students.

Lectures were presented in a relatively easy way to follow, and he explained the material very well. Posts lectures after class online, met with students who received below a 50 on any midterm exam to make sure they do better on the next few exams. Clicker was not necessary though, but he used it to gauge where in the class everyone was in lecture.

I hated the mandatory attendance. It filled the class with people who didn't really want to be there and sat there playing games on their laptops. As a lecturer the professor wasn't bad. I loved the demonstrations he did almost every class. The way he wrote out everything on his computer using the projector was great. Really helpful.
Nice professor!!!!!!

Good, engaging lectures which cover substantive, insightful content. Really nice professor who cares about his students and puts in significant effort to make the learning experience smooth. Grading criteria is generous and clear.
he is brilliant!

Well-run, organized course. It's not hard to get an A but the content is not trivial (you'll learn something). Anson is a good lecturer and the grading criteria is both very clear and very generous. Sometimes his lectures can get really tedious and I didn't feel like he was amazing at explaining challenging concepts.

Brilliant professor, articulate speaker and good pedagogy. All lectures were recorded and all work done in class is on a tablet, which makes for easy revision! Much better than chalk. 

CSC489 was very well designed course: good extension policy, dropping the lowest homework grade, attendance-based grading components, and reasonable exams.

5 homeworks, 2 exams, and you must attend classes in person every lecture. The tasks are average so it is not difficult but still requires much attention.
The lectures are very interesting, and yet the notions are often quite confusing so i'd be better to email the professor for office-hour appointments.
If you want an easy A, take Bruce Blaine's course. But you will rarely learn anything from him. If you indeed wish to learn something, take another professor's course.

Very good professor. He has the ability to make hard thing much easier and make students understand easily. His lecture is really fun and always answer questions from students. Most importantly, he is very generous in the grading aspect!
Great professor!!!!!!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Respected

comment: I took him for STAT 212. He's a super nice and funny guy. He gets a bad rep, but I think that the material is just boring lol. He definitely cares about his students and tries to help out as much as he can. Super caring and exams are insanely easy. Very easy to get an A; I just didn't study enough. Labs and HW are manageable.

YOU SHOULD AVOID THIS PROFESSOR AT ALL COST. He does not teach anything related to programming in R. He wishes you to just simply copy and paste code from his example/demo into the exam by changing some variables. Even if you use the most basic command like print he would give you a bad grade just because he didn't teach you even the basics.

Nice guy but one of the worst classes ever taken. Terrible organization. Terrible grading. Tests out of 20 points and you lose 1-2 points for seemingly insignificant mistakes never covered in class. Unclear grading so you never know how much detail he wants. Lectures were good if you needed to catch up on sleep. Made simple topics seem so complex.
Amazing teacher. Take her class if you get the chance, you wont regret it.

Professor Doubleday is amazing! She is very enthusiastic in class and recommends so many other ways to engage with the language: music, poetry, fun metaphors and language quirks, videos, and movies. You will be called on several times every class, but the amount of speaking by students is really great for a foreign language class.

Professor Doubleday is an amazing professor and is perfect for teaching russian. Her conversation class is well organized and great for facilitating speaking skills. It was a fun class that definitely benefited my learning of a language.

Professor Doubleday is an amazing professor, especially for learning Russian. The organization of the class is perfect for learning a language, as long as you put in the time and the effort. She always makes herself available outside of class and genuinely cares about her students.

Professor Doubleday has an enthusiasm that is contagious when it comes to the Russian language, making class enjoyable. You definitely will need to do the homework and put in the work, but it's worth it. She is very accessible outside of class and wants her students to succeed.

Professor Doubleday makes Russian interesting and fun. You have to go to class and put in the work, but it's worth it. She cares a lot about her students and is willing to help you outside of class. Definitely a class worth taking with her.

Very knowledgable professor. He can explain things relatively well. I like how he is able to take complex ideas and find trivial examples of them. However, sometimes he can get side tracked and begins to make things very complicated, skipping steps, etc. 
One thing I liked is that he went over each student's test 1-on-1 in person.

Made me feel dumb for getting a problem wrong on a test. Told me to "use common sense" and laughed at my answers while reviewing test together. This class is hard enough, but his teaching is very difficult to follow -- ended up not going to his lectures and using Chaves's notes instead. Would not recommend him for this class.

He is very patient and cares about students. He would have students going to his office and give feed back one by one after midterms. He has lots of thoughts that leads to deeper understanding, but sometime his lectures are not organized very well. Need to preview the text and review your notes.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational

comment: Hands down one of the worst professors in the department. He goes out of his way to make you feel stupid (and then can't figure out how to do the proofs himself). His exams had little to no resemblance to the review sheets and his handwriting is absolutely god awful. His classes were so disorganized. I'll never take a class with him again.

Absolutely one of the worst math teaching styles I've ever experienced, and for first year U of R students who are starting CS, it's important to feel confident in this course. This professor is not it. Brushes lightly over MAJOR topics without highlighting its importance, does not review notes before lectures, and spends lots of time on tangents.

Mth210 is a pretty difficult class but Prof Thakur always explains things concisely. His tests are mainly based on lectures and are not that challenging if you go over his notes. He's also accessible outside of class and responds quickly to questions. Great professor!

Love Norma! She was the perfect teacher for ASL 101! I had so much fun and loved coming to her class every day. She is great at answering any questions you have and giving feedback! Take ASL with her!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: Showed a lot of variety with lessons. Be prepared to present in class and feel complete homework before class because it will often be looked at again or brought up in discussion. Answers questions clearly and is helpful with any confusion on materials or assignments! Definitely recommend for any ASL classes!!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: If you're taking ASL classes Norma is the way to go. I've now had her for 3 classes and love her. Tough grader for 206, but super nice woman, and her classes are fun. Attendance is graded and if you're taking ASLA 200 or 250 you need to do the readings. Presentations are asynchronous for 206, so you can practice lots. 10/10 recommend

She's truly the best ASL101 professor (though I'm totally bias) but she really cares about students, is willing to explain any questions or clear up confusion (in creative ways), and welcomes/cracks jokes every class!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: Great professor, shes really nice, understanding, and makes my 9AM class very enjoyable

Truly one of the sweetest professors I've had. She checks in on how students are doing outside of class, but is also a great teacher. Her explanations are clear, and while she's a tougher grader on exams, she gives really helpful feedback for future improvement and is always available for questions. Would definitely recommend!

Difficult class content-wise if you don't have an anatomy/physiology background. Difficult to predict what will actually be tested on. Once you realize that it's a quantitative physiology class (emphasis on quantitative!!), you'll realize that you need to emphasize the content that focuses on actual calculations with the bio as a side.
An easy-going professor with plenty of office hours.

This class was asynchronous, so everything was online and you do it at your own pace. I'm not a stem student and took this class as a gpa boost, which I wouldn't really recommend unless you're really interested in the subject, since it's stem based. He had a ton of office hours and gave me a B- even though I didn't do the last module or the final

Doesn't know how to teach and feels good about himself. Difficult homework that relate to nothing learned in class. Doesn't explain easy concepts well. Now he's teaching BME 295 and BME 260, both are required for BME majors at UR, so it sucks a lot.

Homework is a crazy ton and has nothing to do with what's taught in lectures. Exams are difficult. Man is not a good lecturer as well. Feels like easy concepts are being taught with more difficulty. Mandatory class for BME majors so it legitimately sucks.

There are classes I have taken as an upper-level BME that have truly shown me the wonders of the field. Having taken other anatomy and physiology classes, I felt well prepared for this class. However, he is such a bad professor that he explains the most simple topics in the most confusing way. I learned NOTHING from this class!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Prof S is genuinely one of the best professors I've ever had. He wants every single one of his students writing to improve, and his feedback reflects this. Not only does he suggest feedback with a kind attitude, but he treats each story with respect, no matter the grammatical/spelling errors. He never tries to change a story, just how it's told.

Really great at giving feedback! Took several creative writing courses with him over the years and he really helped me improve my stories without imposing any of his own ideas on to them. Always provided great stories to read and suggested awesome books. Would rate 6 stars if I could.
Terrible attitude.

Professor S has passion for his subject and it shows. He gives great feedback and is very accessible outside of class, even on short notice. You are expected to show up and contribute to class discussions, but that isn't a downside, as he picks interesting readings and is very good at leading discussions.

Excellent professor, easily one of the best at this school. I took screenwriting with him and I enjoyed it very much. He organized the class really well, allowed us to engage in conversations with each other, gave us valuable feedback, and was accessible outside of class as well. Would highly recommend taking a course with him.

I have him for screenwriting and I love the class. I have learned so much from discussion and he really knows his stuff. He gives fantastic and helpful feedback, while encouraging you to write your story and be creative. The semester project is writing a full length screenplay and at first I was intimidated but now I'm 25 pages in! Def take him!!!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: He's my absolute favorite professor. He's been extremely helpful in class and out of class. I've decided to become a creative writing professor after taking this course. We read amazing authors that have become my favorites. I loved this class so much. We had a great energy because he was such a easy-going guy. I wish I could take it again.

This guy expects you to know and learn the material well, in a very fair manner. He'll make jokes about students in a lighthearted way, always trying to have a good time. Material is a little tough, but never in an unfair manner. Almost weekly quizzes are annoying but manageable. Lab assignments are a pain. One of the funnier professors.

First half of the course is discrete math, which is hard to learn through his lectures but not part of the final. His probability lectures are better; attendance is a secret bonus to final grade. Dery is very smart and sometimes finds it hard to empathize with our struggle, but he gave many bonuses to our grades to improve our grade distribution.

Only gives homework assignments for about half the semester, so be prepared to learn independently for the first half. No tests besides the final; just a bunch of quizzes. Mandatory office hours are fun!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I am in the class right now and he is the best professor I've ever had. He is hilarious.

Really tough quizzes and final. He's always available outside of class. Really hard to follow his lectures because he's really smart and just doesn't get that you don't get it and also he has a very heavy accent and talks fast.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Very helpful course. Might be difficult to ECE student. Better have physics background. Professor has a little accent, but quite understandable.

He is very clear about what he expects from you, and his lectures (powerpoint slides) are very organized and are put online.  He may seem dry and boring in class, but he definitely has a sense of humor.

Absolutely amazing professor. Kind, funny, and enthusiastic. I love that she always comes to class ready to learn and adjusts to the class's abilities instantly. I enjoyed my time and always found extra help and practice to be available.

Moves fast through the alphabet so can be hard for those who did't go to Hebrew school as a kid, but Michela will work with you if you seek help. Other than that, super easy. Show up, pay attention and you'll do great. HW takes 10-15 min max. She is also great and has fun joking around with the class.

Michela is a caring, charismatic professor. Her lectures are very smooth as she makes sure everyone in the class understands what is being taught in an efficient way. Very accessible outside of the class and always eager to help you. Hebrew is not an easy language to learn but her pedagogy makes it very easy for students to get a grasp of it.

Michela is an incredible woman and professor. She really cares about the students and Hebrew, and is very good at explaining concepts and teaching in general. The class can be a bit slow if you know any Hebrew, but picks up around the second half of the semester.  If you have interest in Hebrew, definitely take this class, it's great.

Such a doll.. Probably funnier than most of my friends, extremely nice, very clear with assignments/exams, very down-to-earth, etc.. I can't think of anything bad to say. Lectures can be a bit boring if you're familiar with Hebrew, as we mostly just work right through the book, page by page.

She has an Italian accent but she's still very understandable. She's extremely nice (once you realize that "pay attention" means she's about to say something important, not that she's accusing you of slacking off), clear, and knows her stuff. She adjusts her teaching to students; she's made handouts based on things we asked about the class before.

makes you work for your grade thats for sure. He does explain the material fairly well so go to class, review your notes later that day(<that is important), study for a good amount of time and you should be ok.

Professor is a good teacher but arrogant, self-righteous, and forces his judgment upon students. His grading scale is heavily influenced by opinions about the student's maturity and consistency in the class. Will lower participation grade for doing poorly on homework, for example. ("He must not care about this class!") Otherwise, hes a good teacher
No Comments
Good teacher but arrogant
awesome blossom
Demanding TA, but very clear.  Shame on the wedding ring, though.
so sad.
this guy is so harrrrrrddddd :(:(:((:(:(::(:(:(:(:(:(
Only a TA, but probably the most effective one I have ever had. His mastery of language is useful for teaching students. I wish he was my TA for every class.
It is a great introduction to current optical research and shares the understanding of optical problems with direct and clear explanations.
He is very clear and understandable, hilarious as well.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Enthusiastic guy, excellent class. Just a little bit hard. Hottest topic so no textbook.
He understands problems very deeply, and explain questions very clearly, and he is willing to help students. You will improve your knowledge a lot by attending his classes
His only problem is English.  Really smart, energetic, and helpful.  He will do anything to help you and really does care about his classes.  Just talks very very fast.
His classes were very engaging and he made sure that students understand each and every thing.

Prof. Bernal was really great - he offered many materials to get students up to speed even if they did not have necessary prerequisites and was often available outside of class (even after the semester ended!). Given his experience in industry, the class also highlighted the DL techniques currently in use and offered many guest lectures.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: Prof Bernal is really nice and full of sarcasm! He makes the material very accessible and helped me with deep learning even after the class ended and he had no obligation to do so. That says a lot about a professor! Also, there are tons of extra credit opportunities for undergraduates if they are inclined to compete graduate assignments.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Prof Bernal was really great. He prepared for lectures well and poured a lot of effort into preparing slides and code for lecture. He also provided a fair bit of code for the homework to get students started and was always reachable through email with a response time of 30 mins on average. I would highly recommend you take his course!

Do not take this class. He is not even a professor. Worst course ever! Grading is very subjective. he is busy with rationalizing the grading. You can learn deep learning in youtube. homework called "project" never helpful. If many friends in your class, you'll get a fabulous grade by sharing answers with each other. He never cares.

International Economics is an amazing subject to study, but Jones cannot deliver a lecture to save his life. The book lays it out clearly, but he never uses it in class. If he doesn't finish what he wants to cover, you must learn it on your own (which is how it ends up the majority of the time). Hello to my first B in an econ class.

Brilliant man, awful teacher. Lectures consist of him telling pointless stories about his various travels I overheard a conversation with him and a student: "I'm teaching intl econ next year... maybe I'll get it right one of these years." That sums it up really. To do well, read the textbook and pray that the rest of the class is as lost as you are

very knowlegeable (he wrote the book). the class is fairly easy if you go to the lectures and read the chapters in the book at least once before the exam. his stories are interesting, but he tends to repeat them. take this class if you are interested in international trade, or the rest of your schedule is very demanding and you need some balance!
No Comments
No Comments

Dr. Murphy is nice but her class was sometimes frustrating. She always let us out of class 3-5 minutes late and was often unclear with instructions. She is a pretty easy grader, and gave good feedback. Not the hardest class, but not too impactful either.

Dr. Murphy is an incredible professor in my opinion. As a required course, WRTG105-18 seems like it had a typical workload to me. It was difficult, however, to balance it because I am a BME student, so I already had my homework from engineering and natural sci. courses. Dr. M was very flexible with due dates though and made the course interesting.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr Murphy is a great person but the class was not fun. Tons of homework, and more work overall than my friends with different professors for 105. I will say that she is flexible on deadlines which is nice

Dr.M is a great person and accommodating with deadlines as long as you communicate. Her instructions/announcements are LONG and sorta organized but can feel chaotic and make the assignments seem harder than they are-but it shows she genuinely cares. Stay on top of due dates bc she posts the assignments late sometimes & it's easy to forget some.

I had Dr. Murphy for Writing 105 and I really liked her. I will say that there is a LOT of homework. However, she can be flexible about deadlines for major assignments. She is clear about her expectations in her posts about assignments, however, she does forget to post assignments occasionally.

My favorite teacher at the UofR by far!  I love her and her class! She is so approachable and knows a lot about the material.  I highly recommend getting to know her outside of class in her office hours.  Take the class!  You won't regret it!

The TAs said that she has made the tests a lot harder than when they took the class. The problem is that her tests are extremely specific and they cover a wide area. So there's the problem that you could study a lot but a particular area will be question very in depth and some chapters completely left out. Assignments are simple.
Very straight-forward tests, reading the textbook helped but wasn't absolutely necessary to do well. Dr.Wray-Lake is super nice, down-to-earth, and very knowledgable of the material.

Professor Wray-Lake is AWESOME, My favorite  professor by far. She is a great lecturer, if you go to her class, you will do well. She is always willing to help her students and never talks down to us.

As a teacher, she wasn't bad, and she tried to keep class interesting. Also, the exams were noncumulative, which was nice. However, she required that you read the book because she didn't have time to teach everything in class, the only thing that you're graded on are the three exams, and she doesn't curve grades at all. Overall, a 'meh' professor.

Holy heck, this lab class is one of the hardest, most engaging classes the UofR offers.  Make sure you have lotssss of time for revisions and reading.  You really need to plan your time well or you won't get above a B. She's a great teacher though, and take this opportunity to LEARN HOW TO WRITE!
The class is very hard but fun and she is really nice, very helpful, and easy to talk to.
No Comments
Course work is very rought, but expected.  She is super nice and easy to talk to.
No Comments
i love Professor Rogers. Best professor I've had a Rochester. His intelligence and ability to teach in an understandable way is outstanding. I would recommend taking anything with him!
Simply the Best
Very interesting guy and great at explaining. The constant presence of examples makes the class feel tangible and reduces the abstractness.
Hes the best at everything he does.
I loved having a rogers as a teachers, he's a big goof ball who is insanely good at math and teaching

Great Class!  Gary wrote the notes for the course and he wrote them very clear.  I have a significantly greater interest in the material after taking this class.  I took condensed matter physics before and barely understood but this time through I really get a conceptual/quantitative view of what is really going on in the field of s.s. physics

YO MAN! he is indeed "Chillest mofo"~~ great great professor. I thought i was gonna fail out and just come to him a lot and asking lots of question. Man it's worthy he will help you out both the class material and the grade man

Professor Wicks is a great guy. I bombed his mid-term and he said if i did well on the final I would stil have a chance of doing well in the class. So he worked with me and answered my questions after class. I hope you will take his class also.
The man!
Chillest mofo in the land, ever, you could only hope to have this prof.
Though the course material itself is dry,I am learning a lot. Prof Virag is not flashy, but teaches competently. He's obviously smart.

Professor Virag is clearly an intelligent individual; however, his ability to teach is quite questionable. He gives minimal explanations during his lectures and essentially reads the slides of his presentation word for word; so, attending class is more or less pointless as he puts the lectures online. Overall, a very poor professor.
He's the awesomest awesome great professor. Cool accent. He's super clear and very smart.

He posted all the power point slides (which are very thorough) from class online thus going to class can be pointless because he doesn't cover anything besides the slides. He's available if you need help and is really smart but I'm wary of his interest and abilities in teaching.
No Comments

Psych stats is the most boring thing ever, but he made it tolerable! He's really nice and super clear about what he'll test you on. No surprises on the exams and they're pretty easy if you have moderate understanding of how math works.
He's a great teacher! He's very clear about everything and has clear powerpoint slides that you can study off of. The tests are really easy too.
No Comments

He's awesome and has that Powerpoint presentation on lock.  His delivery is no nonsense and clear and what's more he makes an effort to make the class bearable.  I enjoyed taking his class with all my heart and soul.

Mike is a great teacher, he takes his teaching seriously and enjoys what he's doing. He's polite and encourages questions if confused. Even outside of class, he's always there to help you. He makes his teachings insightful and his lecture slides are very clear and organized. Don't risk choosing other professors if you have the chance of taking him.
His teaching is not bad, but his grading criteria is unclear.

Dr. Xi is a great professor. His lecture was intense but never boring. He emphasized the cultivation of mathematical thinking thus spent much class time showing the proof of theorems. He was approachable as well, willing to offer help and responding to emails quickly. If you are interested in math, I strongly recommend you to take his course!

The professor recites textbooks, and the explanations are NOT clear. He always says "so the proof is pretty simple" and "this is similar to what we have done before", and use it as an excuse not to do the full proof in class. In class examples are basic, which doesn't help the HW and the exam at all.
He's a pretty good professor. Very to the point and prepares you incredibly well for exams. His students did the best in that course that semester across all instructors.

Everything is awesome besides grading. There are no clear grading criteria and some hardworking student got A- only because of a unsatisfactory performance on the final examination. He seems to believe that allowing only 25% of the students get A's is reasonable, but beware this is an upper-level course and most instructors allow 80% for an A.

Professor Grimm was somewhat tough. Lectures did not always follow the reading that was assigned prior to class. Also, took a while to get back to me on emails and assignments. Not a lot of help on assignments before due dates even though there was not a clear rubric for some assignments.

The class is like 3 courses in 1. It's lang doc./ling readings, tech stuff, and cult. anth stuff. Her feedback half time is critical w/o any substance and other times it simply makes no sense. Take when you have time to read a lot and only take it if you want to do linguistic-oriented fieldwork.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: I took Ling104 randomly my first semester and this is the class that convinced me to become a Linguistics major! Nadine is a great professor and very understanding of her students' personal problems. This course was also very interesting and a pretty easy A as long as you do the readings (usually around 30 pages every class) and try on the essays.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: Prof Grimm is kind and sweet, but she is very vague with her assignments. She takes a long time to give grades back and is a slightly tough grader. Very nice and understanding person, but not the best with feedback.
Takes forever to give back assignments and is very vague on assignment instructions. And when asked for clarification is kind of flaky. I would not recommend this professor under any circumstance.

Choose Professor Carney over any other professor if you have the choice. You get to learn in a stress-free environment with arguably one of the best math professors in the U of R. His jokes are the good kind of cringe, and if you take his classes you won't be cringing at your grades as a plus.
his enthusiasm and clear teaching method make the class better :D I really enjoy his math jokes
He made math entertaining. Super funny guy in like an awkward way. Highly recommend
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: His enthusiasm makes the class better, This is a hard class but he is extremely accessible outside of class. He will give you hints for the problems and not just straightly tell you the answers, which is great! It's a pity he had a haircut though.

This was Carney's first semester teaching and overall did a good job. Very helpful and wanted you to know the material. Course went from fairly easy to extremely difficult as semester went on. makes a bad joke halfway through lectures. Tests a lot easier than webworks and lecture material which meant there was no test curve.

I took History of Western music 1800-present with Professor Sholes. She prepared amazing lectures and she was good at controlling the pace of each lecture! She was very responsible and gave us in-depth feedbacks for our essays. Since all of the history courses are heavy, I think the workload for MUSC 223 worked perfectly fine for me!

Dr. Sholes is clearly knowledgeable, but her tone/style comes off as very insecure despite this which makes it hard to focus. Two exams and a paper is pretty heavy for a class like this, and the exams are closed-note despite her emphasis on connecting historical trends over just memorizing details. That said, if you put in the work, you'll do well.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Her class is challenging, but she presents the material very well, and her exams are difficult but straightforward with no surprises. She does care about students, and I was impressed how she set up individual meetings to get to know us. I would structure the class differently though; a 8-10 page paper and a final exam in two weeks was a bit much.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: Prof. Sholes is extremely knowledgeable, and she knows her stuff. That said, she is not a good professor because she clearly does not understand the undergraduate experience. Tests are graded so harshly, and there is so much major work near the end of the semester. How she structures the course and the amount of detail she expects is ridiculous.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: She is an excellent teacher and she knows how to explain things clearly. Follow her instructions and do your work, you won't be disappointed!

Tests are based on lecture material and primary literature that goes along with what is taught. Fairly straightforward class. It may seem daunting or like the material is hard to follow in the very beginning, but stick with it and it will make sense.
Pay attention to lectures, need to read primary literature but things you need to know for the exam are all explained during the lecture.

Make sure you record the lectures yourself and go through them after class.  Other than papers there is not much outside reading so the time taken out of class will mostly be for going over notes.  Know the little things and try to make a story out of it.
not the most enthusiastic but still a pretty cool guy

Class is based on reading primary literature.  This was difficult for me but Professor Lambert was very helpful.  He is great one on one and good at breaking down some confusing information.  Tests were specific so know the literature.  Over all though his class pushed me and made me a better student.  Professor and class both recommended.

Professor Grimm is a great guy. Super understanding and always ready to help you out and answer questions. There's just one problem: he isn't good at teaching. I think he's too nervous to detach from the textbook we were working with, and that hurt him - for the parts of the course not covered by the textbook, he did a much better job explaining.

Pretty cool class! Often throws his own schedule out the window on a whim but only to pursue something more interesting. Seems excited to share and to help students grow. Values genuine effort over accuracy (but not a pushover grader). Gives total creative control over them too which is fresh. I could go on, all nice things.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: While the class was slightly disorganized, prof. Grimm is a really nice guy and care how his students are doing. He wants to see improvement, and makes you feel like he's there to help if you need. He'll call for you to answer questions in class, but you'll be fine if you pay attention.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: He was very unhelpful in office hours, and the class was very unstructured and unorganized. I couldn't tell what the main points were and what we were supposed to get out of any of the assignments.
I have never seen a professor stand and sit down so much in one class in my life. Really good prof

This professor just hands out notes and reads over the filled out notes that often have typos. His lectures are all over the place and you get little out of them. Homework problems are the only way to know what's going on.
Hands out packets of notes with no examples for engineering principles! I could not learn anything from lectures and failed when he strayed from the book material! :(

This class is interesting,informal and very comprehensive.Professor Wu's anecdotes makes this class even more lively.There will be guest lectures, who will share their knowledge based on their experience and are some of the pioneers in the field of biotechnology.
Best class ever.  Interesting and easy.
Excellent advisor, interesting lecturer.  A good way to break into the CHE program.
Professor Sun's class is interesting at beginning, until his midterm test and paper. The average was very low for a introductory history class. His accents need improvements.
I regret taking this class, the teacher's accents too strong, he wasted class time to fix the powerpoint, he graded unfair. hes just ridiculous. do yourself a favor: do not take his class!
yes very very awful~~
Not a good prof.  Unfair grading, not clear, accent problems, can't really teach.  Just bad in general.  Do not take his class, you will regret it forever and ever and EVER.
Not clear, Not helpful, Too much work, Bad Grammar, Hard Grader.
He is great! Very clear, very helpful. His accent is a little hard to understand at first but in time it gets cute. Overall he's a very kind, well-qualified teacher of calculus.

One of the best professors I have had at the U of R. He is very organized and clear. He also always explains the reasoning behind calculus concepts. I knew several people who were registered for this class with other professors but would attend his lectures instead because he was so good.
He is soooooo cute! Very intelligent!

Lai was very soft spoken but if you sit close to the front, you should be fine. He was very clear with presenting material and covered revalent examples. All test questions were more than fair and he often went over complex webwork problems. Overall a great teacher
Great professor for differential geometry, knows his stuff.
Extremely quiet, boring and dry.  The class is a joke and you do not have to pay attention, go to class, or do the readings to do well

Powell is unbelievably boring. Her lectures are painfully dull. She speaks so quietly that it's nearly impossible to hear her if you sit too far back in the lecture hall. Exams are fair but Powell has no effect on their grading- the TAs do all the work. Nobody goes to class because she puts powerpoints up on blackboard.
boring, can't hear  her, nice but wastes what could be a good class on boringness...have to study for the midterm and final but def doable
A solid, accomplished professor, but not the most interesting. Not a lot of work to do in the course, a good option for PSC majors interested in electoral politics.

I took the course that she co-taught w/ Niemi.  Powell is very knowledgeable but very boring and overly academic in her lectures.  She tends to keep talking and talking about material beyond the scope of the course.  However, she is very helpful when you talk to her after class.  I also liked her because she was willing to fight for gamma.
Knew his stuff, no question.
No Comments
Weird guy. Very intelligent, but could be kind of a d*ck if you disagreed with him.
No Comments
Very passionate man. Can play the guitar like nothing else. Oooh, and all those tattoos...
A very solid choice as a German teacher. Adjusts the course to the class's needs, cares about her students, and all around makes a very good teacher.

Frau Becker is a phenomenal teacher. Beyond just her teaching skills, she is one of the most caring professors I have come across at this school thus far. I have nothing but kind words to say about her.

Frau Becker assigns a one page Aufsatz with each set of Test/Vocab Quiz, so make sure you drill the vocab with flashcards & pics. The more vocab you know, the less time you spend looking words up. For flashcards, I cross-reference Linguee, LEO Dictionary, Beolingus, & Collins 8th Unabridged Dictionary. Also, use Language Tool for grammar.
She's very sweet, helpful and understanding, with a good sense of humour!
Frau Becker is one of the best Teachers I've ever had, and certainly the best German teacher!!!

One of my favorite professors ever. The lectures aren't anything extraordinary, but the structure of the class motivates me to learn the material thoroughly. Wouldn't recommend this professor if you are not able to self-learn. I enjoy how the class employs a 'teach a man to fish' approach and have an immense amount of respect for the professor.

Professor Nichol's PHYS 246 was definitely one of the top three physics classes I have ever taken in college. PHYS 246 was challenging. Though maths is simple linear algebra, a lot of the learning processes depend on in-depth understanding. Nichol did very well in providing explanations that were not offered in the textbook.

Prof. Nichol explains things so well for quantum theory (PHYS 246). He knows how to explain and is very good at identifying if students have questions and even predicting what questions we have and answering them. The material is very challenging, but he is very good at making quantum theory as painless as possible.

He's not a good professor; he really doesn't know how to teach. The one redeeming thing about him is that if you talk to him outside of class, you'll see that he's super nice and wants you to know the material. He just can't teach it.

Professor Nichol does not care for teaching this class well nor does he care about his students doing well and understanding the material. Apparently, the lectures were meant to reiterate what was stated in the textbook. The textbook used for this course just proves the exact same derivations of equations that the professor did. TAKE SELF-PACED!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He can only read PowerPoints and perform sign languages that you can not understand. The course is not extremely hard but very unreasonable in designing final and midterm exams. There is very limited time for you to debug and you get a very low grade if there is one simple mistake in your program.

Does his best in teaching the given material. He knows C/C++ very well. Spends a lot of time teaching things that aren't as important, and I get more from his slides. Probably good pay attention in class as quizzes are specific. Quizzes are difficult, and midterm is very difficult even for a familiar programmer. Probably torture for new programmers

Gezz, too hard to be an intro course. The midterm is 4 chosen 3 programming questions just in 100 minutes. I can only do two of them. For the first time, I still have time debugging. For the second, I even do not have time debugging. My god, my first course to get a A though I have studied a lot for this course. If this is your major, get ready!!!!

Professor Kastner is a solid lecturer, it's just that the stuff he's teaching is incredibly boring and annoying to memorize. The attendance thing is a but annoying to, but it does boost your grade. He may come off as a bit of a hard-ass but he really isn't, he's actually pretty nice.

This class is an intro to programming and Stephen has improved the class greatly. Focused the class to Object Oriented Design, gives real-life examples since he works side by side also. A great person overall; he will be willing to help you whenever you need it. It is a bit homework intensive but that's how you learn programming!

Don't take a class with this professor. Last semester I took his intro to debate class, and he would skip every other class leaving his overworked TAs to teach the class. He just wants to stack the debate team with people. 
His absences though did make the class easy because he gave up teaching after a few slideshow monologues.

He doesn't really teach much about debate, he just reads off long slideshows about the structure of debates. The class isn't as much about critical thinking and argument as how to win at a debate tournament. He's pretty much impossible to get ahold of outside of class and can be extremely unorganized sometimes

he does not teach at all, he reads off of long slideshows. he is also extremely unorganized, he tends to forget what he put on the syllabus. not once did he ever explain how to do projects/group assignments. he doesn't even introduce debate, all just trying to get you to join the debate team.

Two reasons I didn't like this class: 1. This isn't "how to construct a dynamic, thought provoking arguments". This class is "how to win at the sport that is college debate", unless you love high school policy debate, you will hate this class as I do. 2. For a debate class. Fletcher is incredibly disorganized and extremely frustrating to work for.

Four total debates (midterm, two finals and one SPAR/spontaneous debate) and one group presentation. Great and accessible professor! Even though this was an intro class, more experienced peers made debates more challenging and fun

Disappointing don't think it's very professional of her to convey some of the condescending and insulting attitudes feelingsbeliefs etc. that she has expressed.  QUITE shocking, especially win the religious studies realm(!?).  univ. should be ashamed and embarrassed. Very disappointing.
If one were to make a list of examples for the need for tenure reform Prof Butler would be at the top of the list.
i think she is fantastic. she is helpful, clear and interesting. you are just a bad student.
No Comments

I had this professor for History of Religion in America and it was a very bad experience. She barely comes to class, treats the curriculum with no integrity, does not know students at all and doesn't add her knowledge to the tetbook use. I could have read a book and gotten more informtion than i learned the entire semester. do not take a course w h
Funny, intelligent, and interesting. Lectures were always involving and very tangible.
He makes the subject very interesting. One of the best professors I've ever had.

He teches right off the book. The only good part of the class is the presentation...u actually learn....he doesn't teach you to help you on the homework but the hw is grade ez...the final is a killer if u fail it u do really bad...it was ez clss until after the class....he laughs alot and has no incentive to help
He got his PhD from MIT but it doesn't mean he is brilliant:)..He follows everything on the book, nothing comes from his own mind...
keeps your attention during lecture, even though it's basic stuff from the textbook. You can tell he's brilliant.

She was excellent at teaching. I appreciated the high standard she set for the class; it made me take the class more seriously and ultimately get so much out of the class. The course explored such a wide range of contemporary dance technique. I gained more from this class than I ever anticipated on learning. My favorite class at UR!

Total jerk. Disorganized, terrible with email, emphasized being on time but was always late. Grades based on how much she likes you. Has you write opinion papers but grades you lowly if your opinion doesn't agree with hers. Learned nothing, and her technique isn't even good but she seems to think she's amazing. Wish I had dropped.

I took World Dance with her, I really enjoyed the class and learning more than just one type of dancing.  She clearly knows more than just one type of dance, and demonstrates that in this class. I would have enjoyed being able to dance more than once a week, but the lectures and debates about dance made me look at dance differently.

She is a fanatic about attendance, and I found out too late that she doesn't even record attendance accurately. I dropped an entire letter grade due to her lack of organization.  Dance ability and effort seem not to matter.  Handing something in late, no matter the reason, drastically hurts your grade. Courtney World doesn't check her email EVER.

Disorganized as all hell. A jerk about attendance, even if you have a note from UHS it counts against you. Content is patchy and skips around. Warm-ups take half the class or more. Hopefully things will pick up, I should have dropped the course while I still could.

This professor taught my physics/chemistry advanced lab course. He did very well in giving us freedom to explore the science. I can imagine he would be better for upper-level courses, but I did not have him for any 100/200s to compare. He can be rough around the edges, but I found him to be very helpful in preparing for graduate studies in physics.

Have you ever wondered what it would be like to be taught Thermodynamics by a Part-Time, Assistant Professor? Well... wonder no more! Take PHY 227 for the low price of ~$50,000 a year! Seriously, you will learn everything you wanted to know about nothing... And Nothing is well worth the price! Actually, I lied... Do not take Boersma's courses!

He is the worst professor I've ever had.  I never went to class because he was too useless as a lecturer.  Worse still was his grading system: his tests were straight memorization and sign errors would cost you letter grades.  Do NOT take any course he teaches.

I was very disgusted in this class!! Professor Boersma did a terrible job teaching. Half of the semester was spent on learning trivial probability and the other was spent regurgitating equations from the textbook on homework and exams without learning any physics. It was evident that he had minimal understanding of the subject. Desecrated thermo!!

Professor Boersma is one of the most incompetent teachers I have ever had. I did not learn a single thing in his "class" that I hadn't seen in non-AP high school physics, nor did anybody. Even an A in his class still meant that you knew nothing. His grading system was asinine. Lectures verbatim from text. Don't ever take his classes!!!

Professor Paine was very passionate about the content he lectured on. I enjoyed the content of the course and each of the six assignments was straightforward enough. The only thing that would have made the class better would have been a more exact rubric for the papers as many essay prompts can be a bit open ended.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Prof. Paine is incredibly mindful of his students and willingly explains concepts repeatedly to clarify them. Grading is straight forward as long as you follow all the guidelines. There are a lot require readings but there are some that you can generally just skim through and look at more in depth if needed for writing the essays.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Prof Paine has potential, but tends to let his lectures get sidetracked by the students asking questions every 10 minutes. Though its nice that he cares, he just needs to tell them to come to office hours, rather than letting them make a lecture into a QandA.

Professor Paine is decent. The class is not as interesting as I thought it would be, and a lot of reading is assigned. Though Prof Paine lets you know that skimming is expected, if you are someone who prefers less reading, but in depth, this is not a good class. The lectures can be interesting, but grading is harsh. That may be the TA though.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: He assigns a lot of readings each week (100-200 pages), but they're pretty interesting for the most part. All essays clearly reflect class material and are easy to answer provided that you did at least half the readings. If u follow the essay directions to a T, you get an A. He's really dorky and passionate abt the subject.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Prof.Mort is so polite and supportive, making DSCC201 an ideal intro to Data Science. The content covers Bash, R, Python, comprehensive yet NOT overly broad - perfect for self-exploration. You'll come to appreciate its value as you advance. I'm grateful for the experience in Spring and highly recommend both prof & course to anyone embarking on DS.

Professor Mort is a very kind and caring, and I have no criticism of him as a teacher. However, DSCC 201's syllabus (content) coverage is too wide. With one language introduced at each unit, by the end of the semester, my memory of the previous units faded. Recently, tests are introduced which I think is a step toward the right direction.
You need his lecture to do your homework.
the best professor!
Very good introductory course for data science majors. Also learned a lot of useful things and applied to internships

Professor Pultorak is very easy going and cares about his students, but he is not a great teacher. He is very accessible if you need help, but he is unable to explain concepts clearly. Also, questions on the test are sometimes random and are different from anything we had done during the lectures.

Pultorak has only been at MCC for a few years to my knowledge, but he's doing a good job so far. I had him for ENR253 and ENR157 and he's pretty easy going. He has open note tests and they're relatively fair. The labs can be long and the digital systems project was a bit intense, but he'll work with you if you come to him with questions.

I took Pultorak at MCC and he is the most wonderful professor I have ever had. He is extremely caring about all of his students. He will help you anyway he can and always answers emails fast. Tests always open notes and laptop which really helps. If you have the chance to take a class with Pultorak definitely take it with him.

Best Professor ever! Professor Pultorak is really kind accessible and encouraging, and will always try his best to help students with their difficulties and concerns. A lot of fun projects and the exam was based on the problems in the homework. Highly recommended!

Great professor: clear lectures with a lot of examples. Records lectures, but uses attendance to round up grades. Easy, short labs usually. Scales tests and aims for 85% average. Textbook only needed for homework (get a pdf)
Prof. Digby is amazing

Professor Digby is amazing! She makes the course material interesting, her lectures are good and she's very knowledgeable and passionate. She's caring and will take the time to talk to you about the topics covered in class if you need. She does assign lots of readings, but pay attention during lectures and skim the readings and you should do fine.

She is very kind, and her lectures are super interesting. Her exams are only a couple short answer questions (partially recollection and partially application/analysis). She is very intelligent, and knowledgable about the material. Always open to questions and making sure students understand the content.

Prof. Digby is absolutely amazing. There's a Keynes quote listing need for history, philosophy, politics, and math in a "master economist," and she's the "master prof. of econ." Her class offers a lot of history/political context; her math, if any, is clear; and she's willing to listen to any and all thoughts. She's also incredibly passionate!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Digby is an extremely intelligent girlboss. She knows what she's talking about, but is receptive to what you have to say about the readings. Although the material is dense, and she has a tendency to lose you in the density, she does make the content interesting and makes your brain work. Would recommend to anyone looking for an elective.

I loved this class so much and will recommend to all of my friends. Not only did I learn a ton about poetry, I also felt comfortable sharing my own work because of the class atmosphere and the professor. Professor Wessels cares a lot about his students, was always available and gave tremendously helpful feedback. He even made us food!

Christian is an amazing professor. He is insanely knowledgeable and his passion for poetry is truly infectious. I will be taking more classes with him next semester and recommending him to any friends. His class is not "easy", but it is so fulfilling, I find myself excited to finish work for it. 10/10!!

Professor Wessels is hands down my favorite professor ever. He is so knowledgeable about poetry it will blow your mind and cares so much about his students. I got AMAZING feedback on my own poetry and grew so much as a poet, thanks to this class and Prof Wessels. If you care for poetry, take this class (and follow the prompts)! He's also funny.

Manipulates the content in a distasteful way & seems more interested in the cadence of his own voice than the literary themes he claims to analyze. Talks down to students in a very uncomfortable way. Don't waste your time with his misguided passion.
Really good teacher. Gives great feedback on papers and very quick at responding to emails. Class was so chill and pretty easy so it's not hard to get an A. Genuinely very fun class!

Wessels is a great professor. He's really chill and easy to talk to. I enjoy going to class. Second semester was more fun than the first semester because everyone knows each other more and we do more class discussions and have fewer readings.He's nice with grading and enjoys teaching. I'm not much of a writer, but I enjoyed his class.

I love the way he lectures. Super funny but also very well informed and great at giving feedback. Would take a class just because he's teaching it. I really enjoyed his class even though I don't necessarily like writing.
Do you work and attend class and you will get an A. Attending class was also fun cause Christian is pretty funny.
great professor

Prof Kuzgun is kind and caring and she respects her students. She's willing to slow down when it's necessary and she cares about whether we understand the material. This was the opposite of the MATH161 experience. Key to doing well is YouTube videos that follow the txtbook and getting WebWork done as quickly as possible so you can actually study.
take this class with someone else.
Professor Kuzgun is such a nice professor. She always explains things in details and always provide numerous examples. I would recommend anyone taking her class:)
She is an amazing professor, very caring. Fun fact about her: she wears a T-shirt with text "Monday" on it every Monday.
Professor Moon is funny and seems like a great guy. However, beware that he takes a long time to respond to emails and grade papers. Overall, good class.
No clear grading guidelines and harsh essay grader

Amazing prof! Very reading intensive, but if you pace yourself and are strategic it's fine. He does take a long time to grade, but his feedback is thorough. Attendance not mandatory, but go to lectures because they really help and he gives important updates about assignments. Also go to his office hours-he's really hilarious and great to talk to!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy

comment: He grades extremely late (papers weren't graded for around 2 months, while in the meantime he would give more papers), he was very vague with assignments, and would have papers listed on the syllabus for a date that was nowhere near the date he gave them and gave no warning about assigning papers or finals, and his lectures are very involved.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Professor moon is overall okay but there is definitely room for improvement. Homework can be a lot of reading but you can definitely get away with not reading everything; it's more tedious than difficult. Grading can be a bit subjective but not horrible. He takes ages to grade your papers and assignments.

In case he hasn't retired by next summer, don't take this course. His grading criteria is based on regurgitation of definitions, not demonstrated comprehension and ability. He's rude and condescending to students. Don't make the mistake of ruining your summer by taking this course- you won't enjoy it, and  you won't get the scores you want.

Taking this class in the summer might be the worst decision you ever make.  Unless you have previously taken the course or AP Chem in high school I would not recommend taking it.He does not teach during the year and there's a reason why.  Don't be a fool in thinking it will be easier over the summer.  It's not and you won't get the grade you want.

15 weeks of gen chem in a 6 week session is difficult.  Dr. Hickey paces the course as well as can be expected, but without any time to let the material sink in, it can be tough to keep up.  The fact that Dr. Hickey demands a level of mastery in excess of other faculty at the U or R translates into brutal exams on a very compressed schedule.

Tests really don't reflect what he teaches. He asks you to fully interpret things that he gives you a rudimentary description of. He does know his subject material quite well, though. But most importantly, he might be the slowest teacher ever.
He is a very good teacher but his tests are extremely hard he wants you to be a master at the topic and talk about it as though you have been studying it for years for a general chemistry course.
He does't know what he is talking about.
Classes aren't worth going to.

Prof. Seiferas is very helpful, inviting students to his office anytime. Main problem is many students are forced to take class without having the prerequisite, for them the class obscenely hard and the lectures cryptic. I wish he would stick more closely to a textbook- papers he gives for us to read require reading many other papers to comprehend.

The guy is ferociously talented. I have got to give him that and due to that nature, he is far beyond comprehend-able. It is impossible to follow him in class. Just terrifying difficult in the beginning but it gets better. Still teaching could be a lot better. he is dedicated though but too brilliant to understand student are not as fluent as him!!

Really cares about his students and welcomes feedback.  Not a very good lecturer though, especially when he uses Powerpoint slides.  Tests were surprisingly hard.  Expect to do a LOT of extra studying outside of class.

Mr. Manly is awesome!! I took his class at the dawn of my college career and he has stuck in my mind as one of the best teachers ever. Don't be scared off by the lecture tangent talk here... his tangents are entertaining and will teach you a little about being an adult, not just class. He swears sometimes... you can handle it
