Lectures are not concise and he goes on random tangents.  You never know what he actually finds important and is going to put on the test.  Lectures were useless. It was dumb that we had to meet with partners every week and write a short report on what we "discussed".  A research paper is only worth 8% and the "freshman psych"  didn't have to do it

A fun teacher, great sense of humor. Tests are not that bad -- most material comes from lectures. I have heard that his class doesn't prepare you as well as other professors for psych classes to come though.

He is a nice guy, but his lectures are all over the place. Goes on lots of tangents and then needs to rush through material to catch up. Definitely read the  book. The tests aren't as bad as I had expected.

Hilarious, intereting/unusual  requirements and class set up. Big paper was only worth 8% of our grade, required us to pair up and meet for an hour each week and talk about Pysch, formed small groups in class for debating things, puts comics and fortunes from fortunes cookies on tests. Pretty awesome in my opinion.

Professor is incredibly dull and leaves practically all grading up to the TAs. The grading is inconsistent and harsh. As an undergraduate in a class that is heavily grad students, it doesn't seem like they consider how much experience students have the the material before assignments and quizzes are given.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Prof. Schubert manages to do the impossible: turn the most fascinating topic of our generation into a snooze. He seems more concerned with getting through his slides than engaging students in meaningful conversation. Readings are outdated and writing assignments consist of regurgitating lecture material

One of the few CS professors you'll find with a real interest (and knowledge and experience) in AI outside of the context of engineering. Has a very soporific voice. Humanities-phobic CS students don't tend to cope with the material or the assignments well, but if you can critically read a text and write an essay defending an opinion, you'll be OK.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Its not that I would take again, but I will most likely have to retake to get credit... very unreasonable, medians for the assignments range 30%-50%. Does not like to explain mistakes in class.

Schubert has extensive experience in the field of AI, but unfortunately he can't seem to lead an engaging class on this interesting topic. Get ready for pop quizzes and obtuse essay assignments, with averages of 33-50%. The only reason to attend class is to make sure you can write something down on these quizzes, lest you get a 0 instead.

Very good professor. Clearly wants her students to learn and prepare for med/grad school. She brings in lots of real donor organs/specimens making the labs interesting. Getting an A is very very easy as long as you do well on the lab practicals, which are just memorization.

Dr. Gdowski is by far, one of the best professors at the University of Rochester. This class is all about what you put into it. If you go to lecture, attend all the labs, and interact with the material, you will succeed. She is amazing at explaining lecture material, and her labs are great because she shows you anatomical correlates.

She is a very amazing professor. Taking the course with her was a great decision. She really does care for the progress of the students. I think I did well because I was serious with labs, lectures and using the anatomical models on my own free time

Best class I've taken at UR. She teaches for the Medical School so she really knows what she's talking about. Tests are very fair, no homework except for short pre-labs and she makes the class really interesting. Definitely take it if you get the chance !
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: She's the best professor I have ever taken a class with ever. I am talking Dedication Knowledge Organization, just every aspect about her teaching skills is spectacular, I hope I could take another class with her. The class is a little hard and needs time and dedication, yet it's extremely rewarding and beneficial. EVERY BME SHOULD TAKE HER CLASS.

(WRTG 273) Wayy too much work for a 2-credit class. Assignments are almost all written and mostly talking about yourself. (easy?-ish) Stay on top of everything or you will fall behind. She is nice and will work with you if you reach out. She obviously knows a lot about English, so if you have questions about that, her feedback is valuable.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Online Savvy

comment: Ashley is undoubtedly one of the kindest professors I've had at the UofR. Provided excellent writing feedback and truly cared about our growth as writers and students. She provides ample opportunities to improve your grade through draft revisions and peer feedback. If you are looking for a good WRTG105 professor, look no further!

Please take this professor's class. Don't hesitate. Even though the class wasn't interesting enough, her grades were very nice (almost everybody gets A in my class). The workload isn't that much comparing to other professors. The only thing is it's a small class and you cannot skip one without any reasons.

In my writing class, the workload revolves heavily around reading assignments, making it quite demanding. The teacher's approach involves regular low grades after each task, which initially seemed daunting. However, the silver lining lies in the promise of a curved final exam grade, offering hope for those struggling along the way.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: The professor is responsible to her students; grades are fair. If you submit everything and participate in class, you will be fine. The professor's feedback is very useful. It's not tough to get an A.

Zach is one of my favorite instructors I've ever had, period. He teaches with a passion that just radiates off of him but really lets student opinions shine, as well as making seemingly boring topics pretty interesting. I could go on but I totally recommend his class and am excited to have him as an instructor again.

Zach is a completely fair grader. He puts so much time and effort into helping each student improve their writing. If you do the work, you will get a good grade. There's a lot of discussion and the class really pushes your thinking. I had a reading and discussion post due before almost every class, which got a bit repetitive.

Zach was a great professor for WRTG 105! He is so nice and genuinely cares about each student. You can tell that he is passionate about the subject matter. The material was not too difficult although there was a fair amount of reading to do (and with each reading there is a 3-4 sentence discussion post) and the class is heavily discussion-based.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Barber is an excellent instructor--he's friendly, gave individualized feedback, graded fairly, and fostered a collaborative atmosphere. We learned to write essays/citations/etc, but I most loved the riveting discussions (eg, esp. the one about what happens to us when we die). This course represents the ideal of a first-year writing course. Bravo!

Instructor Zach puts a lot of efforts into structuring his lessons with his students' best interests and intellectual development in mind. You will find Zach to be very approachable and open to feedback, so don't be hesitate to reach out to him whenever you have any concerns regarding academics or criticisms of the lessons.

Zach is a phenomenal writing instructor who truly cares about his students and how he can better their writing skills. My writing improved so much from this class, and the discussions we had were always intriguing. Highly reccomend taking him even if you're not a fan of philosophy.

Professor Barber was amazing and the only Writing professor I had an amazing time with. He is very passionate about philosophy, clear about how he grades and gives very insightful feedback that are gentile but helpful. I grew a lot in writing and he was very accomodating. Take his class if you love discussions!
Fun class! Highly recommend to anyone interested in Pricing policies or anti-trust laws. Prof Shaffer makes classes fun with his dry humor.

Professor Shaffer is a great professor with a lot of credibility backing him up. He has a lot of experience in the field of pricing. Adding to it, his humor is top-notch and makes his classes a lot of fun. Would take again if it was possible.
Professor Shaffer is really an expert in pricing policy and gave incredibly excellent lectures.
No Comments
excellent course, professor intelligent.

Lectures are incredibly interesting and he knows a lot about the blues, including firsthand accounts of musicians that he's met or is friends with. He plays lots of music in class, keeps lectures light and interesting, and makes sure it is easy to pass the course. One short paper and weekly music listening is the only homework.

Laid back class that discusses the story we read. The class is based on a couple of essays and he is a very fair grader and gives helpful feedback. He is more like a friend than a teacher. The class is more discussion based so dont worry about having any prior experience on how to analyze (arabic) literature. I really enjoyed this class.
Excellent teacher

I took almost every course Dr. Beaumont taught. He is an excellent teacher and such a pleasant person to be around. He makes going to class a joy. I learned so much and I feel I'm a better student having had the opportunity to interact with him. His enthusiasm for learning is infectious.
Loved his Arabian Nights class. Readings are very enjoyable and he is a fun guy. Very helpful too. I would definitely take another of his classes.
As a professor, I wish she would practice more rather than solely profess.
A bit rude
She is always encouraging and cheerful, and very accessible outside class.
She isn't at all helpful and she is rude. She shouldn't be the Studio Manager.
Super friendly and helpful, easy grader

I really enjoyed Dr. Ebinger's class. She's also hilarious and gives great examples to put things into perspective. I definitely recommend that you take her class. She instilled in me a great appreciation for Geophysics and science in general and inspired me to prepare for graduate school.

She can be a little all over the place in terms of lectures, but she's incredibly smart and really cares about students. Go see her during office hours, she will ALWAYS be willing to talk to you and help work things out. She wants you to succeed. Also, attendance isn't mandatory, but she notices when you miss.
She has good intentions, but the clarity of the assignments was like mud. I never knew how much work I was expected to put in. Luckily, I tended to overestimate how difficult assignments truly were.
Classes were a disaster but gives good feedback on the extra assignments.

Prof. Ebinger is a bit scatterbrained but she completely knows her field of study (Geophysics) very well. Her exams are very fair and the paper was do-able. Definitely will be taking another class of hers sometime in the future
Kai teaches very well. He relates basic concepts to real world  applications and problems. The assignment are well designed, very hands-on though maybe a little bit tough.

252 is a tough class; I'm not sure Shen is what makes it tough. For me, the tests actually were easier than the assignments. They're open note as well. A lot of exam questions are truefalse or multiple choice. I did recognize one midterm question as being word-for-word from the textbook.

There is just no connection between the lecture and the work to be done. He can teach and has a good standing of the stuff. But the test and homework is too difficult by just knowing what he taught in the lecture.

Kai Shen really knows his stuff. He has a bit of an accent, but he is perfectly understandable, and his accent actually became a large source of entertainment for me in the class. The assignments were very clear, reasonable, and Kai was very helpful regarding bugs in his code (or mine). Plus, the assignments were actually really cool.

I enjoyed taking this class for my degree. I learned a lot about education and its history. Lots of lectures and group assignments but it was fun. This professor was highly knowledgeable and open minded. I could tell she was passionate on the subject. This class was called Race, Class, Gender, and Disability in American Education.
Dr. Ares is an approachable professor and really cares about students learning.
Very helpful. She is passionate on her research and work!
The best! The perfect mix of intelligence, passion for her work, and caring. Lucky you if you find yourself in her class.
No Comments
Great professor, lots of readings but the material isn't bad. If you attend the class and do most of the readings, you will be fine.

Professor Ball's class expanded my interest in history through her extensive knowledge on a continent that isn't informationally accessible (due to its comprehensive history and culture). She made the class not only enjoyable but digestible. Recommend both the course and the professor!

She's one of the best professors I've taken so far. Although the class involved a lot of reading (from her "moderate selection" of books), a lot of the information comes from a high school U.S. History class. She could be a little more transparent on what she wants in an assignment, but she's approachable and wants the best for everyone.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: Molly was awesome! Great teacher, rally cares.

Would never take her again, It was a mistake. She is understanding but her teaching is so egregious and she is unapproachable. Her office hours are so short and she does not respond to emails. It seems as though she is new to teaching.

Polak struggled at the beginning because the official language of the class was JAVA, but she is used to coding in Python. As the semester progressed, she became better at it. To me, the class was easy because I learned everything but graphs in high school. The lectures were okay and I liked her project because I am a cryptography enthusiast.

Polak was lit. She explains hard topics in a way that's easy to understand and makes sure the class is following along with the info. Also very thorough with lectures and explains stuff step by step. Hw was kinda hard tho but the exams were light.
Interesting lectures

I have taken ~3 classes so far with Prof. Gross. Every single class, I learn something new; and every single class, lectures were amazing. I love Prof. Gross. Please take his classes - usual class structure is 3 papers and participation.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment:
Extremely kind, articulate, and passionate. Treats all his students with compassion and respect. Extremely knowledgeable and well-spoken. 
This class made Shakespeare so enjoyable and accessible. I also loved the assignments -- they forced me to engage with the material in unconventional and creative ways, and they felt like a breath of fresh air.

Professor Gross is one of the kindest professor I have met during my time at Rochester. In this particular class, there are three papers overall (7-10 pages each). Make sure to keep up with the books because there are a lot. Most lectures involve class discussions. I wrote most of my papers from the ideas and thoughts that we generated in class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Gross is very knowledgable. He gives good feedback on papers (3 overall), so you have time to fix your grade if you don't start out as well. Class is spent with him explaining different themes in the plays, but there's time to ask questions and contribute. He cares a lot about his students!

(actually had pam for 102)
she is a great teacher, love her to death! she's so sweet and her signing is really to understand (she signs super slow for tests compared to Dima). definitely have to pay attention during class or she'll pick up on it and single you out. also she's pretty bad with tech so you want to be on top the assignments/events

I took the class during covid so it was mostly online. Just show up to class and practice. The homework takes like 15 minutes max to do so it's easy to not want to do it until last minute, but it's so helpful to go to class and ask questions on anything you don't understand. It will help if you want to take 106 in the future.

Great Professor, cares for her student and makes sure everyone understands. You have to go to class and be there on time, you also have to do homework and participate in class. If you study and pay attention you will do great.

Professor Nickels was one of my favorite ASL professors. She is very nice and patient when a student does not understand something in class. She also is accessible outside of class for any questions. However, if you don't participate in class and at least make it look like you want to be there, then she will pick on you and call you out.

Incredibly good at explaining concepts in lecture, and super clear and helpful lecture notes. Also very accessible by email and very understanding with extensions and the like. That said, material was very difficult - homework was very hard and I almost always worked with others and did TA office hours. Also, tests are quite hard and 65% of grade.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Amazing lectures

comment: She is always willing to help. She replies to emails very fast. 80% is A. It is not that hard to get an A, but it is definitely hard to master all the knowledge in ASTRO 111. The workshop and homework can be challenging. TA's office hours are very helpful for the homework.

Professor Douglass is dedicated, prepared for class and manages her lecture well, although the homework got a bit tough towards the end of the semester. She also makes sure that all questions are answered, and gives extra help to those in need. Get yourself acquainted with calculus beforehand though.

Professor Douglass is a great professor who really cares about her students and is always willing to help! AST 142 is a really cool class and she is very enthusiastic about the material. Questions were always welcome and encouraged. Tests were difficult, but no more than to be expected. Homeworks could be more clear, but help is always available

Lectures are very long and at times boring, but it's clear that the Professor is very experienced in the field. He is quite old and some of the things he says are behind the times, but overall he's respectful and kind. Assignments are simple if you follow criteria.

Bruce is by far one of the people professors I've had. He is so kind and caring and genuinly cares about our grades and well-being. Yes, the lectures are long, but they are SO interesting you'll want to sit through the 2 hours. He creates a really inclusive and engaging environment. TAKE HIS CLASSSSSSSSS!!!!!!1

Professor Pilato is a great instructor and speaker. Classes are typically composed of 2-hour lectures, so get ready to concentrate. However, the class content is engaging, and with the amount of music industry experience he has, you never get bored. Highly recommend Prof. Pilato if you are into music business/are a musician.

Pilato has an incredible music management career behind him. He is the perfect man to teach this class, having worked for / with big names such as the Beatles and Drake. He doesnt teach out of a textbook; instead, he teaches from his experience. My only setback is his somewhat old-school approach, but this rarely comes up in class.

Though he witnessed how much of a struggle it is to do my work, he claimed I was too smart to have ADHD. He bluejacked my phone, took a Freudian interpretation of everything I scrolled through, and followed me around. At CVS, he put on an elaborate show, meant to say I don't need to take my medication, I just need to chill and smoke weed with him.
He is really cool and made me more interested in BCS! You have to be prepared to study hard because the exams are challenging but you learn a lot.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Inspirational

comment: He is a very smart professor and he cares about his students. You can't be lazy in his class, you have to put in the work, but you learn a lot if you study hard. Highly recommend.
I would stay far away from him. He has many tricks up his sleeve and he's smart enough to know how not to get caught. Don't trust him, trust your instincts.
Dr. Shestopalov was caring.  He helped during office hours and gave fair exams.  The only downside to this class is some of the homework required a lot of computer work.
The class material was not interesting at all.  However, the professor is very chill and allows extensions, values our feedback, and has fair exams.

The material for Thermo 2 is very dry to start and Shestopalov unfortunately was not able to make it even the slightest bit engaging. He made notes and practice exams available and repeated himself when needed but also had a tendency to mumble. Homework also required a ridiculous amount of Excel calculations and did not really align with the exams.
Really long hws, exams that are not like the hws, and his teaching is so boring!

I wasn't a fan of her teaching style (not sure if it's the blackboard or the way she explains things), but she's very nice. She provided an online link to the textbook, but reading isn't mandatory. The point system allows you to pick and choose what assignments you want to do. Practice exams are very similar to real exams.

She is truly an amazing person. Although people think freshmen orgo is hard, it's very easy to get an A becuase of the point system. the class is interesting and the workshops are great. She's very empathetic and helpful.

Very good lectures and was willing to help outside of class. Problem Sets and Midterm practice tests were very helpful. Tests were hard, but the class is graded on a points system, so getting a good grade isn't that difficult. She really emphasizes fundamentals instead of mechanism memorization, and she is an overall caring person and great teacher

Great person but not great at teaching. Class is a points system, making it easier to get a good overall grade in the class. Every assignment is optional and basically graded on participation. Lectures are confusing and I only learned the material by reading the textbook and watching videos on my own. Be prepared to do a lot of self learning.

While many don't love her lecture style, I was a fan. Orgo can be hard, but thanks to her giving more points available than possible (ie 625 points out of 500 total) it will not tank my grade. In addition when I came to her about being unsure where I'm missing understanding she offered to review my exams personally and give me feedback.

I joined this class late but the lecture recordings are really helpful. still best to go in person because the chalk is more easy to read when you are there. He explains his content really well and you up till the first midterm we didn't touch matrix related problems. Good person to have in your corner, so make sure you use his office hours often!
Intelligent, Funny, Chill guy. Take His Class!

The best professor I have ever had, and a really great guy to boot. His lectures are well motivated, and really make you understand and see the use of the material. HW is difficult but not impossible, though expect to spend a fair amount of time, and try not to drop any 2 s

Dr. Alonso is a fantastic professor.  His knowledge of the material is crazy good, but he's still very in tune with his students.  He's young enough to still remember what it's like to be a student, and he caters to his class very well.

Although sweet and lenient in grading, Prof Gustafson was extremely Zoom illiterate and a poor teacher. Didn't even know how to mute iMessage notifications, which always went off in class. Barely even learned German, since most of the time was spent in breakout rooms doing random discussions. Be prepared to forget a lot of German.
Very interesting class. Offers a good overview of the works of Edgar Allen Poe and ETA Hoffmann. Very interactive.
A good professor, in my opinion. She incites good discussion of the topic and provides useful insights on the topic.
No Comments

Dr. Seluanov was the best lecturer out of all of the ones we had for this class. The downside to that is that the others are not that good, making it hard to follow the concepts, especially in-person. The workshops are presentation based and don't cover any class material which I think is useless, but the bonus points are nice to help w hard exams

Two exams, one 35%, other 45%. Only extra credit you get is through workshops (add up to 10-15% extra) and the class is curved in the end as well. A bit hard to understand due to the accident but you get adjusted quickly. Very understanding and interesting topic, but how exams are worded is why most people lost points, not content.

Seluanov has a heavy accent that's tough to get used to. He gives a disclaimer on the first day of the class that he's "a researcher before he's a professor." In other words, teaching is not his priority whatsoever. That being said, he's not the worst lecturer and he's really knowledgable. Quizzes in workshops. Tests are hard, but he curves a lot.

Nice guy and a generally good lecturer. His accent is sometimes confusing but you do get used to it. Material is difficult and there is a lot of it, but tests are fair (if sometimes worded vaguely). Take good notes in class!
Seluanov is a nice guy and a decent lecturer. His accent is difficult to understand at first but you get used to it. The material is hard but he's more than happy to help. I really enjoyed his class.

As an intimidated beginner (as explicitly mentioned in the syllabus) I found myself often in a panic or completely unsure of what to do. The professor is very kind and willing to help you with things you don't understand, and I think that what she asks of the students is only to spur their potential, but it can be a bit past 'intro'.

I took the intro bio coding class Bio198 and it was anything but intro. Not only did exams take over 12 hours to complete, but extensive coding was required on hw as well as on exams. She is a very nice person and holds office hours, however, her teaching methods are lacking.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: I took BIO/STT214. She doesn't teach very well at all, would've been better off with just the textbook and no lectures to waste my time.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: I took genetics with her over the summer. She is a very sweet and funny woman and genuinely cares for her students but, teaching is not her strongest suit. Her lectures were somewhat confusing. Tests were doable. There was also a paper and presentation due towards the end of class. Needs hard work, but definitely easier than the Fall 198 class.
She's interested in what she is teaching. Tested on concepts and not on knowing every minute detail of a pathway. Was approachable and willing to help.

Lectures were straightforward. Tested on material she covered in class and material she had hinted would be important to know. Was genuinely helpful in class. Attempted to keep things simple and seemed to care whether students understood the lectures or not.

Dr. Balakrishnan is an amazing teacher. She delivers her material with clarity and constantly reiterates what she expects the students to know from her lectures. Though, lots of independent reading associated with this class.
makes an effort to actually teach!

I think she is a fine teacher, although a number of people seemingly do not like her for one reason or another.  It is kind of annoying how she asks people if they have a question if she finds that they are talking, so just be really quiet in class.  The slides are nice, and remember that biochemistry is a difficult subject with a lot of info.
Biochem is a hard class.  Be prepared to work for it.  Her lectures for the most part are straight ppt but details are important.  Over all not the best teacher I have had but there are much worse.

Tests are difficult, her attitude is less than cheery, and she expects students to memorize vast a amount of useless details, all without providing practice exams or online answer keys to previous exams.

Much easier exams than Platt, but much less interesting.  Don't bother going to class, the lectures are online and you'll most likely just sleep through the lectures anyways. ZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZzzzzzzzzzz

I've had Dr. Peck for 200 and 203. Very nice and helpful guy, but very disorganized. On the plus side, he's really lax with deadlines, but he also tends to revise the syllabus often, which can be confusing. He's very passionate about German literature and culture, and you'll get a lot out of his classes if you put in the work.

Dr. Peck is a great teacher, though at first I believed his teaching methods were a little weird, I eventually got used to it and I find myself understanding german texts after about 2 months of classes, his exams are fair, work-load is light and he is very friendly and cares about teaching German.
He is a very good Ger101 teacher. His tests are very fair and the grading is decent. He is a nice guy and cares alot about German.

Very difficult high level German course. Grading was harsh and only vaguely explained. This was listed as a 200 level class but seemed more like a gradate course. Two ten page papers in german in addition to 100 pages a week and two exams. Do not take course unless COMPLETELY fluent in german or you will flounder.
OMG cutest math TA ever, and soooooo smart!
How the heck is James on this?! He's not a prof, I lived with him for 2 years!! He is super hot though, and enjoys putting eggplants down his pants, among other things...
How the hell is James on this?!? He's not a prof, I lived with him for 2 years!! He is super hot though, and enjoys putting eggplants down his pants, among other things...
James is the hottest TA ever.  And he is a mathematical gangstah.  It is too bad he left...
Great
No Comments
Nicest guy I've ever met.  Very into the topic.  I'd recommend him to anyone.
terrible, terrible lecturer

Vogel is one of the best professors the university could ask for. He is extremely knowledgeable, funny, and warm to be around. He forces his students to really think and become better writers. The in class discussions are great, readings relevant and class overall interesting. Life-changing experience.

Vogel is excellent. He is highly knowledgable on what he covers in the course (race and masculinity), always assigns readings that are relevant, interesting, and controversial, and never fails to induce thought-provoking in class discussion. I loved every second of the class, from the self-directed research to watching "Do the Right Thing."

He was extremely helpful and nice and I loved how much he strived to help all the students. I also loved the topic and the discussion proved to be helpful. Just a tip for anyone who wants to take his class, you will leave loving Michael Jackson. All in all great and supportive teacher.

Joe was a great teacher, and his impact seems even more relevant the more time I spend in English classes.  I was already a pretty good writer but he made me the best.  Plus he's an expert without being a d*ck about it.  He's published (a lot) and never even made one mention about it in class.  Love him!

Lots of Reading, but it is engaging. Can also get away will not reading for one class and just discussing topics she brings up. Lectures are concise and well informed when she does lecture-- although generally more discussion and reading based. Classes small enough, she'll tailor discussion to you. Open-ended essays-- she wants to see your ideas.
She loves reading and she enjoys discussions. Show up to class with notes and ready for discussion. Skip class and you won't do well. She's well regarded.
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She is amazing and willing to assist. She cares about her student and always available during office hours. She is very patient, but you will need to read and contribute to class discussions. She is passionate about what she teaches and I took five classes with her. She knows me well and I know her very well!!
Love her. She can be a little absent-minded, but she's the best professor ever and the coolest person I know. If you try hard, and don't screw around, you'll do well.
Great professor. Even if you do not enjoy finance or if it is your first time studying, he makes it seem easy.
Great class, great guy. Would recommend.
He could teach a class on 100 ways to tie your shoe and I'd take it.
Great guy, easy class, show up and you'll be good
Absolutely disaster who shows no respect to students and could not even write email with a proper manner. Terrible personality let along the diabolical teaching
Wonderful teacher but could come off as harsh. Not too liked as a person by most but teaches well. Makes concepts easy to understand.
Lectures turned into rants, stuck on attendance, TAs graded things incorrectly. I hear he bad mouths previous classes to his current classes. Not a good look.

Pretnar displays mastery of the subject matter, along with arrogance, pedantic lectures, and inaccurate slides. He is retaliatory in grading (most of which is done by TAs that constantly need to be shown their errors) and makes condescending comments to a group of masters level students. I've never experienced a professor this frustrating before.

This class has two tests and a 10-15 page paper, each worth 1/3 of your final grade. He is a very kind man and most of his lectures were somewhat interesting. However, you will never get your final paper or second exam grade back. Im not even sure if he read/looked at them. Very sweet man though, very understanding and interesting class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: The class depends on 2 exams and a final paper. If you pay attention in class and do a study guide of the exam material, you're set. He is monotone during class, but I find the material really interesting. Everything is writing, so look at possible prompts for tests and set time aside for the final paper. Good teacher, ok at presenting
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: Pretty easy political science class in general, was really fun to learn. All the content is very intuitive, similar to a business class but with an environmental flavor. Being a good writer is the key to success in the class; if you can write a good essay then it'll be an easy class, but if you struggle with writing, I would avoid it. Prof is nice

He's very knowledgable and seems to genuinely care about teaching well. I didn't feel like expectations were always the most clear, and that can make an impact since the grade is only based on three things (two exams and a paper). That being said, I learned a lot from his classif you're considering it, go for it!

Her class is 2.5 hours of discussion. The discussion is not very fruitful. If you have an opinion contrary to her own, your input to the class is shut down. The movies that we watch and texts that we read are exceedingly d
rating_tags: Lots of homework--So many papers--Graded by few things

comment: Prof. Hwang is a very kind teacher -- more so if you participate heavily in the class. German had a lot of work that came alongside it, so prepare to work for your grade. I have no arguments against taking her course, just be ready to work!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: I learned a lot from this course - professor Hwang is really good at distributing material and teaching students a lot without much pressure. Among some, she was considered a somewhat tough grader. There is a lot of homework writing tho. I highly recommend this class as I think it is great both for language skills and cultural understanding.

Doesn't seem to put much effort into her teaching. "Provides" (tells us how to get them, usually not online) the students with films to watch out of class but provides little direction on discussion in class. Takes a while to return back graded work.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: One of the worst professors I've had. Makes his TA do all of the work and grades notes subjectively. Slides are not helpful and lectures are lackluster. Tough grader with little empathy for students. Used to consider going to grad school for Art History but reconsidered because of classes/professors like this.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Quiz and test material is only from the lectures. The slides barely have any words, so you have to go to the lectures and take good notes to figure out what's going on. People record the lectures on their phones so that if you miss anything you can go back. A lot of hw reading, but it's a history class so it's what you sign up for.

This class requires 40-100 pages of reading after every class. Almost the entire grade of this class is based on notes taken from these readings, with no guidelines, arbitrary grading and no feedback. Lectures consist of him rambling off trivia facts on the lecture's topic, with no class discussion (which was promised in the syllabus).
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: He makes his TA do most of the grading. The requirements for notes are not immediately clear and you are graded mostly on your notes. He directly refused to record lectures as required by the school. He does not care about the students. Do not expect any flexibility or kindness.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: He is a very funny professor! He is very chill and the essays are easy, however, the reading is kind of difficult. But I would definitely recommend anyone wanting to take an ENG course it would be with him. Again, very chill professor.

He is hilarious, makes lectures fun, and I've found myself looking forward to the class. There are lots of readings, but put in the time and you should easily pass. There technically are textbooks, but they won't cost you anything unless you want a physical copy as I did. He is extremely understanding and it was a joy to have him. Highly recommend.
Professor Zawacki is very chill. Be sure to participate in class or he'll ghost you on your grades though! He is a chill chost.

He's awesome! Makes lecture incredibly entertaining - you learn without realizing. He's really helpful with any assignments, and understanding of any circumstances you may have regarding needing extensions, etc. 11/10 I recommend.

I never had any contact with him, all of my learning was done independently or with TAs. It's clear that he's tired of teaching this course given that he has no part in it whatsoever, and he gives out Incompletes like candy to those who procrastinate. It is a hard course but if you start early and pace yourself its not too bad. I, however, did not.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: I never even exchanged an email with this guy, never saw him in person. The TAs were great though! Just make sure you start the workload before the last few weeks of class.

If you're here because you are considering self paced physics, DO NOT DO IT. 
First of all, he has no clue how to use Blackboard. Assignments are nearly impossible to find, somethings are listed in multiple places, or nowhere at all, and he never updates his assignments ever. Not to mention the TAs will yell at you in front of the entire class.

This class is not worth it if you can't pace yourself. There are weekly homeworks and quizzes(13), 4 midterms, and a final. It is a lot of work. Ask the TAs for help and attend workshops. I learned most of the material through Crash Course, Prof Dave Explains, & Khan Academy. The homeworks & answer keys are from 3 years ago and haven't been updated

Professor Chirre is a really nice guy who cares about his students, and he's funny in lectures. He's a bit disorganized with the way he goes through topics, and beware of cold calling. He creates a really encouraging environment in the classroom, but sometimes after tests he would talk about how easy and simple it was which I though was unecessary
Professor Chirre is a great teacher. He really cares about his students and wants them to actually learn. I found him easy to understand. His classes are really funny, get ready for a lot of jokes!
Can be hard to understand and moves fast quickly. Hes a funny guy but sometimes what he says is confusing.

Professor Chirre is very passionate about teaching math as seen throughout his lectures. I however find him extremely hard to understand and have to resort to teaching myself the material outside of class through YouTube videos which I comprehend far more than his lectures. Great professor who is willing to help students, but not the best lecturer.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: This is the Best professor you can ever have for a Japanese for film class. She is knowledgeable and passionate, and she's still trying to learn from her students. Don't be daunted by the seemingly overwhelming syllabus of her class, workload is actually not that much.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Amazing lectures

comment: Amazing. Passionate. Kind. Thoughtful. Interesting.

She's a rockstar. Organized, knowledgeable, and humble. I had no background in Japanese culture but she introduced it so fascinatingly. One of my favorite college professors. Her grading criteria and assignments are simple and well organized. Gives ample time to complete tasks - you'll have to watch 1 film/week + 90 mins of other work.
Had prof bernardi a couple of years ago and her classes were the only ones i truly enjoyed.  Very caring teacher.  And yes she deserves a chili pepper.

I definitely could have tried harder in this class, but I noticed all my assignments got the same grade (84) in this class no matter the effort I put in. I loved him as a person but I think his lectures could have been more focused, they had good information, it neither felt introductory or an in-depth and specific, but rather some in-between.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Course has good lectures & discussions. He is open to questions (tagent ones too). "Mexico thruough time" does have a lean on social history (more readings), but that is also by the nature of HIS200 courses. I personally find the classes very enjoyable & interesting, but we did lose 50% of the class by Day 2 (16 -> 9 ppl). Doesn't hurt to try tho
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: Great lectures and awesome professor. Hes always finding ways to make history interesting. Papers are long and readings are long but doable. Great professor!

Professor Sierra is a fantastic scholar, professor, and person. His survey courses are demanding in terms of workload, although the work itself is not difficult. His lectures are engaging, and the discussions we had in class were excellent.

The way she is able to explain tough concepts in such an understandable way is incredible. Not only does she manage to explain them well, but shows how they are applied in real life and how this matters to you when you go into an engineering job and use this in your work. Homework is tough, but TA's and the professor are excellent sources of help.

It will be challenging but extremely rewarding. Her lectures are amazing for making complex concepts and math understandable. She's very insightful and one of her best characteristics is that in her feedback she will help you see an equally viable but more simple solution while being incredibly supportive and giving you a good laugh.

She goes through lots of information that can take time to process fairly quickly. Accessible, friendly, and fun. Homeworks are challenging, but really help you learn. Lots of opportunities for bonus points to help with your grade. Was kind to accommodate a weekly extra (optional) class for the online students to make sure we're okay. She's great
she really does not care if you are struggling. she will just push you further into the dirt to try to "motivate" you.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--So many papers

comment: even though he says the it's okay if you don't know anything about python to take this course, but if you actually believe that you will get lost, graded 100 final projects in 2 days i don't understand how is that possible. also requires you to handwrite code for exams
He is a good teacher if you really take the time to study Python, actually. I think it's necessary to be acquainted with each lesson since the materials and content are in sequence.

Personally I was lost in class due to the pace/ teaching style and it is a sentiment that 90% of students shared. He said in his syllabus that he defines success as "understanding 60% of the class content" which makes no sense to me and this approach to teaching left huge gaps in my knowledge. Weekly homeworks and average on the final is about 30%.

He sucks, the homeworks are ahead of lectures, himself does not grade it, but let TA grades it, which are tough on grading. And his exams are online with lots of codings, even it's open-book, it does not work. He cannot welly explain the coding by himself. Don't take him!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Professor Caetano designs the notes herself, meaning there aren't any required textbook for this class. If you takes notes and review them before exams, you will be find on midterms or final. Sometimes professor doesn't explain things very clearly, partly due to her accents.

This woman is amazing! Her lectures are clear and presented in a logical order. She's passionate about econometrics and about helping students. She teaches you the intuition behind topics; why things are the way they are. She makes you apply what you learn so that you truly master the material. This teacher is brilliant. Highly recommend.
Good class with interesting material.  Very clear and concise.  Difficult exams and homework, but worth it.

Soooooo hard, teaching econometrics at the hardest level imaginable. She is passionate about it and abotu teaching, she also does her best to help students. She is a good teacher, just designs the course to be brutally hard.
Great professor, fun person in class - the kind who would be down to grab a drink on a Wednesday
She's probably the best MTH164 teacher in U of R

She really is a good teacher. She knows her stuff and is the first math teacher I have had at this school that actually keeps me engaged in the lecture.  She is pretty funny, too, if you pay attention.  That said, I hate the math department here and the curriculum she needs to teach is very difficult given the speed at which it needs to be taught.
Lectures go at a nice steady pace and are usually easy to understand.

This teacher might be the worst teacher I've ever had. She's not the sharpest tool in the shed and doesn't grade anything, but gets mad at you when you don't turn it in. A brick could teach ASL better than her. She provides you with NO HELP and isn't flexible for anything.
Does not grade assignments and is not reliable and awful teaching style
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: This teacher is makes ASL so boring and hard to the point where I want to drop out and I love learning this language, but she just makes this class so difficult for no apparent reason

Inconsistent and unclear grading will mark you down for not being detailed enough and then also mark you down for not being brief enough. When you approach her with a question she'll just tell you to "figure it out." Generally unhelpful and not liked by most of her students. If you want to major or minor in ASL, do not take MRS, she will ruin it.

Ridiculous grading criteria and has the empathy of a shoe. Does not matter what the circumstances are for an absence, you cannot miss class. School sports? Does not care. Drs Note? Does not care. Any other valid reason? Does not care. Take any other prof
He has accent but it wasn't that huge problem since its math class. He is very helpful during his office hour.
worst professor ever !

He is a very nice guy but not a very good teacher.  He goes through examples at a very fast pace and does many rather advanced computations in his head.  His accent is also rather heavy which makes it hard to understand.  Many of my friends who were in the same class went to different lectures for MTH 162 and then only showed up for tests.

Lee is very interested in his class and is responsive to questions outside of class, but his teaching style involves going through many arduous and occasionally too simplistic of examples. It seems as though he is often missing the target concepts as he spends so long on the beginnings of the chapters. Tests are reasonable with outside studying.

Professor Lee is excellent for MTH 162. Going into the course I was very scared, but he presents the material in an extremely clear, straightforward, and organized way. He frequently pauses and asks the class if they have questions. He has clear answers to these as well. Super nice, very helpful if you speak to him one on one. A great Prof!

Best calc teacher I have had so far. During class, he gives examples of the concepts and uses student participation to answer them. Constantly asks if anyone has questions. Tests are very straightforward but the calc deparment expects you to memorize everything & work hard. Don't fall behind!
Lectures are boring and he just throws everything to you. There is no connection between chapters, or at least he failed to find them.
I barely understood what went on during lecture, I basically taught everything to myself

She pushes you to succeed, and it works better than any other class. Be warned, she uses "holistic grading" and does not give you much notice for assignments. Despite this, take her if you want to participate and improve!

I had Loredana for two semesters (SP324 and SP453) and she is the best. She makes you work, but you will learn so much about Spanish and the world. She is very knowledgeable and brilliant. She truly cares about her students and is incredibly kind and sweet. I would highly recommend her classes.
I think she was the best Spanish professor I have had so far. She gives you difficult readings but I think that she genuinely cares about our education. I truly learned something in this class.
An extremely smart professor. Her Spanish is beautiful and she will make you think outside of box. Get ready to work hard in the class, but your written Spanish will improve significantly.
Dr. Goldschmidt grades essays leniently and will give review sheets right before the exams covering everything you need to know. Funny guy, great class. Exactly what I'm looking for in a phil course

Funny Professor but can also explain harder concepts (e.g. Metaethics) very competently. His class is super chill: there are three midterms all of which are very manageable, plus an essay which he provides clear guidelines along with an example essay for. PHL102 is a great class to start a PHL cluster, especially if you have never done PHL before.

Only four assignments, three tests and one essay. The tests are pretty straightforward and you can learn everything straight from the book or internet, you really don't need the class. The facilitation of discussion is quite boring, frankly. The professor usually complains about his salary and that gets old after awhile. Wouldn't take again.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Funny professor. Cares for students that show up to lecture. Tests are straightforward. Makes lots of jokes that make more complex topics easier to understand and remember. Overall good professor.

Patrick was a wonderful teacher and always willing to meet up to go over material and explain things again. He is very clear to understand and teaches things well. He isn't even my current professor and is still tutoring me in my math class I'm in now.
Prof. P goes out of his way to help you understand the material, prepare for tests, and do well in the course. Great professor, snazzy dresser; the bowtie game is on point.

Patrick is a grad student and better then the actual professors. He was always willing to meet and help anyone out. He didn't teach 142 but was a TA and his recitations were always full. Can't forget about the bow ties.
Patrick made class interesting even though I find math boring.  I would love to take a class from him again and love his bowties.
he is the worst professor I've ever had.he only speak to girls in class and gives good grades to them. if you are a dude, he will just turn cold face to you either in office hours or in class.
Saw my writing improve more than ever before.
I have never had a more offensive professor. Speaks down to you, jokes about inappropriate topics, and overall he's just a creepy person.

If you want to improve your English, take his class!! (I am telling it to Int'l students!)He's a great professor! You'll learn a lot from him! (Many of int'l students in UR passed his English class!) Also, if you're already taking his class, use various kinds of vocab words and participate a lot with loud voice. That is what he loves!

Took this class in 2022, disappointed Barnett's rating was "low" (i.e.,3.8). This guy is chill af and I love him. I wish he was my dad. As for the class, it's tough. You must study everything for an A: lectures, textbook, workshops, office hours. Missing lecture is brutal cause it's not recorded. Go to as many office hours as possible.

Dr. Barrentt is super knowledgeable!  While not a chem major, I really enjoyed his class. His tests were reasonable and the homework helped me prepare for the exams. His lectures were nicely organized and difficult concepts were explained clearly. He provided many opportunities to get help and is an understanding and funny person overall.

Professor Barnett is very knowledgeable and passionate about the material. His exam questions are fair and test the material well, but sometimes the tests are too long. He records lectures but only makes them available near exam dates, so attending lectures is important. An understanding person and a funny professor. Overall a pretty good class.

Prepare for no notes or recorded lectures being available outside of class. Even if you have a doctor's note, he will not provide lecture material, so make friends in class you can get notes from. Also, homework must be turned in during lecture time as a hard copy. This class is brute memorization (no periodic table given on first exam)
Really sweet professor. Lots of reading but class is mostly summary. Go to office hours if you need help on paper topics and ideas. Gustafson is so caring and nice - very flexible on extensions too.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Most boring class I've ever taken- if you're thinking about taking Monsters, Ghosts, and Aliens- don't. Hundreds of pages of reading for every class, but there is no point because the lecture is mere summary. Only questions she asks are "and then what happened?" "what happened on page 59?" it makes me want to bash my head against a wall.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: She's nice and enjoys hearing what students have to say, but her lectures feel endless and are super boring. The "presentations" are really just saying in a few sentences to the class what you're going to write your paper about. Easy to skate by in this course. Wish the content was as interesting as the course description.
Very sweet woman with an obvious love for the source material. Knows her stuff and encourages her students to think differently when analyzing the readings. Would definitely recommend!
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: He takes his time with explanations and examples to help students follow easily. He was never impatient and seemed to truly want students to succeed. I would recommend office hoursvery helpfuland he often started them early to give students more time to ask questions. Overall, he gets credit for my first online math class being very smooth!
Clear in class notes, which are really important in this circumstance.
Great guy but not the best prof. His lectures are rushed and he seems anxious to speak. Would recommend a different 161 prof.
Great guy, Very Kind, Cares about his students and the subject. Hand writes all the notes but is clear and concise. Switched into his class late and he was super helpful with the transition.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Caring

comment: No one has been able to consume my passions for theatre that good as him. Th
His lectures are very confused as they are rarely structured and focused. Grading criteria is vague. Never recommend taking them.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Nigel Maister should not be allowed to teach stage management. He is a director and lacks any real knowledge of stage management. AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!!!

You either love him or you hate him, or both. You have to have a good sense of humor and, though he is a *lot*, he's actually very understanding. He expects you to take his classes seriously but, other than that, if you're a good student, he'll like you and you'll like him. His courses are always fun and easy A's if you're not an idiot.

Prof Kumar was so good to me. This was the easiest class I have ever taken. Get to know him, I went to his office hours every week and we would just talk math. It is so worth it because on my midterms, I knew I missed some points at, but he graded me very easily and therefore it ended in me getting 100s. Answer his questing in lecture!

No work done by himself. He did literally nothing except for reading textbook. Can never make a point clear. Class is useless, RUN if you can, GO ATTEND OTHER SECTIONS IF YOU CAN. Indeed one of the worst professor you can ever have in this school.
Grading are unclear and harsh, final grades are posted but without telling how you did.
He just simply recited the textbook in class. The assignments were too much and difficult, with little relevance to his lectures. The exams also had little to do with past exams.

Worst ever professor in the math dept. Lectures are useless and boring, basically just reading textbooks. Emails are responded but always not up-to-date. If he said in class he will get back to you on Wednesday, and you will receive his email at earliest Friday. basically all other work except for the lecture are done by other sections' professor.

Dr. Ogie and the course content is amazing. However, the course structure is a bit annoying. There are a lot of readings, and his exams are actually pretty hard. Your lowest gets dropped, but it still isn't easy to do well on the exams. He also grades on participation. Great class, but was a bit tricky. Put in the work and you'll be fine.

What can I say about this great man that has not already been said? He's an absolute legend, a true gem! He is very intelligent and truly cares about his students. Health Economics was my favorite economics class during my time as an undergrad. Tests are tricky, but if you do the readings and put in the work, you'll do well. 15/10 would recommend.

A great professor who really cares about his students and their interest.  I highly suggest attending classes and going to office hours.  This is not a hard class, it requires work and reading the materials provided.

Great professor and class. By no means easy, but consistently listening in class and putting in the time before exams should leave you successful. He is very good at answering any questions during class and office hours and going to the recitation is very very helpful.

Worst professor ever. He doesn't see students raise their hands. There are two weeks until finals and he has yet to return the one midterm and one homework assigned, so we don't have any grades yet. He is difficult to follow, doesn't finish sentences, posts assignments last minute, and overall, doesn't care about teaching.
What a great guy!!! So helpful and nice, I love his mustache!

So, I'm sitting in his class right now and he hasn't looked at the class once.  It is like this everyday.  The material is so interesting but the monotonously boring and uncaring man puts me to sleep twice a week, when I want to learn.   Not a fan.
WORST EVER
West African dance was SO much fun! You will not learn much. but it will be a workout, and Karen will definitely have you laughing. Grading was easy. Any class with Karen is a must take dance class!

She is cooky, but fun. She doesn't keep track of her choreography, changes it, then expects you to know it.  You gotta take the class though because you'll end up with fond memories. Best dance class in the department.

Karen is a nice person, but has very poor teaching skills.  She is more interested in making sure the front row looks good for our performances rather than actually helping us learn african dance.  she grades very easily, though.
West african dance with karen is an absolute blast! a great workout, and a really fun class overall.

All around, he is not that bad of a professor. Disorganized at times, but a few minutes at his office hours can clear up any questions. He gives lots of practice problems (and answers) before every test, that are very similar to the actual test questions. The notes are very thorough and the papers are really easy.
Very disorganized, no idea what he's teaching in the class. The exams are not consistent with course materials. Terrible experience. My sincere advice - avoid him at all cost.

This guy has no idea what he's teaching. He actually does not know the class material and makes mistakes every 5 minutes. He is most definitely not qualified to teach and should not be allowed to teach this class. Do not take his classes. Naturally his notes are completely useless as well.
Highly quantitative mixed with a very dry professor. Tough class with some exam questions unrelated to the course material.
A solid teacher, but was not especially inspiring or helpful. Didn't feel like I learned that much, although the reading selections were all interesting.
I love her! She is very open to your opinions and the way she runs her seminars is extrememly helpful. You really grow as a writer.
I adore this woman.  She's brilliant, funny, and absolutely amazing.  A-maz-ing.
She's hot and talented. The fiction writing course is great.
She is a very organized and earnest person, and very helpful out of the class. Although her homework is time consuming, her tests are very similar to homework.

Although this class is overall pretty easy, her expectations may be a little high for her undergraduate students.Ended up rushing through material at the end but her tests aren't bad.  Takes class performance way too personally.She's a little scarey...
No Comments
Hard course but interesting. She doesn't give too much A's.
She's the best! So caring and willing to spend one on one time with students to go over difficult material. Made sure that all of her students succeeded and actually enjoy learning chinese.
Pretty awesome!
huge help with hw and test prep
Im in love w her!

She exaggerates her lack of knowledge in the field. Whenever someone asked simple questions in class regarding the material, she froze, gave a confusing answer, then emailed me later giving me an answer from Wikipedia. Her tests are terribly worded and she refuses to admit she is wrong. The TA at the time was awful! DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS WITH HER!

She clearly is new and her skills as a teacher shows it. Her lectures are disorganized, her explanations are poor at best, she can't admit when she's wrong, she doesn't give exams back neither does she explain why answers are wrong. Going to her office hours is useless, and the TA at the time didnt even understand the material well enough to teach.

I enjoy interacting with Dr. Kline out of class, but in class, it's very clear that she's a brand new professor. Powerpoints, exams, and assignments are badly made, and she holds an attitude towards her teaching and course that feels unnecessary and unprofessional. In talking with her outside, I must reiterate that she is a wonderful person!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: Really nice person, but kind of a mess as a professor. She is often late for class and always seems a bit unprepared and flustered. Definitely has trouble commanding attention of a big lecture class, so I feel like she would do better in a smaller class setting. Lots of errors on tests, and sometimes really confusing examples in class.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: She is a great professor and makes class interesting. I especially enjoy the sections, where you get to discuss the content from the week. The class was 20% discussion posts, 20% participation/attendance, and 60% from 3 papers, which are not that bad and you have plenty of time to do them. There is also 15% extra credit possible from the papers.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I enjoyed this course a great deal. I took 2 classes with Professor Mariner and she loves class discussions. If you read the material you should be good to go. I wish she had more structured lectures. Class discussions would get boring often.

the best teacher ever- she is so smart, caring, inspirational, driven, kind, and honestly STUNNING. class is really reasonable in terms of the amount of work. she also wants everyone to do well and gives tons of options for extra credit. she does get mad when people take advantage of her, which tbh makes me mad too bc she doesn't deserve that
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational

comment: One of the most incredible teachers I have ever had the privilege of having. She is so knowledgable, caring, and interesting. The topics discussed in class truly teach life lessons and things applicable to the real world. Aside from this, she is a very fair grader and gives a very reasonable amount of work. My class with her is my favorite ever.
don't take

Lisa Kahn is by far one of the best teachers in the economics department. She brings in super cool guest speakers who are highly respected in their field. Her lectures are super creative and emphasize how social science research works. Very easy to do well in the class and just a really fun class to take! Highly recommend for any economics major!!!

Prof Kahn's class was honestly really interesting and I thought she was a really good professor. If you go over the lectures and think about the material she talks about in class, you'll do fine. I also didn't think she's a very harsh professor.

This was one of my least favorite classes at the U of R. Though Prof. Kahn was a nice woman and the class was not too hard, the lectures were boring and repetitive, and after completing the class I felt like I had not gained anything. She gave vague answers to student questions and did an overall poor job of explaining the material.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: Good lecturer but very slow grader. Expect to receive grades at least a month after assignments are due! She is very disorganized when it comes to grading and it seems like she assigns too many assignments because she cannot handle the grading herself. Expect final grades to be posted after the FINAL grades are due.

LOVE LOVE LOVE Courtney Jones. One of the few caring professors in the public health department. Her personal stories and amazing lectures made it feel like she actually cared about us; she is the reason why I wanted to go into public health. I wish she taught more undergrad classes because the other PH professors are just not it.

Courtney Jones is extremely accommodating. I love her lectures because she always adds personal anecdotes that help students understand the content taught. I wish she taught more classes at our university. She is wonderful.

Dr. Jones is the best professor I've had. Her lectures are fascinating, and she is an inspiring individual. She gives fair exams and is very accessible outside of class. She is also very understanding of extenuating circumstances. She is caring and knowledgeable; I cannot recommend her enough.
Was my graduate advisor for 2 years during my master's. Excellent Prof
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures--Would take again

comment: No Comments
No Comments
No Comments

Wow. U of R kinda messed this hire up. Not sure if he is actually a math professor or if he took polyjuice potion to capture prof carstea and steal his salary. don't even consider taking a class with him.

he's a nice guy. he knows he has an accent & will try to do what he can to improve. he's pretty bad for anyone learning it for the first time with the accent & a little too scripty writing. 162 fall curves are, i think, higher and you get cheat sheets. i took it just for premed, so i never went to class since knew the stuff.

Hard to understand, and not just because of his accent, but because he mumbles. Makes all his examples extremely difficult, seems to forget we don't know the material yet. Seems nice, but not a very good teacher. Had to teach myself everything and went to class all the time.

His accent and the fact that he talks at the board is a little hard in terms of trying to understand. He's good to listen to if you teach yourself the concept before class and show up for clarifications and examples. Examples sometimes he makes unnecessarily difficult. He says the occasional funny thing a lot of ppl skip lecture.
He is a nice guy, but he can't explain himself clearly. A simple idea could become an extremely hard concept by listening to his explanation.

Petridis was an excellent teacher; he was very enthusiastic about the material and truly wanted students to learn the information covered.  Tests and homeworks were fair, and he was always willing to help students.

Petridis is a good teacher, not great.  He often just teaches in such a frenzy that he's difficult to follow.  It's obvious he's extremely intelligent and knowledgeable, but sometimes he has a little problem explaining himself.  Great guy though, he's extremely kind and helpful.
He is a terrible teacher. Going to his lectures is a waste of time.

Though Professor Das usually teaches higher level courses, he did an excellent job of explaining the material in this lower level class in a way that anyone could understand. It is obvious that he cares for his students and is passionate about physics.

Professor Das really cares about students and tries to make lectures as helpful as possible. You can tell that he DID really think about the stuff before teaching. Everything is memorised in his mind. He didn't bring anything other than a piece of paper to the class. And I never saw him looking at that piece of paper. First class treatment!
Such a genius. Explains things really well . Highly recommended.

Genius prof. rarely teaches undergrads. His lectures follows his book(s) word for word. We all opened his book and followed along. HW is decent and tests are related to the material taught. But his tests are only 5-10 questions so you better not get any wrong or else your grade is toast! Makes you wonder if you'll ever be as smart as he is.
Definitely the best professor in ECE department!!!
Easy and tough.
BEST ECE PROFESSOR HANDS DOWN
Good quality

I had her for ATHS381, She is very passionate about the study, and it's obvious she cares a lot about the subject matter at hand. She did end up canceling a lot of classes, and since the class was only once week, I feel like I missed a lot, but outside of that, when we did have class it was very insightful and I feel like I learned a lot.

Did not teach archaeology as a science based course, but rather as a history class, based on the struggles and social issues faced by archaeologists across history. Not what I was looking for, felt like taking a high school class all over again: long syllabus, harsh class rules, etc.

"Inkas & Their Ancestors" class crosslisted as Anthro and History, but it obviously is an Archaeology class. Her lectures are VERY information heavy and definitely focus on Peru's prehistory (briefly discuss the Inkas for 2 weeks). Time consuming projects (make a khipu, study a site via Google Earth) but she's nice and passionate about her field

Bautista is a sweetheart, very knowledgeable, and incredibly caring. Class was almost entirely discussion-based with a few scattered lectures so participation is important. There's a lot of reading but it's difficult (though not impossible) to participate without the readings so at least skim them. Bautista expects a lot but she's a fair grader.
The class was difficult but it was helpful that Professor Bautista was very passionate about the topic.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: Online lectures are great.
She doesn't teach at all. Just give recorded lecture and you need to watch them before class. The lectures are useless

A lot of materials to be covered in one semester so the explanations are not as detailed as I would prefer. It appears to me that she's trying her best to make things clear and she gives amazingly organized notes. Very "Asian style "of teaching. Quite a lot of work indeed but I don't think it's too hard to get good grades in this.

Terrible professor. Having taken a statistics class already, I already knew much of the information in advance. She overcomplicates the concepts that are much easier than they seem to be. She unnecessarily makes the homework so long. This class is required and she clearly hates teaching it.

Professor Noto is a caring&knowledgeable person, but don't love her teaching style. Lectures spent taking notes on semi unclear slides and just weren't engaging. The material was very interesting but almost none of it stuck in my head. Group work was fun, gave good feedback on tests, felt a bit unapproachable despite niceness&good study guides.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Gives good feedback

comment: Professor Noto is great. I was able to do well in this class with no law background, as her tests are very fair. If you do the readings and study the slides you will be fine, she does reward in-depthness so write a lot rather than a little. She is so nice, and obviously cares about her students.
Great professor, but sometimes too nice to get real feedback from. Loved the class.

Prof Noto is amazing! I've taken all the classes she offers. Definitely reading heavy but you can sometimes get away with not reading everything because she goes over everything in lecture. She will sometimes ask questions that you should know the answer to from the readings. Tests are extremely fair, as long as your study the slides you'll be fine
If you don't want to suffer, do not take her class. Her exams are super hard and she does not teach well at all. She does not answer questions and simply does not care about her students.

- 45 (short answer and essay-heavy ) questions in 90 minutes for Exam 1
- did not give Exam 1 grades within a week of Exam 2
- fails to explain concepts well
- fails to explain light microscopy with accuracy (however, tests us on this?)
- I had to switch my major in order to avoid her in future classes

Exams were difficult, lectures were good, she is a very good professor in that she listens to students and is easy to communicate with. Dense note taking is important in this class. I feel like I really learned a lot!
In spite of losing a loved in the midst of a pandemic and racial tensions, Dr. Naganathan was always available even before the start of class to ensure that I succeed. True gem!

The "true neutral" of the ECE department. He's a kind, caring teacher that teaches the class in a straightforward manner. Only 1 in person class a week that consists of a worksheet on the previous week's video lectures. No recitation even though you have to sign up for one.

Great professor. Very willing to listen to students outside of class. Class is purely "taught" through video lectures, but there are only 3  a week so  pace yourself and watch at a consistent rate, especially since a large portion of the video lectures are review of specific examples, giving a source to reference when trying to understand stuff.

Wu's class is well organized and consistent, but as a teacher, he seems bored and uninterested in the class. His recorded lectures are quality, but a bit boring and it can be hard to stay disciplined with watching them. Midterms are a time crunch. He was kind to offer a makeup midterm before the final. The final was difficult but doable.

Prof Wu was one of the best professors I've ever had: super laid back and was always offering help. Although he did make the class somewhat "self paced" by assigning lectures, recorded lectures were extremely high quality. Challenging but interesting class with amazing professor, 10/10.

His lectures were so clear and helpful. He explained things very well and went over examples that you would see in homework and exams. He is also a very nice guy and is more than happy to listen to you questions/suggestions.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: PHLT 230 - Extremely unorganized, to the detriment of her students. Upped the page requirement by 10 pages the night before the deadline. Got 2 cases mixed up for an entire class and had to be corrected by a student. Does not make her expectations clear, and takes points off for things not included in the assignment. TA was a savior. Waste of time

PHLT230, most boring class ever, almost as bad as Rich from PHLT103 epi. She drones on about things and is very unorganized without the TA (bless our TA). Has very specific grading and instructions on how to do things, if it's not done her way, it's just wrong. Law and policy is boring, and she makes it even more miserable.
the class was good! disorganized at times but you come out learning some useful content/skills and it's really doable to get an A
rating_tags: Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT--Graded by few things

comment: This was my first Public Health class even though it is expected that students should have a foundational understanding. But the professor was very accommodating in explaining those foundational topics whenever she mentioned them in class. She is also very approachable in and out of class and knows the subject matter well. She is truly great.
good class. Learned a lot about diffusion.
