FIN 402 Capital Budgeting & Corporate Objectives is a veru challenging class, and group assignments may take hours to complete. However, she is a brilliant individual and knows the subject inside out. She may talk a little fast at times but she is one the most helpful professors I have ever come across. You must read your notes prior to class.
Maybe a good practitioner, but does not know how to teach. She blames students for not asking questions during the lecture. Maybe she needs to learn teaching in graduate class 101.
Bad instructor, doesn't care about student's needs.
Don't go in with the expectation of learning anything and you'll really enjoy the class for its humor value.  Has some really interesting anecdotes.
Worst professor in the world. Terrible teacher and terrible person who takes every opportunity to insult you.
One of the best professors that I have had, very knowledgable in his field. I would defiantly recommend you take his class!!
very fake person. exams are terrible.

Professor Zeng isn't the best but he really tries to make sure everybody understands each topic. He covers a handful of examples for very topic and for the most part tries his best to be very clear and direct. Probably the most interesting math class of the 160 series and he definitely was a solid professor.

I won't say he is an amazing professor. But he is just about average. His lectures are clear. He is also very nice and would try his best to answer your questions. He got accent, which might be sometimes not that easy to understand. But he is very helpful if you go to his office hour. very patient.
super nice guy. oblivious to everything that goes on. half of the kids don't pay attention to a word he says but he just keeps on talking... trooper. assignments are pretty easy so far as well

I took an intro class with him and loved it.  He was always ready to answer questions and his class was discussion based. I  know some people disliked him, but i thought his lectures were well constructed and thought out. I learned a lot from this class.
Best math professor at UofR!! He is great and explains everything

Winfree is the best math teacher at this school. THe first few classes will make you want to die, but then you will realize that he understands math better than anybody and is far superior than any other teacher. He explains thoroughly and is passionate about the subject. Stick with him, he is an incredible teacher.
Skip is the bomb. Nobody can understand how spellbinding, hilarious, and soul-deep his classes are without being in them. TAKE HIS CLASS.

You think you know all about theater until you meet this man. This is perhaps one of the best classes I've ever taken, and I'm really sad that this is the only course he teaches. He makes it fun and enjoyable, but you really learn a lot. But get what you want out of this class, don't just sit there and expect to be lectured all day.

Alex is rad. He expects a lot, but makes it fun and is invested in your learning. Funny lectures go by fast and it's clear he's passionate about what he does and puts history into current events. Attendance counts, but there's extra credit. Kinda a slow grader but not harsh. Would totally take his class again.

Totally a tough grader. Will never take his course again. Try to take other 1xx courses. He asks for attendance and participation for 20% in total. Three lab works and three papers. Extremely harsh on grading papers, so if you are not an excellent writer, do not try his course!

Professor Jessica Robinson, does not give good feedback. Her feedback's are mostly a comment " I agree" in response to the peer feedback a student gives on the paper. Moreover, if you go to her office hours for feedback, She says no to give any feedback and says if I give you feedback, I will have to do that for all students. She is not helpful.
Not approachable and biased grader
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: the worst... the most critical as if we are submitting to the highest rated medical journal out there. Often inflexible, unrealistic expectations for reading and comprehension. Rigid with high expectations. Unsure how a student is expected to pass if they have not yet completed the writing lab course, because skills we learn there are relevant.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: I do not mind a tough grader, but this instructor is so hypercritical that she is looking for missed periods, missed spaces in your APA papers. If you make mistakes she threatens to reject future papers. Absolutely no sense of compassion and care. A robot. Does not teach, just throws redundant reading. Instructions unclear, students must clarify.

Easily one of the better BCS professors at Rochester. She sincerely cares about your success and is very helpful and available outside of class.  I only had her for senior seminar so I can't comment much on her grading or testing but she's a generally great person and teacher, so try and take at least one of her classes.
I absolutely love her
Half-decent lecturer, but graded harshly on open-ended assignments with unclear rubrics. Class was filled with busy-work.

I took History of Native America with Professor Theobald and highly recommend taking this course. There were about 10 pages of reading per week as a minimum but the readings were always on different topics so it didn't feel redundant. The lectures were engaging and class participation was highly encouraged. Great class, even better professor
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Erin's awesome. By far one of my favorite professors that I've taken at Rochester. She gives great feedback on papers and does an awesome job integrating interesting topics during writing exercises. She's really understanding and wants to see you succeed, which is a rare trait for most teachers at this level. Take her class.

Erin has to be one of the best professors to have, especially as a first year. She clearly shows compassion and empathy for her students making sure they are able to balance their classes along with writing. I also loved the topic int his class and felt that the material was very intriguing and applicable to what I liked.

Professor Novy-Marx is wonderful. She really cares about her students and tries to involve everyone in group discussions. Make sure to come to class ready to participate. Tests are what you would expect, she does not try to trick you. Strongly recommend taking a class with her!!

You need to know what the reading talks about since a lot of the class is group discussion. She basically tells you what is on the midterm and final so it's not hard to study for. Most of your grade is from your final group projects and she's very lenient with grading. She really cares about her students and wants them to all succeed! Love her <3
Takes the time to review papers and give great feedback. However, assigns too many papers considering how repetitive the papers were.
He is changing his grading criteria frequently through out the semester...

Professor VanWijngaarden is great. He is accessible via email, understanding on assignments/due dates, and clearly knows the subject matter well and is able to teach in an engaging manner. Not sure if this was unique to this semester but the mix of in-person and online was oddly perfect.

He is a very esteemed professor and knows a lot about the environmental field. He is generally a pretty understanding and nice person. Lectures go by really fast so I had to rewatch them often. PHLT201W case studies are graded somewhat harshly.

gorgeous professor
lots of reading, but usually just need to attend every class seriously then you got it
no clear judging criteria, so get serious about everything she mentioned
very accessible out the class, and she'll share inspiring suggestion for you during office hour
be aware of she will randomly pick student to answer

Prof Smoller is so caring and does a lot to make her courses engaging and fun. There's a lot of reading, and the exams are long and handwritten, but she's by far my favorite prof ever. She really cares about her students, and goes above and beyond. Cannot recommend her enough, though she does expect you to try your best, as she should.

Dr. Smoller is enthusiastic about the course, but she grades to perfection and can be a bit vague about what's expected of you on assignments. Several readings were assigned each week which were often too long to complete, and she will randomly call on you during discussions.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Assigns weekly readings, which can be long. Fair grader. Excited and passionate about the subject. Loves interacting with students. Would recommend, but be prepared to read!!

Professor Corbeaux was great for WRTG 105. There are readings pretty often, but most of them are interesting and are relevant to helping you write your papers for the class. She gives useful feedback and grades based off of her feedback, which is extremely helpful. I highly recommend going to her office hours with questions, she's very helpful.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: One of the best things about her class is that you can pursue the topic of utopia in any way you'd like, which makes the process of learning to write on an academic level so much less taxing. Another one of the best things is how willing she is to help you write. Gives clear, thorough feedback.

Claire is sweet. 2023 Fall WRTG 105-55 is her debut class and it is my pleasure to take the class with her. She cares about her students and would listen to our suggestions. The topic of her WRTG 105 is utopia, which is a very intriguing topic to me. She did a great job of helping the students transition from high school to college English writing.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Gives good feedback

comment: Liked it, nice lady.

Her heart is in the right place, but she is very unorganized and doesn't seem to know what she wants from students.  She expects us to cite all these educational theorists in our papers, yet she has terrible powerpoints and cribs from a sheet of quotes & researchers herself.  Basically, it's really, really hard to follow her for an entire class.
I love Professor Li!! Go talk to him in his office or e-mail him. He's really helpful for materials science questions. And a genius.
Very funny man, talks about ninja swords, and likes to talk about highschool.  Good guy

Extremely helpful, tried hard to give new information. Some students were rude because she was young and inexperienced, which caused her to fumble during the lectures, but she was fair and always answered questions quickly.

Confusing,not well spoken. Unable to get through a sentence without saying "um" and "like" 10 times.  Didn't learn anything. Doesn't seem to know what she is talking about. What she has written and what she tries to articulate often don't make any sense. Makes embarassing grammatical errors. Fair grader though.
I took Cosmology with her, and she was absolutely hilarious.  She graded tough, but fair, and her assignments were never too onerous.  One of the best writing classes I've ever taken!
by far the worst teacher I've had. expects you to already have the writing skills of a grad student and grades very harshly.

Great professor, cant say much else. 245 requires a LOT of time commitment (Assuming you will put effort into engaging with the activities and assignments), but its also life-changing and very fun. THIS IS NOT AN CAKEWALK CLASS; ITS 4 CREDITS FOR A REASON. There are tons of readings, which imo acclimates you to picking apart readings in tutoring
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Gives good feedback

comment: One of the best teachers I have ever met. She is clear, organized, and approachable. She always encourages you to express your own ideas. The class is interesting and her comments on your papers are super helpful for your revision. She is not an easy grader, but if you really put a lot of efforts in your papers, it will pay off.
Utter failure as an instructor, personality is terrible.  Great at talking for hours on end and cowering in corners.  Kind of a blowhard, needs to get whats cumming to him.
This guy go to UHS a lot but at the same time not enough. Plus he doesn't always recycle stuff.
Amazing.
No Comments
Giving low scores. Compared to other professors in the writing department, Kara really disappoints students a lot. I will never recommend this professor at all.

She's an absolutely wonderful professor. She teaches with great interest and skill. I want to study medieval literature because of this class now! She makes class interesting and fun. You will grow a lot in English writing after a class with McShane.

Dr. McAleavey is one of the most caring professors in the Biomedical Engineering department. You can tell that he is extremely passionate about ultrasound and his lectures are interesting and informative. He is always happy to help a student who needs assistance. Overall, Dr. McAleavey is fair, knowledgeable, excited, kind, and resourceful.

Is the class the most interesting thing ever? No. But he's a great professor, a little quirky, very friendly and approachable, and he's very accommodating. He grades fairly, and, for once in my college career , he ACTUALLY tests the same things he's covered and asked about in homework, and the tests are straight forward. Overall great dude

TUR/REL246 was one of the best courses I have taken, and Professor Turkkan is utterly inspirational, iconic, intelligent, and fantastic. She truly cares about students, including their studies and their lives as students. Dr. Turkkan is motivated to making courses manageable. She makes you CRITICALLY think about different themes in a unique way.

TUR 247 was by far the best course I have taken at U of R. Dr. Turkkan helped me understand the history, complex identity problems, and how western travers views created a one-sided understanding of the city of Istanbul. She introduced different perspectives to the city through readings, literature, films, documentary, music, and baklava! She too

Such an amazing and caring professor. Very approachable and knowledgeable about business plan writing. The class itself is not hard and provides basic information about BPs, but you can easily build on that info later. She also offers individual feedback on business presentation skills if you ask for it and coaches multiple teams for competitions.

A waste of time, a waste of your tuition. Professor Meyers ent223k class consists of random discussions, most often unrelated to the course. I learned nothing from this class or the one assignment she gives. Your grade depends on participation and one project. Her grading is tough/biased. (she has to like you) Stay away from anything she teaches.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Wonderful teacher and hilarious person! If you go to her office hours with drafts, she will help you a lot. My writing improved a ton with her class!

Not a hard grader, but just was not always clear about what she wanted on pieces.  I'd never written a feature story or anything completely biographical before, so felt awk. Teaching style did not rub me the right way. I humor writing class to be more of a workshop but I felt like we spent more time reading others' work. Kind of weak teacher.
Prof. Becker is very warm, dynamic and really cares about her students. Classes are structured and easy to follow with many interactive elements.
Professor Becker is so nice, and her tests are pretty easy as long as you pay attention in class.

Dr. Dwyer is a fantastic professor! He is very personable, easy to approach with questions, and gives good feedback on assignments. He uses slides but expands vocally, so note-taking and attendance are imperative. He is entertaining and engaging, so you won't get bored. I wish I could take every class with him! He also wears great sweaters.

Dr. Dwyer is the best! Overall, his lectures are really interesting and CLST 172 examines a lot of very interesting films and readings. He does a great job making the class manageable in terms of weekly work. 10/10 would recommend taking a class with him.

Dr. Roessner is incredibly knowledgable about his field and imparts as much of that knowledge onto you as he can. The class is very project heavy, and requires a lot of time commitment outside of class, so do not take it if you are overloading! Lectures focus on theory and you learn recording skills in lab. TA's are usually pretty good as well.

GREAT guy! Very approachable and reasonable if you have any troubles regarding assignments. He's a great resource if you have any questions about the music business/audio engineering field (and he's excited to answer them!). Do your studying and be curious about the lectures--this is how you'll get a good grade and get the most out of this class!
VERY tough grader. If possible, take STR 203 in the Spring, with Raith.
Terrible professor

The difficulty is actually a 3.5. He just has ALOT of simple tasks that you have to do on a weekly basis. The lectures were intense and had lots of material covered each week so it adds up throughout the semester. However, the lectures were organized, simple and extremely interesting if you like qualitative discussion of organizational economics.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: I love Julie! She's such a nice professor and this course is also pretty interesting. And we got chance to sing with those amazing chamber singers which is so cool!!! I will definitely take it again next semester and probably for every semesters in the future. Grade is based on attendance and two concerts only, so come and have fun!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Caring--Graded by few things

comment: She is such a nice woman, and she is very understanding. She never asks too much of students, and she's very chill all the time. If you like singing and want to relax, join. It is a nice thing to do once a week, and it's not very taxing, mentally.

What he taught in class has little to no connection to the questions on the test.
P.S.: Tests are taken online but google is not usable.

Everything I know about finance I owe it to his corporate finance course. Although, he gives really lengthy case study team assignments each week they go a long way in developing basic knowledge and real-world modelling skills. Other than that, he is quite respectful, accessible and brilliant at explaining tough concepts.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: This class was amazing! I learned a lot and every class Leila pushed us think about things in a new way and encouraged our thoughts. There is a lot of reading (do it or you can't participate) but they are all extremely interesting. 2 essays throughout the semester and heavy participation and attendance points. Took a field trip to farm sanctuary.

I love this class so much. She is wary of being lenient if students are not doing the readings. The readings are so insightful. I've had the best discussions in this class. Highly recommend if you want to explore food inequality and issues. Even if that's not your thing, taking this class highlights human compassion and solutions through activism.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: LOVE HIM! He is difficult to understand and the class doesn't have a lot of structure, so it can be confusing in the beginning. He is very responsive to emails, responds within 24h. Do the work, show up to class, participate, and you will receive an A :)

It was a little difficult to understand how the class worked at first, but soon enough it became ritualistic. Classes were a great opportunity to discuss global current events with someone who is extremely knowledgeable on the subject. Taking this class has increased the practicality of my political thought.

Professor Vi made Spanish 200 very interesting and fun. I really improved my Spanish skills in reading and writing in her class. She is super understanding and is not strict about deadlines or grading. Highly would recommend her class.

She is incredibly kind and makes interesting classes! You couldn't ask for a better professor. The class is graded very easily, but you still will learn a lot and be engaged. One of the best people alive

Tiger is so engaging and sweet. He creates an encouraging environment, and if you apologize for messing up he'll tell you not to worry because you're still learning. He's a pretty easy grader, but he shares tons of opportunities to connect with the Deaf community and pushes people to get more involved with ASL outside of class. Amazing prof :)

Professor Balint is a great ASL teacher! I had never taken any sign language courses before so I was nervous walking in that I would fall behind. However, Prof Balint creates a safe space inside the classroom where you feel ok to make mistakes and learn from them. I always felt prepared for exams. Make sure to attend lectures for the practice!

Tiger is super funny and a great professor. The homework was never too difficult and he is a fair grader. I loved his class! 

I recommend going to ASL club in addition to the class to practice signing with others

The lectures are really good, and she knows everything about psychology like in the back of her mind. There is no need to look at the textbook during class.If students have questions, she is able to answer them with clarity.Homework,quizzes,and exams can be quite challenging, but talking to her after class is very helpful.

She is a grad student, not a prof... She's nice but gives boring lectures like no-one else. Fortunately, her lectures are all online, so you never have to go to class! Overall the class is pretty easy (even without attending). The TAs grade HW pretty harshly, but tests are not usually hard. The final is optional; it will replace a lower midterm.
Super chill professor, very passionate about what he's teaching.
He's great.
Not a bad experience

I really don't understand why our school need us to take this recitation. The recitation completely has nothing to do with its lecture. Also, the class is trying to teach students topics such as "How to be successful" and " How to prepare for lecture". I think those questions are all depend on personal situation. They are totally nonsense.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Blankenship started off rough and gave us a lot of homework/tests that we didn't really have the capacity to finish, but that's just because he came to a River Campus elective class with an Eastman degree. Now his assignments are really lenient and he's a very knowledgeable and passionate guy. If you want to know theory well, I highly recommend.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Michael was a very nice guy, but was very unorganized making it difficult to know what we were learning about. We never followed the syllabus and he moved at such a fast pace, we often had to redo tests and quizzes because he eventually realized the class did not understand the concepts yet.
Very helpful both in and out of class in researching publishing industry and forming contacts, as well as own opinion and aesthetic for international literature (in the scope of publishing).
No comment.

Professor Kroeger is very nice and seems to genuinely be interested in the material she teaches. You can tell she cares about her students. This class was easy and fun, mostly discussion based with a few small papers.
One of the nicest professors I've ever met. Lectures can sometimes get a bit boring, but it's an easy A and she really cares about the students.

She is extremely sweet and caring towards her students. The class is pretty hard and sometimes the homeworks and tests are unreasonably hard. And I mean really unreasonably. Lectures can get pretty dull and are straight from the textbook, but she teaches you everything you need to do well. Overall really enjoyable and nice person.

Prof. Basdogan was teaching for the first time when I took this class, but she did an amazing job. She always answered our questions clearly. The home work was short. And the exams were decent because they related very closely to the assignments. Very easy class if you try.

Yasemin taught me as a Heat and Mass Transfer teacher. She made difficult concepts very easy. Her teaching style is slow yet calculated. Class is structured well, and exams are directly related to the homework. Recitations go over examples on the exams. Also, her office is pink-themed.

Final verdict: very girl-boss, very mindful, very demure.
The class was very fast-paced and was heavily reliant on test grades and problem-set scores.

Always read the statistics portion of the textbook, because there are quizzes (important!) and he only tests the numbers. No need to stay for class after the quizzes (always at the beginning) because lectures are the same as textbook and they are not very useful (participation is count as extra credit but earning it does not help much).
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Course is too hard bic professor gives no practice and no HW. no class recording and no textbook. Exam is hard, u even don't know how and what can go review before test.  Average gpa for this course is low. hard to get A. professor is nice but i hate this course

I really enjoyed Professor Cardot's class. He has funny, engaging lectures and is enthusiastic about people talking in class. Exams/homework can be challenging, but he and TAs are available for help. You can also work on homework with classmates.

He should be more specific in the grade criteria. He should offer different types of assessment. He should grade students' exams instead of give them to the T.A. There is none feedback in the final papers... we don't know what should be improved =/

Overall amazing professor. Homework is almost always an A as long as you finish them on time. There are extra credit for both the midterm and the final, and even if you don't answer correctly he will still give you as many points possible. Only minor complaint is that for the final paper the word count is a bit high, do it early if possible.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: One of the most compelling and wonderful teachers I've ever had. Can command the room with his drum, and is an all around wonderful presence.

Just show up and give it your all. He is very easygoing and allowed us to mess up. It was really helpful because I am a beginner. The only thing I didn't like is that he didn't know our names. If he was correcting you, he would look at you while explaining. It was kind of hard to know if he was talking to you.

Professor Flores gives great and unique lectures on American cultural history. He assigned compelling essays and texts that enriched the classroom experience. He expects consistent participation from the class and will try to draw out responses from you. Overall, an enjoyable, easy enough class that offered interesting content.

This man is an amazing professor. The history of Mexico class I took with him was just amazing. He is super knowledgeable about US-Mexico relationships, and very enthusiastic to share. I loved that he was able to talk and actually answer all of our questions about it. He bases his grades on papers you can submit as many times as youd like.

I am speechless. This class is a complete waste of time and the professor should be prevented from teaching ever again. He is extremely disorganized and you will spend the entire semester having absolutely no idea wtf you are doing or learning about. Lecture barely touch on content and he expects you to an expert in the first week.

Very disorganized, terrible lecturer. The fact that very few out of 30 registered students regularly attended class speaks for itself. Unclear grading criteria for the final project. No feedback on exams or HW. The TAs have no grading rubric and apparently not even the answers to the homework problems. Reading the textbook is only way to get an A.
This is a lecture heavy class, but they are all recorded and he is available for help outside of class
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Online Savvy

comment: He's a nice guy I guess but the worst biology professor I've ever had. Boring class too
Really smart guy. Cares deeply about his students. Easy grader. Good amount of reading. Participation is important.

He's a fantastic instructor who cares deeply about his students. I found I was able to learn a great amount from him and felt myself improve dramatically in my writing from taking his course. I highly recommend taking a course with him if the opportunity arises.

This class is a discussion class however it is up to the students to make it worthwhile. The professor is fair and does not put his input over everyone else's instead he listens to yours and may play devil's advocate or agree on good points. He also responds very fast to emails and when it comes to essays, he is more than happy to read it over.

Really nice and easy to get a hold of, the homework is a decent amount of reading but it's very doable, and class discussions are always fun to participate in. He offers extra credit if you read a book and discuss it with him. The writing topics are nice because you have a lot of freedom to write about whatever you want. Lowkey a chill guy.

Compared to the other writing classes, he gives more readings, so don't take if you hate reading. But his class is the broadest (more topics) and you'll have so much freedom to write about whatever you want. He was always kind, accessible through email, willing to give extensions, open to feedback, and made the effort to know everyone individually.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Gives good feedback

comment: Very helpful, cares about students. Would like more examples though.
Most boring and ineffective professor ever. It was literally impossible not to sleep through every class he taught. I ended up learing everything by myself using the textbook...

Great lecturer. Is very clear on everything, and makes sure we know the topic being studied. But make sure to go over your notes after every lecture since the material is dense and will not stick if you don't go over it. I took MTH 165 in the summer and I am glad that I did.
No Comments
He doesn't teach the class well but it is possible to pass his class. However, don't have any expectations. You get what you get with hardly any exceptions.

Schenk is a very nice guy, but his teaching style is a bit antique, ironic since its a CIS class. He is very boring and hardly any of the stuff he teaches is on the exam. On top of that, the TA was terrible. He tells you however exactly what will be on the Midterm/Final. Class isn't a breezer, but there is no motivation to go to class.
interesting lectures. very hard exams
Depends on his TAs. I went to ask him for help, he made me feel extremely studpid. You are on your own.

I took Intro to Creative Writing with her. She doesn't give enough credit to student ideas; she doesn't like students using adjectives in poems. Limited amounts of positive feedback. Talking to her during office hours helped, but mainly this was a really frustrating class for me.

Intro to poetry was an easy A-. She is a v.kind woman, even made three hour classes bearable to sit through. I'm a huge peotry lover and I've taken poetry classes that have made a huge difference in my life. Was disappointed that hers didn't. Going to all classes is mandatory, but very little homework is given/reading is skipable.
Pretty boring, slight accent. Not as terrible as everyone says though.

Worst teacher I have had so far at U of R.  Averages on tests were between 30 and 40%.  Blamed students for not understanding material even though his lectures were completely incomprehensible.  A smart guy, but he can't teach at all.

Great professor. Casual class style. Makes room for everyone to talk. Do the reading and participate in discussion and you will do well. Good feedback on your writing. Makes you think! Always a big group project.
Waste of time.

Taking a self-paced course was very difficult because in order to do well in the class you really have to work your butt off. He was technically the professor for the class, but I never saw him. The TAs ran the show.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: In order to get A, you need to be in top 7 out of 135
Awesome workshops!
She was a great TA. Very good at filling in everything that Ted Pawlicki left out of his lecture (everything). She's pretty hot too.

The professor is not a tough grader, in this course, she offers blogs that most of the time she will give you perfect on it. GET READY TO READ!!!! A lot of reading materials but focus mostly on the book chapters if you don't have enough time to read everything. She is nice and her lectures were SUPER educational. Amazing class!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lots of homework

comment: Prof Yarborough is nice and teaches interesting material. Be prepared to write 10 page papers, but with pretty chill grading
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--So many papers

comment: This class is a wild ride - you'll learn a lot, but the workload may make you nauseous. The Real Reader grades are like a blindfolded monkey, and Laura's feedback is as helpful as a screen door on a submarine. So hang on tight, because your grades will be a mystery until the end!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: I really enjoyed Laura's class. She was well prepared and the lectures were organized. Something I really liked was her clear grading criteria for the WRT 273 class, which helped in indicating my course grade during the semester.
rating_tags: Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: Two things are graded: participation and a final 10-20 page paper. You must read a lot of articles, and if you are a STEM major, do not overload this class. I did and it was exceptionally hard to keep. It is interesting, but if you have no experience with analyzing and critiquing papers, its difficult to understand him. Mainly discussion

Miron doesn't teach students how to think critically about scientific papers and expects students to already know how to critique studies. 50% of the class grade was participation, 50% was a final paper, so you won't be graded until the very end and by that point, you can't do anything to change it. Grading criteria were unclear. Wouldn't recommend
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: Lectures are not very well structured; grading rubrics on individual homework do not match the actual grading. It is a big group project that needs a lot of personal research and study. The VR/AR workshop is not that helpful, and YouTube videos will be your friend. However, this course is pretty fun to take.

worst professor ever existed. does not teach anything basically, no code, just playing ytb videos and throwing non-sense ideas. does not seem to understand the theory. TAs teach out-of-date frameworks and code, what a great match! develop unity for final project, taught by studioX guys, they are great btw, help out projects a lot.

She doesn't teach anything useful. She spent the first half of the semester showing is pointless Youtube videos. Then, she dumped a huge project on us without guidance. The project was really annoying. You have to make 30,000 prototypes to satisfy her. When I asked her for help she was vague and unhelpful. Worst class ever.

Attendance/ textbook mandatory. Strict attendance policy (one unexcused absence = 1/3 letter grade drop), but there may be some leniency (I missed a class and did not see a drop in my grade). No tech in class, and will call you out if he sees you on your phone. There was normally a new reading for each class, but they were never very long.

Textbook and attendance mandatory. No electronics allowed in class. His lectures are very interesting, even when the class material is not. He does a good job of facilitating class discussions. He grades papers generously and gives good feedback. Go to office hours if you want good grades on your paper.

Really enjoyed Ravi's classes. It's a LOT of work, but very rewarding and with so many resources provided for out-of-classroom self study. Need a solid MS Excel foundation & willingness to play with code & tools. Genuinely get the impression he wants you to succeed. Homework and tests are well documented and fairly graded.
Great class.
The grading criteria is super vague. You don't know what you write is correct or wrong. The textbook is amazingly hard to read and difficult to understand.

Very new professor, was teaching based off of already created course outline. A lot of the reading was pretty dense and hard to get through, but mostly used as a starting point for class discussion rather than a hard topic. Almost too nice of a grader, and a little shy with authority, but you can tell he really cares about his students.

The best professor I have ever taken at the University of Rochester. I came into this class with no prior knowledge of startups, business, or even marketing, and now I am coming out of it ready to apply for an MBA program. This class is all about founding your own startup and figuring out how to make it successful. It's extremely hands-on, & fun!

The course is super interactive. 90% of work is done in class and no HW. Davey is very engaging and cares about his students. He works in Silicon Valley so he gives valuable feedbacks on personal communication skills thats super helpful in real work setting. Very useful and interesting course easily one of my favorites at UR! Highly recommend!
Mostly just horrifically boring.  Bring things to do in his class and drink caffeine!!
Lectures are delivered in monotone level.
Definitely the best professor of the three that teach this class.

Dr. Hunter was really helpful and informative during class. Her lectures are clear for the most part; the only part of the class I didn't enjoy was the final project. Still, she provided a lot of the materials I requested for the project and went above and beyond to ensure that I knew how to use it. Really great person and teacher.

I loved this class. Only class I looked forward to going to. Depressing topic, but really informs you about Refugee and Immigrant situations in America. Class discussion based, sit in a circle, several films shown. She does a great job of engaging and encouraging students to talk in class.

He's chill but horrible professor. Unclear, very unorganized, cares only about research and has said so himself. He takes off a million points on your exams. You may have not said anything incorrect, but because someone else in the class had a slightly better worded answer, you can lose points. Long story short, it doesn't reflect what you know.

You can tell she loves her subject, and her lectures were always interesting. She also always made herself available to discuss papers and assignments outside of class, and gave great, encouraging feedback.

I learned a lot in Dr. Guzman-Rea's class. The topic was interesting and I liked the class field trips to off campus events. I enjoyed the interview assignment the most, but the final project was fun as well. You should take her class if you have the chance.
Eco268 is a really interesting class and Professor Bai is so amazing. Her class always has clear structure.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Perhaps one of the best professors you will ever come across. Focuses on learning and scoring a great grade (which you can easily manage if you follow instructions). Super easy-going and friendly, he welcomes seeking help/discussing ideas beyond the classroom. I also highly recommend taking the course as it is extremely interesting and unique.
His a great professor. He will provide really clear instructions. Also will give personal guidance.
Professor Tang is a very nice tutor. He is knowledgeable, patience, interesting and generous.
His tests are very different than most professors. It really tests you if you can apply the material to real life and articles.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: Rose was an awesome professor. She really genuinely cared about her students both as people and as writers. Homework and essays were very clear and class time was very helpful in understanding college writing. She gives personalized feedback that is very specific and really gets you thinking. Would 100% take her class again.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: The course itself was mediocre. Lectures were boring and uninspired. Homework assignments were uninteresting but at least they were aligned with the lecture material. Readings were interesting -- most likely the only good attribute from the course. Can I get my tuition refunded?
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: Literally the easiest class I've ever taken. It's just basic statistics. If you have a pulse, you'll get an A in the class. The tests are copy and pasted from the review, with some numbers different, and some exactly the same. If you want to do well, just memorize the review. Overall, ridiculously easy class

Took Writing 105: Argumentative Detectives. Interesting class, lots of papers but it's a writing course so it should be expected. I had a hard time staying on top of work this year but she was really understanding and really helped me out. If you're swamped you can get an extension. Great professor. Grades fairly and sincerely cares about students.

Going into lets do the time warp again, my high school writing skills were pretty bad. My high school did not strive to improve my writing in any way, shape, or form, and it really showed when I took this class. Emily's critique really brought my writing up to the college level. I had to change so much about my writing, but I learned a lot.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Accessible outside class

comment: The best writing teacher ever! She strived to connect with every student, and it really showed. She was very understanding and loved cracking jokes. There was a lot of reading done outside of class but they were mostly interesting. Will miss her a lot!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment:
Course: Let's Do the Time Warp Again.
One of if not the most understanding professor I've ever had; also very in touch with the students and gives extensions on papers if you ask. A lot of reading and expect to report on your thoughts. Most of the writing is done on your own time, but sometimes there are in-class workshops.
Absolutely loved her
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: One of the most understanding instructors I've ever had, she's extremely approachable and makes an effort to connect with her students. I would recommend her to any other student.
rating_tags: Caring--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Really boring professor. Does not know how to keep class interested. Also has no feeling for the whole class is lost and asleep

The lectures for BUS118 are pretty chill. Professor is also a very nice person and classes tend to be interactive. He grades the homework and exams VERY generously. As long as you don't write misinformation then you will be solid. Minimal work required compared to other classes: 1 easy midterm, 5 very short writings, and 1 term paper.

BEST PROFFESOR EVER!!!!!! Very caring and understanding if you need an extension. If I could I would DEFINITELY take this class again!!!! AMAZING lectures and a super compassionate professor. Be ready to read a lot and reflect on it in class. Readings are super fun tho!!!! I can't emphasize how SPECTACULAR this professor was.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: Taught a section in virology. Very good lecturer, but make sure to take notes on his slides since he doesn't have anything but the main point down written down, which is why I say attendance is mandatory for more details on his slides. Definitely has a sense of humor. Super nice professor and answered any and all questions I had :)

Tessa was a fabulous professor! She took the time to get to know each student, curated an open discussion environment, graded papers fairly with great feedback, assigned interesting readings, and was extremely flexible! If you are looking for a great WRTG 105 class, Tessa is the one!

During the first day of PHYS 114 lecture, Professor Blok said he was here to guide us through the material, not teach us. This was highly discouraging to hear. I also did not like how homework was only 10% of your grade and some of the exam questions were worded weirdly.

I took his first class as a professor. He's probably the most caring professor I've had, and is working very hard to become a great professor. Grading schemes & class time can get a little disorganized, but he's always willing to help and receive feedback. I have never done so well in a class that I understood the material of so poorly.
He's a pretty good professor, and can explain things pretty well! Lectures are mostly based on the textbook. Exams can be a bit hard at times, but he does give significant partial credit.
A good talker
i loved baldo, and took many of his classes. he's a great guy and a great teacher. but don't bother sucking up, he doesn't play favorites.
Great woman, but little grammar mistakes and a thick accent can make reading some of her handouts or listening to a lecture a little frustrating. Had a lot of fun though!

Took class expecting to love it (sports films) & I did-until I got the grades back on my papers. Did all the hw & turned in on time, went to every class, & somehow ended up w/ a D+. Professor is young and very awkward. I would get 80-100% on all of my hw and then C's on my papers-the ones that she had already reviewed as drafts & said she liked.

He makes the material really easy to understand and he is a REALLY nice guy. The course is a little slow and dry but what else can you expect from accounting. Class is mandatory because there is a short quiz every class. If this course is required for your major, I recommend taking it with Owens.

Such a horrible professor. If you take him, you'll have to learn everything on your own and will still get a low C on the class. He is a very hard grader. He expects you to know the whole book and beyond. But at the same time, he doesn't know the material very well himself. He always comes unprepared to the class and makes tons of mistakes.

This was her first class ever.  She started rusty but picked up very fast.  Wants students to understand the material.  Homework and tests are fair.  Final was pretty difficult (but we got to use our books)
Lectures were clear. Made sure students understand what's going on. Gets class discussions going.
Very easy class, don't actually have to do the readings for class, BUT you do have do do them to write the two papers required. If you actually attend, she's a good professor and you'll learn a lot.
The worst professor I came across.  Stay away!

Her English is not pretty good. The examples she used in lectures are too simple compared to tests. Reading the textbook is much better than attending letcures. Tests can be hard but there will be curve.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Great professor that makes the material very accessible. This was a traditional Japanese literature class, so I didn't have extremely high expectations in terms of how interesting it would be. But Holloway made it really enjoyable, and I think I got a lot from this class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Really awesome teacher. She's nice, funny, and an overall chill person. Very understanding about turning art in after the due date, which is typical for most artists. She also does a couple field trip days as well to museums and her print shop. Very knowledgeable in printmaking, she can pretty much help you with any troubleshooting problem.

Professor Barber was great! I enjoyed the class and even though it was the first time taking an ethics class it wasn't all too bad. There was a learning curve and it definitely isn't an easy A, but do the readings do your homework start the essays early, and it's manageable. Above all class made you think and was interesting at all times!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: Steven York is not a professor, rather, he is a TA for this class. The professor Mark Povich is a very good professor, but this TA ruined our interest towards this course. He deducted 10 points in midterm for using sth. instead of something???

She gives reading quizzes (just one question) in every class at the beginning, so attendance is mandatory. Her lecture notes are really organized & helpful. Go to office hour before submitting essays. It is a little unreasonable to have group projects in a Philosophy course, but it was an easy A so I'm gonna let that slide.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: Anurag is great! Math 165 was a tough course for me but Anurag did a good job with it. He does a lot of examples and is helpful when you have a question. He challenges the class by asking questions and while in my class not many people responded, it was helpful to solidify some of the ideas in the class.
Great professor. Very accessible and straightforward about what's on the tests. Very lecture heavy and lots of material, but he makes it engaging.

Dr. Olsen is by far one of the best professors I have had the privilege of learning from during my time at UofR. He genuinely cares about his students' success, and cultivates an environment in which students may learn uninhibitedly--not fearing the prospect of making mistakes. Dr. Olsen is far from condescending and always willing to help.

Professor Buckley is one of the better professors I've had. He paces out his lectures and assignments well, and he tries to avoid overwhelming students with several overlapping assignments. Homework can be difficult, but if you go to office hours you'll be fine. Exams tend to be a little harder than homework, but it all works out in the curve.
He's a good guy, but he really doesn't know how to teach in a class with many people.

Professor Blackman stands out in the way that he wrote homework/test questions. In principle, they were never difficult, but they tested the fundamentals of a subject at a very deep level. Homework, and exams especially, were fantastic learning experiences. He's also a very kind person and amazing to chat with. Stand-up guy and brilliant physicist.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Inspirational--Accessible outside class

comment: He's a nice guy but his business modelling course is difficult unless you are a robot. He dives into extremely tough VBA coding techniques before students even have the chance to master the simple ones. It's a useful course but if you don't like coding, it might be tough. HWs are really long. Though, he's understanding with extensions and stuff.

This professor has no idea what two credits mean. She gives so much reading and writing outside of class. She also expects you to practice for 30 minutes every day of the week. She frequently goes on long tangents about the following topics: Her trauma, sex, and female periods. It's so weird. Unless you're into that, DO NOT TAKE HER.

No need to attend class b/c tests are from the book. He is extremely inflexible when it comes to grading however and has extremely high expectations for tests given the amount of allowed time. REFUSED to curve the class despite the class average being a C+. You'll learn but take at your own risk. could just buy the book instead to be honest.

Don't take this course! The professor is really bad. It's too much coursework in very little time (although interesting!) and the professor is tone-deaf to the level of intellect of students. There are tests every day on topics taught in the previous class (sometimes for topics taught the same day) and it's all closed book. DO NOT RECOMMEND!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes--Test heavy

comment: Ms. Everett is one of the best teachers I have ever had the fortune of having. She is interesting, fun, and extremely knowledgeable. If you ever see a class that she teaches, TAKE IT!  note-if the rating is lowered due to lack of textbook use, that is because the class i took didn't have a textbook.

A lenient grader, but she's good at promoting discussion of topics. She is well prepared for classes - providing lots of handouts and extracurriculars like contemporary artwork, statistics, primary sources, etc.
She is passionate and funny yet expects a lot from her students.
Tough grade, but great guy.

I like Jacob. He's straight forward and teaches you things relevant to the homeworks and exams. If you need help he will provide it. Much better than the other guy who was teaching CIE when I took it (Hans Johnson). If you can get a class with him, I'd say go for it. He's solid.
The difficulty lies not so much in developing new ideas, as in escaping from old ones.
Tough class... hes a really nice/funny guy but his class is pretty complicated and his exam is very difficult. No midterm though and homework's aren't too bad. Final exam is 70%.

Brenda is wonderful- I had her as my prof for 105 my first semester as a freshman, and she was super understanding when I had trouble getting things completed on time and with all the stuff that comes with starting college.

A great teacher, but not an easy grader. If you genuinely show interest, it will go a long way. She is a meticulous and detail orientated teacher. She is always willing to help her students. Pay attention and follow directions closely and you will do fine in her class.
This dude is mad awesome.  I wish i had him....

Chris is the man! He's a grad student at Eastman, but teaches some of the musicianship classes on the River campus. He really enjoys teaching and makes aural skills fun. He's really young and down to earth and is eager to help. He's also a great jazz pianist and always spices up basic singing exercises with some nice, unexpected, jazzy harmonies.

Taught "The Peaceful Warrior." The job of teaching WRT courses is often given to terrible starting profs who don't know what they're doing, but I found Marshall's class quite good, and the material quite interesting - even though I didn't want to be there and was only taking the course to fulfill my long-overdue freshman writing req. Good prof.

She was well spoken and overall the class and her teaching style was favorable. I would recommend this class if your willing to show up, the reading is not really needed to get an A on the exams just on the papers.
Homework and test heavy, but the homeworks teach the concepts and the test are generally easier than the homework. Very fun and interesting class!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: She is the most caring professor I have come across throughout my college studies. She is helpful, sweet, and awesome. She teaches French in a unique way to the extent you will be drawn to participate in the class. Down to earth, and always reaching out to her students if they do not perform in the exam, and providing extra work for them cover-up.
His classes are interesting.

This was Dr. Patterson's first time teaching a college course and, though it took some time for her to get used to running a course, she was a good teacher. As a clinical neuropsychologist, she effectively communicated many important aspects of the field, factually and practically. She cared a lot about her students and checked in with us.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Caring

comment: When she lectures, she doesn't give room to answer/ask questions. She will barely explain things and she has zero tone of voice. She doesn't seem to teach material, just writing down a script given to her to read and then we as the class write down the script that she writes. She doesn't teach. If I had her paper I could teach her class better.

Professor Tapia is incredibly kind and funny. They are very creative in their assignments and helped make the writing process much more enjoyable. They provided great feedback on papers and were extremely easy to talk to. Their approach to teaching is fresh and interesting. I cannot recommend them enough!

Professor Murray gives lots of information during his lectures, and gets ready for doing some coding work in the problem sets. Problem sets will get more difficult by the end of the semester, and tests are hard. Really need hard work to get an A for this class, but I learned a lot.

Dr. K is a caring and personable professor who will find a way to connect with each of his students. The lectures were engaging and he incorporated group work frequently into classes, which kept things interesting. The workload is very manageable and he offers meaningful feedback for every assignment. I highly recommend taking any of his courses.

wish I could write more about how bad this class was. Majority of class petitioned to have grades increased due to how little things were explained and how unrelated exams were to course material.Inacessible outside class, actively condescending to students. Described class as "guinea pigs" after 1st exam avg was

K ham is super nice and caring! The class was really interesting and you can tell that she is passionate about the subject. There are outside lab requirements but it was generally never too burdensome and was a great opportunity to learn more about lights and tech!

Druckman was a great teacher. responds to emails within minutes and is super understanding and down to earth. Focuses on learning rather than purposefully making things hard for students. loved his class.

I took the W with him and it was well worth my time. By the end of the course I had a whole experiment design completed, and his feedback was really helpful and encouraging. He's incredibly flexible, genuinely cares about students, and gives equal respect to student comments, regardless of political leanings. I only wish I had him sooner.
Very good professor highly recommend
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Prof. Druckman is an incredible teacher with wonderful insights into polarization, polling, and misinformation. He also cares about his students, always responding to emails with great feedback. Finally, he loves teaching research methodology--an underemphasized topic at UR. Don't miss a chance to learn from one of the best political scientists!
I literally learned nothing from this class, and the attendance is mandatory. Just don't take this class.
Never take his class
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: While Corporate Finance is a tough class, this professor made it as comprehensible as it could have been. Exams are not incredibly difficult, but the time constraint makes them nearly impossible to finish. Very interesting material.

He made his preference for "being nice" over following proper laboratory procedure, including safety procedures, quite clear. Despite this, I have never had a more demeaning experience. At first, I loved it, and I gained great experience, so the negatives were easy to let go. When I consider the state it left me in, I wonder if it was worth it.
Super chill professor, funny and nice. Good experience in this easy class.

Horrible. His paper prompts are 10-page digressions which ask the student to address so many points that he is forced to write as badly as Locke does. His timelines, quizzes and asking us to review material after class prove that he doesn't trust us to learn, so why should we trust him to teach? Many hours of life are wasted in his class.

(For Contemporary African Poilitics) Professor Harding isn't a super easy A, but he has clear, organized lectures that build on concepts each week. The readings and lectures go together really well, but even if you read you really should go to class. He is very knowledgeable about the ideas and clearly interested in them which shines through.

I found this course somewhat easy and very interesting, particularly for its focus on economic development/growth. If you did well with Landsburg you'll do well here. Others disagreed with me. Aguiar is fun, but not really accessible outside class. I heard from friends that the paper required from students taking the "W" section was easy to write.
No Comments
No Comments
Ms. Kiggins is "cool", "calm" and "collected" and she certainly brings a breadth of practical experience and expertise.
Great professor, excellent lecturer
Fair & balanced, gives great feedback, positive & constructive.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Terrible writing 105 course. Prof frequently canceled class or held it on zoom. Heavy on identity politics and huge assignments where students had to lead an entire 115 minute class by themselves.

Professor Sum is an incredibly sweet, caring professor who is clearly passionate about Anthropology and China. Her class was well structured: readings were relevant, assignments were productive and fairly easy. She balances lecture and discussion really well and she clearly works hard to keep our workload manageable.
It is a language class so it is very difficult, but she wants you to learn, and she is very patient and caring, and such an amazing person.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Extremely boring lectures
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: I took Kegon for econometrics. You have to turn in your class notes for a grade which essentially makes attendance required. The material is difficult but he teaches it well and gives great examples. Two homeworks, a replication project, and a final writing project. You must understand the material to do well on the assignments.

3 tests, 3 projects, and vary a good bit in terms of difficulty. Things are unorganized in a goofy way, and he embodies that ethos. Extremely responsive and caring. He'd change deadlines if asked, checked in with us if we got to class early, was always asking for feedback on teaching. Offered to write letters of rec and stuff. Stand up guy.

Professor Osucha is very sweet and knowledgeable about American Literature. Class is heavy on reading and participation, but that's the usual for an English class. Mostly graded on 3 papers and weekly blog posts. Tends to go on tangents, but I found that the class likes that, so we don't have to talk much and can just chill.

I would say his class is not well-paced overall, since the first several weeks we seat tight and do nothing, while all the materials are thrown at you at roughly the last two weeks. Group project takes great percentage of your final grade, while there is a chance you might get a rough grade without constructive feedback as well

Definitely the best class I have taken at UofR so far! Professor Wessels is so passionate about poetry and knows how to share his knowledge about it with his students in super helpful and inspiring ways. Gives lots of feedback, too, and is very understanding of students‘ needs and struggles. I will be taking more classes with him and so should you!
Mr. Weasels talked more about his own work than the coursework we were supposed to be learning. I love writing & his method of teaching turned it into a laborious daunting chore. Never again

This class is more of a presentation of his own pretentious knowledge rather than providing any actual educational instruction, inspiration, or guidelines. The headaches weren't worth the credits- DO NOT TAKE!

Very funny and will bring back deadlines if the majority of the class needs it. It is always nice to participate in class and he is very knowledgeable in writing. I don't like writing but he made writing the 8-10 research paper not as bad as I expected. Just ensure you are on task in class and he will like you if you participate.

I enjoyed how this course was driven by data and how its focus was looking directly at how race impacts political trends and Professor Komisarchik is incredibly well researched. The assignments are difficult and there are only three grades, but she is definitely a fair grader. The readings are extensive but skimmable, and lectures are great.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment:
5 homeworks, no exams, 1 Group Project
But that does not mean the course is easy.
If you do bad on some of the homework you may not have a good grade.
The lectures are carefully arranged and the slides are easy to follow, but the pace in class is very quick so you have to focus.
But after all this course is fruitful.

I do not know if Pablo will ever teach again, but I hope he does not. Pablo seems to have good intentions but he absolutely can't convey the content. I don't believe it's his burden to teach but I do think it's his burden to communicate. He would just write ramblings on the board making it impossible to take good notes. Do not recommend.

This professor didn't give a good course grade, and the class content is boring and awful. Some students actually didn't learn anything. The grade criteria was also unclear. She said the grade would be given according to the criteria, but actually not.
rating_tags: Tough grader--So many papers--Graded by few things

comment: Dates his students. Stay away!
Quite know to be involved with his female students in an unprofessionally matter.

Hands on optical fabrication course, show up for an engaging and good time. He's super knowledgeable on the topic due to years in the field professionally. He teaches concepts clearly, and will take as much time as needed to make sure everyone is on the same page.

She's clearly a very new professor. Lectures and instructions were disorganized, she often had computing errors in her slides and would have to correct them in class. Never gave a prompt for the final paper, just gave brief verbal instructions in lecture (she says lectures are optional, but they're definitely required if you want to pass)

Professor Raqueno is an awesome professor. The GIS lectures he gave are down-to-earth and fun. He is also very accessible outside of the classroom and truly cares about his students. GIS is overall not an easy class, but you shall succeed as long as you treat your labs and final project seriously.
A professor clearly does not know how to teach undergraduate students. Made homework during the exam week and was vague about homework expectations and labs.

She is extremely nice and genuinely cares about ALL her students. I didn't like how she taught the class seminar style though; there are way too many people in the class now for it to be that personal (it has expanded to around 100). There are a lot of readings in the class; tests aren't hard so long as you keep up. I highly recommend this class.

She is actually a nice professor.  The journals are annoying to keep up with but its not that bad.  The class is pretty fun but she does expect us to come into SAGE during the weekend to do work (which is annoying too) Overall she is okay!

He is not very clear and is not good about explaining concepts he just makes you do the activities in the textbook in class which isnt helpful if you don't know if youre doing it right so you end up learning the wrong thing. Also he is absolutely awful at responding to emails which is incredibly frustrating. He is a really tough grader.

I took this course for my public health major. It is an interesting class that shows your a different side of health and gender studies. The class, though, it extremely heavy on history and not on public health. The course readings are all about women and health, but they date back to the 1800s and before.
Immaculate dress sense, always well-suited.  Very helpful and sincere, and extremely dedicated.  Needs to brush up on his sense of humor though.
Class was very easy, but too easy that receiving an A- was TOO competitive. No exams.. just projects.

Professor Ruskin is a really lovely professor. In the class I'm in, there are only 2 short assignments, 3 exams and weekly quizzes (usually 5 questions). Each of these parts of the class are really pretty easy if you attend the lectures and take half-way decent notes. He also posts readings to clarify certain topics (optional to read though).
Very fun professor, but definitely NOT a push-over. She's a stickler for good writing, but you definitely learn a lot.

This is the best class I've ever taken. She only teaches less than half the time but regardless of who's behind the podium, I learned so much every lecture. You have to read a lot of primary literature, and the tests are open note. If you understand concepts well and can think creatively about problems, you'll be fine.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: She never remind you about anything and will give you a very low grade in the end. When you email her and want to discuss about your grade or ask her anything else. She never answer you back. The worst ever.

Cool class, she talks about her job at the hospital and brings in guest lecturers. Only graded on 3 exams and a case study. Exams are easy if you write down everything she says in class and memorize it all - half is common sense tho. The optional final replaces an exam and the questions are from the previous exams. Go to class - recordings are bad.

Professor Frey is a great professor, he is very knowledgeable about everything he teaches and his lectures and the papers he chooses are very interesting. The papers are long reads but you don't need to understand everything and he explains well in lecture. The only grades are the tests but he gives so much time and the questions are very fair.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Amazing lectures

comment:
One of the best professors I've taken at UofR. The lectures are compelling, office hours are helpful, and the professor is an expert in the field. But the class is hard. He moves through content quickly and it's easy to get lost.
5 homeworks, 1 exam, 5–10 pop quizzes total. Lectures not recorded. Posted slide decks are sparse, so go to lecture.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: Ralf can seem intimidating, but is actually a really nice guy. I chose to have him as my advisor. This was by far the most practical class I took as an undergrad. It seemed that many things I had learned in the past came into an alignment, and that I was in the right place. I would highly recommend it for anyone interested in doing research.
Good class and did a sufficient job explaining and covering course content. Projects were fun and not too much work. Hard subject, but overall good class.

This is the worst teacher I have ever seen in my entire life. Worst of all he's a Ph.D. student but doesn't treat his students as someone who are going through academics and understand what it takes to be an undergrad. He's condescending and very disrespectful to students. His comments on students' papers are very demeaning and undermining.
rating_tags: Tough grader--So many papers--Graded by few things

comment: The best professor ever in the university. I took this class as my second foreign language so this course is pretty intense and covers a lot of material. However, she's just so nice to provide extra help I need and office hours to go over my questions. You need to spend a lot of time ready for oral and other exams. But you will learn a lot!

Great professor. Very intelligent, passionate, and funny. WRT105 has a huge amount of assignments no matter which one you take, so you won't escape it no matter what. He will take you and your writing seriously no matter how bad you are.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: Prof Valdez is really nice, you can tell she's passionate and wants students to succeed (and understand/learn the language). There is some homework through online textbook almost every night (usually not too much) and she doesn't take many points off if you submit it late. 3 mandatory conversation hours, one group presentation, 2 exams (one oral).

The most unorganized professor I've ever had. The first test was impossible, and nobody finished because she made it twice as long as it should've been. Her lectures consist of her stating random facts that nobody understands. There are no words on her slides, just hundreds of slides with pictures. Class isn't recorded so attendance is a must.

Dr Marshall's Religion and Hip-Hop class was quite unique. She is a nice and caring professor who wants you to do well and makes it very easy to do so. Attendance is mandatory and there is one short assignment per week based on the reading she gives you. Easy A
Really chill, just do the work and it's an easy A
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I looooooove Mariah! She's really nice and she always encourages us to share our ideas. Though there were various tasks, they weren't hard, and Mariah gives us chance to earn credits back. We watched a lot of wonderful dance videos on class and Mariah also tells us some fun stories about the person we talked about. She made this class awesome!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: Lisa Cerami is an inspiring Professor, especially for someone who wants to go into academia. When she speaks you can hear her passion for the subject, she especially loves hearing her student's opinions and perspectives on the material they read.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: Her passion for the topic shines through her lectures. You want to participate in class because she is so caring and energetic that it feels bad to sit and let class happen around you. A super relaxed and fun course, taught by someone with a genuine interest in making sure students get what they want out of it.

He is a very caring professor, but is rather young and new to it. He makes a decent amount of mistakes and does not fully understand the material. He lectures were not easy to follow. He does teach out of the textbook so I recommend using the textbook. He is very helpful to students I just wish he was better at relaying the information better.

I couldn't understand anything he was talking about in his lectures, he moved very fast and would often mumble at the board and then turn around to stare at you once he had basically solved the whole equation. I couldn't tell how he was getting places in his lectures and was really lost overall.

Over complicates certain topics by explaining them in a more convoluted way. Clearly very passionate. Very open to questions, although to the detriment of the pacing of the class. He also does sometimes make minor arithmetic mistakes, although they never interfere with the actual concepts he is teaching.

Professor Rau-Murthy was a fun lecturer, but he did not know how to convey the material. He frequently went off-course in his lectures and ended up in unrelated tangents for half the class, putting us weeks behind the other sections. People left class unnecessarily confused because he would overcomplicate the material. Recitations are very helpful.

Seems new to the teaching biz, so rn he makes a lot of mistakes and is uncharismatic but has a lot of potential for improvement. The class pretty much became self-taught after the 2nd exam. He goes over Webwork in class which is very nice. I recommend online tools like Symbolabs double intg calculator or triple intgs on Desmos. Textbook also helps.
Nice teaching and question answering

I don't think he teaches well, not only because he's not an AI expert, but also due to unclear slides and assignments. There are no hints for homework in the slides, and his exams have too many questions to finish. The midterm average was 79/100. His slides are fixed by Berkeley's CS188, but it's better to watch the videos than take Kang's course.
Very caring professor, easy/clear grader, and made me enjoy the subject much more. Willing to meet outside of class and wants to see students succeed. A little hard to understand sometimes though.

Kim is very funny and kind like much of the ASL department here is. This class was my first experience with ASL, and the conversational approach she took for the class definitely helped me retain the language. Many classes involved us learning the vocab and then walking around and using it to talk to our classmates. All around great intro course.

She's a good prof and gave good lectures. I wasn't and am not interested in the content of the course, but it's a required CS major course, and I do recommend taking it with her because I enjoyed her lecturing style. Exams were difficult. Some projects felt a bit arbitrary at times, but they are the same across all versions of this course.

Contrary to other reviews, the exams were NOT difficult. In fact, they were almost 1:1 to the practice exams. Lecture notes are detailed, and there is a 1% final grade extra credit for answering questions in class. HW was 10 MC with two tries (lol). She is very attentive and will pour extra effort into answering questions in and out of class. 10/10

Good teacher who cares about students and listens to feedback. Lectures are engaging but sometimes lack clarity in connecting ideas, with vague examples and confusing edge cases. The grading is skewed, with 75% based on tests, including a difficult final worth 35%. Study consistently and attend recitations to do well.
rating_tags: Caring--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Really nice professor, wants you to succeed. Midterms are very clear, final is quite a bit harder but nonetheless the class is doable. Professor is very approachable and open to listening.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: For his first time teaching a section, I think things went really well! Definitely can tell he's passionate about math and would sometimes get a sidetracked, but other than that lectures were generally useful. If you take the class in the fall you get a cheat sheet on exams which was a life saver! One of the better 162 professors
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Very reasonable professor, kind and understanding of your situation if you struggle to write. Interesting lectures and resources. Readings were interesting. Office hours are often and were useful. Overall great teacher.

Professor Gama-Krummel is very available, understanding, and gives good feedback. Despite our classes immature behavior at times, I felt like she always stayed professional and while still being able to have some fun here and there. She gives very good critiques on writing, when it comes to structure, thesis statements, and more. W professor!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring--Accessible outside class

comment: Looked AI through readings, videos, discussions, and even Virtual Reality in the StudioX. Ademas class offers deep insights into AI's impact on healthcare, education, and ethics and opportunity to explore. Expect consistent effort, with assignments. Highly recommended for those interested in AI's philosophical and ethical dimensions.

Genuine guy! Grading took a while and the TA's weren't the best, but he had a lot of passion for what he was doing. Liked to incorporate fun facts in his slides to keep us entertained, and got more fun as the semester went on.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: 4 exams in the class, worst grade dropped, and small assignment, perception journal, worth 10% of the grade. The content was interesting and Professor Keane did a good job explaining things but rushed over slides and sometimes skipped important concepts. Exams were harder than they should've been, Also have to get > 94 to get an A.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things
